Reviews.Title: “Promises Promises”
Reviews.Author: Kotara261
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at La Concha for a week. Mother and Father of the Bride. The wedding itself was not held at La Concha but a welcome dinner for 80 people and a farewell brunch for 80 people were handled by the hotel catering dept. The catering dept delivered superior product and service as promised, but the hotel front desk was seriously wanting. It took over 24 hours to finally get the promised room after unpacking and repacking at least three times. Our original room was to be adjoining with family but it really wasn't. "Well you need to understand sir that we really do not have adjoining rooms in the sense that they are connected, we just told you that." The original room was half the normal size, next to a service elevator and , condition wise, resembled a Frat house room. Our second room was the regular size and in much better condition but did not have the promised "step out" balcony. " Oh, really? That room doesn't have a step out balcony? Are you sure? We're sorry sir" We'll take care of it right away!! Eight hours later, at 11 PM, after attending a welcome party away from the hotel, we moved into the "Promised" room. For the next 5 days we received 2 $8 bottles of water in our room until we had amassed 10 bottles, and once again we had to deal with the front desk. " Are you sure there are really 10 bottles of water in your room sir?" Hidden bellman and housekeeping fees. When the front office manager, Cynthia Colon, was challanged over non-disclosed charges she quickly blamed the Wedding Planner. Really? My room contract was with the La Conca Hotel, not Ms. Lopez the wedding planner. Four other parties staying at La Concha for the wedding experienced similar unprofessional conduct at the front desk. The front desk personnal, led by Ms Colon, were quick to point out the Fantastic Room rate being enjoyed by the wedding guests. Enough! The hotel staff, bellmen, housekeeping, bartenders, wait staff etc. were all vey professional, helpfull and pleasant. Management on the other hand, thinks very highly of itself and not so much of its guests. So rating wise..... Hotel Public Areas - 8 Hotel Rooms in old tower - 3 Hotel Rooms in New Tower - 6 Hotel Staff - 9 Hotel Management - 2 Food - 5 Catering Dept - 10 Value for the dollar - 3 The wedding is over. It was beautiful, the kids are happy. Good memories.......... La Concha? Fah Git aboud it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jamie W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at LaConcha for a 5 day family vacation. The hotel was outstanding in every way-it was clean, had a helpful staff and the pool and beach were great. It was convenient to walk everywhere-Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts are close by as are some outstanding restaurants. We stayed in the new suite towers and the rooms were spacious and clean. The WIFI throughout was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, rough service for platinum member”
Reviews.Author: Jesse Z
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this is a gorgeous hotel all around. It is very modern and kept very well, but there is a severe lack in service from the hotel staff - especially for a platinum member. Due to a late arriving flight, we would not be arriving at the hotel until 4AM local time. I called and spoke with the front desk before our flight left and informed them of our late arrival and was told there would be no problem, and that we had been upgraded into a 1 bedroom oceanview suite. Upon arrival (almost 4am exactly) I asked if we could have a late checkout due to our early morning arrival and was informed that the hotel manager would arrive at 7am and I could call and ask then, but for now they were unable to even consider the request. Not a big deal, but not even an effort to try an accommodate us. When we arrived to our room it was a 1 bedroom suite, but faced the loud bars that were still very busy at 4am, no ocean in sight at all. I woke up a little bit past 7am to call the hotel manager, who I reached, and was immediately and flat out "no" to my request for a late checkout and that we needed to "vacate" our room by 11am. I've stayed at Marriot's (JW's, Renaissance's, Marquis, all of them) all over the world, and to have one not even try to consider a platinum member's request was a huge turn-off. The mere 7 hours we spent in our hotel cost us almost $300 and a headache from customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights before cruise at La Concha.”
Reviews.Author: Clinton_ILCruiser
Reviews.Content: Family stayed at La Concha two nights prior to cruise. Let me start with the positives. Grounds are very nicely kept. Has a nice beach, pool, and hot tub area. For those who like to gamble, there is a casino attached to the hotel. Lot's of shopping and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Safe to walk the streets around the hotel at night as well. Lot's of police presence in the area. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant, however there are several on the grounds. Staff was very accomodating!!! Now for the room. Kinda of small, but clean. We had asked for a roll out bed, we received a blowup matress, not a big deal. Also asked for a balcony, we got a sliding glass window, again, not the end of the world. Walls seemed paper thin, as we could hear lot's of noise at night. I thought the price for staying on the beach was resonable, however, would have been better with a balcony. Internet is free, however sometimes so slow it was unusable. Would I stay again, maybe???

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessilyn G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha in April 2012. The hotel is gorgeous! The staff was amazing, very helpful and accommodating. I loved that the pool is open 24 hours! The hotel has a sushi bar and I ate the best sushi I have ever had at La Concha! I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay when in PR”
Reviews.Author: joe b
Reviews.Content: Spent a few night at La Concha on a business trip and the property was amazing all around. Nightly atmosphere at the bar in the lobby is a win...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zs29
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location but very busy this time of year and entirely too many people.waits upto 10min for elevator!wifi in rooms,hotel,and beach!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the strange”
Reviews.Author: tamaralea
Reviews.Content: As we drove up to the hotel, I felt as though I had made a huge mistake. The area around the hotel is fairly run down. A sense of relief came over me as I walked into the lobby. I was also relieved to get the room I requested, as the hotel was completely booked just before Easter. We stayed in the suite tower, in a cityview room. After reading reviews, we packed a few pairs of earplugs. We didn't need them, as the noise wasn't bad on the Wed. and Thurs. night we were there. The noise comes from two rinky dink bars that appear to serve drinks right on the sidewalk and seemed to attract 50-75 people nightly. The hotel ought to just buy out those properties and be done with noise issues. Our unit was large, with a separate kitchen area. I lifted up a chair cushion and found food underneath. Other than that, things appeared clean. The bathroom was large, but we hated the shower. It has a clear half-door, so water leaks all over the bathroom. The other side is a transparent wall to the bedroom. Yes, you can easily make out body parts from the bedroom side. There were no sheets for the sleep sofa, so we had to call housekeeping. The two queen beds in the bedroom were actually full sized beds, not queen, as previously mentioned. We ate at Perla one night. While the atmosphere was really cool, the food was lacking. My husband ordered scallops and received a plate with 4 scallops as a main course. I had the Chilean sea bass. It was good, not great. We also ordered salads, but they were nothing special. Let's just say, don't go there for the food. We wanted to do the chef's tasting menu, but everyone at the table has to order it, and our son doesn't eat seafood or coconut desserts. You will leave the restaurant hungry. The waves were really crashing in when we were there. Surfers were out in full force. One wave came within 12" of the hotel. Waves were as high as the cement jetty/seawall. I would never dream of going in the water under those conditions. I just sat on the beach for a few hours. It's great people-watching. During my people-watching I observed one of the hotel's beach chair valet's hit up the ice cream vendor for $5. Another hotel employee chased off a guy who was renting boogie boards. As much as I hate beach vendors, I really feel hotel employees are taking advantage of the beach vendors. Beware of a big, handsome, well-tanned, silver-haired, 50-something, Caucasion guy wearing a white Old Navy sweatshirt and WHITE FLIP FLOPS. He's either an undercover police officer or a thief. All-in-all, I wasn't crazy about the Condado area. The hotels are close together. The area restaurants weren't that good. The beaches were crowded. I much preferred the Wyndham Rio Mar, out by the rainforest. We also stayed on Vieques and at El Convento in Old San Juan (see my other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Beware the see-through bathrooms.....”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia S
Reviews.Content: Overall, the service and location are great. It's clean and well-maintained. I didn't enjoy the scramble to get a lounge chair by the pool in front of the new tower, but that's a minor thing. The major complaint with the hotel is the bathroom of the junior suite we stayed in. The shower is an opaque glass that fronts the main bedroom. Therefore, every time somebody turns on a light in the bathroom, the light flows right into the bedroom. And since we are a family of 3 (mom,dad, teenage boy), using the shower was really uncomfortable because you can see through it from the bedroom. So when my son took a shower, I had to hide in the living room or on the balcony, and vice versa if I was taking a shower. It's a really beautiful design idea but not very practical.

Reviews.Title: “this place is a heaven”
Reviews.Author: jose p
Reviews.Content: Great service,i was impress by the staff from the minute i got there. felix and cesar made me feel welcome and the housekeeper jackie. They were the bridge for me to stay in this place .i work for the (UN) and i travel very often, first time in san juan and is the only place i would stay when i come back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: GullFeather
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon -were immediately checked in and were on top floor- we arrived on a Tues. and as the week went on the lobby became more crowded w/incoming guests. Our room was spacious enough for 2 adults and one child-two queen beds,nice linens,very clean. Bathroom had walk-in glass shower and nice Aveda products. The wall of glass overlooking the constant waves was beautiful and the sound of the surf mesmerizing. The staff from the minute you get out of your taxi, to check-in,to being shown your room, and on to the restaurants and beach were cheerful, polite and accommodating. I'm sure if I had a problem it would've been corrected ASAP; however, I had no problems and enjoyed every service this resort provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: BiteDoc08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned (sadly) from a wonderful anniversary trip to San Juan and as Marriott Gold members were fortunate to have been booked at La Concha! We loved it! Our Cabana room had a fun retro style and was clean and well appointed overlooking the pool area. Service was great although slow at times and pricey in the restaurant around the pool/beach. Location is superb for exploring San Juan. Victor at the concierge desk is the best!! He directed us to great restaurants and was always ready to help with a genuine smile and attitude. We look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for a quick family vacation”
Reviews.Author: MSMiller-author
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the hotel with our three children, ages 16, 14, and 9. The hotel looks as if it were new from the inside. The lobby is beatiful, as are the grounds and rooms. Our room, a junior suite, was huge by hotel standards. The two-tiered pool area is great and we all spent time going from beach to pool and back again. Staff was great. The only negative at all is that the music in the bar lobby was very loud on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: psucollege18
Reviews.Content: I would like to start off by saying that the website that the hotel has is completely deceiving. I am a very experienced traveller and have stayed at many hotels and resorts around the world. I do plenty of research before booking my vacation and thought that this was a beautiful hotel...boy I was wrong! The only good things I have to say is that the lobby is very nice and the valet people were extremely friendly. After we checked in, I was shocked to see that our room was a cheesy replica of Ikea display and did not appear to be very clean. The kitchen was not clean, we even left a little makeup on the table and on the floor to see if anyone really cleaned...it is night number 4 and there is still eyeshadow on the table from the first night. The air conditioning only goes up 5 degrees, which I personally like my room cold and figure this would be a problem, but the loud system that goes on and off every 5 minutes either kept the room freezing cold in one area and was uncomfortablely hot. Again, we booked a room with two queenbeds only to find out that they are a full at best. The bathroom has the worst lighting ever (extremely bright in weird areas) and the awkward see-thru glass wall that faces the bedroom gave plenty of sight to see for whoever was next to you. I got to see a new side of my friends. The trash was barely taken care of unless we called, the floor was not cleaned, the counters were never cleaned and I hope that the shower was, but I doubt it. Oh and I don't know if this is just a weekend thing, but the water pressure didn't work until 3 hours ago on Friday. Despite all of this, we were trying to stay positive and enjoy the beach and pool side...but guess what...it sucks. The pool in the main area was small and over packed. Walking out to the beach...that amazing infinity pool turned out to be a small pee green pond filled with who knows what and maybe sand? The beach was okay at best, the staff were sercivable. The outdoor furniture looked like it hasn't been cleaned in months, with stains and sand and the freaking pidgons that would come next to you wanting your food. We did find the scond infinity pool but it was okay, and a little small for my standards. If you're interested in staying in San Juan, I recommend Old San Juan because the neighborhood that this hotel is in is extremely diverse...meaning, down the block you have a Louis Vuitton shop but literally turn down the corner and you will run into a pregnant hooker. I have to say tht it is safe for tourist because the police are out in full force. But that doesn't mean they aren't on their cell phones and or smoking cigarettes on the job. Oh and if you wanted a good nights sleep, the walls are paper thin and the bar across the street plays loud music until 4 am...and it's not the best music to fall asleep to either. I feel as though that once the Vanderbilt is finished next door to La Concha, they may have some competition and will update their standards. overall the stay here was okay at best. The service was okay, the food was a bit overpriced, but okay, the lounge was okay. If you're single and looking for a fun hotel, this probably won't be up your ally.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! They will rip you off”
Reviews.Author: ExecGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked a New Year's Eve meal at the Voga Restaurant in this hotel. I was sent an authorization form telling me that they needed a credit card number to hold the reservation but that I wouldn't be charged. At the end of the meal, I was presented with a credit card receipt. Again, was told that this was the actual amount owed. IMAGINE my horror and disbelief when I received my credit card statement a month later, only to find out that I had been charged twice. They have not answered any of my calls, or my emails. AMEX keeps trying to get a-hold of them, and no response. This is a terrible way to run a business. BE WARNED

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ralph R
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and frequent this hotel and consider it to be the best on the island. Have stayed on other properties when not able to stay at La Concha and they are not even close. The staff is unbelievable!!! They are always going out of there way to help and do it with a smile. The facilities are amazing and the rooms are comfortable. The lobby has a nice bar area and some nice restaurants to chose from. The rooms in the suite tower are like small apartments if you are staying for an extended period of time. They have a refrigerator/freezer and a small hot plate/microwave. The bathrooms are great with a nice big shower. Would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Puerto Rico. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RalatTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha from April 6-8th (Easter weekend). Decor - Sleek and modern. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was very clean, had a kitchenette which was very convenient, the sofa bed was quite small (I'm 5'3 and my sister is 5'1 both under 130 lbs and it was a little cramped), the bathroom is spacious. I would say though that the room really isn't set up for small children. No dvd player Food - we ate at the pool bar one of the afternoons, was not a fan of the guacamole and latin chips but my mother enjoyed her chicken-avocado sandwhich, my sister enjoyed her longaniza sliders, and my father liked his steak wrap. The pina coladas were delicious Pool/beach - one two level pool and another small infinity pool but you have to get there EARLY in order to get seats. the beach is really nice but not entirely private, the hotel has some territory but it's not exclusive to guests. the water was amazing and wasn't too rough Location - I love the Condado area of san juan, lots of places to shop and to go out to eat. I recommend ropa vieja (cuban/latin food) and budatai (japanese/prican fusion) in the immediate areas. Ben and Jerry's and Starbucks are very close Atmosphere - At night the lobby lights up and becomes one of THE places in condado. dress code enforced if you are not a guest of the hotel. Good DJ with a trumpet player going along with the music All in all I enjoyed my stay at La Concha. My family has a home on the island but it's nice to get away for weekends at the different hotels. Even if I wasn't going to stay I'd definitely be coming back to the lobby for nightlife. Didn't try the casino so can't say anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Innovative, fun and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: hhiwaterlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite section, and we found the modern accents wonderful. From the two flat screens, the large refrigerator and freezer, and the cool bath the suite was awesome. Our 8 year old played in the main pool for two whole days. The staff was courteous and helpful without exception. That includes car attendants, registration, bellhops, pool staff and waiters. The food and drinks were expensive but very good. Food menus were innovative and food quality excellent. Next time I'm in San Juan, I'll stay at La Concha again.

Reviews.Title: “We lived like kings for 5 days”
Reviews.Author: robertskn
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research when booking our hotel for our first trip to Puerto Rico. La Concha came highly recommended, but it was more than I'd planned on spending for a hotel. We lucked up and got a deal, a Suite in the tower for the regular room rate. It was like a sign, so I booked it. SO glad I did. This was the BEST vacation my fiance and I have ever been on. The suite was incredible, with a view that inspired tons of photos. The service, beautiful accommodations, view and location made it worth every penny. We are still reminiscing about our stay and will be "homesick" until we can make it back to La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: cooke376
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our post cruise stay, our room was not available for 3 hours which for this level of hotel i thought it was strange. The hotel and decor was beautiful and all pools were heated which was lovely. The room was amazing and had well worth the cost but the service in the pool bar was very poor we waitied for 30mins to be served. The cost of drinks in the var were reasonable and ot overpriced....if we got a deal i would stay here again but only with a cherap deal.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, retro vibe that is great for families & romantic getaways”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Concha for a quick couples getaway. In choosing our San Juan hotel, we looked at various Marriott properties and, boy, am I glad we chose La Concha. Beautiful property with three pools and direct beach access. The lobby is modern and open. The service was impeccable. The rooms were spacious and pleasant. The beds were comfortable. The restaurants were excellent. The location is ideal. The casino was spacious, not too crowded, and not at all smoky. When we return to San Juan with kids, we'll stay here again. There were two things I wish I had known prior to booking this resort, so I'll pass them along to you. 1. There is a new tower and an old tower. The old tower was clearly a child of the 60's and La Concha has tried to maintain that retro vibe in building out the new property. We were in the new tower, so I cannot comment on the old tower rooms, other than to say they all have ocean views, which is nice. I can recommend the new tower, which has suites. The bedroom is pretty standard. The other room has a fold-out bed, dining area, and mini-kitchenette, with two electric burners and a large refrigerator with its own ice maker. Very convenient. My only gripe is that the decor looks like it came straight from Ikea -- not unattractive, but not as comfy as it might have been. Overall, a minor complaint. 2. The bathrooms in the new tower, however, are a warning to those who would place form over function. They are beautiful creations, with wide, light wood sliding doors, top mounted bowl sinks, and acres of frosted glass. There were three problems with the bathroom itself, however. First of all, the frosted glass opens into the bedroom. So, when someone (say...me) had to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, turning on the light floods the bedroom with light. Not such a nice thing to do and there's no way around it because of the placement of the lights. We ended up using a flashlight, which is sub-optimal on vacation. Second, the frosted glass doesn't really provide as much privacy as it might. In fact, it provides precious little privacy at all. Again, this is fine if you're on a romantic getaway and have no personal body issues. If, however, you're with the kids or some buddies from college, you might not want them in the bedroom while you're rubbing soap all over yourself. Finally, the shower (which did include a jetted tub), has one of those fixed glass walls separating it from the rest of the bathroom. You can't reach the shower controls without climbing in. So, every morning, I ended up doing a little contortionist yoga to avoid the cold water that came out of the shower head. (In their defense, it warms it really, really quick.) Hotels, please don't let your designers run amok like this -- different lighting wiring, a sliding door on the shower, and glass with some ripples in it would have been a good idea. Also be aware of resort fees and taxes, which will add 20% to your room rate. All that said, I will go back there again. It's location was perfect, as it was far enough away from the cruise ship port to keep the visiting-for-the-day crowds away, but close enough to get to the cool stuff quickly. The beach is small, but nice, and the pools "flow" from one to the other down to the beach nicely. For those of you with elite Marriott status, the Ocean club saves you money on breakfast, hors d'oeuvres, dessert, and drinks each day. Really a great location. We looked at the other Marriott down the street and were very happy we chose La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with our son and had a very positive experience. The staff is super-friendly. The room is spacious. House keeping came every day but at very different times each day so it was a bit of a guessing game when the room would be ready. The food was good - not fabulous, but not horrible. We actually enjoyed the breakfast best. We spent a ton of time at the beachfront infinity pool - beautiful views. One of my only complaints was that valet took a long time to get your ticket and car to come around...the guys were very nice...but really busy I guess. It was easier to just hop in a cab than rent a car! I was also surprised by the amount of children at the property - I thought we were going to be the only ones with a toddler and boy were we wrong! Great trip - definitely get a room with some sort of ocean view. We had a partial on a high floor and it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Quick Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: surfcowboy43
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at La Concha for 5 nights. The overall experience was mostly wonderful with just a downfall or two thrown in. Let's start with the good. We enjoyed a beautiful suite and had a connecting room as well in the newer part of the hotel. The ocean view was also fantastic. The connecting King Room also had a "mini" kitchen with an additional fridge which was nice for water,juice,beer etc. The rooms were clean and very updated with kinda this "W" vibe. Although neither the Suite nor the King Room was especially large, it did have this cool boutique/South Beach hotel feel to it. The Ocean View was worth every penny because I could even hear the surf crashing on the beach at night which lulled me to sleep(even with the sliding doors closed). The Lobby has this very hip open air lay out with a great bar in the middle. On some nights, a live musician will play on the edge of the lobby bordering on the outside patio. The music can be heard both inside the hotel and outside as well. If your dining outside, it's a nice compliment to your meal. Speaking of meals, I cannot remember a Carribean Vacation were every single meal was excellent! I've traveled quite extensively through the Carribean and the only other two islands which have perhaps equally as good food is Turks and Caicos and Aruba. Both signature restaurants in the hotel were great- the Italian Restaurant featured homemade pastas, while Perla was more Continental. Again, both meals were fantastic with great service. We also ate off site which will be covered in a separate review. Just a few additional random thoughts: The pools and service was great, the staff very helpful and nice. However, the elevators are slow and one broke while we were there-again, not really a big deal. The overall stay reminded me of being in South Beach, Miami without the flocks of beautiful people and more families. The resort is only about 20 minutes to the airport so that's a big plus as well. Now here is the problem: Serious Gamblers Beware: This is not the resort for you. The caliber of play is not what you would find at the Atlantis, with most of it local trade. I noticed several $5 match play coupons on the tables. In fact, when we checked out we were quite disapointed at the dismal comps offered considering the amount of play which we gave them. It's obvious that they really don't care about running a Vegas or Atlantic City caliber gaming operation-their bread and butter are the locals and that's fine. When I really want to be rewarded fairly for my gaming in Puerto Rico, I'll head to the El San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Everything”
Reviews.Author: AEfromIdaho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha for week at the end of March. The staff was TERRIFIC! Each night we asked for dinner recommendations and were never disappoinment. The rooms where great and the stay so comfortable. I would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Cautious about upgrades, front desk and bell staff were amazing”
Reviews.Author: CoreyGlynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at La Concha prior to a cruise. If you're planning the same, this hotel is ready for you, no minimum stays like several places in San Juan. The room was great, freshly renovated with a retro vibe. We were "upgraded" to a larger suite on a lower floor of the City-side. My caution is to double check proximity to the Nightclub. I like Adele, but hearing the remix through my pillow at 4 am was a bit much. The bar and restaurant staff we really slow but the food was good. The bell staff (and the front desk staff) were amazing. We had accidentally left a suitcase in the cab. With only a sketchy description, the staff quizzed the local cabbies for almost and hour, found our cab and had the bag returned. Saved the trip. Amazing, dedicated service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kimcox
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at LaConcha for 5 days over spring break. It was just fine for our purposes. We had one room in the suite tower and one in the beach tower. I would suggest getting a room in the suite tower. It was the nicer of the two rooms. Both rooms were ocean front, and we booked one in particular because it had a hot tub on the balcony. Unfortunately, the hot tob didn't work. It never got hot and half the jets didn't work. Calls to maintenance did no good. Other than that, our room in the suite tower was spacious and comfortable. The hotel was hip and fun. The open air lobby was quite nice. Food at the hotel was good and the mojitos were memorable. I have been there on the weekend when the nightlife takes over, but we were there doing the week. It was relatively quiet and family friendly. Staff was helpful. Don't expect to be able to play in the surf right outside the hotel. The surf on the beach was snarly, so we went to another beach for jet skiing and other motorized water sports. Abundant fast food places were nearby, which made the kids happy. All in all, this hotel is a good place for a family getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: toddindc
Reviews.Content: We only had 1 night here but I wish we had stayed the majority of our time in this hotel. While this was an older hotel, it has been renovated and it was done beautifully! Elements of the original design are still intact and is also modern. Rooms are well done and expansive (at least the cabana rooms). Right on the beach. Nice pool. Friendliest people I met in PR were at this property (guests and staff). Well situated-can walk to restaurants and can easily get to other parts of San Juan. I will come back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but definitely depends which tower you stay in”
Reviews.Author: Goboilers19
Reviews.Content: We started in the beach tower, upon arrival our room was ready. However when we arrived to our room we noticed that our sheets had stains and the bathroom smelled of strong bleach which came from the shower drain. The carpets also had some visible stains on them. When we asked the maid for a change of sheets she said they did not have anymore but then attempted to find some (and she did). Then after spending our first night in the room we realized in the morning that our door did not lock externally. These issues were brought to the attention of the management and they handled it very professionally. Because of these issues we were then placed in the suite tower. The room was much newer and nicer although the majority of rooms in that tower are not ocean view due to the way the building is set up. If planning to stay here it is definitely worth paying extra for the suite tower. The staff were all very friendly and professional as well. The only other down side is that the majority of the pools have shade for the better part of the day. So if you are wanting sun,make sure and plan according the first day for the chairs that are in the sun in the main pool.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redshirtfriday
Reviews.Content: Amazing, everything from landing until leaving....NO complaints (some rain, more then expected but dealt with it)....as for the hotel...big, sparkling clean, friendly staff, excellent location.....amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Fun family vacatioin!”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline C
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at La Concha...we were there with our almost 3 year old daughter. Had an amazing ocean view room on 4th floor, ocean tower. Our daughter really enjoyed pool-hopping and also loved making sand castles on the beach. There were other families with small children there, which made it fun for her and relaxing for us. We ordered room service for breakfast most days...food was good. Neighborhood was safe, and we went for a walk every night after dinner. On our last full day we discovered that the Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream (right next door!) offered breakfast...the ham, egg, cheese croissant was actually the best breakfast we had all week and at half the price. They also have sandwiches, wich we had for dinner as well. A nice break from the hotel food, and of course the ice cream is good too. We met the mother/daughter owners...Puerto Rico natives who have spent some time in the states as well. Very nice people who are sure to succeed in this stellar location with gread food.

Reviews.Title: “Best Handicap Accessible Hotel in Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: NavyBrat82
Reviews.Content: Recent trip with elderly mother. We were amazed with how accessible everything was, (except hot tubs). While the ocean surf was too rough for my mother she was still able to swim in the infinity pool which overlooked the beach, she loved it. She loved the 1 cent slot machines, kept her entertained for hours. We found the ramp system the best yet. Rooms were very South Beach flavored and fun. Italian restaurant - food was great and pool view was majestic - even during the rain showers. Breakfast service was slow if you didn't do the buffet. Don't recommend street side as the bars stay open til 5:00am and you will not get any sleep unless you bring your sleep machine or earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Not young/sexy enough for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MindyLePooh
Reviews.Content: If you like blaring, thumping techno music rave parties every Friday and Saturday night, overpriced restaurants with bad service, rooms with minimal furniture and ridiculously saggy beds, "business center" that charges $4 per page of outgoing fax, then this place is for you. I prefer comfortable beds and a quiet, peaceful check-in process (yelling over the rave music for half an hour to the front desk clerk was not an auspicious start). This hotel did nothing for me - I guess because I'm not the young/sexy kind.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: annmarie27_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a sophisticated, cosmopolitan flair to it. It's in a great location in the center of shops and restaurants that you can walk to, and a short ride to Old San Juan (a must see--the streets and housing are really interesting to look at). The area is full of exercise buffs who walk, run, bike, rollerblade throughout the day/night. The hotel was very busy with various conferences going on and at night the lobby bar was popular with the after conference crowd. The food is a bit pricey but we were knew that ahead of time from other reviewers. Only two downsides: while there are sliding doors in your room that you can open and see the ocean, the hotel had no balcony to sit on, which we like to do at night; and the beach seems to "close up" by about 5pm with the staff waiting for you to leave so they can take your chair and clean up. Even so, I think this is one of the niceous hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Meet & Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: teddybee1
Reviews.Content: This is a great and very cool hotel to stay at, which we did for 3 days prior to going on our cruise. Everything about the resort is top of the line: the pool and surrounding area; the rooms; and the grounds. The hotel bar is great as is the sushi restaurant. The hotel front door personnel and super (Hector is the best). The hotel is also in a great location. We also like and enjoyed the casino (did not win anything but what the heck, we had fun). Overall, this is a great hotel and is highly recommended because of it how clean it is, the great rooms (we had a an ocean front/view, which was the best, and bedding and linen were top notch); the cool hotel environment (lobby, bar, restaurants and overall appearance); and it high level of energy (the laughing, smiling, and happy talkative people). The ppol and beach are just outstanding too. The only down size to the hotel/our stay was: 1) The check in, which was painful and long. In particular, check in is 4:00 p.m. (requested an early check in, which was not possible due to the high volume of guest). However, we finally got our room at 5:33 p.m., and hour and half past the check-in (Denise was helpful and very nice but there still was the wait). And 2) the slow, slow drink service at the bar; the hotel needs more bartender on duty at key/busy times. Nonetheless, this hotel is great. (Note: management adequately addressed our check in issue).

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and comfort in San Jaun”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelorChicago
Reviews.Content: This resort was a fantastic stay. We spent three nights in one of their ocean suites and couldn't have been more satisfied with the hotel rooms, amenities, casino, and overall location. La Concha has a beautiful beach front with perfect infinity pools for those who don't like to venture onto the sand. The gym is beautiful. The restuarants were very good (4 of them). The surrounding area is safe and close to old San Juan. The overall cost is appropriate for the product. My only advice is try to get rooms on the side of the hotel away from any clubs, especially of your considering lower floors.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Breezy”
Reviews.Author: BuzeeBee
Reviews.Content: La Concha has an easy breezy feel to it unlike most other hotels in the San Juan area. For those looking to stay within the â€œMarriottâ€� family hotels, youâ€™ll find that it definitely has a lighter feel to it than the old San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino. BTW: The Casino has an austere looking, vacant building next to it, right on the beach and needs upgrades to its rooms throughout. La Concha feels as if itâ€™s beckoning, from every angle. And, itâ€™s rooms, though they open to the outside, also unfold into the courtyard for safety, style, and design. One of the benefits of the openness has to be the intoxicating, stellar, ocean breezes from every angle. Youâ€™re on the beach. And, that feels nice. And as for the food, you will enjoy plenty of variety. Light fare for the savvy traveler includes sushi and miso soup, etc. These are surprisingly well made. Note: donâ€™t forget to try the mixed drinks in the lobby bar (or on the lounge chairs by the pool) to start off on the right note and to set the tone for the rest of your stay. Probably one of the more unique observations about this hotel would be that they have managed somehow to make you feel as if youâ€™re walking into history when you step through the doors. Yet, no one would ever question that this hotel meets all of the criteria for a contemporary style. So, ladies, get out your long, flowing, flowery, cotton dresses with lovely sandles that you clan slide off for a walk on the beach. And gentlemen, donâ€™t forget to bring your Panama Hats!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kruzingtogether
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good experience at La Concha! The pool area was amazing, and it was on a decent beach, considering how close it was to San Juan. Although the food was a bit overpriced, it was good. The area surrounding the hotel was nice for walking around. Our room (suite) was very spacious and pretty clean - no major complaints, just with all the glass, they need to do a better job in order to make it look completely clean. The three biggest complaints we had were (1) the wait at reception was REALLY long for check-in, and the front desk staff seemed inefficient in handling the process; (2) the elevatators took WAY too long to come and when they did were way too crowded; and (3) we could not sleep until nearly 4am because of all the street noise - we were on a high floor but facing the city -- maybe an oceanview room would solve this.. All in all, though, we had a nice experience and would consider returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ReenaNYC_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Concha for a weekend getaway. We stayed in an ocean suite and had an amazing view of the ocean from our balcony! The pool is great or if you feel like it, you can take a swim on the ocean. The staff were very friendly and helpful in planning our trip around the city. The only downside is that the hotel gets crowded, so it was hard to get poolside seats - but the "adult only" pool was usually free and quiet! We also loved that the hotel is located in a neighborhood with a bunch of restaurants and some bars within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Dorado”
Reviews.Author: oreck1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a prime location in Dorado section of San Juan. Easy to OSJ by taxi and even bus if you stand the wait. Hotel services could not be better. Rooms and grounds are kept in top condition. We had an eight floor ocean front room with a fantastic view. Sliding window opened floor to ceiling to let in the sound of crashing waves. Beach service is excellent. Pool seating gets reserved early by towel leavers but we always found two chairs in the afternoon. Lots of local choices for meals. Front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. The concierge will book dinners, rental cars and offer advice on everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “The best HOTEL and staff”
Reviews.Author: 902smileeface902
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at La Concha Resort in Puerto Rico and loved every second of my stay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We had the delight of the executive lounge and the staff everyday were more then gracious and kind. Michael Tischler was there everyday to help us plan outings and make sure everything was always there for us. The room was excellent and very clean and the pool area spotless. We will come back time and time again to La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Great time !”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked into the Howard Johnson Isla Verde after seeing it got decent reviews online and was close to the El San Juan which is the epicenter of nightlife in SJ, the HoJo was a nightmare in every aspect and after one night we decided to find another place to stay whether we lost money or not (Expedia refunded the remaining 3 nights) we stopped at La Concha to have a drink while walking around Condido and decided this is where we wanted to stay, the lobby, pool area and beach were all immaculate and very Miami Beach in their layout and feel, the crowd was a mix of families, older and younger couples and a couple bachelor/bachelorette party groups. Our room was nice and airy and we had an ocean view, bathroom was clean and the double headed shower was great. This hotel salvaged our trip even though the weather wasn't great during the weekend, the neighborhood is also nice with good restaurants and bars within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Negligent Actions On Behalf of La Concha - Letter to the GM”
Reviews.Author: FayATL
Reviews.Content: Spent my 30th B-day at the La Concha in July 2011, hoping for a memorable experience...unfortunately, it was more of a NIGHTMARE! Here's the letter I eventually wrote to the Renaissance Group GM, Luis Rivera, to address the ruined experience. After learning of the issues, he provided additional discounts, albeit regretfully, to the price we paid for the trip. To keep things in perspective, I've traveled all around the world, I'm NOT high maintenance, and I've never been compelled to write a review on Trip Advisor until now. "... I've been a guest at your resort in San Juan since Wed, July 20th. I am checking out today and was hoping to speak with you prior regarding a myriad of very serious issues that I've encountered with the hotel staff and accommodations during my stay. I'm appalled at the lack of compassion demonstrated by the management team in that this stay has been a nightmare since the moment we checked in. I chose the La Concha because of the location, upscale appeal and rave reviews on the internet, however, I've yet to experience any of those things over the course of a 5 day stay. My 30th birthday has been a disaster because of the negligence displayed by the La Concha management team and I'd like to speak with you directly regarding my concerns. To give you a brief overview, my party and I were moved to 3 different rooms for reasons including insect infestations, faulty plumbing, as well as, poor cleaning and upkeep. Additionally, we've been treated poorly by the beach attendant staff and been the victim of extremely slow hotel response time on request, to the point where we've missed reservations and had to completely change plans. On top of all of that, the Concierge and Guest Services team, failed to follow through on a surprise 30th birthday audio visual request that was planned a week prior to our arrival. Only after our arrival, about an hour before the presentation was needed, were we informed that the La Concha would be unable to accommodate the request though we were informed everything was set-up and ready to go by the Concierge manager, Louise. My largest concerns rest with the management team, namely Alfredo Arroyo, who initially appeared very concerned when I met with him to discuss these issues on Friday, July 22nd. I was on the verge of checking out of the hotel; however, he immediately apologized and offered to comp our first two nights, upgrade our room, and provide complimentary breakfast during our last 3 days on the property. He also asked that we meet with him again before we checked out to ensure that the remainder of our stay met our expectations and to determine if any further comps he should be applied. However, upon meeting with Alfredo yesterday, Sun, July 24th, he rescinded his offer for breakfast stating that he felt he'd done enough and was being "fair". He also dismissed the remaining issues that my party and I experienced after meeting with him and since being moved to yet a 3rd room. I find his callous response completely deplorable and dishonorable, which is why I am now escalating the matter to you."

Reviews.Title: “Like South Beach, but in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: 60618Travelers
Reviews.Content: This place is super modern and beautiful... however, the South beach vibe with DJ's by the pool and people taking shots and "woo-ing" isn't really my scene, so I'm happy that we only spent a day here enjoying the facilities since they are partner hotels with Hotel El Convento where we stayed. The pools are nice and I would have liked the beach more if it hadn't been so crowded, and if we hadn't just come back from Culebra where the beaches were phenomenal. We had food by the pool which was kind of a disaster and the service was not spectacular either. However, they target a specific clientele, and they do it well!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Accommodations in Condado”
Reviews.Author: consortium1
Reviews.Content: While we planned to stay at a nearby B&B, options changed and we wound up at La Concha. What a nice surprise! Clearly, no comparison to a B&B, but a great first introduction to Condado, the upscale beach neighborhood of San Juan. While the casino adjacent to the lobby is a bit of a detraction, it doesn't undermine what is a well-appointed, stylish hotel. The entrance is surrounded by modern water features, the lobby is the place to be (we arrived on a Friday night), and the rooms are spacious, elegantly designed, and offer unexpected amenities (mini kitchen, Aveda bath products, large closets, etc.) We didn't dine at the on-site restaurants, but the menus and decor looked great. Excellent poolside scene and beautiful ocean views from multiple angles. The beach area is not spacious, but there are plenty of chaise lounges and umbrellas, food/drink service, and amazing views of the ocean. The surrounding neighborhood is modernized, for better or worse. High end shopping (Gucci, etc.) is available as are multiple bars and small restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MGSUCH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the end of the Condado beach area. A great location. However, because of the geography, the beach loses sun sooner than some of the adjacent properties. The hotel itself is very nice. The only problem is that when full, the staff does not seem to be able to keep up with the demand and often appears disorganized. We are vegan and discussed dietary concerns with the concierge before arriving and were assured there would be no problem. However, upon our arrival we saw that there was actually only one option on all of the menus that would work for us. Thankfully there was a viable option a few doors away. Prices for food and drinks are high, but you are paying for a nice property. The pool area is divided nicely into several areas to sit. Smoke from the outdoor grill tends to flood part of the deck area. The first room we were given had a completely obstructed ocean view. As we booked an ocean view, we were not happy. We immediately went back to the front desk and they said it would be no problem to change rooms. We had to wait another hour before a room was available. They explained the room was ready, it just needed to be inspected first. I am not sure what they inspected as there were a few issues with the room, specifically the bathroom. There was a burned out light bulb and there was no toilet paper holder. We told the front desk about these problems and they promised to fix them. Upon returning from dinner, neither problem was addressed. We brought it to their attention the following morning before going out on a tour. When we returned 5 hours later, they were still not fixed. As we were leaving the next morning, we gave up trying. Overall, it is a nice hotel, but overpriced for what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: kb k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha for 6 nights, with 2 kids under the age of 4 with us. Resort is very nice, but some major downfalls for this price point. - Not enough staff at the resort. Always a wait at the check in desk and concierge desk. Sometimes we just gave up and left. Also when you did get a chance to talk to them they were not friendly at all, and were actually rude at times. They don't make eye contact when interacting with you, they smack their gum, and actually tried to discredit our platinum status at check-in and were arguing with us (sheila was the associate that checked us in). - Room keys had to be re-programmed 6 times in the first 2 days. Finally we were told the battery was replaced and we should not have the issue again. We had the issue 2 more times over the next 5 days. - Food quality at bar pool is very bad. First of all the seating area is pretty spread out so the waiters don't know if you are waiting to order. We ordered the chicken noodle soup for our daughter one day and the chicken looked really pink and undercooked - took it back and found out that they were actually serving us campbells soup....really???? If you don't cook it fresh, it shouldn't be on your menu! - Bar in the Lobby gets really loud on Thursday nights as they have a weekly party there starting at 6:30pm! You can hear the music on the entire main floor because if is blasting! YOu would think you are in a club not a hotel lobby. - The Sunday night that we were there, there was a group outside protesting against the Telecom company that was holding your event there. We got informed with a letter under our door of the protest. This is not your typical protest...they had huge speakers and were playing loud music and chanting. It went on till almost 9:30pm! Super annoying. The resort did not try to offer any sort of apology beyond the letter for the inconvenience to the guests staying there. - Rooms were nice except there is no privacy in the bathroom. The bathroom is separated from the room with a frosted glass, so you can see the person taking a shower. Also if they go to the bathroom in the middle of the night, and turn on the lights, the whole room is disturbed b/c of the lights. Other then that everything else was great about the rooms, and shower pressure was best I have had at a hotel. - Pools were very small. One of the three pools is adult only. The only infinity pool that is usable by families is tiny, and the deepest end of the pool is only 4 feet. The largest pool is not beach front, which is very disappointing for a resort of this size. - Ocean Lounge staff was super nice and accommodating. Mike gave our kids some toys and always made them feel welcome. But the night staff was even better! The lady manager and Jose were very personable and always willing to go the extra mile to make you feel welcome! We loved hanging out with them and our kids actually miss them! Overall one thing we noticed was the resort was very focused on making money, be it from a convention, company party, or club-by party in the lobby. They need to change the focus to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elainey21
Reviews.Content: La Concha was a great way to experience Puerto Rico for the first time! We stayed in a suite and had excellent service, and the room was great as well! The best part was that even though we went when the hotel was completely booked we never struggled to get beach or pool chairs!! Everyone who worked there was nice and attentive, down to the doormen. Special thanks to Felix for making our trip extra great!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, modern and 'cool'”
Reviews.Author: jad74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights recently before going on a cruise. Was on someone else's points, so not sure exactly what price rooms are, but know from others that they're expensive! Was really impressed when walking into the hotel - great lobby, really helpful and friendly staff, and a good sized bar were immediately apparent. Room was a bit small for us (3 of us sharing), but would have been fine if there were less of us! Had a great view out over the beach and ocean, window opened as well so easy to get fresh air in the room. We had a minor problem with the bathroom when we got there, but it was fixed quickly when we reported it. Drinks and food were predictably expensive, but the quality was very good. Breakfast was (I think) about $25/head, so we headed out for breakfast to nearby restaurants - doormen were more than happy to recommend places to try. Really nice outside area, some covered, some not, with waiter service for food and drinks. Nice pool area (though was quite cold!). Also, right on the beach as well, with loads of sun-beds, so that was another plus. Concierge desk was sometimes a bit understaffed, but were very helpful and efficient. I suppose the key question is - "Would I stay here again?". That would be a definite yes, provided I could get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “We would return to La Concha in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: SaintlyNYC
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at La Concha I was prepared for the worst, and of course, we ended up having wonderful time. We arrived by taxi (18 for 2 people and our luggage). We did not meet anyone at the front to help with our bags; we had no encounter with this famous Felix that so many people have written about. We arrived in the late morning and after a nice lunch at the hotel bar we had our room by 1:30pm. We had reserved a junior suite in the new tower and upon arrival in our room everything that was promised was there and ready. The previous reviews lend me to believe that the people who did not enjoy their stay had rooms in the older, not newly renovated tower of the hotel. Great views. Great room. Fantastic pools. Nice beach. Wonderful food. If you can get a reservation at PERLA, their gourmet restaurant, get one. I will remember their Black Truffle soup w/ White Truffle Flan for the rest of my life. Amazing. We ate brunch at VOGA. The $25 all you can eat breakfast buffet was a deal, but that could be because we are used to New York prices. It was very good with a wide range of breakfast foods all the way to the omelet bar. I seriously have a new appreciation for a slow cooked omelet. We did have the knowledge beforehand due to some reviews that we should get to the pool early and reserve our chairs, which we did, but I rarely saw it being crazy around the pools. Well, except for the number of children who seem to run free from their parents. If you do not really want to be near the children there is the â€˜adults onlyâ€™ infinity pool area. Smaller, but nice and quiet. Those chairs are taken by 8am daily. We were at La Concha from March 14th til the 18th. If you have any questions I can help with please just send me a message. I will also post my skydrive link for all my photos of the hotel: https://skydrive.live.com/redir.aspx?cid=3d780ddf45e46362&resid=3D780DDF45E46362!6378&parid=root As mentioned I never had the use for Felix, the valet, but the best service I received at the hotel was poolside. If you can get Daniel Rodriguez (sp?) as your waiter, please do so. He was very attentive and a really sweet guy, even when the computers were going crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Moose97
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Puerto Rico, the La Concha resort was a great choice. The rooms where a good size and the Ocean views were amazing, it was unfortunately that the room did not have real balconies just a tiny walk out space. The lobby was a hig engery and trendy place to hang out and the bars and resutaurants were well designed and fun. We sampled the food at 3 of the 4 places in the hotel and the service and food was a very high standard. There are lot of eating options on the Condado strip so this hotel is a good choice as a base. You can then eat as high end as you want too or as cheaply as you want too. Cocktails at the hotel bar are pricey and the noise level is high, so not a place for families with very young children, especially on a Friday or Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pascal482
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. We had the suite, which is quite large. It isn't cheap, though. I liked the proximity to the beach. We did some great body-surfing there. Likes: breakfast--good food, some nice fruit. The breads are processed... location (keep in mind Puerto Rico is quite poor so between nice hotels are decrepit buildings and graffiti) Staff--attentive, professional, helpful-- a Marriott specialty Dislikes Expensive I think if I return to PR, I will stay in this area of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “This place has horrible service”
Reviews.Author: bigtimetravel Y
Reviews.Content: A gorgeous property but in reality......"What a hole". The service is absolute zero! You wait forever for waitstaff. They play music until the middle of the night and could care less. If you are on the "suite jacuzzi spa" floor and it is a Friday......watch out! It is crazy loud (as if the DJ was in your room). It doesn't matter how high your overall tab is, it is all about charging you $5 for a beach chair. We came her for a relaxing week. We were not "pampered" at all. A small bright spot was Mario at Voga. For the rest of the time we were disappointed with the entire service of this hotel. It was similar to Holiday Inn. The beach is nice and the adult pool is nice but what a joke!!!!! Don't come here to relax and be covered. It doesn't matter how much you tip.........THEY DON'T CARE!!!!!! They have one server for two pools and a beach. Wait an hour and you may get served a drink if you are lucky. This place has potential but is understaffed and have no idea what taking car of your guests means. WE WILL NEVER COME BACK!!!! The Hilton Caribe was a lesser property and we were treated better there. What a joke!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic!”
Reviews.Author: BeachBumDE
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a beautifully designed and meticulously maintained hotel in the center of San Juan's Condadao Beach district. Stunning common areas give the place a 'hip' South Beach aura, which complimented our ultra-modern luxe suite. Every amenity was included in our living/kitchen area, and the bathroom was large and very 'cool'...lots of frosted glass instead of solid walls. Our bed was extremely comfortable, and the large flat-screen had oodles of channels. Three beautiful and imaginative pools are incorporated in the high-style hotel design. Plush towels are provided for both pool and beach lounging. My only complaint is slow waitstaff/beverage service in both the outdoor grille and on the beach. Otherwise, this is a perfect choice for a gorgeous beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great everything”
Reviews.Author: mrfood
Reviews.Content: Switched from el San Juan after reading trip advisor reviews. La concha fantastic, rooms nice, restaurants very good, la perla outstanding. Service was outstanding from check in to check out. Concierge very helpful and knowledgable about restaurants. Marmalade in old San Juan one of the finest restaurants anywhere., I owned restaurants and was very impressed with overall quality of food and svc. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time”
Reviews.Author: TerriGator
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on March 3 and 4 and had a fabulous time. The resort is clean, the staff was excellent and it is convenient to plenty of excellent dining establishments. On the Sunday that we were there they had a Farmer's Market in the park right next to the resort and it was divine! Got fresh fruit, fresh bread and drank $7 Mojitos! Doesn't get much better than that. I also found the beach to be very adequate, despite some of the comments I have seen. As others have said, the staff members at the beach are more than willing to move your chair/umbrella anywhere you would like and do so with a smile! The rooms have been remodeled and we found them completely satisfactory. The lobby and bar area is THE place to be on a Saturday night - live music and lots of colorful locals. If you decide to stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be”
Reviews.Author: Pampeano77
Reviews.Content: I went the first time with my family and we had the best time ever, fancy and sophisticated. With modern design is one of coolest places in PR. We had room facing the ocean, AMAZING. Bathroom spacius and had a rain shower, loved it. I love the white furniture in the room as well. great sound and LCD with satelite TV. Loved the restaurant La Perla. Also every Friday and SAturday teh lobby turns into a disco and lots of people join the party from another hotels. Also has a Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking”
Reviews.Author: lakely
Reviews.Content: Me and my bestfriend stayed at the la concha from 3/15-3/19 I must say it was a great experience the rooms were nice the staff very helpful and friendly. I liked the fact that all of the pols are open 24hrs and are clean its nice to take a swim after the party. Staff is still around 4am to give you towels. My only complaint would be that housekeeping doesn't come in your room when your still sleeping. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Astounding Valet Personnel”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights to do a triathlon in Old San Juan. The valet staff made up feel like we were coming home each time we came back to the hotel . Our bikes needed careful attention during storage and they made sure they were handled properly . They sent us off to the race with high five encouragement and congratulations on our return. It was so sincere we wanted them in our celebration pictures. I hope you have the privilege of meeting Felix , Victor and the rest of the men who will take care of you went you enter and leave the hotel. They honestly made us feel like family. As Felix hugged us goodbye , he said "Su Familia" . And the hotel was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Warining: 16% Resort Fee added to your bill”
Reviews.Author: Fun R
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday night March 20, 2012. I've stayed at La Concha a few years ago, enjoyed the resort and paid a $20 resort fee per nigh. I needed to stay in San Juan on a layover last weekend and was shocked when I got my bill with a $57 or 16% resort fee, when I only expected $20. If I would have stayed 7 nights, I would have had to pay $400 in resort fees!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience ...”
Reviews.Author: Cari K
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the La Concha Resort. The Hotel was very nice as was the staff and food. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: anon19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with 3 friends in January before getting our cruise. Was meant to be 4 of us but they could not come in the end.. probably a blessing as the room we had was a squeeze with 3 of us. When we checked in we explained that we had elite status and normally that means an upgrade however as they were full they could not oblige this time. Anyway the room had a great ocean view with a large window that opened which was good because the a/c was quite noisey. Wifi on and off. Our main problem was that the toilet made a huge amount of noise when flushing and took forever. Luckily maintenance sorted this quickly for us. The hotel was very clean at all times including the pool, gym and bar areas. This hotel really is cool and at nights they sometimes had a dj playing in the main lobby area. The gym was well equipped and looked out to the sea. Breakfast in the restaurant was $25 a head so only did that one day and ventured out the others. Staff could not have been more helpful with recommendations and getting taxis. I really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LazyDazeLondon
Reviews.Content: Loved the public spaces of this hotel, and the outdoor design and lauout of terraces and pools. Were there 3 nights after a cruise so didnt venture out very far as there were several restaurants on site and all were excellent, especially Pearl which has imaginative menu and delicious, well presented dishes. The complimentary coffee in the morning in the lobby was a nice touch....and decently strong, but you really MUST ask Mirnel to make you a macchiato or latte which she does with great care. Positively the best we have ever had! I would recommend it and would go back, but we did find the bill a bit expensive with a heavy resort charge on top of the room rate, which came as a surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front room was beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Kalwj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 5 day stay at La Concha. We stayed in the ocean front suite which was beautiful! Almost an entire side of the wall is glass and slides open so it turns into a balcony overlooking the ocean. We absolutely loved it! The beach was always sunny and chairs and umbrellas were always available. We frequent the beaches of Hawaii which are pristine and I can say this beach is worth the trip. Our room was clean, had an overall positive experience with all the staff. The food was somewhat pricey, but that is expected at any beach resort! Overall, great time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone- as long as you reserve the ocean front jr. Suite!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Great”
Reviews.Author: R S
Reviews.Content: Jacqueline and Maria on the housekeeping staff are great. We had an issue with room and they quickly worked to assist in getting us another room. The room is great. very clean and great view. Thanks to them our trip is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: DBeth
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from 3/11-3/15/12. Overall we had a great trip and really enjoyed the hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. We had a room overlooking the pool on the first floor of a building of 2 floors. The room was fine as well as the bathroom and big shower. There are many pools to choose from. The beach was very nice but got very crowded as the day went on. They have full drink/food service on the beach as well as the pool. The ocean can be very rough so you need to be extra careful. We enjoyed the lobby bar and the casino. The lunch menu was good also. We went to 3 fabulous restuarants. Casa Lolla, Jam Rum Bar and the famous Ropa Vieja. All 3 are a must. All in all it was a great 5 day vacation and would return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Pools Are Nice, Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: jtml0802
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights with 9 girls for my bachelorette party. I did really like the pool area (especially the adults only infinity pool. Unfortunately, we didn't discover this until our last day here.) and because one of the rooms we had was very nice (sleeping area with the bed, a "living" area with a couch and stretched out lounger, plus a balcony). However, the service at the hotel was horrendous at times. Two of our rooms were not ready by check-in time. We had also requested in advance that the rooms be near each other to keep our party close, but we received rooms on different floors. They also messed up the surprise champagne delivery that my fiance had set up for us and so we did not receive this upon arrival to our room, but later on. When we complained about all this, they didn't have much to say. They finally offered us free late check out, but our flight was in the morning so we didn't need to take advantage of that anyway. Unfortunately, it rained quite a bit when we were there and a portion of the hotel has outdoor hallways where the rooms and elevators are. After the rain, nobody cleaned the elevator area on our floor to make sure big puddles would be swept away, so it was very easy for people to slip. We also ate at one of the restaurants for brunch, but the waitress got all our omelette orders mixed up! I would give this place a 2, but I do like the pools and think the building itself is nice... they just need to work on service. Oh, I will say though, that one point in good service would be the bellhops and doormen... they did always have a smile on their face and helped us get cabs when necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: postcolonialist
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to La Concha, and I was very happy with my stay. The hotel is aesthetically pleasing, filled with modern furniture, interesting lighting, and a hip vibe. I stayed in an ocean view room with two queen beds and a very small balcony. The room was tidy and spacious and included a small fridge, where we stored bottles of water we picked up at the nearby Walgreens. The room was carpeted, which I always find an odd choice in the tropics, but the room was fresh and clean. The beach was very full over the weekend, but we never had trouble finding beach chairs or a sunny spot. The ocean is very rough, and I say this as someone who loves big waves. Fortunately, there is a nice infinity pool on the beach, so we did our sunbathing and dipped in the infinity pool to cool off when we didn't want to brave the surf (and the surfers). There are a few vendors on the beach, but I didn't find it particularly bothersome. If you eat breakfast on the later side and then don't eat again until dinner, the breakfast buffet ($25 pp) is a reasonable deal - we opted for the buffet. But there are budget friendly options for the money conscious nearby, including a well-stocked Walgreens, a Starbucks, a Wendy's, and a Dunkin Donuts. There are a number of dinner options in the area, both inside and outside of the hotel. We dined in the hotel on two nights, once at Perla and the other time at Solera, which becomes a tapas bar at night. Perla was a lovely way to start off our trip. We ordered steak and lobster, both of which were fantastic, and don't miss the boca negra cake, which they serve with graham cracker ice cream and a toasted marshmallow - just like a deconstructed s'more. Perla was pricey, but the food was great and the atmosphere was lovely. Plus, you feel like you're dining in a giant oyster shell floating on water. (That's not a bad thing.) Solera was a decent choice, and the small plates we ordered tasted great, but they didn't really seem to fit together in the way I think a tapas menu should. We also loved the lobby bar, where we often stopped for a pre-dinner drink. I enjoyed a mojito or two (or three)! Outside of the hotel, we opted for dinner at Ropa Vieja, which is in walking distance. Don't miss this one, since there is very good Puerto Rican food to be had there. We went for the goat stew and the shrimp mofongo - yum! We also took a cab to Jose Enrique, which tends to get rave reviews. The menu changes nightly but the restaurant serves food inspired by a variety of Latin American cuisines and they know how to cook meat right. Our super splurgey meal was at Marmalade in Old San Juan, which was incredible and worth the price of admission. Just a 10-15 minute drive from the airport and relatively convenient to Old San Juan, La Concha was great for our 6-day beach holiday. I can't say this was my favorite beach vacation (once you've been to Dubai, nothing can measure up) but La Concha had everything I needed for a fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Modern Hotel with Very Friendly Employees”
Reviews.Author: Lusk623
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with gorgeous pool grounds (three pools.) The employees are very helpful and friendly. The jr suites and suites are spacious, the restaurants very good. The casino was OK for a slots player - nothing really fun, all of the machines the same with different themes. Well located to old San Juan and lots of restaurants you can walk to.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jbfgator
Reviews.Content: I guess the La Concha has experienced some negative press recently, but I love this place. It's funky and always a lot going on in the common areas. Staff is friendly. Lobby bar is always happening, as is the outside food seating. I've never been here on anything but business, but the pool and beach are beautiful. Workout room is very well equipped and has tremendous views. There is a casino. The rooms are small and my only "complaint" is that I can never seem to get my room cool enough! I believe all of them have an ocean view. Never stayed in the new tower, but folks I've traveled with say you must request a room there. One of the best features of this property is the location. Away from what I would consider touristy areas and yet lots of great shops and restaurants within a very short and safe walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cmnsensepls
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the most important things covered: clean, good food, great location, plenty of pools, and on the beach. The La Concha is in a great location. Easy walking distance to restaurants, shops, spas and bars. The beautiful beach is only steps out of the lobby and has plenty of chairs and umbrellas. The hotel had 4 separate pools; two with ocean view and one that is adult only. The suite had a large balcony and nice bathroom; great view of the ocean. Lemon water and fresh towels at each pool . Hotel is fun, the poolside restaurant is fantastic, and spent a great evening in the casino playing roulette. The hotel gave us each $20 to spend at the casino. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean, open, modern decor. Would go back. For the price this place is awesome. Housekeeping and concierge a bit slow if you are needy or expect a 5 star experience. This is way more fun and less stuffy than those places though. They even have a guy that makes giant coconut drinks! Try it the local way filled with cutty sark or filled with a drink of your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: HEARTPA
Reviews.Content: My wife, 12 yo daughter and I stayed at La Concha from March 8-12 2012. La Concha is in a great location to see San Juan and all the splendor this wonderful city has to offer. We arrivied at SJU and found a cab easily. The cab fare was flat at $15.00 to the Condado area. The cabs were clean and in excellent condition. The cabbies spoke english pretty well. We took numerous cab rides into old San Juan and again this was a fair flat rate. Never saw a meter running. Upon arriving at La Concha we were greeted with 2 of the nicest bellman I have ever come across in my travels, Victor and Felix. They will make you feel very welcome and both are very proactive in making sure you are taken care of during your stay. The check-in and check-out process was easy. Concierge services were always available, efficient and steered us to the right places. The king suite was large, clean, modern with a large fridge (for a hotel room), mw, stovetop and 2 flatscreen tv's. One in the master and a smaller one in the room with a pull out sleeper sofa. My 12 yo daughter slept on the sleeper sofa and found it comfortable. The Beach and surf was beautiful. The infinity pools were small, but clean and warm. The only negative was there was alot of shade in the area of the pools so if your there to work on a tan get out to the pool areas early or sun at the beach. We did not use the spa or on-site restaurants. The gym was was equipped with a direct view of the surf. The only low experieince was the bartenders. The outside pool bartenders were busy and made really good drinks but I never saw them smile at a customer or make eye contact (sort of distracted out of proportion to being busy). The inside bartenders who were not busy when my wife and I sat down never even acknowledged us. One tender in particular walked past us twice and without saying even "be with you in a minute". These 2 examples are small, but they are ones that guests remember. If you are looking for a great adventure that is somewhat physically challenging, call the Rocaliza tour group for the El Salto tour to the rain forest where you can hike, rapell and zip line. They will pick you up at the hotel. The guides were terrrific. (Marcus, Jacob and Samuel) In summary, I would highy recommend this hotel without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Big resort. very slow elevator.”
Reviews.Author: ila9
Reviews.Content: We were here with a big group last Spring for a wedding. The hotel had open areas to meet up. The elevators were incredible slow and 1 was shut down for at least 30minutes. Some celebrity was there (rumors were that of J.Lo) and required top security.
