As we were leaving the hotel to board our buses to take us to the rehearsal dinner (there were 250 of us) the entourage of big black SUVs took over the driveway. Annoying considering how many of us had to wait in the lobby for the craziness to move. One con about the hotel room. There are mirrors on the closet doors.. you have to make sure to close it correctly bec it can shatter if you open the drawer. We were told the hotel bar was the place to be 'scene'... it seemed slow that night. The area wasnt near much nightlife or a place to find a late nite snack. Thank god for the Subway sandwich shop across the street.

Reviews.Title: “nasty, nasty, nasty”
Reviews.Author: chriss z
Reviews.Content: first of all the service was terrible i had to wait so much time in the lobby to do my check in, when i got to my suite the key didn't work and i had to go to front desk because when i asked help at housekeeping they where having a bad attitude with me, when i finally got to my room i found hair in the floor and the worst part was that there was hair in the tube too. The sheets has stains , the refrigerator was durty, the walls had stains all over, when i went to take a shower the towel was broken . The next day when i went to the pool and then when i was going back to my room i saw in my room a housekeeping with a men kissing that had the same uniforme of La Concha Resort when they both saw me they got out of my suite. I lost my money in this (hotel) that really looks like a campers house i'm never going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you love Embassy Suites, this is for you”
Reviews.Author: alanglazen
Reviews.Content: There is absolutely zero charm to the rooms at this otherwise nice hotel. The rooms are exactly like those in Embassy Suites. Plenty of room, fridge, tv room---but devoid of style, warmth, anything. Really, the best use of this hotel is for New Year's Eve. Get the least expensive room, and enjoy the best, massive, free party on the island! Maybe that's why service was so poor, because we were there for New Years weekend. Aside from that, the food is good as are the drinks, but very expensive. Still, a nice place, and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sweetplums
Reviews.Content: I thought the overall atmosphere of the hotel was a lot of fun and the staff of the hotel were all incredibly nice which was pleasantly surprising. Felix is awesome, if you stay there, you'll know who he is. The room was a nice size and we had a great view of the ocean. We didn't check out any of the restaurants, but the lobby bar was a lot of fun at night and so was the casino. I would definitely recommend the hotel for people looking for a good nightlife while in Puerto Rico. A few complaints: We could hear the music in the lobby every night in our room after we went to bed. I was told you could not hear the music if you stayed in the "suite tower", but we were in the regular tower and could definitely hear the music. There is a rather steep resort fee you are charged daily (I believe it was $36+) and we were also charged for a maid gratuity daily, and a bellhop gratuity on the first day. These fees were by no means expensive, but we did not use the maid service once, and the bellhop did not help us with our bags on the first day, so to be charged for services you are not using was a bit obnoxious. Overall it was a fun hotel in a good location to get around San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: katy22
Reviews.Content: My husband and son are currently staying at La Concha. After a terrible screw up by Jet Blue they were put in a room with one double bed...two big guys, one small bed...not the most comfortable accommodations they were looking for. Since I booked this getaway for them, I called Jet Blue to see if they could help....let's just say I will never book a flight/hotel with them again. I then called the hotel directly and spoke to the front desk, I explained the situation and was so happy to hear a "let's see what we can do for you" The hotel was totally booked that night, but they assured me they would see what would be available the following day. They were sympathetic to the situation , and more importantly the wanted a guest in their hotel to be happy!! Happy ending, they were moved to a new room...two beds, and an ocean view!! I will be sure to tell anyone who is heading to Puerto Rico to do themselves a favor and book a room at the La Concha Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View from my 12th floor balcony in the Suite tower!”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: I travel to San Juan on business a few times per year and have always stayed at the Conrad hotel just down the street from La Concha but on this trip I decided to spend a couple of nights here to see what this hotel has to offer. I can tell you that the service at this Renaissance Marriott is far superior to the service at the Conrad which is a Hilton property. I am a Diamond rewards member with Hilton and I never receive any upgrades or special treatment at the Conrad. I was extremely impressed with the e-concierge service Marriott provided prior to check-in which allowed me to make any requests or special arrangements for my room. I am a Gold level member with their rewards program and I requested a complementary room upgrade from partial ocean view to ocean view and it was granted. Also, I requested the highest possible floor and that was also granted. My room was ocean front in the newer Suite Tower which has beautiful, spacious accomodations. From the friendly, helpful valet parking staff to the front desk employee who checked me in I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby and public areas of the hotel are gorgeous! My room had a nicely appointed living room / kitchen area, a spacious bath with an all glass walk in shower, a large closet, and comfortable bedroom with a wall of glass looking out over the beautiful Atlantic ocean. I slept both nights with the balcony door open to the refreshing sea breeze. My balcony included a table and chairs for relaxing or dining outdoors. I had dinner in the beautifully landscaped outdoor patio of the Solera restaurant and although the service is a bit slow, the staff was friendly. The complimentary breakfast that was served in the private lounge each morning was great and the ocean view was even better. Another difference that I noticed as a business traveler between the Conrad Hilton and this Marriott property is that La Concha has a complimentary business center where they DO NOT charge you to use the computers or to print documents! While staying at the Conrad on one of my trips I had a horrible experience with their business center and because it is run by an outside company they charge very high rates for printing and internet usage. I really enjoyed my stay at La Concha although I barely got to spend any time there enjoying the hotel facilities because I was out working all day. I would definitely like to return for a personal vacation someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn5Pa
Reviews.Content: This resort has everything you need for a great vacation Our room was lovely- ocean view. You could leave the sliding windows open at night to hear the ocean waves...not a bug in sight! The pools were lovely, and the restaurants in the hotel are good. The Perla is worth the money to make it a special evening. The Vogo Italian restaurant has a wonderful Venetian Lasagna. You can walk the treadmills in the fitness room while looking out at the ocean Courteous staff. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: likethewind27
Reviews.Content: Hotel was pretty but overpriced. Rooms were compact but view of the ocean was beautiful. Check in was long and challenging because the hotel was over-booked and they didn't have a room with 2 double beds. They finally "found" one after 45 minutes of waiting at the check-in desk. This is a negative way to begin a hotel stay and taints the experience. Brunch buffet was good and we were happy we sat inside because the birds all over the outside tables were disgusting. My husband and son enjoyed the casino and even won a bit of money. Great restaurants within walking distance. Beach was nice and food and drink service was sporadic but still nice to have at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: DCchick77
Reviews.Content: Nothing but fantastic could describe my stay here. One of the best places I have ever stayed. Staff was friendly, pool was very nice, Perla had a great pairing menu very reasonably priced. This was my second trip to San Juan and the best hotel. First time I stayed at the Caribe Hilton and would never recommend anyone stay there, La Concha is far better as to location, rooms, food etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke...”
Reviews.Author: Reef2121
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it is a preferred vendor for my company and given that I was born and raised in PR I has visited the bar/casino on previous ocassions. Upon arrival my room key did not function. The maid service lady was in the room next to mine so she asked me about my problem and proceeded to try to open the door with the master key with no luck. She informed me to wait by my door as she called maintenance service. After 30 MINS. someone showed up!!! I must give it to the cleaning lady, Atena, who was very apoligetic about the issue and remained available as she proceeded to continue with her duties in the room next to me. After waiting in the sun with 85F weather in my suit the door to my room was opened. I walked into a ocean view suite with stained sheets (needless to say they were not redlipstick stains...) Since the cleaning staff was next door I inform (and called frontdesk) and the already apologelic lady changed the sheets for me. I had valet my car and called to get it in the morning as I was intructed during check in. I came down ~15mins later after my call and no car, according to the valet staff the front desk told the them the wrong ticket number when I had call, strike 2. After an all day meeting I return to my suite around 6pm and every single outlet in the room is not functioning which hindered my ability to complete my work duties on my laptop. Again I go to front desk and they assure me they would take care of it, which they did. As I was going out for dinner I stopped by and explained that I had a late flight the next day and needed to complete several telecons and webconferences from my room and wanted to see if I could get a late check out, without even checking what room and/or rate on the computer I got a very rude NO. I am not sure if this is due to the fact that I am from PR and tried to be understanding/friendly with the staff in spanish but as a business traveler with an international corporation this experience does not make me want to come back here EVER. I will be making sure that upon my return to the US I inform my company's travel agent vendor to never book anyone here, for me its truly sad as I would love to bring business back to this place but never after this experience. Can't wait for the Vanderbilt Hotel next door to open... I also found that multiple crimes have occured in this hotel, BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to love it, but.........”
Reviews.Author: ohiorona
Reviews.Content: I really had high hopes for this property, we ususally stay at the Ritz in Puerto Rico, but on Marriott points I was able to get free nights at La Concha. I think age and expectations play a big part in the reviews. I've been traveling almost 30 years and have a pretty high standard to meet. That isn't to say those who haven't traveled as much are not entitled to their opinion, but that being said if you haven't stayed at truly amazing resorts, this would be considered very good, I however, without sounding snobbish, expected a little more. First although we had a oceanfront suite, I felt the furnishings were very cheap looking the room, It was clean, but still had an older feel to it. The pool area is very nice, but serivce at all the reataurants was horrible, That is what I am basing my average rating on in particular. Especially the breakfast restaurant, extremely disorganized, and for four days, never got our food without asking or it took forever. The area is not what I would call upscale as opposed to other areas in PR. A couple of so called designer shops nearby, but really nothing. It's also smack in the middle of downtown Condado, stil a cab ride to nicer restaurants and Old San Juan. The lobby area was the most attractive and active area of the hotel and the casino was on par with other island casinos. All I can say is it just depends on how high your standards are and what you are used to. If I was 20 again, this place would probably be a 5 star, but that was then this is 30 years later. Let's put it this way , we went to the Ritz for dinner and I felt like I was where I needed to be. The remodeling was done well, but even the new tower didn't feel updated, and the only pools to get morning sun is the main pool area the small one at the towers gets 0 sun in the morning and the pool overlooking the ocean isn't that sunny either, so everyone is kind of on top of each other. Like I said it depends on what kind of vacation you are looking for they still need to work on the restaurants or I would have rated higher. But it can't compare to the Ritz experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha-overall a good experience, but a few small issues”
Reviews.Author: Clare B
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 March-5 March 2012 at this resort in the new tower in a one bedroom suite. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. The property is lovely and well-maintained, the surrounding neighborhood is interesting, and the service is friendly, albeit slow. There were a few issues that detracted from our overall experience. We arrived late afternoon after a long day of travel. Upon arrival, there was a long line and no separate line for Marriott Rewards Elite members, so we waited a while. When we got to the desk, we were told that our room needed to be "inspected by engineering" and were handed a restaurant-style beeper to notify us when the room was ready. After waiting for a while, I found a staff member and requested that we get a room immediately. Miraculously, our room was ready at that time. When we got in, it was clear that the "inspection" had something to do with previous guests smoking in the suite, because it reeked. At that point, we just opened the sliding door and hoped for the best because we didn't want to wait any longer. The lamp by the door did not work, so I called the front desk about that. A gentleman came to look at it and said someone would be back to fix it. It was not fixed during our stay. There were also some other small service issues (coffee and other items not replaced daily, etc.) but nothing major. Our experience with the poolside restaurant is consistent with other reviewers'-adequate, resort-priced food with slow service. I didn't expect anything else-service in the islands is typically friendly, but slow. I don't think this restaurant was any exception. The food and drink were not cheap, but not out of line given that this is a resort. We enjoyed the suite tower and were excited about the adults-only pool. There seemed to be a wedding going on that weekend, so twice the pool and associated terrace were closed for private events, which was disappointing. We had to go over to the main pool area which was a lot louder and more crowded, and not as convenient to our room. The ocean was too rough for swimming, but we did sit on the beach. I found that the gentlemen manning the chairs and umbrellas were friendly and attentive. We spoke with two ladies at the concierge desk regarding recommendations for dining in Old San Juan and excursions on the way to Fajardo. One was very helpful, the other was less so. In sum, we had a nice stay despite the blips. The lobby and street facing the hotel are very loud at night, but being in the suite tower facing the ocean, we did not have any noise issues. There is a Hertz located in the Marriott a few blocks up Ashford, which was convenient when we rented a car. There are a lot of good restaurants and some upscale shops within walking distance. We had breakfast at the DD across the street, and the Walgreens a bit farther up was perfect for stocking up on bottled water, sunscreen, etc.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: Erinne C
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the best time. La Concha is located in a terrific spot. The beach was great. The staff was so friendly and helpful! Special shout outs to Kristina who gave us "emergency champagne" and also the Best.Bartender.Ever: Jonathan Ruiz!

Reviews.Title: “Great long awaited vacation”
Reviews.Author: karenjim10
Reviews.Content: After reading Tripadvisor reviews by other people, I chose La Concha and I was really happy with the choice. The staff was unbelievable. Kirstine and Linette at the front desk were great. Unbelievably helpful and always cheerful. Then there was Victor the concierge. Great recommendations, delightful personality and made reservations all over for us. Stayed in the towers with a partial view. The rooms were great, if you get partial view, it's best to be up higher. The hotel is in good condition. They make everything very easy, all very helpful, and relaxed. I did expect the area to be like "south Beach" but that was the only thing a little disappointing. It's like they started to build up the area, and then stopped. But it grew on us and we enjoyed it. The beach in front of the hotel is ok, but the infinity pools are WONDERFUL. They are heated, and you just sit in the pool looking at the ocean and its great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place within a local area”
Reviews.Author: amgobrogge
Reviews.Content: This resort is directly on the beach and right in the heart of the Condado Beach area. There are many, many restaurants and shops within walking distance of this hotel. The resort has a very chic, hip and trendy feel to it. The infinity pools are amazing, although the adult pool that faces the ocean is mostly shaded. The service at the pool area was great. My husband and I had a 1 Bedroom suite overlooking the main pool and we could even see the cruise ship, but the noise at night is really an issue for this place. The area is definitely a late night party scene. If you don't want noise, then you should book an ocean view/front room. Also the set up of the bathroom doesn't lend to much privacy. There is only a frosted glass window separating the bathroom from where the bed is, and if you have children along that might be a concern. Overall it was a very nice property with great amenities. It only took about 10 minutes by cab to get to the airport and then also a 10 minute cab right to get over to Old San Juan. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Superbowl Weekend 2012”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie G
Reviews.Content: There is always something happening at La Concha, We were there Super Bowl weekend and they had a huge screen in the lobby for the game and a good crowd of Yankees rooting for their teams. it's in a good area for great restaurants without needing a cab, and to further avoid cab fares the bus stops right outside and gets you to Old San Juan for seventy-five cents. The park next door is nice. The people that felt the area was maybe not quite safe haven't been in truly bad areas. There are always people on the street, cabs, and a good rythym of life since there is a residential area nearby. Not all tourists, but a good mix of residents in the area too. The rooms that face the city get a bit noisy from the bar across the street, but I don't know what the hotel can do about that. Very comfortable room, superb attitude from all employees, good food, especially the shushi bar, and love the all adult infinity pool that is heated. We also used the private, members only club which was very nice. All trips that we arranged through the conceriage went smoothly and were well worth the experience. No complaints about the La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous health code violations. Won't be returning, ever.”
Reviews.Author: Hwk01
Reviews.Content: Allow me to start by saying that after traveling to many worldwide destinations, I consider myself very open minded to cultural variations in standards and service, to include allowing some room for forgiveness when it comes expectations of a hotel and its staff. What transpired at La Concha Resort during our recent visit transcends these allowances, and was far from acceptable. I'll start with check in. Arriving around 5pm in the afternoon, only one staff member was available to assist guests. After waiting for a while, we were greeted by a friendly employee, though we'd later find out that despite informing them of our parking arrangements, we'd eventually be improperly charged. After a long day of travel, we were hungry and anxious to try out the hotel's restaurants that we'd previously read positive reviews of. We stopped by Solera, the poolside tapas lounge. Finding the non-staffed receptionist's stand for the restaurant, we waited for over 5 minutes as various waiters and staff members visually acknowledged us, however neglected to greet us, nor assist in any way. Typically I'd speak up, but I wanted to see where simply waiting would get us. Not far, it seems. Eventually someone came by to seat us, providing us with only one menu. That was only the beginning of the wait however. We jokingly wondered how long it would take a waiter to arrive, finding the answer to be about 15 minutes. Both of us having been in professional food service for many combined years, we have a realistic expectation of what good service looks like, and this wasn't it. Being on vacation however, we were again willing to let things slide, looking to relax. Drinks took another 15 minutes. Food, another 30. An hour after showing, we finally had food on the table, and empty drinks with no second round in sight. Giving up on this lost cause led us off the resort and across the street to a local bar & grill that provided much better service. Back to the room, we called it a night. Understanding that people have infinite sleep preferences, be warned that La Concha's beds satisfy none. A stiff bed, thin sheets, and hard, thin pillows are what await. Sleep didn't come easy, or comfortable here. The straw that broke the back however was our visit to La Concha's Komakai sushi bar. Only intending to stop by for a quick appetizer, we ordered a lobster roll. We anticipated by now from previous service that it would be slow, and this visit was no exception. What did surprise and disgust us however, was when a sushi chef came out from the kitchen (into the dining area) with a bleeding nose, rags wrapped around his face. He then proceeded behind the sushi bar where our food was being prepared, talking to the other chef while his nose bled. During that time, he touched various utensils, food prep items, and various foods, still covering his bleeding nose. Immediately upon being served our food, openly prepared near a bleeding chef, I sought out management. Walking to to front desk and asking for the on duty manager earned me a 10 minute wait, while my wife sat back at our table with our likely contaminated sushi. After finally speaking to a manager and explaining the situation, I was told that she would speak a food service manager, and offered little other resolution. I of course informed her that we would not be eating the food we were served, and she agreed. Walking back to my wife, I watched as she consulted with the food service manager in the lobby. The food manager neglected to speak with me, and went to discuss the matter with the offending chef. Disgusted with the dangerous food service standards, we left to find food in the local area again instead. What really put the nail in the coffin, however, was seeing that upon our return nearly an hour later, the previously offending cook was still behind the sushi bar, preparing other guest's food. Not only was this blatant health code violation ignored by the chef, but apparently acceptable to the management. No effort by the staff was ever made to amend this experience (or any other), and by this point we were just ready to call it quits and leave. Any effort to address serious concerns such as these are met with general indifference by the management. I'm still considering addressing this issue with the local health department, as management at La Concha shows no inclination to police themselves or their employees. Other experiences at the hotel's Voga restaurant provided better service and flavors, though now realizing how lax La Concha is with health standards in their kitchens, it makes me worry, to say the least. One concession I will make about our visit however was the service provided by the valet staff. These professionals are the first to greet you as you arrive, and reflect a positive attitude about the resort that is not seen nearly anywhere else. Management: take note, if your entire staff was even half as professional, courteous, and helpful as your valet team, you'd have a hotel worth considering. Potential guests: your experiences may vary, these are merely mine. Again, I'm generally agreeable when it comes to variation in service standards across various borders, but I draw the line at dangerous and unhealthy violations. Stay and eat at La Concha at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “very late review”
Reviews.Author: P F
Reviews.Content: This review is VERY late in coming. I almost feel bad having waited so long (I made a promise that I would post something - because they were just so good!). My wife and I went for our honeymoon. They went out of their way to make it memorable. Luis Forty, Director of Guest Services, was SO helpful!! The restaurant (in the shell) was unreal. Sitting by the pool or beach was so nice on a good day. 5 stars - even if 2+ years late! We will go back someday! (could only choose back to 2011).

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyLadyCB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned for a 4 night stay. The hotel is little bit more than what we normally spend...but worth it for a special occasion! We booked an oceanfront junior suite. Loved the room (albeit not exactly spotless - minor carpet stain and other minor issues), bed was okay. When I booked our stay I sent an email specifically requesting a high floor and was disappointed to hear that they booked us on the third floor when we checked in. However, they changed our room to a higher floor when I mentioned that we were there for my husband's birthday! Our room didn't come with a microwave, but I was able to request one from housekeeping. Quiet room, beautiful view, and comfortable chase lounges to rest on while I stared at the ocean! Some people on tripadvisor said that they were unaware that the hotel was going to charge a resort fee (mine was about $40 a night). I booked my trip with Orbitz and was given the heads up. Note to the hotel, it wouldn't hurt for you guys to reiterate the fee upon checking in. Be aware that the beaches are not private. Also, there are pros and cons to the area...easy access to local spots, you're in the middle of everything...Walgreens, liquor stores, etc. (You really don't need a car except if you want to take a few day trips. There are car rental places near the hotel - we rented a Lancer from Enterprise for about $48/day.) There's a lot of traffic on the street at night, particularly on the weekends. I was also surprised to see homeless people sleeping on the street just a block from the hotel. I never felt unsafe...however, the visual is a bit unsettling. Some reviewers here complained about the pools being crowded, but I didn't see that. It was a bit breezy so I appreciated the slightly heated pools! Restaurants in the neighborhood - avoid Cafe del Angel (spelling?) across the street! My husband is Puerto Rican so I know good Puerto Rican food. This place served watered down beans and food with minimal flavor. Pelayos (71 Luisa Street) is a must for any meal! I heard about their pancakes from Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. My husband said they served a great cup of coffee! We also went for dinner and I had the best arroz con pollo! Don't pass on the deserts....take the yummy flan and delicious amaretto cake to go! There is a Denny's at the Conrad hotel but their pancakes were like paper weights....yuck! Dining recommendation away from the property - if you rent a car, drive to Guavate about 20 mins away...the concierge can give you directions and it's an easy drive. The best time to go to this area is on the weekend when they have live music, but even if you go during the week, you will get the best lechon (roasted pork) ever! i first heard about this area from a Travel Channel link. We're only talking about a block or two of side-road eateries. There's nothing fancy about this place, in fact, the spot we went to looked like a dive, but the food was great, plentiful and reasonably priced! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - wrong place”
Reviews.Author: mainys
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the tower suites - partial ocean view. Very nice room, although if you have trouble lifting your legs or are unsteady, get the room with the walk in shower - the tub is high. The bathroom is gorgeous. Bed passable for the week. Living room nice to have. Tile floors in living room - carpeted bedroom. The resort is very beautiful but the pools are too crowded. Chairs too close and beach water rough. The street vendors come down the beach, which is unwanted. Walking the beach is horrendous - graffiti on beach walls and sketchy characters about. Location of hotel is god awful. Run down buildings all around and homeless people lying on the sidewalk. It's not worth being on the beach to stay here. Stay in Old San Juan at El Convento. Nice and beautiful there. There are plenty of police around, which gives both the feeling of safety and yet why do you need so many police - so you don't feel safe. Too bad La Concha's neighborhood wasn't a match for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ! South Beach comes to San Juan...”
Reviews.Author: traveler51
Reviews.Content: Arriving at midnight read reviews that Condado area is all closed up so we checked in and headed to the casino for a drink....Looking out from our room was a bit worried since all I saw was darkness and pavement (thought it was a parking lot was a park) complained to front desk and he assured me it wasn't I had one of the prettiest views in the hotel overlooking the lagoon type beach.(He also said if I wasnt satisfied the next day, he would put me elsewhere but it was 100 percent occupied) Next morning he was right...floor to ceiling windows just beautiful...(Window opened to get the sea breeze) We were on the 12 th floor panoramic views.... Beach boys were great...immediately want to help you w/ chairs and umbrellas (get them early sun is HOT!) Since it was Feb. break (we checked in Wed. night) each day the hotel/beach seemed to get more crowded but they handled it beautifully...(Even with 2 weddings scheduled over the weekend) We were checking out Sunday for a 7 day cruise as were alot of other guests.... The numerous pools at resort are lovely although we spent most of the time at the beach... changing tides make it calm then rough a happy medium for all.... Poolside bars and restaurants were EXCELLENT...although you can get some GREAT buys at local restaurants ...will write in another review.(s) The famed restaurant that sits overlooking the water is pricey but the view,service, and food is worth it even if you go for appetizers. That weekend it was booked solid so check out if you need areservation beforehand. They are also linked to Opentable.com if you are a member. By the way there is a Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts in a 2 block radius of hotel but the morning Puerto Rican coffee in the room and coffee bar is really good as well. If you forget something at home Walgreens is 2 blocks away and open 24/7. Outside hotel and steps away you have some of the finest shopping a person can ask for numerous boutiques, Cartier, Louis Vuitton,Salvatore Ferragamo...and others... All in all we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great with my Toddler! to my surprise”
Reviews.Author: lareduxer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time with our 18m old at La Concha during SuperBowl weekend. I was a bit hesitant to stay there at first, as the resort really seems to cater to an older and more hip crowd. But they managed to balance it all very well. We had a room in the 11th floor of teh Ocean Tower, I think all rooms there are consider Ocean View suites. Since we had orignally booked a room in a lower floor, we were upgraded and that was nice. The room had ample space in the living room, flat screen TV in both rooms, a full refrigerator, very large closet, microwave, coffe maker, and a full stock kitchen. The pool is open 24h and heated, it has two levels one mostly for adults and near the jacuzzis and a lower one with plent yof kids playing. We ate at La Perla, found it to be a bit over the top, but the fish was great. Love the pitcher of "Parcha" Mojito (passion fruit) and the breakfast down starts at the lobby had great coffee, yogurt, fruit, and fresh pastries. Stay away from the Sushi bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pharmduq64
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great stay. Bar in the lobby is wonderful, staff are friendly, and room was spectacular. Second time there, better than the first.

Reviews.Title: “Condado's Best”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: Having been to San Juan many times and stayed at numerous hotels, we found La Concha to be just perfect. From the moment you walk into the very hip and spacious lobby you are treated exceptionally well. All the staff are friendly and willing to please. We stayed in a King Suite in the Suite Towers with a gorgeous view of the ocean. Very comfortable bed, two flat screens, small kitchen and sitting room (bit uncomfortable and retro looking but functional). The beach is great (it helps to have amazing weather) and you can certainly swim in the ocean contrary to other TA reports. The guys get you a chair and umbrella and away you go. Not a mad, rushed scene even in the height of the season. The pools are ok--main one had too many kids for me and the others were pretty shaded--and heated. Food is generally good. La Perla fine room, nice view, good solid food and reasonable prices. Breakfast was at the Italian restaurant (which we did not eat in in the evening) and the $25 buffet good quality and plenty of interesting things plus an omlett station. Lunch was served pool site--wraps and burgers and salads--all well prepared. The location is great right on Ashford and a short walk to restaurants and hotels and up market shops. Bit funky but ok with me. Prices are very good at this hotel and it gets my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Condado at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Aloha_Kid_Art
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this place online and we stayed to stay here because of it's excellent location and great value (military rates $195/night). We had an ocean view room on the 4th floor - small but cozy. We had to ask for luggage racks to put our suitcases on. A desk chair had to be replaced due to a broken wheel. The shower had a mildew smell to it. We asked someone to investigate it while we were out and about. Upon our return, we checked in with the front desk. This new staff shift knew nothing of our complaint (no note left for the oncoming shift). They sent someone up shortly thereafter to spray some chemicals down the shower drain. On our second day, the housekeeper forgot to leave washclothes and soap. The valet service was courteous and helpful until we checked out when they could not locate our car for over 45 minutes. Several outdoor hotel parties went late into the night and were loud enough to be heard in our room. We used the gym facilities and they were excellent with modern equipment and friendly staff. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants but did have drinks nightly at the Italian restaurant where the bartenders were friendly and gave generous pours. The location of La Concha is on Ashford Street - the heart of lots of excellent nighttime activities in Condado (all within walking distances). We've decided we will not be staying at La Concha again but will definitely return to the area for fun and relaxation at another facility.

Reviews.Title: “Kickin' Back w/Kids in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Kickinbackwthekids
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Puerto Rico with the family. We loved La Concha! The resort is beautiful for so many reasons. We stayed in the Suite Tower, a newly constructed tower-each room includes a kitchen, sitting area, beautiful bathroom and separate bedroom. The overall ambience of the resort is elegant with a retro-chic vibe. The service is outstanding-from the minute you arrive at the front desk, to housekeeping who graciously attends to each guests individual needs, The personalized service continues to the pool and beach and essentially everywhere your turn! There is no question that the staff has been trained to make each guest feel special. The poolside servers are wonderful-I could drop a few names but that wouldn't be fair because they are ALL outstanding! There are so many little treasures throughout the property-sitting areas for dining, lounging, reading or relaxing! The property beckons to each guest to slow down, relax and enjoy! La Concha is a great value! This resort and its well trained, polished staff provide five star service at an affordable price. We look forward to returning next year with the family, as well as beforehand as a couple!

Reviews.Title: “You can have it all.”
Reviews.Author: francophileinny
Reviews.Content: Consider your own needs before booking anywhere. My needs were as follows: Beach plus pool Ocean view room for under $350 a night No more than ten minutes from Old San Juan One high end restaurant for a good dinner I prefer smaller hotels, but after a day I was okay with the massive amounts of people and the spot mongering of beach lounge chairs which is prevalent at resorts since I am a morning person who likes to wake up at 6:30, go to the beach to read/nap until 10 for breakfast time. There is the family space (inside courtyard pool area) which has tight seating, the ocean side pool with more space, the beach with plenty of space to not be amongst the thorngs if you choose, and one pool on the opposite side of the porperty which I preferred as it was pretty much adults only and under fifteen lounge chairs next to an infinity pool overlooking the ocean. This is where I went when I lamented the quantity of people surrounding me. There is an odd vibe of business folk with meetings and laptops and families and kids running about. Sunset becomes clublike festive and no more pool time. The staff were all so pleasant and helpful. One concierge mixed up the helicopter arrangements, but everyone else was proficient in the communications and job. The bar staff in the main lounge were eager to push the drinks, everywhere else was much more chill. Breakfast for two was $46 and dinner at Perla was $148 - this makes the dinner an amazing value in comparison. As a New Yorker, the prices were no shock, and for resort prices, I didn't think they were all that high. I was comfortable with the prices. some spoke about the horrendous resort fee. Every hotel has this. Go to another island if this upsets you (or rent a house for a week like our friends did near Boqueron). The food was fine, service was island speed. No one moves swiftly in hot climates. Nicaragua, Hawaii, the southern US, Puebla Mexico, Botswana. If you are in a rush, you cannot have a sit down lunch. Even France and Italy require a two hour lunch. Prior reviews had complaints, but the only agreement I have is that I saw that they were understaffed at times. One guy to move lounge chairs one morning and two waitresses doing their best at breakfast (with smiles and great personality). I was pleased by my stay (20-24). Got the Ocean View Jr. Suite for just $303. The room was 4th floor. I wanted higher up, but then saw the view. If I were higher, I wouldn't have the sand, waves, and palm tress in my view (just the water). It was much more pleasant. 3rd and 4th floor rooms by the restaurant Solera about 408-415 had exhaust from the restaurant as well as pool noises and club like noises. 405 only had pool noises. At Solera, if you are in a rush, sit by the bar, but endure the smoke of the cooking, otherwise sit on the comfy lounges far from the cooking station and be patient. Perla was great food. Skip the wine. My PR friends don't understand the wine craze on the island. the wine list is great, but you cannot find a bottle for under $65. There were many bottles between $600-2000. At this price, the wine should be decanted with me present hours before I enjoy it. It was a silly thing to have at a resort restaurant. Just get a mixed drink. Walgreens is across the street and down a block, so get your big bottles of water and essentials there to cut costs and be comfortable during your stay. There is a mini fridge in room. San Juan is really a one day trip, so there is no need to stay in the Old District. There is the Castillo del Morro and tourist shops. Nothing so special that you truly need, unless you have never been off the mainland before. For me, Old San Juan was best after 5pm, when most of the cruise ship folks and other tourists left my PR friends and I to stroll in cooler, breezier weather with more space to stroll. Avoid Old San Juan in middle of day - hot, lots of people. Staying at Condado area allowed us to visit city by taxi ($15-20) each way, and enjoy most of our time with the sound of waves and a beautiful tradewind breeze. I will return to this hotel again. Updated facilities with cool retro original shell kept (not just the restaurant shell) and modern interiors, happy helpful people (DON'T forget to tip everyone - tourism industry requires a modicum of generosity on your part!). I do wish they had hooks for towels in the bathroom closer to the shower and a place or way to dry bathing suits (it is a beach resort!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: CBaldy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend getaway for our 17th anniversary and just got back today. We had a wonderful time! Our room was in the "older" building and overlooking the city. We didn't care. Clean, comfy. The staff was wonderful! we checked in a little early but the room wasn't ready, so the hotel held our luggage while we explored the property. We were given a pager to let us know when it was ready. The property is gorgeous! infinity pools, marble floors, white furniture in the lobby, an open air lobby, three pools, beautiful view of the ocean, right on the beach. Just perfect. less than 30 minutes we got our room. within minutes, the manager called us to check in and make sure we were happy with our accommodations. we were. Our room was very large, with a seating area, kitchenette (2 eye stove, microwave, fridge) and a balcony. The bathroom had two shower heads...a stationary one and one with a hose. The wall beside the kitchen had two wall closets with a dresser area between them. very nice. We wanted to go to El Yunque and Luquillo beach but that particular tour wasn't one of the options in the tour book at the concierge desk. I spoke with Zoraida (?) and she said she could make a couple of calls for me. Turns out she booked us the following morning for a tour doing exactly what we wanted! It was only supposed to be about 4 hours but it was truly an all day . event. It was so worth it. Zoraida connected us with a tour guide named Rupert. ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! He took local roads to El Yunque so he could give us a "history tour" of each of the towns on the way to the rain forest. Waterfalls, botanical information, historical information, Rupert had it all. We went to the rain forest, had a fantastic lunch and relaxed at the beach.. Highly recommend! The following day, we took the bus to Old San Juan. The bus stop is at the end of the drive way of the hotel and is only 75 cents. The bus ride is about 10 minutes to town and drops you off a block from the heart of Old San Juan. The one drawback...no schedule. It kind of runs when it wants to...sort of. If a cab driver sees a group of people, you may be able to work out a deal for about $3 per person. Go to LaBombonera! Mallorca bread. That's all I'm going to say. Went back to the hotel and lounged at the pool, then the beach...SO nice. Pools are nice and warm, clean. The staff is very attentive. They keep an eye on the beach entrance to the pool to ensure only guests are at the pool. Natalia at the concierge desk helped us plan our anniversary dinner, she is very sweet and helpful. We kept it simple and went to a nice Italian restaurant (yes, Italian :0)) two minutes walk from the hotel. VERY nice. Something I wanted to add in addition to a wonderful attentive staff, this hotel is in a great location. Every morning people are running up and down the street, there is a second beach five minutes walk from the hotel (Condado Beach) no waves. There are plenty of authentic cuisine restaurants, chains (if you're missing home) starbucks, dunkin doughnuts, souvenir shops, upscale shops (Cartier & Louis Vuitton about 1 block away). There's a casino in the hotel and another casino about 10 minute stroll down the street. I felt safe very safe. The Heineken Jazz Fest happened at the plaza right beside the hotel. Wonderful music! Traffic was at a stand still and there were people everywhere but it was very nice, no craziness. again, I felt very safe. If you want a nice getaway, this is the place. If you have trouble with noise, ask for an ocean view room or shut the sliding glass door, it blocks all the street sounds. The staff and hotel are lovely and I would definitely return. A side note, the internet is free but slow. That's ok, you have nothing but time! You're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The holidays in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: carlafp
Reviews.Content: WE decided to spend Christmas in SanJuan with our teenagers - what a wonderful choice it was! The hotel was lovely, the room was spacious- we had booked a junior suite, but when we went to check-in theonly available were with just a King size bed...the front desk quickly moved us to a room with two queen - not full- size beds with an ocean view to compensate...it was a agreat room the standard rooms must be oversized the bathroom was roomy and we had a lovely view. Service was a little slow in the poolside cafe, but we enjoyed everything else about our stay - even though lots of other guests were REALLY obnoxious about "reserving" pool chairs...we went down to the beach and LOVED the ambience

Reviews.Title: “A Real Paradise”
Reviews.Author: kolet S
Reviews.Content: We have spent a wonderful time in La Concha to start 2012 (New Year's Eve weekend). The beach is nice and close. The service, decorations and ocean view excellent, the party was really gorgeous (band+DJ). We came with our 28- year - old daughter from london who enjoyed herself as in Ibiza. She even met VIP from the UK. We stayed there two weekends last year. The first time, Vanessa, a guest service agent, took great care of us. All the staff is caring ! Super time ! We'll certainly come back. Kolet from Martinique (French Caribbean).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fond memories”
Reviews.Author: MGfromFL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I joined 6 family members from Feb. 18 to Feb. 24. (same group as the review from Peter F). La Concha provided us with a great experience, beginning before the trip as Victor Rodriguez worked with my sister and I via email to make arrangements for 8 people for dinner and excursions. The concierge staff continued to assist us throughout the trip. While the entire staff was extraordinarily pleasant and helpful, three people stood out to me: Victor Rodriguez, Frank Aponte, and Luis Torres. In particular for me, Victor truly went above and beyond to provide us with a memorable visit. A particular highlight was when I asked him about arranging a birthday lunch for my husband. I wanted a dessert that was not on the hotel menu, and Victor went outside of his work schedule to pick up a fabulous tropical treat and get it to the hotel on time. Somehow from that point on it seemed like most of the staff knew we were celebrating a birthday. A perfectly chilled bottle of champagne was sent up to our room - that was a complete surprise and what a treat! We ate breakfast at the Voga Grill, where Luis took great care of us, lunch at the poolside grill, ordered sushi one night, and had cocktails at the bar. Everything was fresh, well-prepared, and tasty. Cocktails were perfect - nothing watered down or second rate. We felt we received excellent value for any food service (the two for one special breakfast offer helped here). Could use a bit more variety for the lunch menu - after 5 lunches we had eaten everything. Maybe a daily special or two - or make the children's menu available to adults in different portions (the macaroni and cheese looked darn good). We had a room in the "old" tower on the 7th floor. The view was fabulous and the sound of the ocean was soothing, and there was nothing "old" about the room. The only thing that should have been done differently from the beginning is that our room was small with no drawer space, which was fine once extra hangars were delivered. The hotel should realize that without drawers you need a good supply of hangars and should stock the room with them. I should note that the rooms in general are not small at all - we just had a setup where you enter through a hallway (which kept things quiet at night) and then there are two rooms on either side of the hall. The pool area was beautiful and a very pleasant seating area for lunch, but we always sat on the beach. The beach staff was great about setting up chairs and umbrellas for our large group. Great beach for walking on early in the morning - bring shoes and walk back on the sidewalk to see the neighborhood. I would definitely return to La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter V
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at La Concha many times while on business in Puerto Rico. Everytime I have stayed there the staff has been very friendly and go out of their way to make sure your stay is great. The last time I stayed at La Concha at the end of January and beginning of February, I was getting the continental breakfast and one of the La Concha staff members, Giovonni Colon, was superb! Not only was he stocking items at the bar area but he went out of his way to talk to and other customers. He is very genuine and really went the extra mile to make sure we enjoyed our stay at La Concha. It is because of staff such as Giovonni that I will continue to stay at La Concha and recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great employees”
Reviews.Author: marvin0128
Reviews.Content: Louise the front desk manager answered all my many many questions which much patience and advice about what I could do with my 10 year old son during our vacation. Franky the concierge implemented my decisions by repeatedly making phone calls until he was able to get positive responses, Thank you both for helping me organize a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful setting and pretty nice environment”
Reviews.Author: Roadwarriormama
Reviews.Content: I visited here this week with 2 adults. It looks good for families too though. 3 pools - one would be great for small kids, one is good for all and one is adult only. Warm water in pools. Beach is nice, although pretty rough water here - so not great for ocean swimming. A short dip is fine. We ate at the poolside restaurant and that was good. Lucky enough to be in the Suite tower, which was very modern and nice. Staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. Good recommendations from concierge. Good location to access Old SJ and other local restaurants. We took rainforest tour arranged by hotel and it worked great (although if you pay by cc there is a surcharge). It is resort pricing, so be prepared for the drinks etc. to seem a bit over the top. But the mojitos are extremely good... I would consider returning if I was going to be on this part of the island again.

Reviews.Title: “Odd Set-up”
Reviews.Author: boardthedogandgo
Reviews.Content: As the title indicates, the outdoor space has an odd set up. There are four pools that get only intermittent sun during the day. So if you want continuous sun, you would have to move from pool to pool all day. The beach is a bit crowded but probably the best way to get sun and a little personal space. The rooms are okay. They try to decorate the rooms in a chic/clean line mode, but the decor in the rooms reminded me of something from the 1970s. The bed is terrible and the pillows are worse. The bathroom is adequate but it would be better with two sinks and a bench in the shower to aid with leg shaving, but by the end of the week I became more proficient at standing on one leg and shaving. So those are the negatives.... The biggest assets of the resort are the location, staff, and lobby. The location is great, walking distance to shops, groceries, restaurants. The staff are super friendly, helpful. The lobby is beautiful and well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but service sometimes lacking”
Reviews.Author: Daniel G
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a one-bedroom suite in the tower. Overall had a great experience. Beach is especially nice because of proximity to hotel and pools. Hotel did not seem crowded even though over Presidents' Day weekend and school vacation. Pools and ocean were great for pre-teens. Although we reserved a room with a city view, we ended up in a room overlooking the bay and pool area. Night noise was not a problem, even though we were only on the 6th floor. Music by the pool was on weekend only, and only until 10pm. We had two complaints. First, hotel room, while nice on the surface, had a number of flaws. Mattress on pull-out couch was incredibly uncomfortable (after first night, switched to air mattresses provided by hotel). Two sliding doors in room were off the track. Kitchen sink was not attached to counter. Kitchen supplies very limited, apparently stocked for threesomes (3 plates, 3 bowls, 3 glasses). Second, service was not up to standards for hotel of this caliber. Examples: "buzzer" that was supposed to notify us when our room was ready never worked. Housekeeping forgot to supply coffee and toilet paper (!) on two different days. Room was not serviced until 6pm on one day. Staff member who brought air mattresses failed to bring sheets.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: pumba8
Reviews.Content: After a very enjoyable 10 day stay at gran melia in rio grande area we decided to spend our last three nites exploring san juan. We has the choice of any hotel but based on reviews and pictures of the hotel decided to stay here. It is hard at this point for me to imagine that these reviews are authentic. The hotel layout and room design is certainly lovely and very convenient.. The junior suite and full suite are large and well appointed. However, there are significant problems at this hotel. Day one -we arrive for check in at the 4pm designated time to be told our room was not ready. and not sure when it would be because they are so full. So we are given a pager (very convenient but this certainly tells you something about this being a usual problem) Didnt have to wait too long and checked into junior suite 305. We were concerned about noise because it is right near the 24hour pool but assured that it would be no problem. Not really the case, and the airconditioner was so noisy going on and off all nite made sleep difficlut. The worst was the smell that started wafting thru our room when we returned at 10pm and it was mildly smokey. The rooms are just abover the exhaust vent from the grill ,Onions and hamburger smell ugh. So we called that nite for room change and and would pay more for a 1 bedroom suite in the tower. They said we could pack our things in a.m go out and they would move us. We returned at 3 and After many calls and trips to front desk with waits in line again we finally got a room at 5:30pm. It is puzzling how long it takes them to see if your room is ready. Finally a manager went to see if the room was ready. It was other than the hair all over the bathroom floor. These things could have been overlooked some but on our last day I got really sick and needed a doctor. They are supposed to have a doctor on call . We called and hotel staff said he would call back in 5 minutes after 20 with no return call we called again only to told he was at a function and couldnt help and we could go to local hospital.(thankful for the wonderful pharmacist at walgreens who helped facillitate us getting a rx from my doctor in the states) No other backup available.from hotel Beach area pretty but understaffed so it is difficult to get a drink cups and junk start littrering the beach by 3. The lounge chairs on the beach seem dirty as well as the the chic sitting areas scattered poolside. Breakfast outside was good except for the pigeons that perch on the neighboring tables. Valet guys were great but the front desk staff were smiling but extremly unhelpful. Couldn't wait to get home

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for families - great for couples”
Reviews.Author: M_M269
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites in the suite tower. There is one HUGE problem - there is no privacy. The bathroom shower stall has a translucent wall that faces the bedroom - i.e. if you're in the bedroom you get a fairly detailed view of the person having a shower. The toilet stall is a little better - the glass is opaque. But there are no locks anywhere - not on the door to the bedroom, the door to the bathroom, or the door to the toilet. So, if you're travelling with kids and expect privacy - watch out. Having said that, the amenities are great, having a beach right outside the hotel is fantastic, the service is excellent, its in a great location, the breakfast at the restaurant is good (but pricey). If we ever go to San Juan as a couple, we will definitely stay there. As a family, forget it. For nearby restaurants try: Cafe D'Angel right opposite the hotel and Orcozo's east of the hotel before the Walgreens for local food. Pelayo's (I hope I got the spelling right) has a very good breakfast - try the pancakes. Its a couple of blocks north of the hotel. We dropped in to Waiter's (about a block or two west of the hotel) on a whim - great food. Watch out for the beach directly in front of the eastern end of the hotel. It appears deserted - part of the reason may be that there are lots of big rocks hidden in the water.

Reviews.Title: “A very chic hotel. Wonferul family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ericst22
Reviews.Content: I am not one to write reviews, but our stay here warranted one. The staff here is amazing. Everyone from the bell hop especially "Victor", to the front desk, to another Victor at the concierge desk, to the bar staff and even the beach help was very friendly. My family had a wonderful time here. As far as the noise some people complain about on these reviews, we did not have a problem. Being from NYC, we love the vibe that this hotel gives alongs with the area around it. This is the Latin flavor people should expect when coming to Puerto Rico. The music especially. We had a 1 br suite on the 9th floor that had an amazing city view from the balcony. A clear view of the cruises coming in and out of the ports in Old San Juan. The rooms was spacious enough for my family of 5 on our six night stay. 2 adults, 2 teenagers and a 3 year old. Why not an excellent review..Only small things...1. the glass enclosed bathroom that can be seen from the bedroom. Not cool to see my sons taking a shower or my sons not being able to go to the balcony while my wife was taking one. 2. with all the space this hotel has they shoud have just a small area(pool area) for those families that do travel with kids. My 3 year old had fun but probably would've had a much better time in a more kid friendly area..Just a small one. But overall we had a great time and would come here again. Recommendations.. The Latin Sliders in the hotel.. Orozcos restaurant 2 blocks up.. Cafe Puerto Rico in Old San Juan Walgreens 2 blocks up!!! BIG TIME.. was able to get cereal, eggs and all the little things that was able to keep a little of the food spending down.. The hotel has free WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service at a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: dreese1
Reviews.Content: La Concha is probably the best Marriott property I've stayed at outside of Asia! The service at this hotel was like what I encountered in Asia. Incredibly helpful and very friendly. I was extremely impressed. The hotel feels very modern and new - rooms were spotless and very new. As a Marriott Gold member, I was upgraded to a suite when I checked in. Louise at the concierge desk was awesome. I spoke with her on the phone before my arrival and she arranged my excellent tour to Fajardo for the bioluminescent kayaking. The resort also has a great lounge for elite members. Breakfast included eggs, ham, sausage, fruits, yogurt, breads, cereal, juices. The beach was good as were the two infinity pools overlooking the beach (one is for kids). I had a great lunch on the beach. Plethora of lounge chairs and good food/drink service on the beach. This hotel was much newer and nicer than the nearby Marriott Stellaris Resort which feels old and dated. The taxi was a fixed rate of $17.50 to/from the hotel and takes about 15 min if there is no traffic. I have recommended this hotel to friends who will be visiting San Juan next month and I will be staying here on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: unlisted1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, the service is awsome! We were there for two nights in a junior suit with a fantastic view of the ocean, the room was large and furnished comfortably. We only ate there once as it was very expensive and there are many good resturants with in walking distance. The pool is great with very warm water and nice atmosphere. I would deffinatly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure to double check your reservation”
Reviews.Author: Lovemytrips11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! The view of the ocean was exacly what we wanted but before you check in make sure you are getting the room you asked for. The only reason i booked a room in that hotel was so i could get the ocean view room i requested and when i got to the hotel they had moved me to a city view. MAKE SURE you double check what room you are getting before you make your reservation. I also heard that the city view rooms can be noisy but thats what i was told, cant really tell you for sure. The food is great, the service is very good and overall we had a great weekend. Must eat at the Pearl...exquisite meal!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Mercury251
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from 4 nights at La Concha. We had a 1-bedroom suite with a partial ocean view and balcony. The partial ocean view becomes more partial depending on the floor level and on the distance from the elevator. We stayed in 658 and I found the view to be nice enough. The room was huge for 2 people with a nice living room, modern kitchen, king bed, desk, two televisions, and good closet space. The shower had a glass wall and two shower heads: a rainfall and a handheld wand. The outline of a person in the shower is visible from the bedroom - this would be a problem. There is a club called Ocean a block away. One night we were made awake by drumming and very loud music. My guess is that all rooms with a partial ocean views can easily hear this club on Saturday nights. The location of the hotel is great for Condado. Access to Old San Juan and the airport are easily accomplished. The beach in front of the hotel is wide and one can walk easily to different sections. Waves in the winter are big and fun. As a runner, I was able to run from the hotel to Old San Juan and back while my enjoyed the beach. I did not have much luck in the casino, but it is a nice amenity to have.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated - Not Really Worth the Cost”
Reviews.Author: jlynnl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, and will give you a breakdown of what is good and what is not... The Good: Spacious rooms, courteous staff, efficient lobby bartenders and casino staff, good location, very clean. The only positive thing that I can really say about this hotel is that the location is great and the rooms are spacious. There is a bus stop directly in front of the hotel and costs 75 cents to Old San Juan, only 1 stop over. The lobby bartenders were probably the most efficient of the entire hotel staff, and were extremely friendly. That is pretty much all that this place has going for them. The Bad: Overpriced for what you get, small pools, crowded pools, lack of pool seating, uncomfortable / creaky bed, mediocre food, extremely slow service by staff (check-in, baggage handlers, waitstaff at poolbar). Although the staff is very courteous and nice, you just can't get over how slow and inefficient everything is at the hotel. I understand people may say relax you're in San Juan, but if they are charging high prices and ask guests to dress in a certain manner at the hotel, then we should expect a certain level of attentiveness. Also, the adult only pool area is SO SMALL, and if it is meant to be adults only, then they should enforce it by not letting any children in that area. Overall, it was a decent experience, but I think the hotel is trying too hard to be something it can never be. I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: atl_traveler_8
Reviews.Content: Perhaps my experience was tainted because we spent 2 nights at the Ritz prior to transferring to La Concha, but I was disappointed. The lobby bar area is cool, the pool areas are nice, and our ocean front view was great, too, but looks aren't everything. Although everyone was very nice, the service was consistently sub-par. My wife and I decided that they just didn't have enough people. The wait at the restaurants was long, the beach service was spotty, I had to ask for silverware/napkins on 2 different occasions, etc. The food was average: While we had a good meal at Perla, the other meals were all disappointing: guacamole from a mix, a Mojitos without sugar, cold food, powdered eggs, etc. The beach is fine, but the shadow of the building creates shade in the mid/late afternoon. The water isn't all that great either (lots of sea grass...). We were reminded once more of the sub-par service as we waited for the bellman to hail us a cab. He was too busy talking to someone else, so we just bypassed him. In the end, the place is fine, but I wish we had paid more to stay at the Ritz. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay - but expected more as a Platinum Member”
Reviews.Author: KristinManz
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in February at La Concha. Facilities are very nice and recently updated. Pool area was clean and modern, and the beachfront was nice as well. Staff were always on hand to provide you with a chair and umbrella (at no cost). Hotel staff were extremely friendly. The area surrounding the hotel has shopping, restaurants, and a Walgreens. I was paying the full room rate (not using points), and I'm a Platinum Marriott Rewards Member. I was a little disappointed at the lack of Platinum perks I received. I was told I would need to pay for an upgrade to ocean view....whereas at other properties you're always given an upgrade at no cost if the room is available. I also had to haggle to get a late checkout, which was pretty annoying. The hotel should treat frequent guests a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamPS
Reviews.Content: The Staff at this hotel is amazing! I have been traveling weekly for work and get to many cities each month. The staff at La Concha is superb. From the Associate Director of Sales (Hermes Croatto) who will welcome you as you arrive, to Sofia Ramos (Reservations Coordinator) who makes sure the room is as you requested, to Katherine Pena (Receptionist) who is just the nicest, welcoming individual you can imagine, to a new intern Roxana Ruiz (she will be great). The staff is well informed and suited for their job. Matching peoples talents and interests to their jobs is something LaConcha's management does very well. I strongly recommend you give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on Condando Beach”
Reviews.Author: Emmy C
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights post-cruise at this hotel. The heated pools were the main attraction here. Enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere in the garden courtyard surrounding the bi-level pool. Food service was good. We ate dinner at the Italian restaurant and had breakfast a few times at the same location. Our room was large, clean, and welcoming. Would definitely recommend this hotel for travelers going to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico At It's Finest”
Reviews.Author: nyisle
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the wonderful people of La Concha Resort: A Renaissance Hotel for their hospitality, service, and professionalism displayed during our stay in Puerto Rico. They put us on the 11th floor of the Tower and we enjoyed our access to the Ocean Club since we are Marriott Rewards Members. The property was beautiful and well maintained. Views were outstanding. Everyone was helpful and courteous. We loved the sushi at Solera with a tropical spin. The area of Condado was nice and safe. We walked everywhere and dined at a number of establishments. We would choose this area again compared to other places such as Isla Verde, Old San Juan, and remote locations (Fajardo, etc). You are at the heart of everything. Beware of Saturday night stays....The Oceano Club next to the hotel likes to hold parties late into the evening/morning. We were woken up at 2:30am by loud music and drums. It sounded as if they were having a great time. You will pay some money to stay here but it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brazier100
Reviews.Content: Excellent family friendly hotel. I booked the wrong room type and the hotel handled my room change professionally and quickly. The beach at this hotel is great. The pools are nice but there are not enough lounge chairs due to not enough space around the pools. This is my second time staying here and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service!”
Reviews.Author: Teckelmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise in a resort view room on the second floor. The room overlooked the pool with an unexpected partial sea view through a large walkway opening directly across. A large balcony, clean room with a large glass enclosed shower was very comfortable. By far, the best service by hotel service staff we've ever had beginning with the warm greeting by the valet, to the phone call from the front desk staff minutes after we entered our room to check that we had everything we needed. The staff seemed quite genuine. Overall Very friendly, hip vibe. Great breakfast overlooking the sea in the Italian restaurant..pricey but very good. Two weddings and lots of those guests dressed up was a bit awkward as we were in beach clothes but not a big deal. The infinity pool right on the ocean was our favorite place. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Six great days in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic property, iconic "shell" that houses LaPerla restaurant, spectacular lobby and gardens, beautiful spa-like suite. But the best part was the people. At the front drive, Felix was awesome with a great smile and warm welcome, he always seemed to be on duty! Kristina at reception was so sweet and helpful you wanted to hug her. Great staff, gorgeous cocktail waitresses in the Lobby Bar. Every restaurant was excellent. Bar service in the pool garden was great, as were the bathtub-warm pools and live Latin jazz. You gotta go.

Reviews.Title: “'Big Fat Greek-Puerto Rican' etc...Magical weekend!”
Reviews.Author: maria k
Reviews.Content: My son's marriage in Old San Juan brought over 100 guests from all over the world. Even though the wedding reception was in a sister hotel, the out of towners stayed in La Concha ( recommended by the bride's family). I, mother of the groom, hosted a Welcome Greek-Puerto Rican 'fusion' party hoping to blend the best of both cultures. I cannot say enough about the staff, the professionalism, the venue, the food of this beautiful hotel!...the guests are still talking about 'best party weekend'...I don't know where to begin because we enjoyed all the amenities ( the suites, pool, restaurants, casino!), but I want to concentrate on my personal experience of hosting and organizing a party over the phone and trust people you have never met! I have done several events in my home town, Miami, and had specific details ...but I want to commend Jessica Rivera and Fabiola Cruz in catering who surpassed my expectations. They are THE most professional, pleasant, creative people who captained their 'crew' for a spectacular party! Both of them communicated with me for months through emails and phone calls, and never did they seem to be bothered by my endless questions. The room they suggested, El Mirador, has incredible sea and city views, and the huge wrap around terrace allowed us to have the cigar roller ( Rafa from the Plaza in OSJ) treat the guests with his organic cigars.! We were greeted with Puerto Rican mojitos, and sampled Greek hor'deuvres... The 100% consensus was that food was FABULOUS! I can go on and on...but space is limited. .. To sum it up...a magical weekend ( ending with my 89 year old mother winning over $700 in the casino!) What a weekend!....Thank you La Concha! ( we all plan a reunion next year!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: KTBNY
Reviews.Content: The staff goes out of its way to provide the best service to La Concha's guests. On the first morning I was there, my shoes got raked away by the beach rake. When I told Carlos, who was working on the beach, he said that he'd check with the rake driver when he finished his run. When I returned to the beach later that morning, lo and behold, there was Carlos with my shoes. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. The ocean view is what made the room special. The only criticism of the place is that there's no place to hang wet bathing suits to dry. It seems to me that if you have 4 pools and are located on the beach, it'd make sense to provide a line on which to hang them.

Reviews.Title: “85% Perfect, with one major flaw...”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the La Concha based on other Trip Advisor reviews and a recommendation by one of our closest friends. We travel a lot, and really spend our time researching what will be the best place to stay while we shut off our phones and forget about the world. For the most part, La Concha did not disappoint. As pointed out in many other reviews, the staff at La Concha is amazing. They are extremely friendly, helpful, and will cater to your needs efficiently and effectively. We had a great experience with all of our waiters, the Concierge, hotel staff, bellhops, and cleaning crew. I even had a great experience communicating with their staff (and getting excited!) on the La Concha Facebook page, which is very rare. I literally cannot say enough about my experience with the staff. The resort itself is also done well, with a beautiful lobby, pool area, well-maintained beach, and great bars and restaurants. We were there for a "romantic" vacation, but I could see how this hotel would also be great for groups. As for people with children, it depends on what you're looking for. We are city people, and we expect our children to adapt to their environment, rather than catering to every Disney princess, chicken finger, and kids pool they want. If you're like us, yes, you can bring your kids here. If you expect Pluto to serve your child a Shirley Temple while they're having a tea party with their friends, you might not want to stay here. :-) Something else worth noting about the La Concha....the locals spend a lot of time here, which we love. We hate vacationing where there is a clear divide between local and tourist. It feels unnatural and stuffy. This is not the case at La Concha. Their bar is popular with the locals and we loved how everyone mixed it up every night in the bar, restaurants, and casinos. A lot of our staff had been to the restaurants they recommended (try Marmalade for one of the best meals of your life....try Casa Lola for great food, but be prepared for lousy service), so we really felt like we were getting recommendations on things the locals loved, and not some tourist trap. As for the room and some of the complaints about the noise.....we were in a city-view, one bedroom suite in the newer Ocean Tower (don't get a suite unless you have a large group....we didn't spend a second in the living room part and we felt like the room would've worked much better if they would've flipped the bedroom and living room) and yes, it did get noisy at night being right next to the street. Also, the air conditioner was unbelievably loud, but we got used to it. Like I said before, we're city people, so we're very used to a lot of noise and it actually was great listening to the music, nightlife, and people enjoying themselves. If you need quiet, do not go city view. Personally, I/We loved it. Ok...time to discuss the flaw. It's so unfortunate because up until we "experienced" the flaw, we were already planning our next vacation to La Concha. On every level, this is a solid 4 star resort. It's clean, the grounds are well-maintained, and the staff is superb. Why, however, did they purchase a 2-star bed and 2-star linens? My husband and I had three of the worst evenings of sleep we have ever experienced in a hotel. The linens were rough and scratchy (just the sheets....the towels and robes were fine), the pillows were cheap and small, and the bed creaked, moved, and bounced every time we rolled over. We both woke up with backaches every morning and last night, our first night home, we slept for over 10 hours because we were so exhausted. Because of business, my husband and I sleep in hotels a lot and this was by far the worst mattress/sheet/pillow combination we have ever experienced. Unfortunately, we probably will not be back to La Concha unless we hear that they have upgraded their mattresses. And when I write "unfortunately," I truly mean that. The La Concha was an absolutely amazing hotel, but if I come home and feel like I need a visit to the chiropractor, I just can't stay there again. I hope upgraded mattresses are a plan in the near future for La Concha.
