Other things worth noting: -Try the mini-burgers at the pool restaurant/bar....so good. -The Puerto Rican beer, Medalla Light, is so fantastic. -Marmalade, Marmalade, Marmalade (Yes, I know I already said that, but it's worth nothing again.) -PACK a flashlight. Our friends experienced a blackout (three hours) last year, and we experienced one this trip as well (about an hour and a half). It happens. Be prepared. -FANTASTIC storage space/closet space in the room -Great gym -Loved the London Blackjack/Lucky Lucky table at the Casino

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 days and had a wonderful time. Met lots of great people from all over, including SC, MD, NY and we were stunned by the genuine friendliness of the staff everywhere on the hotel grounds. Getting up early every morning, I would typically head down to the lobby bar breakfast area to do some work, read or make a few phone calls where Natalie, Muriel and others would greet me with the best capaccino. Muriel took the greatest care in preparing it. Concierge assistance was outstanding as well and made the trip much more enjoyable. The folks here are trained properly and the professionalism was noticable throughout our week. Well done! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Resort Thing, Done Pretty Well”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence H
Reviews.Content: We spent a very long weekend in Puerto Rico, and we liked the look of the reviews for La Concha, so we gave it a try. On the whole, it was a pretty nice experience. The hotel services were good, but I didn't find them to be quite up to the Marriott standard--still, no dealbreakers there. The only thing that stands out in my mind was a sliding mirror door that absolutely would not stay on its track, but to be fair, we never called the desk about it, so I'll give them a pass. The hotel was certainly a haven for partying and for the posh crowd, and we really didn't fit either of those descriptions. (Our days mainly consisted of outdoor adventures--OSJ, El Yunque, etc.) Still, the non-food service staff were very nice. If you're big into the club scene, this place is definitely for you, and even if not, don't necessarily pass it up. The beach access, pools, hot tubs, and outdoor furniture were all awesome. The bar service was expensive, but that was completely expected. The food, however, was humdrum for great prices. The only outstanding thing was the sushi, but that's more for another review. The foodservice staff was often unattentive, once going on break for about twenty minutes just as we had finished our meal and were waiting on the check. It's a beautiful hotel in a great location. We won't be coming back--just because there are probably places that suit our tastes and interests better. If you want a lavish beach hotel or a hot dancing/drinking spot, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, hip resort in the middle of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MegBedfordMA
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a very hip, happening resort in the Condado district of San Juan that strives, and mostly succeeds, at providing top-notch service and atmosphere. I just returned from a five day stay and had a very nice time. Here's what's great about it: 1. The service - extremely helpful and courteous staff from the management to the front desk to the bellman to the waitstaff in the restaurants. To give two examples, I was concerned about the noise after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor since I was traveling with my dad who is not in the best of health. I contacted the hotel's guest services manager and he blocked rooms on higher floors in the back of the hotel so the noise wouldn't be an issue. That made a huge difference. Also, Linette at the front desk booked a rainforest tour to El Yunque for us with a guide who was fantastic. 2. The food - not cheap, but excellent, esp at Voga. 3. The decor - the rooms in the tower have been recently renovated and have a modern-chic vibe to them (white, turquoise, chartreuse) as does the hotel overall. 4. The convenience- to the airport, Old San Juan, the East Coast, not to mention it's within walking distance to lots of restaurants in the neighborhood and a Walgreen's where we got milk, juice and cereal for our breakfasts. Here are some things to think about when choosing this property: 1. It's more for couples than families, at least those with little kids, in my opinion. If you go with small children, you wan't feel out of place and you'll have a good time, i went with my 9 year old and extended family and he loved it. But with all the chic decor, the house music in the hallways and elevator, and the bar/nightclub in the lobby, it's just more for adults. Plus, the pools are small and there isn't one that is super-geared for kids with a cool slide or wading area. 2. The beach is a small strip of urban sand surrounded by high-rises, and it's too dangerous to swim there, anyway. A local person literally begged me not to go swimming there, saying it was much safer further down the beach around the bend. If you are going to PR for the beach, this isn't the property for you. 3. This is a nice property but not a spectacular one (like the St. Regis Monarch Beach in CA or the Ritz in Naples FL, two of my all time fave places). Then again, it's probably 40-50% of the cost of those places so the small trade-offs are worthwhile. Overall, I liked La Concha a lot. There is a lot to recommend it and if you want a few days by the pool with your honey I certainly think this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot right on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: ScPe
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay here after getting bumped when the Doubletree was overbooked. Beautiful view of the beach from our room (I think all rooms have ocean views.). Very modern style. We enjoyed the pools and beach in front of the hotel and used the large fitness facilities. Great location too. Only a $15 cab ride to Old San Juan or the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tally R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a business/pleasure trip to Puerto Rico. The hotel was chosen for us by our business group. It was wonderful! The rooms are so large and modern. The food at the hotel is pretty pricey but very good. You can go right down the street to the store and pick up anything you need to stock your kitchen (mini-apartment) if you are really budget-minded. There were a fair amount of children there but I would have to say that the hotel is geared more towards adults. We were in a part of the hotel that is only serviced by two elevators so sometimes it was a little slow. Even though the hotel was completely booked while we were there it never felt really crowded. The beach itself I thought was so-so. The waves crash in pretty heavily and it is noisy and hard to enjoy the swimming in the ocean. Our room had a jacuzzi tub but it did not work. I didn't call about it because it wasn't that important to me. I think the best part of the hotel was the friendly staff and the doormen. Felix and Neff were wonderful! They offered so much good advice and took the time to say hello and smile each time you entered the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Resort”
Reviews.Author: DuchessKathy
Reviews.Content: Spent the last week (post cruise) at La Concha Resort, Room 1153. The room included a small dining area and kitchenette, so we were able to shop for breakfast & lunch meals. There is a Walgreens two blocks from hotel (they sell a good range of food) and two markets withing four blocks. Our room was immaculate and all the personell very friendly and accomodating. It's easy to go for long walks along Ashford Ave and also down the beach. The city park next to the hotel has a flea market/food vendors on Saturdays....lots of fresh fruit. We walked four blocks to the Hertz car rental, taking a day to explore El Yunque and the Rio Caves. Ate only once at the hotel: in Perla. The food was remarkable and the "shell construction" is beautiful. Otherwise, just walked down the street & popped into a restaurant that looked good. Parts of Ashford Avenue reminded me of Paris with tree-lined boulevards and outdoor dining.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alba j
Reviews.Content: I travel to PR twice a month for business and I feel I found my "home away from home." It starts with the guys out front, continues to the front desk with Kristina, Carolina, and the rest of the truly wonder front desk folks! In the morning, there's Aroma - Mirnel makes the best lattes in PR (and I have a choice of walking to a Starbucks, but I don't.) The gym faces the ocean, the club lounge is great (thanks Pablo, Luisito and the rest of the staff!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Meghan C
Reviews.Content: Travelled a few years ago when it was still under construction so room was noisy and view not so great but we (3 girlfriends and myself) still managed to have a fabulous time! Pool and beach were beautiful, food a little pricey but delicious. We took a taxi into Old San Juan a few nights (cheap when split b/w 4 people) which was amazing- authentic food and old feel to it. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “san juan 2012”
Reviews.Author: hybw
Reviews.Content: great location, excellent rooms. as a marriott time share owner in aruba and being an honarary ambassador i am used to vip treatment, but was very impressed by the greeting and treatment i received from Michael Tischler and his staff at the ocean lounge. he remembered us from last year. The entire front office staff (hector, linette, denise and louise-just to name a few were great) we will be back next february!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views | Accommodating Service | Great Rooms (in the new tower)”
Reviews.Author: Drew D
Reviews.Content: I had the Pleasure of being invited to a destination wedding at La Concha. Our room, a suite in the new tower, was amazing! A great kitchenette, sitting area, large bathroom and a king size bed all with a beach view. The pools are nice, surrounded by luxurious seating and table service for food and great piÃ±a coladas. The beach is really nice, with soft sand and cooling breezes. I'd have to say the staff at this hotel makes all the difference in the way you perceive of the resort. Everyone has been helpful, accommodating and friendly. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Long Overdue Getaway”
Reviews.Author: onlymylaws
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writing a review for tripadvisor.com, but I believe the best way for me to review the hotel is to break down the events by each day to help my recollection. But first, a little background: We are a mid to late 30's couple with three children, ages 14, 9 and 4. I am telling you this because we have not been on a vacation in almost 3.5 years WITHOUT the kids. I love the kids but we needed a getaway to rekindle our relationship. My hubby surprised me with this vacation for my b-day as 2011 was an emotional rollercoaster with the death of my father last July. Needless to say, I was looking forward to LaConcha from the moment I looked it up on tripadvisor and scoured every review...I'm kind of obsessive like that. We stayed from Thursday, 2/2 to Monday, 2/6. I didn't know how this trip was going to go as my luggage had not reached PR by the time we landed. But the airline was able to track it and stated that it would be delivered to our hotel later in the day. Kind of a bummer because that was the suitcase with my swimsuits, etc. in it. NOTE TO SELF: Carry a swimsuit in carryon. Anyway, this was my first time to PR and as we were driving from the airport, I really didn't know what to expect as there are some blighted properties mixed in with high end shops & restaurants on the same blocks, so I had my fingers crossed.... We took a taxi for the 15 min. ride from the airport, which had a flat rate of $16, plus $1 for each suitcase. When we pulled up at the hotel, we were immediately greeted by Felix who had the same upbeat, welcoming personality as described in other reviews. I almost felt assured that this was going to be as good as I have read in other reviews. We left our bag right there with the bellman while we checked in and was told that our bags would be delivered to our room once we got our key. No problem. I took one look at the hotel and was pleased and felt that we made the right choice. The exterior and interior decor of the hotel is very cool, contemporary with white marble, dark wood, white leather furniture and huge red floor vases, and floor to ceiling glass doors which opened to the outdoor gardens. The bar sits right in the center of the lobby and really didn't have much action as it was only about 12:30 in the afternoon. Not cold by any means, just very sophisticted. We booked a Junior Ocean Front Suite in the ocean tower. While I believe the newer tower has a kitchenette, etc. I was not interested as I vowed to not do any type of cooking on this trip! At check-in, we were told that our suite was not available but we could upgrade to a one bedroom ocean front suite for $30/night (which would have normally been a $50/ night upgrade) which was available immediately- I have another thought on this later on in the review. I wanted to wait for the Jr. suite, hubby decided to go with the upgrade...I wasn't going to argue :-) We stayed in room 1001, which was one of the higher floors as I believe there are only 12 floors. The Jr. suite would have been on the same floor as well. Our suite was at the end of the hall, far from the elevator but not too long of a walk. Walking down the corridor to the room, there are several balconies where you can look over into the courtyard where the main swimming pool (with two levels) and the patio and outdoor restaurant were located. Upon entering the suite, I have to admit that I was a llittle underwhelmed. It just looked like a living room with low profile, yet contemporary furniture. The balcony is off of the living area and faces the center courtyard (like the previously mentioned balconies), the side of the hotel which has an open green space and a partial view of the ocean. It had a table with chairs.It was functional to say the least but offered privacy as well. The "WOW" moment for me came when I entered the bedroom. The view of the beach and ocean was so magnificient, I am not sure if that is enough to describe it. There were floor to ceiling windows which provided unobstructed views of the clear blue sky and the beautiful blue/green water. The warm ocean air was so inviting, I was seriously contemplating buying a swimsuit from the hotel store. You could also see Perla restaurant and the infinity pool from my window. You could just see water and beach for miles and miles. The rooms were airy and clean. The bathroom was small with shower only, but it was rain shower so who could be mad. Aveda products and plenty of towels on hand although they neglected to leave any wash cloths. They were delivered right away, along with extra pillows as requested. VACATION MODE turned ON. We decided to use this as an opportunity to explore the property and surrounding area, and to grab something to eat as we were famished by this point. Back down to lobby, we went and checked out the business center located in the newer tower. The exit to the adults swimming area and entry to beach is located next to business center. The hotel has lemonade on hand at various stations throughout the hotel for your pleasure. The adult pool, which is also the infinty pool was empty, I assume because there wasn't much sun out on this side of the hotel. The fitness center was over this way too. We visited the lush garden area which seemed to be lively as it had the main pool in the center, and Solera (the outdoor restaurant), plenty of lounge chairs and music. We decided to eat across the street at the Cafe de Angel on a recommendation from one of the bellmen, since we had no change of clothes yet. DO NOT EAT HERE. I have no other description than to say it SUCKED and was expensive. The service was OK but for two entrees, a shared appetizer and a pina colada + tax was $80 w/o gratuity. The food was mediocre at best. Should have ate at Solera. We walked down Ashford to the Walgreens (2 blocks) to get some water, snacks, etc. for our room. It is a mini grocery store where you can pick up liquor, toiletries, snacks, etc. Our luggage finally arrived later in the evening but we decided to stay close to hotel as it had been a long day. The beds are not extremely comfortable but was fresh and had nice linens. Next day, everything was great. Woke up early to hit the beach, not too crowded, ate an early lunch on the beach as the Solera restaurant services the beach. The food was great and service was fast and efficient. For this meal, burger and fries, grilled chicken sandwich and fries, 2 frozen drinks = $60 including tax and gratuity. We walked down the beach and couldn't help but notice a few abandoned hotels along the beach. The sand on this beach feels like cornmeal and in some areas there is a lot of seaweed. We went in around 2 p.m. to get ready to head to Old San Juan. We took a cab which cost about $12 + tip. If it were earlier in the day, we would have tried the bus for 75 cents. Old San Juan was by far one of my favorite times in PR. The cobblestone streets are narrow and all of the buildings are are close together. The character and flair of Old San Juan cannot be measured and is unlike anywhere I have been. The shop owners were friendly and I found a great shop called Unique Stop which has a wide variety of jewelry, handbags, etc. from authentic Puerto Rican artisans to mainstream designers such as Kendra Scott, etc. There is also a Marshalls, Burger King, for some chain action. Walked along the water near the Port Authority and had some great ice cream which was delicious!!!!!! Sorry can't think of the name. We had been referred to a restaurant, J-Taste, by my father in law, and we happened to stumble upon it just as it was beginning to rain. It is a Japanese restaurant with a very modern decor. We decided to sit at the bar, as we were going to just grab a couple of drinks. The bartender, Donny and the waiter who spoke great English, were awesome. We had such a good time there. It was kind of empty when we first got there but started filling up after a while. You must try this restaurant. One side is hibachi style, the back has a raw sushi bar and the rest of the restaurant has booth or table and chairs. The red and blue lighting really helped with the cool vibe/mood. We ordered off of the appetizer menu and everything we has was wonderful: sushi, shrimp tempura and teriyaki shrimp/chicken skewers. It was really relaxing and we could have sat there all night. They called a cab for us but he charged $16 to take us back. When we mentioned that it was a different amount than going, he stated that he had to charge more bc they have to "pay for the call" which I guess meant they have to pay the cab company. When we arrived back at the hotel, the lobby was buzzing with music and people were dressed at the bar. We went upstairs and got dressed to join the party. I have to admit we looked darn good! I don't think I have dressed for a club in about 7 to 10 years. The lobby was sexy... We needed a snack so we went out to the Solera to order appetizers but was instructed that someone inside should have taken our order. When I told the waiter that no one approached us while we were sitting in the lobby (as we had gotten our drinks from the bar), he was nice enough to find someone to take our order. There is a tapas menu available until 1 a.m. The mahi mahi was great. The fried crab bites...not so much. The waitress inside seemed preoccupied or overwhelmed, not sure which but her service was a bit lacking. We did a lot of people watching as this hotel seems to be the place to be for locals and guests of other hotels. If there was one area of improvement would be the DJ and music selection...seriously the techno, Jersey shore fist-pumping music gets old quick. They need to add some variety as the guests are diverse!!!!!!!!!! We lasted as long as we could but again, we are not club goers and I was trying desperately not yawn. Off to bed for these old-timers.... Next day we were beach bums. We ate at Voga for the buffet breakfast @ $25 pp. It was a pretty good buffet, with fresh fruit, pastries, regular breakfast buffet food, omelet station, waffle/pancacke station. We were a little perturbed by the following. My husband doesn't eat pork which is what was offered on the buffet (i.e. pork sausage, pork bacon). We asked if there were any turkey products avaialble. The waitress said sure, they just didn't put it out but asked what we would like. He asked for turkey sausage. We thought this was included in the buffet charge. WRONG. When the check came, it was almost $7 for the turkey sausage. I mentioned it to the woman who brought us the bill (I can't say waitress bc we got everything ourselves, including juices, etc). The original bill she submitted was $50 something. I gave my credit card but when she brought the authorization for signature, it was higher than the original bill. Only after I questioned her did she tell me it was bc of the turkey sausage.The authorization slip was not detailed to show what had been added. They did remove the charge after slight hesitation on their part. We laid out on the beach for the better part of the day and later walked down Ashford to some of shops...Nice relaxing day....did stop in the lobby for drinks and tapas but finished our night in our room. Next day...up early bc I wanted to hit Old San Juan again to get some gifts and souvenirs. The night before was uncomfortable as the themometer rattled and clicked on and off. Called front desk, the problem was addressed and it needed to be replaced. After expressing our discontent, management comped half our room charge for the night and the upgrade fees for two nights and offered breakfast. What more could you ask? The management and service was always prompt to responding to any issues. Everything is not always going to be right but the response is what is important. We tried to wait for the bus to Old San Juan but a cab offered to take us for $3 pp, so we took it. I picked up everything I wanted to get and went to the Pier to catch the ferry over to the Bacardi Tour. This is something you can do yourself. Please don't fall for the the excursion tours which charge $55 pp. for this tour. The Bacardi Tour is free and the ferry is $1.00 roundtrip. The only weird part is that once you get off the ferry to go to the Bacardi Tour, there are no directions or signs posted as to what to do next. I thought we were there. WRONG. As a group of my fellow ferry passengers and my hubby and I wandered around looking like lost tourist, this old guy was pointing at us and yelling for us to follow him to Bacardi. He led us to a garage where there were three passenger vans and other taxis which take people to the Bacardi estate for $3 pp. This area was a bit seedy so I was constantly looking over my shoulder and cautious. Anyway, once we arrived at Bacardi, it was like entering a whole new land. It felt tropical with palm trees, lush gardens, etc. You are given two free drink vouchers and a bar is right there in an open pavilion. Beautiful, well kept grounds. There is an English speaking tour and a Spanish speaking tour and run alternatively about every 30 min. This tour was nice as it did not last for more than an hour or so. TIP: Be sure to eat before going on the tour as you will not want to drink on an empty stomach. Once we got back to OSJ, we ate a full dinner at J-Taste again. Even better than before and the bartender and waiter were happy to see us again. Once we got back to the hotel we had to pack for the next day as we had an early flight. Sunday, however was the Superbowl, and the SB party was packed in the lobby as they had two projection screens and flat screens showing the game. Very festive. We had a wonderful time although there weren't any drink.appetizer specials. We left at half time to retire in our room and finish watching the game. You could here the uproar though once NY won! It was great. HIGHLIGHTS: We found the jacuzzi which is off the beaten path on the upper tier of the swimming pool in the center court. It is covered and hidden by lush plants...very nice for a late night romantic dip...On the first Sunday of the month, there is a PR festival next door where you can purchase some great stuff...the beach and Solera excellent...The staff was attentive, friendly and knowledgeable, although I will let the first night's recommendation slide.....be sure to tip bc everyone will go the extra mile.... MISSTEPS: The bathrooms are small and didn't always feel like they had been cleaned well... There was hardly any Spanish/Island music played during our stay except once there was a live band for a wedding which we happened to catch...the DJ in the lobby needs some variety (then again, I never seen the DJ, so it could have been music being streamed)...the free wifi is choppy in suite...works well in lobby and on beach....not too many kids (not sure if this is good or bad)..felt like the "your room is not available" bit at checkin was a gimmick as I observed the same thing a few days later with other guests...the resort fee is almost $50/day.... NEXT TIME: Will try El Yunque Rainforest tour, will spend more time in OSJ..will definitely be back at La Concha. Relationship rekindled...MISSION ACCOMPLISHED

Reviews.Title: “BIG hotel but warm innkeepers!”
Reviews.Author: Nick C
Reviews.Content: we were amazed by the warmth of the house staff as we arrived from the SJU airport -- even though this is a "big" hotel on Avenida Ashford in the Condado area of San Juan, the welcome from the doorman to the front desk was warm and cheerful, as if we were the only guests at their little country inn! The room was wonderful with all the big city comforts including an iPhone charging center, and floor to ceiling windows looking out on the beach (which made it a premium room). The building itself is testimony to the concrete industry of 1958- remember little Puerto Rico was competing hard with big Cuba in those days for the tourist peso! The grounds, bars and restaurants were lovely - but above all staff enthusiasm made it special. This is a Marriott hotel so remember your guest points!

Reviews.Title: “Super stay at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Lydia_E500
Reviews.Content: The best thing about La Concha are the people. Everyone I met had a quick smile and greeting. The place is beautiful. I stayed in a suite with a side ocean view and a view of the city. I loved going out on the balcony, especially on evenings when the moon reflected off the water. Memorable, special people included Jennifer Garcia, the lovely and gracious lady who straightened my room and sometimes surprised me with welcome notes; the crew at the Aroma Cafe whose greeting and care always made me feel special, and Hermes Croatto whose manner made all who met him feel cared for and special. If you are going to San Juan this is a great place to stay, be pampered and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: willngrace
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked in I loved the decor! Very open and breezy. My room was perfect, spacious and I had a great view of the beach. Last time I was in PR, I stayed at another location, which was in no way exceptional. Within 30 minutes, the house keeping supervisor came up to my room to welcome me and make me more comfortable. I must say I was surprised, I have stayed in quite a few hotels and have never gotten such a welcome from the behind the scenes staff. I also like that Aveda products were the basic essentials offered in the bathroom. Wi-Fi is free and works great, the business center is also free for computer usage. The location of the hotel is perfect, A bus stop directly outside which has few uses that go into Old San Juan which is a 10 minute ride. The hotel is surrounded by quite a few restaurants if you don't feel like going into the city. There is an awesome Peruvian restaurant one street over, unfortunately I forgot the name. The hotel also has a few restaurants, I enjoyed a few drinks at the hotel bar. The only reason I did not give the hotel 5 stars was due to the following: My room was next to the ice machine so it was noisy. Also, this is a VERY busy hotel so as soon as you enter the lobby be prepared for activity. House keeping did not clear the fridge, so the next morning we discovered leftover items in the fridge. They did clear it out promptly, and when we came back we found a bottle of red wine, with a note of heartfelt apologies in the room. I would recommend la Concha, I ended up staying an extra day, and my discounted rate was honored. I had a good stay and will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: kb9utk
Reviews.Content: We have been to San Juan twice in the past via cruises but have never stayed overnight. Upon arrival, the striking lobby and overall liveliness of La Concha was a feast for the senses and we knew we had made the right choice in staying over in this beautiful city. Check in was quick and we dashed up to the room to drop off luggage and check out the ocean view. High ceilings, tile and glass shower, and modern white leather (?) furniture (along with LARGE closets on either side of a dresser/valet) gave the room a sleek feel. The only disappointment was the "balcony." We pulled back the sliding door to expose about six inches of overhanging cement. Though we had a beautiful view of the pool and ocean, there was no way to utilize the balcony itself. Since we were only staying for one night, we decided to explore the grounds and grab a few drinks. The lobby was excellent for people watching and lounging about. The drinks were somewhat on the pricy side, which is of course to be expected at such a place, but well made. The Mojitos were excellent. After dinner at a local place and then a few more drinks, we retired to our room. The bed was very comfortable--not too soft or too hard. Room darkening shades kept the early morning sun out of our room while we snoozed and the rain-like shower head left us refreshed and ready for our day of exploration in PR. Check out was not as smooth as other hotels, but I believe this was simply an oversight. Although La Concha does allow for self-check out, someone neglected to leave us the bill under the door. A quick stop at the front desk took care of that and the extremely friendly concierge helps us plan a great day in Guatave (GO THERE!). Overall this was an excellent stay. Lots of nightlife, beautiful surroundings, and a central location make this a resort not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: orthon49
Reviews.Content: It was hard to choose the right property, but I think we lucked out on our choise in San Juan. We had an ocean view room on the 9th floor. The view was magnificent. The first thing we did was turn off the air conditioner and open the screen door. Listening to surf at night was lovely. The dinner in La Perla was one of the highlights. Yes, it's pricey, but we figured that the view of the waves lapping gently outside the window, was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. The staff are first rate. Our waiter was super-professional and knowledgeable. Thank goodness this restaurant has a terrific chef. This is not the case in the Italian restaurant on site, nor was it our experience at the Gran Melia in Rio Grande. Perhaps Puerto Rico should have better culinary schools (or something) if it wants to remain a star attraction in the Caribbean. This hotel is a cab ride away from Old San Juan. Nice combination. I was happy to visit Old San Juan, both during the day and at night, but happy for the peace and quiet of La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Nineunder
Reviews.Content: What a joy it was returning to La Concha in mid-January! Arriving near midnight we were welcomed by the warm hotel staff, accommodated in a gorgeous suite in the new tower with a panoramic ocean view and private balcony. The suites are large, technologically appointed with free WiFi throughout the hotel property. I loved the kitchen with fridge and coffee pot to grab juice and coffee while reading emails before heading downstairs. There are at least two separate pools with wait staff to ferry drinks or sandwiches or better take a sun break and lunch at the Solara. The food is terrific, setting Caribbean and most of all relaxing. There is a terrific beach to walk or lounge or swim in the warm waters of the Atlantic. A great location near shopping and many restaurants there is no finer accommodations or a better value in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Sweetest staff EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loretta W
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were going on a Cruise for 7 nights for our Honeymoon. We decided to fly in early and stay at the LaConcha in San Juan, Puerto Rico the night before our Boat sailed out. The staff was so extremely nice! And not in a fake way. They were very cool and just all around the nicest people i have ever met!! Extremely attentive and helpful in every possible way. We enjoyied our stay so much, we went directly to the same Hotel to stay for one more night as soon as we got off the Boat. My Husband and I went out in San Juan (to all the places they sent us) that night, and had the best time! We did NOT want to leave!....Thank you to all of the Staff at LaChonca! Felix especially!! He was truely the sweetest man ever!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: alvarea
Reviews.Content: I went to puerto Rico for couple of days with my boyfriend and stay at la concha which was the best desition I made. The service at the lobby bar was impeccable thanks to Jonathan and at Solera we had great service from everyone specially my favorite server Ruben who made me feel at home and made some amazing dinner recommendations. I will highly recomend la concha to all of my family and friends. Can't wait to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Nicki73262
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for my friend's wedding. Got a huge room (suite) with modern furniture and a very comfortable bed. We had fully equipped kitchen with fridge, freezer, cooker and coffee machine. Other amenities were 2 TVs, 2 docking stations for your iPhone/iPod to play music, desk, hair dryer, in-room safe, iron board, clothes hangers, and plenty of towels. Best of all was the relaxed atmosphere at the hotel and the service. My favorites were the waiter Brooks at the beach and outdoor restaurant and Felix at the valet. Super friendly, great energy, with great stories to tell. The the wedding reception. It was out of this world. Silver couches, amazing decor, and the food, yumm.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: lynnj73
Reviews.Content: Beutiful resort on the ocean. We stayed here for one night post cruise and it was perfect. Kids loved the pools as the ocean was rough that day. Our room was large and clean with comfortable beds. Could not beat the view of the ocean from the window. Breathtaking! Good location for walking to local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful piece of heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Bad622
Reviews.Content: Whew!! My life has slowed a little for me to write review. My overall stay was great! the food, drinks were great.this was a relaxing vacay this time. I was in my room a lot. I had to tell the young lady(Athena)to just clean around me.She was great! I highly recommend La Concha I hope to come again in near future

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: OhSheilah
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed here in Dec of 2011 for 5 days. Great time to go no crowds! Using points, we then upgraded to ocean view room also get's you free hot yummy breakfast and serious happy hour snacks. Seating inside or outside really nice touch for this upgrade only area. Room was large with a kitchen? Great to have refigerator in room and wine glasses. However the bed was HORRIBLE! Seriously, woke up in pain each morning. Before you unpack all your stuff... test out your bed. Large functional balcony w/ great views! Plenty of room to have lunch out on balcony. Bathroom is all glass, great for the 2 of us not so hot for the family we met staying there. Great location, $10 cab ride to old san juan. beach very small not much room to walk but very beautiful! Sometimes part of the ocean front pool is a little odd b/c it's infront of business center.. bikinins and suits odd combo. Still beautiful view! Hotel seems business type in lobby but once you get outside you forget all the suits. Hot tubs were HOT! Non ocean view Pool perfect and outdoor food really outstanding! Washer/ dryer nice touch! Entire Staff was wonderful all the time and everyone was amazingly beautiful! At check out we were very unhappy with Marriott's new policy. When we upgraded for $50 per night that was subjected to local taxes, this is new for Marriott. Taxes added $25 per night, would have been nice to have been notified of this new policy at time of booking. Overall we were very impressed & really enjoyed our stay @ this location, having direct flights from bwi, we will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jlo1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha for two nights before we left on a cruise. I must say that the service upon arrival was excellent. The facility is beautiful and very impressive. The room is fully equipped and spacious. We were surprised by the kitchenette. If we were going to stay longer it would have been the perfect setup for a longer stay. The beach can be a little rough but if you swim at the far end of the beach the rock walkway breaks the surf and it is a little calmer. The beach attendants are very helpful and there is adequate shade if you want that. The entertainment and the bar in the lobby was enjoyable in the evening. For the most part the service in the lobby bar was great. There was one waitress who needed an attitude adjustment but the others were very nice. The food was very expensive and just okay. Next time we will venture away from the hotel. There is a Dunkin Donuts across the street for your coffee fix and a Chili's down the street a bit. All in all, the stay was excellent and we would return for an extended stay. However, the next time we would get the oceanfront room. The only thing that spoiled our stay was the excessive noise from the street which kept us up all night. We booked the city view room and that was a huge mistake. The noise was unbelievable. The only other complaint is that the shower grate was bent and I cut my foot on it. It was very sharp. We had to maneuver around it when we showered. It is hard to believe that the cleaning staff didn't notice this. We did report it to the front desk so hopefully it is fixed. Anyone who stays here is sure to be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Hip! Hot ! THe Place to stay in San Juan....”
Reviews.Author: TNSA
Reviews.Content: We almost do not want to share how amazing this place is ..... Stella and I had another outstanding stay with the crew from La Concha. This is the "place" to stay in San Juan... The whole property has a cool vibe.. from the lobby , which is always a "scene" to the great rooms... La Concha out does our expectations time and time again. What truly stands out is the team ... Michael T. , the platinum lounge rock star.. always willing to get us in to the best restaurants, etc. Michael this trip was working in a neck brace after an car accident.. ?? His response to why was he there.... " He did not want to let down any of the guests.." Unreal... This attitude come from the GM down.. Cheers to another great stay and looking forward to seeing the La Concha crew sool... .hello to Alfredo, Hector, Michael, Aljandra, etc. Best, Tom and Stella

Reviews.Title: “Nice property. Pool area is not the best. Beach Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Jenna181
Reviews.Content: This hotel was modern, cool, and definitely a fun place. The backyard/patio area is great, you can have a cigar, enjoy drinks, sushi, and food, late into the night. Loved that part of it. Rooms were cool, clean, and fun. The only real criticisms I have surrounds the main pool area. it is very, very, very crowded, there were at least 20-30 people I saw who were unable to obtain even one lounge in the morning. Therefore, you have to go to the beach area or one of the smaller back pools, which have no sun (at least in February). But the hotel was a great value, very clean, and fun. Casino attached was great. Recommended for a quick stay.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be dissapointed. Perfect place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ljr2219
Reviews.Content: We went in Jan. 2012 and had a great stay. We loved the food at all the restraunts. Pools are great and the beach is perfect. This hotel is located in a great area for walking to bars and restraunts. The staff are very helpful and pleasant. My brother stayed here a few months before me and had the same great experience. The rooms are very clean and updated. This hotel is a short cab ride to old San Juan and 15 min. ride to the airport. We're heading back at the end of March.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, very modern and very '"in"”
Reviews.Author: JK F
Reviews.Content: La Concha is all you could dream of having when staying in a resort in the Caribbean: Beautiful property and excellent service. This hotel gives a perfect balance of relaxation and nightlife to satisfy the urge for some lively music and a great crowd. The servers and front desk staff are top-of-the-line. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. Thumbs up!! I will be going back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, A Must to Consider in SJ”
Reviews.Author: RowerXX
Reviews.Content: La Concha Resort is located in the Dorado Beach section of SJ. Its at the epicenter of night activity. Its not too far from the airport, not too far from Old San Juan, and its at the beach. And the beach is beautiful. The hotel has been renovated and the rooms are clean and reasonable. Its not the Four Seasons but it aint the Holiday Inn either. Bottom line, the tv's are new flat screen and each room has an efficiency kitchen. There are several pools, no lazy pools, but pools that are clean and pretty, and there's the great, warm, beautiful ocean. The staff is amazingly helpful. Furthermore, there are plentiful excellent restaurants and quick takeout right outside your door. Bottom line is La Concha is good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jane G
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a beautiful hotel right on the beach. Manager Louisa is wonderful and will do anything to help you find a great rate. Walk-in rates are cheaper. Rooms big and nicely appointed, very large. Comfy beds. Beach views have floor to ceiling windows, one that opens and the breeze is wonderful. They can't do enough for you. Felix, outside valet, is fabulous. Get lunch on the beach. Best in town!

Reviews.Title: “The winner on Condado”
Reviews.Author: Alan K
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a beautiful hotel on Condado, minutes from the airport, close to Old San Juan, located on a fabulous beach. I sat on the deck of my 11th floor room overlooking the ocean answering e-mails using the free hotel Wi-Fi, then had lunch poolside with nice food, excellent service. I was there to attend an association meeting, held in a room with a view so wonderful that we had to close the shades to concentrate on business. Service was great, everyone bilingual, property clean and sleek. Friends of ours who live in San Juan told us this hotel is known locally as the place to be. I will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice getaway weekend hotel, typical slow PR service”
Reviews.Author: LeCattt
Reviews.Content: I went on a girl's getaway weekend in January and this was recommended as the best hotel to stay at and it really was! The hotel rooms are great, the beds were amazing, I hadn't slept that well in so long. The beach was ok, not that great but still nice to relax. The pool was nice but we spent more time on the beach. The sushi was DELICIOUS and so was the food by the pool. My only complaint was the horribly slow service...with everything. The food easily took 1-2 hours each time we ordered. Any time we called on room service, we had to wait 3-4 and one time even 5 hours at midnight just to get sheets for our pullout couch. We were a bit dissappointed that they didn't have double bedded rooms which we had reserved because they were sold out of them but they gave us a credit at the end of our stay which made up for it. To be fair, everywhere in Puerto Rico that we went, the service was really poor so it may not be a specific hotel thing but more of an island thing.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Married there soon”
Reviews.Author: Kate G
Reviews.Content: My fiance and traveled to Puerto Rico over the summer and checked out the Ritz, El San Juan Hotel and Casino, La Concha, and the Hilton Caribe. While we liked the other hotels, we were not sold on any of them until we walked into La Concha! It was perfect! It's very modern and clean. It has a "wow" factor and the lobby at night is a blast. I am extremely excited about our upcoming wedding there. We are working with Jessica Rivera, and she has been very helpful. I will post again after the wedding -- hopefully our guests will have an amazing time and echo my sentiments. We also like that it is child friendly without catering to kids. We didn't see many children running around, but we feel comfortable bringing children to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: bbhouston
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times in the past few years. It remains one of the best Condado hotels. Nice beach, great pool, nice casino. Like most hotels on the island, many will find the noise level higher than many hotels....may be the concrete construction required in hurricane-prone areas. The condo tower is my favorite with small kitchens and quieter location. You can't go wrong here. One day, they forgot to clean our room and were nice enought to take $50 off one day. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. I cashed in some Marriott points to get an ocean front room here for the final night of our Puerto Rico trip (2 adults, 2 kids). The hotel was clean and fun, and the ocean front, floor to ceiling, view was spectacular. We did not stay long and did not have time to take advantage of the restaurants, but the place was very nice and the beach was great. It's also an easy close cab right to the Old San Juan. We toured Forte San Cristobal and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “truly the best!”
Reviews.Author: andyfarr76
Reviews.Content: The hotel surpassed our expectations in all respects. The beauty of the place, the comfortableness including a bathroom larger than many studio apartment, the attentiveness of the service, the quality of the services and the responsiveness of the staff--all were as close to perfect as possible. I've stayed in many hotels, and this one is, far and away, the nicest. It made our vacation unforgettable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Renassiance San Juan Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: jaxxxxy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 day trip to San Juan Puerto Rico I had been before and stayed at the Conrad which wasn't bad, and I would say that all of these hotels will have their pros and cons. Keep in mind that although these hotels on Condado say ocean front - the beach experience is best felt at one of the other beaches toward Fajaro. My husband was kind enough to summarize our review as follows: Pros: -------- * Excellent piÃ±a colada served at poolside. * The ocean front suites in the ALL SUITES BLDG offer an amazing 180 degree ocean view from the ocean facing balcony. * Main pool area offers nice setting for outdoor eats & drinks. Day & night. * Nice casino downstairs (for those who like to gamble). * Complimentary plate of tortilla chips + guacamole, salsa, & sour cream was brought to our suite on 2nd day in the afternoon. We discovered this upon return to our room. No note was left and one must be careful with eating sour cream once away from refrigeration, but a nice gesture nonetheless. Cons: -------- * Although we booked an ocean front suite with balcony, we received a suite with glass window (and dirty) facing the ocean on 4th floor in older building. The non-bedroom suite portion was in back and faced a parking lot. There was a balcony, but it too was in back with views of the parking lot, a satellite dish, and a little ocean. * We requested another room, but were told that we would have to wait until the next day as all was booked. We did not need the suite portion. We just wanted the ocean view balcony and a higher room. No attempt was made to try and accommodate us. We would have gladly downgraded from a suite, but either they did not know how to do that or did not want to loose on the revenue. * Shortly after checking in (and long flight and room disatisfaction), we went down to the pool area to order some drinks and eats. No waiter ever came by our seating area. I finally walked over to the grill area and one of the staff said they were sending a waiter over right away. Waited another 10 minutes, but no one ever came to serve on us. We ended up walking out of the hotel and settled for something elsewhere. * On our 2nd morning we decided to eat at the breakfast Buffett. Upon arrival, we asked to be seated in the outside portion of the restaurant. The hostess gave us a little bit of a strange look and said she would have to check if it's ok. She returned to say that it was ok and seated us. Once seated, we counted at least 10 unoccupied tables outside (& 3-4 occupied) so we were puzzled as to why the big production. * There are very aggressive pigeons at the restaurant (outdoor portion) who come to your table and eat your food (if left unattended). So can't all get up at once to go to Buffett. Apparently, hotel has not figured out a solution to this * On our final night we phoned reception to ask for a late checkout (2pm instead of 12noon) as our flight was not until 4pm. We were told to check back the next day as this is "subject to availability". Upon checking back the following morning, we were told that no more late checkouts are being issued and that we would have had to ask for it early in the morning. Of course thats not what we were told when we asked the previous evening. I asked again for some extra time, perhaps 1:30 instead. After a lengthy phone conversation with someone else on the staff the hotel clerk agreed to a 1pm checkout. As a related side note, we spent $1400 on a 3-night suite stay + $200 incidentals and were asking for 2 extra hours to check out (with still ample time to prepare the room for the next guest check-in).

Reviews.Title: “trendy hotel by the sea with bad service”
Reviews.Author: givemesunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early January for three nights. I have traveled to over 90 countries, but have never seen worst check in line than at this hotel. The line to check in took 20 minutes during the first week of January. I shudder to think how long the line is during peak times. The hotel looks trendy and hip. It reminded me of South Beach in Miami. The vibe is young with most of the guests in their 20's and the furniture is knock offs of Modern Classics like Saarinen. The room was not ready until 4 p.m. I was pleased with the size of our room. It was an apartment with a full size kitchen, sitting room, bathroom, balcony and bedroom. The kitchen was fully equipped and you could basically cook all your meals there. A small grocery store was a few blocks away as well as Walgreen's with a small food department. The hotel is on a beach and has a small heated infinity pool by the beachside. They would not let anyone under 15 to use the pool, which would be devastating for people with small kids. The pool was almost like a hot tub. The biggest problem we had was no maid service. After spending the whole day at the beach with the "please make the room" sign hanging outside our door nobody had cleaned the room by 4.30 p.m. Just when I hopped in the shower the maid came and left and said she would be back at 5 p.m. She never returned. We started calling for a maid service at 8 p.m. After several phone calls and talking to the night manager a surly reluctant maid showed up at nine. She took her time cleaning the room and left at 9.45 p.m. She made the beds and cleaned the bathroom, but did not wipe the kitchen table that was dirty. I would have cleaned it myself,but there was no cleaning supplies. I had to go and get clean towels and supplies from the maid's carts subsequent days. I guess the young clientele does not mind this kind of bad service. There were some large groups of college swim teams who were staying at the property at the time. I am giving four stars to the hotel for its location and overall look and amenities. I would give zero stars for service. The hotel is about one hour walk from Old town San Juan (3-4 miles) a cab is $15. Outside the hotel there are several low end restaurants like Wendy's and expensive stores like Louis Vuitton. For better food we went to the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property and terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Bridget48Usa
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the views of the ocean from the rooms at La Concha although we learned there is lots of inconsistency in the size and amenities in the rooms so don't just take the first one offered! Like other reviewers, we too noted the noisy late night parties on the beach but that's a tradeoff for the sound of the ocean waves. The staff was superb and this property offers the benefit of both a series of fine pools and the beach front. This hotel could rate five stars if there was some fine tuning like picking up empty glassware at the pool; cleaning out room refrigerators between guests (we found an old pizza in ours); and generally picking up room service trays and emptying trashbins in the halls regularly.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Experience”
Reviews.Author: BlondieBNY
Reviews.Content: The Hotel as well as the staff are great, they go beyond there regular job to make sure to give you 110% hospitality. Being disabled usually makes it difficult for me to enjoy a place at its best but the hotel and staff made sure i felt like family and loved. The hotel is beautiful the beaches are great the pool and jacuzzi are so beautiful in the day and night to look at and enjoy. The rooms are nice. I was able to enjoy the downstairs lounge and the casino. I was also upgraded to a suite which was lovely and had a kitchen which was very helpful for someone in my situation. I especially will love to thank Louise for making me feel like family and Felix, Alex, Raymond and Javier these guys when above and beyond to make sure i was always ok even with my disability. Thank you guys so much and I will see you guys again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Get Married here and work with Jessica Rivera”
Reviews.Author: Kiki H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married here in January 2012. Our experience with the hotel and staff was amazing. Jessica Rivera, the Wedding Manager, went above and beyond for us. She is fantastic and will make your wedding day very easy. The entire staff at La Concha treated us fantastically and we couldn't have been happier with our wedding weekend. We had over 70 guests at our wedding and everyone came away with rave reviews of the hotel. A definite place to stay while visiting Puerto Rico! Alejandra at the front desk is awesome as well! We made two visits to the hotel prior to the wedding and every experience we had was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha - Puerto Rico at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: talyah
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at La Concha probably 4 times and have loved it each time. The hotel is located in the heart of the Condado. It is centrally located with eateries nearby as well as a Walgreens for all of those "forgotten" sundries {about 3 blocks from the hotel} and if you continue to walk along the same street you will run into some fast food, familiar restaurants, like "Fuddruckers". Anyway, back to the hotel, it's located on a beach that is beautiful and a park that sits alongside LaConcha. Sometimes there are events, food events, that you can enjoy. The rooms at the hotel are nice, I really like the patio rooms that look right into the pool. Otherwise a room on the higher floors are best -- especially if you are a star gazer as I am, not that you can't see stars from anywhere but for me the higher up I am the more I feel I can reach out and touch -- they are beautiful! Another good quality is their food, don't miss having lunch at the restaurant by the pool. Their burgers are to die for and there's a salad with grilled chicken and avocado... um um Oh and there's a casino on site and the lobby turns into a disco during evening hours. And don't forget you can start out at the front of the hotel, make a right and walk...enjoy the sights, stop at Cold Stone Creamery for an ice cream cone. I love La Concha and will be visiting it again in the not so distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: remember922
Reviews.Content: We checked in around 2 pm. The room we wanted, ocean view up high, was ready immediately. Staff is very pleasant and helpful. The view from our window breathtaking. Lower floors are bound to be noisy at night, there is loud music at the main pool area, but our room was whisper quiet. Make sure you eat the breakfast buffet, amazing fruit, fruit smoothies, pastries and the usual hot breakfast foods. There are three restaurants: An Italian. My friend and I had two specialty pizzas that were very good. One is probably enough for two people with small to medium appetites. I'm not sure why they chose an Italian restaurant, I would have liked more local foods. There is the grill by the pool that makes burgers and the like. We only ordered drinks there but although the tropical drinks were delicious they were a bit skimpy with the alcohol. The third restaurant is a seafood restaurant located within the La Concha structure. We plan to eat there tonight! There is a small cocktail bar at the beach and waiter service as well. Beach lounges are plentiful. All in all this is a very relaxed atmosphere until the band starts in the evening. Other notes: the outdoor hot tub was too hot at 107 degrees. There is only one shop, if you like to shop hotel boutiques you are out of luck, but this one has the necessities and a bit more. I think $10 is reasonable for a mixed drink at a nice resort. When I stayed at the Ritz Carlton here a few years back a frozen margarita cost $25!! Beds are comfy with no signs of bedbugs. The rooms were clean and the shower came from an overhead spout with optional hand held shower head. The casino is nice, no cigarette smoke! I recommend this hotel, especially for young couples.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha is FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for a couple of days before a cruise and had booked a room at another hotel (Sandy Beach - it's disgusting) and walked down to La Concha to see what a room would cost for the second night. ( I was willing to leave the Sandy Beach even though already paid for it was that bad) and I got a walk in rate of $179. That was only 20 more than Sandy Beach and LaConcha is a 5 star resort. It is very modern, all rooms are HUGE, some have whirpool tubs. The beds are very comfortable and the views and breezes are incredible. The staff was some of the most helpful and friendly especially Felix, who greets you by name at the door with a ton of energy and high fives. Louise, the manager, is a star employee who booked us a reservation for our return from our cruise, as we were staying in San Juan for another day. Louise reserved a room for us before our cruise and if the price was going to be too high for us she would have allowed us to cancel with no penalty. She was FANTASTIC. She also did help us get the best price, although it was in Jan. 2012, during high season. STAY AT LA CONCHA IT IS THE BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff at a well designed property”
Reviews.Author: sandyfeet10
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at La Concha, a busy big hotel on a small property that works because the staff is wonderful and the design quotient is high. Stayed in a 1 BR suite in the suite tower with a connecting room for our college aged daughter. Suite was bright and beachy with great views of the ocean. Very comfy, clean and roomy. Pool area was lush and beautiful, and beach was as nice as it could be given the location. If you are a beach walker, this is not the location for you as the hotel is on a cove that you can walk in less than 10 minutes. Absolute best part of the hotel was the staff. Felix the doorman is awesome, Tania in the bar and everyone else. Service everywhere quick and friendly and everyone seems to want to make your stay as nice as possible. When I read other reviews prior to our trip with so many staff names in them, I thought they must be written by personal friends of the staff. But now I know... the staff really is so warm, welcoming and efficient they deserve the shout outs. Place was at 100 percent occupancy for most of our stay--wedding, business conference, tourists of all types-- and it worked because of the staff and the layout of the hotel. Was there as my husband was on business and my daughter and I wanted to escape the chilly winter weather. So all fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinBadgerGuy
Reviews.Content: We are just finishing up a 4-day stay at the Renaissance La Concha. I was a bit worried by some of the previous reviews, but this hotel was great to us. I am a Platinum Premier member with Marriott Rewards if that matters to you. (I always like to look for and read reviews by fellow road warriors.) I would imagine that your experience will vary a bit depending on the room type reserved and the occupancy of this hotel during your stay. As always, I will break my review down by the various areas of the hotel that we used. Check In: We arrived around 9:45pm, and we were immediately welcomed to the hotel. We were not given an upgrade in advance of arrival, but we were offered an upgrade at check in. We elected to pay for an upgrade to an oceanview suite in the suites tower, since we wanted a full ocean view. It was well worth the money. Check in was quick and we were on the way to our room. Rooms: There are at least two different towers within this hotel. The suites tower is the newest portion of the hotel, and what my review is based on. Our room had a living room, nice bathroom, standard Marriott bedroom, and a balcony overlooking the ocean. The Aveda products at Renaissance hotels are always a nice touch. Housekeeping did a nice job. The only negative to the room was the frosted glass in the shower overlooking the bedroom. It's great if you are staying with a significant other, but it would be awkward if you were with a friend/family member. The bed was also a bit worn--one side of the bed sloped down a bit, but was still comfortable with lots of pillows. Pools: The pools are a bit small, and only one of them is heated. The heated pool was the one that I liked the most. If the other pools were heated, they would be great as well. There are two hot tubs, I believe, but they looked small. If you need a hot tub, pay for the suite that has a hot tub on the deck. Ocean: The ocean is also nice, although it was pretty cold during our stay. However, there were lots of people determined to swim in it regardless of temperature! There is a rock wall to block some of the waves, and there is a little walkway at the top of the rocks that you can walk on. Works well for pictures if it isn't windy. Food: We ate at the Italian restaurant, which has excellent food. Service was on island time, but when the food arrived, it was very good. We also ate at Solera, the poolside restaurant several times. Our first waiter, Brock, overheard that my wife was sick from traveling. He immediately made her a non-alcoholic drink that made her feel 100% better, in addition to serving some delicious lunch food. Our other experiences were also good. Note that the chips and guacamole are actually vegetable chips of some sort, so if you are a picky eater like me, you probably won't like them. If you are a foodie, you will probably love them. Lounge: The club lounge at this hotel is amazing. The dinner/dessert spreads were tasty, and the staff were super helpful/friendly. It was constantly busy, so there must be a lot of Marriott Rewards fans that stay at this hotel. Casino: The casino was a decent size, and is attached to the hotel. Tip: If you like playing in the casino, you can get some free match play certificates at the hotel front desk. They have a few London Deal/Rummy Blackjack tables, one regular blackjack table, craps, roulette and slots. If you are going to play, sign up for their rewards card so you can earn comps. And take advantage of the fact that they serve tasty sandwiches for free at night, and Dunkin Donuts in the morning. Overall: We had a great stay at La Concha. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and the facilities were very nice. We are looking forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: JohnoAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend at La Concha. Overall a nice hotel, but very busy. We arrived at 2 pm but our room wasn't ready until after 4 pm, and this must happen a lot because they weren't very apologetic. There were 2 weddings (one Friday and one Sat). La Concha is better for adults than families. If you have kids, you should choose the Marriott. Friendly staff. Good gym. Nice oceanfront rooms w/fridges (ask for 12th floor w/balcony). Breakfast buffet is awesome. Casino is good and lobby bar is lively. Adult pool is quiet, but never gets sun so we hung out on the beach every day, which gets pretty crowded since it's public. Water/waves were great. We rented a car and drove to the rainforest which was cool, but also busy with tourists. I'd stay here again if traveling with other couples or in a group. If just my wife and I, I would probably choose a more remote resort.

Reviews.Title: “My trip to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: gengels
Reviews.Content: We flew into San Juan about 11:30 AM. A quick trip brought us to La Concha Resort. It is a beautiful hotel, open lobby, infinity pools, regular pools, a beautful restaurant shaped like a shell. The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional. The room had a pseudo balcony (about a foot wide) which allowed you t stand and look out at the beach and the ocean. Room was very large, very clean and looked very new. There was a casino and a small cafe attached perfect for a quick lunch. Many restaurants in surrounding few blocks. All in all a wonderful experience. In fact, I went ziplining over the rain forest, traveled to Baccardi and took trolleys, buses and ferries all over San Juan. I loved this vacation. I understand this hotel has recently been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: LSussi
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 20yr. old daughter stayed here from Jan. 5th through Jan. 12th. We were very happy overall with our experience at La Concha and with Puerto Rico especially being our first time there. The lobby is open air but with the air conditioning on as well it stayed comfortable in temp. Very beautiful lobby with a nice lobby bar. Drinks were top price but that's how it is at all Caribbean resorts that we have been to. We booked a room in the suite tower that had two beds, a kitchen area with microwave, Mini fridge, sink and two burner stove. There was also a seperate living room and nice bathroom. There were two nice flat screen tvs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. The room was very spacious for the three of us. There was a hallway area with a large double sliding glass door closet that provided extra mirror area for us to get ready. We had a balcony which over looked Ashford Ave., which was a change for us from the usual ocean or pool view. But it was interesting needless to say. It was kind of noisy at night time especially on Fri and Sat nights but I just left the airconditioning fan run constantly and that would cover up most of the noise. The bedroom was a bit small for two beds but we managed just fine and after the first night my husband and I decided that our mattress was awful and sunken in. We just called the front desk in the morning and within 30 min. we had a new mattress and box spring. Very nice service! Our room was cleaned everyday although I felt that she could have done a better job cleaning especially the floors but I admit that I am very fussy. We used the workout room almost every day and found it to be large and adequate. We mainly layed out at the main pool area and were usually able to find chairs but normally put towels on them earlier to guarentee that we got the area that we wanted. We never used the two smaller pools facing the ocean because they were always totally shaded the whole afternoon. The beach was nice and you could walk quite a ways down past other hotels. The waves were very large and we got to see some surfers and lots of boogie boarders. It would have been nice to have some music playing near the pool area but all in all it was very nice. For some reason we were given access to the preferred lounge which was a nice little extra that we hadn't counted on. They had a nice breakfast every morning, late afternoon snacks and evening time desserts. We had dinner at the Perla restaurant which was excellent. Beautiful lighting and atmosphere. Good food and service. Our bill was about 150.00 for the 3 of us. I have to give a shout out to Felix in the Valet area, he was awesome!! He was so very friendly and always put a smile on our faces. Everyone there went out of their way to say hello and to smile but the top award should go to Felix for sure!!! Bottom line is, we would definately go back to Puerto Rico and we would stay again at La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and service”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne722
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a very busy weekend. We enjoyed lounging by the pools overlooking an amazing ocean view, and we ordered food and drinks outside every day. At times the staff members were working so hard that they were running, but every single one of them served us with a smile. Our room was huge and had a partial ocean view that was enough to watch the waves, and also gave a great city view. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Extra $”
Reviews.Author: Bebrbabe
Reviews.Content: This was our second cruise trip out of San Juan and I chose this hotel for a couple nights pre-cruise, upgrading a bit from the Holiday Inn just a block off-ocean where we stayed last time. It was only about $40 more per night, but one look at the ocean-front view when we got our room and just: WOW! That sealed the deal right there - this is where we'll be staying in the future. The hotel itself is just beautiful and I have never had such friendly service when visiting this island: excellent in every way. Condado Beach itself is lovely. There were surfers the day we arrived which was fun to watch, but as the wind/waves died down families took up the sand, complete with bar/grill service. It was great. The area itself is very walk-able and felt safe/well patrolled, and Dunkin Donuts is just a half-block down the street for the morning coffee and stroll (handy), as well as a Walgreens for those things we forgot to pack. Chilis and Wendys restaurants are just a couple blocks away also if the kids would like to eat something more familiar. As for the rooms, the Ocean Tower was great as we loved the views; We were on the 5th floor and as other reviewers have said, I would avoid the third floor if you want a clear view of the ocean; Also request a non-adjoining room unless you need one. I would imagine the garden or pool view rooms would also be very nice, and they have full balconies that you can sit on as opposed to the Ocean Tower "balconies" that are just a 6"-wide strip of concrete/railing off the sliding glass door. It was $20 cab fare from the airport, and another $20 to the cruise terminal from here for the 4 of us;

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Jdamato
Reviews.Content: Outstanding property! Best staff ever! Thank you Ruddy Matos in guest services, Felix in valet and Ana Marina in food service! They will make your stay amazing! Jim & Tracy DAmato

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Travel3lee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1/9-1/13 and had a great experience. We stayed on the 3rd fl in the spa suites. The balcony was huge, the view was beautiful, it was everything we were expecting. We ate at Voga and Solera and they were both great. We also enjoyed many of the local restaurants. We took the bus into Old San Juan daily for only 0.75, which I highly recommend. There's so much in walking distance, we can not wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdeleG63
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 3 nights and we did not have any major issues. Our room was missing the coffee maker but when I called the staff apologized and sent one right up. The room had a lovely ocean front view and although it was large, the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. As for the frosted glass on the bathroom door that so many reviews seem to mention ..the frosted glass is only on a portion of the door between the bedroom and the bathroom ... I was traveling with a friend of the opposite sex and unless I had stared intently while he was in there I really don't think it is an issue. I appreciated the coin laundry facilities and breakfast in the club room. The pool outside of the club room is nice and quiet overlooking the ocean although limited sun. The pool restaurant food was good. The casino was limited, mostly automated even the tables, but I did not choose the hotel for the casino. The lobby is really pretty, overall a good 4* hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay”
Reviews.Author: DrFady
Reviews.Content: Cool lobby. Lots of fun at night. Rooms are typical W hotel like trendy but nothing special. the main reason to stay here is night life plus location. Lots to do around hotel plus a $ 15 ride to old san Juan where you find really cool restaurants.. beach area is ok. You don't feel like you are in the caribbean. San Juan is to party not to be at beach. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and employees, but it doesn't feel like a resort”
Reviews.Author: 4okay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of days before Christmas 12/22 to 12/24. It was a nice location. There was bakery within walking distance where we had our cafe con leche, and a top notch breakfast. Ask the parking attendants and they'll tell you. The employees were very nice!! We were without a phone however for 24 hours, which was a major problem. We had family members staying at the hotel, and we had to go to their room to speak with them. We also received no shampoo, and had to go down to the lobby, and when it was time to go to sleep, we realized we needed another pillow and had to go down again--and we were on the 11th floor. Each time we went down we were told that someone would be at our room right away to fix the phone--but it never happened. The employees were really nice though. We did get a discount in the end, but I made sure that we got a printed copy showing the discount--because I had learned that they say "yes, we're going to do this..." so sweetly, but their words didn't lead to action, and I knew I might not get that discount if I didn't ask for a printed copy of my hotel bill at the moment they said they would give me one. The hotel is nice, but the pictures look nicer than the hotel really is. I was surprised by the small pools. The pictures make the pools look bigger and classier than they are. The water in the pool was colder than the water in the ocean. We were surprised by that. The air temperature was warm, humid in late December. You had beautiful island breezes. Walgreens Pharmacy was a few blocks down the street. We purchased postcards, toiletries, water, souvenirs--t-shirts, and a man's swimsuit--all at very good prices. We tried the fitness facility which was free and you could watch a few cable tv channels on the ellipticals and bicycles. We ate at the italian restaurant which stated that they had a 3 course meal for a fixed price if you ate before a certain time. When we got there, we discovered that they only had 2 entrees you could choose from for this price, and their advertisement was quite misleading. We were not able to have the pri-fixed dinner. I ordered chicken piccatta, which came with no capers?!? When I explained to our waitress that I was used to having capers in my piccata, she brought me a small bowl full. The meal was not memorable for anyone in our family of four. The bread they brought was the highlight. Our server Joann was very nice. The hotel room was big with 2 queen beds. It was very clean. I believe that all the rooms overlook the ocean. The television was large and they had a music system. The bathroom had frosted glass instead of walls which can be odd for families with teens. Being close to Christmas there were parties outside on the street. Many drivers like to honk their horn, and I unfortunately heard them. I was awakened the first night thinking that the fire alarm was going off at the hotel. My family snored on unaffected. We felt the place was an average hotel, not really a resort. It was definitely overpriced!!! It was a short ride from the airport--about 10 or 15 minutes. It cost about $16.75 (increase due to gas prices), plus an additional dollar for luggage. All the cabbies were nice. Overall, I would not return to the Concha unless I couldn't find another accommodation. It really wasn't worth the price we paid. I would prefer staying in a resort if I am paying resort prices. Reading this review, I realized that what I would return for was the bakery, not the hotel. That's pretty sad.

Reviews.Title: “Please Do Not Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Christmas2010
Reviews.Content: While the location of this hotel is fine, the service is absolutely non-existent. For example, because I was arriving early in the day I booked my room for the night before. To my surprise, my room was not ready upon arrival, and the concierge Alexandra looks me in the face and lies to me saying that because I was classified by the computer as a 'no show' my reservation had been cancelled so how could they be held responsible for preparing a room that wasn't booked. What!?! When I spoke to the manager about this, she caught Alexandra in her lie and things got sorted out. Another example of the nightmare of La Concha is the behavior of Reymundo the Assistant Manager at Voga Restaurant (which by the way is fabulous).
