My daughter and I orderer lunch at Solera (the outdoor restaurant) and told the waiter we had only 1 hour to eat. Our meal had not come in 45 minutes (a salad and a wrap!), so we cancelled our meal and had to check out. At the check out desk, I was asked how everything had been, and I told the reception person about our lunch. Reymundo came to me and said when I came back to the hotel (in 1 week after our cruise), I would eat for free the entire week no matter if it were in the hotel's restaurants or room service. When I returned, I realized that this was a lie as well. What is up with this staff? The Head Concierge Louise took 8 hours to find a vase for my flowers and when I asked about this she said that she thought the clients had been stealing the vases so they couldn't find one for me! What?!? It was like this the whole week and I will never ever stay here again, as there are many better hotels on the Condado. However, if you are looking for great service, get Kenneth the server in Perla a fabulous hotel restaurant, or get Alfredo in the Voga restaurant. The casino is fine and the shopping across the street from the hotel is great. The beach is nice and the attendants there are helpful. The gym is small but ok. Go somewhere else if you want service. Please don't make the same mistake I did and expect a hotel that charges $350-600 for a room to care about your comfort. They do not.

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointing Start to a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Profesor140
Reviews.Content: I never thought I'd write a review on the first night of a stay, but the start to my family's stay at the La Concha Resort has been quite disappointing. We arrived at the hotel property after a late night flight -- after a full day at work and traveling for several hours, we were looking forward to checking in as quickly as possible and getting a good night's rest. Upon settling into the room, we pulled back the covers to the bed and found hairs in the sheets, strongly suggesting that the sheets were not properly changed prior to our arrival. We travel relatively frequently for work and leisure so we've become accustomed to an inconvenience here and there and you hope that a property's management will work with it's guests to quickly resolve any concerns or issues. Unfortunately, this was not our experience at La Concha. We had to place three calls to the front desk to have the room serviced and the sheets changed, taking approximately 45 minutes for someone to be sent up. This was a significant disappointment as you would expect that the hotel's team would want to make a good first impression and the request under the circumstances was far from unreasonable. As we waited for the sheets to be changed, we took a closer look at the room and as noted in other reviews, there appears to be a lack of attention to the cleanliness of the rooms (debris/dirt in the drawers, a torn curtain, grime and dirt on the room phones, stains and stickiness on some of the surfaces where spills were not properly cleaned, etc.). Wear and tear is to be expected in any hotel room, but a commitment to cleanliness should not be a point of compromise for guests. The guest services book touts the property's "delighted to serve" philosophy. Unfortunately, on the very first night of my family's stay, they fell well below the standard that their motto suggests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & very modern”
Reviews.Author: LisaNewYork
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 5 nights in the suite tower and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful, very modern and clean. The lobby has waterfalls and feather trees, very upscale. I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating but I found a few things that I was unhappy about. They have 4 pools, 2 of them which no one is ever in I think because of the way the hotel is designed that the 2 pools are always in the shade. During my 6 days I never saw anyone in them nor did I see any sun in those pool areas. The other 2 pools are very close together. In fact if you walk out of one pool all you have to do is walk up a few steps and you'll be in the other one. One of the major problems I had with the pool area is that the chairs are so close to each other and I mean very close. At one point some guys foot was on my chair! The chairs are up against each other. Not sure why they do this....they also have a restaurant and tables and chairs right near the pool area where you can have lunch so that was pretty cool. Another thing that's pretty strange was that if you stay in the suite tower and you come out to the beach area, you walk on about 100 yards of sand that is totally unused - again I think because the way the hotel is designed, this area gets no sun at all. After you walk that distance you will a bunch of chairs that are jammed together so everyone is on top of each other once again. The cabana guys are very quick to pull in your beach chair if you're not occupying it. There was one time where we asked for 2 chairs and an umbrella and after a quick dip in the pool our umbrella was gone. We asked what happened and the response was something like he was all alone and busy and had to start clearing the beach. Another time some guy came back to find his chair gone and his stuff laying in the sand! The minute someone leaves their chairs they quickly pull them in and stack them and I figured out why. If they leave the chairs they get no tip if someone comes on the beach and uses them but if they pull them in and have to bring them out most likely they get tipped. I didn't like this at all. The other issue I had was with the room. For some reason and I don't know why they design them this way but the bathroom wall that faces the bedroom is made out of see through frosted glass where if you're in the bedroom you can see someone taking a shower. So if you're not going witha significant other this may be a problem for some people. Otherwise the rooms are beautiful and very modern. Overall I would recommend this hotel despite a few little issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Puerto Rico!!”
Reviews.Author: Adam C
Reviews.Content: I book the trip for my girlfriends birthday in November. We had never been to Puerto Rico before and where not sure what to expect. But as soon as we got off the play, we where greeted by our driver, who was extremely helpful and friendly, and we knew we had made a good choice. Then when we arrived at La Concha we where both very impressed by how beautiful the lobby was. The staff outside was AMAZING!! Felix was the first hotel employee we met. He was an absolute pleasure. He knew my name the second I got out of the car, and was so polite and helpful the whole time. The rest of the staff was great as well, but Felix really set the bar high. The weather was not the greatest while we where there, but the hotel and all the fun spots around it really made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, nice people”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Concha resort for approximately 3 weeks in December 2011. I had a lovely room in the Tower Suites. While I was in town for business, I had an enjoyable stay with very helpful staff. If you will be there for an extended period of time, note that the rooms get damp because of their beachfront location. I purchased a damp-rid at the nearby Walgreen's and that eliminated the dampness and its accompanying smell. During my time, one of the elevators in the Tower Suites was broken, that was very inconvenient but it is my understanding that they needed a part from the Far East (literally), which is why the elevator repair was delayed. The staff was very helpful and nice and the rooms were well-appointed with Aveda bath products. The gift shop sells nice travel candles that gave a homey feel to my room. There is also on-site guest laundry facilites that came in quite handy during my three week stay. Finally, the restaurants. Yum, yum, yum. The Italian restaurant was a staple for me. I had their lasagna modified to be made with vegetables and it was superb. La Perla restaurant was exquisite. Overall, a centrally located beautiful property. Downsides: the lobby has a very South Beach, party all the time feel. Great when you are on vacation, just depressing when you are there for work. Clearly, the hotel cannot control the purpose of my stay. The lobby bar is a bit loud making it difficult to have a conversation. On two nights during there were fireworks that literally shook the hotel room. Again, simply not my style.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT 7 DAY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: Louise M
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 1 bedroom suite ocean view the sound of the ocean put us to sleep. The staff was very helpful and coopertive. Johnaton the day bartender was amazing, kind, polite and always ready to serve. Victor and Louise were so helpful. Everything you need is in walking distance. We had a wonderful vacation. Thank you to all at this wonderful hotel. We will be back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “great 4 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: Roshi79
Reviews.Content: One of the best short little getaways I've had in a while. 2 of my friends and myself decided to get out of NYC for a few days before the holidays and couldn't have picked a better place. From the minute we entered the hotel we received the utmost amazing service. The hotel itself is modern and beautifully laid out. The beach outside of the hotel is beautifully kept and well staffed. We found ourselves 3 out of the 4 days laying either poolside or by the beach mainly due the beautiful scenery as well as the outstanding service provided to us. Have to give a shout out to Brock who was there whenever we needed him. I have never seen someone work so diligently in the hospitality industry to assure that his clientele are well taken care of. All in all this was a great little trip and we will definitely be back. regards: roshi, julie and joe

Reviews.Title: “Chic 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack809
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best hotels in San Juan. Having to travel throughout the Caribbean quite a lot on business, I try to pick a different hotel most months. This is definitely one I can become addicted to. Chic new interiors, great ocean views, in a really great neigborhood (Walgreens on the corner, about 2 blocks away). The staff is super professional and nothing was too hard for them to arrange. Rates could be a bit better, but for the amenities (great gym, heated pool, onsite bar and restaurants) I don't mind paying. Get a room on the ocean side. City view is pretty busy/noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - ask for Ocean View, City View is noisy.”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 2 BR suite on the 10th floor of the tower. The accommodations were exactly what we were looking for. In hind sight though I would have opted to pay the extra $ to have an ocean view room. The street in front of the hotel is party central - very loud until 4 am. Everyone we encountered was very friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: MissPerpetualMotion
Reviews.Content: The staff at La Concha Hotel in Condado, San Juan De Puerto Rico , are the nicest and most efficient and helpful staff i have ever encountered in my life....5 star and 6 star hotels worldwide included .

Reviews.Title: “Super stay - but too short!”
Reviews.Author: CDE32648
Reviews.Content: the hotel is just what you would expect in San Juan! Very hip, ocean-side, 4 pools - and we used every one! We stayed in the new tower of 'suites' and loved it! Seperate living room/bedroom areas with basically a full kitchen! The service was very good. The Executive Lounge was a bit disappointing - not what we have seen at other Renaissance's but a great locaton and view of the water. Loved it - wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive!”
Reviews.Author: mauikit
Reviews.Content: I was always curious about this hotel every time I'm in San Juan. I found a great rate at the Marriott website and was able to stay from 12/22-12/24. It was a great experience and will definitely come back! My boyfriend and I had a great holiday stay. Customer service was top notch - they let us do a very early check in, without any hesitation. The rooms are spacious and had a wonderful view of the ocean. The breakfast buffet had a variety of selections. Most of all, the hotel is very clean and well maintained. It's definitely rated A!

Reviews.Title: “Great but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Andy Z
Reviews.Content: We had our family vacation here from Dec. 24-30. Two teenagers (17 and 19). We also went with another family with two teenagers (15 and 17). Although very pricey, we knew that going in. The drinks at the resort are very expensive ($8 beers and $13 glass of wine), The suite was big and nice. One huge complaint. We were on the 10th floor over looking the street. There was constant loud music, screaming, fire works on the street every night from about 11pm until 6am. We were up half the night. The kids were ok because they were in the other suite room away from the street. The place was packed so they couldn't move us. In speaking with the desk staff, they said this was the normal week end noise and during the holiday, they "weren't surprised" that this occurred every night. Otherwise very good. Good service, beach, food and room.

Reviews.Title: “great atmosphere & nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: the La Concha is in a great location in Conodado with a beautiful view out over the water. The service and amenities were first class (Aveda products) and it's a cheap cab ride away from Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Best area of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: coltsneckgirl
Reviews.Content: Went in early November with my husband and 6 couples. What an amazing time we had! I have stayed at many hotels in San Juan but loved this one the most. TheCondado area is the most hopping for nightlife. ( It's very rundown now near the El San Juan / isle verde. ) this hotel is upscale and very cool. The staff is excellent and friendly. A few little glitches in the rooms like a broken closet door but nothing to upset anyone on vacation. The beach here is very nice. The water is rough though and wouldnt reccomend this place for kids. It's adjacent to a park and not public so you have to keep an eye on your things but where else can you lay on the beach and see Fendi in the distance? Yes you are in shoppers heaven! The high designers a here but also small boutiques with lots of cute things to buy. the bar in the hotel is fun and lively. The small bar is so fun and SMALL! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: ElGringoViajero
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just before and after New Year's Eve. This is a beautiful property. I was upgraded to a suite upon check in and was amazed at the quality of the room. The room was extremely modern and well-equipped. There was a contemporary kitchen with a refrigerator, freezer, and a two burner induction stove. The kitchen was equipped with everything you would need to prepare a small meal. I spent some time out at one of the pools - the pool that was designated for adults. No kids were allowed. It was so nice to be able to soak in a pool (heated by the way) that had no kids. It was an infinity pool so you could swim up to the edge and look out over the beach. The gym was also quite nice and contained a good set of cardio equipment and free weights. New Year's Eve was fantastic. The music, light show, and fireworks were out of this world. The music went on till after 1pm but I was able to fall asleep without a problem. But, be forewarned, it will be loud on New Year's Eve. The very next morning, New Year's Day, you could not even tell that there had been an event there. They cleaned up that fast. There were some small quirks that were somewhat annoying for me since I am more used to Marriott brand properties. First, there was no luggage stand in the room so I had to unpack my suitcase on a table. Second, there was only one free electrical outlet by the desk. Lastly, and this was annoying, the garage is a split-level type with an "A" side and a "B" side. The elevators in the garage did not go to each side, but were rather a half flight of stairs between them. So if you have wheeled luggage, you need to either carry it up a half flight of stairs or wheel it up one of the ramps between floors. It's an odd design. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bernard”
Reviews.Author: Mike K
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a great place to go and stay, especially for New Years', as they throw a big party. If you had to make friends with any bartender there, I suggest finding Bernard Rodriguez. He is a great friendly guy who will not only make you great drinks, but will make you feel welcome at the island and give you advice that would come from a great tour guide. HIt up Bernard at La Concha resort in San Juan

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: DeRepentigny
Reviews.Content: Booked only 1 night before our cruise, december 17th 2011. At our arrival around 7h15 pm, we asked some people from the staff to direct us to a quiet pool for a dip. They actually opened a pool for us and provided us towels and all the rest, even though they were busy with 2 wedding receptions at the same time. We had a room on floor #8 with an ocean view. They have huge patio doors and juliette balconies. Very clean and nice minimalist design in the rooms. The interior garden has a beautiful terrasse nearby a 2 level pool where they serve light meals and great drinks. Nice big lush vegetation in the garden! We ordered a selection of tapas (5) with no fish and it was a meal by itself. The margaritas were very good and the ambiance very casual and relax. For breakfast, you have everything you need at the hotel for a small breakfast (pastries and coffees) at the lobby bar. It was quite the same price at the Starbucks around the corner for the viennoiseries but they did not seem as fresh as the ones at the hotel. We rarely felt such a personnalized service in a hotel, where the employees come to meet you at the front desk on the other side of the counter and take time to provide you all the information you need. No rush! They also call the guests in their rooms about 30 minutes after the check in to make sure everything is perfect. Definetly, for us, these attentions make a huge difference...

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation during Christmas week”
Reviews.Author: falkon181
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with family during Christmas week. Oceanview rooms--very nice. comfortable and clean. Staff was very helpful and attentive and the food at the hotel and the immediate neighborhood was great. Pools were very busy and loud(main pool) --chairs taken by 8:00a.m. Beach better for relaxing... the shady infinity pool areas were quieter. Great gym with ocean view. Spent one day in Old San Juan and one day doing a rainforest/kayaking tour. All arrangements made at hotel. We'd go back...

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary on several levels”
Reviews.Author: exNYfamily
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: we stayed for free thanks to hubby's many Marriott rewards points. Excellent service all around, from the friendly valets to the timely housekeeping, to the kids on the beach who drag the loungers around, to the waitresses and bartenders. Rooms are bigger than we thought they would be. Even though we were on a low floor (3rd), and even though we could smell the hamburger grill exhaust from below, we had a view of the famous shell and the ocean out our window. Bathroom was spacious, mildew free and plenty of space to store toiletries. Closet space was also excellent. Love the decor in the lobby. Minor complaints: 1. Elite Rewards lounge closed for Christmas week. That was kind of mean IMHO, and the first time we've encountered such a policy at a Marriott property. 2. Good housekeeping, but I don't understand why they took my hotel robe away halfway through my visit and never gave me another one. 3. They hide the bathroom mat under a pile of towels, so before you waste a bath towel like we did, look for it. 4. Our sofabed was too broken to be fixed, so our daughter slept on the made up sofa itself instead, also one funky lamp was completely broken with exposed wires - dangerous but easily remedied (we unplugged it). **Note to hotel management** We are in the tropics, and your a/c works OK, but why on earth did we have to suffer under down comforters???? Too hot at night for sure, even with the a/c cranked as far down as it would go. Why not use a cotton duvet instead? Or layers? I did not sleep well any night because of this - with the comforter off, too cold, with it on, too hot. Re: dining - we ate at Solera grill - very good tapas, fun atmosphere, good cocktails. We ate once at Voga for breakfast buffet - excellent but pricey ($26/pp). We ate at Perla TWICE because it was so excellent. It was a nice break from all things fried or rice and I thought they did a good job of combining the local with the international. Get a window table for sure, you can see the waves even at night. Lovely atmosphere inside too, excellent table service. And the wine list is so long they bring it to you on an iPad. It was the only place on the whole island where we could find caribbean lobster on the menu (and it was excellent). If you rent a car, it will cost $20/night to valet park it, but you have no choice in the Condado district, no street parking anywhere. Worth it, as many ins and outs as you want. The pool scene - not our cup of tea, I don't travel all that way to sit by a pool, I want my toes in the sand, but for those who are into that sort of thing, to me it looked overcrowded and competitive. People were laying out towels by 7:30am to reserve loungers and there must have been some kind of brawl over it because after a few days the towel handler told me not to use towels to reserve poolside seats (which I pointed out never applies to me anyway, but would have loved to witness that cat fight!). Also, for New Years Eve they were closing down the whole pool area at 2pm to prep for that night, so the beach was extra-crowded that day. The beach - is on the Atlantic, the waves are VERY rough, no lifeguards. The beach itself is nice, but I think they should store the loungers further back or off to 1 side - the towers of them block the view for people not sitting right by the water. Good amount of palm trees on the beach (fyi all PR beaches are public, so leave your wallet in the room), very breezy and they do have beach waiters if you want a piÃ±a colada without getting it yourself. There is a big park next door, looks like they hold a lot of free concerts there, so next time I'd look into that. Overall, we thought this was one of the most organized, clean, pretty resorts in the whole Marriott chain. That being said I think if we return to PR we'd look to be in Aguadilla because the beaches are so much better. And since we stayed for free, I have no idea if it is worth cost.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany O
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I travel at least once every year and PR was calling our name. Once we arrived at the hotel it was love at first sight!!! The entire staff was excellent and the property was gorgeous. Awwwww we were at bliss. I will return and stay longer next time, There is a property on Miami Beach called Eden Roc that is owned by the same company for La Concha. Great service all around and this has become my new spot whenever I come back to PR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway.”
Reviews.Author: cdeb007
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here. Wonderful time. Here are the details: Room: Our room was a one bedroom in the suite towers which was great for vacationing. A separate room where one person could stay up if the other wanted to sleep. A great kitchenette and large fridge/freezer so we could stock up on breakfast/lunch/drinks. Very clean. Rooms in the tower are quiet. I can see that a room near the pool would be loud but we couldn't hear a thing in our room. Balcony had a great view. Had nice ipod plug in station that we used to listen to music throughout room and on balcony. Complaint: Shower in our room was glass facing the bedroom, connected to toilet. If you had to go to bathroom in the middle of the night and you turned the light on it wakes up anyone sleeping in bedroom. Beach: Good enough. We traveled to vieques at the end of our trip so we were just looking for a place to lay and forget life since we knew we were headed to nice beaches later in the trip. A little crowded but nice and had waiter service. Readily available chairs and towels. had lemon water available to avoid dehydration. Pool: Didn't use the main pool. But there was an adult infinity pool available if you stayed in suite tower. It was great. we went there after spending day on the beach. Beautiful view of ocean, quiet. Gym: Excellent with a decent amount of machines and ocean view. Restaurants: Didn't eat at the conch shell restaurant. Fair in quality. Nothing amazing. good for snacks or to eat if you didn't have much time. Central bar was good to get a drink while waiting to go out and explore. I felt the service was prompt even though PR has a reputation for being slow by NY standards. Overall location was amazing. It was beautiful (decorated for christmas) and the people were nice. I would definitely stay there again. Relaxing and forget about real life...this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay with Great View”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: Booked an oceanview suite through priceline. The room was spacious and very clean, and the bed comfortable. We had an amazing ocean view from the balcony! It was a very pleasant experience overall. (Everything about the priceline booking was accurate. We just had to pay the resort fee and valet parking fee upon checkout.)

Reviews.Title: “Second time around and there will probably be a third...”
Reviews.Author: MsOnMyWay
Reviews.Content: The pros and cons of the La Concha. Pros: -Right on Condado Beach (okay beach with nice waves and some seaweed. Chairs always available and the beach staff will set you up wherever you like) -Hotel nicely designed -great ocean views from the full ocean view rooms -nice trendy rooms (stayed in the suite tower both times. Suites have full size fridge, microwave, cooktop, cookware/utensils, flat panel tvs in both rooms, nice stereo system in living area, iPod dock in bedroom, large balcony with table and chairs, nice bathroom with jetted tub (note tub/shower has frosted glass on the the bedroom side so your silhouette can be seen from the bedroom) -multiple nice small pools (not heated) and a couple intimate hot tubs open 24 hours -close to local shops, luxury shops (Cartier, Gucci, etc.), restaurants, market that is held next door, and a handy Walgreens. -Plenty of cool lounge areas around the hotel -staff pretty nice/helpful Cons: -housekeeping occurred afterp 4pm 3 of 4 days -hotel room was very noisy from the music in the lobby and from wherever else the noise was coming until 3 am -continental breakfast that was included was not great at all and if I had to pay, it would have been upsetting -1 of 2 elevators for the suite tower was broken for 3 days and the one that did work wouldn't come up to my floor (10). Had to go to another floor to catch the elevator -$20 parking -no hotel spa (you're referred to a no so relaxing day spa across the street or one a couple blocks down) -lobby mojitos weren't good -$$ tours thru the hotel Bottom line: I recommend this hotel for a romantic or a fun trip to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: camelia_2012
Reviews.Content: First of all be aware of all the additional taxes when you book a room. We were here after Christmas through Jan 1. The room, ocean front was ok buy not up to over $600 value. The room cleaning was not done until late or they even forgat to do it. First night, the towels were missing ; the food was so so and pretty expensive especially the breakfast. For NY even we asked if we need a reservation, we ended up standing up and looking at the people, mostly outsiders, having their own bottle service tables. The hotel not very.considered to its guests that also paid a lot of money to enjoy its facility . Overall la concha renaissance is not really up to the standard of a renaissance hotel. Not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Concha service managers disrespectful and not concerned about complaints.”
Reviews.Author: sal2009
Reviews.Content: I am a 29 year old nyc doctor traveling with my partner on new years. We paid over $600 for our room. This is the nicest resort in the candado. I have stayed here before with no complaints and many chic resorts of this type. There was a circuit party going on in the pool lobby area (think drugs, underage drinking, etc.) until 4am. We called to complain at 3am (figured that was reasonable) but they just put us on hold. When we finally went downstairs to the lobby, (oh and we were on the top floor...what abt the poor bottom floor people), there was a sole receptionist who clearly had been fielding complaints from innumerable hotel guests he admitted. he felt bad but had no power as the management was unavailable and unwilling to deal with the problem. To make matters worse, the individuals at the party were not staying at the hotel...the management cared more about locals visiting the circuit party than the guests paying for very expensive rooms. There was never any warning or disclaimer that this kind of acticvity to be going on when we booked the hotel. Bottom line, I'm a young guy who likes to party but I know when something becomes inappropriate and the most important hotel in the condado should be concerned about their guests. If you are 40 years or older or habe kids, DO NOT STAY HERE. I will be elimating this resort from all my companies future travel in the future and be telling my friends/acquaintances to stay elsewhere not so much because of the noise, but because of the lack of concern on behalf of the management.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Hot Spot”
Reviews.Author: PBrave
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent venue. A few oversights here and there, nothing major. Well maintained, good beach (for Conadado). Ocean view imperative, makes a big difference. Spacious rooms. Incredibly helpful and attentive staff. Skip overpriced lobby breakfast. Good casino. Great location in Condado, walking distance to many great restaurants and a 10 minute drive from Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great city/beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha right after Thanksgiving for 6 days. We normally stay at all-inclusives that are in more remote areas but decided to do something different this time. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted by friendly and accommodating staff. We had a suite in the tower with partial ocean view and like it a lot. The hotel has a very contemporary feel both in the public areas as well as the rooms/suites. The main pool area was very lush with vegetation and made you feel like you were at a remote resort. We stayed mostly at the beach as there were a few kids at the pool. The beach was okay, although we have been to islands and resorts with fabulous beaches, so we may be beach snobs. The attendants at the beach could not have been nicer. They would bring you your chairs and umbrella and set them up wherever you wanted. You could even tell them that you were going up for lunch and they would make sure that your set-up did not disappear. We enjoyed the food at the hotel very much. The lunch options at Solara by the pool were excellent. We tried all of the restaurants in the hotel. Our favorite by far was Perla. We had Kenny G as our server and he was excellent. We also need to give a shout out to Brock who works at the beach/pool who was full of good info about the resort and the area. We would definitely stay there again when we are back in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Truffles37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love the La Concha Hotel. The pools were amazing and the view was great. The rooms were so quiet, that we slept wonderfully there. We had a tower room with a partial ocean view on the 5th floor - no noise at all! The staff were all helpful, friendly and engaging. The only restaurant we ate at in the hotel was the outdoor grill, which was good, but overpriced like most of the hotel restaurants. A cental location for a trip to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: Wolverine S
Reviews.Content: What more do you need from a resort: our ocean-view room from the 10th floor was just out of this world. The adults-only pool with a view of the ocean was fantastic and WARM. I couldn't believe the whole pool was heated like that. We went swimming there even in the night The other pools seemed crowded with sun bathers.. so good luck if you're going in the peak season and sun-bathing is high on your list of things to do. I personally don't get the whole sun-bathing thing, so this was a non-issue for me. The beach was also crowded when I was there but it didn't matter to me either as I was interested in playing in the water with the waves that were pretty huge at times. Room was very good and comfortable. Knocking off a star for the following reasons: - No tub in the bathroom - Crowded in the peak season. - 15$ / night for parking. This itself bumped up the cost of renting a car and we ended up cancelling our car rental - On premise restaurants were expensive.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at La Concha! Concierge staff (shout out to Victor and crew!) couldn't have more helpful with restaurant recommendations, places to see, etc. Great ocean views, beach side or poolside lounging. Always easy to grab a taxi from the hotel to get to old San Juan or any of the other hot spots. Room had a mini fridge and flat screen TV. Lobby was spacious and modern. One of our best vacations ever, and we will definitely repeat!

Reviews.Title: “We go back every year for a reason!”
Reviews.Author: LRaven
Reviews.Content: We go to La Concha about once a year and never visit PR without stopping here for a night or two. We stayed in a really nice suite with a pool/ocean view and a blacony. The room was in the new tower and everything was new. The room had a full kitchen with stove and microwave, refrigerator and freezer which was very convenient for storing our rum drinks of the day! The gym at this hotel is great and overlooks the beach. Its bright and clean and one of the nicest hotel gyms I've been in. The staff at the hotel is great and it is within walking distance to starbucks and many good restaurants. It is about a $12 cab ride to downtown San Juan. The food and drinks by the pool and at the beach are fine but pricey. We usually make our own drinks and buy food at the pool. Pricing wise I dont think you can do much better for the quality with AAA it was like $160 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelToo239
Reviews.Content: There is so much that we loved about the hotel. First of all, we were greeted by friendly staff as soon as we exited our cab. The people who worked at the front desk on the day of our check-in were also very friendly and accommodating. Victor Rodriguez was a wonderful concierge--great service and recommendations; arranged a terrific tour to the rainforest and some wonderful restaurant reservations based on what we were seeking in San Juan. Pablo at the Ocean Lounge and he was also provided wonderful service. . Almost all of the front desk staff were pleasant and friendly. The one exception was a difficult front desk manager-he did not believe what we were saying and made that clear before he checked and discovered we were correct. However, that's a small issue when everyone else was perfect. The view from our room was gorgeous; the pools were wonderful; there were always chairs and towels available, and we also enjoyed the beach.The room was clean and the amenities were excellent. We want to return tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crystalvegas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at La Concha at 9:00am after finishing a cruise....thought we could just check our luggage for the day. The young lady at the desk was so pleasant and helpful. She checked us in and gave us a beautiful king bedded room with an incredible ocean view. Rooms are gorgeous, luxurious, and very clean. EVERYONE we came into contact with at the hotel was so friendly, helpful and professional. I can't say enough good things about this place. Beach/pool areas are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: maw0512
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Puerto Rico for six nights stay at La Concha. Taxi ride from Airport to the hotel is about $16 plus one bag they count $1 for it...... we had only two bags with tips we paid about $22 one way taxi ride. This Hotel is a beach front resort with a casino. We were little early just before 2 PM, the check-in desk was able to check us in right away. We did upgrade our room from the city view room to a City View one bedroom (Paid upgrade, not free).....which we love it so much. we had a great view of the city and the bay. I took lots of pic from the balcony in our room. The room is clean and the maid service is great. She is always making sure our room is clean........and smell clean daily. Security is always around the pool area and staff were very friendly and helpful. Lobby Bar have delicious cocktails and lunch sandwiches are yummy. Only one little complain......the tower that we stay have two elevators, but one was down and never get it work during our six nights stay............ because, one elevator stop at each floor is annoying......but, oh well...... we live..... The hotel pools are amazing. We love the adult only small pool that near our tower.....it was so relaxing and nice. Hotel is locate in the nice area Condado.......we feel safe during our entire stay. Got Gucci and LV store just one block away....... The restaurant Perla food is not cheap, but they were really good. The view is nice from the restaurant. We were mostly hang-out at the hotel and old San Juan....... too many things to do, not enough time. We did take the bus #53, #21 and maybe #10 (the bus stop is right in front of the hotel) to Old San Juan ($0.75 each way)....feels like a local.... not the ideal of getting around, but that how we does it since we had few incidents of the taxi ride......... that's why we end up taking the bus to/from hotel to San Juan.....The bus wait time sometime can be up to an hour........... not really shows online for the bus map and scheduled at all......little confusing..., that's why we only take the route that we knew....from the hotel to old san juan.... :) Previously, we paid $20 for one way taxi ride from old San Juan back to the hotel..... since we went to Old San Juan almost every other day, we decided bus will save us big $. Would have rent a car......if we have more time there. Check out was quick and the front desk staff let us check out little later then what we suppose to with no extra charge..... again, staff are very nice and helpful with smile all the time. They do charge the resort fee $20 or $15 per night..... can't remember. BTW, We love the local little restaurant call Pinky's......LOVE IT......Simply Delicious. We ate there every morning. We will stay in La Concha next time when we visit Puerto Rico.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but don't expect even coffee in the AM”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, chic hotel with a lovely beach and gorgeous views and sitting areas. We had a high floor with an ocean view and the room was large and comfortable. For what we paid, my main issue was that they don't put out coffee or tea in the morning and there wasn't a happy hour at the bar. The only free item I saw was when you pick up your beach towels, you can get a cup of water and there was oranges in the container. Coffee in the shop downstairs was around $3.75 a cup, but they did offer free refills. The food in the lobby cafe was very expensive, so we walked down the street daily for our breakfast. I just felt that more should be offered to thei clients. A resort fee of $25.00 during the week and $50.00 weekends was tagged on and I was told this is for wifi, internet and other hotel amenities. The environment is beautiful however.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ragu_ON
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for one night prior to our cruise. The lobby was very modern and large. We had to wait for our room, it was already 5 PM. So we decided to have a bite to eat. The restaurant at the pool was comfortable and the food was pretty good. Prices were a little expensive but not overly. When we went to our room, we found an ultra modern room, tastefully decorated with a great view of the beach and ocean. That evening we walked up and down Ashford, taking in the local sights and finally enjoying a local meal at a restaurant across from the hotel. They have a casino which we never used. A very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha - wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OnIslandTime
Reviews.Content: We visited San Juan for a long weekend in November and it was a fabulous base. We loved La Concha and had a room in the suite tower and it was fantastic. The room was huge! There was a sitting area and kitchenette, and the shower/bath area was to die for! The location in Condado is excellent. There are lots of wonderful restaurants within walking distance. We really enjoyed Miro, a tapas bar down the street and the restaurant in the Condado Hilton. The pool area was lovely. There is also beach sitting available but the surf was a bit rough duing our visit. We drove to Fajardo to take a trip with East Wind Catamaran to Culebra and the famed Playa Flamenco - it is spectacular! We would love to return for another visit and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously chic! 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick17
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience here in La Concha. The lobby is very modern and beautifully decorated, the front staff very welcoming. Located at the heart of Ashford Ave, you are within walking distance of the beach, a pharmacy (Walgreens), and many many restaurants and bars. The room was clean, spacious, and I hate to repeat myself, but beautiful! Decorated with white and subtle aqua colors, it gives the room the vibe of your own oasis. The only issue I found with the room was that the safe had a big screw right in the middle of the safe, so you can't really put big items, like a laptop or iPad. I called front desk and they 'sent' an engineer to the room, but after 20mns of waiting, I called again to cancel it. It wasn't fair for me to wait that long since my time was very limited! I wanted to go out! Another plus of the location, there are ALWAYS taxis outside the hotel. Working at the valet and greeting people is Felix, and like some reviewers have mentioned, he is THE nicest guy in the hotel; not the managers, not the front desks gals, it is Felix. A ride to the mall or Old San Juan is $15. Not too bad, considering there's always traffic. I'm not sure how the housekeeping works in this hotel, whether the maids do only 1 round around the hallway, or what. But twice it happened to me that I slept in and left a little late from the room, and when I leave I switch the hangtag to maid service. However, both of those times I come back late to the room, and notice that the room wasn't serviced. The first time I let it slide, calling housekeeping to request new towels. But at the second time, I definitely requested service. I think the managers need to take a look at how that is done, because I'm sure many people would like to sleep in at some point during their vacation, right? Note* When I arrived and left, there was only one elevator in service... It can get annoying, specially during 'rush hours'.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price...Service, Accomodation, Location A+++++”
Reviews.Author: bobbih
Reviews.Content: We spent a surprising 3 nights at this hotel last December, 2010 and would return tomorrow if we could. It had been newly renovated at the time and the decor was just so exciting, from the lobby and throughout. Our room faced the ocean and it was joyful to look out and see the gorgeous blue water and the sun shining every day. The staff was so helpful. From the front desk and concierge to the best mojito maker in the city, it was a pleasure to be there. We had the pleasure to meet a native Bronx gentleman, I think who managed the outdoor restaurant area, who directed us to a cozy spot by the water and chatted about the good old days in New York. He was extremely proud to be working at this hotel which says a lot. The local bus is just outside, cabs are called and there in five minutes, the area is wonderful for a walk and choice of restaurants are around so you can walk to eat a nice dinner. This was a great hotel and I have wanted to write a detailed review for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware : it's a family resort !”
Reviews.Author: cristianonyc
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the magazines editorials featuring this property as a young, hip, adults only, hot new San Juan spot . I found my self trapped in a family resort with thousands of children ! The staff is attentive and very friendly , the rooms are decent , as well as the food at the two restaurants. The modern decor of the resort is all over the place and a little too much , but I guess for San Juan this is the best choice. Do not expect a Delano- Standard- W hotel type of property and clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: yogagirlgd
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 month old baby and I had a wonderful experience at La Concha. We had a one bedroom suite in the Ocean Tower with partial ocean view. The room was spacious and well laid out. It allowed us to put our son to sleep in the bedroom and then enjoy dinner in the kitchen and living room. The pool was also really peaceful and clean. A lot of cute quiet nooks to relax in. Although everyone was incredibly friendly, the service could have been a bit better. If we decide to vacation here again, we would definitely stay here again. Quick side note- be mindful when booking, there was a huge price jump closer to Christmas and we chose to move to another hotel for those two days. Our room more then doubled in price.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: KristenWT
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this review is overdue (I stayed here late August and got caught in Hurricane Irene). However, as I look to TA for recommendations..it's only right for a destination which has so many questions. My review will be prior to the storm: Room: I had an ocean view room and the view was awesome! Some previous reviews mention requesting an ocean view and/or pool and I concur (if views mean alot to you). Looking around the landscape that surrounds the hotel..I couldn't imagine what kind of views you may have otherwise. Beach: is nice, water (color) was not as dark blue as some have stated, neither is the sand full of rocks or ocean rocky. Plenty of seating at the beach and pool & they really insist on placing your chair and umbrella down for you. Which was fine..as long as there was not a wait. However, the hotel should consider getting more staff to assist with that area. Service on the beach was slow, but food and drinks were not too far away. The new suites have an infinity pool which was really nice and less busy. Supposedly all adults only, and staff tried their best in that area. Food: I only ate the Breakfast buffet once (due to the storm) and it wasn't bad. Typical buffet food. I did ask for restaurant suggestions from the concierge and the most awesome bell guys (I've drawn a blank to their names)..but they were the most courteous out of the hotel staff. I also tried some of the best rated restaurants from TA. Try--LaPerla, if you want to dine and see the beach. Very nice! Location: excellent location amongst fine shopping and local dining all within walking distance. Cleanliness: no complaints. Overall, good pick for the price! Many have said & are absolutely right..this is a nice, trendy, hip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Beach and and bar scene”
Reviews.Author: MCZAR1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at La Concha. This was our second time there and we decided to try out the 0cean tower suites. It is a separate building and a newer addition. I found the rooms to be spacious with a small balcony. There is a small kitchen area which does include a refrigerator, freezer ,microwave and 2 cooking surfaces. They also provided some pots and pans. The abothroom was large and feature a combination whirlpool tub and shower. The bathroom wall facing the bedroom is made of frosted glass which is cool but also means that anyone who uses the bathroom and turns on the light will illuminate the bedroom too. The walls are not close to being soundproof and we easily heard a loud conversation taking place in the room next to ours as well as the outside music coming from a bar about 1 block away. IIt is classified as a resort so you will pay a resort fee but that does mean that there is wi fi throughout the hotel available at no (extra) charge. Overall I enjoyed the hotel and for the most part the staff is very friendly and helpful. The only exception was the female concierge who was rushed, did not offer any suggestions and probably is in the wrong job. The bar/lounge area is a very open area and attracts a crowd from outside the hotel esp on weekends. I would defintely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLinny
Reviews.Content: I am here at the hotel now and felt the need to share with everyone, what a complete and utter disappointment this hotel is. First of all, it is located right across the street from a night club which blasts music until 4 am on Friday and Saturday, and it is the loudest thing you have ever heard. Sleep is not an option. The pools are quite small and there is a small beach area littered with seaweed (not the hotels fault, but they certainly don't seem inclined to clean it. And the prices are off the chart. $16 for a burger at the pool and $13 for pancakes in the morning. That is just a sample. And the concierge service is anything but helpful. I have stayed at many hotels around the US and Latin American, and this was one of the worst experiences I have ever had. I tried to discuss with one of the managers, Michael [--], but he only made matters worse. He is completely and uttlerly useless. How he still has a job in the service industry is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a restful -or- relaxing environment! Too NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: NancyAllan
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell this hotel is beautiful HOWEVER if you're looking for a restful and relaxing stay then I strongly recommend choosing a DIFFERENT hotel. TRUST ME we are not the type of people to exaggerate. This hotel was hands down the loudest hotel I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: kennyb25
Reviews.Content: La Concha is an excellent Beach Resort on Ashford Ave. The resort has a very modern up to date look. I stayed in one of the ocean front beach Suites which had just about every amenity that you could possible want. Full kitchen, living room separate bedroom towards the back with a wonderful ocean view off of the balcony. The resort itself has several excellent restaurants on site, several pools, gym, casino with all the major table games and slots. Resort staff was excellent from the moment that you arrive until the moment that you leave. They were always available to assist in anyway possible. The resort is within walking distance to several great restaurants, shops and bars. A short distance from the airport about 15min and also very close to old San Juan about 15min also. I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a great stay in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of noise if you want a tranquil time”
Reviews.Author: O M
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty hotel, well designed, relatively new stuff (and Aveda products for shampoo etc). But it does not inspire fondness. When we arrived, we were given a king bed, even though we asked for two queen beds in advance (these beds were not officially confirmed in our reservation, tho we called in advance and were assured we would get what we wanted). Even after complaining to the manager, we were not moved into a room with two beds till two days later. We were, however, upgraded -- which was a nice gesture, but inadequate under the circumstances. Since we came with two rooms, we were told that two rooms would be upgraded, but when time came, only one was upgraded. Beware: if you are noise sensitive, the rooms facing the street are thumping till well after 4 am on the weekends! There are clubs at and near the hotel and music blasting from cruising cars. This is not a tranquil environment.

Reviews.Title: “50 bucks says if you look closely, your room isn't clean.”
Reviews.Author: Alefeusch
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a brand new 1-bedroom suite built just last year. Walls were scuffed up, paint was chipped, shower was stained, windows had fingerprints, carpet was dirty, furniture had food all over it that wiped off easily with a cloth. This place spends way too much time being cool and way too little time keeping up their hotel-- partially because there aren't many better choices in the area. Maybe a little competition from the brand new Vanderbilt opening up next door will force them to re-consider there attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, unparalleled service, gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth4050
Reviews.Content: We stayed at la concha renaissance hotel in the condado area for two nights before embarking on a cruise. We stayed in a suite the first night with a city view, the room itself was immaculate, modern and very fresh looking. After American airlines lost my mothers baggage the staff was more than helpful in providing extra amenities including toothbrushes/paste, extra pillows, etc. the first night we had a difficult time sleeping as the hotel seems to be surrounded by nightclubs, which is great if you're a young person who doesn't have to be anywhere in the morning. The hotel staff was more than happy to move us to a partial ocean view with a less loud club nearby so that my mother could sleep better the next night. The ocean view was stunning and the pools were hardly crowded. Also, the bell staff alerted us ASAP as soon as our lost baggage arrived! Felix is the best! All in all, a very pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Puerto Rico! (and Family friendly)”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: I have been to Puerto Rico 7 times now, and have stayed at different hotels each time, and I must say that the Renaissance La Concha by far has the cleanest facilities, friendliest staff, superbe ammenities, and is a 11 on a scale of 1-10! Every staff member who comes within 10 feet of you takes the time to make sure you have been taken care of...and if you need anything, including special requests, they go our of your way to fulfill your needs/desires. One example was Ruben Espequa, a beachside food & beverage server, who was tasked by my daughter to create a special drink, which he did not have to necessary supplies to make. Ruben asked if she would be willing wait a few mintues for him to make her drink, and promised to deliver it to her out on the beach...Ruben searched all the resports restaurants to find all the ingredients to make her drink, and within fifteen minutes later Ruben showed up with the most amazing drink, with extra garnishes, and a fantastic presentationl Hector and Jaun work on the beach setting up chairs & umbrellas. They were constantly moving the chairs to ensure my Daughters were in full sunlight and the day proceeded, and brought them fresh towels several times during the day. The front desk staff was incredibly helpful in assisting with our luggage, giving us advice on the best places to eat (local places...not chains) and gave us a free DOUBLE upgrade because of our loyalty to the Marriott properties. The night life at this hotel is extremely lively, with live music in the lobby lounge, as well as the casio (the casion staff was wonderful too!) and they even had live bands playing out around the pool areas at night so you could enjoy the weather, scenery, and ambiance. As I mentioned, I have stayed at a defferent hotel each trip to P.R., but I have found my new "Home away from home" when in San Juan...and will not stay at location in P.R. ever again. Two Thumbs Up! Perfect 10! Sure Bet! (And Family friendly) If you want the best of the best.......La Concha Resort by Reniassane is THE place to stay! Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Judy W
Reviews.Content: We had a great week-long visit for our anniversary. Loved our 9th floor room with fantastic view of the ocean, rocky coast and beach area. Housekeeping service was great, room was quiet (could hear no other guests), clean and contemporary. We dined at all the restaurants: Solera, La Perla (fantastic!!), and Voga Italian Grill - and would recommend all of them for atmosphere, service, and top notch food. Concierge and front desk staff were all helpful, upbeat and knowledgable. This is a very cool place to stay: expensive but top notch and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern upscale resort”
Reviews.Author: Road_Maven
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for one Saturday night preceeding a cruise. The decor is uber chic wilth light pastel colors throughout the public areas. The inviting bar area with its open floor plan mad an inviting placer to have a drink with friends or just people watch. The room we were given was a 'city view' suite. 'city view' is a fancy way of saying a view of the parking lot or old buildings. Spend the extra $$$ and go for the ocean view. That's why you came to PR in the first place. Our only complaint was that our room wasn't ready when we checked in even though it was after 4 pm. In fact, several in our group had the same problem. We were given pagers, like those you find at a mall restaurant so this happens frequently. After spending a long day traveling, you want to get to your room when you arrive. We made the best of it by having a late lunch with our new friends at the outdoor pool bar and after a couple of hours, we settled into our room. The accomodations were very comfortable. The weather was not good and therefore I can't comment about the private beach or the pools except to say, they looked fine. All and all, I would like to come back and spend a week here on my next vacation. It seems to have everything I would need for a restful relaxing holiday. In closing, La Concha is a busy vibrant resort with lots going on. The bar scene is active and once you check in and leave your day to day troubles at the door, you can start your vacation. Go fo it.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of resort...”
Reviews.Author: Pathjoel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha for 7 days. The resort is perfect. The location is right on Condado Beach, not in the tourist-crazy Old San Juan. Sit at the infinity pool overlooking the ocean and you will feel like you are in paradise. The suites feel like a condo. Perla Rstaurant has wonderful Filet Mignon. And walk to Pinky's restaurant for breakfast, while you eat with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for those who prefer trendy”
Reviews.Author: DonBeach
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful well run property on the beach. Staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is on the trendy side so if that is not your taste, look elsewhere. One complaint is there are several small swimming pools suitable for wading but no pool for lap swimming. The Marriott nearby, which is a more typical hotel property, has a traditional large pool.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Fun, Fantastic Hotel Full of Energy!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights (definitely not long enough) at La Concha Resort. Having stayed at The Ritz during my last visit to San Juan, after reading tripadvisor reviews, I decided to give La Concha Resort a try and couldn't be happier! La Concha is a wonderful hotel and full of energy. I had a studio suite (room 504). The room was ultra modern. I had a total unobstructed view of the ocean. The pools and beach are wonderful. The staff couldn't be more accommodating. The hotel has a small casino on-site also. Check-in was a breeze. The only tiny flaw I could find with my room was that one of the closet doors had a missing handle and wouldn't stay closed. The room was very clean and the bed quite comfortable. Whenever I return to San Juan, I will DEFINITELY stay at La Concha Resort again. Thanks for a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Week at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: andialeigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocean Tower, room 822, for a girlfriend getaway of five nights. We really enjoyed La Concha. The room was clean, the view was awesome, there were two closets and plenty of drawer space, and lots of shelf space in the bathroom for all of our toiletries. The beds were comfortable, although I did wake up with a sore back a couple of nights, that is fairly typical for me. No slippers and only one robe provided, but we brought sarongs and didn't need them. The staff dresses all in white and are both friendly and professional. Housekeeping did their job well too. The drinks were expensive, as you would expect from a full service property, but tasty. We split an order of sliders from the outdoor cafe and between the two of us could not finish it because it was so bad. We didn't eat at the other restaurants so I can't comment to them. No spa, but we got massages across the street at Zen one day when it was raining. The pool is a perfect temperature and the hot tubs were not crowded. The beach outside the spa was a little rough (expected in the winter time) and the sun was mostly gone by mid-afternoon due to the building casting shade, but I'm super white and was glad that I didn't have to rent an umbrella. My friend was a little desperate for afternoon rays though. Apparently the neighborhood is a little scary so they don't advise you to walk the streets or beaches after dark. That was a little unsettling but other than the armored police offers on every corner I didn't see anything alarming. We had free wifi which is a super nice benefit, and the downstairs bar was quite hoppin' at times. We really enjoyed Oceana down the road too (a trendy open air nightclub with tapas and an ocean view). Not perfect, but very very enjoyable. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ebrahits
Reviews.Content: My and a friend recently stayed for 4 nights at La Concha. We chose this place because we heard it was a little "younger" and "hipper" than some of the other hotels around. We were incredibly pleased with the choice. Rooms in the tower are accessed through open-air hallways and have ridiculous views of the ocean (I've never seen the ocean be that close to a room view--usually the ocean is a little ways off). The room was impeccably clean and well-appointed with Aveda bath products. The shower is styled in a "modern chic" with only half of a glass door, so when you turn it on, water does get outside of the shower area a little bit, but it was no big deal since the shower itself was great (both a rain-shower head and a hand-held with great pressure). Our room was cleaned twice a day. One thing that was strange was that, despite the awesome view, there was no balcony. There is about a two-foot space where you can squeeze outside to see the view from your room, but that's it. There are a variety of restaurants and bars on the property and each one is truly excellent. We went to La Perle (the clam-shaped restaurant the hotel is famous for) and it was both beautiful and amazing (me and my friend are both from Manhattan where we are used to going to high-end celebrity chef restaurants on a weekly basis, and we both agreed that La Perle makes it to our Top Ten Best Restaurants we've eaten at; but even if you are not a foodie, you should go just to see the gorgeous room). The pools were great and there weren't any screaming kids when we were there. The one facing the ocean was often in shadows so we mostly sat by the pools on the inner courtyard. What really sets this place apart though is the service. Everyone from concierge, to towel service, to doormen, to security went above and beyond, almost to a point where it was silly how incredibly nice they were. One time, we wanted to use the jacuzzi at night (pools are open 24hrs!) but there had been a cocktail reception earlier in the evening so the heat had been turned off. We asked a hotel associate if there was another jacuzzi somewhere we could use. He could have just said "no, sorry," but instead, he called up the building management on his walkie-talkie and asked them to come down and turn on both jacuzzis, then he assured me and my friend they would be ready to use in 20 minutes, then he found us at another part of the hotel specifically to come tell us that the jacuzzi was ready, and even later, once we were in the jacuzzi, he came back to ask how it was and if everything was okay and to apologize profusely that they weren't on to begin with. He went SO out of his way to make sure we were enjoying every second. This was indicative of ALL the service at La Concha. They go way WAY beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: StevenEP
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I recently spent a week in Puerto Rico and split our time between the Tamarindo Hacienda on Vieques and the La Concha in San Juan. Both locations and properties lived up to 90% of our expectations, but everything at the La Concha was above and beyond except for the lobby nightlife (more below)-; When we arrived in San Juan we taxied to Isla Grande airport and flew Vieques Air Link (VAL)to Vieques and had an amazing time exploring the island and it's very nice secluded beaches as well as simply hanging out in Esperanza at night talking and partying with the locals, most of who relocated from the US mainland. Upon our return from Vieques via VAL (VAL was a wonderful experience and everybody from the baggage handlers, customer service employees to the pilots were all very good) and arriving at La Concha we knew we did it right. Upon exiting the taxi we were met by Felix who lived up to his high energy and very helpful expectations. The young lady named Linette was great at check-in and checkout; the process was flawless. Upon entering the 8th floor tower suite ocean view room to visiting the beach, pools, lobby bar and pool bar/grill and restauraunt (Solara I think) there was not a time I was not impressed and happy with the service and quality. Sleeping to the sound of the ocean crashing along the shore to a 2am swim in the pool while looking at the stars, I had the best sleep I have ever had while on vacation if not ever! The La Concha was clean and the employees were all courteous and willing to help. If I had one disappointment it was the lobby bar at night. I stayed at the La Concha instead of the Marriot this trip because the new lobby at the Marriot was still not opened after being renovated. Do not get me wrong, we were very happy staying at the La Concha, but we thought the lobby would have some live music and dancing, at least a DJ. It had neither, although very nice, the drinks were very expensive and small and the lobby was full of very young people hanging around and drinking. I did think there would be a DJ or music to dance to for all. Although we are in our early 50's we are very youthful and enjoy a younger crowd, but the lobby was full of very young people barely old enough to drink hanging around checking each other out with some music blaring from a sound system. Please understand, this was the only negative and not a slap at all on the Hotel, it was more about our expectations and that we were disappointed that our expectations were not met. In closing, we loved the La Concha, the Condado area of San Juan, the beach along Pinones and Old San Juan and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: jennamack
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great service on beach/pool. Great pool/beach food. Good lobby bar services. Beautiful ocean views from rooms. Cons: Disappointing, inexperienced concierge staff. How do they not have a list of recommended restaurants? Pretty much all Renaissance hotels do. Housekeeping was lacking on some days. Breakfast staff pitiful and slow. Had great meals while in San Juan. Jam has 50% off on Monday nights (all food)--excellent food & presentation. La Piccolo awesome. Raos good lunch place. di Parma which is right next to the hotel is a wonderful cafe esp. if you get tired of the pool/beach food at the hotel. Excellent pizza and salads. Budatai is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Property was OK - but the food was just plain bad”
Reviews.Author: Geenainva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while on business travel. As a frequent traveler and Gold member of Marriott, I have access to the concierge lounge. Normally these lounges have decent appetizers in the evening and nice, healthy and appetizing choices for breakfast. This was not the case with the La Concha. The evening appetizers seemed to be of the cheapest frozen variety, or they were just down right awful. The breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs that were far too salty to eat, or a "cream of wheat" type cereal that was so overly sweeten that it was impossible to eat. The food at the restaurants was little better, and was expensive to boot. To top this off, the hotel added a 29.50 per day "resort charge" that is not advertised in it's prices when making the reservation. They would not remove this charge, but I will take it up with Marriott headquarters as I feel this is a deceptive practice with which a reputable business would not want to be associated. There just has to be better places to stay if you're going to Puerto Rico. I certainly will cross this one off my list!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGuido7
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at La Concha. The staff was great and the hotel was very modern and clean. The beach was small but not crowded. The ocean was a little rough but more in a fun way than a scary way. Some of the smaller pools were in the shade most of the day. We had a suite on the city side. The room was very noisy at night but very spacious. The location is less than a $20 cab to both airport and old San Juan. There are restaurants and drug stores across the street. The lounge is only open M-F. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Valerie K
Reviews.Content: Got an ocean view room with a corner balcony. Really the nicest room at this property. There are few rooms with balconies, so if you can upgrade to a corner, it is worth it. The conceirge lounge is large and very nice. The main pool is nice and there is also an adult pool which is a nice added feature. The best part of staying here is the waves were incredible at the small beach. Had a blast just riding the waves with little effort. The water in the ocean was warmer than the pool and the waves are amazing. I am told it is not a private beach but the only folks I saw using it were hotel guests. It is small but did I say the waves were a blast. I am told the Thai restaurant across the street is amazing but we did not have time to try it. As stated in other reviews the suite had a wonderful bathroom, Aveeda shampoos, a fridge, microwave, etc. which was a nice feautre.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the hype!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGirlWest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at La Concha during our last three nights in Puerto Rico; we did so based on the strength of the reviews on Tripadvisor. You can imagine that our expectations were high and unfortunately we were left disappointed; especially since we sincerely wanted to like this hotel. Pros: - Fantastic location adjacent to the beach and within walking distance of many restaurants - The ocean view from our 9th floor room - The largest of the three pools was quite nice - The lobby was trendy and clean - The bell boys and service staff (with the exception of the pool staff) was very kind and friendly - When we had concerns about our room they were promptly addressed - Our room was available for an early check-in Cons: - Upon arrival our bed sheets had a large circular orange stain - Upon arrival our shower drain was completely clogged and nearly flooded the room - The closet doors in the room could not slide out without bashing into the dresser handles next to them. From the significant wear on the furniture it was clear that this had been a long standing issue. - The room was generally beginning to show it's wear - The original tower has balcony like areas in the corridors where one in theory could step out and take in the views of the city. Except it rained significant amounts nightly and not once during our stay was the water mopped. I didn't notice the first day and nearly slipped. - The literature in our room was very limited - no explanation of the spa services or a menu list of the different restaurants on the premises - The cabana beds were never once attended to during our visit - consequently they were not only dirty but had puddles of water on them from the overnight rain - The staff at the pool side restaurant was inattentive and rude - they never came by to take our order so I approached a group of them having a casual conversation. They then said "YES!?!?" as though I had interrupted them. - The area surrounding the ocean view pools was dirty. Pretty well all the beach loungers were dirty and again there were puddles galore. - The beach was completely unmaintained - in fact the seaweed wasn't raked (I could understand if they were going for a natural look) and it was totally full of garbage (unforgivable) - The beach loungers were completely disorderly - strewn about at will I have to say by far the most disappointing part of the hotel was the deplorable conditions of the area around the ocean. Let me put it to you this way, adjacent to the hotel there was a public beach. That one was raked and cleaned every morning. There was a noticeable difference between that area and the much less pleasant area in front of La Concha. To the credit of the hotel - during our stay we noticed there were what appeared to be visiting Marriott bosses inspecting the property. We saw them pointing out numerous flaws and giving instructions as to how the hotel should be run. Then on the morning we were leaving we saw the beach being cleaned. The bottom line is that this hotel could be fantastic. But it's certainly not there yet. The good news is that it doesn't have that far to go but it will take considerable effort on the part of the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: Extremely serene, beautiful, and relaxing. The staff was very accommodating; in particular a waiter, Ruben. He was very friendly, made us feel very much at home and saw to our needs. We even ran into him one evening outside of the hotel and he was so gracious as to give us some dance instructions. It made for a memorable evening. Can not wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “The best it could be”
Reviews.Author: BCKL78
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 5am to a cheerful front desk and bellman. Got a tower 1BR suite ocean view - really nice. Unit had a fridge, ice maker, range top and microwave. Son slept on sofabed which was kind of uncomfortable but he's 18 so he didn't care. Main pool area was really nice with plenty of chairs even at peak times. 2 smaller "infinity pool" areas also very nice. Beach area well maintained and attended. The surf was rough, but if you like big waves you'll love this beach. Fitness center had ocean view and was super clean and nice. At night, the lobby turns into a nightclub - comfortable and plentiful seating around a neat bar. Lobby opens up to the pool area which is open all night - they serve food and drinks late. Pool restaurant features Caribbean-themed tapas and sushi along with a few grill options. Nice drinks, too. There are 2 higher-end restaurants onsite, but we didn't eat there. In the heart of Condado, there are at least 6-8 decent restaurants and bars within a 2 minute walk, along with a 24-hour Walgreens that sells everything, including beer, wine, and hard liquor. Hotel is 10 min cab from airport and 10 min from old San Juan. This hotel is geared for people who are looking for city-type nightlife and are OK with a city location but also like resort amenities. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Talk about awesome...”
Reviews.Author: JMagic21824
Reviews.Content: In a word: Peaceful. In three: Iâ€™ll be back. Iâ€™ll preface this by saying up until this year, I havenâ€™t been one to travel an awful lot, but, like most people, you know when something just doesnâ€™t fit or doesnâ€™t feel right. This was NOT one of those places. From the beginning, every part of our experience here was delightful and above expectations. We were greeted upon check-in with glasses of champagne and a wonderfully maintained suite with a great view. Everyone, and I do mean EVERYONE, was courteous and extremely helpful. From recommending a great restaurant to helping us book a snorkeling adventure, it was all done with genuine concern for us enjoying our stay. There were several pools throughout the property and even though there seemed to be a large number of people around, none felt crowded and we were able to enjoy a dip as we needed. The bar in the lobby was lively, but not over the top; Perfect for drinks before dinner or before heading to your room for the night. I suppose my only complaint would be that the elevator seemed to move a bit slower than normal. But then again, this IS vacation, so itâ€™s probably intentional. At any rate, I would definitely recommend you stay here, regardless of if this is your first, second, or more visit to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Gorgeous Views”
Reviews.Author: Bonita10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night before leaving on cruise. We had ocean view room, floor to ceiling windows, which gave a great view of the beach and ocean! the room had a queen bed and had nice bathroom (small room) our friends had the double beds, much bigger. The stafe was nice, they had a very nice gym which i used, new machines with a nice view of the beach. they had 2 pools an infiniti pool and lounging pool and 2 hot tubs in the corner for some privacy. The food was deeelish! we had a beef wrap sandwich- super yummy, with sangria and hamburgers were good too.
