For dinner we did the Concha Restaurant that is there and it was expensive and small portions but over all the food was excellent, sometimes you just got to spoil yourself. The lounge was in the lobby very nice to just have drinks and listen to the music played by the dj. We took a tour of the Yunque before bording, which is a must! I highly recommend this hotel, we even saw some famous people staying there too, so all and all a winner, will def stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not a great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: TampaFLA
Reviews.Content: To start we stayed Nov 21-25th (4 nights). I am seasoned business traveler, and a Marriott Platinum Elite member. This trip was for a vacation. First, the check in process. I requested an early check in, and understand that it is based on availability. When we arrived our room was not yet ready, so our bags were held and we were asked to wait in the lobby area. It would have been nice to have been given access to the club lounge while we waited. Instead, we waited in the lobby area for at least two hours. After checking into the room, it took four calls to the front desk to get extra towels, bedding, blankets, and pillows for the pull out sofa, and a wine opener. These are things that should have already been taken care of. Secondly the Ocean Club Lounge. While this could have been a great experience, it was not. The lounge constantly had unsupervised children roaming around handling food, opening cabinets, etc. If it had happened once, or maybe twice, it wouldn't be an issue. The employees in the lounge noticed it, but did not take any action. The attendant at the concierge desk inside the lounge provided misinformation to us on more than one occasion. Specifically, I asked on two separate occasions (two different employees) if the lounge would be open and providing regular service on Thursday and Friday (Thanksgiving Day and the day after) and was told yes. I was surprised to find out that it would be open, as most club level service is not open on a holiday. We found out on our own that it would be closed on Thanksgiving day (and the day after). In addition, the "adults only" pool area was hardly that. Families with strollers and children were constantly around, while the employees noticed, but took no action. As a Platinum member, I have stayed at numerous Marriott properties across the US, and have never had a club level experience as this. After learning that the lounge would be closed, we made reservations to have Thanksgiving dinner at Voga inside the hotel. This did not turn out well. When we arrived we were promptly seated, and then ignored. Guests coming in after us were greeted by their server while we continued to wait. We walked out and had dinner outside of the hotel. The front desk and concierge staff were good, but I've had better experiences at other Marriott properties. Maybe because it was a holiday weekend - I'm not sure? I believe the hotel staff and management tend to over-promise, and under-deliver. I would not recommend this hotel to my family, friends or colleagues. And, if given the opportunity, I would stay at another hotel in Puerto Rico. If you're a season traveler you might be disappointed, and should look to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at an affordable rate”
Reviews.Author: hrmorris
Reviews.Content: In preparing to board a cruise, we stayed 5 days at this hotel. Conveniently located right on the beach, our room's door faced the swimming pool garden and our balcony faced the swimming pool ocean. The rooms were immaculate and the service was great. Downstairs were the restaurants and bar along with the casino. Food was some of the best we had in San Juan and my wife said that the Sangria was the best she had ever had. If I had a complain, it was that on Friday nights, the hotel becomes very crowded with young people who come for a drink and the casino. I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: busouki
Reviews.Content: We had not been in San Juan for about 10 years. Staying at La Concha was like coming home. Although certain stretches of Ashford Avenue are under construction and some are a bit down-in-the-heels, La Concha was absolutley beautiful. Service could not have been better. Rooms overlooking the ocean - just wonderfully sophisticated Carribean cool. I'm booking out next trip to San Juan to stay for a longer time period as one night wasn't enough to thoroughly enjoy this top-notch resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great view! Great people!”
Reviews.Author: sprman80
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until the time we left, every staff member was excellent. They have 3 main pool areas, 2 of which overlook the ocean. We didn't get to eat at all the restaurants, but we did eat at Voga and Solera... Both were really good, a bit pricey, but what do you expect from a resort of this caliber. The first night we did hear a lot of honking from the streets below, but it stopped being a problem the next night. The bellmen are great, especially Felix. Always helpful, offers to take pictures for you ...... "say whiskey."

Reviews.Title: “It is a beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: NashuaNH
Reviews.Content: I had a beautiful room that had a view of the ocean. The pools were fabulous, especially the warm water pool near the outdoor bar. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Breakfast was available every morning and good to start out the day. I didnt eat at the hotel, but there were many options/bars to choose from if you wanted. I was very impressed by the hotel, really nice...

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: reddyme04
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at La Concha for a couple's vacation. It was a quick cab ride from the airport. When we got to the hotel, our room was not yet ready. We walked across the street and got some subway, and came back and it still was not ready! They offered us some complimentary cocktails from the bar, so we were content waiting a bit longer until finally our room was ready. The room was nice. We had an AMAZING view of the beach (and I do not recall paying extra for this or anything --- we may have been upgraded due to the LONG wait). On a negative note, we saw one of THE largest cockroaches ever in our room. My fiance fought with that quick SOB for about 30 mins! It would not die! Finally, he got him but only after completely turning the room upside down. I chalked it up to being a tropical island thing, but will admit that it made sleeping a little more difficult the next few nights. The hotel lobby has those walls that can be removed during the day, so it was open to the pool area. There are tons of little sofas and cabanas around the pool and we never had trouble locating a spot to have a few drinks. The service was good, but my fiance ordered vodka on the rocks, and was charged $3 just for the rocks which felt like a rip off! We did the Old San Juan (we just took a cab there and trekked around on our own), Bioluminescent kayaking (A++++), and rainforest tour (A+++). We enjoyed all of our outings. We walked the block where the hotel is and there are some high end retailers there, along side abandoned buildings... that part was pretty depressing. The food at the resort was not great (though I was pregnant, but did not know at the time), so it may have been my food aversions. LOL. We never dined at the sit down restaurants... Only the pool bar, and outside restaurants. Overall, I'd return to PR. I would stay at La Concha again.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean Lounge Staff”
Reviews.Author: Toni D
Reviews.Content: Kudo's to Pablo, Luis, and Michael. After being a guest at the hotel since August 2011 this place is like home for me. Every evening I am greeted by these 3 gentlemen, they make you feel welcome and provide you with exceptional service. Pablo will even make you his special fresh squeezed lemonade while you are trying to recover from a cold. I look forward to getting back to the hotel every Monday through Friday.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: 03KING
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this resort for a wedding and coins the location and the amenities to be outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jack G
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a beautiful hotel that is enhanced by its very competent staff. Two of the staff, Felix Perez, Doorman and Alejandra, Concierge are outstanding! Felix meets and greets everyone with unending enthusiasm. He makes you feel welcome and welcomes you back each time you return to the hotel. He presents a very positive first impression of the hotel and the staff. Alejandra is an expert professional Concierge. She was very helpful in providing information about the sights in San Juan and most importantly how to get there. She provided detailed maps and driving instructions. She did this with a smile that lit up the room. She provided her phone number for us to call in case we got lost.

Reviews.Title: “So AMAZING, I used the towels!!”
Reviews.Author: Lexu2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha after returning from a cruise. The minute you get to the front of the hotel your jaw drops. BEAUTIFUL! They gave me a complimentary "welcome" call in my room and had no attitudes at all!! The hotel rooms are updated and super clean. I always wear slippers in hotel rooms and this time I didn't. The grounds are beautiful and the food is great. If you are on a budget, you will have some trouble as the area comes equipped with Gucci, Luis Vuitton and other similar stores. Thank you to Anna Maria and Francisco who offered great service...we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: DANIEL H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights.. and to make a long story short the hotel is just really nice. the rooms, the pools, but the beach so so... The staff was super friendly, as all the puertoricansâ€¦. This was my fourth time in the island. You have lot of nightlife near the hotel. (Not BRAVA style, which for me is the best N.club in the island) The only thing that I didnâ€™t like was the buffet breakfast, it was the same thing every 3 daysâ€¦ but it was fillingâ€¦ drinks by the pool are pricy though!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tropical Getaway”
Reviews.Author: barbara5650
Reviews.Content: While La Concha is a resort with resort prices and fees; the pools, landscape, ocean views, service, food and beds make this Renaissance a great escape. I went back for a second stay in October and loved it equally.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Crystal H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an incredible time at La Concha. The room was very spacious and the view was spectacular. The hotel was always clean and if you like the contemporary style you will enjoy this hotelâ€™s ambiance. The staff was always helpful and friendly. We received great service from a server, Ruben, while spending time by the beach. He helped to make our experience at La Concha memorable by making great recommendations of places to go and always having an upbeat attitude. Also, the bartenders at Solera made amazing drinks and the people at the front desk (which I donâ€™t recall their names) made us fell at home. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have an awesome experience. I know my husband and I will never forget this vacation.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Glenda M
Reviews.Content: La Concha is by far the most incredible resort my husband and I have ever stayed at, and we travel very frequently and have stayed at many resorts that promise you the world. La Concha delivers! We had a beautiful, clean, incredibly chic Junior Suite with a fantastic ocean view. the beach is gorgeous, the 3 pools a perfect temperature and the service impeccable. Room service was fantastic, dining even more fantastic. I have never had seared ahi tuna like this hotel can provide...I ordered it 3 times in our 5 day stay! the staff was attentive and friendly, we were never ignored from check in, to the beach guys, to the servers and bartenders. Even the room amenities are top notch AVEDA brand. No cheaping out here! Worth every penny and thank you La Concha for an incredible first trip to Peurto Rico. We will be back without a doubt, it just won't be soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Exalted, Glorious and all of the above!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PamV405
Reviews.Content: As my BFF said in her review it was MAGNIFICENT, from the time we stepped out of the cab we received nothing but excellent customer service. I was a little set back from the "incidental Fees" but it worked out because we drank tropical drinks on the beach and ate very well while there. I can't begin to tell you about the beautiful view that mesmerized me every morning when I awoke. the shower was beautiful I wish I could have packed it up in my suitcase. The location was great right in the heart of San Juan with various places to eat no matter how much you wanted to spend. Our experience was so great that we are going back for seven days next year are going to request the same room hopefully we get lucky. I dont see how anybody can say anything bad about the service or the hotel I was totally satisfied and I am very a picky person when it comes to hotels.The hotel in all is just beautiful from the lobby to the restaurants the pools everything!!!! I LOVE LOVE THE LA CONCHA cant wait to get back been sick every since missing it LOL!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you can!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler173
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough great things about this hotel. The staff is incredible. They are always patient, helpful, smiling, friendly, courteous. When we got to La Concha we thought about upgrading our room and they patiently took us around to a few different rooms so that we could look at them before we committed to one. They gave us excellent suggestions on where to eat and things to do. Nothing we asked of them was ever a problem and always fulfilled with an honest smile. The room was top notch. Everything was modern and in great condition. The beach could get a little noisy at night since who wouldn't want to spend some time on/near the beach at night?, But since we did not go to bed until midnight/two am, it was not an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Never Go Back”
Reviews.Author: BeansMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel this past summer and my experience was not good. First it is extortionately expensive for what it is. Paying a hotel fee, followed by a resort fee, followed by a breakfast charge. In any event, we paid for the continental breakfast option - you basically sit at the bar in the main lobby and pick one juice, one pastry, one tea or cofee and one cereal. The people at the bar watched us like hawks to make sure we didn't take more than we should which made us really uncomfortable. My husband was actually disgusted by this behaviour. We sometimes finished our breakfast before we were served our coffee if it was not the regular coffee, the service at the bar for drinks was really slow. It started to rain one afternoon so i sat near the bar looking at the cocktail list for about 15 minutes. Eventually i went to the bar and asked if i should be ordering at the bar or if they serve at teh table, and they said they take orders at the table. So back i went and still no-one came to take my order. After 30 minutes, i gave up. I found the rooms small, although clean and comfortable, the beach was not that great, it is coarse sand. And as far as i am concerned, the hotel has nothing authentic about it. It is a just like being in America - you are expected to tip for everything and anything even if the service is bad, (although we refused at breakfast two days even though the other days, the service was awful, we tipped) which is such a shame as although i love America, being in PR, i would have expected something traditional about this hotel so i knew i was in PR - i may as well have gone to Florida! Such a shame really - i am glad i went to El Yunque and some other places outside of the hotel as i didn't find this hotel had anything to offer. I have stayed in much nicer hotels, including the Marriott (last week in Ahmedabad in India which was excellent, authentic, fresh, great customer service, value for money, authentically India and yet modern) but i don't think i will ever come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Excellent Location, and a darn good beach.”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: My wife, and two year old son stayed five nights at the La Concha. The hotel is very good, although it doesn't quite get to our standard to award an "excellent" rating. First the the location is excellent. You are well situated on Ashford Ave in the Condado tourist district -- there are some very good local restaurants (see my other reviews) that provide a break from the hotel provided food (which is also very good). If you gamble, the Casino at the La Concha is pretty standard for Puerto Rico -- plenty of $5.00 blackjack and craps to go around -- no live poker here. TIP! Ask the front desk for match-play coupons -- even if you are not on one of their packages they will typically give you a few! There are a few different options when it comes to the beach and pools. First the pools -- you will find a multi-tier central pool in the court-yard -- it is very nice -- although this area does tend to get crowded on the weekends -- there is a smaller "infinity" pool to the right as you walk to the beach-- we found this pool to be perfect with a toddler -- never crowded, quiet and shaded! There is also an "adults only" pool accessible from the other side of the hotel. The beach is very good. Its large enough not to feel crowded on even a busy weekend -- and the sand stretches way out into the water so when the wind is low, it makes for good swimming -- beware the water can get rough at times... you can walk the beach from the La Concha to the Marriott and beyond -- remember beaches are public in Puerto Rico, so you will have a mix of locals and tourists. The rooms are pretty standard resort rooms that would expect from a higher-end property -- but not over the top like you might find at a five-diamond resort. We had a mid-level ocean view room in the original tower and were very pleased with the size --- our only complaint is there modernistic furniture looks better than it feels. The staff at the La Concha really set this property apart -- and if I were rating the properly solely on the staff they would earn 5 stars. Front desk, service, housekeeping and especially the bellman make this property stand-out -- think Ritz Carlton level service and you have the La Concha! Food at the hotel is better than average -- portions for the kids meals are actually pretty big -- and the menu has enough variety to keep things interesting. If you are traveling with children under the age of 5 -- don't expect to see too many other families -- even during the "sell-out" nights -- we were one of a handful of guests with toddlers in tow -- for us that was perfect. The only word of caution is that during peak-sell-out periods some services moved back to "island time" for completion -- but that was the rare exception during our stay. We would definitely return to La Concha on a future visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pascorp
Reviews.Content: This was by far the nicest hotel on the Ashford Ave strip in Condado area in San Juan. It's also only 10 minutes from the airport. Lots of good bars and restaurants across the street to down a few blocks. Also, Walgreens store down the block comes in very handy. Hotel has nice pools and beach area and rooms are great and very reasonably priced. The lobby bar is great if you are waiting for someone or just want to grab a quick drink but the real action is at the restaurants and bars down the block where there are better crowds and later night action. Would definitely come again. Old San Juan is a ten minute cab ride, 20 min bus ride or 1 hour walk (like we did) right along the coast...easy and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Right on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Carma73
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel after a week long Carribean cruise. So we were there to relax - We were in the Ocean Tower with a view of the beach, overlooking the landmark shell. The decor was perfect so that you could focus your attention on the amazing view the room had. I will say the little details in the room needed a little attention (i.e. corner molding not painted with clean lines - you notice this because of the minimalistic decor in the room). I didn't care for the rooms opening up to the outside but that is personal preference. The lobby was amazing and very cool. We had lunch as the pool side resturant, the food the good. We relaxed in the infinity pool over looking the beach. We had drinks in the lobby bar very good Sangria, The staff was nice but not overly helpful, We also had dinner in the shell resturant. The atmosphere was nice, romantic and the food was good, but you pay for the experience.. I think we would have liked the Italian resturant in the hotel better. I would stay here again and would recommend it to friends. The major problem was not a hotel problem, at 1:00 AM a wedding party decided to let off fireworks on the beach in front of our room, and not the guy down the street fireworks. They were like New Year's Eve in Time Square fireworks, as we had a 5:00AM wake up call and the windows in the hotel are not sound proof we jumped out of bed not knowing what was going on the bangs were so loud, it's a funny story now - not so much then. A side note we did walk around the neighborhood. There are a few designer shops around but not alot of shopping. It is also a cab or shuttle ride to Old San Juan where most of the tourist attractions are.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: Ok, I've stayed in my fair share of high end properties, but there was something about this resort that just stood out! When my husband, our two kids and I entered the lobby it just hit us. The open air feel of the lobby with its very modern and chic design is impressive. You right away feel very cosmopolitan, but not in a snobby way. The service was amazing starting with the bellman to the front desk staff. Our front desk professional was Harif Marzan. He was courteous and accommodating with a great sense of humor. He was great with my kids (12 & 14) and you know how difficult kids that age can be. By the time we left the desk they were relaxed and laughing... yeah! As for our suite... WOW! You walk in to a comfortable, chic living area with a pullout couch, flat screen tv, table and chairs, bar and patio (overlooking ocean). Then the hallway bath, which by the way, always smells like fresh lavender (how do they do that?) followed by the bedroom with flat screen and best of all... a floor to ceiling, wall length window providing a breathtaking view of the ocean! We were a family of four, so right away they came to us and asked if we would need any additional supplies, towels, shampoo, etc... Usually I have to beg, borrow and steal to get an extra towel, and it was the La Concha staff who asked us first. That was refreshing! Moving on to the beach and outside amenities, the beach was clean and the ocean was fun with super big waves to body surf. The beach staff (I think it was Rudy? and the guys were very helpful with setting up chairs and umbrellas). The two tiered main pools were great. Top pool was heated and overflowed into main floor pool with fountains. Two jacuzzis on top level were clean and soothing as well. On that second level was a fitness room. First, I must say it was very clean and they had a nice amount of treadmills, ellipticals, bikes and weights. A separate room was available for classes too. One of those classes we took was a meditation class. This was our first experience with meditation and it was so brilliantly introduced to us by the Fitness Center Manager, Ana Paula Azirovic. My fourteen year old daughter and I both agreed that her knowledge and her approach were so comforting and energizing. Just listening to her speak relaxed you. And, her years of practice showed in her classes. She was always available throughout our stay to answer questions and help us in any way. We loved her and the fitness experience at La Concha. The food at the pool bar was fantastic. Very fresh and well prepared. We were only there for two nights and did not get a chance to experience the other restaurants, but the menus looked great and the prices were on point. Having spent the first part of our vacation in Rio Mar at the Wyndham, we were meeting up with some friends for the tail end of our trip and unfortunately only had two nights at La Concha. Next time... it's La Concha the whole trip! Although we could have done without the resort fee, our overall experience was Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great resort for our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: janechris23
Reviews.Content: We had a great week's stay here. We loved our ocean/city view. The rooms separates by a convenient wall so if you want to wake up early, make some coffee and turn the other TV on, you won't bother your partner at all! We had a frig, freezer, ice maker, toaster, and utensils and dish ware (so convenient!). We got a few groceries across the street and made toast and jelly in the morning, etc. The room was very clean, service was fantastic. The pools were great, and little beach area is private and perfect sized. The rooms are clean and modern. I don't know how its possible but we did not hear ANYTHING above or next to us which was awesome (first time for us during a hotel stay). On the cost side, you cannot take a cab anywhere in PR without it being at least $10-30, even if its down the road. The Perla restaurant was $$$ but the food was fantastic and atmosphere was nice. For some reason the italian restaurant was closed.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Julia R
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I traveled to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon and were lucky enough to get a really good deal to stay here. This is hands down the nicest hotel on the waterfront in Condado. It's not only luxurious with four pools and a floating restaurant but the staff are some of the friendliest people I have ever met. We relaxed by the pool at least half of our time there and came to know some of the staff members pretty Well. The manager at the poolside bar Solera - Joey Negron - was so nice, worked hard and gave us complimentary drinks when he found out it was our honeymoon (this resulted in an absolute addiction to their white sangria - amazing!). Yalila is so sweet and makes the best white sangria! Eduardo the bellhop was also really great. And finally Hector, he served us everyday but it felt more like kicking it with a friend than being served. Super nice, prompt and had good reccommendations for everywhere we were going. This dude is probably the best guy I've ever met in a resort setting. Thank you all including those whose names I forgot because you all helped make our honeymoon the best week of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Big but cosy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: gooders47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at the end of a transatlantic cruise and will return again next time we are in San Juan. As we checked in we just mentioned that we had a problem with our flights home, before we had unpacked they phoned for more details and within half an hour they had resovled the issue. All the staff were great nothing was too much trouble. The Oyster restaurant was expensive but all the others eating areas were priced as per local spots. Don't take a taxi from the hotel, 20$, for San Juan old town, go to the bus stop and a taxi will stop with other fares on board and offer you a deal, 3$. The bus is only 75cents but they never seem to arrive till you get into the taxi. The room, complete with mini kitchen was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a long weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Michlieb
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at laConcha instead of a resort further afield because of its proximity to the airport and the short nature of our stay. Really couldnt have been happier in our decision. First the grounds are lovely. The infinity pools while small were beautiful as we're the overall grounds. We stayed in the newer suite tower,which I would recommend. We had a partialocean view which was nice, but I agree with some of he other reviews which suggested the full view being worth it. My only observations which could be a negative are beyond the resorts control. 1- the hotel is located in the middle of a busy area in town. While in the hotel you don't notice and we enjoyed the ability to go out to Walgreens or dunkin donuts, it is cityish. 2- the beach was beautiful, but the surf is quite rough. For those who like snorkeling or leisurely swimming in the ocean, it's not ideal. But it's lovely and great for wave jumping. We had a great long weekend and have no complaints whatsoever with any of the service or amenities T the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Birthday”
Reviews.Author: cinamon78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week this past July. Check-in was fairly quick, but after going up to my room I realized they tried sticking me in the older building when I specifically reserved and paid for an oceanview suite in the newer tower. After going back to check-in the lady at the counter tried to tell me the only difference is that the one you reserved has a kitchenette. That could not have been more of a lie. The original room was a partial oceanview with a nice view of the busy street out front. The room was considerably smaller, and it was not nearly as nice. We finally got the keys to our correct room and WOW, what a difference. It was exactly like the picture. Walking in you had a straight view out to the ocean. The living room/kitchenette was perfect. The bed was amazingly comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and nice. The location was good in the mornings as well. There is a Dunkin Donuts right down the street. We'd get our coffee and breakfast and take it down to the beachfront pool. There are also several restaurants and shopping all within walking distance. We only left the neighborhood once to go into Old San Juan. Normally I live on the beach, this trip was different though. The infinity edge pool was practically on the sand. I got the best of both worlds. No sand sticking everywhere, but still had a perfect ocean view from my lounger. The pool temperature was perfect too. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I come back to Puerto Rico. I stayed at the Caribe Hilton about 5 years ago and although it was also a gorgeous room, the beach couldn't compare. The Hilton was also isolated. We had to take cabs everywhere. This was a much better fit this time all around.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie H
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time, the staff was excellent and I wish I could have stayed longer. I had stayed earlier in October at another property in the same area on business and was dreading the stay but felt perhaps the issue was the hotel. Sure enough. I had a totally different and much nicer experience at the La Concha. I would like to commend the room service staff. I had ordered an add on to my entree and it wasn't on the entree. The server's attitude was, "It wasn't a problem, they would be right be back" and I will tell you that they were. I would also like to mention that the original incomplete entree was hot (really - there was steam!) and so was the replacement. I can recommend the hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine property and scene, but some glitches and excessive resort fee”
Reviews.Author: JRDelirious
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha for one night as part of a social event so as to not have to drive back home late. The property actually consists of two buildings, one significantly older (though much more architecturally interesting in the light of day) than the newer "suite tower" with its large covered atrium. Definitely seek a beach view room, it's splendid. In the older tower, avoid the 3rd floor -- the hallway is old-pre-AC-style open to the outside and at that level you'll be swathed in the blowout of the HVAC units from the casinos and restaurants on the way to your room. The room is well furnished, confortable, but the closet doors came easily off their railings and one of the closet door handles was missing. The casino/bar/restaurant/ballroom areas were quite well set up and pleasing, the scene in the common areas is quite good, and there is a high level of quality service from the staff for guests and visitors alike. Upon exiting my parking card failed and they promptly dealt with the matter, no backup was created (BTW the self-parking is labyrinthine, a bit tight, and sometimes confusing as to where are you relative to entering the building, but the rate is reasonable for San Juan). However!! This property loses a whole star in my ratings due to the charge of a whopping $30 Resort Fee on my one-night booking. Really?? Just to get a sense of scale, the Bellagio in Vegas charges $21 and, sorry, La Concha, you're fine but nowhere near that league.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it so much!”
Reviews.Author: Sherea
Reviews.Content: My obnoxiously long review: The resort is beautiful, there are four pools and none of them were ever crowded. The beach area was nice also, but the waves were ridiculous and I was too scared of getting washed away. I generally stayed near the shoreline. We were a little concerned at first because the weather report said it would rain everyday the first week of November. It did rain each day, but only for like an hour. The ocean view suite we had was amazing. It was the equivalent of a swanky one bedroom downtown apartment that included a sleeper sofa, breakfast nook, kitchenette, bath, bed, desk, two flat screen tvâ€™s and balcony area. No bathtub, but I am too much of a â€œgermaphobeâ€� to ever take a bath in hotels, anyway. Shout out to the 4th floor suite maid (didnâ€™t catch her name) â€“ she was so nice and kept our room looking spectacular. There were only two issues with the room that were infinitesimal compared to the room's overall presentation, but it may be a deal breaker for others. First, we made good use of the kitchenette because we donâ€™t eat red meats, pork, dairy, fried food, etc. My hubby and I are both neat freaks, but that didnâ€™t stop the tiny ants from showing their presence on the kitchen counter. Again, not a major issue because Iâ€™m a home owner and know how easy it is for those little buggers to find their way in no matter how well you spray and tidy up. But, I did call the front desk and ask them to spray. Also, the room had a mildew smell to it. This was also not a serious issue because my home is within a mile of Lake Michigan and the humidity stays high inside despite insulating, ventilating, and sealing penetrations! We stayed on the resort majority of the week there. We had reservations for the restaurants but cancelled because we ended up buying enough food to prepare ourselves. We did, however, have lunch at the Solera grill a few times and it was well worth it! There are plenty of stores, boutiques, and restaurants within walking distances from the hotel. Thereâ€™s a 24 hour Walgreens a 5 min walk from the resort. Also, Thereâ€™s a grocery store within a 5 min drive of the hotel . La policiaca is present on every other corner day and night. We rented a car (three car rental places in walking distance) for a day to drive to El Yunque Rainforest (please go!). It was definitely cheaper for 2+ people (entrance to the rainforest is free) compared to paying for a tour and the hotel and rental place will give directions. We regret not going to old San Juan and some of the other locations/activities outside of the resort. But, the resort was so nice that we didnâ€™t want to ever leave the property! The casino was nice. I'm originally from Detroit and the La Concha casino is about 1/5 the size of Detroit's MGM Grand. But, it's San Juan, not Las Vegas! My hubby enjoys going to casinos. So the fact that he liked it is a good thing. Bottom line: We'll be returning next year!

Reviews.Title: “A trendy, comfortable and friendly hotel in the heart of Condado, San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: RamirezP
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at La Concha on 4 separate occasions now, for business and pleasure (you can have it all in San Juan). La Concha is a Miami style trendy hotel with a lively lobby (great bar, bar staff and DJ music on weekends). The designers did a great job renovating this historic hotel- mixing fashionable while maintaining the historic shell, and creating a new tower of suite guest rooms. The reception staff is very friendly, and all will remember returning guests warmly. One more thing- location, location! Perfectly situated a short walk from many restaurants and bars, and convenient auto access to major highways, airport etc. Love La Concha!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kristin M
Reviews.Content: I went to La Concha last January with my mom. This place blew me away. It's amazingly gorgeous. Every thing about it... we had a room overlooking the pool with a patio we used everyday, and the set up of the room was amazing. Thinking about it breaks my heart that I won't be able to come back this year. At night the downstairs bar turns into a hip club (which I wish I brought appropriate dress clothes so I could've gone more). Every day we would walk around the streets of Puerto Rico after spending some time at one of the many great pools. I felt pretty safe around there even though we did witness a robbing. But keep your wits and you'll be fine. I highly recommend taking a cab to see Old san juan from there. The only down fall would be the price of everything. We primarily bought our own rum and made drinks to take to the pool because drinks by the pool were generally around $10 with tip. I def. would recommend this place to Honey mooners... I know for a fact that when I get married this is exactly where I want to go. Great everything... service, pools, bars and restaurants. I've never had a better vacation. ONE THING: Do not pay extra for the airport transfer. They wanted to sell us this transfer for $75 just to get to the hotel. Everyone speaks English there and we hopped right in a cab and it only took about 10 minutes and it was only $15! Even though at the resort we spent a TON of money, it was worth every single penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in the Condado/Isla Verde Area”
Reviews.Author: 414WisTraveler
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a great hotel located in the Condado area. I've stayed there several times this year, 2011, and had fantastic service. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. The pools are by far the best in the area with the design and pool-side service. The rooms are newly designed and nice. This hotel caters to a younger traveler with the hip lounge. The first couple trips to Puerto Rico I stayed at the Ritz in Isla Verde by the airport. I much prefer La Concha becuase of the area and clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: frobig
Reviews.Content: Service: All restaurant/bar/pool/beach service was great. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our showers from two rooms were cold the full 4 day stay and the front desk said they were having issues but weren't able to fix it until the last day. You'd expect a problem like this to be a top priority but it was not. Rooms: Very nice clean rooms. Comfortable beds. The full size fridge was a plus. Food: Great food but pricey. NYC prices but a few restaurant options. Drinks were good but again, very expensive. I'd walk down the street to the local places about 6 blocks to the left. Location: Directly in front of the resort is not so nice and you should just be aware but nothing dangerous per se. Down the street you will find more restaurants and bars and shops where it gets a bit nicer. The beach at the resort is well situated next to a pier and the resort staff are always present to provide chairs and service. The area is reserved for guests of La Concha only (or seemingly so). Great, swimmable waves and the water was warm in Oct. The weather couldn't have been better. We took a day trip to la isla de Vieques which was great. quiet gorgeous beaches there. Old SJ is a taxi ride away and should not be missed. Atmosphere: If you want quiet don't go here. It's a party atmosphere and has a great lobby bar but is noisy. It's also right on a main road so you hear honking and people outside. The walls were thin so could hear people on the halls as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality-price relationship”
Reviews.Author: Titi45_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in October and were quite satisfied with the hotel location, facilities and quality of service. The location was very good because the resort is on the beach, but at the same time only 15 minutes by taxi from Old San Juan. The restaurants were excellent and the pools' area was attractively designed and very well illuminated at night. Other very good restaurants could be found nearby. The staff in general and the concierge desk in particular were very helpful. The only thing to improve was the continental breakfast offered at the lobby bar, they said it was because of the remodelling being done there. When we checked out we noticed that the resort fee was somewhat higher than the one included in our reservation, we mentioned this at the front desk and they corrected it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “We usually hostel it but we were on our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Sweetcalves
Reviews.Content: La Concha was worth the price. My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon for 6 nights. We stayed on the 11th floor with an ocean view balcony. The view was breathtaking. Every single staff in the hotel from the front desk, concierge to the beach towel guys were very very friendly and willing to bend over backwards at our every whim. We cannot stress enough how relaxing of an experience it was to stay at La Concha. The only reservations I have are about the two restaurants we ate at which are situated inside the hotel. La Perla and Voga were both overpriced when you consider the quality of the food and their lackluster customer service. The only good ing about them were the ocean views and proximity to our rooms. Other than that, I would suggest dining outside the hotel in Old San Juan if you want a fine dining experience. The room service food however, was excellent for what it was.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: nburns3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LaConcha the last week of October. It is a beautiful hotel on a beautiful piece of property in Condado. The room was very nice with a fantastic ocean view. The bathroom was nicely appointed and the bedding was clean, crisp and comfortable. The staff at the hotel is very helpful and I highly recommend working with Louise at the Concierge Desk. She was fantastic and made great recommendations and reservations for our group of 7! The other staff members we encountered were also very helpful and pleasant. The hotel location is great - easy to get to Old San Juan and excursions - and the lobby bar was a lot of fun. We ate at Perla at the hotel and had a great waiter and a tasty meal. It is pricey, but worth it. If you are thinking of going to Puerto Rico, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous people make a good resort great!”
Reviews.Author: rascalofcowtown
Reviews.Content: First up splurge fot the Tower. With that you get the Ocean Club (not open on the weekends). Light breakfast, honor bar, snacks and a private outaide sitting area. Also, if there is an event going on in the hotel lobby you are insured a quiet night's rest. (while we were there the hotel hosted it's massively fun halloween party) This hotel had a great layout with everything you need flowing off the main lobby. 4 pools including two inifity edge pools overlooking the beach. you could literally move from sunny spot to sunny spot, pool to pool as the day moves on. the beach was spotless although tyhe surf was as expected often rough. location is up and coming with a mix of high & low end retail. better restaurants were to the west/left of the hotel. don't bother calling housekeping or the front desk at peak times they never picked up. due take the bus to old san juan as for slight incovenience a couple saves upwards of $40. staff was superb.....felix & eduardo on the bell stand, jonathan at the lobby bar, server samatha, paulo & mike in the oc, & espcially brock on beverages made our 5 days & 4 nights fabulous. I'm sure i've missed many folks whose smile and attention to detail made our trip awesome, i'll catch you on our return as we will be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Will Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: MCH2004
Reviews.Content: Went to La Concha in August to celebrate the birthday of my fiance. SERVICE: Upon arrival, we were greeted by very nice staff but had to wait in an extremely long line to check in (this is the only "service complaint"). All staff members were extremely friendly and eager to help any way possible. ROOM: We had a city view room which was great during the day but in the evenings was overwhelmed with the music from clubs/bars on the street. In the future, we know to reserve/upgrade to an ocean view (our friends stayed in an ocean view room which has similar set up but the ocean (beautiful) and peace is definitely worth it). The rooms are very modern and spacious. In it there is a full-service kitchen with microwave, frig, and stove; cookware and silverware are also provided. The closet is huge, shower/tub is "like home" clean, and the bed is very comfortable. HOTEL: At the hotel, there are many food options. The best restaurant was the one by the pool (canâ€™t remember the name). The other one we went to (up the stairs), again, cannot remember the name...was not worth the money and the private room was VERY hot as it is located outside overlooking the pool. The casino was small but served its purpose and at night the lobby turns into a night lounge. The beach was nice and clean, not overcrowded, and beach towels are provided on the patio (didnâ€™t know this until I down there). There is plenty seating/lounge spaces around the hotel with beautiful scenery. There are two "warm water pools" and a pool...all very nice. LOCATION: There are many shops and restaurants in walking distance to the hotel. Everywhere we ate the food was absolutely delicious (although a little pricey)!! If you plan to go to nightclubs plan to spend approx. $15 each way and even more for daytime excursions. The comforts of this hotel make this all worth it; however, we would have liked to be a little closer to zip lining, atv, and snorkeling tours. Overall, we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to get away, Decent place for business.”
Reviews.Author: Matt M
Reviews.Content: Overall: The hotel was a great place to stay and I'd go again. It was a bit pricey, but for a resort you expect that. Service: Incredible. The bellmen and staff were friendly and enthusiastic and made every attempt to make the stay enjoyable. Good dinner recommendations and tips about the area. Value: We were there for business and it is slightly expensive (especially with the $30 resort fee that could be disclosed a little better). We stayed there due to the proximity to the convention center (less than 10 min drive) and because it was a hotel we could get rewards at. Sleep Quality: I mean, my room was next to the ocean. Does it get any better? Maybe it does, but having a natural noise machine was great (though, if you closed the window it was silent). Bed was very comfortable, clean, etc. Cleanliness: Overall I would say it was good. The room was pretty clean; bed was fine, floors and couch area all fine. Shower could have used a little work, but it wasn't anything worth complaining about. Hotel itself could use a fresh coat of paint, especially on the ocean side. Location: Excellent because great food in walking distance (there was this small little place across the street that was fantastic), close to Old San Jaun and the Convention center (both via car). Easy to get to and find. Rooms: I think I've covered most of the room stuff, but it was a great room. I think the furniture was nice and the room was modern. AC worked with no problems. One odd thing: why have a metal chair/furniture with a room that faces the ocean? Legs of the chair were rusting a bit. Other thoughts: I was on the third floor, ocean side, and my door faced the vent from the Solara Grill. This brings up two points: 1) the door made sure I never heard that fan even though it ran 24/7 and 2) it smelled so good whenever I stepped out my door. Food was also fantastic. Solara Grill is expensive, but it is a resort. I had a hibachi steak tapas one night and it was one of the best dishes I've ever had. No joke, great flavors, etc. Lastly, when I got the list of room charges their was parking on my room for 4 days. I only put parking on once and my coworker had it on his room the other 5 nights. He had 5 and I had 4, but we only drove one car. Not sure how this happened, but they took care of it no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel, PERFECT stay!”
Reviews.Author: OverseasMR
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short vacation at La Concha with my husband and daughter and I am now very sorry I didn't stay longer! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly bellmen that seemed happy to see us even before we stepped out of the cab. The lobby is very modern and spacious with lots of places to just lounge and relax. Very South Beach. Louis at the concierge was the funniest person I met there, simply amazing, and Zeraida at the front desk seemed to be there all the time! They both had pretty green eyes and were the friendliest of all the staff, always smiley and fun to talk to with great recommendations and tips. Zeraida even offered us a complimentary crib for our 1 year old daughter as we checked in. It was in our room within minutes. She was even there at 6 in the morning on our last day as we were leaving for the airport... and she did our check out too! Food was a little pricey but everything we tried was delicious. Overall, it is great place to stay. I already miss our beautiful view of the ocean and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: annapolisg
Reviews.Content: This was a long weekend getaway for hubby and I. Really, all we wanted to do was sit on beach with umbrella drinks and sleep/read. The hotel was perfect for that- we stayed in oceanfront suite. The restaurant was very slow for breakfast, but we figured we were on 'island time' and food was so so. We had dinner at Perla at the hotel on our last night and it was AMAZING! Had we known, we would've eaten there every night. One small downer was that the concierge lounge was closed on weekends (couldn't even go in for soda/water). We wanted to be social, but the bar was pretty empty each night- not sure what people are referencing with noise and partying until 3am. Huge bonus- the sell mojitos by the pitcher:). We will go back. Dont bring kids- there really isn't anything for them to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bob C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha for 2 weeks, while on a work assignment. The hotel is beautiful, every amenity you could ask for and it is located directly on Condado Beach. The restaurants have excellent food and all of the hotel staff was superb. I am a marriott elite member and had access to the Ocean Lounge. Pablo, Luis and Michael were very friendly, always had a smile and went out of their way to provide each guest with the best experience possible. The front desk help were very friendly and were ready to help all guests in any way they could. The staff of the poolside restaurant were outstanding. The lobby bar provided a nice atmosphere for some late night socializing. Excellent place to stay for a fabulous trip, peronal or business.

Reviews.Title: “Expert service, luxury living, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Pegtrimble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for over 5 weeks when on an assignment in Puerto Rico. The hotel was very clean, full of assorted amenities to include free, in-room wi-fi, and staff who went the extra mile to assure our food, our room and our experience was top-notch. The hotel is directly on the beach, with convenient parking and access to major roads to all points in the island. If you wish a casino, one is attached. The room we had was an ocean view suite and quite roomy. A kitchette, dining table and seating area form the front room; the bathroom separates the bedroom area from the living area. The balcony off the bedroom is roomy enough for a table and chairs and ours faced east providing a splendid view of the sunrise. The staff at the restaurant at poolside (and the food) were outstanding. Even after dining there almost every evening, we still looked forward to returning every night to sit with a breeze, some music and small bites for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING AMAZING Thumbs WAY up”
Reviews.Author: mvnbjv
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 4 days! This hotel is BEAUTIFUL!! We booked a suite on the 4th floor. Our view was AMAZING! The staff at the hotel were very knowledgeable and helpful. It was very accessible to the bus which we rode to Old San Juan. This is a MUST if u plan on staying in Condado! The infinity pools were great, the beach was WONDERFUL! I have nothing bad to say abt this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...not the best service!”
Reviews.Author: jenicajoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha for 9 days in July '11. This hotel is located in the heart of the Condado area. There are nearby conveniences such as: donut shops, Walgreens, grocery stores, restaurants, souvenir shops, and you can always catch a taxi. If you are going to stay at this resort, you MUST reserve an ocean view room. It is well worth your money. The hotel is beautifully decorated with a very chic modern feel. The hotel staff was very friendly, but a bit slow. We had to ask for extra towels, robes, etc numerous times and even had to go to the front desk twice after waiting 45 mins on two different occasions. The fitness center, restaurants, and pools were great, but I noticed people coming into the resort and swimming area who were not guests of the hotel. I just wish they were a little more exclusive. We absolutely LOVED Puerto Rico, but we will probably try a different and more exclusive resort the next time we visit. Nobody wins anything at the Casino...don't waste your money. I wouldn't recommend this resort to couples who are looking for an exclusive, quiet, and romantic resort. I think this resort is great for familes and friends. My husband and I travel quite a bit, and I have to say that we would definitely go back to Puerto Rico and this resort with friends and family (but not on a couples trip). Happy Traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Directly on the Beach, beware of Expensive Resort Fee's!”
Reviews.Author: kovacicn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference at the Convention Center. On first arrival the building has some exterior issues. The paint is rusted on many of the sides and the rain has chipped away many areas. The lobby and grounds are on the whole ever nice. The restaurant on the lobby level is good, I had the hanger steak with mango salsa and was very pleased. The pool and hot tub are well designed and the walk to the beach is about 100 feet. The water from the Ocean was warm and the hotel did a good job keeping the beach around the hotel in good order. The BEACH IS AWESOME, and if this was all I was looking for it would be a great hotel. The rooms left much to desire. I had a suite room facing the city, and if I was to do it again I would ask for one facing the ocean. The furniture in the room was very uncomfortable. The tile on the main floor and in the bathroom was dirty and unkeep. Even after a few cleanings it was not clean, and the table in the main area was dirty when I checked in. The bed was the only bright spot. It was amazingly comfortable, the sheets, pillows and mattress where perfect. One side note, be careful of the resort fee. IT WAS 30 dollars a day, plus a high tax rate and you can add an additional 60 dollars a night to your bill. If you rented a car add an additional 20 dollars for parking and you have 80 bucks a night in random fees!

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Jcooperpvb
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 3:30. Surprised to find dried blood splatter on the bathroom floor. We were unable to change to a comparable room but the front desk manager said the floor could be cleaned right away. So, we asked them to do so and bring sheets for the sofa bed while they are at it. So, we go down to the pool for two hours only to return to the blood still on the floor. Finally, get sheets an hour later. By this time it's our daughter's bedtime so we raided a housekeeping cart and cleaned the blood ourselves. One star is a generous rating for this self-catering hotel.

Reviews.Title: “its was bad”
Reviews.Author: omar f
Reviews.Content: it was horrible im from mexico i never meet sombody like the man of service at the beach i never gone forget his name, is luis and he supouse to be the supervisor i hate his the treatment please do someting i never gone recomended the hotel to nobody

Reviews.Title: “Ashantia”
Reviews.Author: Ashantia123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the La Concha for the weekend of Oct. 13th - Oct. 17th. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and modern, I usually don't go all out on hotel rooms but it was well worth every penny. The staff was polite and helpful, we got there hours before check-in time but they put us in a room right away, the next day they called and found the cheapest place to rent a car they even gave written direction to attraction and the numbers of the buses to take all those things were very helpful because some of the local are not very friendly.The hotel was in a good location to many restaurants and shop. My husband and I are already planning our next trip to San Juan and we will without a second thought stay at the La Concha again. Hint : Rent a car the tours are kind of expensive and gitting around in a cab can add up to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service!”
Reviews.Author: Arielle M
Reviews.Content: I am usually not one to write reviews on hotels, but in this case it was a must! I recently returned from a 4 night stay at La Concha, and it was fabulous! We were greeted as we pulled up by the doormen, who were all great! Especially Felix and Victor, who greeted us everytime we headed out each day. Felix gave everyone high fives and made you feel like he has known you for years! They gave us great suggestions which resturants and places to check out. We got a ocean-view room with two beds (there were 4 of us) and although the room was not huge, we had plenty of room for for stuff. I would suggest spending the extra money for the ocean view, it was such a pretty view! The room and bathroom were very clean and looked fairly updated. We spent most of our time by the ocean, the hotel does provide lounge chairs and towels for all guests. The pools are a bit small, but very nice as well and never seemed super crowded. We did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants, but did hear that the food was little pricey, but good. The hotel is located in a great area (for walking and driving). Right across the street there are several small places to eat, although we walked a bit up the street for dinner. Ropa Vieja Grill was really nice and had a good menu for people who wanted to try the local dishes, as well as for "picky eaters". Old San Juan also has some great places to eat. We had a great meal at the Parrot Club on our last night there. $30 for an app, dinner and dessert! Can't beat that. Although we did do alot of walking, I would suggest to rent a car. We spent about $150 for the car for the days we were there and it was well worth it! We were able to explore the area, without paying tons for taxis. The are several tour groups that charge for trips to the Bacardi Factory and the Rainforest. Stay away from these groups, they are a rip off! The Bacardi Factory is free to get into, you get a guided tour and 2 free drink tickets! The Rainforest (which is a must to see) is $3 to enter. You can take your own car up and explore, everything is marked and very easy to find. Overall, our trip to Puerto Rico was awesome! I would defintely return and stay at La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: TAINA1983
Reviews.Content: Me and 4 girlfriends stayed in La Cocha Hotel for the weekend of Oct. 14th - Oct. 17th. The hotel is beautiful, clean and modern. The hotel staff are very nice and friendly and willing to accommodate you in every way possible. The rooms were nice and clean. The pool was awesome and was open all night. The bar in the main lobby was great and was open 24hrs. The strawberry or Parcha Mojitos were GREAT! a must have. The food and drinks are a bit overpriced which is typical for a Hotel of that caliber and area, but nonetheless very tasty. The hotel is only 10 minutes away via taxi to Old San Juan and close to many shops and restaurants. When I return to beautiful San Juan I will stay at La Concha. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Asa17
Reviews.Content: I returned home yesterday after spending 4 wonderful days at La Concha. I absolutely love this resort. The hotel staff were friendly especially Carlos and Felix they were suberb. The resort is lovely close to many restaurants and shops. I would definitely come back and stay longer. I am very glad I chose this resort. We were going to stay at the Marriott which is a few blocks away but are in the midst of reconstruction. We walked over there but didnt feel any ambiance. Maybe that will change once everything isdone. La Concha Is a very hip and vibrant place. Yes it costs a little more but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: TLunedi
Reviews.Content: Our trip to San Juan Puerto Rico was chosen only one day before traveling. We had planned to travel to Puerto Vallarta but a hurricane changed our plans. My three criteria for a good hotel is SERVICE, convenience and comfort. This hotel provided all three at a decent price point. The hotel was very welcoming even though they did not have the king room that we had requested. The beds were very comfortable even though the hotel seemed a bit dated. I was disappointed that our room came with a 12 inch "balcony". The highlight of our stay was the beach/pool waiter, Ruben. He was one of the first employees that we met. He was very friendly and was a wealth of enthusiastic tourist information. All of his recommendations were spot-on. He also took great care of us while we were at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A swanky splurge well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Leesh11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha with my sister in law and friend for 5 nights in October in an ocean view room to celebrate my friends upcoming wedding. We booked our trip through Ruth DeMuth (tripguy travel agency) and everything went smooth. Right after landing we were taken to the hotel and check in was a breeze. The lobby in La Concha is crisp white, clean, swanky atmosphere with house music at night. Maria is conceierge was very helpful with recommendations on where to eat nearby. For walking distance I recommend the following places we checked out: Peruiccan (delicious Peruvian cuisine) , waiters (reasonably priced and casual atmosphere bar food and also light fare), lost cafe (delish delish delish!!! Everything is good breakfast and lunch). Our room was nice and clean but based off of other reviews, I went ahead and called each morning to request clean linens and towels because a lot of people were saying that if you don't, housekeeping won't come each day. I didn't chance it I just called and never had a problem. The best thing about our room was the view. I would say if you are going to stay here to definately get an ocean view took because it is so beautiful and you can hear the waves as you sleep. Amazing. One thing about the rooms : no stationary or pens. Really? For that price? And the shower has just a half glass door no biggie if you are traveling with your man or comfortable around eachother like we are but if you are modest be advised. The drinks in the lobby are pricey but we are used to it the prices are similar in LA. Also they were renovating the bar while we were there so we didn't get the full lobby experience but on Friday and sat they had a dj, fun ambience and you can also drink and hang out outside plenty of couches and cushions. The perla has a nice bar upstairs and we had a drink there as well very nice fancy place to eat. Tapas at solera also very good! I loved the infinity pools although we didn't spend that much time at the pool and there are two decent sized hot tubs. The beach by the hotel is very nice! Felix the bellboy was very sweet ad greeted us each morning with a high five and something nice to say. Taxis from this hotel to old san Juan are $15 so plan your day accordingly so you aren't wasting $$ going back and forth. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel and felt like it was money well spent. A little bit of a splurge but when you are on vacation you want to pamper yourself! Everyone we met was very nice who worked here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: binsu16
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during hurricane season for a quick getaway. We had a long wait for check in and we were so excited to see our room. Only to be disappointed, the door would fling open if we didn't keep the deadbolt on, the furniture is dirty and bathroom didn't work. We called down and they basically told us they'd have maintenance to take a look at the issue. I don't think anyone ever came and we just dealt with it. So we went about our day and wanted to get to the pools/ beach area. But there was no staff during the middle of the day to help with beach chairs and the furniture outside was filthy. The one saving grace of the hotel is the close proxminety to the beach. Overall it was a nice stay because we're not that picky but they do need some improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Great week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jfarriba
Reviews.Content: Greatly enjoyed our stay at La Concha. Top of the line Mariott property in a great location in Condado Near airport, and approximately midway between Isla Verde and Old San Juan. Staff very friendly and accomodating. Feliz working the arrival area brought enthusiasm each day and did a great job. Reuben Espezua, working the pool area, did an excellent job and was helpful with local information.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha - What a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Natties
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a great hotel! Another plus is that it's 15 minutes from the airport. All of the staff were extremely accommodating (Felix, Eduardo to name a few) and the hotel was clean and very modern. At check-in everyone was very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is ideal because it's on Ashford Ave. which is a main drag with tons of eating options, Walgreens, and shopping within walking distance. We felt safe walking the streets outside of the La Concha. There is a strong foot police presence. We saw the same few homeless people walking the streets each day pandhandling, but that was the only downfall. Since the breakfast at the Italian restaurant in the La Concha and the a la carte breakfast option in the lobby are both expensive it was nice to be able to walk to Dunkin Donuts, the Lost Coffee Shop, or eat in the room (cereal/milk from Walgreens). We ate breakfast at the Italian restaurant in the hotel twice, and although it was delicious!... it was around $20 per person. For lunch and dinner we recommend these surrounding restaurants: The Greenhouse, JAM Bistro and Rum Bar !!!! (so good!! great atmosphere, and 50% your bill on Mondays- be sure to make a reservation), the Punk Burger Bar (behind Lost Cafe), the Pure & Natural Cafe (great healthy wraps, salads, juices and smoothies), and the Old Harbor Brewery in Old San Juan. The 3 pools at the La Concha are all very nice. Fresh towels and iced lemon water were always available at the pool that we went to each day (the Tower Suites Adult Infinity Pool). It was a very quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The beach is just a few steps down from the Tower Suites Adult Pool and there is a restroom at the pool (which is a nice convenience). The only drawback of the Tower Suites Adult Pool is that it does not get sun after lunchtime (at least the chairs are all shaded after this time of day). That's when I would head to the beach for more sun. The beach area has plentiful lounge chairs and umbrellas (you can always get a chair). The ocean at the hotel is rough - it's not calm, still water. The beach is not little kid friendly. This hotel is more for adults, it does not seem like a setting for a family vacation if you have very young kids (not much to entertain the kids with and the pools are all small). The casino was very nice and clean (non-smoking). Our room was great, and it was clean. We had the Partial Ocean View Suite in the Tower Suites (with balcony). These rooms overlook the rooftops of other buildings and you get to see the ocean, too. It was nice having dishes, silverware, sink, coffeemaker, fridge/freezer, microwave, etc! Great for keeping bottled water handy and storing leftovers from our meals to eat later on. Only complaints: The air conditioning unit constantly shut on and off to keep the room temp set. While the room was never humid and was always nicely cooled, the noise of the air turning on and off woke me up a lot at night. Maybe I am a light sleeper? Oh and...people in PR party! On Tuesday night there was a party in another club/bar building nearby that kept us up until 3am with the loudest music. Although it kept us up we got a good laugh out of it since we were on vacation and did not have to wake up early. We don't recommend eating in the few eating spots DIRECTLY across from the hotel driveway. Venture down the street a bit (make a left out of the hotel and you will find tons of options, including the ones I mentioned above).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience! Wonderful place to stay overall!”
Reviews.Author: Peggymd
Reviews.Content: As soon as we pulled our car in from a long drive we were immediately greeted and welcomed at our car! They assisted with our luggage and we felt as though we were immediately going to like our stay and without a doubt we did! The check in was also friendly efficient and felt very personal. We were escorted to our rooms with our luggage. On our way to our room we were given information about the pool and where to eat as well as other information about LaConcha. Our room was impressive! The room was very clean and well done. The ocean view speaks for itself! There are 3 places to eat. As we arrived late and tired we ate at the poolside grill which to our surprise was still open. The food and service were great! The next evening we ate at Perla. Again very impressive decor excellent service and great food! The pools were very clean and beautiful! Drinks were served poolside again providing excellent service ! The beach was very clean and enjoyable. All lounging equipment was kept very clean and orderly. We even received assistance beachside as the attendant put our towels on our lounge chairs for us! Drinks were also served and available beachside! Overall it was truly an awesome experience! We really hated to leave! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel w/ a Miami vibe”
Reviews.Author: weluv2explore
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel immediately, it was just what we were looking for. The lobby was gorgeous, the concierge and desk staff was very friendly. We requested a higher level floor as we read it could get noisy at night. Our 7th floor o/v room was very nice, we loved the shower. We arrived to a complimentary bottle of wine, but no wine key and no one had one??? But wine was on the menu. Anyway, we bought one at Walgreen's a few blocks down(we needed to buy wine to take onto the cruise we were taking the next day anyway). We had lunch at the pool upon arrival, nothing special, $14 for a chicken and cheese(that's it as far as toppings and sides) quesadilla, $9 for chips and guacamole(the chips were good) and $10.50 for a mojito. Service was really slow at the pool, no one was in a hurry to do anything and could care less. We ran into this many times in San Juan. I can understand being slow as long as you acknowledge me and communicate with me. This was the only time we ate at the hotel( and we were told by the very nice bartender inside the hotel from New York that the owners are "foodies" and the quesadilla was amazing...I come from a foodie town, Columbus, OH, and that was the most bland one I've ever had. Anyway back to the rest of the hotel, we had a lot of fun gambling, hanging out @ the pool/beach and bar. We used the gym the next morning, it was very nice. I would definitely stay here again, we just wouldn't eat here. We had reservations @ La Perla, but cancelled. We had a great light breakfast the next morning @ Picachos, a few blocks down. A great dinner @ St. Germain in Old San Juan and a great lunch the next day @ Ropa Vieja down the street. And great coffee drinks @ Caficultura.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, not the luxury I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen S
Reviews.Content: The La concha hotel is a very nice place to stay. Once you get the suite tower, you recognize that it's a refurbished Embassy Suites, without the great breakfast. The suite room was spacious, perfect for a couple and a teenager. We had a partial ocean view and got exactly what we paid for. Nothing is included in the price. The breakfast area, Aromas, is in the lobby and quite expensive for coffee and breakfast. We ended going across the street to the Dunkin donuts and buying coffee and breakfast sandwhiches at a much cheaper price. The rooms have in room coffee, but the individual cup machines. We loved having the kitchenette and refrigerator, the teenager had a use of the microwave for late night snacks. The bathroom decor is modern and glass. The strange thing is the shower is glassed in, so bedroom partners can see you shower. Thus, mom had to leave the area when the teenage son showered. You can see everything, even though the glass is frosted. The hotel staff was very nice, and Victor, the concierge, was excellent. He made reservations for us, drew maps, and looked up any information we asked for. The business center was available for computer use and ticket printing. The pool area was great, the suite tower had its own pool and beach area. There is a public beach next door, can get busy on weekends, but it wasn't crowded and didn't bother us. There was a wedding on Saturday night, that got a little loud for awhile, but didn't last late at all. We only walked through the casino, we aren't gamblers. You can tell the owners have merged two neighboring hotels into one property. It was nice that the little kids had their own are and pool. We liked having our own pool area at the suite tower next to the beach. There is a Walgreens down the street that has anything you might need, including some food and drink items. I had anticipated that this would be the nicest place I've ever stayed, but it wasn't. If a breakfast was included, it would've been so much nicer. There is a continental breakfast in some packages. The parking garage was fine, we self-parked each day, only had trouble with the tickets at times, but the staff was very accomodating to validate each ticket.

Reviews.Title: “All you want for an outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: WorkPlayAndPlayWork
Reviews.Content: La Concha consistently delivers an outstanding experience. During multiple stays, both for business and pleasure, we have enjoyed all the hotel has to offer and it has never disappointed. La Concha kicks off your stay with stunning architecture and ambiance in the highly desirable and trendy Condado beach area. But La Concha is not just about the pretty looks, it also offers excellent service and carefully curated on site amenities, as well as full Concierge services, to help you make the most of your stay in Puerto Rico A particular favorite at the hotel is the Ocean Lounge. As frequent (worldwide) Marriott guests, we rate this concierge lounge in the top 10 both for looks and location and Number One in service. The Ocean Lounge staff is the best we have had the pleasure of meeting, although Michael, Pablo and Pamela are our favorites (hi guys!), everyone at the lounge is just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down best hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Anitini
Reviews.Content: I've visited San Juan several times in the past year and highly recommend La Concha. I just returned from a two night stay from a weekend birthday celebration. The concierge is incredibly helpful; helped my boyfriend put together a surprise gift of flowers,cake and wine together upon entering the room and even asked if we wanted to be upgraded to a suite! The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day, pools are open 24/7 and service is wonderful. Having stayed at the Ritz and San Juan Hotel and Casino previously, I can confidently say that La Concha beats the "best". They provide an excellent combination of customer service while giving you plenty of space and privacy. There are plenty of small shops on the street parallel to the beach that include good local food restaurants, boutique shops, a walgreens and a dunkin donuts. Rooms are very clean and modern and offer a great room service menu. I could go on forever about this hotel. All in all, if you're looking for a great, modern hotel on the beach with great customer service while not being suffocated go with La Concha...it's the BEST!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in San Juan!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkWendy29
Reviews.Content: We went to the La Concha Resort in July 2011 for our 1st wedding anniversary and it was so fabulous, that we had to go back again. The atmosphere has an urban retro feel to it. The lobby is spacious and luxurious with beautiful furniture that looks like a remake of the 70's, only more chic. The service is great, the staff was very hospitable.The hotel is low key by day, but alive night with great music to sit at the bar and hang out. Feliz Perez, staff attendant, is filled w/energy, he is so friendly and inviting. My husband and I would always look for him every time we left and return to hotel, because he made us feel like we knew him forever. If you need to know about the area, make sure you ask Jose Carlos, he knows a lot about the area. We like the hotel is located right on the beach, and it is clean and the staff is very courteous. Though the water is rough, you can still swim, its not that bad.
