The rooms are really beautiful and spacious, just make sure, if you stay with city view, that you get a room on the above the 6flr, it can get noisy, especially if you are looking to sleep in.Even though the hotel is respectful of all ages, I would say that hotel more suited for adults than kids. There are lots of places to eat outside the hotel, recommend that you eat outside b/c it can b quite expensive to eat @ hotel. Great place to stay fun and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Feliz Perez, the bellhop, ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: BostonJoJo
Reviews.Content: This hotel far exceeded our expectations. The view from our room was breathtaking. The room was clean and a good size with flat screen TV, mini fridge for us to use, stereo system, and more. The hotel is modern, quiet by day, fun and energetic by night. The casino is a perfect size with reasonable minimum bets. There are 4 pools and a great beach. The fitness center has lots of equipment including treadmills (4), stairmasters, elipticals, weights and nautilus machines---overlooking the ocean! We ate at the breakfast buffet---not Las Vegas, but good food and decent selection. But by far, the staff is the most polite and accomodating we've come across in our travels. Felix Perez, the super star bell hop was ultra friendly and jovial every time we saw him. The maid service was excellent. We can't say enough about the staff. There were lots of families, couples, and some young kids. Nice mix of people. Renting a car for 5 people was cheaper to go to the rain forest and bio bays than using the tourist packages. Rain forest was amazing. Kayaking in the bio bay at night was really cool but not as "luminescent" as we were led to believe. Old San Juan--shops and restaurants--was fun to visit.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Meadow, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “photos are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Lis N
Reviews.Content: the restaurant in the all the pictures is beautiful, but the rest of the resort was too modern. water was very rough and not the gorgeous serene blue one would expect. the rooms themselves were very pretty and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mercado978
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and staff!!! I was here with my sisters, we had a suite great view and bed was great pillow was great!Of course I check the bed for bugs since I had a bad experience in Miami once you have a bad experience you will learn to check before you unloading your things. If you like music, hanging out just party all night this is your spot. For couples at night time was really nice, pool open all night!!!very romantic I thought!!!! Please is beautiful!!! Staff Ricardo Angel Jose Carlos need any information ask for them they know the hot spots!!!! I will go again hopefully soon!!!! One thing the service was good but to get the check back takes a tad bit long.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: emma_wp
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel, sitting right on the beach, great views, large rooms with a lot of cooking ware. We stayed in the newer building, which is said to be better than the old one, with larger space and balcony for each room. There are 3 pools in the hotel, 2 facing the ocean. There are also a lot of amenities, such as gym, club, and a casino attached to the hotel. The area is also very good, a lot of restaurants, shops, and bars, easy to get to the highway, 15 mins drive to the airport. The only thing I am not very happy about the hotel is that the a/c fan in the room is very noisy and the walls seem to be thin so that I can hear the sounds from my neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LLACJamaica
Reviews.Content: Amazing view. Amazing food. Amazing customer service. The pools are open 24/7 and the bar and restaurants are open late. We were offered an upgrade, had our dinner reservations made and taken care of. Great shopping and access to Old San Juan, Downtown San Juan and major airports. Bilingual and amazingly friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful one night stay”
Reviews.Author: kkelly1003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the LaConcha Resort on our first day back to the Island. I must say that I am very impressed with the staff, management overall amenities of this hotel. We DID NOT want to leave. The room was very clean, the bed sheets were comfortable as was the bed. The bathroom was extremely polished. I mean I checked inside the closets, baseboards, and I could not find a drop of dust or dirt. The beach was very nice and clean - no overcrowding just sunbathing and gawking at the beautiful blue water. The staff at the Grill were all awesome and the food was great (try the sliders and shrimp lo mein). The drinks were to die for!!!! I even had a special birthday drink made for me only - too cute!! Inside LaConcha's lobby reminds you of a a combination of an Asian garden that meets modern taste and a bit of contemporary style. ALL of the bars were fully staffed and there was no wait time at all. The staff even remembered us the next morning/afternoon before we checked (did I mention we had a late check-out) and was able to enjoy the beach and pools before checking-out. The casino was nice...my Mom's favorite place! Overall LaConcha and Condado rocks!! Again, we were only there for an overnight stay and enjoyed it more than we did at another hotel on the other side of the Island. Go LaConcha!!!! Whooooo hooo!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MaybeMoreNextTime
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days here - my fifth time in San Juan and first time at La Choncha. The property and location are excellent. We had an oceanfront tower suite: Incredible view, nice big bathroom with whirlpool, very modern kitchenette in the room and lots of space. Pros: Best location, nice casino, superb housekeeping service, fast valet parking, nice (but expensive) restaurants in the hotel Cons: Uneven experience with staff - some great, some indifferent. Bathroom is big and nice, but the frosted glass between the shower and the bedroom is a bit wierd. I would definitely stay here again, no question. That said, the Condado section of town seemed to be in decline a bit - less crowded and a little bit more "gritty" than it has been in the past...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: N S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay here after hearing multiple glowing recommendations from friends. The hotel is in a great location where you can walk to local restaurants and have access to the beach. We had an ocean view room and the view was beautiful. There are several pools that were easily accessible and central to the hotel. The staff at every level were friendly and helpful from the bellmen to the bar. The food and drinks were a little pricey but we were completely satisified. The only thing I would say is that the elevators are not air conditioned so riding to the top floors in the heat was a little uncomfortable. Otherwise you cannot go wrong with a stay here on your next trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at La concha was great! We got a free upgrade to a gorgeous suite (just ask!) and we were always treated with kindness. Beds were clean and comfy - king size with awesome down comforters. All of the staff were always helpful with great suggestions for dining/going out options! Whenever we needed a taxi - Felix was our man! (very polite and prompt!) Also we rented a car for the day (under $30) to go to the rainforest and the la concha staff (alejanhandra) made it easy - set up the rental, a ride to the rental office and gave us towels and directions with a map for easy access! The suite was clean, tidy and had a great view of the ocean. The maid even did our breakfast dishes! Brock at the pool was fast with our lunch/drink orders and served with a smile. I got the feeling that everyone enjoyed working at this resort! All staff spoke english and spanish fluently and were impressed and encouraging for us to try out our poor spanish! Great location with numerous reataurants, bars, parks and a mini mart all within walking distance. I would recommend the stay for anyone! It was a little more expensive than what I would normally pay for a hotel - but I think that it was well worth it! ENJOY YOUR TRIP!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty, and the front desk doesn't care!”
Reviews.Author: ericnpsl
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 nights in this hotel. My room smelled like a dirty gym shoe. I asked them to clean my room. They would not. So I mopped my own floor, and the towel was black afterwards. The cushions on the couch smelled and made my face itch after a nap. The ice machines in some suites don't work. The suite tower had only 1 working elevator while we were there, so be prepared to wait a long time to get up and down. Black fuzzy junk was hanging from the valence over the curtains. The phones don't work in the suite tower on upper floors. Everyday they told me they would bring towels, clean my room, and fix the whirlpool jets in my upgraded ocean front suite. They did not. No one at the front desk cares about anything you ask for, or how long you wait in line while other people are complaining. On my last night I told them I was tired of them saying they would fix things because I was leaving the next day. So they took $90 off my bill. I told them I didn't want the money. This was my only big vacation for the year. I just wanted a clean working room. I just wanted a happy fun vacation. Sadly, they just did not care! They gave my friends 1000 bonus Marriott points for the same issues. We also tried getting a Bloody Mary one day around 11:00am. Each bar sent us to the next because the bar tenders at each location said that another bar makes them. Finally Voga (the restaurant they turn into a cafeteria in the morning) was able to make one for us. We waited in the lobby with the hostess for at least 30 minutes while they made two drinks. Fortunately for the hostess, we learned she just got an internship next year with Marriott in Orlando or California where she will learn how a real hotel operates. We never tried again after spending nearly an hour total to get a Bloody Mary on a vacation. If you can get past the dirty facilities, they built a beautiful hotel on the beach. If the staff cared, it has the potential of being a great place to stay. The only redeeming quality the hotel has is the concierge desk. Four members of the staff set us up on amazing excursions everyday all over the island. If you do choose this hotel, a real Marriott hotel is just down the beach. The staff there is very friendly! Their poolside bar service is amazing. They are very helpful, and will help you find local restaurants! You can also get towels for your room by the pools. Remember, you will need to find your own towels on the island if you plan to take a shower, or clean up the dirt on the floors. Good luck in making your decision. This hotel is a beautiful property in a great location, but I imagine there might be other great properties nearby. If you only take one or two big vacations a year, be careful. I just wish I didn't come back from vacation with this experience. I had an amazing trip, and I loved Puerto Rico. But I left with a bad feeling for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: ktichenor1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here September 15th-20th. From the time we stepped out of the taxi onto the property, to the time we were leaving all the staff were courteous, happy, and inviting towards us. Every morning when we'd leave for an adventure, staff at the front desk would wave and ask us what we were up to for the day and were very enthusastic. Louise, who unfortunely we didn't get to see on our stay, was able to book all our day outings for us which was such an amazing help for us, which included the agenda for the week, directions for each place and found a very affordable car rental place nearby. PERLA PERLA PERLA. I would highly recommend everyone eat a meal at the restaurant Perla at the hotel. Just the atmosphere alone is amazing. All the waitstaff was very kind and friendly. The wine list was extensive, there was something for everyone. The ocean view room was breathtaking, it was amazing to wake up to every morning. Honestly, the only negative comment I can make about this hotel is the drink vending machine did not work on our floor and many others. You had to go down to the gift shop and purchase drinks if you wanted one. So again, I can't recommend this hotel enough. If I ever come back, which I hope I do, La Concha will be the only place I stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well done La concha...”
Reviews.Author: RussJ35
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at La Concha Resort this past weekend. Let me start of by saying it's a very nice place to spend your time while in Puerto Rico. The staff was second to none, very helpful and very nice, service with a smile. The grounds are well kept and very clean, the only downside i think you may find with the grounds are the pools are kinda small for the size of the hotel. there's great nightlife in the lobby of the hotel, really cool chic crowd. Once you leave the resort there are many choices for you to eat and drink, everything is within walking distance, there's no need to take a cab. The area is very safe at night and during the day. There's also a walgreens very close by. You can't go wrong if you choose this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mrpbmet
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one week at La Concha and it was worth every penny. The staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is right on the beach and minutes away from Old San Juan. There are alot of restaurant options on the strip. My only complaint was with the housekeeping. The room was not vacuumed. On one occasion the garbage was not changed. Towels were not replenished for a number of days. Overall, there is more of an upside to this hotel because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great views, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: recuerdeme
Reviews.Content: I loved just about everything about La Concha. Haven travelled to Puerto rico many times and stayed at many hotels and apartments I have to say I've finally found a "home" in La Concha. The hotel itself is beautful, I got a room with a lovely view of the beach. The service and staff is great and friendly. And of course it is int he heart of Condado with plenty of restaurants, clubs, bars and shopping around.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of City View Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dpoli
Reviews.Content: Pros: The staff, most notably Pablo in the Ocean Lounge. I travelled with my disabled mother,and he went above and beyond to accomodate our every need. Perla--absolute perfection. The pools and beach --superb--as well as the staff serving food and beverages ! Room 413--ocean front , 2 queen bedded room with shower that could accomodate someone with a handicap( i.e no tub) Cons: The city view suites face the street. The first night in suite 873, we were awakened by party goers at 3:30AM. We looked out and saw patrons streaming out of the bar across the street and what looked like a brawl. The noise went on all night The suite had the equipment to prepare a light meal, but nothing to clean up with--no paper towels, dish soap, sponges, or towels. Also lacking in the suite was a phone book, paper or pad, extra tissues or toilet paper. An oversight, perhaps? Voga--we ate dinner the night of a power outtage. We understand that that they were running on generators. We waited over 1 hour for our food to arrive, and when my daughter removed the head of her prawn, it oozed a red substance that looked like blood--very un -appetizing. Needless to say, we did not eat our meals. The staff did send up a lemon chicken dinner that was inedible. We assumed that the service and food issues at Voga was just due to the power outtage. So, like fools, we went there the following morning for breakfast . ( We are had access to the Ocean Lounge but wanted something different). Once again, service was poor and the food fair. To wait 45 minutes for eggs benedict and a fruit plate is ridiculous. The staff at this property is what sets it apart from others. The location is Ok. My family and I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Stole My Heart.”
Reviews.Author: rebecca s
Reviews.Content: Sleek. Chic. Sexy. Modern. Lush. Gorgeous. Swank. Perfection. We had an absolutely fantastic stay at La Concha for the last two nights of our 5 night visit to Puerto Rico. When our group of four arrived we were told that they could not guarantee us a room with two queen size beds and oceanfront view which was our original hope. Booking through orbitz is always a gamble, but we knew that this was where we wanted to end our trip and so we took the risk. What we ended up getting was even better than we ever could have expected. We were given a city view corner suite with two queen size beds, a full living room, and galley kitchen, perfect for storing late night empanadas. In a hotel with views as spectacular as this, forfeiting the ocean view was a small price to pay as we spent limited time in the room as it was. The hotel grounds are absolutely phenomenal, every floor has a balcony next to the elevator offering views of the ocean, every floor is also built in a circular fashion that leaves the center agape with views of the pond filled atrium below. The resort boasts 3 pool areas, all three have infinity pools with two facing the ocean and one being "adult only". There are two hidden hot tubs, first come first serve beach cabanas, and a number of outdoor areas of plush white couches where you can lay out in comfort with a good book or just enjoy the sounds of the ocean. Each level of the main garden and pool space offers outdoor couches, perfectly kept landscaping, and the sweet sounds of running water. Whoever designed this hotel kept in mind that running water equals relaxation and for that, there are streams, fountains, and pool jets at every turn; in conjunction with the ambient house music, this was paradise. Lush gardens surround the pool area off to the side of the hotel lobby where you will find Solera, the poolside bar and grill that delivers to you and your party without question. You order...they find you, no questions asked. I can't comment on the food being too overpriced as a negative, this is a pricey hotel with great service, I was on vacation and was willing to treat myself to expensive cocktails. I knew what I was getting myself into and took full advantage of what each of our resorts offered. The service was great, the guys handing out towels at the pool were the sweetest things. Young and handsome, willing to share the secret nightlife spots, and asking questions about city life...clearly we wanted to switch lives because I could find myself being very happy in the islands for the rest of my life; conversely it looked like they were trying to get out. Bellmen were equally friendly helping with our suitcases at every turn and calling taxis only after asking where we were off to and offering their suggestions on what to see. I don't think I saw one person working at this resort without a smile on their face. A huge plus for this hotel and their accommodating staff was our late afternoon flight and our inquiring about a late check out. We had stopped by the concierge on our last night and were told that we would only be given until 1pm to check out of the rooms but that we could leave our luggage on site to use their facilities. They then told us to call back in the morning in the event that there were any room cancellations and that they would try to make arrangements for us then. We were concerned about having a shower to use before getting on the flight home, sitting for 4 hours smelling like chlorine and salt was not going to make for happy travelers miserably heading back home from an otherwise wonderful vacation. Calling the morning of our departure they told us that we could have access to the room until 3pm for no additional charge. This was absolutely more than we could ever have asked of them, and a sign that the staff will go above and beyond to ensure their customer's satisfaction. My only major issue with the hotel as has been mentioned by other reviewers was housekeeping. I understand hotels being eco-friendly with air conditioners that turn off when doors are open, or only changing the sheets every third day unless requested more frequently. But why they couldn't change and replenish towels each day was a little upsetting. All in all, this was a terrific experience. Service was great, room accommodations stellar, grounds were perfect. Pricey as it was, this is a great place to celebrate a special occasion or splurge for a little extra vacation satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great trendy contemporary hotel”
Reviews.Author: emrtes
Reviews.Content: The staff here is truly outstanding - the valet (Jonathan) remembered us every time we stopped by, even though we left the hotel to visit another part of the island for a few days. The property itself is great - very clean and very pretty. The beach is nice, a little dangerous for kids and anyone who is not used to rip tides. Great pools, great views, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Here Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: Slow_Pony
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1BR suite in early Sept 2011. Had a great ocean view. The Italian restaurant was beautiful but slow. I think they lost our order - took an hour to get our food. Hotel itself is immaculate and the staff is very friendly. The frosted glass bathroom was kind of freaky since it oped to the BR. Great location. An easy trip to the port. Really liked having other options close. Restaurant across the street (Angels something) served awesome $5 margaritas. Orazcos two blocks down offered a really good breakfast for $6 and it's a couple of doordown to a Walgreens to pick up any items you might need. Nice casino. Nothing like Vegas but a good selection of games and slots. Lobbybar staff was only place employees seemed a bit indifferent. Overall, we had a really nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic week in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl S
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to start with, that I never write a review, but I felt the need to as my husband and I had such a wonderful time 8/13-8/20. We went to take a break and visit the family. We pulled up to the hotel and what a wonderful site. The hotel is so beautiful! Everyone was so nice to us especially Victor and Caesar when we went out to get our car. They were so pleasant and made us feel so good, what wonderful people! We also had a great experience at the main pool with Omar taking care of us and our crew being so needy. I also have to mention Ovi that talked to me at the adult pool, when I just could not stop talking and he was so pleasant and just listened to me. The housekeeping was excellent! I would suggest a room on the ocean with the beach right in front of you. My husband and I sat on the balcony every night enjoying the beautiful ocean! Two of our friends are there right now because we loved it so much!

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN THE CARRIBEAN”
Reviews.Author: jeffandrews
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel. Stylish, elegant, fantastic pools, central to everything, fantastic food, amazing drinks. (Poolside service could be a tad faster but hey, its an island... the pace is slower). Got a great tour today by an incredibly helpful Carlos Garcia. He couldnt have been nicer providing us with info on local attractions and hotel amenities we didnt even know existed. I would hightly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: iheartshoes21
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at La Concha for 3 nights/4 days. We stayed in an ocean view room on the 5th floor. The view was amazing! The large windows overlooked the beach and ocean. Although it would have been nice to have a balcony the windows opened up so you could still feel the fresh air. The room was spacious, clean and had great storage. The bathroom shower was amazing! The rain shower head option was a nice treat. the ground of the hotel were all very modern and clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The food we ate via room service, the bar and by the pool was always delish. We had the chicken quesadilla's twice, they were very tasty! Can't complain about anything we had a great stay and would come back! www.stylemecheaply.com

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding wedding at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: IvyMan2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a destination wedding in San Juan this past August and it was an unbelievable event! Mostly thanks to the spectacular hospitality of La Concha hotel. We had a 45 room block and every one of our guests was more than delighted with the experience. We also hosted our cocktail reception in the Solera pool area and Fremiot took care of our every need - from the food, to the ambience, to the service! If you're planning an event there, I would specifically ask to have Fremiot handle it - trusting the person you're working with is the most nerve-wrecking part, and with him you definitely won't go wrong. Fridays also have a jazz ensemble play in the area so we got the extra perk of having live music. This hotel is great due to its close location to Old San Juan while still being in bustling Condado and access to beautiful beaches. Hands down, the perfect hotel for any international event.

Reviews.Title: “For the 21 and Over Crowd.”
Reviews.Author: Pawanpreetster
Reviews.Content: After reading tons of reviews on TripAdvisor, I finally settled on La Concha to be our residence while celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary during Labor Day weekend. We stayed in a 1BR suite in the Suite Tower with an ocean view. Though it sucks that you have to pay an extra $100-200 for the view, it is honestly worth it. I think my husband and I both spent at least 2 hours everyday just lounging around on our balcony, watching the waves! Plus, who doesn't like going to sleep to the sound of waves? One day we experienced mid-day rain and thundershowers, so we just sat on our balcony and watched the ocean and as the sun reappeared we headed back to the beach! The beach is long, white, and beautiful. The ocean is not tranquil, but the waves aren't so aggressive that you can't enjoy warm water, wade around, or 'ride the wave.' I especally loved that there was an "adult" pool facing the ocean and this pool didn't seem to have a closing time! We went into the pool 2 nights after enduring the humidity while walking around Old San Juan. It was so refreshing and fun! The majority of the people here were between the ages of 20-35. Definitely had a good-times, party vibe, but the beauty of the hotel is that if you're not there to party, you don't have to! There are enough pools to avoid the "Snooki's and Mike's," and the lobby did have a DJ on Thurs, Fri, and Saturday, but it doesn't turn into this raging club, as others have described! Also, the staff here is GREAT. I would definitely come here with my husband (while we're still young), girlfriends, and other couples. If I had kids I might consider a place that didn't have such a "South Beach" vibe to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- What you see online is what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Binibunch
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha with my girlfriends for the weekend, kinda last minute decision. Great choice!! The accomodations were immaculate. Felix greeted us upon our arrival and was the most friendliest of all. We were even upgraded to a suite free of charge!! The staff was pleasant for the most part. Very tight security on and off the premises, which was a plus. The bartenders could use some hospitality training though, not very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is located in the middle of everything and about 15 mins from old san juan (shopping/dining). We took the bus back and forth with no problem. Danny International (about 3 blocks down) has the best breakfast, large portions and very reasonable. It beats $27 for breakfast at the hotel. But steer away from the restaurants across the street from the hotel. Very convenient but the food was terrible!! Overall, I would definitely return to this property..No doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dominika D
Reviews.Content: I read a few reviews on her prior to going, and while some were amazing...others scared me! Well let me start by saying there is NOTHING to be afraid of! The hotel staff try very hard to make everyone happy and meet your every need. Victor, Ruddy, & Rebecca were our favorite people as they were amazing in tending to us and giving us great advice on what to see and where to go. When we arrived there was an issue in the room under us so because we were asked to move we got a free complementary breakfast...room service brought us everything we wanted. The food was okay...that is honestly the biggest complaint I had. Overall the hotel foom outside of room service was amazing as well, as were drinks (Pineapple mojito! :) One night while sitting at the bar my friend wanted a bag of chips and the store was closed, the bartender immediately brought her one. She felt like a superstar! :) We were there for a total of five nights, and were honestly very well taken care of. The room was awesome, and very clean. The property was gorgeous, and the main pool was definately a favorite. There are a lot of couples around and it's really a very romantic place, but if you go with friends you will not be disappointed either. Everything is well taken care of and it really feels like paradise! I highly recommend this hotel, and I would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific! Extradinario!”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at La Concha Hotel. From the time I step into the lobby I knew I was in for a good time. Service and courtesy was the order of the day. The room had a balcony or looking the Ashford Ave where all the business are located. There are rooms that overlook the ocean (oceanview rooms) however I was not complaining with 90 dollars per night which was a steal. The room a 50 inch LCD TV, living room, desk or computer desk kitchen with a two-burner stove, small fride microvave, small sink and safe deposit box. Beds were very comfortable and like the soft pillows. Internet acess free of charge. Other amenities included: Gym and the use of the swimming pools are 24 hours. There is small pool (one of the three different pools) over looking the beach, and the beach is within walking distance. Security is visible at all times. I am a local do not have to pay to stay at any hotel in the island of Puerto Rico, my family lives in this island, however for a change of pace, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Back again to greatness!”
Reviews.Author: Qilobaby
Reviews.Content: This is my second experience with La Concha and once again it was fabulous! This time I went with a group for a wedding and had a splendid time. They have added a new side that has suites, an adult pool, and a private lounge area. The private lounge area is an extra $35 a person so we had to skip that sorry, the food and drinks are already pricey at this place. But as usual we had a regular room (all oceanview) and all of the great staff that La Concha always has. I had some issues with my boyfriend flying in from NYC and the staff helped me arrange a taxi ride from 2.5 hrs away at 3am, boy they saved me and they were never rude, they found a solution with a smile, what more can you ask for. I didn't get to tour Puerto Rico this much this time as time was short and mainly taken up by wedding activites, but I would love to go back. I ate at the hotel a few times this trip, breakfast was ok and we had lite faire at the pool bar (burgers, drinks, quesidilla) the food was good. When I am in Condado this is where I am!

Reviews.Title: “Started off wrong, but made it right with an exceptional recovery....”
Reviews.Author: MotownTransplant
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Labor Day Week 2011 for an anniversary celebration. We initially booked a partial view suite and upon our arrival our room was not available due to an overbooked crowd. To make up for the miss, the Director of Guest Services, Jose Cepeda put for one night in a king sized room in the main hotel and then moved us over to an ocean-view suite for the remaining 5 nights at the resort. In addition to the inconvenience, he allowed us to eat at any of the resort restaurants on the house for the night. Our room was immaculate, the view was breathtaking and the service was top-notch. The resort has a wide array of choices of eateries and activities including the private pool, the beach facing the Atlantic Ocean the and the casino. The concierge was quite helpful in assisting me with renting a car and taking the local bus routes. Jose even gave us a good suggestion to visit Luquillo Beach. If you a going to San Juan, PR and would like to make it a special experience, I highly recommend LaConcha., I can assure you on our return, we will make another visit to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Bossy305
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from PR celebrating his birthday. The resort was beautiful and the stay was great overall. However, there are a few things that I would like to advise interested visitors on. 1. There is a $100.00 per night hold on your credit or debit card, as a security deposit (seems to be the norm for all hotels in PR) so be sure to bring extra means of spending. Luckily we came prepared. 2. The central air units are automatically set to blow on low with a fixed setting of 68 degrees that cannot be adjusted (hotel policy). We're just accustomed to a cooler room setting. 3. The hotel food at the resort as well as the food on the strip is disgusting. 4.The alcholic beverages are over priced and are weak. The lobby bartenders are the least pleasant staff throughout the entire hotel. Those minor issues are nothing compared to the excellent customer service rendered to match the beautiful atmosphere of The La Concha Resort. Shortly after checking in (appx 1am) we realized that our ac was blowing on fan mode and could not be adjusted. The concierge had a technican there within a matter of minutes. The pair worked diligently to fix the unit and although it took appx. 2 hours (a little before 3am) we were completely satisfied with the exception of the set temperature rule. The concierge service is amazing (they book the excursions for you COMPLIMENTARY!) Francisco is the best, he was also interested in knowing whether or not you enjoyed the excursions!!! Louise was great as well. Jose Rodriguez is also a wonderful manager, he was very accommodating. Kristina is very friendly also, she wore a different color flower in her hair everyday with a ring to match. Our room was an oceanfront that overlooked one of the four pools in the resort with the only pool that gave the very best view of the beach. The hotel has great beach space. CAUTION: There are several rocks in close range of the ocean. Watch your feet! The lobby had live dj's on Thurs. Fri. and Sat. nights. The updated modern look of the hotel was very nice, providing a mature feel as well as a fun young adult vibe. Despite rumors of a hurricane/storm hitting that weekend (9/9/11-9/12/11), the weather was beautiful! We had MAYBE 15 minutes of drizzle and heavy winds on Sat. evening. I must save the best for last. FELIX!!!!!!! Is by far the MOST AMAZING PERSON at the resort. His personality is so welcoming, he's so friendly and extremely grateful and appreciative. He's a very pleasant individual, we looked forward to walking out of the lobby and seeing him first thing in the morning. He went on vacation mid-way through our vacation but I'm glad that we got a chance to meet him. HOPE YOU ENJOYED YOUR VACATION FELIX. We'd definitely stay here again. FYI, rent a car, it cheaper. We blew at least $350.00-$400.00 on taxi services alone. Exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We did not stay here but we spent a lot of time at this resort...”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from my birthday celebration in Puerto Rico. We stayed at a condo near La Concha and spent a lot of time at the hotel. We celebrated my birthday at La Perla (see review on La Perla) as well as having visited the casino on a couple of occasions. We also had drinks in the hotel lobby on the night of my birthday. We would definitely recommend La Concha for people to stay at. First of all it is in a great location. It is a beautiful hotel, very modern and tastefully decorated. There is a lot of activity there and the casino is really good. We are not big gamblers but we loved playing the slots and Roulette there. Something else that we appreciated at La Concha is that they rent chairs to non guests. So you can enjoy a chair and an umbrella at their resort which is a nice plus. I can't say that the Marriott was as accomodating, in fact they were pretty rude. Another good thing is that the bus stop for Old San Juan is located right in front of La Concha, making it very convenient as well. Overall I would recommend La Concha as I feel that any guest would have a wonderful time there.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for my vacation”
Reviews.Author: nikkigfoster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Labor Day Weekend 2011 and it was perfect. The hotel customer service is exceptional. Everything was always clean and up to part. Since it was a holiday weekend there were many guests at the property and the hotel kept everything in order with the crowd. The pools are amazing. They are so tranquil and relaxing. I stayed there and the beach majority of my stay. I thoroughly enjoyed the relaxation. You can even get massages on the beach/by the pool. The pool service with Rogelio was the best! He was very efficient and super fast. I recommend you ask for him if you prefer food/beverage by the pool. There is a restaurant directly across the street from the hotel named ORALE GUEY and they have the best food on the strip. The meat is marinated well. We often ate there and it's very cheap. I'm getting hungry just thinking about the tacos!!! There is a Walgreens and some fast food in walking distance so you're always open to options for food and beverage. We purchased snacks and beverages for the room from Walgreen's as it is more economical during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “would not return”
Reviews.Author: thsNewYork
Reviews.Content: had to extend working vacation due to hurricane. would not recommend hotel. stayed in the towers. had corner room with king bed. the terrace, which could only be accessed from our room, had a window over looking it from the adjacent hotel room. we could see people inside, they could see us outside. i have never had a room with a terrace that was not private. the room was small, somewhat claustrophobic. there was a mirrored closet wall directly in front of bed, which fell off track and landed on my husbands foot. we called the hotel to let them know. it really could have badly hurt someone. the best was large but unattractive, the sound from people in the pool at all hours of the night wafted up to our room. it was the longest 36 hours of vacation. the immediate are was pretty seedy. definitely would not recommend and would not return. we checked in on a sunday and the lobby was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Well located. Good Beach.”
Reviews.Author: marion5501
Reviews.Content: My husband, 7 year old child, my father and his girlfriend and I all enjoyed the two separate pools (both on the smallish side, but never over filled), but the beach front was especially great. We had nice ocean views out our clean and comfortable room, that was definitely on the larger side. The mini bar was empty, but we filled it with our own needs. The pool-side food and drink service was nice (but added up). This is a nice, well run hotel in the center of tourist San Juan. I'd definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “great hotel beautiful view May 2010”
Reviews.Author: texasinsc
Reviews.Content: we and two other couples stayed at this hotel after a southern carribean cruise. the hotel was very modern and service was great. this was the beach hotel district with good restaurants and shops. the hotel had two great pools plus a private beach area. there were restaurants with easy walking distance and some specialized in the great seafood offered in San Juan. . this was a great location and close to the airport for easy transfer using cabs. the breakfast offered upstairs was very good and not pricy. our room had a great view of the ocean and beach area.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN PUERTO RICO,WILL BE BACK SOON”
Reviews.Author: juan h
Reviews.Content: Ever since this past weekend ,september 9 to the 12 ,every time the name of this hotel comes to my head,"'La Concha" ,a smile will come to my mouth; im a person that likes to travel,and i have been in hotels all over the world, united states,south america,europe,ect.. and i truly can say that this hotel has the best customer service i have seen,is located in a great area were you feel really secure,the facilities are really modern and more than extra clean,and the best part is the staff,everybody that works in this hotel,you can tell has a honest smile in there faces everytime they see you,from felix at the entrance,louise graulau and francisco at that check in desk,and the rest of the people working at the hotel.. thanks a lot to everyone,i will be back really soon,and recomend this hotel to every single of my friends.. also congratulations to the general manager of this hotel for having such a great instinc at that time to hire people to work in this place... Juan Pablo Hernandez

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in SJ”
Reviews.Author: JustinATL
Reviews.Content: La Concha is ideally situated between the resort-oriented Isla Verde neighborhood and the more tourist / cruise ship-oriented neighborhood of Old San Juan. The hotel has been restored back to its mid-century roots, and the lobby feels like a modern interpretation of a place you might see on Mad Men (Don Draper goes to PR?). Speaking of the lobby, the lobby bar is a gathering spot for both locals and tourists - there was DJ and a large crowd at the bar on most evenings. The hotel definitetly leans more toward singles, young couples and gay tourists, but families will be comfortable nonetheless. The outdoor pool areas are where the hotel shines - there are two infinity edge pools for lounging and the hotel has a very 'boutique property' feel. The hotel is directly on the beach, though this particular stretch is not very luxurious. The 1 bedroom suite was a good layout and included a kitchenette with a large fridge. If you are looking for a hip hotel in SJ, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Damarys D
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed during our Mini-Vacation for Labor Day weekend and this is by far the best resort in el Condado. The staff is great, rooms beautiful. The adult infinity pool is relaxing with a great view of the beach. We enjoyed our stay and recommend the Resort to all our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trinitee0971
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LaConcha on 9/7/2011. My twin and I decided to celebrate our 40th in PR and after some in-depth research picked LaConcha. My twin and I, along with our guests, were thoroughly impressed with the resort and the staff members. The hotel is RIGHT on the beach!!! There are eateries all along Ashford Ave (ie no car needed) and the bus ride to Old San Juan was just $.75!!!! Unfortunately, due to Tropical Storm Maria coming through, we will have to shorten our vacation here by 2 days. But no worries because I will be back in PR in January with my daughter for her Christmas break. Trying to sell my HHonors points now because I want to stay at LaConcha!!! LOL!!! Thank you LaConcha for making our first time in PR FABULOUS!!! See you soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “4 am is no time to run a shopvac in the hallway.”
Reviews.Author: Iwest1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Great location. Pablo in the Ocean Club was phenomenal. But somebody thought running a loud vacuum at 4 am was a good decision. Fail. Also did not get credited with my Reward points without filing a missing stay request with Marriott. Even so, the stay was pleasant & I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not customer-focused”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastCoaster
Reviews.Content: We checked in one day before Hurricane Irene and stayed for 10 days (our flight was cancelled so we had to stay 2 extra days). The hotel did NOTHING for the guests during the hurricane. When the power went out we had to wait in line for hours for the few outlets in the lobby to charge phones and laptops. The lobby had power of course (and the other two Marriots in view had power throughout the hotel), as did the restaurant so they could bilk the helpless guests (all restaurants and stores in town was closed because of the hurricane) for food from stratospherically expensive lobby bar and restaurants. In the rooms, no A/C, no lights, no TV; in the lobby, no water/coffee/snacks/movies for kids/special concierge to help with travel plan disruptions--NOTHING. At check-in, we weren't allowed in our room until 7 o'clock because it was being "inspected". We went in to the room to find a condom box next to the bed and a beer bottle cap on the bathroom floor. Nice inspection. At check-out we were offered nothing for the total negligence of the hotel during 55+ hours of no power and had to fight to get even a small compensation. And forget sleep unless you're in the separate suites building. The lobby music is so loud that n the 11th floor we were part of the party well into the wee hours. It was LOUD. Could be a beautiful, enjoyable, really wonderful hotel if they dropped the attitude and tried adding some hospitality and attention to detail. That's the point after all.

Reviews.Title: “GRRRRRREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: quita45
Reviews.Content: I had the best time in Puerto Rico and what made it even better was my stay at La Concha Resort. The customer service was superb. They made me feel like I was an all-star during my stay. When we first arrived we were greeted by Felix Perez. He was the best. Every time we had a question he answered with such enthusiasm. Each time we left and entered he gave us high fives. That was the best. I look forward to my return trip next year and I hope that Felix is still there. My trip was already operating at 150% but with the customer service of Felix Perez and Ms. Medina at the front desk it made it 250%. Thank you guys. I cannot wait to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the service and the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KHy123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few nights to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is very stylish and has a few good spots to sit and enjoy a drink. Their beach location is great, although when we were there the surf was very strong, so parents with small children might want to be careful. The pool areas were a lot of fun and the staff was great. I would definitely love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Couples Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Leah R
Reviews.Content: For a quick getaway or a long stay, this is definitely the hotel to stay. Superb View, Clean Room, Comfortable Beds, Excellent Location (Right off of Ashford Avenue) Tons of Restaurants to Dine and great shopping area as well (Louis Vuitton etc). At night, come right downstairs and there is a club atmosphere in the lobby, expensive drinks but you can go next door or across the street for some Coquito for an excellent price. Tons of Bacardi for cheap of course. There is a casino right next door, we gambled right before we left for our plane. Definitely will go Back!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, and Stylish. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Papimorenito501
Reviews.Content: Traveled to La Concha in August. Hotel â€“ Modern, chic, and clean. Let me put it another way â€“ there is a Louis Vuitton and Gucci across the street! We stayed on the 5th floor (553) in the new tower wing of the hotel (thank you!!!). This was a very nicely appointed room - separate living room, kitchen area with refrigerator-freeze (very handy after walk to the Walgreens for water and beverages), stove. An amazing view from the balcony. We sat and had breakfast there the morning after Irene roared through. From looking at the hotel from the beach, it does not look like the larger wing of the hotel has actual balconies. Dining/Restaurant â€“ We had dinner at Perla and were not disappointed. Definitely worth dining there just for the evening experience and ambiance. Definitely pricey, but worth it. We also had lunch a couple of times at Solera. Once upon arrival while lounging on the beach waiting for our room. Only one attendant, but very fast service. The bar area serves Tapas in the evening and hosts different themed nights every evening. Great place to people watch. Definitely one of the â€œinâ€� places and bar scenes in the area. Not too much to say about dining options outside of the hotel â€“ a few fast food places nearby. A cafÃ© across the street from the little plaza outside, was OK. Didnâ€™t get to try Dannyâ€™s International. We walked there on the morning we left, but the power was out (Hurricane Irene!) Itâ€™s about a ten minute walk. Beach â€“ The beach outside of the hotel is swimmable, but is not calm. May be better outside of hurricane season when storms arenâ€™t churning up the tide a bit. Plenty of room to lounge and plenty of chairs and umbrellas to be set up for you. Pool â€“ We didnâ€™t spend too much time poolside, but there are three pools at the hotel. Two of them are infinity pools. We saw most people over in the main pool nearest the bar and lobby area. Families and people of all ages. Our itinerary during our stay: Day 1 - Relaxed at on the beach, set up a beach chair and enjoyed a mojito, dinner @ Pamelas Day 2 - Rented a car and drove to Ponce. If I had to do it over, I would drive to the Cabo Rojo area and spent the day at Baqueron Bay Beach or Buye Beach in the southwest area of PR. Day 3 â€“ Drove rented car to Fajardo and tried to buy tickets for ferry to Culebra â€“ no luck - Flew to Culebra! Get there EARLY! Flamenco beach is worth the trip! Day 4 â€“ Purchased a tour - spent the day in El Yunque and then Luquillo Beach (didnâ€™t get to try the kiosks). Beach here is calmer than near the hotel. Taxi to San Juan Hotel in the evening â€“ live Salsa bands and dancing until the early morning (free, except for the taxi ride!) Day 5 - Old San Juan, breakfast at La Bombonera...here comes Irene, shops closed up early. Day 6 â€“ Lounged around the hotel and beach before heading home. I would like to extend a very special thanks to the hard working team of ladies at the front desk â€“ Alejandra Sepulveda and Tatiana Sanchez. They made our check-in, arrival and stay extremely pleasant â€“ warm, welcoming and special. Mr. Alfredo Arroyo and his team are top notch. I emailed ahead to inform that we were celebrating some special occasions during our stay and we were not disappointed by the level of attention. We would definitely stay here again! Feel free to message me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - stylish & elegant”
Reviews.Author: David_T_1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the one night for a special occasion, but would love to go back. The room was beautiful, the bed ultra comfortable and the views amazing. Yes, we could hear the nightlife noise - but that's to be expected staying in this area - our answer was to be out IN the nightlife - then by bedtime it had quietened down. Despite mixed reviews, every one of the staff made us feel welcome - more than that, we felt special. Definitely worth a return visit when funds permit

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: eistraveller
Reviews.Content: Perfect for all travellers, with or without children. Great food, service and cocktails on site or within walking distance. This is now my go-to San Juan spot for trips under 7 days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: JNice S
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel. Customer service was superb!!! All were great. But, one person stood out who went the extra mile. The person at the front desk, named Victor was friendly, attentive, great /warm communicator, & followed through to make sure we are having a wonderful vacation at this property. Overall, a great experience. Yes, I would recommend and a must revisit destination for us. We plan to go come back soon....

Reviews.Title: “Well kept and fun place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker22
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Concha was great. The hotel has a beautiful lobby and outdoor spaces. The area by the pool was pristine and the beach was well kept. We really enjoyed swimming in the ocean (big waves- not calm water) and then retreating to the infiniti pool looking at the beach. Our room was spacious and well appointed. The view was spectacular. Floor to ceiling windows made it feel like we were on a cruise ship- all you could see was beautiful green water. Food at the hotel was expensive and there were not plentiful alternatives nearby, beyond Subway and other fast food chains.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Time”
Reviews.Author: cocolopez20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here post cruise and had a lovely time. As you enter the grounds the staff greet you with smiles and great energy! The staff are friendly and helpful. The location on the beach and the hotel itself is both quite trendy and beautiful. We plan on returning for a longer stay. The ocean view rooms are the best way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: Elle C
Reviews.Content: The staff was really welcoming especially Felix. He was very friendly and sociable. Great person to greet the guests as they come in..... Great hotel...location, accomodations and the view..... Nice pool areas.... We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: G F
Reviews.Content: The music in the lobby was outrageously loud. Even on the 9th floor at 1:00 in the morning I could hear it in my room over my TV. I've stayed at La Concha before and really enjoyed it but they seem to be going down market and focusing more on the club scene in the lobby than the hotel component.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort for Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jjp023
Reviews.Content: Private beaches were awesome and very relaxing! Pools were a little too warm for my liking. The pools were nearly as hot as a hot tub, which isnt the most relaxing swim. Food and drinks were excellent but a little overpriced. Our room was clean and maintained throughout our trip. The amenities were great and the view was superb. In a great location, easily accessible to all different things in the area. The Conceirge was very friendly and helped us set up several activities.

Reviews.Title: “overall nice place”
Reviews.Author: steven p
Reviews.Content: La Concha was a beautiful resort. The pools and access to beach were very nice. Free chairs and umbrellas for beach as well as fresh towels were a nice luxury. The food in the hotels was exceptional. Two of the staff went above and beyond in taking care of us, that was Brock and Rebecca and we really appreciate it. The one area of the hotel we were disappointed with was the downs stairs bar area, the service was terrible and they didn't seem to want you there. the only other issue was the restraunt by the pool needs better vetilation because the smoke and smell of food overwhelmed the rooms above it.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. Would definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: MylaMay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now fiance') surprised me with a vacation to San Juan. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by Felix Perez who was smiley and jovial and made us feel so welcome. He was eager to help us out when he realized we wanted a picture taken of us in the front of the hotel which was very modern and chic, yet comfortable. During check in, I found staff to be extremely welcoming as they greeted us with champagne and offered to a better room than had already been assigned. We wanted a room with a view of the ocean, which we had but we would have been blocked by the restaurant. The rooms were very clean and very nicely decorated and laid out; the bed and pillows were comfortable as well. There was plenty of room for both of us to unpack and the room included two hanging closets and plenty of drawer space. We would have liked a larger patio area in the room as opposed to the Romeo & Juliette balcony, but how much time do you really spend in the room anyway when you've got a terrific resort and town to explore. The bar area in the lobby turns into a club at night that much resembles a Miami disco atmosphere with live DJs and even a stilt walker (a la Carnivale) one night. There was plenty of room around the big pool near the bar to relax with a few cocktails and I never felt over crowded or over powered by the music from the bar. The pool area facing the beach was terrific. Both pool areas were kept very clean during the day and at night. It seemed that the small pool over looking the beach was more of a family area during the day and the large pool area is more for adults. The beach area was clean as well (despite a little debris on the first day from Tropical Storm Irena). You can walk the beach during the day and even order a massage near the beach or in your room. The concierge was very courteous and knowledgeable, however, at times the line was a little long to get information. They could use a little more assistance behind the counter to keep the wait time down. We did book an excursion through the hotel concierge and they were enthusiastic to give us input and tips. We did the night kayaking tour because the rain forest was still closed due to the storm, but again we had a terrific time. There are five restaurants in the hotel from sushi, to Puerto Rican, Italian and Perla (the big shell restaurant in the photos) of which we ate at two. The Puerto Rican grill near the big pool area was slow as far as service, but was decent if you wanted to just grab something while hanging out by the pool. Perla is very nice on the inside and out and you are definitely in awe of the structure and decor, but the food is a bit lack luster for a true dining experience. While it looks like the structure is floating on water from the outside (at certain angles in the photos), it is less inspiring from the inside and you can clearly see the bottom of the shallow pool of water the restaurant is built on. The meal itself was okay. Very nice presentation of the food and the staff was proper (although at times our server was slow), we had a plenty of people that attended to our table. I would probably not go back to this restaurant if we went back to San Juan as there is better food out there, but the experience of being there was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene Impact - Will Not go back”
Reviews.Author: steve p
Reviews.Content: Similar to other poster, had unfortunate impact of staying at property during the storm. Hotel had a limited generator for lobby and hallways. No power nor hot water in rooms. Ironically, other Marriott 2 blocks away and other Marriott properties on island had full generator power. Hotel proactively offered nothing, had to escalate to get any resolution. Hotel neglected any customer satisfaction efforts during this 55+ hour outage. Nothing was offered up to any guests. While hundreeds of people gathered in lobby, to wait things out, everyone was left to pay full price on drinks and food.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Rocky1964
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay! We had an ocean view room in the older tower and the view was amazing! The balcony was more like a ledge...would have been great if it were big enough to accommodate table and chairs. The entire staff were so friendly and helpful! The lobby is chic and beautiful. We loved the pools and the beach was beautiful and clean. The restaurant La Perla has to be one of the best restaurants on the island! The Voga Italian Grill for dinner was also amazing! Every morning we had the buffet at the Voga. The service was awesome and the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. They were especially attentive and friendly to our 10 year old. Next time we will try to stay in the newer tower if we can afford it :-) We go to Puerto Rico yearly, and this so far has been the best place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We had a Blast and will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: MayaPapaya1410
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a fantastic girls getaway at the La Concha Resort in Puerto Rico. It is very Americanized, so more like Mexico, but if you go into Old San Juan you will get a bit of the more of how the locals live. The weather is top notch, hot and sunny almost everyday even if they call for rain. However we did get a really rainy day, but it cleared up in the late afternoon. First off, the hotel was very up-to-date, modern and clean. The service was amazing! Staff there were very accommodating and friendly, especially, Santiago (Manager) who made sure our stay was very good and Victor (Front Desk) who was very helpful with where to go, what to see and where to eat! And of course crazy Felix (Entrance) who always put a smile on our face ("Thouck Thock" (high fives). The food was very good at the hotel. We ate at the Voga Italian Grill and the Solera Restaurant which is by the pool. Both had very good food and a very tastey menu. Don't forget to try the awesome hot sauce (Pica/pique) especially made for that hotel! And the water is very safe to drink. They always have a huge water (with Lemons) dispenser by the towel service area (poolside). And the cool Almond scented face towels were also available for cooling you off. There were always lawn chairs available by the big pool area and at the beach. You didn't have to run down early to reserve any spots. The food out of the resort was also pretty tasty. Note: When they say Continental Breakfast, it doesn't mean that it is complimentary (we learned that first hand) :( Oh and make sure when you take a cab from their airport to La Concha, it only costs $17.50 for everyone (not for each person, some cab drivers may screw you!) We went into Old San Juan (which is a must see), try the Restaurant called La Bombanera for breakfast or brunch. They are infamous for their Mallorca sandwiches which you can have with egg, ham, and cheese, It is a must try! Their coffee is also very tasty! We then took a stroll to their different souvenir shops and visit El Morro (historical landmark). If you go into Old San Juan at night, they have great places to eat as well like the Dragon Fly (asian fusion) and there you will see people dancing salsa in the streets and have a number of clubs and lounges. A great club that we went to is Brava, Friday and Saturday nights are the best. We went on a Thursday, very young... We were very surprised at how beautiful, fun and friendly place Puerto Rico was. The resort is amazing for all walks of life including families with young children. Needless to say, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Hurrican Irene”
Reviews.Author: LIVELAUGHLOVE30
Reviews.Content: We heard this was one of the Condado hotel reservations. The lobby is very nice but the rooms still appeared dated. The problem was not that Hurricane Irene had power out on most of the island, the problem was that with all the guests staying at the hotel and hanging out in the lobby, La Concha did not offer any specials or discounts. The guests seemed to be in good spirits, no complaining and all we got for our trouble was complimentary flash lights!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love La Concha”
Reviews.Author: imabluehen
Reviews.Content: Our room had an awesome oceanfront view! I thought it was a very nice room and found the amenities to be fabulous. From the time we stepped out of the cab everyone at La Concha was so helpful and friendly. I thought the pools and beach were very nice as well. I enjoyed the lobby bar a few times and the casino as well. Every time we left La Concha we were always greeted with a welcome back! I would definitely go back to La Concha if Puerto Rico is my destination.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, relaxing resort. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: myers
Reviews.Content: We chose this resort based on a recommendation from a friend, and we were not disappointed. It is in a great area of town - many restaurants, shops, bars etc within walking distance. The lobby alone was enough to let us know we had chosen a great place. It's gorgeous, large, and open to the elements. Very cool bar area that transforms into an area with a DJ in the evenings. Our suite was beautiful with modern furnishings, a full kitchen with a sitting area and breakfast nook. The bathroom is large and the bedroom had plenty of room and a comfy bed. We had a city view... if you are a light sleeper this may not be for you. They really know how to have fun in PR, and the music went on well into the early morning! It didn't bother us, however. The resort is directly on the ocean, with two infinity pools overlooking the beach â€“ one of which is adults only. A nice perk! The pool areas are amazing, beautiful areas to sit during the day or in the evening with a cocktail listening to the band outside. If you need a little shade, grab one of the cabanas. No need to rent them, which was a surprise! It's first come, first serve, and they were a great respite from the sun after a bit of a burn the day before. Are the drinks expensive? Yes. But it's a resort. If you're concerned about that, there are a few liquor stores within walking distance, and you can pick up your own beverages. Even better if you have a fridge in your room! The concierge (Louise) was very helpful in recommending restaurants and making reservations. La Bodega Compostela is a wine/tapas restaurant that was recommended â€“ great food, great service, extensive wine list. Casa Lola was also recommended â€“ unfortunately we had horrible service here, and the food was just okay. We grabbed lunch next door to the resort one day at Di Parma â€“ supercute place with great food and great service. We sat outside with a view of the park near the water. We had dinner at La Perla our last evening there â€“ wonderful. The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable, and the food was delicious. The inside of the restaurant is really beautiful. If available, request a seat by the window overlooking the water. Our one and only complaint about the resort is the public restrooms. Both by the pools and in the lobby, they were just not what you would expect based on the quality of the rest of the resort. Many stalls were out of order, didn't have locking doors, and overall weren't terribly clean. So we just ran up to the room â€“ a small sacrifice for an overall wonderful experience. I would highly recommend staying at La Concha â€“ for both couples and families!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tejenks32
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the service was top nice. Hotel personel was very friendly and helpful. The beachfront view was great, we stayed on the tenth floor. Try out the Parrot Club resturant in Old San Juan! I'd like to go back just to eat there again. Cons: The food and drinks were pricey but overall a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Keeper!”
Reviews.Author: debmomto4
Reviews.Content: Visited La Concha with my 4 children - 2 of which are over 18 , a 16 yo and 11 yo and my sister. Had a very relaxing time. Very nice concierge and bellmen. Enjoyed the pools, beach and pool restaurant. Many restaurants walking distance from hotel and Hertz right up the block where I rented a car for 2 days. Did do valet because it was a big car and if you self-park you run the risk of scraping sides on the circular driveway but small price to pay for having the car waiting for you. Older children enjoyed being able to go to the casino. Breakfast buffet was pricey but I did take out and we ate it in room. 2 Buffets were enough for all of us. Beach is right outside the door. No problem getting chairs for all of us. Water was beautiful - warm - choppy one day but it was a day after a tropical storm passed by and the next day there were hardly any waves.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it here!!”
Reviews.Author: KHNY
Reviews.Content: I came to PR for the first time with 3 others for my birthday last week and chose to stay at La Concha Resort b/c of the stellar ratings, eventhough friends of mine suggested we book the Conrad or the El San Juan. However, after staying at La Concha and visiting the other hotels, I must say I am very VERY happy we decided on La Concha. The hotel was very modern and CLEAN and the service was impeccable! ROOM: Our room was the ocean, which was stunning. The room was spacious and very CLEAN and smelled good to the point where my sister wanted to know if the hotel sold the scent lol (you don't find that often). The beds were very comfortable and the amenities were also great (aveda products, flat screen and ipod doc :)). The shower in the bathroom also had a rain shower head and a long handled shower head which I found great! You don't find that in most hotels. SERVICE: Excellent service from beginning to end. From the moment you step out of the cab, you are greeted with smiles. Felix is really spirited and defintely gets you in the fun vacation mood. The front desk was also warm and very friendly and accommodates your concerns. We were really impressed with Victor at concierge who was highly informative and guided us to all the places that we would be interested in, as it was our first time in PR. On one of the days, we decided to kayak the bioluminescent lagoon in Fajardo (our first time kayaking and quite the comedy show it turned out to be--im sure we're on youtube) anyway Victor equipped us with towels and informed us of all the essentials we needed, which we're glad he did. Defintely go to him for suggestions, information and/or concerns. We defintely want to come back to explore the other places he highly suggested. The restaurant Solera had very friendly staff as well and the food was really good and fresh. Service was a bit on the slow side, but we're from New York and used to everything being done in a NY minute. I have to say Reuben (waiter) was very good and attentive to our picky requests. POOLS Gorgeous pools!! The main pool is fun for kids and families and right by the restaurant Solera. There are also 2 infinity pools that overlook the beach, which are a bit small but nonetheless fun and gorgeous. We found these pools to be quite shaded so we stayed by the main pool or beach for more sun. Overall, La Concha made PR an amazing experience for all of us. We defintely had a fun time here and already recommending it to others. We're defintely coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip of our lives! Can't wait to return!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zumbagirl420
Reviews.Content: When the taxi first pulled up to La Concha, we were immediately greeted by Felix who remembered us from last year! He was in a great mood every single day and made us feel so special and welcome. We were also greeted soon after by Anthony who remembered us as "the ladies with the matching smiles" - How can you not be in a great mood with greetings like these? :) There was a small problem with our room since we needed two beds (my mom and I) and there only seemed to be king bed rooms left. Zuheil was at the front desk helping us and she went way above and beyond to try and find us a room. She also has a gorgeous smile and a matching personality to entertain us while we waited for some help from a manager. The Guest Services Manager, Jose came out to help us. I was so impressed that he literally ran up the steps to different rooms to try and find us something that matched what we were looking for. It is so refreshing to see a manager that doesn't feel like he is "above" any job at the hotel. He came back sweating and holding a key for this amazing room that had the two beds we needed plus this gorgeous ocean front view! This is only the first hour of our trip!! Things just kept getting better and better from there. We went to the gym to take some ZUMBA classes and Victor who normally does the towels at the pool came in with wet towels for our faces and cold waters for everyone. He knew we would be back the next day so he came to the gym early and moved all of the spinning bikes out of the exercise room for us without even having to ask him! We always like to get the concierge room with the snacks and drinks throughout the day... and Pablo always makes this experience special. We knew him from last year as well and he always goes a step beyond to make sure we have everything we need. Probably the most noteworthy employees on this trip were Alejandra from the Concierge and Kristina at the front desk. Not only did they recommend the BEST beaches, places to eat, most convenient and affordable ways to get there... but they are just GOOD people. They are both super special and super dedicated. I can tell they are the type of employees that would come in on a day off, stay late, etc just because they love what they do and want their guests to be happy.. which we were!! Also worth mentioning is Luis at the front desk- he has a great personality and went out of his way to make conversation and inform us of different things to do in the area that we didn't know about! Everyone that we encountered at La Concha was wonderful...but these particular employees that I mentioned really went above and beyond anything we could have ever imagined. We have been to La Concha once before which is why we came back this time...but this time was incomparable. A vacation is what you make of it...but when everyone in the staff is so friendly and always in a good mood.. the guests can't help but be the same way. We will not only be returning to La Concha ASAP, but we will be telling anyone that will listen how wonderful it is there. One final note... as a previous Property Manager for an apartment community, with lots of experience in hiring and firing staff... I would be THRILLED to have any of the staff mentioned above working for/with me. They are all super stars and deserve much recognition. Pics below with most of the mentioned staff! Missing Puerto Rico terribly, Renee Gelber

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Place Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rusiliya29
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is beautiful and was honestly one of (if not the best) hotel I have ever stayed at (and I travel very frequent!). We got to the hotel a few hours before check in and wanted to do an early check in, however no rooms were available at the time so we just went straight to the beach as the hotel is located just steps away. We later were able to check in at regular time (3pm) but received an upgraded room with a high floor and a view of the ocean since we had to wait (at no extra charge!). The room was beautiful and clean! The beds are so comfortable you don't want to get up. The hotel has 3 pools from what I saw. One has a waterfall and the other two are infinity pools - all of which are amazing. We ate at both of the restaurants (La Perla) and (Cafe de Angel (i think that's the name). The service is amazing at both and we even got free birthday cake for my friends birthday (without even having to ask for it!). The staff really makes this hotel an experience. They make you feel at home and very welcome. The service didn't feel forced and was very genuine. They wanted us to have a good time and were happy we were there. Victor from the front desk was our mini tour guide and told us all the places to visit before we went to Old San Juan so we wouldn't miss anything. I think we would have been lost tourists without his help. Truly great and genuine guy. He introduced us to Santiago who's the pool restaurant manager who got us a free pitcher of sangria on our last day and also the hotel's amazing pique sauce! (soo good if you like hot sauce!). Our pool waiter was Reuben (so sweet and fun) he told us about this little place in old san juan that makes fantastic mallorcas called la bombonera. And last but def not least was Felix from the front of the hotel where you get the taxis took more pictures of us then I even know what to do with. I wouldn't have half of them if it wasn't for him. We loved his high-fives! All in all this was an great hotel and I would recommend it for everyone families, young people, couples, etc. I will def be back to to San Juan and would not stay any other place besides La Concha. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly service, beautiful property, VERY secure.”
Reviews.Author: TKevPao
Reviews.Content: My husband was in San Juan on business so I tagged along for the trip. I am so glad I did. This resort could not have been in a better location. Every day I walked across the street to the local restaurants for lunch and was never disappointed. Orate Guey, which is literally RIGHT across the street, has $2 beer and $2 tacos. What more can you ask for? The staff at the hotel is super-friendly and willing to help with any requests. The breakfast buffet at the hotel is mediocre and overpriced, but on-par with pretty much any other hotel. Walk half a block up the street and there is a Dunkin Donuts which trumped the $22 breakfast buffet. One thing I was particularly impressed with was security. The hotel has security officers everywhere. If you wander off from the hotel you can't throw a rock without hitting a smiling, friendly police officer. Not sure why they need so much security, as it seemed like a pretty safe area, but it sure made walking alone on the streets that much more pleasant. I will definitely visit San Juan again, and will stay at the La Concha for sure!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, EXCELLENT customer service”
Reviews.Author: Romina_Peluffo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week and we were very pleased. This was our second time in Puerto Rico but our first time staying at La Concha and we would definitely return! People are very friendly, they made us feel at home and were always ready to help whenever we needed assistance. Having the beach only a few steps away is PERFECT and that is where we spent most of our time. We were delighted to have met Luis Rosario, he's extremely friendly, always with a smile on his face and happy to help whenever possible. We cant wait to visit Puerto Rico and stay at La Concha again!

Reviews.Title: “more expensive than the Marriot, but also a bit better”
Reviews.Author: PhlPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha on our last 2 nights in Puerto Rico. We weren't given a room in the main hotel, which was a disappointment. But our cabana room was nice. It was spacious had a really great shower, and there was no noise from anywhere outside of the room. Maid Service was really late on our second day. Apparently the hotel had overbooked the maid, so we wasted a lot of time waiting for that so we could shower and head out for dinner.
