The beach here is really lovely, and the sands are well maintained. The pools are nice as well. My only complaint is one of the towel guys for the pool/beach. They make you sign a card saying if the towels are not returned, there is a $15 fee. So when I returned the towels, I asked the guy to check that there wasn't anything left in their box with my name on it. He rolled his eyes at me and said no there wasn't. Not a big deal, but as a paying guest, I really don't appreciate that - especially from a towel boy. All in all, I enjoyed the stay. A nice end to a nice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Epitome of cool”
Reviews.Author: Black_Hawk586
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop before our big week on a cruise, and what a way to start your vacations! As soon as you arrive you get greeted with a smile from heaven by Felix (bell person) and checked in by Luis (front desk) great costumer service, very informative. Over all the staff was great. Loved the design, open spaces, 4 pools including one adult pool for relaxation. Clean rooms, great night life, thousands of restaurants in the area (ropa vieja was amazing). Will definitely return for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very accommodating and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Shortydee
Reviews.Content: Victor Rodriguez at the concierge desk was so friendly and extremely helpful! He always had a smile on his face, great personality!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel! Hope to come back!”
Reviews.Author: Timmi C
Reviews.Content: La Concha is well worth the money! It was literally right on the beach, had 3 pools, 2 of which overlook the beach(awesome!), concierges were more than kind and helpful, and there is a casino in the lobby. What more could you ask for?! We had an oceanfront room, and the view from our balcony overlooking the ocean was breathtaking. The building to our right wasn't the most beautiful thing in the world, but the ocean more than made up for it! We were close to a CVS (one block away), and tons of restaurants in the area, so you don't feel like you HAVE to order from the hotel's restaurant. Old San Juan is a short 10 minute car ride away. There are also car rentals in the area, so you dont' have to rent a car from the airport (recommended), as I made that mistake. La Concha does charge for parking ($15/day for self park vs $20-25/day for valet). The valets are very nice as well! All of the employees were so cordial, nice and helpful, this is what customer service is all about. I highly recommend staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha delivers!”
Reviews.Author: BradandSuz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights post cruise and we had as much fun in Puerto Rico as on our cruise. Hotel is very modern and rooms are big. We really liked our ocean view rooms. Lots of food close by. Lot of beach to walk. Water can be a bit rough. I would recommend Charle's car rentals as well, as they will pick you up at the cruise port and later drop you off at the airport. That saves some bucks and time. Rental prices are very fair as well - better on line than calling. Kids saw Mark Antony who stays there occasionally.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suite not for teens and their parents!”
Reviews.Author: ghellis
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the junior suite with my two parents (I am 15) and was stunned when I walked in the room and was looking into the bathroom with a clear glass shower and a glass door leading to the toilet! There was no door to the restroom!! The bed was right outside the shower with a clear view to whoever might be inside. My parents and I had to coordinate shower taking and when we would be out of the room so we could take a shower! This room would be fine for any couple or if you have small children but not anyone older like me! Really awkward and not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “The amicable people of Puerto Rico make the heart and soul of La Concha.”
Reviews.Author: thepinkmoon87
Reviews.Content: This is my 1st time at a resort. Felix Perez, Victor (Rodriguez?), Ruben (waiter) were the ones that stand out to me. Genuinely concerned staff ready and available to help as much as possible. Would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: afmcguire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the infinity pool over looking the ocean was delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here for business or if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: iftrav
Reviews.Content: The incredibly loud amplification of music in evenings echos trough the room. I you are hoping to sleep, give it away. The staff will tell you it is just for one night - until the next night. Give this place a miss. The place needs to decide if it is a pub or a travellers hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but don't get a room on the street side”
Reviews.Author: dordor33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the past two nights and overall it's a great resort. The pools and beach area are really nice. Food is typical hotel food. The nightlife is good if you are into that. However, a new bar/club opened across the street a month ago and they have no regard for people trying to sleep at 4:30am. I called the front desk about how loud the music was and they told me there was nothing they could do. I thought they would at least call the police because it had to be breaking a noise ordinance. I stayed in the Suite Tower on the street side (and a coworker stayed on the same side and he thought the music was ridiculously loud as well). My coworker later found out that the police were called, but this has been going on since they opened. When the police show up, they will turn the music down, but turning back up a few minutes later. If you stay here, request not to be street side/Suite Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place! We'll stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JFredPhoenixAZ
Reviews.Content: Spent just one night here pre-cruise. Wish we could have stayed longer! This is a beautiful resort on a gorgeous stretch of beach. The beautiful lobby, is air conditioned but feels open air. The pool complex is stunning. The rooms are clean, modern and comfortable. Didn't use the casino but it was jumping on a Saturday night. Try the tripleta sandwich at the sidewalk cafe. Out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Decor, Wonderful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BonaFideDiva
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a birthday weekend with the girls. The hotel grounds were kept very well. The front desk staff was very helpful. Didn't eat here, but there is a very good authentic Puerto Rican restaurant across the street that has such good eats for a very affordable price. Totally recommend them. Close proximity to other beaches so there is a ton of opportunity to be social. The ONLY complaint I have is that there were no mirrors! How does a penthouse suite have NO mirrors? Go figure...

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot...A Must See + Stay”
Reviews.Author: JahnayMaryland
Reviews.Content: I visited the LaConcha on business travel for a week in August. This is a fantastic hotel. I dont know where to start. We had a king suite with a kitchen. It was great, not to mention a balcony with a view of the resort and street below. It was amazing. Housekeeping was great. Just everyone on staff was so helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel has multiple pools so that was great. The fitness room is nice not to mention they offer different classes during the week if you are interested in signing up while during your stay (i.e yoga, spin). Hotel food - La Perla is great. The breakfast buffet is good nothing that fancy, your typical buffet - omelet station, waffles, pancakes, coffee, oatmeal, etc. Again I could keep going about this hotel and staff. Note that taxi travel can get pricey after a few days. PR operates on a zone sytem so depending on what zone you travel to/fro it determines the cost of your trip. Typically between $12-$15, even if it is down the street. They really don't like taking credit cards either so beware of that. They charge you automatic $30 for use of credit card so if your trip is only $14 u really get paid twice that just to use your credit card. Other than that...great hotel + location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Hhmj
Reviews.Content: The public areas and the event was wonderful the banquets team make every moment unique an the food was delicious never try the sweet skirt steak and I can't stop enjoying

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Rochelle01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and it was absolutely beautiful. Close to shopping, local resteraunts, and night life. All within walking distance. The beach at the back of the resort was awsome! Helpful staff. Everyone was friendly. We will definitely stay here again when we return. No complaints at ALL..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and experience!! Loved every second of it!!”
Reviews.Author: Dalia G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I hopped a plan a day after our wedding to San Juan. Needless to say we were exhausted and it was very refreshing to have the bell hop take our bags as soon as we got out of the cab, much better then having to lug them around the front desk and such. We arrived around 12 and our room wasn't ready yet so we walked around the beautiful lobby and had a bite to eat at the little restaurant in the casino, good food, inexpensive and nothing but smiles from the staff. Within 1/2 hour they called us to let us know our room was ready. We had a suite in the new tower on the 10th floor and it was amazing!! Big and spacious, full kitchenette, the bedroom was really nice. I've read some complaints about the bathroom glass wall that looks onto the bedroom, but as newlyweds and honeymooners, we found it to be a nice touch 8) The view of the beach was lovely. The room was very clean and stacked with a generous amount of towels. We were pretty high up so we never heard any club music. The hotel was great, the pool was nice, a little small but offered great views of the beach. The beach was really empty and very nice, there weren't any rocks, but the waves were a little rough at times. The service in the hotel was great, we were always greeted with great enthusiasm and smiles, everyone was incredibly nice and helpful. Natalia Gonzales was the best!!! Her recommendations were always spot on!! We ate at perla restaurant, it was pretty but the food wasn't amazing. I would def recommend La casa lola and Ropa Vieja for local restaurants, they're both within walking distance to the hotel and are AMAZING!! All in all I would def recommend this hotel, wish we could go back!! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha San Juan= Beautiful vacation”
Reviews.Author: crissygirl2002
Reviews.Content: My family travels a few times a year on bigger vacations. Our teen age boys are ages 19,18, & 13 so we wanted a trip for the whole family before they returned to college. The flight from Chicago is about 4&1/2 hrs, no passports required, American Currency, and most everyone speaks English. La Concha is located in the middle of some upsale retail stores, next to a less crowded beach, and the hotel itself is lovely. Our room were booked through Expedia and I feel I got a fair price. The is no shuttle from the hotel but the cabs ride (acyually a van) has set rates and for 5 of us it was $22.00 with 5 pieces of luggage. We arrived around 3pm and our room wasnt ready so we ate at the bar. Some reviews state the food is pricey , but this is a resort so I didnt expect it to be cheap. There are bars and resturants across the street, including Wendys, Subway, and a Walgreens (about 5 min walk) . The hotel staff is friendly & helpful. The hotel is extremely clean..and there are no bed bugs! We stayed in the Suite Tower and the rooms are just like the website: which is not always the case, I normally cannot afford the rooms featured on the website. We have a full size fridge, microwave, and cook top complete with pots & pans. So I kept cereal, yogurts, some water, and soda .--etc s snacking. the room contains a seperate bedroom from living room/kitchenette. The living room has pull out couch and we requested an air mattress which we received at no charge. The neighborhood changes after severa-several l blocks, so just beware of your surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Cons at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: conlon10
Reviews.Content: Experiences are all about expectations- and first impressions! I carefully read several reviews before and after making my reservation back in May. We are Marriott Gold members and used points for our stay. Although we are "guaranteed" an upgrade (based on availability) I chose to use extra points to assure that we would get a room to our liking. I also requested an early check in and a room with 2 beds (which was guaranteed). We arrived at La Concha at 4pm only to learn that our room was not ready. I also discovered that we did not have a room in the "suites" tower as I had requested. Denise did not offer any options, suggestions or apologies. My state of relaxation after 4 days at El Conquistador (where being an Hilton Honors member means something) quickly vanished. It was the most unusual and dissapointing check in experience that I have ever had, and it didn't stop there. Unsure of how long it would take for our room Denise told us that she would call when it was ready. We returned to the front desk after some time had passed (with no phone call) and were given a key and room number. That's it! No directions to the room or other ammenities at the hotel. As a result we wondered around the "wrong" tower before asking directions. Our room did have an ocean view with 2 beds, was spacious but worn with dirty carpeting. We did not have any housekeeping issues. The grounds are lovely and modern with a great vibe that my 17 year old son appreciated. I would never recommend this property for a family with children under 15. We enjoyed the sushi bar for 2 meals and Elias was terriffic. We had an amazing dinner at La Perla, Elaine and the rest of the staff made it a memorable evening. Everyone at the hotel, aside from our initial encounter, was very friendly and accomodating. We did recieve a note of apology with a token gesture of bonus points to our rewards account. The effort was appreciated, but sadly we can not forget our first impression.

Reviews.Title: “what a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: kcfolk
Reviews.Content: Upon our early arrival at La Concha Resort, we were warmly greeted and taken care of by the staff. Our room wasn't yet ready so we sat in the beautiful lobby and ordered drinks. Our server suggested we start our vacation with their passion fruit mojito. Wow! We were hooked from the first sip. When we got to our 11th floor room, we were blown away! The modern/tropical decor was gorgeous and the room itself was plenty spacious for the 3 of us. The living/dining area was nicely equipped with microwave, sink, fridge, freezer and cook top as well as any utensil we would need. There was plenty of comfortable seating and bright lighting. Our bathroom had a huge shower and good size sink and vanity. The bedroom was amazing with a very comfortable bed and amazing ocean view out the balcony. Our room was always well stocked and clean when we arrived after a day of swimming or exploring San Juan. We also have to mention the wonderful man we met in the concierge lounge. His name is Pedro O Rivera. His warm and friendly manner with us, as well as the other guests made our trip extra special. Pedro gave us suggestions for restaurants and places to visit, as well as drawing maps for us to follow while driving. He gave our 9 year old special attention, teaching him Spanish and bringing him carribean fruits to try. The beach is beautiful and the swimming pools were clean and well maintained. We ate several times poolside and were very impressed with the food and the good service. Wonderful experience. We look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: stu-nodd-cuzin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocean Tower the room was large with white leather furniture, glass doors that opened and you could hear and see the ocean. Staff was friendly and helpful. Pools a little on the small side but very warm. The beach was large with warm ocean water that was a bit rough but refreshing. We ate at four restaurants one of which was Perla that is located in the hotel. I don't really care how much ambiance it has the food sucks and is expensive. If you want to see the room they have a bar, sit there and have a drink don't waste your hard earned dollars on dinner. I had the lobster tail which was so bad that I couldn't even eat it. When I mentioned this to the waiter, I was told that other customers loved it so much that they wanted to eat the shell. I should have replied and told him to eat it himself but at times I try to be a lady and hold back negative responses. On the other hand we walked to the left to Jam Rum Bar & Bistro, on Magdalena Ave., then as you exit the hotel to the right Ropa Vieja Grill & Casa Lola all three were excellent and highly recommended. We would go back to LaConcha and the three mentioned restaurants. Also Mike's Pizza was good for lunch. We walked Ashford Ave and there was always police present either on foot or in cars. The trip was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: professor0247
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was reluctant to go to PR as I thought i would miss my home and some B ' way shows back in NY. The staff at the hotel was friendly and accomodating. One particular manager, Michael Tischler, was extremely helpful - making every effort that the guests at the La Concha feel at home. Mike directed his efforts to pleasing the customer and made my stay at the La Concha as comfortable as possible. He has an exceedingly pleasant personality and is a warm and gracious host. Thanks to all the staff at La Concha - particularly Mike. Would definitely stay there again when I return to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: geogiasun12345
Reviews.Content: La Concha aims to provide each visitor with a memorable beach vacation and will bend over backwards to make it happen. check in was a dream. Not only did Luis give us messages from family upon arrival, our room had been upgraded to a suite so we could be near family. The concierge desk was extremely helpful with making reservations and recommendations. Natalie was terrific. The doormen out front were extremely friendly, especially Felix and Randolph who would make sure my tiny children had fun even if we were just waiting for a cab. The pool restaurants were very good and the service was impeccable. When it rained one day the concierge suggested we speak to the manager of the Ocean Lounge to see if we could lounge for a bit by the sea under cover, and the manager of the Ocean Lounge was more than happy to oblige. Our room was clean, the view was good, I never heard the noise that some reviews mentioned from the lobby bars, and everyone was fantastic. The beach is small but very pretty and there are chairs and umbrellas available all day. The infinity pools have wonderful ocean views and the main pool is terrific for kids. The numerous pools and comfortable lounge seating with ocean and pool views makes it easy to spend a day (or days) and never leave the property. I would recommend this hotel without reservations to anyone! Thanks La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha....Tropical paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Bdcarr27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from vacationing at La Concha while celebrating our anniversary. From the moment we stepped into the lobby we knew that this would be a vacation we would not forget. The bellhops were so nice and friendly, especially Jonathan. Upon checking in, we were told that we were upgraded to an ocean view suite in the brand new tower, thanks to Alfredo and Cynthia the managers. When we walked into our room for the first time, our jaws hit the floor. Kitchenette, cute living room, awesome bathroom with glass shower separating the shower from the bedroom, big comfy bed, and the most breathtaking view of the ocean from the balcony! We were in heaven. We didn't eat much at the hotel because of the prices, but it didn't phase us one bit. Just a short walk from the hotel are some really delicious restaurants with really GREAT prices. Some of our favorites were Orate Guey (right across the street) for Mexican, Orozco's for delicious Puerto Rican food (and our favorite breakfast spot, and great Mofongo), and Danny's International (just a short walk past the Marriott). We also hit up a local liquor store and made drinks right in our room to bring to the beach, pool, etc. Walgreens nearby was really great for anything else we needed to stock the fridge. Our favorites from the trip were swimming and relaxing in the pool located directly in front of the new tower, taking the bus to Old San Juan ($.75 each way), and simply just hanging out on the balcony taking in the view. Swimming at night in the main pool was also fun. There was a local music festival in the park while we were there with awesome live music. We will definitely be back to stay at La Concha in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “No problems! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: PTLover
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in upscale Condado area, 10 minutes from airport. Contemporary lobby with nice open bar which serves small meals/appetizers and continental fare with fresh juices in the morning. Check in was flawless, modern room in Ocean Tower, room size was on the small size but it was a quiet, corner room on the 9th room with a full balcoony with table and 2 chairs looking directy at the beautiful ocean. Nice bath with jetted tub and full kitchenette included. Housekeeping was daily and efficient. Hotel has all the amenities you would expect ncluding a casino however it does not have a spa. Hotel literature suggests the Zen Spa, about 2 & 1/2 blocks away..nice, clean up-to-date facilites but massages were just "ok". DId not eat at any of the restaurants on the premises, excellent Tapas Bar Cafe across the street with the best sangria in Puerto Rico! Multiple restaurants in the area, no lack of food. Upscale shopping is only 1-3 blocks away, Vuitton, Ferragamo, Gucci, etc. Nice local neighborhood grocery store close by..turn right out of the hotel..about 3 blocks on the left...get your snacks, sodas, etc here. Taxis are ever present..about $15 to old San Juan. No regrets at this hotel...easy decision to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “standard room has a bed and no other furniture”
Reviews.Author: NotUsuallyPicky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 465 after booking and paying for a standard room on Expedia for a business trip. The room has a nice bed... and that's it. There is no other place to sit. No side chair. No desk. No armchair. No table. An alcove by the doorway contains a kitchenette, which might be nice except that after you cook something you'd have to eat it in bed. There is a balcony with a small table and some plastic chairs, but it overlooks a parking deck and a lot of concrete buildings. Internet is free and has no password required. Perla restaurant was nearly empty on a Wednesday night. Very attentive service and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust this hotel- the safe is not safe!”
Reviews.Author: rogerstrav
Reviews.Content: a couple of days after we checked out of this hotel i realized i had left a signifcant amount of cash in our room safe. after the hotel informed me that nothing was turned in to lost and found or security i spoke with the Director of Security. he told me the policy was, if housekeeping was cleaning a room after a guest checked out and the safe was locked, an engineer and security were called to the room to unlock the safe. he also said he would start an investigation to see exactly what happened. when i called back he told me that the safe was locked and the engineer and security went to the room to unlock the safe however they saw nothing there. REALLY??!! i wonder, how many guests upon checking out of a hotel room, clean all of their valuables out of the safe and then RE-LOCK it??!! why would anyone do that?? i asked him if any further aciton would be taken to see if he could at least get someone to admit that the money was there but his investigation was over. all in all this hotel was average but please, keep your eye on your things as the employees obviously cannot be trusted and by all means don't leave anything in the hotel safe. (that's right, the SAFE is not safe at the LaConcha)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: MissWorldExplorer
Reviews.Content: The room was not ready upon arrival, however, it wasn't a deal breaker for us. The staff was extremely kind. The room was clean, modern, roomy, and simply amazing. I have no words for the pools and the beach. The pool we mostly attended was for the adults only - where couples from different destinations leisured around - and boy, oh boy, was it relaxing and beautiful. Whether you're swimming in the ocean or laying out by the pool, it was a relaxation at its finest. The in-room service was yummy. Very expensive but it was delicious. Be prepared to spend some cash on the resort if you're planning on eating and drinking at the resort. My suggestion is to walk down the strip and find a restaurant your heart desires. It's less expensive and it's walking distance. Overall, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible time !! Most definetly go back....Loved San Juan PR and the people!”
Reviews.Author: MyThoughtsqueensNY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our two boy's (18 and 15 yrs old) just got back after 9 day stay at La Concha. I have never taken time after my stay in a resort to review my experience, good or bad, however in this case I feel obligated. The entire hotel staff could not do enough for you ! what ever the request big or small they take personnal pride to any task. The rooms and grounds were spotless every day and although it was the off season it was nice not to have to get up at the crack of dawn to cliam a lounge chair, any number of chairs were made available to you anywhere on the beach or pool you desire. I would most definetly recommend La Concha to family or friends. A great and relaxing time had by all.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in PR - Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brina_B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take a quick island vacation and thought Puerto Rico would be the perfect destination. It was our first trip out of the states together and we were excited to visit San Juan. Honestly, I was a little nervous about booking at the La Concha, or any new hotel for that matter- you can never tell when the photos online are embellished or exaggerated. Upon our arrival we were impressed. Our first impression of the hotel's lobby was just what we were looking for. The pool, bar, restaurant and atmosphere in general made us feel like we were truly on a tropical island! It reminded us of The Standard Hotel or a W Hotel, just enough luxury and decor to feel like you were staying in a 5 star hotel with reasonable prices. We had a King size, ocean front room with an amazing view of the beach and one of the pools. The rooms were clean and comfortable with an ipod dock! (crucial for us) Everyday our room was serviced by the time we came back from site seeing or relaxing on the beach. Note that the rooms in the new suite tower had a small "kitchen" with a fridge, sink, microwave and utensils. It was very handy with leftovers! The bathrooms were also spacious and had just the right amount of room and storage to feel at home. We planned the trip with no schedule or plans - on purpose! We wanted to see what the island had to offer and make arrangements based upon our mood. The hotel offered a bar, multiple restaurants, three pools, a fitness gym and of course the beach! Let's say we had more than enough options to occupy our time. Of course being new to the island we wanted to make sure we also visited Old San Juan, historic sites, the rainforest etc. Victor at the concierge was amazing and so helpful! We told him exactly what we liked to do and he hooked us up with everything from restaurants, a rental car, reservations to go zip-lining and also suggested some "hidden" gems. He also told us what to "skip out" on. All of his suggestions were on point and he even checked in on us to make sure everything turned out as we expected. We met several other couples that were in the same position as us - excited to leave the states, new to Puerto Rico etc. They all had the same feelings and were happy with their choice of hotel. My boyfriend and I left the hotel wishing we could have extended our stay and now all he talks about is going back to Puerto Rico and staying at La Concha again. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “fun, casual yet elegant, upscale yet family friendly”
Reviews.Author: theislanddog
Reviews.Content: Upon landing is Puerto Rico, which we had done a few time prior, we knew the area we were going to, and the Renaissance is right in the heart of the action. some might say that it actually is the heart of the action. if you are one who stays close to the resort, you will find a variety of chioces for meals and snacks. if you wander away, there are so many fine or casual places to eat, have a cocktail, or just walk. the resort itself underwent a huge facelift not long ago, and it is quite lovely. there are several pools, a few more active, and a couple that are quiteter and more private. most offer really fine views of the sea. there is food and beverage service anywhere on the property. they are not hawking cocktails of any other wares, nor are there any street folks trying to beg or sell you things. the beach is rather small, but not crowded, and quite scenic. the waves crashing at one end on a pier, and the soft sand and towering palms make for a nice combination. be aware that you are in a city, and if you get a "city view" or partial water view room or suite, you may not be thrilled with the view. try to remember that although you are on vacation, it is after all, a city, which happens to be on the water. there is a small casino in the hotel, and the huge lobby has live music at certain times. many locals appear to enjoy this place, which is an advantage, as you will find that the people of Puerto Rico are warm, friendly, and eager to have a fun time, or just relax and enjoy family and friends. The staff at this hotel have proved to be quite helpful on a occasions we have stayed there. We don't usually vacation in Puerto Rico, as we like to see a lot of places, but we try to start our cruise vacations from there. The renaissance is the perfect place to unwind and get in vacation mode, and get used to the weather. We try to plan three or four nights there before our cruises, and at least one night there when we reutrn to land. There is quite a variety of units, so ask about things like sepearate stiing areas, balconies, pullout beds, cooktops, refrigerators and microwaves. These are options that could save you a lot of cash if you have a lot of hungry mouths to feed. It make s a vacation much less stressful and less hurried. there is no urgency to meet your flight, as you are on the beach for an extra day. check in was fairly normal, no long lines. You will have no problem getting your needs met, as most staff will speak english well enough to help you. any requests we had were quickly taken care of. Keep in mind this is not a brand new hotel, and some things are a little dated. but don't let thet discourage you. This is a wonderful and safe place for the entire family. prices vary, and if you have Marriott points, you are in luck, as we always use points and happily pay either none, or a small upgrade fee. we have paid up to $100 a night upgrade, but if really isn't necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Xtina39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. The service at this hotel is amazing! Everyone from the guy who brought out our chairs to the beach to the room service waitress was wonderful! Do not miss the tapas bar Solera by the pool. I can almost say this was the best meal we had our entire stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as our first stay, but still a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Tim0say
Reviews.Content: We went this time during prom season where there seemed to be a lot of parties. The hotel itself is beautiful, the suite only tower is new and really nice. The staff was a little inconsistent this time but overall it was okay. Good location to many of the other hotels and decent restaurants and a $20 cab ride to old San Juan. The beach is really nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Coastal_NC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very "Miami-esque". The lobby is very nice with a bar that is popular in the evenings. Our room was oceanfront, on the top floor, so the view couldn't be beat. The room was average for a Renaissance, but had a resort feel to it. The shower was great, but overall the bathroom was very small. Concierge was extremely helpful and made booking a few tours very easy. They also informed us of a festival that was going on at the time and all of the "dos and don'ts" for going down to it. The Club Lounge was on the ground floor, but was more like a restaurant than a typical lounge (had to ask staff for a beverage instead of having a cooler accessible). There were 2 small pools, one was in the shade most of the day. The other stayed packed. There was a hot tub that we enjoyed after a very long day of hiking in the rainforest - a must see. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite, view of the Atlantic”
Reviews.Author: cwhitley
Reviews.Content: My wife picked out this resort for our San Juan visit, and I'm glad she did. We sprung for a suite, and it may be the best hotel room we've ever had. It was spacious, comfortable, had all the conveniences we could want and a fantastic balcony view of the Atlantic Ocean. When we arrived, our room wasn't ready yet, so they gave us a $50 credit to their poolside restaurant while we waited. Downsides were that we needed every bit of that $50 and that the credit hadn't showed up on our final bill (although that was soon removed after bringing it up). We ordered room service breakfast the next morning, which was timely and perfect on the balcony. The rest of the time we bought groceries at a Walgreen's a couple blocks away. It was our anniversary, so we ate at the Perla restaurant, which was expensive but a great dining experience. Food and service were wonderful. Lobby bar was a constant hot spot but still received good service. Good mix of people at the hotel: the young and the beautiful were there, but also families, senior citizens, business travelers and even military personnel. Major downside is the resort fee, which is non-negotiable and expensive. It can make the final bill startling. Only consolation is that it seems to be standard among San Juan resorts. That covers umbrellas, beach chairs and towels, yet that didn't seem like much for the price. Drink and food service is available sometimes on the beach, but it's inconsistent. Still, a wonderful place. We enjoyed San Juan, and we would return to La Concha. P.S. If going to Old San Juan, take the bus which stops right outside the hotel and cost only 50 cents. Good way to see locals and much cheaper than a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Chic comfort and great service!”
Reviews.Author: N_V_adventurers
Reviews.Content: We were at La Concha for 5 nights(6 days) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The infinity pools were the highlight and the helpful staff deserve special mention! The concierge was very helpful and gave us several options for local tours and sights. The other staff at the front desk (Luis comes to mind) were extremely friendly and always ready with tips on the best places for eating/nightlife. Rooms in the new tower (we were on the 11th floor) were clean,spacious and well designed. The area (Condado) was very safe and had numerous eateries (and a Walgreens!). Among the few cons, the business center at the hotel was small and one had to often wait in line to access the computers. Although the security guards tried their best, the adult pool had young kids at times which was a bit uncomfortable. The restaurants at the hotel were a bit pricey and so were the taxis rides to the old city. The hotel should perhaps consider a shuttle to the old city for its guests (even if only at fixed frequencies).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lbk01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautful. A couple things to be aware of. On weekend nights there is a bar downstairs which is the hot spot of the area-if you are there or out late, it won't bother you, but you can hear loud music until very late, so this would not be good for families or if you're trying to sleep. I only noticed it on the weekend nights. In our room the bathroom was very nice but was clear so you could see the person in the shower from the bedroom. This was fine for us a couple but could be a problem depending on who is traveling. When I made the reservation there was an option to check for a free upgrade. It seems we got it because we were given a very nice suite corner room-it had a separate living room when you walked in, and was very large with a balcony along the whole corner. One side had a view of the beach and one side had a view of the city and pool. This hotel is in the Condado area, which is a nice area. There is a small beach. We spent a lot of time in Old San Juan and would take a taxi there.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel in Condado / San Juan!!”
Reviews.Author: luxurymiami
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a week in San Juan where we stayed at La Concha Resort and I have to say that this is the best hotel in the upscale Condado area. I work in the hotel industry and was truly impressed (which doesn't happen very often). Here is what I'd like to share: - LOCATION: the hotel is ON the beach and since it's the last property on the sand stretch, the beach feels like is private - ROOMS: The hotel has a Hotel Tower and a Suite Tower. The rooms in the Hotel Tower have no balcony and no kitchenette, but all Suites do. We were enjoying breakfast on the balcony each morning and that was lovely. - POOLS: the resort has 3 pools and all are very well maintained. The infinity pool adjacent to the suite tower is not restricted for kids but natually draws adults and therefore is quiet. The big pool by the restaurant is surrounded with palm trees and lush greenery and is very exotic. There are two hot jacuzzi tubs that are almost private becasue of teh way they are tucked in the garden - RESTAURANTS: the 5 F&B outlets are all are very well appointed and worth the try. However, there are many restaurants just outside the hotel and if you prefer genuine puertoriocan food, the small inexpensive looking places are just the spots you may be looking for (great tips for restaurants can be found on frommers.com) - STAFF: very friendly and helpful employees troughout the entire hotel - PROXIMITY TO OLD SAN JUAN: La Concha has a bus stop right in front and $0.75 is the fare to Old Town San Juan which is a must see. Taxi ride is $15, also worth it. Overall - this is a hotel I will recommend to everyone looking for an upscale experience in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for romantic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RiaMe
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a 5 day honeymoon. The location was great because it was right ON a great beach, there were plenty of restaurants in the area. The staff was extremely nice, helpful and accomodating. We had the spa-room in the towers suite. I was disappointed at the lack of privacy on the balcony with the spa. We had an end unit and there wasnt a privacy wall to the right of the building so the construction men on the building to the right could see on our balcony. Then the spa balcony's stick out from the back of the building so the balcony's above can see straight down to our balcony. So there was no opportunity for "creative fun" in the balcony. Otherwise the rooms are absoutely beautiful. Our phone never worked and no one ever came to fix it. The food is VERY pricey so I would recommend eating at the resaturants outside the hotel. We were very disappointed at the quality of the breakfast buffett. For two people we spent 47.00! Well we found a great resaturant just walking distance from the hotel and spent 20.00 for a great breakfast for both of us. Wish we had of discovered that place sooner. The Pearla Resaturant has great food...but again expensive. I did like how you can get a van to many of the local attractions. We took the El Yunque Rain Forest van tour one day. Just know that it is not just your hotel guests and you will be with a group. San Juan doesn't offer alot of ACTIVITES per say. So expect to do more beach sun bathing and eating more than anything. Most cab rides are 15.00 even if it's 10 minutes away. Oh and I jus tlove the fact when you stay in the spa tower there is an ADULT ONLY infinity pool. That was awesome! All in all I loved this place and would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsudak
Reviews.Content: Me and my new bride stayed here on part of our honeymoon. The room itself was fantastic. We loved the convenience of walking out the door onto the beach. The concierges were very helpful. We had a great dinner in La Perla, one of the restaurants in the hotel. Last but not least, my man, Jonathan, whose title was likely bellhop, but bent over backwards to assist us in so many ways, he defied any title. Would certainly recommend to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service and beach!”
Reviews.Author: EM_1908
Reviews.Content: I was there in July for a conference but got to stay a few extra days to enjoy the beautiful beach and pools. The staff was very friendly and helpfull at all times. The rooms were modern and spacious, the lobby bar and casino were very entertaining and the gym was just perfect (who doesnt like to train while looking at the ocean). If you eat there, I strongly suggest you try La Perla for dinner, asbsolutely fantastic! The only down side to this hotel is the limited choices of food for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lesteryen
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend to San Juan for 4 days, just to take a break from our demanding jobs. After careful research, I have selected La Concha Resort over Ritz-Carlton or Conrad. It appeared that I have made the correct decision. Upon our arrival, we were offered an option to upgrade ourselves to a one-bedroom suite at the new tower by paying an upgrade fee of $60 per night. We ended up taking the offer and we found ourselves in a huge one-bedroom suite at the corner of the new tower. This suite can be connected to a standard room next door to form a two-bedroom suite, which is good if you are visiting with a huge family. The layout of the suite was good. The living room was spacious, and was equipped with a large sofa bed and an armchair. There was a dining area, and it was situated next to the windows, providing excellent ocean view. There was also an open kitchen, equipped with microwave and electric stove. The king-sized bed inside the bedroom was very comfortable. There was a balcony outside the bedroom, which was equipped with 2 chairs. The bathroom was enclosed by a glass wall, which resulted in a bit of inconvenience as I was sharing the suite with my friend. Whilst the suite was nicely appointed, I believe certain aspects of the resort should be improved. First, the quality of the breakfast was mediocre. Limited variety of food and fruits were offered at the breakfast buffet. I would expect more from a Renaissance resort. Second, housekeeping was done in a slow fashion. Our suite was usually not cleaned until the afternoon and housekeeping was only offered once a day. For a resort of this class, I would expect twice daily housekeeping services to be offered. Guests staying at resorts use up a lot of towels, as they visit swimming pools and the beach multiple times per day. Therefore, it is important that the resort is able to replenish towels for guests quickly. Third, poolside services should be improved. I was asked for my room number and I had to sign a piece of paper, acknowledging that I had taken some towels for my own use at the swimming pool. What I hated most was that, I was asked to return those towels that I took to the booth when I had finished using them, or I would be charged $15 for each towel that I did not return. In conclusion, this is an above average resort. Its quality was in line with what I had expected from a Renaissance resort. It will become a top class resort if the housekeeping and poolside services can be improved.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE it...Over & Over..Goin Back AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: Vinnypep
Reviews.Content: First, I have been here before but have never written a review...until now because I felt the Hotel & it's employees deserved some recognition... ~OVERALL...This is, in my opinion, a GREAT HOTEL, GREAT ALWAYS Smiley, courteous, professional staff, It has a Great Lobby scene, Clean rooms & Great food (SOLERA during the day is Awesome~Try the steak wrap)) ~I arrived on July 3 at 10am in San Juan. The hotel knew in advance i would be checking in Early ( I always take the 6am flight from JFK). I always expect that they would not honor the early arrival because check out is noon. Well, when I checked in at the front desk the clerks we're SUPER Smiley and polite...They took my cell phone # & as fast as i ordered my first mojito I got a call & my room was READY at 1030 am. Awesome start! That day I had the pleasure of meeting a Manager of the Ocean Lounge, Mr. Michael Tischler. What an awesome guy..So polite, professional & respectful. First asking your name, then for 6 days Never forgetting it and always addressing me as Mr. X(my last name)...No matter what problem or concern, however small or large, He always made you feel as it was his ONLY concern. He invited me into the Ocean lounge one morning and Mr. Tischler, as i watch, made EVERY person in the lounge feel as if they were the ONLY person. Real Professionalism and just a great host. (I bumped into him at the front desk also later on in the week where he was helping a staff that was clearly bogged down by multiple checkins/outs etc...Does this guy ever leave?) GREAT Host & Manager!! ~On to my vacation...The property is gorgeous the pools are well maintained, the Large pool in the center and the infinity pool on the beach are ok, the area a little messy & LOADED with kids running around and screaming...fine (they should make the Upper pool in the center with the jacuzzis ADULT ONLY) I stayed by the new tower infinity pool which IS labeled as ADULT ONLY...so great not to have screaming kids playing beachball in the pool. One day there were some families with kids who got by and Mr Tischler actually asked them to leave the pool area...very courteous & the family apologized and went to the other pool area. There are two things lacking in this area-#1.STAFF-6 days i was there, there was ONLY 1 Server for the ADULT pool/beach area...this poor guy(i think his name was Jomar) was running like a nut all over the place and people were tryin so hard to get drinks etc..WAY understaffed, but Jomar attended to EVERYONE...carrying trayloads of drinks......#2.SECURITY-Really sad that this is a Renaissance/Marriot Property and lackin in certain security. I am a Former Detective and it's just not good and they should take a look at it. Basically anyone can walk up from the beach and use the pools.( I saw it happen more than once while there)The Marriot Stellaris uses a Bracelet system which i think is good. If you want to bring guests up, just show your key or bracelet. Also the inner security, keeping kids OUT of the Adult pool area and Stop unecessary annoyance in the regular pool area, when necessary. ~Also a great manager, Tania, my last day there was a little issue with a wedding on my floor, the cleanup went until 6am...unfortuantely my room was next to the service hallway and i was kept up...i called down & had an angry tone and she apoligized and took care of it..askin the men to please keep it down, always maintaining professionalism ~I was missing one server from my 3 previous vacations here-Sandra Morales Cruz-She was probably the best server I've had at La Concha or any other hotel for that matter. I was told she was on vacation(go figure) and that she also has moved into Sales. The way she was as a server, always professional, yet fun & joking and always knew how to make the guest happy~ I'm sure she'd be an asset to sales...a BIG loss for the servers! ~A Great Casino Shift manager-Rafy Avila- knows how to treat good customers and knows how to get rid of the annoying ones! ~Being there for 6days there was so much that i couldn't remember it all..Happy Good Times! ~Honorable mentions for being GREAT, David & Yalila ~~I really wish, being a 6x repeat customer, i could speak directly to the owners, just to see their expressions when i tell them what a great job their employees are doing!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: shellbell45
Reviews.Content: Awesome Resort. Very modern and fun. In a tourist area so quite a few homeless lurking around but still felt safe. 3 Pools and a great fitness center. Staff was Wonderful! They upgraded our room to a suite.. free! Food is very expensive at the resort but is expensive all over Ashton Ave. If you are going to eat out ... eat at the hotel. It is expensive but VERY good. Walgreens nearby. We ended up buying all of our beer at the grocery store and drinking at the resort to say money for our 7 day stay because drinks range from $5-$10. There were a few bad reviews about the beach but I thought it was breathtaking. *If you get a chance .. go to Culebra Island. Heard from everyone that they have the best beaches. Only an hour ferry ride away :) Can't wait to go back! Whatever you do.. don't drink the water there! I got very sick :(

Reviews.Title: “NIce, but some downsides”
Reviews.Author: KristyneA
Reviews.Content: We went on a weekend trip over Memorial Day. The hotel and grounds are really nice - the pools are beautiful and the tower rooms (where we were) are spacious and clean. With the tiny kitchen and the living room, you could live there for a while! Being right on the (lovely) beach is fantastic. Food is good and not expensive. The breakfast is lovely and yummy and nicely priced. Things I did not like - service was ok to poor. To give an example, on the first day we went to the beach and asked for chairs and an umbrella. We were told we were only "allowed" two chairs and one umbrella (even though we could see a big pile of both, unused). ( We are a family of five and rented two tower rooms.) When we told the Beach Guy that we had rented two rooms, he "allowed" us two more chairs (now total 4) , but was really angry and surly about it and slammed them around, almost smacking my daughter in the legs. Later, when he was off doing something else my husband had to "sneak" another umbrella and a fifth chair so we could all have chairs. This seemed ridiculous to me and spoiled the beginning of the day. Between the two room and meals for 5, I spent a lot of there - so to be begrudged a few lawn chairs really irked. Second, the elevator in the garage broke and slammed into the first floor. Although we fell only about a foot, the impact caused the Plexiglas screen over the elevator light fixture to fall down and hit my ten year old quite hard in the head. After being trapped in the hot hot garage elevator for about 20 minutes, the hotel staff thankfully was able to crowbar us out. Elevators break, I know, so not complaining about that, but some inquiry into whether the sobbing girl was hurt and some ice would have been nice. Instead I had to drag her upstairs crying to get ice from the freezer and figure out if she was seriously hurt. (Not, thankfully). Third (and this is not the hotel's fault), a major part of the clientele was just really really horrible. I don't care if people want to curse and drink and be a little wild (I do, sometimes!), but screaming the F-word across the beach and yelling off-color "requests" to bikini clad college girls so we all can hear, kind of spoiled the day. Just to be clear, I am separating my opinion of the behavior from the fact that it was so loud that we all had to be involved. If you find this annoying, as I do, don't go. If you want to go there and act like this, please can you do it less ostentatiously? All in all, nice trip. I love PR - I don't know why more people do not go!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: lorilorilori825
Reviews.Content: My husband and I liked everything about this hotel. The decor, the staff and not to mention the lovely blue water. Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle204
Reviews.Content: I generally do not do hotel reviews, but I feel customers should know the truth. You dont want to experience what I experienced. My hotel stay here was not nice. My first day checking in, I arrived early for early check in after providing me with a room upon my arrival, I checked my room and the air conditioner didn't work. They called the repair guy who took about twenty min trying to fix it. Remind you the room was still hot , the repair guy could not confirm if it was fixed. We then asked to move rooms immediately. I was told Puerto Rico is hot and it is the repair guy job to fix the AC , and initailly told all rooms was booked, but they could place me in a smaller connecting room. I wanted what I requested and a higher level because of the music level in the lobby. So after speaking with a manager , I didn't have to wait long she tried to tell me the same initally about them being overbook. I said I understand but I have arrived three hours early and check in is not until four, so then I gave them time to work on it she came back in fourty min and they got me a new room. But still bothered you would initally tell a guess well you have to give the air conditioner guy time to work on the ac. Ms I am on vacation and would like to go in my room and relax. Oh and my favorite part PR is hot. smh. Yes, I am aware of that, but I dont want a hot room. But she did try so I tried to be postive. But for the amount of money they charge, it is not good service. Second, you need to know the area is not clean. Next door the people put garbage out right in front, so for me it didn't feel like a resort and homeless people were sitting on the ground . Please listen to me when I say check your credit card statement, Laconche charges a $400 dallor resort fee in additon to what you are paying . I was told this is normal. , I have stayed in hotels all over. Many hold your card as a reassurance, but do not charge it or just charge the first night of your stay. Well they charged my card by the third night and additional two hundred and ninteen dallors . Then upon check out charged me an additional two hundred dallors and 19 again.I was told my bill was already paid. I only new this because I called my bank and check right away before leaving the hotel . They advised me my card would not be charge it was only a hold. Then later I was told they held the four hundred the money will not be released for seven to ten days. Why would you hold the four hundred after you already have your money for the nights we stayed. Most importantly you should make the customer aware of this initally before arriving. Do you think they apologized are said sorry for the inconvience.Upgraded me any form or did anything to makeup no. I was shocked when I checked out. So I had to have them write a statement to my cc company to release my money back to my card. Remind you when I booked the room I was not made aware of this at all. They never mentioned a four hundred dallor fee in additon to what you are paying. . I paid the full amount the day before for the room.She didn't expect me to call my bank right away thou. The cleaning of the rooms were half done. they just make the beds . The ocean view in the Ocean tower is nice, but no place to sit on your balcony and the terrance sliding door window looked like it had not been cleaned in years. The jacuzzi jets were not working fully. One had a low temperature so it was like being in the regular tub. I will say the lobby bell men were very helpful and my trip to Puerto Rico itself was nice But the hotel pictures makes you feel like you are going to stay some where beautiful. Oh and my trip to the rainforest was cancel the morning of and I planned that also ahead of time. I assumed not enough people to go. But it would of been nice to get a coutesy call the night before . They slide that along witht the bill in my door. The lobby is nice looking, but that is about it.You can really tell this hotel need renovations around the jacuzzi paint is chipping. and the furniture in the rooms. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LuisGGiraldo
Reviews.Content: Great, chic, posh, modern. Incredible service, amazing new rooms. Everything about this hotel was A+. Evenings at the lobby bar are the place to be. Wether business or pleasure La Concha is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Modern and MUCH better than El San Juan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David_and_Lauren
Reviews.Content: After suffering through 5 days in Fajardo, we arrived here for the back end 3 days of our trip and....wow, what a difference -- especially juxtaposed against El conquistador (a poorly managed, and unkept historic hotel which still prides itself as luxurious). The La Concha lobby is beautiful and modern. There are 2 infinity pools facing the beach and a main pool in the center of the "U shaped" hotel layout that has no beach views but it very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect - right in between Isla Verde and Old San Juan - on a great stretch of sand. 15 minutes East to Isla Verde, 15 minutes West to Old San Juan. Perfect. You get the best of both worlds. The service was EXCELLENT! Room service was quick, friendly and helpful. Concierge took the time to address every question we had and make all reservations for us (check out the tapas at El Convento in Old San Juan). When booking, we were undecided between this hotel and El San Juan, which many of our friends had claimed was "the" hotel for San Juan. While there, we made it a point to visit El San Juan and we were both thrilled with our choice. El San Juan hotel is farther from Old San Juan town, which is significant when paying taxi's to take you into town every day and you're dealing with a 30 minute ride each way rather than a 15-minute ride. Also, El San Juan had a gorgeous lobby but many of the facilities were older and seemed run down, the pool area had a very "suspect" crowd, and we generally got a "darker" feel to this hotel rather than a light, airy, breezy, and elegant feel, which is what La Concha is. By the way, La Concha is in Condado which reminds me greatly of South Beach. It felt like South Beach - not like a tropical island. Note 3 things about La Concha: (1) the rooms are small and, if you are in the corner area with an ocean view (as we did), there is no terrace. They claim there is but it is actually just a large window with a sticker that calls the window a "balcony." See picture. (2) the continental breakfast at Aroma Cafe is not really a breakfast at all. The selection is comparable to a Starbucks - it's a grab-on-the-go place with one coffee and a choice of 2 of the following items: croissant, bagel, yogurt, cereal or fruit cup. On the first day we tried it, noticed the fruit was literally spoiled, and then proceeded to the restaurant for the infinitely better ($22/pp) breakfast with an omlet, waffles, fresh fruit, etc; and (3) La Concha is a trendy nightlife hotel (like Delano in South Beach or the Gansevoort in NYC) so be prepared to have techno music in the elevators and a club scene in your lobby all night long. The music didn't stop until 4:30AM so if you think you're sleeping with an open window and the sounds of the ocean waves, you're sadly mistaken. You'll be listening to JLo and Pitbull instead. Overall - we HIGHLY recommend this hotel and if we return, there is no other place we would stay. No question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...But needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: Aplus
Reviews.Content: My family and I just came home from an 8 day vacation in PR in La Concha...I'm a research queen so when I travel I like to know what to expect and I never really write reviews but I felt like now I needed to. Â First I will say that La Concha is a very nice looking hotel..lobby,pools,room in the new tower..etc. BUT this is not a family hotel, this is for adults..couples, girls weekend..etc..it's a party place and it is noisy more on the weekends..in the new towers where I specifically asked for you do get less noise but there were about 3 nights that it was hard to sleep. Now I tried to be openminded about the bad service reviews about this hotel but it was on the money which really bothers me because they claim to be a 4 star resort and for the price u pay!! I usually do nice resorts on the norm bc of the service and cleanliness but it was not good here. The maid service was totally lacking, yes we had new towels everyday but the floor was not cleaned and my 2 kids kept sneezing bc it was so dusty ..the housekeeper was nice enough but she also left items like a bottle of some strong smelling cleaning liquid in the bathroom counter which my 3 yr old could reach,the sheets were never changed in a week!! At the pool I have to say that Brock and another older lady who's name I forgot were great aside from them the pool waiters were rude they would just walk by and ignore people who wanted service! The front valet guys Victor and another young man who I really wish I remembered his name were great!!! I also think that the pools were way too small for a resort. All in all I wouldn't go back there... the service was just not as it should be and for the money I spent it should of been top notch and I'm not a hotel snob by far...but being helpful in the service industry is a must and the whole cleanliness thing really grossed me out!! Another family next to us had a different housekeeping person and they still had bad service! So for fun and party yes the vibe is good for pretty pictures it's great too but the service is not 4 stars at all. I hope they read all these service issues bc seriously I won't be going back there.Â

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our visit to Puerto Rico and stay at La Concha!!”
Reviews.Author: mzmartin07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Puerto Rico to celebrate 4 year anniversary. Cabs are always waiting at airport and outside hotel. Cab fare to hotel $18 for 2 people. We stayed at the La Concha Renaissance. The hotel was nice with beach access. 3 pools and you sometimes have to pick your time to visit because the pools can become overcrowded at times. 3 restarants onsite which were kind of pricey. However, there are many restaurants along the strip to choose from. These include Subway, Wendys, Danny's International - which has a very extensive menu and a good option for breakfast. There is much to see and a lot of walking in Old San Juan. Bus ride to Old San Juan is 75 cents per person each way and you will need exact change. They have trolleys in Old San Juan that you can ride for free to see the sites there and you can hop on and off of them at whatever stop you want. Be prepared to wait if you do get off for the next one to come by. All in all the trip was great!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: mamasita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha for 10 nights at the end of June. It must be one of the top hotels in San Juan. My daughter was traveling with a group and they were staying at the San Juan Marriott down the street and it also seemed very nice. Here are my impressions: Facilities: La Concha is a category 6 Marriott, buy you have to keep in mind that it is in a city and in the Caribbean. The design in upscale and trendy but being in a city, they don't have room for the grand entryways, large swimming pools, and lush landscaping that you do find in other Caribbean resorts. That being said, the hotel is very attractive and immaculately clean! The pools are small, but they were not crowded when we were there. One of them is designated for adults only, but it seems not everyone gets that message, so nearly every time we went there, a lone family would come by with kids. The staff don't necessarily say anything unless you ask them to, which is kind of awkward. I would recommend a tasteful sign to help that situation. (I love kids and have 3 of my own, but sometimes I go on vacation without them, and it is nice to be at a pool that is quiet, with no splashing.) Rooms: We stayed in a 2 BR suite, because our daughter was with us for part of the trip. It was great for us because we had two separate rooms (hers had the sofa bed), a full kitchen, and a large bathroom in between the rooms. The jetted tub was a nice surprise too. There was also an ocean view balcony, which was very pleasant. The room was kept very clean and well- supplied. We did have a problem with the AC the first few days, but we seemed to work it out. We heard that in June and July, dust from the Sahara desert settles over Puerto Rico and affects the weather, so it was very humid. It was hard to get the humidity out of the room, so it ended up feeling cold but damp. We didn't complain, just tried to figure it out, and finally when it rained, we opened up the balcony and the "front door" to air out and that seemed to fix the problem. Food: We didn't eat much at the hotel, because there is so much right outside to choose from, but what we did have was excellent. Except for the coffee!! When we travel to the Caribbean, I look forward to the great coffee, but something's wrong in San Juan! We only tried the concierge lounge, but the coffee was terrible - very weak. This was not just a problem at the hotel, either. The Dunkin Donuts coffee was weak and overly sweet. Also weak at the breakfast place across the street. Baffling! The best coffee I had was at the Subway right across from the hotel, where you can get a small cup of good coffee. There was a Starbucks several blocks down, but I was discouraged and didn't try that. There are many good restaurants within walking distance, and this was very convenient. There are also some fast food options if you just need something familiar, but "fast" is relative, so plan ahead. Subway was fine, but when we went to Wendy's, what looked to us like an average lunch line (10 people?) took 45 minutes to get through! Location: The hotel is very conveniently located to many restaurants, some shopping, and all necessities (There are two Walgreens stores within walking distance.) Old San Juan is a 10 minute taxi ride away. And of course, you are right on the beach. The city was surprisingly clean, and we felt safe walking at night. It does seem that San Juan is suffering economically. There are many hotels or apartments that look like they have been abandoned or are for sale. The restaurants were not nearly full. There were a few homeless people on the streets. But again, we felt safe and were not harassed by anyone. Staff: We had no problems with check in or other services. The concierge was friendly and enthusiastic and gave us lots of good advice. Service at the pools is a little sparse, so you may want to order before you get too hungry or thirsty! But the most memorable part of this hotel was Felix, at the front door. Even on a rainy day, Felix is like sunshine and makes you feel like the most special guest in the hotel! We send him a big, leap in the air high-five! So if you are staying in San Juan, La Concha is a great choice, and probably one of the top few hotels in the city. It is clean, convenient and friendly. Say hi to Felix for us!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time may be last”
Reviews.Author: mimiSanSaba_Texas
Reviews.Content: 2nd time at the la concha. loved it the first time. hated it this time. the room was so hot. The front desk sent someone up to look at he AC. They did not speak english so it was totaly useless. They need help with people skills. I paid to much for my room with so little service. The only highlight was the tour to the rainforest. We had Gina as a tour guide. She was excellant and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful- would go back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: sarahevery
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend for 4 nights, expecting a great hotel as others had previously mentioned to us that it was the nicest hotel you could find in the San Juan area. They were right! We had a very late check in (3AM to be exact!) and walked right into the hotel, checked in took 5 minutes, and were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving--what a breeze! I wish all hotels were like this! I actually felt like the hotel's website did not do it justice in describing the rooms. Our room (Ocean Tower, Ocean View room with King Bed) offered much more than described, including a microwave, a more than mini-fridge with an ice maker, a cook-top with pots and pans, a sink, and everything you would need to cook and eat a meal in your room. Although we didn't use the stuff, it was nice to know it was there! We did use the microwave to heat up tons of leftovers -- (the restaurants around the hotel serve very generous portions). The pool areas were beautiful. One pool (somewhat small) is adults only, which we enjoyed. It is one of two small pools that are ocean-front. They also offer bar & food service at that pool via a waiter. The large pool is behind the hotel, which overlooks Ashford Ave. There are plentiful chairs, and the atmosphere was great, despite screaming children. There are 2 hot tubs on both sides of the pool that are covered as well, which was nice when the afternoon showers came through. There are also tables & chairs you can order food from near the pool as well. I'm not sure what some of the other reviews were referring to when complaining about the maid service. Ours was perfect. Our bed had fresh sheets on it every day and we had fresh towels in the bathroom. Everything was always straightened in the bathroom, but they did not touch our suitcases (which I liked). The lobby bar was fun too at night. There were lots of people our age (25-30) hanging out at the bar after 10-11ish and they have a live DJ Friday & Saturday nights, which was cool. We never had to leave the hotel to have a good time at night. We also hung out in the casino for quite a few hours each night (yes, the drinks are free), and managed to win a few hundred on the BlackJack tables. Someone else also hit the Jackpot on a slot machine behind us one night as well for around $2,000. The dealers at the tables were great--I highly recommend Luis and Jennie. Jennie is like a huidini when she deals...and all the dealers speak perfect Spanish and English and go between the two with such ease! The beach was someone empty when we were there, which I kind of liked, but is definitely swim-able, unlike what other reviewers say. The rocks they are speaking of are to the East & West about 100 yards each way, so you have plenty of room to swim. The only complaint I have about this hotel (and I hate to even give them one) was that we scheduled a late checkout (instead of 12pm, we had to be out by 1pm), and we tried to come back to our room at 12:30 to get our stuff to leave, our keys didn't work. It took about 30 minutes to get someone to let us back into our room (The front-desk people tried to re-program the keys, but it didn't work). So we didn't end up leaving our room until about 1:30...but didn't get charged a fee because it wasn't our fault. There were several other people on our floor that had the same issue, but it all worked out in the end. The concierge was very nice and helpful as well. They tell you which tours are BS and which ones are worth it. Our iterary follows: (and I wouldn't have changed a thing!) 1st day: Bioluminescent Bay tour via Kayak at night (Absolutely amazing- once in a lifetime experience that you must do!!--take the late tour on a moon-less night) 2nd day: Rented a car to drive to rainforest--hiked to La Mina falls--beautiful! Night: Ate at Orozco's about a 2 minute walk from La Concha (Authentic PR food- GREAT!) 3rd Day: Old San Juan, checked out forts & went shopping) Night: Ate at di Parma Trattoria (Italian, 2 minute walk from La Concha-- AMAZING) 4th Day: Pool, Casino, Luonge around & check out the rest of the hotel Other notes: There is a Walgreens about a 5-10 minute walk away from La Concha that has bottled water & necessities you forgot at home. *This walgreens does not have refridgerated food like we are used to in the US...FYI. There is also a Wendy's about 2 minutes away as well--convenient and cheap! We used Charlie Car Rental (stand is about 5-10 minute walk from La Concha) and were very satisfied--car was clean, cheap & ran well.)

Reviews.Title: “Poor poor service!”
Reviews.Author: W0rldT0See
Reviews.Content: I made reservation two months ahead of time, called in on the day of our arrival to let the service desk know that our flight was delayed and that we will be getting in much later than anticipated. When we showed up at the hotel we were told that the hotel was overbooked for the night and there were no rooms available! They weren't even going to come up with alternative accommodations for us because "we just had reservations and were not charged for the room!" I actually had to call my credit card company to find out that they did actually charge my card! What a horrible way to start the vacation! We ended up staying at a different hotel, which Renaissance paid for, but it was not at all what we expected from our one day stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and hospitality - right in the middle of dining and nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: geminirock
Reviews.Content: There are so many great local places to eat and go out to within a 10 minutes walk in either direction from the hotel. You are also a short taxi ride from Old San Juan where you'll find the more tourist-oriented shopping and dining. The grounds surrounding the hotel are beautiful and well kept, and we especially appreciated the adult-only pool that overlooked the ocean. We had many questions upon arriving and the Concierge staff were patient and helpful in directing us to sites and restaurants - and their suggestions were spot on!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and the people”
Reviews.Author: WardfamilyInland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was awesome and the staff was great. Oriana is the most fabulous bartender and Jonathon and Felix in bell service are phenomenal. The friendliness and the assistance provided to my family was exceptional. I am already planning our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Good place to launch the bachelor party”
Reviews.Author: WVProud
Reviews.Content: We went July 7-10 with 10 guys for a bachelor party. Had a great time. It was a good launching point with good service. Rooms were big and the hotel bar was busy. The casino wasn't really busy which was nice sometimes and boring others. Only down side- I thought their website pictures were a bit misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Trendy, Hip, Chic, Sexy”
Reviews.Author: EL_GQ
Reviews.Content: My partner and I checked in on July 4-8th 2011. We have no negative comments to say about this hotel. The valet guys are super. Hector the valet/bellman always greeted us with a smile and made us feel welcomed. The Front Desk was excellent. Kristina and Hector the Front Desk team was helpful and knowledgeable and were always willing to help. My partner and I reserved an ocean view King Size bed and it was amazing. The beds were comfy and the shower was spacious. Our room came with a mini ref. and a sofa. The only complaint I will have is that there is a an adult only pool and I spotted non-adults in this pool. The sushi joint inside was great along with the hotel lobby bar. This hotel earns an A. Trendy, chic, hip and reminded me a lot of the Standard Hotel in Downtown Los Angeles but better. There is always something going on in the hotel lobby from music to live tango dancers. This hotel is connected to a Casino with slots and tables. Kinda of pricy but worth it. It comes with a full size gym that offers Zumba and Spinning class to free personal training sessions. This hotel is located in the upcale area of Condando and there is a lot of police so it made us feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service; Mediocre for its Price”
Reviews.Author: Aalynia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in an ocean suite room (hot tub on the balcony) and were looking for a nice, relaxing vacation to celebrate our honeymoon and upcoming life changes. In our experience, this is not the place to do so. We requested early Check-in (we arrived at 2:00-2:15ish), and despite my husband's status as a platinum member, we were told we could not check in. Fine--these things happen--but certainly not a good start to our trip. The check-in attendant suggested we walk around and see the area. Exiting the front of the hotel and making a right, there is one block of somewhat high-end shopping (e.g. Cartier and the likes). Go past that block and there is a store where you can stock up on your own liquor/food and, since we had a kitchenette, we opted to do just that. We came back around 3:30 and, much to our surprise, the room was still not complete. They have a guaranteed check-in time of 4; they were done at 3:58. Since we didn't want to wait further, we asked if we could just have our bags instead of waiting for the bellhop to bring them up. We were told they would be brought to us. After waiting another 20 minutes, my husband asked where they were and was told "Oh they're outside with the bellhop." My husband went outside, got them, and we went up to the room. At this point we've been waiting for two hours, but we finally enter the room. The room we were given was a corner room, which led to our initial excitement that finally everything was remedied and we could get this show on the road. We went out onto the balcony and, lo-and-behold, our corner faced the ocean in the front and a very questionable building to the side. It looked like an extremely run-down apartment, with a vacant construction lot to the side. Given our desire to enjoy the balcony's hot tub, this was not an optimal environment. We go inside, my husband requests a change in room, and I begin noticing some issues in the room: there are red stains on the comforter, black spots in the shower, mold spores on the ceiling (along with a dingy smell of mold), even minor things like typos in the menus and such. My husband complained to the manager, and he gave my husband Marriott points (really, we have more than enough of those) and worked on changed the room. An hour later, the room was changed and the manager came over with us to make sure it was acceptable, and it would have been...if it weren't for the smell of smoke in the room. Now, Marriotts are smoke-free facilities, so there should not have been a smokey smell.
