The manager seemed to not notice it, until we went on the balcony and noticed cigarette burns in the lounge furniture. Granted, the manager was angered by this and would have to fine the previous customers, and this is certainly not his fault. But the fact of the matter is that my husband is sensitive to the smell of smoke. This made it difficult to enjoy the room. Upon stating so, the manager brought room service over to spray the room down. They (1) barely spoke English, so we couldn't ask them anything, and (2) were unable to rid the room of the smell, instead only masking the odor in perfumes. The hot tub--the key reason we wanted that room--had very, very limited instructions that did not explain where the valve to plug it in was located (in a hidden corner behind the tub). Ergo, to our foolish belief, we thought the tub would plug itself or somesuch, which it did not. We called maintenance to help us figure out what to do, which is when we learned of the valve. Also, the digital system on the tub did not work (but note that the instructions discussed using the system to check temperature), so we called maintenance again. He explained that none of the digital aspects of the tub worked in any of the rooms. As such, we were unable to check the temperature. By 9:30 or so, we finally had the tub ready to go. During the tubbing situation, we went to the lounge for gold/platinum guests, which was nice. It was relatively large, had an array of options, an honor bar, and the employees were kind. The TV was a bit blurred though and perhaps should be replaced. We ended up only staying one night, leaving to go to a different hotel in the US Virgin Islands. Yes, once the kinks were worked out, the people were amiable, but it was more of a "paying-for-what-its-worth" situation; for the amount we were paying on this vacation (and given my husband's platinum status), we shouldn't have had to go through what we went through. Additionally, the beach area had some vagrants sleeping and walking around on the beach area--it just wasn't comfortable and it didn't make me feel safe. Leaving this hotel was one of the best decisions we made.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: beachluvrNJ
Reviews.Content: I recently surprised my boyfriend with a trip to La Concha for his birthday (6/26 to 7/1). We saw La Concha last year and knew that next time we visited San Juan, that would be where we would stay. The lobby looked so cool and they had just added a new tower. Iâ€™ve never written a review before, but after our recent stay, I decided to do so. The moment we got out of the cab at La Concha, we received a very warm welcome. The lobby is gorgeous -- so sleek, bright and modern. Check-in was a breeze. We were in our ocean front room in the Suite Tower within minutes. The room was perfect; separate living room/dining/kitchenette area and bedroom - nice size, very clean and modern with plenty of storage. A nearly full-size refrigerator was a plus also, not to mention the two large flat screen televisions. The bathroom was great; the shower was so nice, with an overhead rain shower --- very sexy too --- with itâ€™s frosted glass walls which separate the shower from the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable. When we were in the room, we probably spent more time on the great balcony over looking the ocean than in the room itself. A nice touch was the cheese/fruit tray that was sent to our room since we were there for a special occasion. The lay-out of the resort is very good for its size. Very nice atmosphere with beautiful palm trees and tropical plants. There are 3 pools, two which overlook the beach, with plenty of lounge chairs. The pools are not large, but big enough to cool off in. There are also many comfortable areas outside just to relax and enjoy a drink or food. Servers come around frequently to take your food or beverage order, even on the beach. The drinks were great and the food delicious. We found the prices about the same that youâ€™d pay at any nice resort. The food and service at Solera is very good -- really enjoyed the burgers, the Latin sliders and the tapas after 6 p.m. Vladimir and the others waiters/waitresses took great care of us! Dinner was delicious at Voga, as was the outstanding service we received from Rushtid! Breakfast was also very good - omelettes made to order, and anything else you could want for breakfast. Or you could get a light breakfast at the Lobby Bar in the morning. Cocktails at the Lobby Bar were great! Arianna is very sweet and makes a perfect Mojito! The employees are so nice and courteous, and always smiling and ready to assist you with whatever you may need. The resort is beautiful, well-maintained and in a very convenient area. Decent casino too. We felt safe walking on Ashford Avenue, even in the evening. Very convenient to restaurants and stores. The beach is really nice too with chairs and umbrellas provided for guests. Weâ€™ve been to San Juan a number of times in the past, so we know that the ocean isnâ€˜t as calm as on other islands, but it was actually a bit calmer than usual. We had a great time and would highly recommend this resort. Five nights were not enough for us. We didnâ€™t experience any of the negative things that other reviewers have written about. A vacation is what you make it! Special thanks to Mr. Arroyo and Mr. Santiago who saved the evening of my boyfriendâ€™s birthday for us! They do a great job at running the resort -- and itâ€™s nice that they are always nearby ensuring things are running well. Loved it! Weâ€™ll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it--perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: kyleandcrystal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel July 2-5, 2011. My husband and I had never been to Puerto Rico and wanted to stay close to San Juan, but still be on the beach. We narrowed it down to two and based on our past stays with Renaissance hotels and TripAdvisor chose this one. It was a $20 cab ride (including tip) from the airport. The lobby is very pretty--all white with touches of red and orange. Very modern. The check in process was easy. Our room was not ready, but they gave us two complimentary drinks and called when our room was ready. The hotel stored our bags and delivered them to our room. This wasn't a problem since we were starving. There are dozens of great restaurants walking distance from the hotel. Another reason we decided on the La Concha. Our room was very nice. Beautiful furnishings and an amazing view. The bathroom was large with plenty of storage. There was not a dresser or drawers, which was interesting since we brought shorts and t-shirts. But there was a shelf in the closet that worked. We stayed in room 811 and had a great view. The undertow is extremely strong here and the beaches are not sandy white--that is just part of Puerto Rico. We never had a problem with the neighborhood. Yes there were panhandlers, but we ignored them and they never bothered us. We were there for the weekend of the 4th and there was always a large police presence. In fact we did the three mile walk (during the day) from La Concha to Old San Juan and never felt unsafe. The lobby bar on Saturday is a happening place! Very lively and loud. But once in our room we didnâ€™t really hear the noise over the ocean. On Monday there was a band at the plaza next to the hotel that we could hear in our room. But they stopped playing by 7:00 pm. It is a $15 cab ride to Old San Juan, which I thought was a little high, but the fares are regulated. Our only problem: Before going up to our room, we stopped at the lobby bar to have a drink. This was probably our only complaint about the hotel. The service at the bar was not great. The bartender looked right at us and then walked away. Finally, after five or six minutes she came over to help us. We were two of twelve people there. This wouldnâ€™t have been a big deal if she was helping another customer, but she wasnâ€™t . Bottom Line: I would stay here again. The location is fantastic. The neighborhood is convenient and safe for a large city. I am always concerned about the safety of hotels and never felt unsafe here. It is great for a relaxing weekend and group trip. But we arrive places and try to embrace the local culture and fare and not fight it. The front desk, beach attendants, concierge and bell hops were amazing! They all deserve huge kudos. We chose this hotel in part because of the reviews--so this is as objective of a review as I can give and has information I look for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend - We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: mskeeinmd
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from a fourth of July - all girls getaway. I loved the hotel and the staff were absolutely wonderful! From the moment we arrived from the airport, they took care of everything. They upgraded us to an ocean room view. We relaxed in the lobby sipping drinks and eating tapas while my luggage was delivered to my room. They have 4 pools and each one is fabulous. There is the infinity pool that overlooks the ocean and this is the adults only pool. You have quick and easy access to the beach. The beach is wonderful, but the guys who pull out the chairs and put up your umbrellas seem like they would rather be doing another job. I tipped $5.00 just for putting out my chair and umbrella. The housekeeping staff was very attentive as well. We asked for extra washcloths and towels because we showered at least twice a day from the beach and humidity. They were more than accomodating. The tapas bar in the lounge and Solera on the beach and pool were my favorite restaurants. My friends enjoyed the sushi from the sushi spot! One thing we can all agree on is that La Perla was a waste of money. We all enjoy 5 star dining, but this wasn't it. We ordered the chef's four course tasting. Therisotto was horrible. It was crunchy and we were told that it was al dente. I don't think I've ever eaten crunchy rice. The service at this restaurant was so unbelieveably slow. Don't waste your money there. Also try, Jam Rum Bar & Bistro for great food and drinks. Pelayo is also a great spot for breakfast with the best food at $10 or less. It's about a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: trizi01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the long 4th of July weekend. Our flight was delayed for 3+ hours on Friday night and we did not check into the hotel until 3AM...no problem at all. The lobby was still very lively and check in was a breeze. The room was very nice. It had a small refrigerator and it was very clean. The entire hotel is very well kept. I've read many complaints about the shower, it did not bother me at all. I enjoyed the dual shower heads, they both worked well and the shower was spacious. We were very hungry when we arrived so we went up to the room, showered and went out to get something to eat. Easily found food close by at this hour. After, we stopped by the casino and got back to our room after 6AM. The bed is the most comfortable bed I've slept on at a hotel and the pillows are heavenly!! The view from our room was gorgeous but I missed having a balcony. We had an end unit which did not even have any balcony at all and that was a disappointment. Although, I liked that the large window opened up and I could hear the ocean, just not the same as sitting out on your balcony. We had lunch by the pool at Solera and it was delicious...so was the Sangria and White Lace cocktail :) We spent the day at the adult pool and security did great with not allowing any kids in. This spot of the hotel was very quiet as were many other spots. The property is very large, yet you can find plenty of areas to be alone or be within a crowd if you want, I liked that a lot. Pools were small for such a large resort but we never had a problem getting chairs. For me, the beach is nothing to write home about as it looks like most NY beaches just with a prettier atmosphere, but I expected this and didn't go for the beach. The hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful. It can get noisy at night, we had a party going on outside our room door one night...early morning actually. I didn't complain to anyone about it. There was another door behind the main room door, so I closed it and that took care of the noise problem. No matter what time we got back to our hotel there was always activity in the pools and the lobby, very lively hotel. We had dinner at Latin Roots in Old San Juan and they had live music and very good food. We had breakfast at Voga and it was very good but not enough. I had Eggs Benedict made with crab cakes and it was supposed to have avocado as well but they didn't have any (??) - it was still excellent but I did leave hungry. We had dinner at Latin Roots in Old San Juan and they had live music and very good food but ran out of Pernil by the time we arrived :( We had lunch across the street from La Concha at Angel Cafe or Cafe Angel (not sure) it was very good Puerto Rican food. Had EXCELLENT Shrimp Mofungo here!! I have to say the absolute BEST meal we had was at Casa Lola - I will be craving that steak for a very long time...the Ropa Vieja Empanadas were soooooooo good and so was the cheese flan. The service by our waiter Juan Carlos was fantastic and the restaurant itself is very pretty with a great atmosphere. We would definitely return to La Concha for a quick getaway again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the hood”
Reviews.Author: daahmad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, but way too expensive for what it offers. I was extremely dissappointed in the beach. It looked like a Texas beach (not very pretty with green water). The staff is very friendly and helpful, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone celebrating an anniversary or honeymoon. The cheapest glass of wine in the main restaurant cost $15.00!!!!! PR is a great place to take your family to see the rich history, not a paradise to relax. There are many other places that make PR look very average. The crime rate in Purto Rico is terrible. We never felt safe on the beach at night or on the street in front of the hotel. Homeless people asked for money every 100 feet. I don't understand why this hotel is rated so highly other than the nice staff. The location is horrible and the prices are way too high. I was very dissappointed and will never go to PR again. Bad beaches + High prices + high crime rate = waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Was ok but don't think I would return”
Reviews.Author: sunshine11
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd trip to la concha. The first time the hotel had just opened and the stay was wonderful! This time it was just ok. Pros: excellent location, in the midst of great shopping and lots of goodvplaces to eat! Suites are a very nice touch and provides extra space and kitchens, good for leftovers. The staff was very nice. Cons: checked inti the hotel and the guy said I didn't have a reservation because I was supposed to have checked in the day before. I had to pull out my iPad to show him the correct information for check in. This took a large amount of unnecessary time. Felt bad for holding up the line. Good part was that room was ready! The pool situation is awful! They have 3 pools here one of them being an adult pool. So why are kids swimming and crowding up the adult pool when there are 2 other pools for them to swim in?????? It got so bad that one time I looked at the pool and there was a pacifier floating in the adult pool. Yuck! I heard several people talk about this situation. There should be someone from mgmt to address this issue ASAP. People from the hotel sa this and said nothing. Cleaning of the room was ok, could have been better. Upon arrival i some some hair in the room that was not mine. Thats my pet peeve in hotels. Alll in all the stay was just ok. Was much better when it first opened! I think the management needs to be more involved and visible at la concha.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In San Juan”
Reviews.Author: GoTigers19
Reviews.Content: From the moment my family and I arrived at La Concha on Tuesday June 7 through the day we left on Wednesday June 16, the service was impeccable. Felix Perez the doorman was there when we arrived and when we departed. He was very kind and accommodating. Raiza Medina the front desk concierge was awesome! She checked us in, made sure our requests as Platinum guests were met, greeted me by name daily, and gave us great advise on food and beaches. The Ocean Lounge serves as the Concierge Lounge. As a Platinum member of the Marriott Reward Program, this is often our favorite place to grab meals and drinks on our various travels. Michael Tischler the Manager was a favorite of my wife and kids, as well as Pablo Rivera, who also worked in the Oceans Lounge. They were truly great guys. The staff as a whole was genuinely pleasant and kind. They were always positive and only spoke well of the Island and its attributes. Our room was fantastic. We had an upgrade to a corner suite, which had a separate kitchen area instead of the typical studio suite. The room was "laid" in true Renaissance fashion and every amenity was provided. We could see the ocean without getting out of bed. We went to sleep every night listening to the sound of the ocean waves clapping on the beach. The girls shared the the sofa bed, which was okay with them at 11 and 16 years of age, they had a large flat screen television to themselves. A great aspect of the hotel, and there are many, is that you are literally a few yards from the ocean when you walk off the back patio. There are also 3 pools. The location of the hotel was on the main drag Ashford and the hotel lobby turns into a club at night. Truly a good time, with tourists and locals alike. There is Starbucks located 3 blocks to the right of the hotel when exiting it, next to the Conrad. Ivet and her team were very courteous and kind. After day two, they remembered our drinks. La Concha is located 2 miles from Old San Juan which is similar in architecture and layout to the French Quarter in New Orleans. Saturday Night in Old San Juan is a must. We were about 30 miles from the Rainforest and Caves. We were also able to visit some of the local beaches and eat local food in Pinones' . I suggest renting a car and putting your own personal tours together. The paid tours were very expensive and we were able to view the same attractions for a fraction of the price. Danny's International Restuarant, a few blocks from La Concha has great food, and if we had planned better would have gone to grocery store for food to stock the fridge. Instead we bought snacks and everything from Walgreans. Not the most economical decision. There is a subway and Chilli's walking distance from the hotel. This was our first visit to the Caribbean. La Concha and their staff made us feel special every minute we were there. That was the best choice for hotel and I would not stay anywhere else on the Island if given the opportunity to visit again. Thanks La Concha staff for helping to make our stay unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “I have a FABOLOUS TIME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iCandyDiva
Reviews.Content: The La Concha Resort was awesome! We were greeted by Felix when we arrived and his smile and energetic personality let us know we had made a GREAT choice! As we entered the hotel lobby we were very impressed with the contemporary decor. Our rooms were not ready, but we were compensated for the inconvenience :-) While we waited we sat in the lobby and had cocktails, chips and salsa. They were superb, pricey, but superb!!! I entered my suite and loved it!!!!!!!!! Everything was so modern...TV, i-Dock, and sophisticated shower!!! Felix was very helpful and was always there to ensure that we ate at the best spots and our cab drivers were on point. Actually all of the bellman were awsome...I loved this hotel and HIGHLY reccomend this resort if visiting San Juan. The food was soooooooo good at Voga the Italian restauant. 5 STARS all the way!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel and would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: 1dts
Reviews.Content: The suites in the new tower are amazing and the grounds and architecture are breathtaking. We had a great time in the water but they do have an undertow so you can't go out very deep but still enjoyable. We had great service from everyone at the hotel. We took cabs to get downtown and that was costly. Be sure and get a verbal commitment from the cab driver re the amount before you leave. We had a few drivers try and get more money from us at the end than was agreed to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Valet Service”
Reviews.Author: rim2011
Reviews.Content: Valet service guys are great! Felix is very professional, courteous and always aware of what the customer needs. He's an asset to La Concha. Doorbell guys are great too. I believe his name was Johnattan, he's was very professional and provided great customer service as well. Thanks! R. Irizarry

Reviews.Title: “Plan To Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: LVanHoy
Reviews.Content: I also did research prior to booking our honeymoon here at the La Concha resort in San Juan. I am so glad I mad our rsvp's here. We loved the staff...especially FELIX with valet. He had a great attitude which brightened our day each time we left the hotel or returned to relax. We were tempted to change our flights and add another day to our trip but went home and promised ourselves we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, poor response to billing issue.”
Reviews.Author: zuzu522
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at La Concha. The resort is really nice, well-maintained and the staff was always willing to help. However, I have since had a problem getting them to properly bill my credit cards. I was double billed and incorrect amounts were applied to credit cards. I have only been able to get a live person on the phone once although I have left at least 4-5 messages. And I have yet to receive confirmation that the errors have been corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff.”
Reviews.Author: bcerbelli
Reviews.Content: Having done a ton of reasearch on all the hotels in San Juan and picked La Concha, my wife and I were very pleased. We are in our mid thirties and celebrated out 1 year wedding anniversary here at the end of June. Driving up to the hotel, it is not very impressive from the outside, but it the location was right in the middle of a lot of activity such as restaurants, bars, hotels, shops, food, etc. The staff were all very friendly right from the valet, front desk, wait staff and bar tenders. We were greeted at reception with a glass of champagne which was a nice surprise. I had also emailed the concierge a few days before we arrived about a possible upgrade for our anniversary. Well that email came through! We were upgraded from a partial ocean view room to a full ocean view suite. And it was really beautiful! It was two rooms (1 living room with couch, table and balcony, the other,the bedroom w/ wall to ceiling windows facing the ocean that opened). Both had flat screen 42" TVs as well. The bathroom was kind of small with not so good lighting. The shower was also very weird. No door so no matter what the floor gets wet. 2 shower heads, 1 an overhead rain one and the other a removable one. We could never get both to work correctly with the same temp at the same time, but it wasnt that big a deal. The hotel itself is very stylish and modern. Lots of color throughout, whether with paint or neon lights. The bar in the lobby huge and serves sushi. On weekends they have a DJ and it got somewhat busy. During the week they have no entertainment until Wednesday and that is just some tango dancers showing off their moves. 3 pools, 2 in a courtyard, 1 an infinity pool over looking the beack. They were nice and refreshing. Although 1 should be deemed an adult only pool if I had my way. There were a lot of kids around. 2 hot tubs were in secluded corners which was cool, but the water was cold in one and just warm in the other. The beach is really nice. I read many reviews about it being rocky but saw not one rock on the beach itself. There were some in the water but not many. The hotel shares some space with a public beach, so you get some locals, but that was fine. The real issue is that the waves are non-stop. You really couldnt just get in the ocean and relax. It was more for boogie boarders and wave jumpers. There are 4 restaurants on site and all fantastic, albeit pretty over-priced. But to be honest, all food in Puerto Rico is pricey. The Perla fine dining resturant was fantastic! They have a 3 course and 5 course frice fixed menu along with their ala carte. We went for the 5 course with wine tasting and everything was great! Get there early and get the middle table over looking the water. Best spot in the house! -We only tried the Italian restauirant for breakfast and the food was pretty good. The buffet was $22 though. -The sushi place has a limited menu, but if Edwin is the cook, he is awesome! Ask him to make you his famous fried rice. Its not on the menu but was the best thing we had there! -The outdoor cafe has an awesome steak wrap for lunch with crispy fries. At night they serve tapas. Try the BBQ on mashed potatos and watermelon ahi tuna. Lastly, this is a great location! There is a park next door that had a festival on sat and sun. Hundreds of locals and visitors brought lounge chairs, coolers and food and listened to jazz one night and an assortment the other. A couple of local Puerto Rican restaurants are within walking distance too. Try the Catfish "Balls" right across from the hotel. They are delicious! Dont forget that you can buy snacks, wine, beer and liqour right down past the hotel and park across the street at the market. Its much cheaper than $10 hotel drinks. We brought a cooler with us (one of those Collapsible ones) and made drinks on the beach all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: skampyspride
Reviews.Content: La Concha - nice modern hotel. very clean, service was great, staff was really friendly and helpful. They didn't have any more 2 bedroom rooms so they upgraded us to a suite - which was nice. The only negative was the frosted glass shower - we waited in the living room area when people would shower becuase if you were in the bedroom you could see them through the frosted glass. We had my dad and my daughter with us - we each perfer privacy while showering. The beach was beautiful and clean but the water was rough. Felix Perez, the valet was invaluable. He gave us directions, recommended places to eat, - everything we could ask for he was there to help. Everyone was exeptionally nice - Nef, the other valets, the front desk staff and house keeping. We ate at VOGA one night - awesome! Best lasagne I have ever had! Pelayo was our favorite breakfast spot. The location of the hotel is great, plenty of things within walking distance or a short cab ride. We did rent a car and drove to El Yunke rainforest - highly recommended. The view from El Yunke peak was incredible and we were in the clouds there - really cool experience. Another favorite was the Bioluminscent bay in Vieques - very worth it. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and even more happy with the staff - truly the best!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS VACAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: beadlebug
Reviews.Content: I NEVER write reviews, but I had to write one on my stay with La Concha. My family and I usually take 2 vacations per year. This trip was our summer vacation to Puerto Rico. I chose La Concha based on reviews from Trip Advisor and found the hotel to be ABOVE AND BEYOND the reviews I read. This trip was absolutely amazing. La Concha made it even more amazing for us. The service was exceptional! Upon arrival we were greeted with quick service and great hospitality. Once we entered our room, I realized that we did not receive the room that I had booked via on-line (2 queen beds in a suite and NOT a king suite). The on-line reservation did say "not guraranteed." I presented the problem to the manager at the front desk and he explained there was no guarantee for the room and offered to change our room assignment two days later once there was availability. The switch was smooth and the staff moved our luggage and food from the refrigerator extremely fast upon request. The concierge was also exceptional. The time they took in explaining locations, getting car service, and providing directions was sooo appreciated. We would have been lost without them. The staff on the beach and pool also accomodated our every need. From moving our chairs, digging holes for the umbrellas, towels, drinks, and food were all provided quickly and with a smile. Also, after parking overnight in the hotel garage our first night, we were attempting to leave the next day. Well, when we entered the parking ticket in the automated system, the cost was approx $43.00. We were previously told parking was $15.00. We pressed the button for help and someone immediately came out. He asked a couple of questions and phoned someone at the front desk who came out within 30 seconds. He told us the policy and then scanned his badge to let us out...no charge! There was no hassle at all! In all my years of travel, I have NOT received this type of service from every area (valet, concierge, front desk, housekeeping, pool/beach, restaurants) of a hotel/resort anywhere...no matter the level of hotel. I would highly recommend this resort. We will be returning. Thanks La Concha for making our stay a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: aherpin
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! We had a suite in the new portion of the hotel and I couldn't be more pleased with it. Our room was ready on our arrival at 3pm. I had no idea when they said we had a kitchenette that it would include a full size frig, a high grade microwave and a stove. For those looking to save some money by cooking and loading up the frig..this a great benefit...but what kind of vacation is that! The location was perfect. Great local food close by.....Subway across the street....a 24-hour Walgreen's just down the way. The service was world class. I can't say enough about one doorman in particular--Felix. His service is truly legendary and unforgettable. Ask the doormen about places to eat--they will not lead you astray. I will no doubt return to this hotel on my next visit. I have traveled the world and can truly say this is one of best hotel experiences I have ever had! I had read some of the really bad reviews on this site and quite frankly, I was a bit anxious about this hotel, but none of my worries or fears came to pass. I'm sorry the few that did have less than pleasant experiences didn't get to experience what my family and I did. It was a great, relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Okay - Some Problems”
Reviews.Author: Oldmrhare
Reviews.Content: I would say the hotel falls a bit short of expectations. I was charged a 'resort fee' that was not explained to me upon registration. You may want to look out for that. They wouldn't budge on that one. I was also billed for a bar tab I didn't order. They did take care of that after taking time to review the receipts while I waited to check out. The concierge directed me to a non-existent restaraunt - not a big deal unless you walked a ways in the heat to get there and not find it. The room (suite) was overall pretty nice but the air conditioner is unacceptably loud. I had to turn up the temperature to avoid being awakened by the noise. TV worked first day, not the second. Printer didn't work in the business room. Nice beach location, dining, lounging and swimming areas. In my opinion, these are the main reasons to stay at this hotel. The pools are quite small - more like big hot tubs but still fun. Great views if you get an ocean view room. I asked for an upgrade and got a partial view at no extra charge. Comfortable bed. Roomy suite although the decor of the suite portion was a questionably 70s trashy look... Also, if you are modest, look out for the glass wall between the shower and the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Wonderful Atmosphere, Beautiful Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: KKsTravels
Reviews.Content: Our friends were recently married at the La Concha Resort. We were attendees of the wedding. It is a beautiful hotel, with gorgeous atmosphere! The rooms are very modern, clean and neat. The service is phenominal at this resort. The staff are friendly and attentive. The food and drinks are great! At night time, the hotel lobby turns into a nightclub. It is chic and trendy. I would definitely recommend this hotel and perhaps re-visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get enough of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: cottoncandyforyou
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful overlooking the ocean! The rooms were extremely clean, staff was welcoming and friendly, and the services were great. Close to the airport (make sure to share a taxi from the airport to the hotel - flat rate/trip, they do not charge per person), seconds away from the bus stop which is $0.75 - you can take it to major tourist areas like Old San Juan. Food was great!

Reviews.Title: “What can I say....”
Reviews.Author: News2uu
Reviews.Content: Alot actually! We spent a week at La Concha and loved almost every second of it.. We arrived early on a Saturday and pretty much expected to wait for our room. Check in was a pleasant breeze and we did have to wait for our room, but after 45 mins and two free beers at the bar it was ready. The Jr. Suite (king) was very clean and set up wonderfully, perfect for two people. Great ocean views! The beach was clean and the chair/umbrella guys were so friendly! One thing my partner noticed was that many were not tipping these employees. Come on people! These guys spend all day on the hot beach catering to us, take care of them!!! Spent most of the day on the beach and running back and forth to the "adult" pool for a change of pace. Really enjoyable. Weekends you will find servers on the beach, but weekdays we had to run up to place and order. No big deal really. Drinks were priced high, but didn't expect them to be low. A bucket of Medalla light (local beer) packed in ice hit the spot and was priced right. The pools were clean, but fairly small compared to other sites in San Juan, but being off season they were never packed. No complaints. Noticed alot of reviews complaining about the house keeping services. We were usually out of our room by 9am and the room was always clean by 1:30 or so. So in other words perfect. I think alot of people leave the room late and expect it done in an hour. Not gonna happpen folks... We did not eat on site much. We have tripped to the Condado area many, many times, so we know alot of off-site places that are more reasonably priced. The pastry/coffee bar in the lobby is expensive and you can get a much better cup of Java at the Duncan Donut a short block from the hotel for alot less $$.. "Bryan" will take good care of you... Don't be afraid to venture out and walk the Condado along Ashford St. Many shops and great eats along the way. It's very safe and you will meet and see some very friendly locals. The locals will always give you a smile and a hello. Really, really highly recommend II postino!! Great italian food and the service is impeccable. We went back two nights later and our waiter had the night off, but was in the parking lot hanging with some friends. He came back in to get us started and bought us an appetizer to start things off! Also "Mikes" about 2-3 blocks from the hotel has perfect pizza and pasta. My only issue with the service was with the main lobby bar. Not alot of smiles and welcoming attitudes with the bartenders there. The Marriot up the road has great happy hours and the bartenders are full of personality, but of course it's not as "hip" as la concha and maybe were just not that hip anymore! We also lost alot of money in the hotel casino and won alot at the marriot casino :) Like I said we venture out so La Concha was a PERFECT home base. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!! Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steven9797
Reviews.Content: Great hotel.. Location is great!!! Can see and do lots of things around san juan and old san juan. Staff at hotel are very friendly.. Only bad thing is the food service at the pool area is slow... When we first arrived we were greated and treated very warmly... Even when we left they were very nice and accommodating.. Johnathan gomez was very kind in taking care of out luggage and getting us a cab to the airport.. This was our very first time in puerto rico and couldn't have picked a better place to party and relax... we stopped by other nearby hotels like conrad at condado beach and la concha was far better hands down.. Nearby is la concha's sister hotel marriott and that was a great place to go salsa dancing at the bar with live music... Stay at la concha and you won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fralfred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for the last 3 days of our stay in Puerto Rico. What a treat!! Our experience was great from the moment we checked-in to the time we checked-out. The staff was so pleasant and friendly. Javier and Pablo in particular were so helpful! We were upgraded to a suite and it was beautiful. We had the pleasure of having breakfast every morning at the breakfast buffet and dined at their Italian restaurant one evening. The food was fresh and well-prepared and waitstaff very professional. We had drinks in the lounge outside and at the indoor bar as well - the mojitos were wonderful!! The location is great with access to the beach. There are many good restaurants within walking distance from the hotel and some shopping. The rooms were quiet and the location very safe! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was planning to visit the area!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable 4 days at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: photraveler7
Reviews.Content: We had a really enjoyable short vacation here. Service was excellent - every employee we interacted with was extremely pleasant and helpful - very friendly vibe. The hotel was immaculate and the staff was seemingly always busy keeping it that way. Very vibrant weekend bar scene at the lobby bar. The food and drinks at the pool were fairly expensive, as expected at a resort. The beach directly adjacent to the property was very nice, although small. We stayed in a junior suite, which was very spacious. The only complaints are that the bed could have been a little more comfortable - the mattress sagged a bit in the middle. Also it was difficult to shower without getting the bathroom floor wet - there is no door, just a pane of glass enclosing half the shower. We would definitely stay here again when visiting San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “We were here for our honeymoon in 1965 and wanted to remember”
Reviews.Author: jqlineb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at La Concha in January,1965. We have not been back to PR as a couple, except to pass through the airport. Obviously, the scenery has changed, but not the wonderful people who made our experience 46 years later as great as our original time. Our junior suite was an excellent choice. It gave us more than enough room to move about and storage for our clothing and enough shelf space in the bathroom. We arrived before the 4 pm check in time (about 1 pm) and were told our room was not ready, but that they would call us on cell when it was. They did check our luggage. No call. About 3:30 pm, I went to the desk and they said the room had been ready. Some wasted time. However, Carlos brought our bags up and was very helpful in getting us hangars, showing us various technical things and getting someone there immediately to fix the safe, which is important to us. We then went to the concierge to suggest somewhere close for a quick bite. Ms. Emmanuel hit it right on the mark. It was great. Day two. We went to Level 25 on the mezzanine for breakfast. We were escorted to a table inside(we don't like to eat in the heat) and were welcomed by one of the loveliest people we have ever encountered in a restaurant. ,Tatiana. The food was very good, reasonably priced for a resort area and the service, impeccable. Tatiana took care of us on several occasions and was pleasant and attentive at all times. Her other co-workers were also very attentive. On to the beach. There are many area to enjoy the water and sun. However, all the chairs at the beach and pool are lounges. I need a straight chair and my husband was able to find one that he took to the pool area. This could be an issue for someone who can't use a lounge. We met Oswaldo at the beach, who I believe is a security or beach manager. Again another friendly, helpful person, who is also a very knowledgable person, wanting to tell us about his island. Thanks also to Felix at the front door, who was most helpful in securing cabs and getting us to where we wanted to go. Our biggest disappointment was at Perla restaurant.. Perla was said to be one of the best in San Juan. Service was mediocre. When you have to ask for another cocktail in a first class place???????????. Secondly, my husband ordered the filet mignon. It was priced at $39. A six oz piece of meat, that also had some inedible fat, was served. My husband mentioned to several on the wait staff and the answer was, we have to tell the chef. That was it. We do not like to complain, however, most places will tell you the size of the meat portion. Overall, we had a wonderful experience and it was well worth the 46 year interim. We would definitely recommend LaConcha. PS It has a nice casino. Thought it wqs better than others we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: NYYFan27
Reviews.Content: Not sure where to start. After reading some of the reviews I must admit I had some reservations about staying here. Shouldn't have had any though. Exceeded my expectations. Stayed here with my wife and 17 y.o. son. Booked a partial ocean view one bedroom suite and was upgraded to a full ocean view. Wow what a room with a view. Very clean and housekeeping was outstanding. Please dismiss the reviews that had issues with housekeeping. Based on my stay the staff does a wonderful job. Should add we stayed for 4 nights 6/14 - 6/18. Some reviews state the the beach is rough. Well we come from NY and much calmer than any ocean beach here. The hotel does offer service on the beach. The best part of the hotel are the employees. EVERYONE we encountered was friendly and very helpful. They go out of their way to help. The lobby and poolside areas are just plain stunning. How a resort should look. Never had any issues with lounges by the pools. Plenty of them to go around. All the food and drinks we had were excellent. It may be that we were on vacation with really no worries but we have no complaints with the hotel. I know other reviews say the prices for food and drinks are high. In my opinion they are in line with most resorts but with better quality. It's a very well maintained resort so you are paying for what you get. I could go on and on but this review is already too long. Rest assured you will not be disappointed with LaConcha. If you have any questions you would like answered just contact me. GREAT HOTEL with great employees and awesome pools and food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tjb1211
Reviews.Content: First off - let me say Carlos (bellman) is the man! He kept us in the loop of what the hot spots were for the day/night. It was a guys getaway trip in which we had 2 awesome suites. We were on the 7th floor and had 2 connecting suites (1 was on a corner in which we had ocean view & city view - awesome!) The hotel is extremely clean and everyone is very nice and accommodating. The pools were awesome and so was the beach. 2 things to know about the hotel: there is no air conditioning in the elevator or in the hallways & there are little frogs that make these chirping noises that sometimes get annoying. I encountered 2 issues during my stay: I got stuck in an elevator for about 1 minute in which I needed to force the doors open (2 crew members saw this and escorted me through the basement and back up to the lobby) & I was locked out of my room from 1am-3am on a Friday night. The whole computer lock was not functioning properly and the only key that worked was the Managers key (David Flores). This was a bit of an inconvenience. The staff were very accommodating because of these issues and took 50% off of 1 room for the night I was locked out and they also issued me credit towards the hotel stay. They also let me eat free at the buffet. Despite these issues, the stay was excellent and it is the best place to stay in San Juan. I would definitely go back to PR and stay at La Concha again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to enjoy San Juans beaches”
Reviews.Author: Ekh886
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I started our week long trip in Puerto Rico with La Concha as our first stop. The lobby and hotel grounds are impressive, modern and clean and full of people 24/7. We only spent one afternoon at the pools and beach but it was beautiful. Had lunch by their poolside cafe which was good but a bit overpriced! Concierge did recommend a great dinner spot (Jose Enrique) which is a quick walk from the hotel....check that place out for amazing innovative local cuisine. Overall La Concha was great, clean and we loved the view from our ocean tower room!

Reviews.Title: “Increible location and awesome concierge service by Indihira, Pablo, Michael.”
Reviews.Author: Robburns23
Reviews.Content: Next to the beach and awesome service. Beautiful pools and great rooms. Concierge service is the best I have ever seen!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan95
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night stay at La Concha. We had high expectations as the hotel came highly recommended by friends. My husband and I went with 2 other couples. Please keep in mind when reading this that we are in the 40-50 year old age range, and have stayed at many luxury hotels all over the world. Overall, La Concha is definitely one of the nicest hotels to stay in the Condado Beach area of San Juan. The Pros...Check in was easy and the staff was wonderful. Our room was a standard Ocean front King. Great view though I would have preferred a higher floor- we were on the 4th. If you like contemporary furnishings ie..white leather couches then this is for you. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The pool area was very nice, especially the adults only infinity pool. It overlooked the ocean right on the beach. The beach was easy access and no problem getting a chair and an umbrella. The nightlife Thurs, Fri, and Sat. night was unbelievable. There is a bar right in the center of the expansive lobby and packed with beautiful YOUNG people on those nights. Our husbands enjoyed "the view" very much. If you are between the ages of 18-30, you will love this. We ate at La Perla for dinner, the food was fantastic. Have the chocolate Martini, OMG. The location of the hotel is nice if you like to walk. There are many good restaurants within walking distance. The Cons...There is no spa in this hotel, we would have enjoyed that. The casino is very small, only a few tables and LOTS of penny slots. The biggest problem for us was the noise level. You cannot get a good nights sleep because you are woken up every few hours by some sort of noise. We woke up to kids screaming at the pool at 7:00am, chirping noises made by the elevators, teens screaming up and down the hallways from 1:00am - 4:00am, and construction noises at 8:00am. The walls are thin and the doors are not insulated for noise. In addition, the bathrooms in the rooms could be larger, the door should not be vented, and the shower was poorly designed. It is open with half a glass wall and water gets all over the floor. Overall...If you are between the ages of 18-30 and love to party, this is the hotel for you. If you are over 30...You may want to consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Brooke53
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I wanted to take a trip to somewhere tropical and different. She lives in New York and I live in Calif. It was easier and closer to go to Puerto Rico for her so......Puerto Rico it was. The resort was wonderful the staff was so nice and helpful and fun. The concierge Louise was the best.!!!!!!! Talk to her she really knows the island. Great help and she really liked to share her knowledge about San Juan and everything the area had to offer. All the restaurants she recommended were fabulous. We are foodies so most were on the higher end but great!!!! The beach area was perfect and the pool areas were great. Our room was everything we wanted, with a balcony over looking the ocean, a kitchen, the bathroom had a spa tub. Clean nicely appointed. I can't recommend this hotel enough. The location was good with a bus stop right outside the hotel. Walgreens down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute!”
Reviews.Author: Tlinquist
Reviews.Content: The best part of La Concha is their friendly, helpful staff! Jose Rivera (bellman) was the bomb!! He gave us so much info & recommendations. He was never to busy to help either! And we bugged him a lot. Thank u Jose!!! The front desk actually let us check in at 6:30 am! Nine hours early. Did they have to? No! But they did! What a view! We stayed in 915 Ocean Tower (older side). It was roomy, nice, and comphy. The only reason I didnt rate higher is for minor cosmetic reasons like slight erosion on the metal parts of furniture probably from the salt and beach, but it didn't ruin my stay. The shower which was cool with blue LED lights made me giggle. I thought it had a shower door but it was a walk in, some parts of the grout looked stained as if it had not been taken care of very well, but it didnt gross me out! After enjoying a day at their awesome clean beach drinking my own mix of pineapple & rum I had no worries about these cosmetic issues! The beach was sooo awesome! Clean sand, clear blue water, perfect place to just play and relax. Best beach I've been to compared to Mexico. We didn't eat at the hotel. We opted for local nearby spots. Breakfast at Pelaya was amazing! Don Jose was okay, nearby Hibachi was super. Liked having Wendy's & Subway next door for quick cheap eats. Old San Juan was fun! Lots of shopping spots, good local food & drinks. Go early, shops start closing at 6. Eat Monfongo! Don't know the name of the eatery but they have pastries in their window and food was yummy! They are next door to a wholesale jewlery store. If you like Coach then stop to shop while in Old San Juan. Ask for directions! Great prices!! You don't want to skip the store. Avoid Senor Frogs (gross)! My biggest regret was skipping the rainforest. We took a ferry $.50 one way to Bacardi Distillery. No signs or info on getting there so was caught off guard by men loading people in vans to drive people there. But thankfully other tourists gave us the all clear and they were right - all was fine! I feel that tour was a waste of time. Yes it was free & 2 free drinks were nice. If you are a bacardi fan then u will enjoy it. If you only care for souveniers then drink, shop, & leave! Skip the tour its boring! And the ferry leaves every30 minutes so be prepared to sit and wait. Everything and everyone moves slow in PR so it made for a long day with no beach time. The people of PR love to jog at all hours of the day all over town. If u love to run join them! If you don't love running you'll actually consider it when they pass by you and you see how in shape they are. And I must add people of PR are very friendly! PR as a whole is laid back and nice. They could use some govt support and funding to improve cleanliness in the city, repair buildings, especially with such beautiful beaches! While there listen for the sounds of the Coqui frog. They sound like birds - super cool! Oh and last but not least...i traveled with 3 other couples, we all stayed at La Concha, different rooms & towers but all our rooms were nice and none of us had came back with bed bugs! We all stayed 5 days and never saw 1 bug of any type! Angel fish, yes....a lizzard, yes...and an enormous sea turtle made her way to shore at La Concha and laid eggs, something very rare! Tnx LaConcha & jose for a great vacay! Hope to post pics soon. Ck out there FB page, I got lots of info on them there!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, delicious food, great location, and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cfranco10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha for three days and we loved it!!!! The room and hotel itself were great. Our room for comfortable with a great view of the pool and beach. However, if I could complain about two things, I would say this: (1) The shower and (2) the price of the resort food (not to mention room service---it was ridiculous! Nevertheless, I would definately go back! Although the food at the resort was expensive, it was delicious!!!! Can't complain about quality. The resort had several beautiful pools and located right on the beach. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. At the last minute, a tour company canceled by trip to El Rio Camuy. I was only in PR for just one more day and Frankie Aponte came to our rescue!! He booked us a personal tour of El Rio Camuy and the Observatory in just 1 hour. What a way to close out our stay in PR! Thank you Frankie!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: temu11
Reviews.Content: my stay at la concha was perfect from the room, service, restaurants, to the staff..The room first of all was upgraded to a beautiful suite with a living room, kitchen and the room, by the way, is exactly as shown in the photos on expedia...the layout here was amazing, from the outdoor pools, gym facing the ocean, umbrella covered couches, to relax and read, eat, chill, drink a pina colada ;)...food here was great as well..fresh every time...and the staff ......amazing!!!!!.....they were all helpful and directed me to any place, whether it be restaurant or excursion on the island.. they were well prepared....hey Victor Rodriguez !!!!!!!....he"s the concierge...HOT and HELPFUL..who can ask for anything more???..the most respectful, polite and well mannered young man. Must be one of the "well seasoned" there,by the looks of it..He assisted me throughout my stay from food ,to which excursions were best on the island, places to see, items to purchase for each excursion...he was always attentive and made my stay easy and peaceful!!!..so with that.....this is definitely the hotel to be at..Cant wait to book my next trip......

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the La Concha”
Reviews.Author: ShawnaLUVSPR2011
Reviews.Content: I had to take the time to write a review bc I was beyond pleased with my stay at the La Concha this past week in June 2011. I enjoyed a very rare vacation getaway with my best friend of 16 yrs and this resort hotel had everything we were hoping for in a week away. The minute we arrived at La Concha we were swept off our feet by excellent valet staff. Each time we either left or returned the wonderful and lighthearted Felix warmly high-fived and greeted my friend and I. There was much charisma in their staff. Everyone was very helpful and were always asking us how our stay was, if we needed anything thing or just was inquiring of our day. The hotel boasts a handful of "security" and staff that casually and quietly monitor the grounds throughout the day and night which made us feel very safe and assured while we enjoyed the pools and the beach well into the wee hours of the morning. This is very important for many female travelers such as ourselves. The lobby is spectacular, and an experience in itself. The lobby hosts a wonderful nightlife with awesome drinks and music and the grounds offer many places to sit, which despite it's open-air layout, allows for private chats and restful moments. This hotel is perfect for that getaway to Puerto Rico when you want sophistication and class without that feeling of being "stuffy" or uptight. La Concha was the perfect mix for a great week in San Juan. After enjoying excursions, snorkeling, rainforest exploration, shopping and dining, La Concha was the perfect place to truly call "home" for the week. It was more than difficult to leave. The only downside I can pass along is the cost involved when dining and enjoying cocktails within the hotel itself. A mojito I enjoyed poolside was about $12, which really adds us quickly without realizing it. It was an added expense that I should mention to future travelers, particularly ones on a restrictive budget. However, this is to be expected with a luxury hotel. Plan on extra expenses with dining and drinking on site if that is what you desire, we definitely spent way more than intended with our drinks some of the evenings. Overall, La Concha was awesome, and I would not take the time to write this if it wasn't a truly topnotch experience. We were so happy we chose La Concha for our best friends/girls' trip! Excellent! This was one of the best hotels I have stumbled uopn in booking trips online and I will definitely be a return customer. Puerto Rico 2012! Gracias La Concha :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-beware of loud parties”
Reviews.Author: DeboWabo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay at the hotel. We reserved a room with a hot tub on the balcony in the suite section. These rooms are very nice and have kitchenettes. I will give you one warning-June is a busy month for parties (weddings and proms). The rooms with hot tubs are located directly above the space where the parties are held. We had two parties beneath us while we stayed there. One lasted until 1:00 AM and the other one STARTED at 1:30 AM and finished at 5:00 AM. The music is so loud that the room actually vibrates. The second party happened to be the night before my husband had to leave for the airport at 6:30 AM. I called the front desk at 2:00 AM to ask when the party would end, and I explained that my husband needed to get some sleep. The front desk clerk said, "What do you expect me to do about it?". This attitude irritated me. I told him that I thought we should receive a substantial discount since we couldn't get any sleep. He asked me to hold so he could talk to a manager. When he returned to the phone, he advised me that we would not be charged for that night (about $300). I thanked him and hung up. In the morning I stopped by the front desk to verify that the note had been made on our account, and it had. I thought this was a very nice hotel. I would advise travelers to stay in the suite section of the hotel but to request rooms on the highest floor available in order to avoid the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but not quite as amazing as I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: travelintami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha from May 30th-June 4th. I am trying to write the most accurate review that I can because when planning our trip to Puerto Rico I struggled and struggled with trying to choose the right hotel. I hope others can benefit from reading about our experience. Check In -The doormen were positive and helpful. Gave us a good first impression of the hotel. -The lobby was quite impressive. It's open layout and beautiful, modern decor made it an inviting place to grab a drink or just sit and people watch. -Check-in went smoothly and before long we were in our ocean view spa suite. Room -My husband and I enjoyed our spa suite in the new Suite Tower. It was very nice to have a large veranda where we could sit and enjoy the sights and sounds of the ocean. I would recommend getting a room in the Suite Tower if possible. -The room decor made for a bit of a "cold" feeling. That didn't really bother us but for some reason it just didn't feel very cozy. -It was nice to have a kitchenette that included a refrigerator and microwave as well as plates, silverware... -The bathroom was large but the nearly clear shower wall may not be ideal for those who prefer a little more privacy. The wall is shared with the bedroom. Beach and Pools -Thought the beach was nice. We had heard a lot of less than positive comments about the beach area but we found it to be a nice place to relax and get some sun. The surf was a little rough but we still had fun taking a dip! -The beach is public but it was never really busy. We enjoyed having the chairs and umbrellas provided by the hotel -Would have loved to have food and beverage service on the beach but it was not provided. -We didn't spend very much time in the pool areas but we did enjoy the "adults only" pool that was situated right below our room. It was quite and a great place to relax with a book. Food and Drink -This is the area in which I was a bit disappointed. We have been a little spoiled in that we have been fortunate enough to enjoy all-inclusive resorts in Mexico, Jamaica, and St. Lucia. It was so nice not to have to pull money out for every drink and meal... While in Puerto Rico I think we ended up spending an additional $800 on food and drinks for just the two of us. -I knew that drink prices would be high but $24 for rum and cokes at the lobby bar seemed a little excessive. They were mixed with Don Q which is a local rum. -We ate at Solera when we first arrived and we did not find the food to be very good. -We ate at Voga and again the food was average but high priced. -Our best dining experiences were outside of the hotel at Jam Rum Bar, Pizza e Birra, and Fefo's Deli. -Also ate at the Latin Star nearby. It was just ok. Misc. -It is important to realize that La Concha is in an urban area. If you are looking for a more resort type feel you may need to check into hotels outside of the San Juan area. -Early June is apparently Prom time in Puerto Rico and the hotel hosted 3 of them while we were there. The loud music from one of the proms played until 3am and it did keep us awake. -Service at La Concha is good. We had no complaints here. -Would have enjoyed a spa but they do not have one on the property. I did visit Zen Spa across the street and it was very nice. -The reviews are perhaps a little inflated for this hotel. I will not deny that La Concha is a great place to stay, perhaps one of the best on the island, but we have been to hotels in the Caribbean that were more impressive. Reading some of the reviews you would think that your experience would be absolutely amazing. I don't think you can go wrong with La Concha when booking a stay in the San Juan area. Just don't set your expectations unreasonably high.

Reviews.Title: “Half Disappointed, Half Appreciative”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMdtravel
Reviews.Content: At first I thought maybe my expectations were too high based on the reviews I had read. But I think a hotel that claims to be a 4 star resort raises expectations. There are certain basics that you expect from a 4 star place. That includes well trained staff and courteous service. There were some staff members who measured up to this standard and often exceeded it. The good was the staff at the Perla restaurant. I had the chef tasting menu. It was great. The waiter was also very good. The sushi chefs in the lobby were also very friendly. Now the bad. The staff at the breakfast restaurant was probably the worst I have encountered. I only made that mistake once and the breakfast was included in my rate. The staff at the outdoor bar/restaurant was only slightly better but the thing that was missing was the desire to be helpful or courteous. I had e mailed the hotel before arriving with some questions about things to do. I asked about taking a tour to El Yunque. The reply was there was no need for a tour because they could provide maps etc.. at the concierge desk. When I asked for maps at the concierge desk after I arrived, they said they could not help with that. They gave me a single page of directions that told you to travel on a main road until you intersected with another road. Only problem was that the two roads identified did not intersect. You had to take a different road to find the second road. The room was clean but it was nothing special - not four star level. The closet door was off the track when we went into the room. We called down because the closet door affected access to a dresser. I was told they would take care of it right away. It was still off the track when we left 4 days later. Also, the wireless never worked. Sometimes it is all these little things that add up and leave you half disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service - Fantastic trip!”
Reviews.Author: linzilocket
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La concha end of April pre cruise but extended our stay to 3 nights, visited San Juan before and lots of All inclusives in the Caribean. This hotel exceeding our expectations, the decor was modern and clean,staff were helpful and great location. Travelled with 5 year old daughter who asked if we could live here! Had a city view suite rooms are as you see on the pics, we didnt have any trouble with housekeeping as other reviews suggest. Room was ideal for a family as it seperated. Had breakfast in the hotel daily very nice as was the Solera at lunchtime, didnt eat in restaurants at night we explored a little. The hotel isnt the cheapest around, but iam a firm beleiever you get what you pay for and really did feel we had value for money. Would go back in a heartbeat and i am not somebody who likes returning to the same place but i would!!! San Juan is lovely old san juan worth a trip and people very friendly. LOVED IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: cayman08
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a reinvigorating weekend getaway, with non-stop air service from many cities, go to the La Concha Resort in San Juan. My ocean front superior room was right on the beach and you could hear the waves crashing. There are several pools and a beautiful beach with lanais. The ocean currents however are very strong and EXTREME CAUTION is necessary as there are rip-tides that can be dangerous. Food and drink are excellent and the lobby bar is the place to be on weekend nights. It's not the Four Seasons for luxury nor is it Atlantis if you crave thousands of other guests and activities, but it hits the mark for a two or three day break.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel for fun and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: karemik2
Reviews.Content: Very contemporary hotel with a great location in Condado. Beach was wonderful as was all the facilities, pools and grounds. Rooms were very spacious with great views of the ocean. We even had a day lounger to enjoy watching the beach and ocean. Casino had all the latest games. The surrounding area has a mix of high end shopping with some run down places...typical of San Juan. Wonderful Puerto Rican food across the street but the hotel has some incredible restaurants with incredible views. Definitely glad we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cantakavita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend while visiting friends in Puerto Rico. We had a room with an ocean view and it was a really beautiful view. The room itself was clean and decent - standard for a chain hotel (Concha is owned by Marriott). The hotel is well located in Condado, with a nice beach, and close to lots of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself has a very popular bar and is a fun place to have a drink at the bar in the evenings. That said, there is techno music blasting all day long by the pool and beach area. I could barely relax while reading a book in my room or on the beach without hearing this music... so if you're not into being trendy and listening to house 24/7 then this is not the place for you. Also, the pool areas are overcrowded and not very relaxing/quiet. The beach is overrun by locals (including groups of teenagers), so it's a nice place to swim and sunbathe but not to hang out for too long (also, the best beaches near San Juan are not in Condado). If it were just for that, we'd give La Concha a 3, but our room wasn't cleaned in two days! First, our room wasn't fully stocked and we had to call for things like more towels (there was only 1 towel in the bathroom). On the day after we checked in, we left for the rainforest at 8AM. When we got back at 3PM, the room hadn't been cleaned, which we thought was strange. We made a call to the front desk around 5PM to ask for room service, and went downstairs to take a dip. When we came back from the beach, the room still hadn't been cleaned, and we had to take a shower with dirty towels!! On our way out for the evening, around 7 or 8PM, we complained to the concierge and asked them to please send housekeeping to the room. When we got back to our room around midnight (anyone see where this is going?) it still hadn't been cleaned.... just totally unacceptable!! We have previously stayed at El Convento in Old San Juan (which shares the same owner as La Concha) and will stay there again next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: gunnercade
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at La Concha before boarding our cruise ship from San Juan. I picked this hotel based mostly on Tripadvisor reviews, and was not disappointed. The room was not big, but it was perfectly adequate, with a great view of the ocean. Service was smooth and super, super friendly, even when the front desk was crowded. We dined twice at one of their restaurants (Voga), and the food, while pricey, was quite good. Other reviewers complain about housekeeping, but we didn't have any problem at all, and housekeepers seemed to be much quieter than in other hotels I have been to. The pools are small and tend to be a bit crowded, but we were not there for the pool, so no complains there. The beach is not outstanding, and the days we were there the sea was a bit 'unfriendly'-my husband is a strong swimmer and dove in anyway, I stayed closer to the beach. The neighborhood has plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distance, and a Walgreens nearby if you forgot your sunscreen (also a liquor store if you want to party in the privacy of your room). We did not have any noise from downstairs in our room on the 9th floor (ocean side). The reception turns into quite the trendy night club at night, with fancily dressed crowds. Sometimes you'll ride the elevator next to some beautifully dressed beautiful people, while returning unshowered from your night kayaking trip. Ahem. On the ugly side, we had 'neighbors' who came back from their party night screaming very late at night. When I opened the door to request silence, I was greeted by a very loud "F... you." I immediately called the front desk, and they assured me they'd send security. No more noises for that night, but the lovely neighbor decided to yell the same words at us while heading out in the morning. Can't blame the hotel for their boorish guests, I guess, they did intervene appropriately. Just be advised that some of the guests here lack in basic manners, or (more likely) cannot handle the liquor they ingest. By the way, Condado has quite an impressive police presence during weekend nights. Wireless was excellent. Parking is either valet or DIY. DIY costs 10$ less, but you have to find your way in the underground parking lot with some unfriendly corners. Overall, we were happy with La Concha, but next time we may try some less party-friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dld8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at La Concha after ending our stay early at the Gran Melia. So comparing the two resorts, would give La Concha an 8 to Gran Melia's 2-3. The location of La Concha is nice and the atmosphere is fun and hip. The beach is ok - actually pretty nice for being an in-town location. The bar is lots of fun and food-beverage staff always has a smile. A word of caution, the front desk staff "upgraded" us to a suite. The room was nice - living room and kitchenette but horrible view, the city with no water view. We paid for a beach view and had a bit of a difficult time get us to the room we paid for. Thought the front desk manager was a little testy and had to put our foot down to get into the actual room we paid for - I am a "Gold" Marriott member so was surprised. Had a good time and will definitely stay again at La Concha when in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful island but hotel service could improve”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Meena
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel in one of the ocean view suites in the new wing of the hotel. Check in was fast and the room was good however I must warn you the bathroom has a frosted glass wall with no blinds and you can pretty much see into the shower cubicle from the room when someone is showering and it may feel a little uncomfortable. The bed was big and comfy however the sofa bed in the room was awful. One member of our group had to sleep in it and said the springs were sticking into her back all night so we had to end up getting an inflatable mattress from the hotel to use. Plus it took about 10 calls to reception/housekeeping to get someone to come and actually make the bed up which they did but then no bedding or comforter was provided which we called about again several times and we had to end up going down to the reception to get bedding at midnight which was annoying. In this respect the service was very poor. Also while we were staying many high schools were having proms in the function rooms and we could hear music on the 8th floor throughout the night. There is a business centre with the new wing so it was helpful that we were able to use the internet there. Pool and beach were also good although the water is pretty rough and the red flag was always up during our stay. Restaurants- the Italian restaurant was amazing and service flawless and food amazing. I wish the same could be said for the eating area by the pool. It took almost 1 hour for our food (just burgers) to come and then when we wanted to pay the bill there was no staff around which was annoying. We were very disappointed by the sevice here. We had the buffet breakfast too which we enjoyed- lots of choice with a waffle and pancake and egg station and the other usual items like pastries, cereal, fruit, toast etc. Puerto Rico is fantastic- we loved old San Juan (about $15 taxi ride from the hotel) and our trip to El Yunque and the city feels very safe and the food is brilliant. We were expecting a lot more from La Concha and while the room was fine and many of the staff members very friendly esp at the door, the service could really do with improving in many areas.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Mims7
Reviews.Content: styed in june 2011 in new tower/suite beautiful room with kitchen partial ocean view with very nice amenieties great beach & pools. private adult pool - very nice excellent gym The VIP lounge has the most incredible staff that deserve mentioning by name. Their positive smiles & gracious greetings made one feel very special. nothing was too much of an effort. Pamela Reyes Jamiss Rivera Cristine Birriel Michael Tishler Indhira Payamo

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: CryAmandla
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and the casino and beach were fun. The only issue that I had was that it was nearly impossible to reach room service or the front desk when trying to call from the room. The numbers were ALWAYS busy. Also, we'd asked for a roll away bed and never received one. Overall, we had a great experience and the friendliness of the staff made up for the flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place-Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: liz4497
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha for 2 nights pre-cruise. The hotel is in a busy part of San Juan, one of the best features is Walgreen's is in walking distance for snacks and soda and other things you need before boarding the ship. The room was very spacious and clean. The only gripe my family had was the shower was all (frosted) glass and quite see through, which was not good for a teenager. Each concierge we talked to was so helpful. They gave us Old San Juan recommendations and booked our rainforest tour (fantastic guide, fun and we learned something!) We ate at the Italian restaurant...delish! We would stay again-the staff makes this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!..ask for Felix!”
Reviews.Author: Drevol2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I travelled from NYC to PR for his bfay. Our stay was short...only 4 days, Mon-Thurs, but we had a good time. First bit of advice, don't stay during the week, especially if you're a young couple like us. There's nothing to do during the week at night. Hotel was good. Rooms were ok...food was ok as well. My fav part about the hotel was the service. Felix, especially was the best! He told us were we should go, restaurants we should try, and was very personable. My least fav part was the power outages. It happened twice for over 8 hrs at a time. Very frustrating... Also don't go during raining season or hurrican season. Just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Night from Hell”
Reviews.Author: loo12Toronto
Reviews.Content: Not a great stay for us... This is a beautiful hotel that had a prom the night we were in town after our cruise. They let the prom run wild all night long ..so loud we could not sleep. At 6 in the morning there was 30 kids in the pool screaming and yelling. When we complained they said " there is a prom at the hotel" as if it was ok to let loose. they bought us breakfast unfortunatley it was the worst buffet I have had and when I went to get some more food the pigeons on the patio swooped in to our plates....What a day

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: foxct
Reviews.Content: Let me point out that this was only our second Carribean trip, the first being Excellence Punta Cana. La Concha is nice, probably one of the best places to stay in Condado Beach area, but it is not up to the standards of resorts like Excellence. La Concha shows a little wear and tear, nothing major. Room was comfortable and clean. For the rate, it is very nice. Solara - the outdoor bar-grill seemed overpriced and the food was poor. Definitely walk to Paleyo (short walk) to dine. The Puerto Rican restaruant across the street is better than Solara. We tried lunch and dinner at Solara and were unimpressed both times. Drinks seemed a bit weak as well. Satruday night the hotel was loud, even on the 9th floor we heard music and people yelling till 3AM. Not sure if it was from the lobby or our floor, but there was some partying going on. We had a child with us, so not exactly our scene. Overall, the hotel is nice and everyone was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for the young crowd”
Reviews.Author: bob41378
Reviews.Content: we went as a family retreat - all adults without children. the hotel is geared for young singles and family with young children. No real itinerary for 50+ active adults. You have to leave the hotel which is difficult without a car. Bus transportation forget it and cabs can be reasonable but get prices from concierge prior to jumping in a cab. The rooms are good but no adjoining rooms or suites even though the ads say so and when you call they will say yes; however when you arrive you get what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely a must must hotel”
Reviews.Author: SBAlex
