Reviews.Content: Last time we stayed at a Marriott just minutes away and it was amazing; hard to believe La Concha San Juan is even beyond amazing all all levels. From the stunning lobby to a room that compared to the trendy boutique hotels in Manhattan, this place is a must for all stops in beautiful San Juan. The special Marriott members bar and light food lounge was on the edge of the water and added a nice touch to an already fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like family...”
Reviews.Author: eflynn
Reviews.Content: I flew to San Juan for a quick, short get away from business over Memorial Weekend. The beach staff, Leo and Brock were amazingly attentive and friendly. Leo checked on my 3-4 times in a 6 hour period and Brock was quick with drinks/food and restaurant recommendations. On my second day on the beach, I got equally as warm a welcome and service. Victor @ the concierge desk was also very warm and welcoming and efficient and quick with confirming Brock's restaurant recommendations as well as throwing a few more in the mix for me to choose from. I rarely travel alone, but your staff made me feel very well taken care of. My thanks to them all!...and I'll see you again soon! Jody Sauer

Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: 1Very-demanding
Reviews.Content: Forget about the facilities, you can read about that elsewhere. This is about felling extremely welcomed from the moment we arrived and the valet parking attendant gave us a very warm welcome, made himself available to us. Checking in was very quick and efficient as well. We had amazing appetizers at the lobby bar that first afternoon. The alcohol selection was and service were all very good. We forgot a bag of shoes in the trunk of the car, but were not sure if they were there. The valet parking offered to check for us and grab the bag if they found it. We went to the valet parking desk expecting to have to wait for our car to be pulled up... they had already grab our shoes, did not have to wait and waste our precious time! The next day, I made tons of special requests from room service, housekeeping. All of the were met with a smile and making truth to a "a pleasure to serve you". The poolside menu for lunch was creative and tasty. Unfortunately meat was undercooked and had to keep turning it back. The rest of my party opted to eat their meat rare rather than turning it back. Not me. Food portions were more than adequate and presented very elegantly, more than expected for a poolside restaurant. The waiter was ok- good. Today, I was extremely impressed with room service food and service. The Arroz con pollo was superb. I KNOW arroz con pollo and this one was one of the best I've ever had. The presentation was elegant but not flashy, It tasted wonderful, together with crispy, crunchy tostones, how they should be. The service was amazing, the poor girl came 4 times to my room because I kept making special requests! Every time with a smile and intention of accommodating my requests. I am writing this while still staying here, that is how impressed and satisfied I am. If you are a VERY HIGH maintenance guest like ME, I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I can not wait to comeback again!! love it ...love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lightc1
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service and when I had a situation with my room, I was moved to another room in less than 5 minutes!! the manager was very attentive and eager to assist us at all the time. Everyone were very helfull and pool what fantastic as well as the jacuzzi. Food and beverage were expensive but it was ok! staffs were very friendly at all time. It was truely a very relaxing and wonderful vacation and place to stay!! I am going back again but without husband only with the girls!! ja! ja! just kidding!!

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as we had expected!”
Reviews.Content: I love Tripadvisor and I was shocked to find that the hotel staff was just as friendly and helpful as I'd anticipated. Check-in was a breeze - we were upgraded to a suite in the new tower. It didn't have an ocean view, but we got a fantastic AAA room rate, so no complaints. We purchased some snacks and drinks from the Walgreens and the mini mart to load up our fridge. The concierge helped us score a perfect table at Perla for a romantic and delicious anniversary dinner. The infinity pool near the Suite tower was lovely and quiet. We had lunch by the pool and found it to be appropriately priced for hotel food - and quite tasty. We did the San Juan Food tour of Old San Juan which was really neat and informative (and tons of good local food we might not have been brave enough to try on our own). We rented a car from Charlie's down the street and drove to El Yunque, Luquillo, and then the bio bay for a tour with Kayak PR. Saved a fortune over the tour groups by doing it ourselves - the roads are well marked and driving was easier than driving at home. We booked spa appointments at Zen Spa which were okay - not fabulous, but not bad...just okay. We had a great dinner at Jam one night, ate at the Burger Shack at the Luquillo kiosks, and were very sad to leave. We could easily have stayed another few days. Overall, a great trip and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere and service!”
Reviews.Author: Gina0611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a relaxing vacation and couldn't have been more pleased with the La Concha resort. The accommodations were very nice - very clean and modern. They gave us a top floor room with a balcony, which we enjoyed using. The pools and beach area are wonderful too. While the food and drinks are a bit pricey at Solera, the convenience and quality of food makes it worth it. We ate there numerous times during our stay and enjoyed the outdoor dining accommodations. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: Etoki
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern decor that feels very Euro. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially Felix Perez, the doorman. We stayed in a city view suite and it was beautiful, great bed and bedding. Not so clean, but nothing serious, mostly the floors. Room service was ridiculously expensive, 2 slices of chocolate cake with ice cream was $33. This included the service fee and tip, but really.... Still one of my favorite places.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property (with a few hiccups)”
Reviews.Author: alston1421
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days over the long Memorial Day weekend. We booked a partial ocean view suite in the suite tower and upgraded to an oceanview/oceanfront suite at check-in for a small fee (well less than the add'l $$ if we had booked the oceanview suite originally). Overall, the property was beautiful, modern and well kept. All the property amenities were nice and we enjoyed them. The adult infinity pool (directly adjacent to the newer suite tower) was a great find, away from the more crowded pools that are close to the main building. I'd highly recommend the newer accommodations in the suite tower, plus with the kitchenette you can go out and buy some groceries and not have to eat out 3 meals/day. We dined on a Wed. night at Perla - 5 course wine pairing dinner and thought it was terrific. Very reasonably priced for the quality of food and a terrific dining experience. I'd recommend doing Perla on a Mon through Wed night when the menu prices are lower ($20pp less in our instance) than on weekends... In comparison, avoid ordering over-priced poolside alcoholic drinks, for example, $9.75 for a rum and coke in a small plastic cup! The staff was generally pleasant but I wouldn't rate the quality of staff/service any higher than about 3 stars: - In general, I thought service was slow compared to what I've received at other Renaissance/Marriott properties... perhaps this is indicative of a bit of a laid back, slower paced vacation vibe. - We needed some hangers in our room upon arrival: it took 2 phone calls downstairs and 2 hours to get hangers. - We requested more pillows (only 2 pillows provided for 2 guests) the first evening at 10pm - the pillows arrived over 1 hour later. When I first called to request, the operator asked if I needed them for that evening?!?! Ah duh, Yes. (Why would I have been calling to get pillows for tomorrow evening?) - Our room wasn't well cleaned at arrival - found safety pins laying around, the bathroom/toliet wasn't all that clean either. I mentioned this to the staff and first thing the next morning, housekeeping addressed the problem to my satisfaction. - The concierge recommendations were less helpful/ideal than the tips I got from the Frommers San Juan pocket guide. We found a great breakfast place Kasalta (35 minutes walk through a nice neighborhood) via Frommers; we found an over-priced mediocre restaurant across the street (Budathai) from the concierage. The concierge suggested we eat at Budathai and get a terrace table - the terrace was NOT the best table in the house... one loud party of 12 people and one other table besides us. The concierge also recommended going to Bacardi Distillery - a so-so jaunt one afternoon - to get there, you either take a taxi the whole route ($35 one way) or take a taxi to old town then take a ferry and then a shared ride to the distillery. The concierge told us it was walking distance (less than 1 mile) from the ferry to the distillery - completely wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations - Need to do better cleaning the rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chipmunk72
Reviews.Content: I had much higher expectations for this resort, especially for the price I paid. My biggest complaint is the cleanliness of the room. We walked in our room and it smelled like urine. The baggage guy came to drop off our luggage at the same time we got to our room and he said the smell was probably the cleaning solution the hotel uses. Well if that is the smell of their cleaning solution, then they need to change it ASAP. He had someone come in and spray some neutralizer on our bedroom carpet, but that didn't help. Next issue was the bedding. The sheets had suspect hairs and were dirty. We called down to the front desk to request someone to come change it. It took like 3 hours for someone to come up and change it... until then I couldn't sit on the bed. Unacceptable! Third issue..... The hotel needs to get all new towels b/c the washing cycle is not quite working for them anymore. We received several dirty towels (which I assumed were washed.... but who knows). I had to call down to the front desk to request new towels b/c there was no way I was using those. Fourth issue.... The cleaning staff did not do a good job cleaning the floors and the carpet in the bedroom looked suspect (and this is why I wear flip-flops in hotel rooms). Oh and let's not forget the suspect water stain on the carpet next door to the bathroom. They need to seriously retrain their cleaning staff! Now the only reason why I didn't request a room change is b/c I had the feeling all the rooms would be unclean and below my standards and further I didn't plan on spending that much time in the room. But I was seriously considering a room change. The only positive thing about the room was the balcony and view. We had a partial ocean view and could see the ocean from our balcony. We also left our balcony door open most of the time and could hear the waves of the ocean. It really would have been a pleasant stay if the room wasn't so dingy. The front desk, concierge and valet staff were all friendly and helpful. The rest of the hotel was whatever.... no big deal. The poolside grill was pretty good though. Would not stay here again b/c of the room. Get it together La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “We Can't Wait To Return!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandLadyBug
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best resorts in Puerto Rico. So glad I did my research first (do check the TripAdvisor reviews. They are accurate). The oceanview suite room was beautiful and had everything we needed. Restaurant food was just adequate but the ambiance was to die for. Loved the pool and the ocean. There was a long wait to check-in due to the hotel being sold out, but the staff were friendly, professional and helpful at all times. The concierge is also very helpful. Use your AAA memebership if you can. The price we got for a 1 bedroom suite with living room and kitchenette is comparable to that of a regular size hotel room with no amenities. We really got a deal. My significant other and I are already talking about a return trip, and we will definitely be staying here when we do.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: Jonny_V70
Reviews.Content: I anticipated a larger room at first. The manager was kind enough to upgrade us at no extra charge for the remaining 3 nights! What I was most surprised about was the food in the hotel. Absolutely fantastic! I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for contemporary style with the most beautiful section of beach in the area. Book the suite. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brandylyn
Reviews.Content: Staff was super friendly and very helpful from staff outside (Felix & Luis Hernendez), bar staff (Coral) to front desk (Resisa). I enjoyed the hotel, rooms were very clean, room service was quick. Also the concierge desk was extremely helpful!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, we will definitely be coming back”
Reviews.Author: AshburnVacationer
Reviews.Content: I originally planned on staying at the Marriott, but it was sold out so we stayed at La Concha Resort. We had a great time and couldn't have been happier with our room. We stayed in one of the suites, which was perfect with our one year old son. We were able to cook him breakfast evey morning I. The kitchenette and had a separate place for him to sleep at night. When we arrived we were greeted by Felix, he is great with young children and really made us feel welcomed. He was also super friendly anytime we left the hotel or returned. The pools are nice and there are plenty of beach chairs and umbrellas to use at the pools or the beach. The food was good, but a little pricey. My only complaint would be the food service at the pool/outdoor restaurant was very slow. Other than that it was a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “I will return and so will you!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CocoChanel1975
Reviews.Content: We my husband an I first arrived we were kind of skeptical because of the outside view of the hotel upon arrival. It did not look like the majority of Marriott hotels. However, when we approached the lobby, it was like an high end art deco. We where greeted with smiles and greeting. When we got to our room we where blown away by the design and the trendy decor and furniture. I recommend a room in the suite tower. We had a one-bedroom suite with a kitchenette. Housekeeping was great. The drinks where awesome and sushi. Every night was filled with music and conversation. If you want to be in the mix of nightlife, upscale accommodations, nice people, and great food and drinks stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: TribecaGal_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha for a mini vacation. My ocean view room on the 5th floor was breathtaking. Clean hotel - rooms, common areas and beach. Entire hotel staff was professional, friendly and most helpful. Food at the hotel restaurants, while a little pricey, but comparable with other top ranked restaurants, was also great. There is a bus right on the corner of the hotel which will take you into Old San Juan, cost is .75 cents, exact change, each way; about a 10- 15 minute ride depending on traffic. This is a big hotel with a lot of activities/events going on, but still very quite. Looking forward to my next trip there. No question - will be staying at La Concha again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel-great vacation”
Reviews.Author: snev13
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel and surprised me with a 30th birthday vacation. He couldn't have done better! At the end of our visit we decided the best way to describe this hotel was "posh". This was our 3rd trip to PR. We've previously stayed at El Conquistador (in Fajardo) and although it was amazing, he decided it was too far away. The location of this hotel is PERFECT. About a 10 min ($12) cab ride from the airport, great neighborhood, many, many local restaurants and boutiques surrounding the hotel. Although there is not a huge "main pool", there are 3 smaller pools, each with their own advantages, and 2 large beach areas. Never had a problem getting a lounge chair which was nice, staff provided as many towels as wanted/needed. My husband and I love to try local foods and 3 out of the 4 days we walked to the local restaurants for breakfast (great food and very reasonable at $4-$8/per person) and less than a 5 min walk in any direction. There is a Subway restaurant directly across from the hotel, and right BEHIND that is an Italian restaurant called "IL Postino". Their breakfast was amazing, huge portions. We also had dinner there which was equally as good. Across from Il Postino was a Tapas restaurant that was great, and many little local PR restaurants with good food and GREAT hot sauces. Most of them sell the hot sauce as well to take home. Most of the time we had lunch at "solera" which is the restaurant that serves food outside near the pool/lounge area. Never had a bad meal there either. The skirt steak wrap was great, as were all of the salads. Didn't have a burger, but they looked and smelled great. As a side note there is also a Walgreens about 2 blocks to the left after you walk out of the lobby. Great to pick up bottled water for the room, cheese/crackers, or anything else you might need. Spent a few late nights in the casino. Had a good time and ended up ahead which is always nice. A lot of locals come to the casino-was fun to meet and get to know some of them Went into Old San Juan one afternoon to visit our favorite ceviche bar-AquaViva. We discovered it on our first trip to PR and make a point of going back each visit. The open air lobby does turn into more of a "club scene" around 10p-11p which we really enjoyed. Loud music, great drinks, lots of beautiful people! Reminded us a lot of South Beach. I can see how it might not be as enjoyable for a different crowd however. We saw LOTS of groups of young women here-It is a great place for a "girls trip" and will think about that for next time. And another note to the ladies-bring your highest heels so you don't feel left out. I have never seen hotter OR higher women's shoes! Overall had a wonderful experience, would absolutely come back and stay again, probably bring a group of our friends with us as well. We love PR, don't need our US passports to get there, you feel as though you are in a tropical place (which you are), and most importantly we felt very safe. Thank you La Concha for a Fabulous time!!!! Please feel free to check out our photos and email me with any questions

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Room, but not worth the BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: LAEmiliaC
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on a king ocean view suite. We have two small children so it was perfect. Connecting living room with a door. We checked for bed bugs when we got there, but have never seen them before so we were not sure what we were looking for. The second to last night there my son woke up in the middle of the night complaining of mosquito bites, so I assumed that's what they were. But none of the rest of us had any. Once we got back to New York, I started itching in our bed. I found a fed bed bugs that I have to assume came with us from the hotel. So make sure you check!!! They need to address the problem! Sent them an email, but no response.

Reviews.Title: “Our Dream Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: krh58
Reviews.Content: My husband and i went for out honeymoon. The hotel was very classy/modern--more upscale than we predicted (in a good way). Also the staff was INCREDIBLY friendly--we even got high fived when we pulled up by a man named Felix : ) The place had all kinds of amentites, great resturants in the hotel, quenching margaritas, and two amazing hot tubs!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Elegant Bliss”
Reviews.Author: ECHere
Reviews.Content: La Concha was our choice for our second trip to PR it's been 15 years. We stayed May 14-21 2011 and endured the crazy weather even in sunny PR it rained, hailed and one tornado the locals had never seen either. We loved the hotel we upgraded to the ocean view which was spectacular with such beautiful, fun water and high waves for body and board surfing. Mix your own drinks you have a fridge and there's lots of places within walking distance to eat and stock up on your own munchies the hotel prices are high but very good quality drinks and food. The grounds, pools, hot tub, lobby are so chic and fun we had a blast. The most beutiful women and men so very warm and delightful. Loved the rain forest, old San Juan, the 75 cent bus rides , free trams, casinos and festive party atmosphere at the hotel. Do the Catamaran trip for sure. We never lacked for anything and would love to stay again would highly recommend this jewel of a hotel for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly relaxed elegance”
Reviews.Author: barrysbin
Reviews.Content: Just a beautiful spaceous hotel, top down. Well run with a staff that gets it. Special prompts to Amelia the server in Solara for setting us up with great Breakfasts and Danillia at the Solara bar who must have branded the term service with a smile. Almost felt guilty for spending so little time in San Juan, the resort is that good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angiejeff
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early, as our flight was earlier in the afternoon. We had booked a regular room but the hotel staff located a suite in the new tower that was ready so she upgraded us to a better room. The hotel is lovely, the grounds and pools were wonderful so we were so dissapointed that it rained the whole day we were there. The sand and beach were not the best we have been to, a little too much surf, but we did enjoy walking on the beach when it wasn't raining. The room was beautiful and everything was supplied, ice, glasses, plates, silverware, etc. Having a big balcony was wonderful. We spent the majority of our time there just soaking in the views of the bustling city. There is a lot of shops and restaurants in the area to walk to, as well as a mini mart across the street with beer and snacks. We had really good service and will be thrilled to stay there again and recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort with A+ Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover4Ever06
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Concha was amazing. The property is beautiful and the staff go beyond expectations to ensure an enjoyable stay. Louis Citron went out of his way to turn what could have been a disasterous vacation into a trip of a lifetime. Upon arrival, my husband experienced issues with his mobility equipment, but Louis ensured that the issue was resolved. We hope to have the opportunity to return to Puerto Rico and we will definitely stay at La Concha again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel w/friendly staff but didn't feel the luxury”
Reviews.Author: Poketlynnt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a quick 4 night stay at La Concha. The hotel is only about 10 to 15 minutes from the airport, which was nice. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived because we were so early, but the staff was very nice about holding our things while we hit the beach and the room was ready a little while later (2 hours ahead of the regular check in time). The Pros: -Great location. Lots of dining choices around the hotel including Dunkin Donuts right across the street and Starbucks, Cold Stone and Haagen Daz down the block. Lots of liquor and convenience stores too (and a Walgreens) within close walking distance. For dinner I would recommend Ropa Vieja for authentic local cuisine. -Friendly and attentive staff. Everyone from the concierge to the people cleaning the pool said hello with a smile. The waiters were all very prompt with orders, although there seemed to be too few waiters on the beach and at the pools (maybe due to the weather though - lots of thunderstorms). -Lots of seating around the whole resort. Whether you want to hang out in the lobby or by any of the 4 pools, there were always plenty of chairs. (this might not be the case during high season). There were also clusters of outdoor couches with umbrellas that I really liked. Cons: - Rooms: They really weren't anything special. We had an ocean front room in the main building on the 5th floor. We didn't have any problem with noise from the pool or restaurants. However, the carpet was really worn and dirty looking. The bed and pillows were soft and lumpy and the sheets were cheap and kept slipping off the edges of the mattress. (We didn't have any housekeeping issues that others have mentioned) - Decor: I knew going in that this was an art-deco type of aesthetic, which isn't my style. However, aside from that, there was a lot of hardscape and not a lot of tropical decoration with the plants. This is a minor issue, but I just couldn't feel relaxed surrounded by concrete. Also, 3 of the 4 pools are crammed into a small area so it feels a bit claustrophobic. - Internet was painfully slow and at times would not connect the our iPad. Food/Drink: We had lunch by the pool almost every day. The menu is basic, but the food was actually pretty good. I'd recommend the Latin Sliders (chorizo burgers w/mushrooms, bleu cheese and onions). All the sandwiches come with fries, which were delicious. Lunch ranges from $12 to $16 approx. Drinks were very good - not watered down at all. Prices were a bit high, but in line with what I've seen elsewhere. $9 to $14 (and up for wine and champagne). The only dinner we ate at the resort was at La Perla, because we felt we had to try it. The ambiance was very nice and the menu was inventive. A fun twist was the wine list presented on an iPad. The food was just okay though, and certainly not worth the price. We eat out A LOT, and I don't mind spending $200 on dinner. But $32 for THREE shrimp on a small pile of rice is a bit much in my opinion. Overall, the hotel had a nice vibe. It's good for a weekend getaway with friends or your partner. There were even some kids there and they seemed to be having fun although it didn't seem there was a lot for them to do. I won't go back, but I'm glad to have visited.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Milagros083177
Reviews.Content: The view, the room, the food and the attention from Mr. Tischler making our room accomodations... everithing was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: thisdivaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Juan Thurs, May 5-Sun, May 8. We arrived to the hotel by taxi for $18 around 4 pm. Waited just a short while to check in and to my amazement our room was ready. We did inquire about upgrading which they were happy to do, but decided we could spend the money elsewhere. We had a king resort view room with a balcony. Very clean and even had a surround sound for the tv which we could not get to work, but able to listen to the local stations and play our cd (which happened to be in the laptop). sliding doors kept the noise out. The only time we heard people at the pool was on Saturday when more guest had checked in, but even then it was still realitively quiet. Also theWe could also see the ocean from our room and I left my laptop out with no issues. The property is very nice. Two infinity pools within the main resort area, one heated (not as hot as the jacuzzi, but very relaxing) and the one overlooking the ocean is not. We did not get to use that one because of its obvious location and it was usally crowded. Beach was much better than I expected from the other photos posted on here. I would say the 3rd infinity pool on the otherside of Perla Restaurant (which we did not use either) was not as pretty from our view on the beach. They are restoring another hotel next to La Concha and there was some graffiti on that building. But then again that was our view from the beach. The staff was wonderful. I would agree with other posts that service can be a bit slow, but we found this to be true at other places as well. Wendy's down the street was by far the slowest. Luis on the beach set up our lounges and umbrella and we tipped. The next day we just found an open spot and sat down. Service is also available on the beach, but you may wait a little while. Felix in the lobby was also great. He secured our bags for us after checkout while we waited until it was time to leave for the airport. The concierge, I think his name was Robert was awesome. The hotel has a neat touch screen at the desk where you can look up area restaurants or other activities. Omar was one of our favs who waited on us in the pool area. The fight was Saturday night and the casino was packed with spectators. We went to La Isla Verde for the evening and by the time we returned around 3 am, the casion was still packed. The bar in the lobby had just closed, but there was still quite a few people enjoying the evening. I would have loved a club in the hotel, but the manager explained to us that not all guests would agree. For me being on vacation without kids and having a place to party all in one would have been great. My only other complaint would be the bathroom. Very lovely, but no fan and not much privacy with the the frosted glass in the door. I agree with other posts that water from the shower does get on the floor, but hey put down a towel. Overall this was a great trip. We enjoyed the hotel so much that we hardly did any of the other activities we had planned. This was truly a vacation in that we simply did nothing but lay out at the beach or pool and relax by day. We enjoyed the nightlife in the area and La Isla Verde. We rested on the beds in the shade at the beach. Weather was perfect, not too hot and very pleasant in the evening. I would definitely recommend the sliders even though pricey for 3, they were delicious. Very contemporary look and feel. Many couples and a few families. I will definitely return. Last comment, if the Real Hangover Crew from Vancouver reads this, we miss you guys and had so much fun! Also our friends from Johns Creek, GA and NY, so glad we met you!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service , great food and awesome nightlife.”
Reviews.Author: wilsoncardonajr
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great vacation . The Solera restaurant was excellent, the manager fremiot was the best he made us feel at home. We are coming back in november , we can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend, but with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: bruss81
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha with a friend in early May. Overall we liked the hotel. Good things: Proximity to bars/restaurants, concierge and staff down at the entrance, fitness center Bad things: Not enough umbrellas at the pools. Sounds like a minor detail but when the sun is pouring down and there's no shade to be found, it is a big deal!!! Fitness Center: Gets busy by 9 AM but has reasonable selection of cardio equipment and weights AND they don't charge extra to use it!!! Location: The location was great for walking to restaurants and bars, and the Walgreens and Starbucks just up the road saved us loads of money on breakfast. However, our Bio Bay excursion (East Island Company) was marred by a terribly long travel time to Fajardo. They picked us up at 3PM and we were not dropped off at the hotel until midnight. Rooms: We stayed in the main hotel with an oceanfront view. While I did miss having a balcony, the tall windows opened up widely allowing for a feel of open air. The carpeting was dirty and the room was dated. I do recommend an ocean view on a level at least as high as the 6th floor. Otherwise the noise from the beach and from La Perla could keep you awake at night. Housekeeping: The most common complaint I'd seen on tripadvisor (aside from the noise of the bar area, which was not a problem) was inability to get the room cleaned in a timely manner. We only had one day where we had sent housekeeping away when they first came at 8AM (what?!) and then didn't get the room cleaned until 5PM, even with a phone call to the front desk at 3PM requesting it be cleaned. When our sink wasn't draining well, we called and had a handful of gentlemen up and working on the problem within minutes. Very pleased with the service there. Food: We didn't eat at the hotel restaurants aside from one lunch out by the pool. The portions were good as was the quality of the food. Prices were a bit steep but what I would expect from a poolside restaurant. Restaurants/Bars: You MUST walk down to Rum Bar and Bistro. Sunday nights they have half off all wine/beer/drinks and Monday night they have half off all food. Seriously do NOT miss this place. Beef carpaccio appetizer, bread with garlic butter, halibut ceviche and halibut entree....all to die for. Bob Marley drink and Agua de Coco mojitos were phenomenal. Marmalade is sister restaurant to Rum. More formal and more pricey but still delicious and worth the money (in Old San Juan). Across the street, Cafe del Angel has a wonderful bartender named Eduardo who made us up some nice tasty and strong mojitos. Noise: Not an issue, even on Friday and Saturday nights. A little bit of base could be heard but nothing that kept me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: lib101
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 5 girlfriends for a 3 night stay at the La Concha. Right away, we were blown away with the super friendly service. Nev the doorman served us champagne at the front desk, and then somehow we were upgraded to a suite in the suite tower. The front desk woman just said "I know when I travel with my girlfriends I would want to be close by, so we put you all in 2 suites next to each other". Originally we had booked 2 junior suites in the original building. A bell hop brought up our bags and told us where to get food and liquor for the room as well as get our radio going with the best Puerto Rico radio station. We had dinner at Solera on Friday night outside on the lounge chairs - 3 big tapas was the perfect amount of food with a pitcher of sangria. I recomend the Paella and the nachos. Really great and just the right amount of food and drink. On Saturday we managed to be on the beach for 1.5 hours before the rain came in. So we had lunch and drinks at the lobby bar and everyone at the bar were offered blue shots (I'm assuming vodka) because of the rain. So we napped and got ready for dinner at Volga. Again, outstanding food and service. Then we hit the lobby bar which turned into quite the scene! Met a lot of interesting people, many of which were local. After realizing the best beach time was in the morning, we hit the beach early then did a spa day at Zen Spa across the street. I don't recommend that place, most of the girls were disappointed in their treatments. Headed to BLT Steak for dinner at the Ritz Carlton that night but only because it was on someone else's dime. Good food, but honestly, you really don't feel like you are in Puerto Rico. Fancy but too stuffy and not fun. The Lobby Bar at La Concha closed at midnight on Sunday, but we brought down our own bottle of wine and the staff was great about that. Monday we hit the beach again then went to Old San Juan before our flight. Definitely want to spend more time there, but we were happy that the hotel had everything right there, you really didn't need to leave. The hotel grounds were beautiful, with lots of places to sit and lounge, 3 pools and a hot tub. The beach was very nice too, and because there were plenty of waves, we watched the sufers do their thing everyday. Nev made our group feel completely safe at the start of our trip and all of the other doormen were fun as well. Felix gave us high fives and we even got a picture with him! Overall, if you are looking to stay a swanky place with out the stuffiness and great food and drinks, the La Concha is it! We loved it so much we are coming back next April!!

Reviews.Title: “My Daughter's Sweet 16! What a blast!”
Reviews.Author: vacolon
Reviews.Content: This trip was planned for my Daughter who turned 16 and was my gift to her. This great review starts off with the friendliness of the staff at La Concha as they gave us a discount for an upgrade for an Ocean View Room since it was her birthday. The help that recieved from Miguel, who helped us with our bags to the room, was fabulous!!! He gave us a quick guide of the hotel (pointing out areas) and recommended some great places to eat which was not a let down at all!!! He was so polite and fun to talk to! The hotel was absolutely fabulous from the room, to the pools and the restaurants and of course the access to the beach! But the best experience we had was with the Concierge! Victor Rodriguez was so helpful in so many ways I don't even know where to start! We had to rent a car so that we can take a 2 hour drive to the zip lining we had planned and he realized that most of the local car rental shops had closed. He called another location and they were able to pick us up at the hotel to get a car. When we ventured off to our 2 hour trip, we got caught in traffic and my daughter was disappointed because the zip lining company did not want to wait for us. As we arrived back at the hotel, Victor eased our worries by recommending other locations and even told us to go relax and have fun while he calls some places for us and sets us up! We were able to have a wonderful time the next day zip lining and it's an experience that the girls and myself will never forget!!!! If you want an awesome hotel with great service, La Concha is the place to be!!! Be sure to ask for Victor as I have never had such great customer service at a hotel before! Thanks Victor!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great price”
Reviews.Author: sologirltraveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were traveling to BVI and stopped in San Juan for two nights to break up our trip. I used TripAdvisor to find a reasonably priced, upscale hotel that was on the beach, and we gave this one a go. For what we needed, we loved it. Ocean view was fabulous, room was basic but nice, and the fitness center was AWESOME. The only downside I heard from my friend was that room service as spotty and the food wasn't great, but you want to get out of the hotel anyway. The staff was friendly and seemed to want you to enjoy your stay. I had a massage by the pool which was nice. If I had only one complaint it's that the infinity pool on the ocean was supposed to be adults only and was swarming with kids. They should have someone watching that or at least post some signage. There is plenty of room for the kids in the larger, main pool area. The adults need somewhere to relax! If you go we highly recommend you go into OLD San Juan and eat at both Dragonfly and Marmalade (where I venture to say I had the BEST meal ever, even eating at restaurants all over the world). When we got back, the hotel bar was hopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTraveler71
Reviews.Content: We returned to San Juan for our second visit and selected La Concha Resort: what a fabulous place! From Felix and the other bell staff, to the front desk and casino staff to staff working the gift shop; all went out of their way to make you feel at home and welcomed. Everyone was extremely helpful in providing information about the resort and surrounding areas to transportation to other areas of San Juan. The many pools, open 24hr/day, offer a great selection for relaxation; the beach is very clean, chairs and umbrellas free and are set up by hotel staff in your selected beach location. We attempted to take the bus to Old San Juan and then opted for sharing a cab with three others. Fare was $12 one way. San Juan has beautiful architecture, cobbelstone streets, friendly people and great shopping! The area is easy for a self walking tour and many choices for meals. Be sure to visit the Cathedral on Crystal Street and then of course, you only need to look down the same street and enjoy the many, many shops! We enjoyed an afternoon meal at Senor Frogs. What fun! May is apparently the rainy season, don't let that stop you! San Juan is fabulous, friendly and La Concha Resort is a wonderful destination!

Reviews.Title: “A+++++ What more can you ask?”
Reviews.Author: brim88
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night/5 day vaca from NYC. Gorgeous mid-century modern tropical hotel unparalled in its renovated design aesthetic and detailing (I'm an architectural interior designer). So clean and well-kept -- not a spec of dust or an insect noticed in 5 days! Staff was incredibly accomodating (front desk upgraded us), housekeeping was very attentive, restaurants/health club/beach/security/port-cochere staff always smiling and very, very helpful. Food was tremendous at the pool and gardens restaurant "Solera". Perla was quite an experience with very gracious and accomodating staff there as well. Beachfront property was absolutely wonderful too. Very close to stores and great restaurants. Minor issues: many little kids (0-5 yrs) - - the hotel should really have more than one adult pool available (the adult pool is a bit away from the action, lacked ambiance, and is waaaay too close to adjacent construction. This construction is no fault of the hotel's and was really only bothersome for one morning on the beach. The two of the main pools central to the hotel are heated - - that seemed very strange as when you are baking in 85+ heat w/extreme UV's you need to cool down your skin in the pool - - not heat it up. Also, the two main pools are loud with lots of drinking and little kiddies w/parents in the pool and we didnt find that relaxing at all. Also, the trade winds at the beach and the adjacent infinity pool are stronger and keep you much cooler. Adjoining Casino was more than fine as we are light gamblers (not many tables open for more active players). Thurs eves many biz functions make use of the property's various function rooms - - but it adds to the lobby vibe at night w/many attractive and well dressed local professionals arriving in their evening best. Friday was a big party night in the lobby but I loved the vibe - - loud but not obnoxiously loud like poolside in Las Vegas! The adjacent street is loud at night (even boisterous at times) so request a high floor/ocean view at all times (you might regret any city views or non-ocean views at this hotel). ALL IN ALL A GREAT EXPERIENCE AND KUDOS TO LA CONCHA STAFF AND MGMT. ON MAKING THIS HOTEL ONE OF THE CARRIBBEAN'S GREAT VACA SPOTS. A+++++++++ EXPERIENCE. BRAVO LA CONCHA. P.S. Buy the La Concha exclusive CD "La Concha Volume 1", great cocktail Latin sounds you can take home.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, great bar, fabulous staff, swanky common areas and rooms”
Reviews.Author: SoCal74
Reviews.Content: Me and my other half stayed here prior to a cruise and then again for a night when the cruise was over. We stayed in the high tower (ocean front view) in the main building on the front end of the cruise and then upgraded to an ocean front suite for the last night on the back end of the cruise. The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the Condado area near many restaurants and it has a great beach with multiple pools and hot tubs. There is some great shopping in the area. Jose is the guest services director and he is fantastic. He will most likely be present in the lobby introducing himself and making sure that your stay is going perfectly. There is a great bar scene in the lobby that starts late (as does everything in PR). I stay at Marriott hotels 100+ nights a year for work. This was one of the best experiences I've had and can't wait for my next trip down here. I'll definitely be booking at La Concha again and recommending it to all my friends and coworkers!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and 60+% oceanview rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carl041
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within walking distant to great restaurants and right on the beach (beware of the strong turf). Good food, comfortable beds and some outstanding staff. Check prices for Tower Suite rooms if rom size is more important than views. Tower Suites have european kitchenettes and living room with sofa bed. Newest hotel in Condado Area. Bus stop 20 feet from main entrance. Plenty of taxi cabs. They do however do not care about loyal clients....have stayed there at least 6 times..."something has to give..."

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: BSchafbuch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at La Concha and had a great time - no real complaints! The staff was very helpful, especially the concierge. They were able to recommend good tours and good places to eat nearby, and also were very helpful with transportation. We had a ocean view room in the tower which was perfect - I would definitely recommend paying the extra! The balcony was good-sized and had a gorgeous view! There was some construction going on next door that was a bit noisy in the morning but did not disrupt our stay at all. We ate at Solera and the Sidewalk Cafe. We loved the Sidewalk Cafe for lunches- prices are reasonable, fresh produce, good smoothies. The prices at the restaurants are a little expensive but comparable to other resorts we have stayed at. The beach was beautiful! The water was a little rough but on our last two days was relatively calm. One day there was a problem with a lot of seaweed. There is a reef nearby to the right of the hotel that several swimmers were getting cut on. The rock pier in front of the hotel offers beauftiful views and is a nice place to go sit and just enjoy the view. There are free chairs and umbrellas on the beach and again the staff is very helpful with setting those up. We had no issues with people approaching us on the beach selling things or asking for money; the ice cream man walks up and down with us cart- good ice cream! Overall it was a great stay and would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, unique resort with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Momof4kidsNearBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with three teenagers--my daughter and a friend, and my son. Since I was the only adult, I initially was concerned that I would have to keep the kids near me at all times, but this resort was very safe and there was no reason to leave. The lobby is very modern and open; it was humid and the common areas of the hotel are 'open-air" so you feel the warm breezes when walking around. We loved our rooms overlooking the beach. Service was outstanding: very friendly and accommodating staff. I found the drink and food prices a little high which is not atypical for a nice resort. Teenagers eat a lot so we went to a nearby CVS and bought snack food and drinks (a six-pack of Corona was $12 in the liquor store!!) Make sure to take a cab out to Old San Juan (about $15 each way). Go in the late afternoon and stay for dinner. It is a really beautiful area and the restaurants are great. (Do not wear heels! The streets are cobblestone and it is VERY hilly). We had a great time. The only downside is that the pools are on the small side. if you like to swim for exercise, be prepared to do a lot of short laps! Also, the ocean water was amazingly warm and clear, but a few of us got a little "roughed up" by the crashing waves. Hang on tight to little children.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Canadianos
Reviews.Content: Went here for a stag for 5 nights, had the best time ever, made tons of noise and partied hard! The location was on the rodeo drive of San Juan with shopping and awesome food steps away from la concha. The best way to cure a hang over was to chill on the beach. Beach chairs n umbrellas are free of charge if u are on the beach. Staff was awesome! Best I've ever dealt with and Jonathon helped us recap what happened to our buddy on night number two which nobody remembered..he was really helpful, the staff was awesome and most of them knew us by our first names which was awesome lol...this place is huge and our entire group will be coming back again soon but with our girlfriends also... Most memorable trip ever, awesome and very helpful staff..Guys will fall in love with all the beautiful girls so if ur bringing ur wife or girlfriend bring a dark pair of shades so she doesn't know who ur lookin at. One word sums it up for this place... Beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and modern hotel...great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: aqualove77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Concha was amazing, This beachfront hotel has everything you need for a resort including bars, restaurants and a casino, the staff is wonderful and courteous. is located in Condado surrounded by a few designer boutiques excellent for shopping and is 15 min from Old San Juan. La Concha is perfect for relaxing and also has a vibrant nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Resort & Staff”
Reviews.Author: ftobo001
Reviews.Content: When first arriving at La Concha, you are taken away by the impressive decor and South Beach style lobby. The room we had was a regular studio Oceanfront, this is definitely worth the price. The view is breathtaking, there are times where we left the balcony door open and enjoyed the sounds of the crashing waves and cool breeze. Bugs around this season weren't a problem, no mosquitoes or palmetto bugs. The pool restaurant Solera had good snacks, I ordered the churrasco fruit salad and it was very tasty. The service was good. The 3 pools are very nice, the main pool is heated.. I would say a bit too hot for the spicy sun. It was nice to relax in the Infiniti adult pool, which was a perfect cool temperature and a overlooking view of the ocean. Felix the doorman, as stated by the rest of the Tripadvisor community, is an exceptional employee. He goes out of his way to acknowledge every person's presence and in a charismatic and funny yet respectful way. Another bellman that deserves credit and praise is Carlos, he gave us great recommendations and was a very pleasant character to interact with. He recommended a great place for breakfast in Old San Juan called "La Bonbonera", thanks Carlos. Great professionalism and genuine love for his job and the culture of people that surround him. The final employee that really stood out was the server on the beach and the pool that works at Solera which is named Omar. He remembered us on consecutive nights and always went the extra mile to serve us. On the day of our departure he mentioned, "Ojala se lleven buenos recuerdos de la isla y muchas gracias por venir.", which means Hopefully you will take unforgettable memories of our island and thanks a lot for coming. We will indeed have these everlasting memories of this beautiful island. Recommendations to eat: to the left of the hotel about five restaurants down is a local puerto rican place with great mofongo, steaks, arroz con gandules and all the great food for a very good price. The service and staff there were outstanding. They have a few plasmas there where we watched a few NBA playoff games.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: racat123
Reviews.Content: We (my husband two kids, my mum, sister and I) wanted to take a relaxing mini vacation and we got just that. Very nice hotel, love the pools and the beach. Wonderful staff especially the guys outside.. Hi Felix and co (Hi five...lol hope you remember us) they were a trip and I always looked forward to walking out of the hotel with my family because they made you feel special... Thanks all, we will be back again....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service - Planning our wedding”
Reviews.Author: IvyMan2010
Reviews.Content: We're planning our destination wedding in San Juan and after looking at dozens of locations we settled for La Concha for our wedding cocktail reception. The staff has been incredibly helpful (particularly Fremiot) and accommodating to our every need. The hotel itself is beautiful with a terrific view of the ocean, a gorgeous pool area (the Solera restaurant has great food), and a bar/lounge that will give the best south beach hotels a run for their money. We highly recommend this Condado hotel and are at ease knowing we have so much support for our special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Steven Starr would be proud”
Reviews.Author: twoandhalfbaths
Reviews.Content: I normally laugh and mock people that write reviews. I always thought it seem pointless. But after my stay at La Concha I'm now guilty as charged! When we first arrived in the lobby I felt like Michael Chorleone in Godfather 2 when he went to Cuba to meet with their government. I mean the lobby presented: marble floors, sky lounge style bar and very chic italian leather seating and much more...We stayed in the mini suite which was very plush, sunk in jet stream tub with a frost glass casing. Oh and two very nice size flat screen tv's with one mounted on the wall. The Ocean view was breathtaking. Me and my wife watch the sunset every night like two teenagers on lovers-lane. La Concha staff couldn't have been more helpful. I needed a USB cord for my laptop and like magic they appeared at my door in minutes. The young ladies at the front desk made sure no patrons were left unattented to when we first arrived. I mean it was so perfect I kept waiting for the other shoe to drop (I'm a New Yorker) so pardon me. I'm so glad we brought some night clothes because these people were dress to impress. The lobby of the hotel has a Upper Manhattan/South Beach style sky lounge that turns into a nightclub. Not annoying with extremely loud music where you can barely hold a conversation with wall to wall traffic. The music is techno/fusion, more of a backdrop for the scene. The restaraunts are very nice as well. We ate at Voga which was very goood for the price we thought. The rest of our stay we ate along the strip on Ashfurd AVE. That's another pro to staying here, you are not confined to the grounds, there's plenty of other options. Oh fellas, be sure to where your darkest pair of shades, your eyes will wonder (no getting around it) the women are beautiful! From the ones cleaning your rooms, bartending, front desk etc they're all knockouts! My wife and I have been together 20 years so it's nothing new for us but to you newbies just be sure to where shades to hide your roaming eyes. Overall "La Concha" met all of our personal needs: great location, great atmosphere, great customer service and a great ambiance! The entire hotel looks like a Steven Starr threw up all over the place. If anybody ever been to a Steven Starr owned restaraunt knows he has a great attention to detail when it comes to aiming to please. La Concha, what can I say? as one Arnold Swartz would say "I'll be back" And to you reading this review.....what are you waiting for? book your trip now! FYI Felix the doorman was the best doorman I ever encountered. Don't worry, you can't miss him, he'll be sure to meet and greet you. The guy is like a walking navigation system he has a pulse on the entire area and he was extremely pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, will come back”
Reviews.Author: Rhearox
Reviews.Content: My friends and I travelled from New York and we stayed at La Concha in San Juan. This was my first time in Puerto Rico and I must say I was very impressed.Upon arriving at La Concha, we were pleasantly greeted with staff. The lobby looks great and the hotel overall has a great ambience. We had an oceanview room and I must say, it was beautiful and to wake up by the beach was priceless!! My friends and I enjoyed the pool at La concha as well. It was very clean and the staff always make sure that you have what you need. Victor R. at Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. He provided great service and ensuring that we got all the information that we needed. He gave us pointers on how to get around Old San Juan and even drew a map for us so we can easily navigate the town. He made our vacation much more enjoyable because he properly directed us to hot spots in Puerto Rico. Overall, my experience with La Concha was wonderful and my friends and I will come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: favio-espineira
Reviews.Content: The place its awesome and also have a beautiful view, food its fantastic and the people its very nice. I do a lot of work when I travel and Internet conection is a most. Most hotels (even the expensive ones) have TERRIBLE Internet services which is often made worse by poor wireless service plus they sometimes charge for that service. At La Concha they offer wired and wireless services at the room free of charge and also a very decent hi-speed service. The Gym is great with a lot of new tech equiment. Nice Job!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews - here's why....”
Reviews.Author: GinaDMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: For everything I liked, seems like there was something I didn't like to balance it out. So I hope this helps you chose based on what's important to you! Location: Pros - right in the heart of San Juan, very safe to walk either right or left out of hotel, various restaurants and price ranges to chose from. Probably the best central location of all the resorts, really nice area of San Juan, except for the BEACH.... Cons - Beach is borderline terrible (so chose location wisely - could be the deal breaker :) Although pretty to see the waves crashing on the rocks, rough waters, lots of seaweed, and not a vibrant beach scene. It's just not a nice, tropical beach. The pool is nothing special (especially if you like an active pool scene, tropical drinks/music, swim up bar, etc.). Hotel: Pros - lobby is definately jumping, seems like the place to be. Good nightlife, people watching (there was a fashion show when we were there, spotted Rosie Perez, NBA cheerleaders staying there (doing a promo at the mall)). Cons - not casual/relaxing/low-key place; felt like after a long day couldn't throw on t-shirt and flip flops and just hang out and get a beer. So this is obviously personal preference, just wasn't our scene. But if you like to get dressed up every night, mingle among the hip, techno at night, and you are ok with paying $30 for 2 drinks than this may be for you....We don't mind for one night but certainly not an entire stay (we are also 40 yrs old so been there/done that, lol). Rooms: Pros - Jr suite was the equivalent of a small apt in NYC; very clean consistent maid service; flat screen TV with all the regular cable channels, plentiful aveda products, nice closet system to stay organized, ocean view room was right on beach, could hear waves crashing at night. Very scenic views. Cons - NOISY. Constantly reminded in the city, buses, motorcycles, early morning construction of some sort (7am). if you open balcony door at night, the sound of ocean can override (which is a pleasant sound!), but if it gets hot, then you have to close door... Food: Pros - Only ate 2 places (pool and Perla), both very good. Perla was very nice (possibly the best Sangria I have ever had). Service was excellent. Cons - expensive ($70 for lunch: salad, sliders, and 4 beers); ($120 for dinner: no apps, 2 small meals, split one dessert and 2 drinks). Fine for a day or two, not every day. Venture out - plenty of places to chose from... Staff: Pros - Awesome people. Genuinely friendly, welcoming, desire to help you enjoy your stay. You'll see Felix's name mentioned a lot in reviews.... Cons - this place is busy, so it's hard to get a personal connection with the hotel or staff. you will wait to check in, wait in line to talk to concierge or talk to guys at cab station for advice, etc. Overall - it's not as though there is anything "wrong" with the hotel, It's definately more personal preference on what area of San Juan to stay in. If you want to be in the city and feel like you are in the thick of things, don't care about money, then stay here. If you still want to be centrally located, save a few bucks, try the Marriott. If you like this area, but want a little more quiet, I would consider the Conrad. IF you are going to Puerto Rico for a relaxing, Caribbean-type experience, I would strongly consider staying in the Isla Verde area. The ESJ or Intercontinental. ESJ crowd average age seemed to range from 20s to 50s, while the Intercontinental was 30s - 70s. The beach there was very nice; warm tranquil water, some areas of shade by palm trees, areas by the hotels had a vibrant beach scene, also quiet areas to chose from. Pool at the ESJ was gorgeous and very lively at the swim up bar but they also had a 2nd quieter pool. The area of Isla Verde is not as nice as Condado though, as far as shops, restaurants, etc. Walking around Isla Verde was more strip-mall-ish. If only we could combine the beach/hotel pools of Isla Verde with Condado that would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Hendrix1127
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in Puerto Rico PERIOD!!! The rooms are beyond comfortable, with fantastic views! Definately get the spa suite it has a two person shower hot tub on terrace with enough room for a table 4 chairs and a lounge chair! It overlooks the ocean and is just fantastic! The bed is very comfy and even leaving the sliding glass door open at night i heard nothing but the ocean...when closed i heard nothing perfect sleep! The parties would go into all hours of the night and i coudlnt hear a thing. Staff is fantastic friendly and very accomodating. Plenty of stores to go out to eat or just get coffee so you dont need to be stuck at the hotel. Condado is a very nice and safe area with partoled beaches at all hours of the night and police everywhere. I'm definately coming back to this hotel again its was a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent hotel - Awful wireless service”
Reviews.Author: RASS_1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel is terrific (just read the other reviews) with great ambiance, good food (mainly in the Volga and La Perla restaurants), outstanding views and great pools. The one big drawback if you need to do any work is that the wireless service is just pathetic, with speeds between 11Mbps (if you are lucky) and 1Mbps (most likely). This can be a big deal when you need to stay connected and you can't even connect to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very modern lobby, great staff especially Felix Perez he was a riot & made us feel like we were special!! Our ocean view was amazing, food in the hotel rest was 6 out of 10. If I can offer one piece of advice walk the strip eat @ local rest SAVE YOUR $$$!!! Concierge staff "Louise" was/is wonderful she helped orchestrate a cake & balloons reasonably as a surprise!! The lobby bar was nice the bartenders were friendly & great! I will b back!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching...stay at La Concha...trust me!”
Reviews.Author: GOLDandGARNET
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I could write an endless amount of information about my stay at La Concha. I will spare you and just explain what you need to know. You must stay in the Suite Tower...it is much nicer than the older building. We had a "partial" ocean view room and it still had an amazing view. The food and drinks are expensive, but you're on vacation, and they are no cheaper at another resort. There is a small shop 1 block away that sells beer & liquor. My girlfriend and I bought a bottle of rum and some mixers and saved a ton of money by mixing our own drinks and heading to the pool or beach. The thing that struck me...everyone we met on the tours/charters were disapointed in their hotel choice. They all wished they had booked La Concha, and were using the La Concha facilities during the day. Bottom Line...this is a resort, and you will pay resort-like prices...La Concha is worth every penny if you stay in the Suite Tower. The reviewers who seemed unhappy were primarily in the older building. Lastly, I was driving myself crazy trying to pick which hotel to stay....I made an educated guess and picked La Concha and when I entered the lobby I knew it was the right choice...stop debating, stop searching, trust me...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views”
Reviews.Author: kam013
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long stay at the La Concha resort. Our immediate impression upon walking in was beautiful. The lobby was bright, open, inviting and a buzz with activity. Check in went smoothly, although not speedy. Our room was a king, ocean view with a full size sliding window overlooking the beach, pool and ocean. The view was breathtaking and it is the thing I miss the most about Puerto Rico. The room was extremely clean, modern and overall very comfortable. The small couch and chair in the room was not really something you could sink into and relax, but we didn't spend a ton of time in the room. During our stay we ate in several of the restaurants and bar. All areas were extremely clean. The servers were all very friendly and attentive once they finally got to you, but initial service and check time were very slow. I don't know if it was the relaxed atmosphere or just the way things are. The breakfast food was . . . well breakfast food, not bad, but okay. If you eat outside though, watch for the pigeons. The staff does a good job of keeping them at bay, but don't walk away from your food unless you are done eating. We really enjoyed our lunch out in the Tapas Lounge area and the dinner that we had at Voga (Level 25) was fantastic. We visited each of the pool areas on the property as well as the beach, all were cleaned daily and very relaxing. Towels were available in several areas, beverages were served pool side and beach side (on one side of the resort). If visiting with young children, watch the surf on the beach, it can get rough. During our visit, my husband and Luis (the young man assisting guests with chairs) had to save a drowning boy who had ventured out too far in the waves. The beach was very beautiful and for the most part extremely relaxing. Our room cost was what I would deem within reason for this type of resort considering the view that we had. Just prepare to have extra cash for tips. We used the valet parking service, room service, cleaning services, beach chair services, and towel services. Granted you don't have to tip each of these people, but we wanted to and it definitely adds up. Overall we were so very pleased with our stay at the La Concha resort. It was a surprise 50th birthday gift for my husband, he had no idea until 2 days before we left. It was everything I wanted it to be for him!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: tintagel74
Reviews.Content: Entering the lobby we were greeted by a lively bar and pop music. Even though i'm not a big partier anymore I liked this a lot as it immediately added a sense of energy to the place. Had a sea view room which i would thoroughly recommend over the city view. I don;t generally get excited about hotel rooms and this was no exception. Nothing to complain about though which is most important. It was very clean, the bed was good, there was a big flat screen and the walk in shower was nice. The hotel offers many food options. Simple bar food, sushi, Italian to more fine dining. We only had the more bar type food which was surprisingly excellent. Probably the best hotel bar food i have ever had. Burgers, quesedillas, steak were all excellent. Cocktails were also good although there were a couple of occasions where i think they might have held back on the alcohol a bit. Beach was awesome and not crowded at all. At times felt like being on your own private beach. There are a few pools to choose from as well as a hot tub and the overall layout of the hotel is a bit more interesting that normal. All in all i can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay there again. Staff were super friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free and fun in the sun at La Concha Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cleo24kt
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan, Puerto Rico for an International Destination Expo being held at the San Juan Convention Center. La Concha Renaissance Resort was one of the properties hosting some of the attendees, and I am glad I stayed at La Concha! Everything about my visit was pleasant and laid back. The check-in process was a breeze and everyone was a delight to work with, from the always smiling and high-fiving Felix, the Valet extraordinaire; to the attentive, hip, funky and fun bartender, Brock, at the Solera bar (where I had cocktails every night after the conference events). The laid back vibe, interesting people watching and great service made my stay unforgettable, and I can't wait to go back! The only thing I can say is that I wish I had more time there, as I was always busy with conference events; however, my next visit there, I will spend more time enjoying the lovely beach, pool and having a meal at their fabulous conch shell enclosed restaurant, Perla, since I missed out on this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!! I'll be back~~!”
Reviews.Author: Milliearredondo57
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting Puerto Rico and I thank God for the wonderful experience that the staff showed me, my daughter & my friend! The hospitality was awesome! We felt safe and secure during the entire time we were there! Munchas Gracias a Felix whom tended to us as if we were family. Felix had an aweome personality and more of your staff should catch his ferver for friendliness! I met a man that made my stay on our last night there very memorable, thanks Ariel! The only thing that should improve is the length of time that Breakfast and coffee took to get to our room. Thank-u for making our first visit a wonderful vacation, HASTA PRONTO!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIQUE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TabSea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 9 day trip to San Juan- the La Concha was a very comfortable place to have stayed. We had an ocean front suite in the new building- came complete with a lounge, fantastic bath & spacious bedroom. The water pressure could have been a bit stronger, but I understand the need to conserve. The view was fantastic, the sound of the ocean lulled us into a deep sleep nightly, then the A/C kicked on- a bit on the noisy side for such a new building- but again- I understand the need to conserve...... Room had a full sized fridge with ice maker that was well utilized. Bottled H2o changed daily & used glasses replaced. Handy radios in the room with Ipod hookups- great for cocktails on the patio with music. Although the one in the bedroom needed to be moved to the workstation (remember to reset the clock when you move it back........ Learned the hard way :) Bed was comfortable & adequate, nice linens were changed daily (I know.....) Needed to ask for some foam pillows as the down ones were way too soft- easy. On the other hand- I dont think our room was swept or vacuumed daily as there was a wad of something on the tile that was there for a few days- we left it to see if anyone noticed. Bathroom was wiped daily & toiletries replenished daily (Aveda products). When we arrived late on our 1st night we ordered room service- 2 items that were easy- but took ages & were quite spendy & not great...... Lesson learned.... Ate out rest of the time. Pools are great- although if you do not want to be annoyed by screaming kids- opt for the pool in the new building. When we were there & the all ages pool there was literally a screaming contest by all the kids........ The adult infinity pool is right on the beach & they start serving delightful cocktails @ 11AM. Get your chairs early though- we witnessed a few "kerfuffles" over chairs that had been "saved" early in the AM & not occupied until HOURS later....... Great beach, comfy chairs & nice umbrellas & drink & food service on the beach- Order the steak wrap with carmelized onions- it was great. The lobby bar gets HOPPIN on weekends- great hip decor & music- as well as sofa service out by the pool. Overall a great stay, helpful, happy staff. Didnt try the "Perla" as we had heard from a few that it wasnt so great for the price but the building is SO DAMN COOL!!!! Stay there- its nice :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AnnieC67
Reviews.Content: We had dirty dishes and food from room-service outside our door for over 24 hrs; when seeking assisatance from the front-desk and management to remove we received no assistance; it was dirty and unsantitory!! I went in person to the front-desk two times, called two times and also spoke to one of the managers -(Jose) to kindly remove the tray and received no help. The management team are unprofessional and rude to your concerns as a guest! The only member of the staff that provided assistance of concerns during the stay was Micheal (in the Concierge Lounge). He was the morning manger of the Concierge was professional and kind. The evening Manager of the Concierge Lounge was another lazy staff member and not very helpful; she appeared bothered when requesting help; very rude! I did try three times to speak to the general manager during the stay to share concerns and issues but again was handled with blatant disregard. It's a shame the staff and management create and foster unprofessional behavior and lack of attention to guest concerns. As stated the stay was disappointing due to staff and management; I would think twice before staying, lovely hotel but if the staff lacks professionalism and are not helpful it is not worth the money to stay. Annie Coughlin

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls Week- Great room, Eat anywhere else but Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chikletqt
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. We had great bellmen, Ron and Felix, who helped with a lost bag issue (left in the taxi). They also continually said hi and bye to us as we came and went. I loved the open airyness of the lobby and modern details. There are three pools- there did seem to be an issue with getting chairs- particularly at the "adult" infinity pool- no chairs were ever available, even during the middle of the week and there is no one to help bring additional chairs. There is direct access to the beach (again umbrella/chair issues). We stayed in a suite in the atrium lobby- 4th fl suite section- which was awesome. It has a bedroom area and a living/kitchen area- full size fridge, mini stove, microwave, sofa, table, flatscreen, stereo. Later in the week we moved to the regular rooms because additional people came and the suite just had a small sofabed- not large as advertised. The regular room was definitely not as great, but it did have an ocean view. The conceirge was friendly with setting up a rainforest tour. I personally did not like the hotel food from Solera- too limited a menu and too "american junk" for me. We also ate at Perla and I wasn't really impressed there either. We mentioned it was our friends birthday and they did nothing. It was billed as gourmet but was basic seafood to me. You can walk to other places which I would suggest. All in all, I would return here with my husband or with the girls- and stay int he suite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Girls Weekend Ever”
Reviews.Author: heatherstj
Reviews.Content: From the second we arrived (5 girls), we had an amazing time. Felix on the front drive is fabulous and made us feel like royalty! We arrived at 10:30 am, and had booked a couple of suites, and our early check-in request had been fulfilled for one of the rooms-totally unexpected on a holiday weekend! We spent the morning/afternoon on the beach (get the beach massage-one of my friends did and it was great!), and Concierge Victor helped us check-in to our second suite. Victor is FABULOUS!! The rooms were wonderfu, very clean, comfortable and spacious. The food is great-we dined poolside and had brunch in the main restaurant. The staff is very friendly and fun. All in all, a great trip! We will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: BruceandMarsha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha for our 9 year delayed honeymoon. We had an amazing time. From the moment we arrived, the customer service was top notch The staff took the time to talk to you and at every opportunity they gave us insight into what places to go see or where to eat. Now let's talk about the rooms. We had an ocean view king suite that was top notch. I am not sure about the noise complaint in other review because our room was peacful and quiet. The view was amazing and everything was well thought out. We truly felt like we were escaping life for the 5 days we were there. The bed was amazing. You know you are in a great place when the bed is soft the pillows are perfect and you sleep so soundly. Everything was top notch. We have no complaints other than the fact we had to leave yesterday. But we will be back! You simply can't miss with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha's Great and Condado's Great”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at La Concha and we really enjoyed our week. Our room was a suite in the new tower. There was plenty of room and the microwave, refrigerator and freezer proved to be very valuable. The one downside is that the â€œkitchen dining areaâ€� is dark with no views, but you make up for it by spending more time on the balcony and the view from the bedroom is great. This was our first time with a balcony at La Concha and that was worth the upgrade. La Concha is a great hotel and everyone we encountered was extremely nice and helpful. I was concerned that things were going to be crowded with the addition of the new tower, but there was still plenty of room at the pool and beach. Iâ€™m not sure if it was the week that we went to La Concha or that families have discovered the hotel, but there were quite a few more kids in the pools and around the hotel. I highly recommend La Concha and Condado, there are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance and it is a very comfortable area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to spend a vacation”
Reviews.Author: familyman80
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the La Concha using a special rate available that only included a breakfast per room.I had stayed before to celebrate a wedding anniversary but this time choose to bring my 6 year old daughter. The biggest trademark of this hotel is the customer service, starting when you get out of your car. The place continue looking in top shape with respect to facilities. Last year I was able to stay in the new tower, where rooms are outstanding. This time I stayed in the original tower, floor 12, that included a balcony looking to the sea. Although quite smaller than the new tower, they are extremely comfortable, nicely decorated, and remodeled. If you're in a budget you have to watch out eating and drinking in the hotel. Food is outstanding but at a price. You can have a very decent breakfast at Aroma (located in the lobby) at a reasonable price for a hotel. Drinks, particularly mojitos are extremelly good but pricey ($10 + taxes + tip). There are three pools (one dedicated to adults). Beach front is at par with nearby hotels. It tends to be a little rough, PR north coast tends to be rough unless it is sheltered.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful honeymoon at La Concha”
