Reviews.Author: kfdmooner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our honeymoon in San Juan and we were hoping for the best when we booked La Concha after reading all of the reviews. Well, it exceeded our expectations. From the moment that we were greeted with champagne in the lobby, we knew that we were in for a luxurious stay. Whether lounging at the pool or eating at La Perla, everything was top notch. The staff was incredibly pleasant especially Miguel and Felix who were very helpful with dining recommendations, getting us taxis and maps, and helping us with anything else that we needed. The hotel was also beautiful and clean and we were very happy with the beach property as well as its location in the city. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Trip to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: GJJorge
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and with a lot of help from the La Concha Resort, it will definitely not be my last. The hotel is beautiful and has everything you could want. A great lobby/bar, casino, pools, spacious rooms, multiple (good) restaurants, and a delightful staff. It's also located just steps from plenty of eateries, shops, a park, and its right on the beach. My girlfriend planned this trip, from airline to hotel, even all the activities, which is why I knew she'd have no idea that I was going to propose to her while in San Juan. I had called the concierge a few days before my trip to get an idea of the different options available in how to pop the question. Harif, one of the concierge staff, was VERY helpful in coordinating the event, he even went out of his way to show up on his day off and take pictures of the proposal (she thought he was a tourist at the time). Harif was also helpful with letting us know where to get great local cuisine and recommended fun activities. The one bedroom suite we stayed in was awesome - very spacious and well laid out. It had a large living and kitchen area with amenities such as a large fridge, freezer, and microwave (even plates and utensils!). There was a flatscreen tv in the living area and in the bedroom. The bed was plush and comfortable, one of the better ones I've slept on in any hotel. The bathroom had a closed off toilet area and a ceiling head shower. The balcony gave us a view of the city and partial view of the bay, but was used mainly to dry our clothes after we got back from the pool/beach. At the end of the day, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family and am looking forward to coming back soon. Definitely take advantage of the great concierge (especially Harif - he's amazing) for tips on where to eat and what to do... they won't disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “The highs and lows of a resort”
Reviews.Author: OHChris
Reviews.Content: This was truly a good/bad experience (ok, not bad, but a bit frustrating!) Good: 1. A great location with good restaurants nearby. Also a walgreens and other stores within walking distance. The are around the hotel seemed safe as well. 2. An OK beach right out back. The beach was small, but big enough. The waves can be a bit strong, but it is the Atlantic side so should be expected. 3. Restaurants seemed nice but we did not partake in them. 4, Great front desk staff. The gentleman that checked us in was great. He saw I was a Marriott Gold member and even though we were on a reward travel, still upgraded us from a standard room to a suite. As our room was not ready he offered us a free drink at the lobby bar. 5. The rooms were recently renovated. We only stayed for a night, but there was a nice kitchenette with a full sized built in fridge. 2 flat screens and nice modern style furniture. 6. Free internet which is a rarity for the top of the brand hotels. For some strange reason, the bargain hotels in a brand's line (Courtyard, Springhill Suites) give free internet while the expensive hotels (JW Marriott, Renaissance) make you pay for it. The not so good: 1. Our room was not ready at 4 when we checked in although check in time is supposed to be 4pm. This was hard because we had to get up at 3:30am to get our flight to get down here and by 4pm we were more than ready to be in the room and having to sit around for an hour (even with the free drink) was annoying. 2. We asked the bell man to get us sheets for the pullout bed, but they never showed up. 3. We had to call housekeeping 2 times to get them to bring up the sheets. 4. Noise. Everyone has a different noise threshold. Mine is pretty high, but on the ninth floor overlooking the pool we could plainly hear loud music until fairly late into the night. We could also hear all of the street sounds, honking, loud motorcycles, car alarms, screaming, etc. This went on until, well, right now as I am writing this review at 5:30am! 5. The aircon unit is also a bit on the loud side, but many hotels have this problem and I am used to that! 6. The beach does have public acess so do keep an eye on any valuables! That is a general comment for everywhere. 7. This is a small critique, but why would there only be one bathrobe in the room? 8. The bathroom is crazy! It is all glassed in to the room. I could not take a shower unless my daughter was in the front room of the suite or she would be able to see me in the shower! Also, if you had to get up in the middle of the night, you could not turn on the bathroom light or you would illuminate the entire bedroom! Designers, think before you do these things! Overall: It is a nice hotel although a bit pricy. I would probably stay here on reward travel or business again, but I would seriously think about getting an oceanfront room which would probably be a bit quieter. I do not think I would pay to stay here myself.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven Results”
Reviews.Author: LobotC2DFW
Reviews.Content: This resort has a lot of good things about but continually fell short in the service areas. Good food. Upscale trim and a recent remodel and very modern decor. VERY slow service for all restaurants and outside bar other than lunch and dinner. We noticed this trend at other restaurants outside the hotel also so it could just be the way things are in San Juan. Nice area of the city beach(not private) but ocean was difficult to swim in this time of year. Red flag was up for the entire week. Not the hotel's fault but be warned. Terrible housekeeping. Took six hours to get a roll of toilet paper becuase housekeeping had completely skipped our room that day. Towels, etc. were in a different place each day. EXTREMELY small room for $250ish with an ocean view. No couch and no room for anything other than a desk chair. Room was really too small for two people. Couldn't really even put two suitcases on the floor flat becuase there was no place for them. Lots of kids. Family friendly but not a place you want to stay if you like silence while you hang around the three pools or the beach or want a romantic weekend. Dress code for Perla the flagship restaurant is listed on the web site as casual like most of their eateries. It is not. It's business casual or higher and fine dining. We were unable to eat there becuase we had not packed the right clothes. Major disappointment. All in all I would go back if I were taking my son with me. If it were just myself and my wife, I would pass.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with wonderful rooms and swimming pools.”
Reviews.Author: GregDrone
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at La Concha. The hotel is in excellent condition. We stayed in the tower and had a two room suite. The kitchenette was furnished with dishes etc. The swimming pools are beautiful. There are lots of restaurants of various prices nearby. The Condado area is conveniently located between the airport and Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Alaska, I'm getting ready to go back to the Ice Road- Hi Felix!”
Reviews.Author: IceRoad_Lover
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a great stay at the LaConcha in San Juan this past week. All staff were incredibly helpful, friendly and attentive to our need. I have two or three more trips this year to San Juan this year, and I will be back to the LaConcha. However, if Felix, Coral and Oriana are not there, I am staying somewhere else. Just kidding. :) They were just a few of the fine folks, out of many, that contributed to make our visit great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Clkwrkdragon5
Reviews.Content: My galpal and I just returned from a trip to SJU (We're from Chicago). We had so much fun! La Concha was absolutely perfect - the oceanview was fabulous, maid service was great, bellboys were friendly and extremely helpful (Felix & Nefdavid), the pools and beach relaxing and mesmerizing. It truly felt like a paradise. Our first trip to SJU was so awesome - Ruby at the Solera restaruant at La Concha, Gina, tour guide, during the visit to La Yunque Rainforest and the many people we encountered while visiting Old San Juan. April was a perfect month to visit Puerto Rico. And La Concha was the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Felix strikes again!”
Reviews.Author: Genajorgejessi
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful resort made better by the warm staff. They must not give Felix a day off because he gave us hi 5's on the way in and on the way out. our room had a great view and a kitchenette that was very convenient. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “People make it happen!”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Jones3322
Reviews.Content: Let's just say that people make it happen. We stayed at la concha because of the recommendations of our friends. The place is spectacular. The room I got was great. The view even better but all of theses things any hotel chain fan have. What others don't have are the people who work there. I felt cared for from the moment I stepped foot on the driveway. Files was very inviting even when the weather was bad. As you walked in everyone was worm to me. I had also planed to propose to my girlfriend and got lots of help from Harf. He took pictures and gave great suggestions on how and when to propose. I don't want to leave anybody out so Filex, Harf, Stephanie, Natalia, and Louise. Anyone can have a great place to stay but you guys have the greatest people working for you. You will be seeing us again! Thanks to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to wind down”
Reviews.Author: ozblanca
Reviews.Content: Just want to give special thanks to Mr. Jose Casanova, Sales Manager, and his staff to make my and my co-workers stay a memorable one. Mr. Casanova went beyond the call of duty and made sure everything was to par at the hotel. Truly a wonderful experience, the attention detail and service provided by his staff is one to be recognized. Definite will recommend not only for business but also for personal vacation if you want to truly experience service at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go BACK!”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaO_11
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the best vacations ever. Hotel was very nice and clean. We had an ocean view room, which I highly recommend. We left the door wide open the whole time and fell asleep to the sounds of the waves. So relaxing. The beds were very comfy and great pillows. I'm a real pillow snob, and these were great. The continental breakfast was great. And the restaurant in the hotel by the pool was fabulous. Best steak salad and chips and drinks. Ruby was a great waitress that served us great every time! All the staff and door guys were so helpful in helping us with anything and any info we inquired about. Really everyone we encountered in PR were so happy and friendly. Very refreshing. We took a tour to the rainforest. Gina was our guide and she was awesome and humorous. She took us to a great little whole in the wall joint to eat after the rainforest which has some of the best PR food EVER! Great great trip! Oh and I got a massage on the beach with Marcos from Euphoria...perhaps the best massage Ever!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Den_Patty
Reviews.Content: Hola! My wife and I stayed at this resort last week. Words just can't describe the top notch, superb level of service we received!! From the first contact we had when we got out of the car with Felix the valet, to simply everyone at the hotel!! The staff was accommodating, sincere, and genuine, and we could tell they enjoyed their jobs! The concierge service was impeccable! ALWAYS greeting us with a smile and great information about the surrounding area.... even though we may have asked the same questions the day before! The room stayed clean and refreshed, too! It was VERY quiet! The restaurant called "Perla" was absolutely outstanding! We had Surf and Turf, and the Filet Mignon. It was just PERFECT! Our complements to the chef! We attended the wedding, catered pool-side on the. The food was fantastic, as well as the servers! It was really enjoyable to talk with one of the staff... he was helping us out with Spanish, while he was learning some English phrases as well! I could go on and on..... We highly recommend this resort to anyone! Dennis and Patty Brookville, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “It really is OK for kids!”
Reviews.Author: PLOTs_travel
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a Spring Break destination that wouldn't be a huge flight from home, but was still a little more unusual than a Florida beach trip. We'd been to San Juan as a couple, but not with the kids. As we were searching for hotels, we came upon La Concha and liked everything we saw. But the hotel's website along with TripAdvisor reviews left me just a little uneasy if it'd be kid appropriate. We travel a bunch with them and are sensitive to making sure they can have fun in any situation. Rest assured...it is just fine for kids (mine are 5 and 2). While it definitely caters to a young/hip audience, it's not family un-friendly. I love that it's not a Disney type resort with animated everything and mini golf in the courtyard. As long as your kids can make fun with sand, beach and pools - they'll be just fine. Get a room in the Suite Tower if you have kids - full ocean view is worth the upgrade. It's over 500 sq. ft. with a nice family room/kitchenette separate from the sleeping space which is perfect for breakfast/lunch/happy hour. Staff is warm and friendly and willing to help. Only downside is the speed of the housekeeping as noted by several other reviews. We waited for 2 hours the first night for an air mattress for one of the kids (they don't do rollaways) which was a little painful as the kids were ready for bed. Other than that, love it all and highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The Best By Far”
Reviews.Author: norah48
Reviews.Content: La Concha, was by far, the nicest resort I have ever stayed at. Earlier reviews stated that the beach area was small, and that the sun was minimal do to tall buildings. I absolutely disagree. There was plenty of sunshine. And the only area that may have gotten less sun was the adult pool which was housed just beneath the Suite Tower. We were upgraded to an oceanfront Suite Tower suite which was extremely clean and comfortable. The maid service arrived each morning unlike some reviews that stated maid service did not arrive until late into the evening. The lobby area was spacious which made relaxing and waiting for friends and family a delight. The food by the pool area was excellent. All outside areas were tropical with hidden areas for groups to form. The casino left a lot to be desired. Since I love slots, I found most if not all the slots to be quite boring. The best part of our trip was the staff which remained upbeat and happy our entire stay. I absolutely would recommend this resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Big, clean rooms; friendly service; and well designed. A great getaway!”
Reviews.Author: halleymonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha to get away and relax for a few days. And it didn't disappoint. I consider myself pretty particular about things, so for me to say it was a wonderful experience, means they are doing a whole lot right. I knew I would be paying more than I wanted to spend but what's important to me was quality - getting what I paid for. And I got that at La Concha. I ended up upgrading to an ocean front room for $25 extra a night. For me, personally, it was worth $100 to be able to sleep to the sound of the ocean and wake to the view of the ocean. If you don't like a loud ocean (eg waves crashing), you'll either want to book a room away from the ocean (partial-ocean view) or close your window at night. Also (and I loved this because I'm not a fan of a/c and I think it's environmentally progressive) the a/c automatically shuts off if the window or sliding door is open. So that may be a problem if you want the a/c on while you hear the ocean - because it ain't gonna happen. Ok, so the rooms are HUGE. They're all suites with two separate rooms. I stayed in the older tower the first night and the newer tower the remaining nights. Both were great. The only difference is the new tower rooms all have kitchenettes (I say kitchenette because it's not a separate room. It's in the living room but it's got a full-size fridge/freezer, sink, and two electric burners with fully stocked utensils, cookware, plateware and glasses. I was really impressed. I didn't cook like I intended to save money, but what I did instead was eat out and then bring home leftovers for a second meal (made my dollar go further) and heat them up on the stove. The rooms are beautifully designed. I always seek out well designed hotels and this one impressed me. The bathroom was big, the shower was big and had the rainforest shower heads as well as a regular shower head. All Aveda products. There's also an iHome docking station in each room for your iPods and iPhones. I stayed in room 751 in the new tower - the pictures are of that room. Very clean, an excellent room overall. No complaints. The first night I stayed in the old tower room 724 - it's a corner suite and also impressive and well designed. I loved both. Speaking of love, Felix at the entrance was a highlight. A great guy. Always smiling and time to stop to say hi, give me a high five and a lovely compliment about how I looked. He seems to love what he does, and it shows. He's an asset to La Concha. I gave him a big hug when I left. Thanks, Felix! I kept hearing that La Concha is THE hot spot. Not that I was looking for that (I went to San Juan to relax and sleep), but then I got kind of excited at the idea of the night life there. I was underwhelmed. Even on Thursday and Friday night it was flat. I mean, there were people at the bar but mostly tourists and bar flys - not the local scene with the hot, trendy flavor of San Juan and beautiful people (mostly middle age couples, families, and some bar fly business types). Y'know, it was ok, but not at caliente as they hyped it to be. Maybe it was just an off weekend. With that said - on the quieter side, I enjoyed it. They had a jazz quartet play in the pool area. They were fabulous. And to sit out there in the balmy evening temps, with a drink - it was lovely. It's a classy joint. I'd defo recommend this place! If you like value for money (and by that I don't mean saving money or cheap prices) then you'll like La Concha. You pay for it, but they make it worth it. I was really impressed and enjoyed my stay! A few tips: 1) if you want to go to old San Juan, take the bus instead of a cab. The bus stop is right outside the entrance of the hotel and it's only $0.75 (coins only). It's a great way to see SJ. Also, the cabs all work by zone fares now. You can find them online. Or just ask at the front desk - no more getting ripped off as tourists. 2) The breakfast bar is spendy ($3 coffee). If you go on the street, the Starbucks is spendier ($4 for a coffee). But the Dunkin Donuts across the street is regular price ($1.50 for a coffee, $1.50 for a sausage and egg sandwich, $1 per donut)! 3) The restaurant just down the street from the hotel - budathai - has a cilantro margarita that's increds. First, I've never had a cilantro margarita. Second, why hasn't this drink caught on like the mojito?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view but not the cleanest.”
Reviews.Author: jerseyTraveler17
Reviews.Content: For the most part The Marriott staff were very friendly. The hotel was, just that, a hotel. It is situated in the city with little space on the beach or grounds to explore. The building could be very pretty, but it's white and shows all the dirt. The room itself needed a thorough cleaning. The rugs were stained, the coverlet was stained, and the counters were never wiped down for the week stay. The bathroom needed a good bleaching especially the corners and around the toilet. There was a porch on our room, but it overlooked the parking garage and was also quite dirty . If you are there for business the wi-fi is very weak in the guest rooms. The Club Lounge is fine but there is a charge for anyone other than the club member and a guest. If you are traveling with your children, there is a $35 extra fee per child per day for use of the Lounge. The best part is definitely the view overlooking the ocean, out the bedroom window.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay in this hotel any more.”
Reviews.Author: Kmyatim
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12pm, was told room not ready. Kept going back and forth till 4.30 then finally it's ready. Got to the room city view even though was charged for an ocean view suite. Went back to front desk request a manager. She apologized gave us an other room bay view on the 11th floor worst than the room before city view very warm because it's the roof top. Even though she was told we are going to check the second room, they didn't wait. The room was sold. Finally the manager made a magic and got us the ocean view room at 5.30pm. Got to the ocean view room had only one robe, no extra sheets for the pull out bed,no extra towels no extra nothing i had to write a list for house keeping and I am paying for an ocean view suite. We travel a lot but very disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE BEST RESORT I HAVE BEEN TO...EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: afitgirl
Reviews.Content: My stay at La Concha was without a doubt the best experience I have had at any resort destination (and I have travelled around the world and stayed at MANY resort hotels!)...from the moment I called and spoke with Natalia from Concierge, to Tania checking me in and getting me my amazing room to departing and having Hector put me in a cab...the unbelievable people who work day and night at LC, anticipated every need I had. The hotel is beautiful, modern, luxurious..the beach is perfect, the pool (2 infinity pools (awsum!), and other pools)...are all laid out perfectly...and the fitness center is open 24 hrs!!! Ana Paula runs the gym and she is amazing! I ran every day along the ocean (heaven!!!!) The room I had was fantastic - ocean view with a small balcony. Plenty of towels!!! And it was immaculate! The hotel is not too huge so everything is easy access. The food is yummy and there are plenty of healthy options so you don't have to overeat. Victor and Louise (along with Nat) at the concierge desk took care of me...telling me where to go to eat, etc....SO helpful. The dining room staff, the guys on the beach getting your chairs, at the beach bar ....everywhere...unreal, and no one has their hand out for a tip. The weather was amazing (one day of rain). And, people are happy in PR, and it is contagious. I would not recommend staying at any other hotel (and i have been to PR several times. This is THE place to be. I went alone and was nervous about that, but I had the best week ever!!!! Michael Tischler (manager of LC) runs a magnificent hotel and he is soooo nice!! Everyone working there was smiling and happy, and that makes your experience that much better. They are a real team. Oh, and one last thing, I loved it so much that I changed my flight to stay 2 extra days...well, actually, Louise changed it for me :-) ....go and enjoy - you will LOVE it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pictures don't do this place justice”
Reviews.Author: dereckashley
Reviews.Content: We decided 9 hours before we got on a plane to go to San Juan, Looking at the pictures of this resort it looked nice, needless to say the pictures didn't do it justice. When we pulled up to the resort we were blown away, such a beautiful resort! The staff was very friendly and helpful, the food at all the restaurants is delicious and healthy, had some junk food on the menu but lots of healthy choices as well which is a major plus! The Casino is very nice and fun, The rooms were clean and comfortable. This place way outdid what we were expecting, we were very satisfied with our choice to stay here and we will be back. The Beach is very nice and they have waiters at all the pools as well as the beach to take your food and drink orders. We loved the modern decor at the hotel and that it is all very well kept at that. We ate Breakfast at the restaurant overlooking the patio and pool every morning and the food and service was amazing!! We also at at Perla one night and the food was great there as well, even the food by the pool was great, salad was very fresh pico was great. i really cant say anything bad about this resort. we had a GREAT time here. Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “An ex hotel owner's view point”
Reviews.Author: theatford6
Reviews.Content: I used to own an Caribbean hotel and I can tell you I am picky. But there is nothing to pick on at La Concha!! It has the best service from the porter opening the car door to the receptionist, the bar and wait staff.....perfect in every way. I thought the hotel had charm, excitement, style, and a wonderful sexy appeal. Sitting in the open-air bar/club area and watching the professional mixologists pouring the most gloriously tinted tropical cocktails was only surpassed by the amazing bright cherry-red patent leather wedgies on the feet of the beautiful lady-staff. The red matches the waves of color on the ceiling and they really stand out against the brilliant white marble floors. The hotel, the bar, the pools.....every part of the hotel was alive and buzzing with good energy. If you arrive in a bad mood be prepared for your spirits to glow!!! Perla, the restaurant, is like sitting in a Botticelli painting of the Birth of Venus!!! The food was delicious, creative and I thought priced well for such superb cuisine. And the service was first class! My room on the sixth floor was so beautifully appointed with white leather furniture, great office space, a large flat-screen TV, sweeping ocean views and a smallish but perfectly beautiful and exotic bathroom. It has been a very long time since I have stayed in a hotel and had these many nice things to say. What i can tell you is I can hardly wait to go back!!! James Weis New York

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...minimal complaints!”
Reviews.Author: HBF75
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a great hotel. We got there early and they had an available room and let us check in....oceanfront, just like I requested. The room was clean, view was fantastic (5th floor). The bed was a little on the soft side so we kept waking up throughout the night, every night. Also, the handheld shower was springing a leak and because there is only half a shower door(they had this in a hotel in key west too, I don't understand the concept), if you moved the wrong way, the whole bathroom would be wet. But that's pretty much all I have to complain about. The staff was courteous and friendly. My husband got a nasty sunburn and the poolguys immediately offered him aloe. The concierge desk recommended great restaurants and even the guys getting the cabs for us were super nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Demo74
Reviews.Content: Juan Gomez greeted us as we stepped out of the cab. Directed us through the gorgeous well appointed lobby to check in. Veronica checked us into our resort view cabana. The room was clean up to date and modern. Food was excellent, service is great, gym was fantastic, concierge directed us to great resteraunts. Atmosphere at night was incredible. Wish we were staying there again at the end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location, but try to stay in the "new" tower”
Reviews.Author: YOW76
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at La Concha with friends after a 1 week cruise. It was the perfect hotel to chill out at after our cruise adventure. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful; I was not expecting such a luxurious setting. The bar and restaurant were lovely and the pool area was fantastic. Also, it is right on the beach, which was very convenient and made for beautiful views if you have an ocean-facing room. You can also have some fun in the casino that is part of the hotel, which is a vice of mine. There were many nice restaurants close by the hotel, within easy walking distance. Our friends were staying in the old tower, which was not as nice as our room in the new tower. So, try to book in the new tower when making your reservation. The only criticism I have was that the hotel was a bit pricey. Having said that, it was very well-kept, luxurious, trendy and well-located, so it will probably be worth the price for a traveller.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Condado”
Reviews.Author: kswagger
Reviews.Content: I travel to PR on Business at least once/month. The La Concha staff always makes me feel welcome - from the valet staff (that is always happy and helpful), the Concierge that has the best recommendations (Victor was very helpful on my last visit; helping me locate a spa for a terrific mani/pedi), and the staff at the super hot and happening hotel bar (Oriana and Jimmy). This is the best place to stay in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: happygrammy4
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel on the beach complete with many pools. Excellent service. The staff was always friendly & helpful. Felix was a delight. The only downside was the housekeeping service. Clean, but not efficient. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, service was a little iffy...”
Reviews.Author: jensshizzle
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was beautiful very contemporary. We only tried the snacks in the lobby area as the food in the hotel was so expensive. There's a nearby grocery store, 5 minute walk and subway is right across the hotel. We stayed at the ocean tower suites with a kitchenette, living room, bedding, balcony with a city view. Bathroom was pretty, but the faucet in the shower area was broken, but when I asked to have it fixed, no one came. It's a good thing we were able to fix the problem temporarily. As for the workers, most of them are very helpful, but sometimes I feel like they're working you up. I've talked to 4 different bellman and for some reason they all apparently came from New York. Anyways, just be careful and don't give too much information about yourself. Service was great if you tip, so if you can tip as much then service will be great.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay”
Reviews.Author: dhernandez1977
Reviews.Content: .-The Hotel is just recent been remodeled. .-The bed and the pillow Super Hard. .-Two day without internet. .-Two days without TV. .-Someone steal my Sony Camera from the pool. .-The door keys get damage, i couldn't dress up on time for my event .-The Parking ticket system doesn't work properly. back and forward to take the car out of the garage .-You send email, and they said sorry but doesn't do anything about it .-Room service super late and the food super cold for a 25$ range breakfast .-15$ Garage charge daily for guest I will not recommend nobody to stay here. 300$ room? for all this

Reviews.Title: “I've never been treated so well on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: AidaA69
Reviews.Content: Although i am more a fan of small boutique hotels off the beaten path, La Concha came very highly recommended. While the hotel did indeed offer some great luxuries including several beautiful pools, hot tubs, bars, restaurants and beach front access, the thing that stood out most was the service from the staff. From the moment we checked in we were greeted by a lovely woman that made us feel right at home. Vladymir and Omar, two accomodating, friendly waiters, catered to us beyond protocol. If there was anything the hotel did not have they went as far as running to the store to get it. Always smiling, friendly, attentive and professional they really made my stay at La Concha unforgettable. I am looking forward to returning to San Juan and La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Hip Hotel - very unique!”
Reviews.Author: gousfbulls5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights for our honeymoon before exploring the rest of the island - stayed at Gran Melia next 4 nights, check out that review. Even though our AAA agent said the hotel does a complimentary guaranteed upgrade to an ocean view room for honeymooners - this did not happen - same thing w/ Gran Melia. I inquired about an upgrade and we were offered an ocean view suite w/ a balcony but it would be an extra $25 a night. Not a big deal, but a little disappointing. This room was def. worth the extra $50! It was a corner suite on the main building. 'L' shaped room and all 3 exterior walls had floor to ceiling windows. We slept with the window open to listen to the ocean - wonderful. The water was rough while we were there, but the beach was just gorgeous! The hotel's interiors were beautifully designed, hip, yet comfortable. Overall, we loved everything about this place - can't thing of anything negative to say. Their restaurant, Perla, was wonderful and worth every penny! Especially after realizing how expensive the food is around the island - it made Perla's prices seem like a bargain. These weren't what I would call nice places, either. We joked that they must have a different menu for tourist where all the prices are jacked up! Crazy! Anyways, Puerto Rico is wonderful and I was so impressed by San Juan's cleanliness. Everywhere we went there were city employees cleaning and maintaing. Also - recycling bins on the public beaches - great! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing. . .”
Reviews.Author: KCinStL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacation pretty frequently and have certainly had our share of sketchy hotels. When I was booking our stay at La Concha (which came highly recommended by a friend, by the way) I was slightly hesitant on the cost. La Concha was much higher than the surrounding hotels but I wanted our vacation to be perfect so I booked it. I am SO glad I went with them. Upon our arrival in the middle of the night, we were pleasantly greeted and welcomed to the most gorgeous hotel I have ever seen. Waterfalls and sleek leather furniture surround the lobby giving it a contemporary atmosphere. We checked in to our amazing ocean view room and immediately went out the back door to the beach. During our stay, every member of the staff at La Concha were more than willing to help with our every request. One gentleman in particular, Victor, was so kind and helpful that I began to turn to him specifically for all of our queries. He went above and beyond to get me the things I needed. He was extremely knowledgable of the island's hot spots, night life, fine dining and he even helped us book all of our outdoor excursions. If you are a person who travels, you are always hesitant on where to stay and what to do if you have never been there. All I can say, is that this experience, this island, this hotel, everything about this trip- has been the best yet... I most definitely will be returning to La Concha, in fact, I wouldn't even consider staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but Service is OK”
Reviews.Author: dmann82
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at thsi hotel on the recommendation of my 13 year old daughter's research. This hotel is gorgeous and there are some friendly people, but beware! The rules here are very different for Platinum Marriott members. I have always traveled with my family to many Marriotts and I've never been told that I couldn't bring my family to the Concierge Lounge, but that is the rule here. They want $35/day per person after the second person. Also it appears platinum members don't get the same service as at other full service Marriotts and JWs. No USA at my door, chocalates on my pillow, etc. I don't think they have a club level. I wasn't upgraded nobody even spoke of an upgrade at check-in. Some of the people are very rude. It appears at the front desk you are rushed to make a decision, they have very little patience. When I am on vacation or business, I am all about customer service, and this hotel needs to improve.

Reviews.Title: “You Must Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannyz44
Reviews.Content: Now this is a hotel you got to try. My wife and I spent a week at the hotel. The lobby area is classy and a great nighlife. The room was fantastic with kitchen, hot tub, and wonderful view. The waves hit the rocks at night which was a beautiful sound and view. The food choice was excellent and priced fairly. The casino was large and friendly. I have been to Puerto Rico about six times and this is the best placed i stayed so far. Danny

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous room, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha one day pre-cruise. We booked a special rate and got a Junior suite with an oceanview room. Upon arrival at 1:30 our room wasnâ€™t ready so we had lunch near the pool and waiting an hour or so. The room was available at about 3:00PM. The room we had was on the 10th floor and the elevators were right in the main part of the hotel. Our room was gorgeous! Our friends were staying at the hotel also and we had seen their room which was smaller but still nice with a kitchenette in it. The room was very clean and the bathroom carried a lot of bath products. However we were missing tissues. Since we were staying only one night we didnâ€™t unpack anything but there was a lot of storage space. When we entered the room we entered the living room with a pull out couch and several soft chairs. This room also had a dining room table and 4 chairs. The outside balcony also had a table with 4 chairs. The bathroom had a walk in shower. In the Bedroom, in addition to the bed there was also a chaise lounge that you could lie down on and watch the ocean through the floor to ceiling glass windows. The room included an iPod on the side of the bed and the bed was very comfortable. We had lunch dinner and breakfast at the hotel and each was very good. There is also a casino in house. My one complaint is that there is a beautiful bar right in the center of the lobby and it is staffed by a large group of bartenders however, each of them seemed really inept at serving people. We waited almost 20 minutes on one side of the bar while they only catered to a small section of the opposite side of the bar. Additionally, with the high price of drinks at this place you expected the drinks to be good, unfortunately, they were very weak. There is a small gym on the property. It only contained dumbbells which went up to 50lbs and a few machines. There were about 3 or 4 treadmills, a couple of ellipticals and one or two bikes. Apparently they offer spinning classes because they had a studio with several bikes in it but I never saw any class going on. The hotel/resort has three pools which were very nice. The infinity pool near the ocean was a favorite of mine. I was surprised at the amount of children at the hotel. The hotel lists itself as not being child friendly yet there were quite a bit of parents with babies in all the pools, not really attractive if you are a young single. There is a Walgreens two blocks away so you can get anything you forgot to bring with you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Hotel, Spotty Service except for Felix - he was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa202
Reviews.Content: Went with a few friends to celebrate a birthday . When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by Felix, and he couldn't have been nicer or more helpful....in fact throughout our entire stay he was one of the highlights of the hotel, always available to help out or make a reccomendation. The hotel lobby was beautiful, very modern decor. The pool areas, restaurants and gym were all very nice. The first 24 hours of our trip were unfortunately marred by the awful service at the front desk. The rooms we booked, and were guaranteed to have, were not available, and the accomodations we were promised to be moved into the next day to make up for it, also ended up being "not available", even after we were assured there would be no more issues. If it weren't for the front desk service, our trip would have be absolutely fantastic. The location was great - beautiful beach area, and plenty of great restaurants all within walking distance. The suites were nice as well, plenty of space, very clean, and modern decor. If the front desk staff could just get there act together, this could be a top notch place. The only other slight negative was the noise on the weekends....if you have a room facing the street, expect some late night noise from the revelers outside til the wee hours of the morning. If you are a light sleeper, it may be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: namaste1177
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha at the end of March/ beginning of April for our spring vacation. We found out about it by reading the reviews on this site. We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay there! The multiple areas for lying out in the sun during the day gave us many choices and there were always lounge chairs at the pool to lie down on. Staff at the pool were friendly and service for food/drinks was quick. We had a great dinner at Solera and had some excellent drinks at both Solera and the lobby bar. Our room was beautiful, and when we complained that our "partial ocean" view included a view of the noisy city, we were moved to a "full ocean view" when one became available. We will definitely return to this hotel if we are in Puerto Rico again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A Home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Keriz1
Reviews.Content: I stay at La Concha twice a year, and it only gets better! I love that when I arrive, all of the valets know me by name and give me a big hug and a "Welcome Back!" -This sets the tone for the entire trip. Felix and Javier are my favorite valets, and Ruby in Solera is so amazing. I had a shoe incidient on the night of my birthday (March 24)- and the two girls working the front desk were so helpful. I am sorry that I have forgetten thier names, but they were so nice, and made what could have been a disaster laughable. Thank you ladies! Try the italian restaurant on the Mezzanine level, Volga. Delicious! I can't wait to return, and see my second "family" again! Thank you Staff of La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “South Beach ambiance with latino hospitality and exuberance”
Reviews.Author: marconj
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at La Concha exceeded our expectations like no hotel/resort ever has. However glorious and inviting the promotional pictures are, they do not do justice to the architectually exciting public areas, beautifully designed gardens, impeccably maintained rooms and accomodating and knowledgeable staff. Never did we feel patronized by hotel employees and every day started with a buenos dias and wishes for a good day. Further, the Condado location could not be beat for the number of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. No need to incur unncessary cab fares when the selection of places to eat within the hotel and in the surrounding area was so plentiful and diverse. Finally, the fitness center is the best. Its view of the beach and ocean made working working out almost pleasurable. To have found paradise in the middle of San Juan; que maravilloso!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikkicq
Reviews.Content: We fully enjoyed our trip to San Juan and it was made even better by our stay at La Concha. The Hotel is gorgeous with great pools and beach side places to lay around and relax!! The guys up front were always helpful and cheery and made us feel at home. Felix, who advised us on fun local places, was always willing to help and made us feel like family! :) This was a great hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor experience overall - would not go back ever!”
Reviews.Author: javajane724
Reviews.Content: Bad experience began at check-in. Even with printed confirmation, desk had us in wrong accommodations & took some time to get the right room. Room was lacking basic amenities such as shower caps, pad & pencil for phone messages, etc. Altho sheets were to be changed every 3 days under green initiative, our sheets were never changed during a five day stay. Room was not cleaned before 3p.m. on 2 occasions. Restroooms near pool were so filthy [no paper, no towels, wet slippery floors] that it was necessary to go all the way to hotel lobby to use restroom. We returned one day to find ourselves locked out of our own bathroom & call to Housekeeping did not result in anyone coming to room to solve problem. It took a trip back to front desk & discussion with manager to finally get the bathroom door open [time wasted was 45 minutes]. When we reviewed our bill we finally understood the poor service. The hotel tacked on automatic daily gratuities for housekeeping as well as a bellman charge upon arrival even though we never used the bell services! Hotel is very dated too - looks like what you expect for a facility built in 1962. The weather was great tho.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time - Will come again!”
Reviews.Author: mymissy24
Reviews.Content: I love how everyone has something to complain about, have a drink and shut up!!!! We stayed for 6 nights, the only issue we had was our hot tub didn't get hot, so we had to run the drain and the hot water when in use, otherwise everything was great - service is a little slow, but it's always busy and that's just expected - I mean seriously....your on vacation, have a little patience people! Lobby Bar was great Jaime (Bartender) was hilarious and fun! Saw some stars while there, Gene Simmons, Macho Camacho, Dion Sanders & Tommy Lee were all staying at the hotel (can't be all that bad huh). The beach was crowded, but the waves were great - if you are looking for calm water, this is not the place for you - but very fun to play! Food was excellent, Sushi was great and I would recommend the Latino Chic (very yummy signature drink). We are already planning another trip back over the Holiday's. I certainly wouldn't call it a 5 star but high 3-4 for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, trendy hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: nolan905
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were greeted with a smile and a high five from an enthusiastic Felix who handled our bags so we didn't have to lug them through the expansive hotel and got us excited to be there. Our room wasn't quite ready so we decided to walk down Ashford Avenue, the main road, where we found Gucci and Louis Vuitton stores next to tiny, graffiti'd Mexican restaurants and a variety of delicious food finds. We stumbled upon an amazing little public beach at the entrance of the Condado Lagoon at the end of Ashford and was easily our favorite spot of the day. Back at the hotel, the lobby bar was hopping and the vibe was fun. Oriana, the bartender, had a 1000 watt smile and made a killer Mojito. She was there throughout our stay and offered suggestions on where to go....we even walked by her on the street one night on her day off and she stopped us to say hi and chat! Our room had a spectacular ocean view and we slept with sliding door open the whole trip and fell asleep to the sound of the waves every night....best sleep I have had in weeks! The hotel was only about a 15 minute cab ride into Old San Juan, which was beautiful at night and came to life with live music and festivals throughout its many public squares and parks. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing spot that also has a young hip cool vibe while not going overboard on price.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous atmosphere/ambiance slightly marred by bad front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: Grenache6
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a stunning ocean view room (clean and comfortable) in the main tower. It was sleek and stylish and I loved the aveda products. The shower design does not have a door and water has a tendency to get everywhere but down the drain. Love the rainfall shower and the handheld showerhead... Especially good for getting sand off! The pool and beach facilities are pretty. Staff does a good job of helping you with towels, chairs, umbrellas and drinks. The two hot tubs were ridiculously hot, over 100 degrees, and management seemed to not care about this. Thumbs up for the infinity pools! Now, the bad news... Our toilet stopped up and the engineer dripped filthy water from the bathroom to the door and down the hall. Our room was not ready when we checked in at three and it wasn't ready for two hours. Worse, when we got the call to come down and pick up our keys, the lobby was super crowded and people kept on cutting in front of us in line! It would have been so much better if they had simply delivered the keys to us, as we already were checked in. Instead the front desk just left us with a very bad impression for the caliber of resort hotel we were staying in. Finally Felix the bellhop was entertaining and fabulous. Cabs don't seem to gouge you as much when you are leaving from the hotel which was a welcome relief. I look forward to returning, hopefully with better front desk service!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: monahyport
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, suites were funky and fun. Felix and the front door was fun and helpful everyday we were there.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst Hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Frankieartist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for two days, after a Cruise. It was a disaster from the moment we went to the check-in desk. They informed us that the only room available (314) had one bed and sofa bed! We had made our reservation on the 30th of August 2010. We were told the Hotel was full, and therefore we could take it or leave it.The room was not cleaned next day, the towels we requested were delivered at 12.15 am when we were in bed asleep. I am also complaining to Royal Caribbean, as they booked us there for our two extra days, at a cost of 300euro per night!, Frankie.Connor

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Lynette_R05
Reviews.Content: As soon as you arrive at the hotel you encounter the friendly staff! Felix P was one of the stand outs of the whole trip. He was very helpful and was always happy to help. We asked him for recommendations for restaurants and he never steared us wrong. The pools are beautiful and the views from the room are amazing. Location is great, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but could definitely be better”
Reviews.Author: venticaffelatte
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I stayed at La Concha five nights - arriving Sunday and departing Friday. I booked this hotel because of its location and its suites. These two features turned out to be what we enjoyed the most but we found the hotel to be lacking in other areas. I liked the fact that my son could sleep on the pull out sofa with his own tv and I could sleep in the bedroom and watch my own tv. I also liked that our room had a small kitchen with amenities - refrigerator, freezer, small range, dishes, etc., and a small seating area. The hotel is very contemporary and close to things you might need/want - Walgreens for snacks, Starbucks for coffee, restaurants, etc. However, for the price, I found the customer service to be inconsistent or just not what it should be. The front desk never told me that I would be charged a $36 resort fee per night. They also never told me that when I checked in they would hold the whole estimated amount of my stay to my credit card plus $100 per night for incidentials. When I found out about this, the front desk clerk told me that I would have a credit with the hotel if I didn't use it...forget about the fact that I might have wanted to use this credit line for other things on my trip. (P.S. Don't trust the video account review that you view on your tv - for the first two days, it had someone else's information on it.) We stayed in the suite tower. The name is somewhat misleading because the rooms actually surround an atrium. We came home after walking all over Old San Juan all day only to find that our room had not been cleaned AND the hotel booked an event in atrium so we could hear the noise from that group while we were in our room. After waiting 30 minutes after my call to housekeeping, I went downstairs to speak with manager. To her credit, someone finally came to clean our room and by 8:45, folks were clearing out of the atrium. However, I find it annoying that they booked a group in the atrium without regard for the hotel guests. There's an outside sitting area and pool for guests of the suites tower to use. However, we couldn't use that one afternoon/evening because they booked it for yet another an event! In general, housekeeping is either hit or miss in quality...so some days our room was cleaner than others despite that we left a tip every day. The air conditioning in the room is very loud but we eventually got used to it. The other reviews about the ocean are accurate - the surf was too rough for swimming. We were looking forward to spending time in the pools but never did - the three pools are small rectangles and the water in them is cold because they are in the shadow of the building and don't get much sun and the pool area is very shaded with trees. A MAJOR disappointment for us given that we wanted to spend at least one day by the pool. If I'm paying for certain amenities, I expect to be able to use them. All in all, a mixed review for La Concha so I'm not sure I would stay there again. We rented a car from Hertz with a navigation system and were able to do a lot on our own without paying for tours. We drove to the rain forest, the Bacardi factory, and to the marina for a speed boat tour with East Island Tours to Culebra to snorkel and go to Flamenco Beach. That tour was awesome and highly recommended! Unlike the other reviewer, we went to Latin Star and hated it - our food was terrible, the mojito sucked (she used a blender so my drink had chunks in it), and the surroundings inside were dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: TTL212
Reviews.Content: This was almost a really nice hotel - but doesn't quite rise to that standard. Everything had been recently renovated, but a lot of the renovations seemed shoddy and not well-maintained. The staff was very friendly, but there were definite lapses in service while we were there. For example, we arrived late at night and there was only one person at the check-in desk. The person in line before us had some kind of problem, so we had to wait for over 30 minutes to get checked in. And then they did not have the type of room we had reserved (king bed, ocean view) available. They said that one would be available the next day, but it's annoying to have to move. They did give us a discount on the first night (after I insisted), but it was still annoying. Then, when the new room was ready the next day (at about 1pm, when we were of course at the pool), I asked if we could wait to move so that I could enjoy the pool and the staff person I spoke to said I should move right away "because then the hotel could rent out the room" we were currently in - as if that should be my main concern. I wound up packing up our stuff just to get it over with, but I had to call more than once to get someone to come pick up our bags and move them to the new room. None of these things were fatal to our experience, but they all indicate a lack of attention to detail. As another example, the hotel has free wi-fi, but it worked horribly. I could not get my ipad to connect long enough to check the weather, let alone go to a web page. On the plus side, the pool and beach areas were absolutely lovely, and the food was very good (although expensive - ask about prices before you order). People also seemed to really like the bar/nightlife in the lobby (though we didn't partake). The Walgreens right down the street was also great for buying extra bottles of water and snacks. Also, we were there for the Ironman 70.3 San Juan triathlon, and the hotel was fairly convenient to that, and a nice place to come back to post-race (though in the future I would stay closer to the race venue). Overall, the hotel was nice, but not amazing. If you're looking for a solid hotel in Condado and want a pretty beach and pool area, this is definitely a good choice. If you're looking for a luxury getaway, this hotel does not provide that.

Reviews.Title: “2 words - clean and service!”
Reviews.Author: ZZ2nd
Reviews.Content: We chose San Juan at the last minute after cancelling our plans for St Croix. We knew San Juan was urban but were hoping the great reviews at LaConcha and great weather would make up for it. We were not disappointed! Being very conscious of germs and bugs, I never think of ANY hotel as clean. I must say, however, that La Concha is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. You feel it is clean even by the white leather furniture and the pristine white headboard. We stayed on points and requested an upgrade to the Suite Towers. Really nice! We had a great ocean front room with a balcony and almost felt like we were sitting on the shore. Even better than the room was the service. From the front desk to the valets (especially Felix Lapez), to the concierge to the staff in the Perla, everyone made us feel like their purpose was to give us good service. The best thing was that it felt genuine and not rehearsed. Everyone was really friendly. In particular we wanted to recognize the staff in the Ocean Lounge, Pablo Rivera went out of his way every time we were in there to make us feel comfortable. The members only lounge is kept immaculate and well serviced by Pamela Reyes and Luis Perez.. The only downside of this property is the beach. We read about it in the reviews so we knew what to expect. It is small and there is the seaweed issue. The property has a few locations to sun yourself that are not on the beach and there are several pools, so it was great for us. If you plan to spend your entire vacation on the beach though, you might not like this one. But for us...perfect weather, a near perfect hotel and great golf courses...it was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: jannie711
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers described it - This hotel is fun, trendy and very clean. The service is fantastic as well! Throughout our 4 night stay, we were always greeted with a friendly hello whenever we saw a staff member. The only reason I'll give this place a 4 instead of 5 is because this was the very first hotel that did not check me into an oceanview room when requested (every single hotel I've stayed at has honored my request for a high floor and nice view). Nonetheless, I stayed in a "cabana room" which overlooked the pool area and was actually nice, comfortable and convenient. In my opinion, the Condado area is one of the better and nicer places to stay in San Juan. First time back in 2006, we stayed in the Isla Verde area and honestly never wanted to come back to PR after that. I stayed at La Concha for a work trip and absolutely fell in love with PR because of this hotel and this area. The Condado area has lots of restaurants, hotels, shops and seems relatively safe to walk anywhere (unlike Isla Verde). Don't expect PR to be cheap like other islands - the cost of everything here was comparable to a regular metropolitan city in the states. Best of all, you dont have to convert your currency! At La Concha, the lobby is a clean, open air, trendy palette of white. The lobby bar is quite big and inviting and sits between the front desk, elevators and the outside patio that leads to the pools and beach. There are several restaurants in the hotel, but I only had the continental breakfast in the lobby every morning - food pretty decent. The pool doesn't seem to get a lot of sun and does have a lot of comfortable shaded areas. Nice place to unwind and read a book. Our room was on the first floor of the cabana building and sitting on our balcony, we seemed to be in the heart of all the action. Because we overlooked the pool area, we did hear the music til about 6 am every morning. The casino was a good size and was always clean. All in all, we absolutely enjoyed our stay at La Concha. Service, location and the hotel itself were all fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Sexy Vibe”
Reviews.Author: jenesis105
Reviews.Content: We stay in San Juan 3-4 times a year, usually for holidays, birthdays, cruises etc. Our first day down here we always start with lunch out side by the pool under a big umbrella amid the tropical plants. its a beautiful setting and the waitstaff are so sweet and helpful. The food however can be "hit or miss". I sent my burger back 2X. The first time it was overdone, the second time it was still "moving on my plate" LOL The perfect Cosmopolitan made me quickly forget my disappointment and empty stomach. The lobby bar is modern and "buzzing" with activity at all times of the day but it is especially appealing during cocktail hour when everyone is bronzed (or if you're from up North, fried) from a day at the pool and fashionably dressed for dinner. The Bartenders are very knowlegeable about various libations and all have pleasant/funny personalities. The downside of the Lobby is that late at night, the music is absolutly DEAFENING! It's very difficult to carry on a conversation let alone get a decent nights sleep if you're located on a low floor. But all in all, the LaConcha is "THE" place in Condado to meet for cocktails, sun and sometimes, a good burger :)

Reviews.Title: “Interesting design, nice rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: tdcCT
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the hotel in mist resprcts One day our room was not cleaned at 4 when we got back. After two calls they shoes at 6 at which point my wife was sleeping. Other than that they did a nice job.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come again”
Reviews.Author: Techcape
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay there in February. The ocean beach is still there and is more protected from winds than other Condado beaches. Good fitness center. Good service poolside. A real resort.

Reviews.Title: “Forget your troubles, cmon get happy!”
Reviews.Author: Skully
Reviews.Content: Wow, La Concha! So glad we found you! We researched just about every hotel in PR and La Concha kept coming up as the best place! Terrific ocean view room (Junior Suite) clean, quiet, spacious, fantastic view and listening to the waves at night was so realaxing! Staff was amazing, friendly, helpful, always had a smile on their face, even when they walked by, they greeted you! The restaurants in the resort were fantastic! We especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet every morning! Very good price for the amount of food offered! Lets not forget about the best Pina Coladas on the island! So amazing and delcious! The hotel is so inviting and offers several places to relax and enjoy the beautiful weather. 3 pools, beautiful beach, garden area with comfortable couches and lounges, 2 hot tubs, nice big bar in the lobby! I could go on forever.. All i can say is, that we loved every minute of our stay and will definitely be returning! Thanks La Concha for helping us escape the winter blues..Anthony L from New York

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but beware of city view rooms”
Reviews.Author: CTorruella
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night (after 6 nights in northwest Puerto Rico) and were overwhelmed by the noise. We made the mistake of trying to save some money and booked a one bedroom suite with a city view on the--bad mistake! The rooms face busy Ashford Avenue and the bars there blast music until 6 a.m. No matter how tightly we closed our balcony slider and even though we were on the 11th floor, the noise coming from the street was overwhelming. Too bad because the bed was super comfy and the room quite cool-- but no relaxation for any of us! The worst $350 we have ever spent on a hotel room. I am sure having an ocean view room would have made all the difference in the world, but this was our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing, fun and exciting hotel!”
Reviews.Author: texasg
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the La Concha March 14-17, with 2 other friends and what a blast of a time we had! Everything went quite smoothly from check-in to check out. I arrived before my other two friends, and I checked in with Natalie. She was able to find my reservation, only thing is is that she wasn't able to find the request that I wanted such as high floors, beach view, double beds, etc. She was going to initially put us on the 4th floor but since I told her we wanted a hight floor she put us in a suite, which had a king size bed, and a sofa bed and kitchenette! It also had a balcony view and it was gorgeous! We ended up getting room 978(new tower) which over looked the pool area and ashford ave. It was very quiet, and that could of been since we were there doing the week. With that being said, it was a very large amount of people there. Didn't get a chance to eat at La Perla but we did eat at the pool bar twice and the food was really good(burgers, steak, drinks, etc). The pool area was very beautiful and the beach area was very relaxing! My friends and I got really good tans! For dinner the second night we ate at The Latin Star down the street near Walgreens. Let me tell you, the food was cheap and good, including their drinks!!! Sometimes the best food is the cheapest food. MInd you my friends and I are all college graduates that have just peaked 30 and we are into having the best. I wouldn't recommend renting a car, but taxi rides can add up, 13-15 each way. We stayed pretty much in the area unless we went to old san juan. Food was pretty good at Aquaviva in old san juan and its very lively. Oh, and if you do a bike tour, Rent the bicycle with Nancy and Tony is the best ever!!!! They went out of their way from the pick up from the hotel to even going over the tour time. We had a blast with them!! All in all, I am already planning another trip back to PR and La Concha is a must do again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, AMAZING STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: zed100
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, with great amenities and great design. It is a great balance between hipness and laid back. We had a little trouble finding the right temp for the room (the A/C blasts quickly and then turns off so it is a bit uneven)....but this was a very minor issue. Our stay was elevated from great to amazing because of the staff, in particular the concierge staff. We arrived at La Concha after spending 3 nights at a hotel in Old San Juan. We had already researched and eaten at many of the authentic and delicious restaurants in the San Juan area and wanted to make sure we didn't miss any good food during our last two days. Francisco (Frankie) spent forever brainstorming and helping us find the best culinary experiences possible for our remaining two days, including arranging a trip to Guavate to get the island's best roast pork. Louise also spent a long time making sure we didn't waste a meal. These two were incredible, and by far the best concierge I have ever encountered. Frankie and Louise helped us the most, but I saw another member of the concierge staff help a family of four research and plan their meals as well. For us, we wanted to eat well, but they seemed equally knowledgeable about any type of experience you might want during your stay. Be sure to use this incomparable resource while at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time visit to San Juan, PR”
Reviews.Author: Maryel53
Reviews.Content: Arrived March 13th for 5 nights and was greeted out front by Felix who set the tone for the trip-very friendly and welcoming-took care of our bags until check-in. Staff at LaConcha were all very friendly and helpful, always greeted guests which made you feel welcome. The Tower Suites oceanfront rooms are spacious and very clean. Pools are very nice but could use more seating. Beach area is great - chairs free to LaConcha guests. Had a few nice lunches around the pool. LaPerla restaurant is excellent in service, atmosphere and food-worth the $$-try for a window table. Lobby/bar area is very chic and inviting. Felt safe walking around the area, especially in evening to go a few blocks for dinner. Hotel a short taxi ride to Old San Juan, etc. The Concierge Lounge is the best we have encountered-the staff there is fabulous. Hotel property is beautiful and well maintained, all staff encountered were gracious. Recommendations from staff about restaurants, sites, etc. were very good. Can't wait to go back again - happy we picked LaConcha.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast @ La Concha”
Reviews.Author: irmabirchall
Reviews.Content: After a warm and efficient welcome from the hostess Jannise, what a pleasure to sit on the veranda overlooking the pool area and be able to establish a wireless connection with no hassles. The buffet choices, the good selection of juices, hot coffee or exotic tea were all at hand whilst catching up with emails and waiting for members of my extended family to join me for breakfast. Thank you to the La Concha breakfast team for the great start of 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chigirl15
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to do an "Adult Spring Break" this year and stayed for 5 nights at La Concha. Our stay was amazing. The staff is so friendly and nice. The hotel is in a great location, but you really wouldn't even need to leave the hotel because everything is here. The beach is really beautiful and there are several pools. The poolside grill Solera is expensive, but has great food. The steak wrap and the salads were delicious. I also highly recommend the frozen mojitos and champagne sangria. At night the Hotel Lobby becomes a happening bar. We even saw members of the band Kiss at the bar. They were staying in the hotel the same time we were. The bartender Jimmy was so friendly and always remembered our favorite drinks each night. Another highlight of the trip was the casino in the hotel. The dealers made playing so much fun, especially Edward and Luis. The fitness center was modern and overlooking the ocean so you could run on the treadmill while watching the waves which was nice. The only downside was that we originally booked a suite with two queen beds, but when we checked in we were told they only have King beds in the Suites. It ended up working out and everything else about our stay was so amazing that it was completely forgotten about. I love La Concha and I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hidalee
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I absolutely loved Puerto Rico, but, I definitely loved this hotel. Great restaurants, great pool, great beach, and great staff. If you stay at the La Concha, you'll have a great trip. Rushdi, a waiter in Voga Restaurant is incredible. And Felix, at the front entry, couldn't be nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Cool, Hip and Sexy. . . in an updated 60's motif”
Reviews.Author: mictim2
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Staying here for 4 nights on business. The update and original design / architecture of this 1959 property is wonderful. . . from the tarazza flooring to the wonderful huge shell shaped roof of the ocean side restaurant. I'm on the 10th floor. . and the window to the ocean is floor to ceiling glass. . .giving the appearance from the other end of the room that i'm on a boat. . .as all I can see is the blue ocean. Simply beautiful. Modern with clean lines in the room furnishing. . . with a great shower with "rain" shower head. Very clean, safe area, lots of good restaurants within walking distance, and a lot of beautiful people. This reminds me of a big, upscale South Beach hotel. I was even invited to a beach side cocktail party last night (unexpectedly) that was hosted by the general manager and his staff. The hotel also has multipe pools that are simply gorgeous and tropical.Only negatives. . . my queen bed could've been better - no pillow top. The $22 breakfast buffet is a rip. . . instead, pick up some good coffee and PR pastries in the lobby bar and save 17 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service”
Reviews.Author: Happiness305
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a fabulous birthday weekend in Puerto Rico. I've stayed at many hotels in PR in the past. However, my stay at La Concha was absolutely spectacular. When I arrived at 11am, I was immediately checked in to my room (Oceanview). I was able to get my birthday weekend started immediately. We all decided to start our celebration on the beach. What a great choice, the service that we rec'd from "Brock" was fantastic! Everytime we completed a drink there he was to take our next order. Unfortunately, the days following the service from other waiters wasn't the same. The probably would have made a killing on us between drinks, food and tips. Last but not least, the service at the Solera restaurant was exceptional. Our service was spectacular the night of my birthday. Mr. Fremiot made sure that we had a great time and all of our need were met. He was readily available for any special last minute requests. Thanks to La Concha team for making me feel so special. Normally you would not see a manager unless there was a problem, however, he was working the room as if he were personally serving each table. I would totally recommend this hotel...make sure you see Fremiot and Brock! Thanks for a great experience..xoxo

Reviews.Title: “Candid Revew of La Concha”
Reviews.Author: derbycityvisitor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in an ocean view room for 10 days between March 4 and March 14, 2011. I chose this hotel primarily because of the reviews I read on trip advisor. It is a very nice hotel in an excellent location. The strengths of the hotel include its 4 pools, cleanliness, beach location and atmosphere for making new friends and acquaintances. The negatives include very slow pool and ocean side bar service as we had to get drinks a number of times ourselves simply because no server came around. (If I were in college I would take a summer job here and make a fortune as the servers appear to be very poorly motivated to sell drinks and thus make tips. I just didn't understand the lack of pool and ocean side service.) We tried the breakfast buffet our first morning and we didn't come back. Generally, the breafast buffets at Marriott hotels are excellent but this one was lacking in food and good quality. It is definitely not worth 50 dollars for two. However we did have breakfast delivered to our rooms several times and it was all very good and timely delivered. We had a fantastic dinner at Perlas restaurant which is located in the hotel. I recommend it highly for food quality, ambiance and service. Try and get a table next to the large windows facing the ocean. The hotel did not have a spa which most 4 star properties offer in resort areas like San Juan. The pop machine on our floor was never filled up the whole time we stayed at the hotel again another loss of revenue for the hotel. We made a couple of trips to Walgreens nearby to stock up on cokes, etc. It was also disappointing that room service ended at 11 pam. I would have expected 24 hour room service but alas, it was not to be. Housekeeping was difficult to figure out as we had to call several times to get our room cleaned but they always timely responded. Some food was left in the room refrigerator from the previous guests so we just tossed it. I do recommend ocean view rooms as the view is awesome. I would also get room as high up as possible. Sometimes, particularly on the weekends it can get pretty noisy in the hotel lobby bar. This hotel is the "in place" to be for week end partying. I knew this based upon reading prior reviews so we were prepared for it. We like to have a good time too even though we are in our 50's but some people complained. La Concha is not the kind of hotel I would recommend for a nice quiet get away. It is a happening place which we enjoyed. Most of the guests were in their 20's, 30's and 40's. I also recommend the "Latin Sliders" for simple bar food. These are a combination of hamburger and pook and are really delicious. We tried a fajita sandwhich however which was not edible. The hotel is host to several weddings a weekend and as a result some of the pool areas get blocked for the wedding guests which means hotel guests have to find another place to relax. This was somewhat inconvenient but there were enough pools and the beach to accomodate the inconvenience. All in all we had a terrific time and we would definitely go back to the La Concha. I would give it a minimum 4 star rating which could be easlily improved if the management paid more attention and corrected the deficiencies noted in this post.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property, But Service Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Jackcatscal
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in an ocean-view room. The hotel and room were very clean, and the location was excellent. But the service in the hotel restaurants--and we tried nearly every one, plus room service--was really lacking. It wasn't that the service people weren't pleasant, because they were. But service times weren't good, and the food was often late and/or cold. And, of course, expensive. Oh, and the "resort charge" on the hotel bill is just annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Felix: the bellman exemplifies extraordinary customer service”
Reviews.Author: borninthebronx
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in so many ways and the start of it with a warm welcome from the ebullient Felix augured well. The Beach is fine;the pools are lovely. The staff is very friendly and wants to help. (The concierge could be more knowledgeable as to what is really happening on the island.) Don't bother with Solera restaurant or the bar; both are overpriced and slow. The breakfast place is very good with fab omelets. La Perla is expensive but worth it. The location is perfect for so many things. Highly enjoyable time at La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Emdoctor
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed for 9 days. Normally by day 7, we've had enough and want to go home. On this trip, we don't want to leave. The hotel lobby is stylish with energetic music and staff. It turns out that La Concha is the hotel for the stars as J-Lo, Mark Anthony, and Lauren Conrad were staying the same time. Also, there was a fashion shoot with a multitude of beautiful people present. The staff were attentive and wonderful. The pools are clean and the heating is perfect for relief from the sun. The hotel has great beach and ocean access. The surf was manageable and enjoyable for body surfing. The rooms are nice with the best in the tower. There's plenty of ocean view rooms. The poolside food is great. Try the sliders! The hotel bar is a San Juan night spot. The restaurants are great. We had magnificent meal at Perla.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: HayOhio
