Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha based on previous TripAdvisor reviews. We just moved into the Ritz Carlton for a business conference for the next 3 days. No doubt about it, we had a much better set up at the La Concha!! First of all, love the retro look of this hotel, lobby is white marble flooring and art deco, staff are absolutely fantastic, and here's the big surprise ... the food here is wonderful! There are 3 or 4 different pool areas, it's right on the beach, get an ocean view if you can, it's heavenly! I'm a clean freak, and this place passed the test. There was a musty smell when the AC was off, but that's to be expected when you are on the beach. We had breakfast on our balcony each morning, and the food always exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GMM0
Reviews.Content: Have been to Puerto Rico many times, but really enjoyed our stay at La Concha Resort. It has a great city, hip vibe, but is right on the ocean. Perfect location near Old San Juan, airport and in the trendy Condado neighborhood. Great service, staff are fabulous! Their F&B director, Jose, is excellent. He took a lot of time recommending restaurants for us and making reservations - totally outside his job description. From their bellman to their bartenders, the entire staff is excellent. For a real treat, have the bartender in the lobby, Oriana, make her passionfruit frozen rum drink. Not to be missed! Will definitely go back and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Top Flight Urban Resort in a beautiful tropical setting”
Reviews.Author: suesviews_11
Reviews.Content: Starting with the impressive open lobby looking out to gardens and pools to the well-appointed ocean view room, our stay was everything we hoped for. The staff were responsive to every request and always cheerful and friendly. The resturants were excellent - Perla for fine dining and atmosphere, the breakfast only restuarant had every imaginable breakfast item and the Tapas resturant was great for quick meals. This was a family reunion and everyone - child to adult - had their needs met. The hotel was on the beach which was very accessible. It is also conveniently located to all San Juan attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenOkumura
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at La Concha twice and have enjoyed ourselves greatly. We stayed towards the end of 2010 and got a great deal on a partial ocean view room which ended up having a wrap-around balcony and a good view of both the ocean and the city/pool area. This time we went for a partial ocean view room and ended up on the East side of the building which didn't have such a good view. The neighbourhood has a few eyesores, but the view of the sea was lovely. The hotel itself is very nice. Whilst there are a lot of rooms, it does not feel overcrowded. The lobby bar doubles as a breakfast bar in the morning where you can buy pastries, and is a popular local hangout in the evening. The pool area is beautifully manicured and there is attentive service from all the staff. The sushi bar is a great place for a quick snack or meal, and La Perla (where we ate on our first visit is a wonderful romantic restaurant. We will definitely stay there again, having looked at and eliminated a number of other potential hotels as options. Our only complaint was in this latest stay it seemed that the housekeeping had been a bit lax with the room. There appeared to be blood stains (about an inch square) on the marble surround of the bathtub which weren't removed even after we notified the front desk about them. A small issue in an otherwise pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SunWorshippers72
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at La Concha & from the moment we walked into the chic modern lobby overlooking a lush verdant pool area we knew this was going to be a great hotel. The room was immaculate with a balcony overlooking a magnificent view of the beach with palm trees, surfers, turquoise waters and the sound of the surf. We had had a beautifully prepared breakfast on our balcony almost every morning delivered by the sweet Tashian. The food at La Concha was consistently delicious and beautifully prepared. The staff at La Concha were all friendly and personable and went out of their way to make our stay a wonderrful experience, from Alexis our bellman to Josian our waiter, who even packed our favorite Sunrise Muffins for the flight home. We loved the location of the hotel with it's proximity to Old San Juan and the many restaurants in walking distance. Two of our favorite dining experiences in Old San Juan were Marmalade, set in a beautifully designed space with amazing, creative gourmet dishes, the white bean soup and black truffle pasta were both to die for, and La Cucina de Ivo where we ate wonderful pasta dishes alfresco in a charming interior courtyard complete with a fountain potted fig trees. We loved our stay at the La Concha so much we want to live there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nikto
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the 6 night stay at La Concha in San Juan, PR. Our stay was great! We arrived really early, around 5:30AM and were upgraded to a nice waterfront room at additional $25 per night (the original reservation had a standard room w/city view). The upgrade was really worth it! The room was incredible with a glass wall sliding door, opening to the French balcony and overlooking the ocean. We would sleep with an open door at night time, listening to the sound of the sea. The hotel was renovated about 3 years ago; therefore the rooms are very nice and clean; the contemporary lobby and beautiful grounds w/several pools and nicely designed landscaping make your stay pleasant. The bars offer excellent drinks (try mohitos!). The location of the hotel is also great! There are several bars/restaurants/cafes right next door; you are only three blocks away from Starbucks and a block away from Dunkin Donuts. We even walked to Old San Juan one morning (it took us about an hour). Visit Miro Restaurant (across from Marriott Hotel and adjacent to Starbucks) and listen to Spanish guitar! Great music and the food is excellent. The owners of the restaurant are from Barcelona, Spain, so you'll feel like you are in Europe. Also, definitely try Marmalade Restaurant in Old San Juan! Excellent bar, great service and delicious food! And of course rainforest is a must! But you may want to rent a car and go on your own. We weren't too thrilled with the tour we booked. Enjoy the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Bhoppe
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the resort now and very much enjoying my stay. This is a very nice resort in a great location. The condado district of san juan has a lot to keep you busy. The views from the ocean view suites in the suite tower are incredible. I highly recommend spending a few extra bucks for an ocean view suite. In addition to the view, the kitchenette and sitting area come in handy and can help you save a few bucks (there are a few small markets down the street well within walking distance that have everything you need for breakfast and lunch, as well as a nice bottle of wine for the nights you want to stay in). My only gripe is that the rug in the sitting area has a strong damp smell to it, which is a bit annoying (and is the only reason I am giving the resort a 4). I guess that is to be expected in a humid climate right on the beach. Make sure to venture away from the resort for dinner and drinks. While there are several nice restaurants and a very trendy bar in the resort, there are many restaurants serving authentic puerto rican cuisine close by. With live music.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a Heart Beat”
Reviews.Author: NanaFromMass
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an eight day stay. Loved it! Loved it! Loved it! Pools were great, white sand beach was beautiful and clean. One bedroom suite was perfection with a view of the ocean from our bedroom and a view of the pool and gardens from our living room. (Bathroom was a bit small but ...what the heck....didn't spend much time in there anyway!) Enjoyed the Breakfast Buffet; Dinner at Le Pearle was unforgettable and the food and service was sensational. The hotel staff was upbeat, helpful and were very sincere in their efforts to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. The ocean waves were better for surfing than for swimming so if you prefer a calm ocean, you can swim in the infinity pool on the beach and watch as the surfers "catch" a wave or two. You can skip the "Italian Grill". Once was enough for us. We were surrounded by staff during the first course which was good but couldn't even find our waitress when Hubby had a badly cooked and tasteless steak and I suffered through a burnt chicken parmesan and the worst tasting pasta ever. HOWEVER, all in all, it was a terrific vacation and we really "would go back in a heart beat"!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, worth every $$$”
Reviews.Author: CurtisinTexas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha 5 days precruise. Located in the upscale Condado area, $12 taxi ride from the airport. An older property, renovated, very eclectic feel and appearance. EVERY staff member we encounterd were professional, friendly, and helpful..reception, housekeeping, bartenders, waitresses, beach guys, valets, you name it, they were all great. As some reviews indicated, yes the drinks/food are somewhat pricey but also very good. We had lunch a couple times at the Solara cafe by the pool, very good food. Very close walking distance to many restaurants and shops, you dont need a car if you are staying in the Condado area. Tour company picked us up at the hotel for excursion to El Yunque rainforest, this was very convenient. We were on a upper floor Jr. Suite, great view of the beaches. The open air bar/pool area was very nice and quite a happening place on friday/sat nights, but the music never bothered us while in the room. The room was great, AC worked well, very clean, nice furnishings and a very comfortable bed and linens. Aveda products in the bath, nice touch. Housekeeping service was flawless. We congratulate the management, every one of the several employees we encountered had a positive, can do, can I help you with anything attitude. Although the property is nice, the staff made our stay enjoyable. Oh yes, the beach, nice beach, chairs and umbrellas provided by the hotel, bar service on the beach as well, plus you could walk the entire length of Condado beach, very nice. One a few dollars in the casino as well. The hotel was completely booked, but that did not have any negative effects on the service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation By Day But Sleepless Nights”
Reviews.Author: leondrataylor
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this resort and I highly recommend the Suite Tower. The first time I stayed in the Ocean Tower and the rooms don't have balconies. I wish I'd upgraded to an ocean view because my room faced Ashford Avenue and I couldn't sleep all weekend. There is an after hours bar across the street and the music is so loud it could be heard on the 10th floor until 6am in the morning. The only thing that drowned the noise was the air conditioner which is extremely loud. When I asked for another room, the desk clerk told me the hotel was at a sold out capacity and advised me to buy ear plugs at Walgreens. Upon arrival only 5 of our 7 rooms were ready. However, one of the guests was compensated $100 for the inconvenience since he was a Platinum Marriott Rewards member. Another guest did not receive her platinum amenity at check-in and she too was compensated $100. The Sereno Infinity pool closed at 2pm on Saturday due to a wedding but the main deck pool was still open. The rooms are spacious but nothing fancy. The hotel is only 3 miles from Old San Juan and there are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. I wouldn't walk on the beach at night for safety reasons. This is a great weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: wydanle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great 4 night get away to this property for our first 'no kids' vacation in 5 years. As others have said, the hotel is beautiful. We loved the location. It is not a resort in the middle of nowhere but a beautiful property smack in the middle of a real neighborhood. We took advantage of this by eating out on the strip and enjoyed our meals and mingling with the locals quite a bit. The beach was great. We enjoyed the waves and there are plenty of chairs/loungers scattered throughout the property for sun and shade lovers alike. While the hotel is modern and trendy looking the patrons were a mix of young and old and we saw many families during our stay with kids of all ages. We would definitely bring our kids to this property. We had a 1 bedroom on the 7th floor in the tower. The room was spacious and clean. We had a partial ocean view and enjoyed sitting on the balcony for breakfast (from the local Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts) each morning. One complaint is the AC is REALLY loud but you get used to it. The biggest problem was we never really had good maid service. They made the bed only 2 of the mornings and our towels were never replaced and the 1 very small garbage can was never emptied. Finally, on our last night there we were out of towels. We started calling at 4 pm and after 4 calls and 2 trips to the front desk we were given some towels. The pile of old ones were never removed. The spotty service continued at the restaurants where the service was actually a bit bizarre. First, let me say the food is excellent. At the poolside Solera one lunch went smoothly but that was it. The other days we would wait a long time for food or drinks and have multiple people waiting on us. It was very confusing, one would bring menus, a second the drinks, a different person your order. At one point I realized when our food did not arrive after 30 minutes that our waitress who took our order was now tending bar. The manager was great when we spoke to him, brought us a free appetizer, and finally got us our food but it marred the experience. Had an excellent meal at La Perla as well but the service there again suffered from poor pacing and forgotten items. Finally, the oddest lapse in service occurred on our last day. Our plane was in the late afternoon and there was no late check out available. I asked the front desk staff if there was a place to shower change after we checked out I was told yes, there was a shower and changing rooms by the pool. After spending the day at the beach and pool I went to pick up my bag at the front desk to get dressed for the airport. I asked how to get to the area to shower/change, the woman told me the hotel did not have such a place! I was a bit shocked but as a well seasoned traveler I quickly regrouped and rinsed off at the outdoor beach shower and got dressed in that bathroom. In spite of this I would return to the hotel but go off property for all my meals and not expect much in the way of service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel in a Pristine Location”
Reviews.Author: Jonnylister
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a very nice hotel. It is part of the Marriott family and is very well kept. We had a hotel room in the old tower, which had a stunning view of the ocean. I'm pretty sure most of the rooms in this tower will have a pretty good view of the ocean, but obviously the higher you are the better. The location of the hotel is perfect. You are in the Colanado area on the main drag with a lot of other hotels, restaurants, bars, etc. The area is very safe, but similar to other large cities, don't travel too far off the main strip if you don't know where you're going. Old San Juan is a quick cab ride away and offers a great historical perspective of the city. The rooms were very clean and the maid service was very good. We would leave for the day and always come back to a clean room, new towels, new glasses, and everything else. The beds were extremely comfortable as ours was a pillow-top. The pillows and blankets were also very nice. There is free Wi-Fi in the rooms, but the coverage is a little spotty and the speed is pretty slow compared to your home network. The bar in the lobby was more of an upscale bar, but had a very nice atmosphere and good service. Outside, they had a beautiful area with many comfortable couches and chairs where you could order food and drink and just relax or read a book. The area was beautifully landscaped and I would say this was the highlight of the hotel. There is also a casino that is attached to the hotel. I am not a big gambler, but I did go one night and had a really good time. Based on the other casinos in the area, this one appeared to be of higher quality than most. No poker tables, but plenty of slots, black jack, roulette, and craps. There are three total pools on site, and all three are very nice. The first is right outside the lobby and is the biggest. It's a two part pool with a waterfall separating them. The water was a little cool, but some (including myself) prefer it that way. There was one gorgeous infinity pool overlooking the ocean that was a blast. The only downside is that the water was definitely chillier than most pools, and the area does not get a lot of sun as it faces directly north (with the hotel immediately behind it). I still highly recommend checking this one out. They have one other infinity pool close to the beach area, but we didn't check this one out. The beach area is gorgeous. Towels are aplenty for hotel guests and there is an employee who will set up chairs and/or umbrellas for you (free of charge!). The area receives sun the whole day and the water is very warm all year round. We had very good waves for duration of the week we were there, and there are stores where you can rent boogie boards, surf boards, jet skis, etc. if you enjoy that. The only negative I have with the hotel is the price. We were there for a friend's wedding so we had a discounted price, but after the hotel fee and taxes, were still paying upwards of $250 a night. Without the wedding discount, you can probably tack on $50-100 more a night. If you're used to paying prices like this, then this is definitely the hotel for you, but we definitely don't normally shell out this amount of cash for a hotel as we generally try to stay closer to $1000 for a week's lodging as opposed to $2000. While the added amenities are certainly nice, we didn't spend a ton of time at the hotel and definitely could have done without them for a lower price. But again, this is just our style and not something I would hold against the hotel, it really just depends on your tastes. All in all, a very nice hotel in a superb location of San Juan. If it's in your budget, I would highly recommend it for anyone planning a trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facilities, Terrible Customer Service - Not Worth The High Cost”
Reviews.Author: Traveller0361
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to cruise. Seeking good beach access, upscale facilities, impeccable cleanliness, and easy access to the sights of Old Suan Juan. The property itself was in very good condition. Amazing lobby/bar combo. Plenty of seating to relax around the pools or eat outside at one of the casual restaurants. Room was clean and large. Bathroom was fairly good size with upscale shower. On to the staff...The fellows who handle the comings and goings out front of the hotel were excellent! Quick, polite, and smiling. This is where the customer service ended. Experienced terrible service from the desk personnel who helped to arrange tours and give other sightseeing information. Wrong information, no call backs, and it appears they failed to mail our stack of postcards which they said they would do! None ever made it to the recipients. Maid service was inconsistent. Wouldn't always replace dirty glassware/cups, and would even leave the dirty ones sitting. The maids were extremely noisy when they were entering and exiting rooms. The safety latch that is on top of the doors were flipped to the outside so the door would remain ajar while they were cleaning. The doors were continually slammed, during early morning and later evening cleanings. This was very jarring and made sleep difficult. Call to the appropriate department went completely unneeded. Service in the restaurant where breakfast was served was spotty. Some things came quickly, some things took forever, including the check. The breakfast buffet was good but very overpriced. Overall, for the very expensive cost of this hotel, it was certainly a very poor experience and could not recommend. Save money and stay in Old San Juan, where good food, shopping, and historic sites abound.

Reviews.Title: “OUR HONEYMOON STAY AT LACONCHA WAS BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: MrsBarreras
Reviews.Content: The staff and the hotel were wonderful. Pictures on website are exactly how the hotel looks and better. Beautiful!!!!!! We do not think there is a better hotel in San Juan! Itâ€™s a must stay! Johnny the nighttime bartender and David the waiter/pool attendant at the hotel restaurant Solera were the best ever!!!!! Will go again def. Matter of fact, we are planning a trip for my birthday in June!!! Thumbs up for La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, but I don't think they deserve Marriott's category 6 rating.”
Reviews.Author: JLubas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip we took from Feb 23-28th. This was our first time to Puerto Rico and we enjoyed ourselves. Overall it was a nice resort. When you first arrive you think its a very chic / modern hotel. In actuality, it appears to be an old hotel that was "added onto" and then remodeled over the years. There is a newer tower that people seemed to like because each room had balconies you could sit out on. Just a word of caution however that the newer tower does have a wing that overlooks the San Juan city - kind of ugly view compared to those with ocean views. The older building (tower) is where we stayed. The rooms we redone and were very nice and clean. Each room had an ocean view which is great. However, this 12 floor tower also had some flaws in that not many rooms had balconies you could sit out on. I was on the 12th floor and had a great view of ocean which two chairs and table. Most rooms however on this tower have only windows or a walk out balcony barely big enough to stand on. This is something they don't reveal on the website too openly and should do a better job explaining. The lobby bar was nice and was lively at night. If you like dressing up and having fancy drinks then this is your place to hang at night to see the local who's who. We also are big pool people and compared to other hotels we felt their pools were lacking. They have 3 pools altogether at this property. Each is relatively small and none with a swim up pool bar. Again, you get the impression that these pools were kind of added on as the property expanded. Sun light was another issue as it pertains to the pool areas. The two smaller infinity pools had no sunlight over them come 1pm, so everyone scattered to find warmth because this property DOES NOT seem to use heaters on their pools. For you beach goers... You could always find chairs and we were there duing a busy week. The staff was willing to set up your chairs and offer you an umbrella if that was your thing. The ocean water was nice, but a little rough for small kids in our opinion. Not a white sandy beach, but more like Jersey Shore sand, yet nice. Finally, and this was my biggest beef with the hotel. During our stay there were two days where they shut down the two small infinity pools for private functions. I don't remember getting a discount for closed facilities so they could use those areas for corporate functions or wedddings. All this did was to force every pool guest to main pool which is not big enough for a busy occupancy week. Would I recommend this hotel to another? The answer is yes now that you know what you are getting into. I hate when my expectations are higher than the reality met upon arrival. I think my review is fair andn pretty spot on. The people and service staff were very friendly to help, but like any other hotel there are always a few who take their sweet old time giving you good service despite your willingness to tip well. As for kids... This is definitely not the most kid friendly place. The smaller pools make it difficult for them to have fun because the adults frowned upon the splashing. The beach is the better place for kids to hang if you decide to bring them. We were there coming off president's week so there were a few families there. I thought the parents seemed stressed because the kids had little to do and not a lot of free running around the pools withought annoying travelers looking to relax. Take that from a guy who left his 9 and 11 year at home to get away for a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Definite recommendation . Spa suite top floor”
Reviews.Author: Davb939
Reviews.Content: I took My girlfriend an our daughter (4months old) here for her birthday. The room wasn't ready when we arrived at 2 a little frustrating , but worth the wait. Room was immaculate and spacious. We stayed in the Spa suite 11th floor(top) without jacuzzi u gain 100sq ft unless u need it it's a waste of space . Service was great they brought our crib up for my daughter within minutes of the request. They had a fully staff hotel and always seemed to be cleaning. If u stay here stay soon as it is recently renovated 6 months ago and thy never usually stay this perfect for that long.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunkissed123
Reviews.Content: Okay, just stayed at la concha in condado san juan. Very clean, nice modern hotel. was excited to stay there after it got great reviews. It is not a hotel for kids there is no kids club and not much for them to do. They have nice small pools but they are cold, trade winds blow all the time so it is windy bring a cover up. The hotel food is pricey and okay most nights we went outside the hotel for dinner , there are alot of restarants in the area , a 5 min. walk. The area is tired but it is beginning to renovate. The beach of the hotel is the most disappointing , if you are looking for a gorgeous beach this is not it. Also the waves are dangerous for all people and especially the young. So , i recommend this hotel very much for itself, beautiful, chic , clean nice staff, great rooms, stay in the Ocean tower, brand new. If i went back though i would find a better surronding area and beach. If you go , old San juan is amazing and the rainforest, take a tour guide you will learn so much more. All in all the people of puerto rico are great, so nice, i would go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities but sometimes noisy”
Reviews.Author: TravelAmateur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the 8th floor of La Concha from Friday, Feb 18, 2011 to Wednesday, Feb 23, 2011. Great facilities; ocean view room with floor/ceiling windows was wonderful; water was hot and all faucets and fixtures worked. House keeping excellent; beds were made and towels replaced by 3 pm every day. Every staff member was friendly and helpful, which was very nice. Pools, seating area, beach all were excellent and well kept. Hotel location was great for city touring. Bus B21 (75 cents, exact change required, bus stop right outside the hotel) went to/from Old Town and ALSO went to the art museum. A few blocks down the street were Walgreens (we forgot sun tan lotion and also wanted Raisin Bran and milk for breakfast), two ice cream stores (Baskin Robbins and Coldstone Creamery), and lots of restaurants. No complaints at all about any of the above. Problems: 1. As mentioned elsewhere, noise from bar/pool is a problem depending on room location and day of the week. The problem is that the door to the room is not soundproofed and opens onto an open air balcony overlooking the pool, so outside noise easily enters the room. There is no weather stripping, or rubber gasket around the door as is done in colder climates. This problem could be solved rather easily and so it's a mystery to me why it hasn't been addressed, especially considering the price of the room. Noise comes from the band or recorded music by pool or bar, as well as occasional loud motorcycles, car alarms, crying children, or hallway conversations. The problem was worse on Friday and Saturday since there was no band/music during the week. In contrast, noise from the surf was inaudible as long as the floor length window was closed, even though the surf was louder than the band. And we never heard any noise from adjacent rooms. But the trumpet and the drums from the band could be clearly heard even in our bathroom at 3 am Friday night/Saturday morning. We finally solved the pool noise problem by opening the ocean view window and letting the surf noise drown out the band. This worked pretty well, actually. The band quit around midnight on Saturday night and we didn't hear anything from Sunday until Wednesday when we left. I expect that this would be a problem only for rooms overlooking the pool, which were all rooms with numbers ending in 01 to about 12 on any floor. 2. Hotel bookkeeping was error-prone but everything was eventually resolved correctly. We had a prepaid reservation and upon checkin they asked for a credit card for incidental expenses which is standard. But it took the desk clerk 15 minutes of phone calls to make the accounting department understand that the reservation was prepaid so our credit card should NOT be charged for the room fees. Of course, all of this was forgotten by the time we checked out since the room fee was again charged to our credit card. In addition, there was a bar bill even though we had not been to the bar. This time it took the desk clerk an hour to get it resolved. But all the charges were eventually charged correctly. The desk clerks were all very helpful and concerned so it was clearly a problem in the accounting department. So visitors should check their bills correctly to make sure they are correct. Four stars because of noise and cost.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND TIME EVEN BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: RJRNyc
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our second trip to La Concha and are already looking forward to a third stay! Aside from the perfect location: great beach, countless restaurants, close to Old San Juan, the hotel is top notch in every way. It's modern, clean, spacious, with comfortable bedding. The fitness room is in great condition and the staff there is also helpful if you have any questions about the equipment. But their best asset is their staff. Starting with Felix, who greeted us time and again when we came and went, to the entire beach and pool staff who seem to always remember where you like your chaise lounges....and there is no questions that Louise is the BEST concierge. She and her staff (especially Natalia and Frankie) greet you with a smile and truly go out of their way to help you with any requests. Louise is one of the reasons we came back to La Concha and the reason we recommended the hotel to several friends who stayed there and loved it - based on our review, one couple stayed for their honeymoon and they are still raving about it! While it was so sad leaving La Concha and beautiful Puerto Rico, we know we will be back with our friends soon.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: Roseanne15
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a fun, hip, place to vacation. Our visit was especially enhanced by the fantastic staff, that is always at you beck and call. The Ocean Club at the hotel should not be missed. The staff, Michael Tischler, Janissa, Pablo, Luis, Christine, and Indhira, were both friendly and professional. It was a pleasure to meet such an attentive group. I hope they will remain eployees for many years, so I may be welcomed back on my many return trips to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Questionable Concierge/Staff”
Reviews.Author: Anon773
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha for 4 days on vacation with my boyfriend. The resort itself is beautiful, from the lobby, bar, pool, restaurants to the beach. However, the concierge and staff is somewhat inept... The first 2 days we were there were great! Although we really just used to resort to sleep in and lay by the beach, since we were out and about on excursion. During our first two days there we also experienced livid guests both days who were berating the staff/front desk. My boyfriend and I thought the guests were just being impatient or whatever, and felt bad for the front desk... That is until we were put in those guest's shoes.... The morning of Day 3, we asked the front desk (Nathalia?) about booking a bio-bay tour for us that night, which she said she would take care of and we should have a tour ready for us. She said she'd call my boyfriend's cell if she was unable to book. So we cancelled our bio-bay tour withe VAC, since it was more convenient to go on the tour from Fajardo, which is an hour drive away, instead of driving and taking a ferry to Vieques. Nathalia said if that tour was booked, she'd find another bio-bay tour for us, either way we'd have a bio-bay tour for that night. So my boyfriend and I rented a car to get to Fajardo for the bio-bay tour that night, and decided to head to El Yunque Rainforest for the day since it's on the way to Fajardo. On our way to Fajardo, we called the bio-bay company to confirm our reservation only to be told that they had called Nathalia and said they were full. Nathalia failed to let us know that she was unable to book the tour. When we called the front desk, they said she called us, but there weren't any missed calls on my boyfriend's phone and she never even bothered to leave a voicemail. So here we are without a biobay tour our last night in Puerto Rico, because we cancelled our original tour under the assumption that Nathalia would book a tour for us, as promised. We couldn't even find another company on our own, because by the time we found out our tour wasn't set, it was too late to make another reservation since they were all full... Incident #2: My boyfriend had the asked the front desk (Victor) if we can get a late check-out and he said we should be able to check out late (5 or 6 pm) for $75. The following day my boyfriend called the front desk and they said the latest check out is 12:30 pm. After much negotiation, my boyfriend was able to get us a 3:30 pm check out for $75. I hate putting these people on blast, because they're nice and everything, but honestly don't tell your guests something if you can't deliver! In hospitality, you shouldn't set up expectations if you can't meet them.... So bottom line: the resort itself is great, but don't rely on the front desk/staff for much... or anything. Also, service at their pool/beach-side restaurant is super-slow, but that doesn't really matter if you're just chilling on the beach. I'd stay here again, but will be sure to plan my own activities instead of counting on the staff, and double checking everything the staff says to ensure it's accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Monarca_11
Reviews.Content: We recently had a great overall stay at La Concha. The room was ready upon arrival in the late afternoon. Given the price we paid it was certainly worth it. We had a gorgeous suite in the newer tower with a view of the ocean on the 10th floor. Everything was in good condition for the most part. The only thing is that for no apparent reason the carpet next to the bed was wet and when we took a bath later that afternoon there was a bit of yellow foam that built up which made it seem a little strange. During our stay we made use of every one of the pools at the resort and enjoyed the beach every day. Our first day we shared the 'duck quesadillas' from Solera which were delicious. We ordered them thanks to reading a previous review from a past guest. The pina coladas were also tasty though they barely poured more than a splash of rum into the mix. The resort is lovely, it is well kept and the staff is so friendly, warm and courteous. The ocean was the perfect temperature and though rough at times it was still fun to play in the waves and watch the surfers and boogie boarders. Natalia at the Concierge was great and recommended a fantastic restaurant in Old San Juan called Latin Roots where they played live salsa music, gave free salsa lessons, and served incredible cuisine, the 'Lechon' was to die for! We did have a couple of incidents that kept our experience from being smooth. One night after coming back to our suite from dinner we found the door open, anyone could have gone into our room. We called Security immediately to check the suite before we went in. David Flores was nice enough to assist us and replied that sometimes when the rooms are cleaned Housekeeping forgets to close the door. He said he would have someone follow up with us the next day to make sure everything was okay. We were a bit shaken up by this incident as it was quite scary not knowing how long that door had remained open but luckily all of our things were intact and nothing was missing. Nevertheless the next day no one followed up with us regarding this incident. Yet the next day after being in the sun we decided to head back to the room and were unable to get in. After trying several times with no luck we asked one of the housekeepers to please have someone come and assist us. Altogether after about a 20 minute delay which set us back a bit with our evening plans, a couple of friendly engineers ended up replacing the battery on our door and provided us with two new keys. At this point the housekeepers were asking what time they could service the room and we said in about an hour. We got ready and went out for dinner, unfortunately when we came back the room had not been serviced. Being a Concierge in New York City I realize that things can always go wrong but it still made me somewhat disappointed given the combination of aforementioned events. Aside from this we really enjoyed our stay and delighted in La Concha, especially visiting la Perla on our last night for our Anniversary dinner which was sensational. Just a few other dining tips: Orale Guey across the street has excellent tacos and $2 beers. Also check out Il Postino for a nice Italian meal about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Bistro de Paris in Santurce is also another great find, the Camembert appetizer is amazing. Also don't forget you're on island time so be patient, enjoy the moments and live it up! Thank you to all the previous trip advisor reviews that helped ensure a good time was had overall.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty view”
Reviews.Author: nycallpro
Reviews.Content: Positive experience. A 5 day escape from winter to a tropical island. Beautiful room with a great ocean view. On site ocean beach and access to pools. Very helpful concierge desk.(Francisco Apcate). Located just a $20 taxi ride from the airport and a 1/2 hr. public bus ride to the must see historic and interesting Old San Juan. Many dining options on site and within walking distance, but the hotel's" Perla" restaurant, is first class and worth at least one visit. Negative: Room reserved wasn't ready for us upon our 5pm sat.arrival. Eventually received a top floor very nice balcony room. Noisy saturday night activities, but the rest of the stay quiet. Very friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beachside in Puerto Rico, won't break the bank”
Reviews.Author: Globalnomadtraveler
Reviews.Content: Pros. Direct access to beach; fun pool scene with bar service and food; safe neighborhood; amazing ocean view 8th floor; clean and comfortable Marriott; fairly well maintained and clean. Cons. Taxi (avg $14 eAch way) needed to everywhere (e.g., Old San Juan, fortresses, top restaurants, airport); not a shopping area; beach fine but big waves not for kids; power was out 1 hour first night. If you prefer being in the heart of picturesque narrow streets, stay in "Old SanJuan". if you want super luxury, head to Isla Verde or away from San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan and great service throughout!”
Reviews.Author: adverturegurl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay and loved the beautiful, luxurious room. Gorgeous ocean front with a balcony and sounds and smells of the ocean below. The decor is bright, contemporary, clean and modern - we loved everything about this place. The food is great and service is excellent on every level. Our room was made up before we returned from breakfast daily and attention to detail is amazing considering this is a large hotel and they make every guest feel special like a boutique property does. We heard remarks about the beach being terrible from the last hurricane, but found that it was fine and still great for enjoying the ocean and beautiful view. This location is safe, in a great area for other restaurants and close (5 mi. drive) to historic San Juan to enjoy this area too. The first several days were spent to the east, at the Wyndham Golf Resort which was a huge disappointment on many levels, for far more money. We found La Concha to be in a different (better) league that the Wyndham hotel. It is surprising that they both carry a 4-star rating - even though the other property was dirty, out-dated, smelly - and none of the room amenities were offered that we enjoyed at La Concha. La Concha is tony and chic and bustling - it is no surprise that it seems to be the PR choice for the beautiful and glamourous traveler. Everyone looks elegant and fashionable at this hotel and it has a very Miami upscale vibe to its atmosphere. Think Raleigh or Delano calibur. LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for couples and friends”
Reviews.Author: vacationjason
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a long weekend. Highline Travel booked us an ocean view room that was awesome. Nothing beats waking up to a gorgeous view and sounds of the ocean. The rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were pretty nice and service at the hotel was great. The hotel amenities are great too. Both the pool and beach were beautiful. It's not a cheap hotel, but then again you definitely get what you pay for and that's a good thing in this case. The hotel had a very lively bar scene, which made it nice for my wife and I to get out and socialize with some of the other guests during the evening. The hotel bar is actually a PR must do, attracting guests from other hotels.They even had a dj on the weekends. I guess because of this, I don't think this hotel is great for families with young children. But if you're traveling with friends, a spouse/partner or solo, definitely stay here. Great recommendation for a fun, quick weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: HailMari
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unique in that it can satisfy those who desire luxury and those who are looking to to cut some corners on spending. We stayed in a beautiful suite that could easily accomodate 4 adults. We had the city view. I wouldn't do that again as it is a bit noisy. The room came equipped with cups, plates, pots, pans, untensils, a stove top, a nice sized refrigerator and an ice makes that holds an inordinate amount of ice. There is also a supermarket just 2 short blocks away. There are also a great deal of restaurants and fast food places within walking distance. We opted to hang out by the pool and order food and drinks poolside. We spent a small fortune on the pina colada with irish ceme and banana puree drink (I forget the name). Easily the best drink I have ever had. We went to Ropa Vieja. It came highly recommended but I didn't like it very much. The codfish fritters were so mushy on the inside, gross and the ropa vieja was a bit tough and served on the cold side. How do you mess up the ropa vieja, that's your restaurant's name. . .We also went to JAM for dinner. Great restaurant. Would go back ina hearbeat. We're already planning to go La Concha soon.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you like blarring Noise -- DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: unitedwalk
Reviews.Content: I am writting this at the moment I am staying at La Concha in San Juan. While it is a beautiful hotel and the staff is very nice -- don't rent a room here if you expect to sleep. The lobby, with a huge bar, faces the pool and open courtyard which the rooms surround. About 10:00 p.m. the music begins blasting (not loud, bone shattering, literally window shaking volume) vibrating throughout the entire hotel. It was so bad the manager agreed to move my room to another area away for the noise and to comp the room for the night. We had this conversation at 1:00 a.m. first in the lobby (at the checkin counter) but then we had to move because we couldn't hear one another over the music.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: ntebrd
Reviews.Content: January and February 2011 have proven to be very busy travel times for us, involving business as well as leisure time. La Concha was, by far, the best hotel we have stayed in during this incredibly hectic period. Not only were we greeted each day with generous smiles and a genuine concern for our comfort, but whatever our needs were, they were answered in a timely and courteous manner. The hotel is well-situated and close to lots of restaurants, bars, and stores. The building is beautifully maintained and our oceanview suite was perfect for our needs. I can't say enough about the staff! Everyone we encountered was so friendly and helpful! Where else can one find a sugar-free mojito, custom-mixed and served with pride but at La Concha! We will make this "our" hotel in San Juan and look forward to returning again very soon! Muchas gracias, todos y cada uno en La Concha!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on our Honeymoon-46 years ago.”
Reviews.Author: HOTRAINS
Reviews.Content: Looking for a new place to stay in the Caribbean we discovered that the La Concha had a major overhall and decided it would be nice to give it a try 46 + years later. After arriving and spending a day there we classified it a three star hotel but upon further thought and experience we upgraded it, in our minds, to a four star hotel. In general we were pleased with everything, the hotel, its location, the pool, the beach,our ocean front room in the original building and the staff. With all the fine restaurants nearby we did not eat in their signature resturant but it looks very nice. My only complaint was the resort fee of $38.61 which was not revealed to us until we checked in and at that the amount was not mentioned until I saw our bill at check-out. The Rate Rules on their web site state the fee excludes taxes and fees but does not explain what fees are for or how much. My shame for not questioning them. I question why a resort adds a resort fee (greater thean 10% of the room rate) to the bill. The total cost should be implicit in the room rate especially if the hotel calls itself a resort. I would not have changed the hotel because of the added cost to the hotel rate but would like to have known about it.

Reviews.Title: “Vibrant with views and sounds of ocean crashing.”
Reviews.Author: Akins1
Reviews.Content: For our 2nd trip to Puerto Rico we decided to try the Condado area because it is closer to Old San Juan nightlife than the Isla Verde area. LaConcha was our choice and the oceanview spa suite located on the 3rd floor was realy close to the beach with its sounds of the ocean crashing was exactly the type of location we wanted to have on our second Valentine weekend vacation In Puerto Rico. If ocean waves crashing is not your thing, just closing the patio doors quiets the noise. I expected a seperate living room with sofa as the hotel site advertised but the room is much smaller than a suite because the outside balcony area is the extra living area with a lounging beach chair and 4 chairs table. Huge balcony to relax, play your IPOD stereo, table for breakfast\ lunch\dinner and a late night dance under stars. I beleive we'll be back and recommend this place to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Awaken by too much noise”
Reviews.Author: EPawlicki
Reviews.Content: It's 4 am on Sunday Feb 13 and I'm awake due too much partying around hotel. It's the second night in a row this has happened. Under no circumstances book a room with partial ocean views. The parking lot next to the hotel is a magnet for young people with boom boxes playing load Reggeaton - at all hours of day and night. E Pawlicki

Reviews.Title: “Great group sales experience”
Reviews.Author: Shawntell
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a group of sales executives at La Concha Resort. The sales associate I had the pleasure of working with, Steve Carroll was helpful with rate & meeting space information as well as an unscheduled site visit by someone in the group! The attendees enjoyed their experience - each had an ocean view room and I would book another group here in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: consumer-analyst
Reviews.Content: Okay so it isn't a luxury hotel. It is a clean hotel with a nice city location, some very good food choices and if you are a Marriott gold or platinum, a great lounge for weekday breakfast and late afternoon early evening cocktails and snacks. The pool area is very nice with good locations for getting that tan, reading your latest novel and catching that afternoon nap(make sure you make your lounge chair claim before 9am on busy days).The beach area is okay if you need to spend some time laying by the ocean. Usually windy with choppy water, this was not what I consider a great beach. It's just okay. The lobby and its bar are very cool and provide a great meeting place or a good place just to hang out. Perla restaurant is a great selection for one of your special dinner nights. Excellent fish dishes! Wine selection is wide but overly expensive by any standard. Ambience is excellent. Have dinner here and you will be very happy. So overall, a good experience for a couple getting out of the Notheast winter. We stayed in a tower oceanfront room which has a refrigerator, microwave and some okay furniture in the living room part.The room is good but you get a feeling that the tower was designed as a small one bedroom vacation club condo. It was sufficient and comfortable but again we are not talking luxury. Overall, the room was good and served its purpose. We attempted to check in at 5pm but room was not ready t after 6pm. Free drinks and food provided at the lobby bar during wait. Nice gesture and it was fine with us. They allowed us to have a 2pm checkout even though outr keys stopped wotking at noon. What I found interesting was that the pace of service was erratic and if you go to get coffee, it usually is in need of replenishment whether it is in the lobby or the lounge. The staff just has a hard time keeping up with the little things. Perhaps that is because it is a leisure hotel instead of a business one. Service is slow. No big deal if you are chilling but if you are in a hurry, it might be a negative factor. I think this is a good hotel choice for a 3 or 4 night getaway stay. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: KJinCT
Reviews.Content: The grounds and decor were beautiful and clean. We had a suite in the north tower which was perfect! What stood out most for us was the staff at the hotel. They were always smiling, friendly and helpful. The concierge, Victor Rodriguez, was extremely helpful with his restaurant suggestions and also shared come money saving tips for us while we explored the island. He set up a few activities for us and made sure we knew what we needed for them. It was about a ten minute taxi ride to Old San Juan, but there were plenty restaurants and shopping available within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LandSSalem_MA
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. This was my 2nd trip to Puerto Rico and my 1st stay at the La Concha. I arrived before my friends at 7 a.m. in the morning. The staff at the valet and the front desk were very accommodating and let me check in early. Over the course of our 5 day stay the staff was very friendly - especially Felix at valet! They should clone him. He was by FAR the friendliest. The service at the pool was a little slow. There seemed to be a lot of pigeons. I found that if the services was a little quicker to clean up it wouldn't have been such a nuisance. We gambled at the casino a bit while we were there. The dealers were not very friendly and over the course of 5 days made several mistakes. We ended up going down the street to the Conrad. The nightlife at the hotel was great. The hotel is very "Miami-ish". The lobby was very lively at night with a dj and great music. On Friday and Saturday it was very busy. We ate the buffet breakfast a few times and had suchi a few other nights. The breakfast seemed a little overpriced; however the sushi was delicious. Overall, I'd defintely put this at the top of my list when going back to Puerto Rico. I enjoyed the atmosphere and thought the staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “This place is ok -”
Reviews.Author: baddabingtmc
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife travel quite a bit - San Juan is just Ok - This place is not bad - area is good - health club needs more equipment - not a good beach for kids - Lots of big waves Overall not a place I would return to

Reviews.Title: “La Concha is the perfect hot spot in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: AngelaK318
Reviews.Content: We just traveled to San Juan this weekend 02/04/11 to celebrate a friend's birthday and La Concha was an amazing find! This was my first trip to San Juan and we wanted a great beach and a fun nightlife and this hit it all! This is the place to go - ocean view literally means ocean view as it is right on the beach! Slept with the window open listening to the waves crashing right outside. The only reason I did not give the rooms 5 stars was bc they do not have any ocean side suites with double beds, only king which doesn't work when you are traveling with friends. The lobby bar on the weekends is hopping with DJ playing music into the wee hours of the morning. The staff truly made it an overall great experience. Asir at the front desk was amazingly accommodating when we arrived, which was on a red-eye flight so he made sure we could get checked-in and get some rest. Jomar served us drinks all day on the beach with a smile and wonderful hospitality. The next day he was our waiter at the pool side restaurant again with the same great service. Concierge at La Concha was the best! Victor was so helpful giving us information on where to go and convinced us to return for New Year's Eve! Stephanie recommended a great local Puerto Rican restaurant in Old San Juan which made our night. I have traveled to many places and have to say La Concha is at the top of the list not only for the great ambience but for the wonderful staff we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with great potential. Great gym.”
Reviews.Author: FayeJ42
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a large resort Hotel in a tourist area of San Juan (NOT Old San Juan). There are many restaurants in walking distance. There are two towers on the beach and one small 2 story building (The Cabanas) between the street and the pool. The rooms were standard size and clean, but the hallways were filthy. For example, a room service tray sat in the hallway for over 24 hours. I saw 2 staff members walk past and ignore it. The carpet in the hallway was stained. La Concha has free internet that worked well for our whole stay. The pool and hot tubs are nice and clean, but relatively small and crowded for the size of the hotel. Pool- and beach- side service was fine. The beach was beautiful, small and shared with a public park. The hotel provided beach chairs. The gym was very nice and open 24 hours. The water on the Atlantic side of PR is rough and it is often not safe to swim. If you are looking for a resort where you can swim in the ocean, you may want to pick a different coast (i.e., not San Juan). We had minor problems with noise as there was a concert in the park next door and the music could be heard easily in the rooms. Thankfully it ended at 10 pm. Food was good quality, but expensive. However, prices in this whole area were high. Service was good, except for one incident. At check in and on every day of our stay, we requested a late check out as our flight was not until 5 pm. The front desk would not give us an answer until the last day and then they insisted we leave by 12:30. At 11:30 am housekeeping knocked on our door (despite the "Do not Disturb" sign). They knocked on the door every 15 minutes until we departed at 12:15.

Reviews.Title: “Not for kids”
Reviews.Author: sunbelly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful when you arrive. Great open lobby. We were taken to our room and had paid for a suite because we were traveling with a 4 year old. The suite apeared fine at first. The room where my daughter would sleep had the pull out and overlooked the pool area. The bedroom was behind it and overlooked the ocean. Apparently at night the pool area becomes a nightclub of sorts. Well since that was the room that my daughter was supposed to sleep in- it becomes very, very noisy. Even I would have had trouble sleeping there. At 10 PM - she is crying because she can't get to sleep. We had to move her into our room to sleep on the chaise- I can't imagine she was very comfortable there. Service could have been better- we had to call housekeeping/front desk 3 times to have the pull out bed made up (and she couldn't even sleep there- I think they knew but didn't say anything to us) The ocean there is also UNSWIMMABLE. Very, Very rough and eroded- you can't even walk out to the beach from the hotel itself since they have barriers up so you don't fall off.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay for honeymooners!”
Reviews.Author: Ozugeil
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our honeymoon. La Concha is the perfect honeymoon spot. Customer service excellence at it's best. As soon as we arrived, we were greeted with smiles and great personality. The person who helped us to our room stayed and answered all our questions and even gave us tips on where to go for tours, fun, food, etc. The staff was at our service immediately! for example, we needed the hot tub filled and were on our way out to dinner, they guaranteed it'd be waiting for us when we got home and it sure was. Room 354 was amazing! The jacuzzi in the room is a perfect treat for honeymooners with a view of the ocean and the stars from right inside your room. AMAZING Stay! The bar has the friendliest staff, the casino is very welcoming, the food is to die for at Perla! We will be back and will definitely stay at La Concha again in one year! Puerto Rico, altogether, was enticing! Very Latino chic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in very busy area”
Reviews.Author: ontheMove19
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a beautiful resort, has an oceanfront suite in the tower. Rooms were very modern and nice, however the air conditioning unit ran continuously and drowned out the sounds of the ocean, as well as driving me insane if you enjoy quiet. The beds were comfortable but nothing spectacular. Everything was very clean, and the staff was extremely friendly and eager to please. The location was very nice, bus stop just outside, taxis always available, restaurants nearby, beautiful ocean views. If you are planning on driving, this is a very difficult area to negotiate because it is SO busy. If you do rent a car, however, I highly recommend Charlie Car Rental next to Walgreen's, just down the street. All in all, this is a beautiful hotel in a busy city location. The lobby is spectacular, the pool areas very nice- rooms lack some storage and real comfort, but look great.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miriam B
Reviews.Content: Beautifully renovated Mid-Century Modern historic tropical building, gorgeous views of the ocean, lovely landscaping, fantastic amenities including gym, hot tubs, 2 infinity pools (including an adult only area, much-appreciated), great bars and restaurants, and a relaxing private beach. The room was AMAZING (I had a suite which was enormous with a big balcony, huge bathroom, comfortable bed, large gallery kitchen with full-size appliances, living and dining room, free wi-fi, gorgeous robe, Aveda bath products.... Great and prompt room service (huge portions) Excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay in 6 months and it got better!”
Reviews.Author: JDM210
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for 2 nights after we came back from a cruise that departed from San Juan. It was just as good as our first visit. Everything is perfect from the get go. As soon as we arrived, Jonathan Gomez greeted us with a smile and took care of our bags. We arrived a little too early for check in and were worried we would have to wait, the front desk took care of that right away for us and had us in our room with no wait. To top it off they upgraded us to a suite with out even asking. All in all, La Concha is the best resort to stay at when visiting PR.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor attention to customer service”
Reviews.Author: Drudolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip but went early as I had my wife with me. Was not told about the existence of a concierge lounge even though I am a Gold Marriott rewards member. When we checked in we had to wait until 6pm for our room to be available. Housekeeping was sketchy at best. some days they would leave washcloths and some not. Never left an extra toilet paper. Had to wait until past 30 pm for the room to be cleaned even after calling housekeeping twice. Will not go back to this hotel if I return to San Juan. Stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan in December and it was much nicer

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place for Relaxation and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Chad_M_K_10
Reviews.Content: La Concha Resort was the perfect place for a weekend get away in Puerto Rico. Our room was spacious and clean and private, with a breathtaking view of the ocean and the beach. The grounds of the resort blend seamlessly between inside and out with lush and well keep foliage surrounding three pools with very different vibes. The gyms is comprehensive with all the equipment you would ever need and a great view of the ocean, but we decided to get our exercise buy running on the beach and swimming in the ocean. Every night there was a live band playing by the courtyard pool and we spent our first and second evenings moving between the hot tub and the pool, soaking in the relaxation. Around 11pm the cafe/lounge, adjacent to the lobby, turns into the San Juan hot spot with the beautiful people of San Juan on display in their tropical best. The brunch, served on a terrace between the pool and the ocean, was excellent with great assortment of tropical juices and both healthy and indulgent fare. The Pina Colada was invented in Puerto Rico in 1954 and the "Solara Flip" a Pina Colada with Bailey's and banana puree, the house special, is the perfect update to the classic drink. As I sat by the pool with my drink and an order of the lamb sliders (not to be missed!), I realized that the "Flip" was the perfect metaphor for this hotel; a sensation from the fifties that has been updated to be even better then the original. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic expierence”
Reviews.Author: maribellozano1
Reviews.Content: Love staying at La Concha hotel. It's location is perfect close to shops and restaurants. Also I would like to say the service at the Ocean Lounge was excellent. All the employees were great and very attentive. Michael Tishler, Pablo Rivera, Pamela Reyes, Janissa Colon, Indira Payano, Christine Birrel and Luis Perez. Please let them know to keep up the great work. I will definily visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “such a great resort”
Reviews.Author: Denred04
Reviews.Content: This resort is exactly as shown in the photographs. We got in very late and spent some time enjoying the night time views. It is just beautiful! We stayed in the newer towers and the rooms were fantastic. Comfortable bed, sofa bed in the living area, and kitchen. One room had a jazuzzi tub, the other did not. Great flat screen tvs in both rooms. The staff is great here and everyone makes you feel welcome and special. The pools are beautiful, but we opted to hang on the beach everyday. Only negative was that they allow children on the computers in the business center, so when my husband needed to check some things for business, hew wasn't able. There are three computers, and two were occupied by little girls on facebook and a Barbie art cite. I emailed the hotel today and maybe they will take my suggestion of setting an age limit. After all, it is called a Business Center! We ate at Solera, which is a bit expensive, but the food is really good. Try the duck quesadillas.... very good. The drinks are delicious, and again, a bit expensive, but we knew ahead of time that we couldn't worry so much about spending a few dollars more than we would at home. The food that you order on the beach is from Solera. The beach is so relaxing, but the water at this end does have a lot of seaweed. It's fine if you want to just relax in the water (just go out a few feet and the water is clear) but if you have kids that want to ride the waves all you have to do is walk to the other Marriott where the water is clear and the waves are great! (They do not reciprocate and let you use their beach chairs. The guy asked me if I was staying there, and I said no, but I guess you can say yes, and see what happens. We were allowed to plop our towels on the sand, and it actually did feel nice to lay right on the sand) We didn't try the other restaurants at the hotel as we opted for local fare. Check out Orale Guey, which is a tiny local bar right across the street. Try the pork tacos and anything else. $2.00 Medalla beers all day and night! a great deal. We were so disappointed that they were closed on Mondays, as we wanted to go for lunch before leaving Puerto Rico. The restaurant next door isn't much to speak of. The food was ok, and pricey and the atmosphere wasn't horrible. We went to JAM one night for dinner, and have a great time. (they noted on their menu that dinner on Sundays and Mondays are 1/2 price...I would call to confirm this) This is an upscale restaurant, about a 5 minute cab ride or 20 minute walk from the hotel. Food and service is excellent! The other restaurant we tried is Puerto Peru, which is about a 30 second walk from the hotel. Great peruvian dishes and good service. Not as pricey as JAM and the food was just as good. I am glad we did both. (don't let the outside bar deter you, the inside of the restaurant is very simplistic, but nice)

Reviews.Title: “Let's Here For La Concha!!”
Reviews.Author: golfnpoker
Reviews.Content: Letâ€™s here it for La Concha! We normally travel a lot and admittedly donâ€™t take the time to write reviews as often as we should. But starting on Day 1, I felt as if I owed it to this place to compose a quick piece. We read the reviews coming in and because of this, booked a room in the all suites tower. This is the newer of the two buildings. Without question and if budgeting allows, you too should stay in this part of the hotel. It is virtually brand new and well worth it. We even splurged for an ocean view room, as it wasnâ€™t much more than the alternative. That is where I sit and write this first part as I eat my breakfast on the balcony overlooking the Atlantic. It is an easy flight from NYC on JetBlue. We arrived midmorning, grabbed our bags, which met us timely at the carousel and seamlessly took an $18 cab to the hotel ($15 plus $1 for each piece of luggage). It was a short ride. We were greeted at the front by a pleasant bellman named Robert. Check-in was simple. They even allowed us to look at different types of rooms before settling in. The older part of the hotelâ€™s rooms had a bit of a musty odor common in the Caribbean. After viewing the suite up on the 11th floor, we fell in love. Where to start? The lobby was chic but not over the top. The pools are beautiful and the ocean is the best we have seen so far. The waters are definitely not calm, but most important to usâ€”the sand is soft and without rocks. I am not only talking on the beach but in the water itself--no seaweed, no shells--only soft sand under your feet. We barely went into the ocean at Atlantis last month. You couldnâ€™t get me out of it here. The room is Four Seasons incredible at half the price with a couch, table, two flat screen televisions, and two decent sound systems. There is large closet space, and a great bathroom. No tub, but otherwise great. It had a fully functional kitchen with pots, pans, silverware, a microwave and oven top. We were so taken by this that our first stop was to the SuperMax supermarket where we stocked our fridge, bought liquor and cooking spray and had omelets for a mid afternoon snack. We bought so much we had to take a cab back. We eat healthy and often and will likely end up making our money back on the suite and be happy doing it. If you donâ€™t need a kitchen and mustiness is no bother, then you can consider the regular rooms. Do not, however, cheap out and get a street view room. We are told the noise may be a problem for some. The rooms are very quiet with the exception of the somewhat loud but smooth air-conditioning system. We enjoy the white noise but for some this may be an issue. It blocks out all other ambient noise so far, and we feel it is a plus. The sounds of the ocean are phenomenal, but it is too warm and humid to sleep with the door open. La Concha isnâ€™t cheap, but one of the most pleasant points is what you get for your money. No hassle, a pleasant staff, and one of the most important thingsâ€”they donâ€™t nickel and dime you for every little thing. The chairs are not out at the beach and some guy will bring them out for you (so you should tip him), but other than that, it had the feel like an all inclusive without the food or drink. For example, the gym is free for use. It happens to be more than just a room with a treadmill. It was quite decent with LifeFitness equipment. We even did a spin class that was offered on our first night. Classes were few, however, but donâ€™t let that stop you. Towels and water at the gym were provided. They even gave us bottled water for the spin class (nice touch). We had two delicious cocktails at the bar, which as you guessed were $11 drinks and were very small. This was a Wednesday night and the place was mellow. The DJ is always playing so I guess anything can happen. We wait for Friday/Saturday night when the place is supposed to explode with activity. We ate a Buddhathai down the block. I canâ€™t recommend it. The hotel casino is okay, but we are no-limit Texas hold â€˜em players and there werenâ€™t any tables going mid-week. We did walk to the Marriott that is down the block but their casino was nothing to speak of either. There was a half filled table playing $5/10 limit-poker. The game broke up soon thereafter. Again, we wait for the weekend when there is supposed to be poker here. All in all the hotel was great and we would definitely recommend it. It is not in the â€œresortâ€� part of town, but I am not sure that matters. The beach is great, the staff is great, and it overall, it receives a rating of GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Trendy = Great!”
Reviews.Author: L0vely_Star
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of a very busy Ashford Avenue. Great rooms with an ocean view. Simply a nice , friendly , clean hotel. The front desk agents were very helpfull and fast upon check in . But the concierge has got to be the place to go ask all your questions about good food and great nightlife. They also arranged all our tours and what not. Thanks to Frankie and Natalia for all the great recomendations and wonderful service!!! You guys made our stay one to remember!! You will def see me again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! (Daniel & Pamela - NY)”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Pamela
Reviews.Content: For 15 years, my wife and I have wanted to return to Puerto Rico. Two weeks ago, we finally made it back. We had a great time enjoying authentic Puertorican food, entertainment and good old fashion rest and relaxation. This trip was special for so many reasons. One of the biggest reasons can be summed up in three words...."World class staff ". The La Concha, on top of being an absolutely amazing hotel, is blessed to have some of the greatest staff members we have ever experienced working for them. If you're thinking about visiting La Concha and you'd like to find out about the great food and service at La Concha's restaurant "Solera", the excellent fitness center, the four wonderful pools, jacuzzis, or the beachside cabanas and grill, then you should really check out the property and it's amenities on marriott.com. If you'd like to know who were the professionals that made our stay one of the greatest trips we have ever taken, you owe it to yourself to finish reading our review. Please let me start by saying that the unmatched staff at La Concha addressed our every need from the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out. Our wish was undoubtedly their pleasure to call their command. They made us feel like my wife and I were the most important guests in the hotel. And by the smiles on their faces we could tell that every other guest felt the same way. The staff was phenomenal! We would like to start by thanking Cynthia, the front desk manager, who addressed an issue we had with our room by upgrading us to a beautiful suite in the main building. The suite was large, extremely comfortable and had the most breath taking view of Condado Beach. Next we'd like to give a special thanks to a special person we had the privilege and honor to meet, Michael Tischler, the Ocean Lounge's Manager. The Ocean Lounge is the hotel's exclusive, members only, lounge for Marriott Gold and Platinum Elite members. Michael went out of his way to make us feel special. He realized that we were staying in the main building and, even though we were pleased with our suite, explained that as Platinum Elite members we needed to be in a Tower building suite, because we've earned it. In a flash, he had us whisked away to a remarkable oceanfront suite. Throughout the rest of our week, Michael went out of his way, daily, to make us feel special and make our stay even more enjoyable. The next person we'd like to thank is Robert. He is the most energetic, accommodating and outgoing bellman that we have ever met. He made our transition from our first suite to the Tower suite quick and effortless. He was very helpful in assisting us in planning our Itinerary and making sure we knew where to go to experience authentic Puertorican cuisine. This added greatly to the enjoyment and experience of our visit to San Juan. In fact, at first, we were going to self park our rental car. After meeting Robert, it wasn't even a question as to whether or not we would use La Concha's valet parking service, even if it was more expensive. Last but not least, we have to give a special thanks to Pablo, who works in the Ocean Lounge. From the first night of our stay, Pablo had the answer to every "where can we go for the best.....?" question we could think of. He gave us maps, directions and recommendations to all of the local hole in the wall spots to get some good eats and entertainment. Having Pablo at our disposal was like having our own personal tour guide. Next year, we planned on visiting the JW Marriott Guanacaste Resort & Spa in Costa Rica ........ umm, I think that's gonna have to wait until the following year. La Concha, we'll see you next January!.... if not sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance La Concha Hotel for two nights prior to taking a seven day southern Caribbean cruise. Both the hotel and the hotel staff were nothing short of excellent. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the bell staff, then the front desk reception and throughout our stay, every single staff member could not have been friendlier. The hotel has a very â€œSouth Beachâ€� feel to it. Modern furniture and accent lighting is used throughout the hotel. From the lobby, bars, pool area and rooms, the entire hotel takes on a very â€œultra barâ€� type feel to it. Iâ€™m a Marriott Platinum Elite member and tend to stay at Marriott properties exclusively throughout the world (Marriottâ€™s, Renaissance and Ritz Carlton hotels). After walking over to the San Juan Marriott and looking at that property, I was very happy that I decided to stay at the Renaissance. The Marriott looked like something out of the 1950â€™s and not in a good way. It looked very run down and tired. The complete opposite of what youâ€™ll find at the Renaissance. Being an Elite member, I was upgraded from an ocean view room to a one bedroom suite. Keeping with the hotels modern/chic look, the tiled suite had a living room with a flat screen TV mounted to the wall next to a nicely equipped kitchenette complete with a stainless steel refrigerator/freezer, microwave, two burner stove and sink. The cabinets are filled with glasses, plates and utensils. Not that I ever plan on cooking while Iâ€™m on vacation but we did make use of the refrigerator and the microwave. The living room had some funky leather and vinyl furniture. Sofa, corner table, chair, etc. There is a nice size bathroom with glass walls around the hydro tub/shower combination that separate the bathroom from the bedroom. The only drawback to the bathroom is that thereâ€™s only one sink. One of my Elite preferences is for extra towels and pillows and we received plenty of both. The bedroom has a modern desk and a second flat screen LCD TV. There is a very large double closet with plenty of storage and an in-room safe built in. The bed was comfortable enough but was not a premium bed found in many of the other Marriott properties. I read some previous postings that complained about the lack of air conditioning or hot water in the shower. We didnâ€™t experience either of these problems during our stay. There are three pools on the property. The main pool is located in a courtyard in the center of the hotel and receives the most sunshine. The other two smaller infinity pools face the ocean but get much less sun (only a couple of hours in the morning), so thereâ€™s not much of a crowd at these pools. The beach, while small, never seemed to be crowded. Thatâ€™s probably due to the constant rough surf found on this side of the island. This is not the location to choose if youâ€™re looking for tranquil waters which is why most guests spend their time at the main pool. There is a nicely equipped gym with all of your standard cardio and weight machines. They also offer free classes six days a week. The cardio machines all have personal TVâ€™s but youâ€™ll probably find yourself staring at the view from the floor to ceiling windows looking out over the pool/beach and ocean. The restaurants and bars were all excellent as well. Service was quick, the food and drinks were all good and the pricing (that some others have complained about), is no different than youâ€™ll find at any other high-end beach resort.
