If youâ€™re looking for a bargain maybe you should be staying at a Holiday Inn. Since we arrived on a Friday and were leaving on Sunday, we were only able to use the concierge lounge on Friday night. There was a nice presentation of both cold and hot food along with an honor bar. As far as concierge lounges go, this had to be one of the nicest looking lounges in the entire Marriott/Renaissance chain of hotels. Too bad they donâ€™t keep it open over the weekend (something you find at most of the international hotels). If you like to gamble, thereâ€™s also a casino right off the lobby. Slots, table games, etc. Only complaint with the casino is their lack of live poker. They appeared to have one table but there was never a game going on so I just had to play craps (and even won a few bucks!). I canâ€™t image anyone being disappointed in their stay at the La Concha. Having seen many of the other hotels in the area, this should be at the very top of your list if youâ€™re planning a trip to San Juan for pleasure, business, a pre or post cruise stay or whatever brings you to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Fine rooms, not in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: OutofKansas
Reviews.Content: After a particularly long wait in line to check in, we were upgraded to a lovely suite with kitchen, living room, and balcony, overlooking the city. The room was clean and well-appointed, with very contemporary furnishings, and we found it totally comfortable, much more than we actually needed, since we were touring from morning till night. The hotel public areas seemed somewhat stark, and noisy, but were clean. We were disappointed that our choices for breakfast were a snack at the bar, where service was negligable, or an expensive buffet, which was more than we wanted. We appreciated the free wifi. When we went for a walk on the beach, which had nice sand and clear water with mild surf, we were distressed to see how much beach seemed to have eroded away and how many buildings seemed to be damaged or abandoned along it. The hotel has two rather small pools, with a huge lounge area surrounding one; these provided good spaces to relax. If I were choosing a hotel in San Juan, I would look for something either next to the airport or in Old San Juan. this location is between. The water landscape in the park areas a short walk from the hotel was quite beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Skivt89
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the La Concha and had a great time. This was our second time staying at the hotel and we were very happy with our choice. The first time we stayed at the La Concha (2 years ago) the new hotel Tower was not built (but, was being built). This time the Tower was completed and a couple members of our party were staying in the Tower. The tower was very nice and each member of our party has a suite, with a kitchen and a nice balcony. My wife and I stayed in the main part of the hotel on the 5th floor with an ocean room, which we enjoyed. By being a gold member of Marriott we were able to use the Ocean Lounge (which is open M-F only)(located on the first floor of the new Tower). We had our breafast in their during the week and also came back after 5:30 for appitzers and dessert (around 7:30). We meet an excellent staff member (Pablo) in the Ocean Club. who we cannot say enough about. He was excellent and gave our some great advice on resturants to go to in the Conado area (we went to a one in front of the hotel) and also one on Asford Avenue in the direction of Old San Juan. Both served local fare and were excellent. Pablo really went the extra mile in everything that he did for us and we very much enjoyed meeting him. The day we were leaving we were lucky enough to meet Felix who was one of the bellman who worked outside in the entrance of the hotel and was able to get us a taxi to the airport right away. We would without question stay at the La Concha again as we enjoyed our stay and look forward to heading back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Est1987
Reviews.Content: Just visited La Concha last week. PROS- 1) Perfect location. If you want to be in the center of the action, this is where it's at. Lots of great restaurants surrounding the hotel, higher end shopping (Louis Vuitton and Gucci stores are right on Ashford Avenue), 2) FANTASTIC ocean view rooms. I highly recommend you get one if staying here. The view is absolutely breathtaking. 3) Very good Service. We had an issue with my credit card checking in and the manager and front desk associate were very accommodating. We really appreciate the hotel staff working with us to resolve the issue. On top of that, we were greeted with complimentary champagne and free drink passes at the lobby bar! 4) The pool area is really nice. The infinity pools are insane, they light up at night and it's gorgeous. The beach isn't bad. We spent two days out there and I realized we probably visited during a less busy time because we had no issues getting chairs or towels. The beach might not have been the largest but it accommodated all the people during our visit without looking overcrowded at all. 5) Free Wi-Fi = AWESOME. Helped us a ton when looking up restaurants and activities. CONS- 1) The food, as mentioned in previous reviews is pretty expensive. But that's not just at the hotel. In this touristy area, it's not uncommon to spend $25 a person (JUST ON LUNCH!) for a meal and drink (with taxes and all). We ate pool side the last night and my sushi and boyfriend's steak were both pretty. Portions could be a little bigger, however (as they are at other restaurants in the area). 2) The hotel should do some minor tweaking...I don't know how reasonable getting rid of the carpet is, but that would definitely make rooms smell less mildewy. The showers as EVERYONE has said are really annoying. Only half of a door and there are two shower heads so it's very difficult not get the bathroom floor wet. We also received a number of towels from housekeeping with holes in them (which is unacceptable for a hotel of this star rating), and the pool area did not seem to be regularly cleared of cups (it's close to the bar and many people bring their drinks to the hot tub/pool areas). 3) The hotel might be a little overpriced. Not sure how it compares to others in the area but I've paid way less for other hotels. If the little problems listed above were fixed, the price might be justified but there is some work that needs to be done around the hotel for people to feel like they're getting their moneys worth. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed San Juan and La Concha. The city is what made the trip for us and our little home away from home at La Concha was great (I mean you can't really beat listening to the sound of waves hitting the shore every night as you're going to sleep and waking up to an ocean view and perfect weather every morning). I would definitely recommend it to others. It's one of the top hotels in the area and didn't have negative reviews about theft or anything like that when I was researching hotels in the area. I always felt like I was safe as well as my belongings. Check it out for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler3636
Reviews.Content: If you're into the nightlife, this hotel is great. It's close to areas where you would want to go out, and its own lobby has one of the best bar scenes in the city. Old San Juan is a short taxi ride away. The pool area is great and the staff by and large are very helpful, especially the concierge and the guys out front. Although you can hang out by the ocean here, the beach is not sandy and there isn't much shore area. If you're going to Puerto Rico to enjoy the ocean you should stay somewhere other than the Condado area. Minor complaints -- something in the room didn't get fixed after two requests, and there was only one trash can in the room. Overall we really liked it and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location!”
Reviews.Author: abbyjennifer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple stayed at La Concha for a couple nights before a cruise. Check in was easy and everyone seemed friendly. All of the food we tried was excellent and the service was great! We enjoyed the infinity pool and spent the majority of our days there. The water was warm and clean. I could imagine that the pool areas may become over crowded during busy season, since there was limited seating. The beach was ok. We are not beach people so we were ok with this. If you are looking for crystal clear (and calmer) waters, you have to hike to the other side of the island. This is not a fault of the resort. We loved the location of La Concha. We headed out to dinner each night (by foot) and ate at Yuerba Buena (make a left out of the hotel and walk down a few blocks)- the food at this restaurant was amazing!!! YUM. We liked the fact that we were able to walk to Walgreens, DD, Baskin Robbins, and other restaurants. The casino was fun. It was very laid back, which is what we enjoy. The bar area seemed to be very popular at night with live music, we did not partake since the sun and food had exhausted us :) If we were to visit the San Juan area again, we would definitly stay at La Concha!!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Service is the BEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Naldonian
Reviews.Content: I would like to take an overdue moment to comment on one of the best hotels in Puerto Rico, if not the world, where I have been a recurring guest every 6- 8 weeks since it reopened three years ago: The Renaissance La Concha Beach Resort in the Condado sector of San Juan. Where to beginâ€¦being an elite member in many hotel programs (Platinum with Marriott); I have had my fine share of hotel stays; but La Concha stands above them All! It is not a question of its impressive beauty and elegance, but of the incomparable, exquisite service that is second to none. From the moment you arrive, the Manager of the Valets, Nefdavid Torres, welcomes you with enthusiasm and a large smile. At the front desk, be it Tanya Sanchez, Linette Bauzo, Cristine Barriel, Lois Graulau, or Zugeil Rosario genuinely greet you with a charm that lets you know you have finally arrived to a wonderful place (I know I am forgetting names). If you have a problem or concern, (which is highly unlikely); the management staff, led by Jose â€œPecoâ€� Suarez and made up of Alfredo Arroyo, Jose Casanova, Jose Cepero, Joaquin Cruz make sure that your stay and comfort are unparalleled (they even purchased a fan for me once since a previous one Iâ€™d keep at the hotel seemed dated- let me clarify, they have air-conditioning, I just always travel with a fan!). I cannot leave behind the great Debbie Alvarez in the Sales Department who is always at my beck and call from wherever in the world I may be to assure me I will have a room at their wonderful resort. But these remarks would be incomplete without commenting on THE OUTSTANDING CONCIERGE LOUNGE STAFF, led by the â€œConcierge to the Stars,â€� Michael Tischler. Not only do they pamper you and cater to your every whim, but they do it with love, caring, and the attention to giving you always a little extra. A special mention here to (as I call them): Janissa â€œde Los Angelesâ€� Colon, Indhira â€œdel Paraisoâ€� Payano, Pamela â€œde los Cielosâ€� Reyes, the great Pablito â€œel Salvavidasâ€� Rivera, and Luis Perez. You guys are the best! Without a doubt, it is worth coming to Puerto Rico just to live the unforgettable experience know as La Concha Renaissance Resort

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort in great location however the service can be improved.”
Reviews.Author: acarv212
Reviews.Content: After searching for a nice, warm getaway for me and my boyfriend to go to in the middle of NYC's cold winter, I setttled on La Concha. La Concha definetely lived up to its good reviews on this site. The resort is only minutes away from Old San Juan and right on the beach. The rooms and amenities are gorgeous. The food in the hotel was delicious and I really felt the entire time I was staying somewhere 5 star. My complaints would have to be that during peak times (weeknds and afternoons-evenings) it seemed as though the friends of the staff at the hotel were allowed on the premises. This was very annoying as we could never find any pool chairs or tables to use bc the groups of 7-10 people who were clearly being ushered into the hotel by their friends who worked there were occupying the space. This hotel was not cheap and therefore I feel we did not have to endure witness this kind of behavior on my vacation. Also, there was a poor job actually there was no job of monitoring people who would leave there towels on the pool chairs for hours and walk away to either eat or leave the hotel only to return back to take their chairs again. As you can imagine this left for 80% of the chairs in the pool area taken up by white towels with no one able to sit in them. If La Concha is reading this, please change your policies and have your staff remove these kind of place holders if someone hasnt returned or left their belongings in a reasonable amount of time. I paid alot of money to enjoy myself in your resort and feel as guests we are entitled to these basic needs. Please rectify this and maybe more people would consider going to resorts like yours more often. This isnt the YMCA its suppose to be a Renaissance Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Chic. Modern. Fabulous View.”
Reviews.Author: barbwild
Reviews.Content: We attended several wedding-related events at LaConcha in December of 2010. Entering LaConcha you are transported to another world - a sleek, spacious lobby/reception/bar with ultramodern interior furnishings. Decorated for the holidays, there were glittering touches everywhere and warm, attentive service. There were many hidden places to lounge during the day --in both sun and shade--near other people or secluded. In the evening the glamour and vibe was amazing - with dramatic lighting and pulsing music. The wedding reception itself took place in an indoor reception area right on the beach. Waves lapped the shore just outside an entire wall of windows. Suspended fabric panels created temporary rooms a soft ceiling to define the space. Food was well prepared and beautifully displayed. It was a magical experience in a truly magnificent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: levinemo1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a 4 night stay at La Concha Marriot Resort. The aesthetics of the hotel were breathtaking. Upon check in we were given the option to upgrade our city view room to an ocean view for $50. We opted for 2 nights with the city view, and 2 with an ocean view. I'd say the ocean view completes the total ambiance of the stay, and I'd tell everyone to take that option. The concierge couldn't have been more friendly, knowledgeable, or willing to help. They helped us book a car through Charlie Rental Cars for only $23 for 24 hours. We drove to Luquillo Beach and then drove up into the rain forest. All together a perfect day! I highly recommend the trip whether on your own or through a group tour. We also booked an in room couple's massage with their help and it was well worth it. Request Harold if you're in the market for a great massage. The food options surrounding the hotel were disappointing for the most part. Budatai was the absolute BEST food I've had in Puerto Rico, and beyond. I wish we had eaten there before the last night, because I would have saved my money and eaten there every night. Also try Ropa Vieja and Waikiki for good food, service, and view! We found the total experience to be very relaxing and exactly what we wanted from our vacation. Also a huge plus that everyone at the hotel was very LGBT friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: geminidsw
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and I am very disappointed with this hotel. The bathroom was/is not clean. I have requested three times for housekeeping to clean the bathroom and no one has done it yet. The female manager assured me after the third request someone would be in to clean the bathroom and I am still waiting. I requested that my luggage be sent to my room as well. After the third request I went and got it myself. I read there was a problem with housekeeping. I generally stay at Hilton properties but a co-worker recommeded this property. In the futre I am going to stick with Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Linums
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the ocean front room- comfortable and well done. We found the staff very friendly and helpful overall. Pablo Rivera in the Concierge level area was exceptional. He gave us local siteseeing tips. places to go and see , restaurant suggestions. He is a gem and his help made our trip all the more special. Due to his guidance we felt very informed locally. Jose Acosta was also very accomodating assuring that our stay was going well. My family spoke to him by chance at one point . Later in the stay I was in the elevator with him and he kindly asked how our stay was going. I actually was going down to lodge a complaint and he handled it on our behalf and made all right. I was very impressed with his professionalism to assure our stay was enjoyable. The pools are great, the beach and setting is lovely. Our only minor complaint is that we had to keep calling to get our room made up nearly daily. The lobby concierge desk was helpful tho one of the staff told us about a beach area in Ponce that we took a day trip to see and it really wasn't too great. But I imagine it is a matter of taste. All in all our experience was very positive and we'd return. New Hampshire.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: rbansal
Reviews.Content: My stay at the La Concha was excellent and very comfortable. The staff go out of their way to make sure every one of your needs are met and are very accommodating to requests. Ms. Cynthia Colon and Mr. Jose Casanova were excellent to work with from the hotel staff. They try and make sure you are comfortable throughout your entire stay. The guest rooms and suites are very well put together and modern/trendy. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Ernesto1972
Reviews.Content: This is our second year staying at the Concha before returning home and we love it. Great service, modern room and perfect location near great restaurants and bars. We are looking to stay back next year....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, gorgeous lobby and pool areas.”
Reviews.Author: MamaNellie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous 5-night stay at La Concha, our first trip to PR. We were very impressed with the hotel - comfortable room (upgraded to a suite in order to have more space and be able to check-in at our early arrival time), awesome lobby and pool areas, helpful staff and convenient location. The package price was a great value, even with the upgrade. The only negative was the extremely high drink and breakfast prices - $25 for 2 regular cocktails! (we bought our own rum at the corner store after that!) Poolside food was excellent - try the grilled tuna salad and plantain chips with guacamole - although service was sometimes quite slow. It was nice to be able to walk up the street to stores, car rental, and restaurants. The bus stop to head into Old San Juan is right in front of the hotel. We did hear some occasional street noise from our partial ocean-view suite room, including brief fireworks one night. The concierge, valet and bell staff were all friendly and accommodating. Andy from valet parking is a real gem! As has been mentioned in other reviews, there is significant beach erosion immediately behind the hotel, so you cannot walk up the beach directly from the hotel property. There is a small, well-maintained beach area adjacent to the main pool, which is nicely protected by a breaker wall. Even if the surf is rough, this beach area is sheltered and relatively calm. If you need to rent a car, you can do so only for the day(s) you need to go outside of Condado / Old San Juan. Avis is less than a block from the hotel - if you return by 4:30, you won't have to keep the car overnight and pay $15 per night for hotel parking. Don't be afraid to drive to El Yunque and some of the northeastern beaches, just be prepared for some traffic.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEACH IS ALMOST ALL GONE”
Reviews.Author: JMSamuel
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at La Concha over a year ago and while there were some issues, they did not have a room for us the first night, they made up for it enough for me to want to go back, not now. It seems that bad storms last August took their beach away, except for a small sliver. What were stairs from the Towers to the beach now end in a 10 foot drop into rocks and water. If you do go stay in the Towers, the one bedroom suite is quite nice. I do have an issue with the separation wall between the bathroom and bedroom being glass block but it was not a deal breaker. We did have to wait 2+ hours for a room and we were told they were expediting a 7th floor room for us. When we were given our room it was on the 5th floor and told rooms were assigned as they become available. If that is the case why tell me I was getting a 7th floor room? Our friends, who arrived about an hour later, went through the identical thing. No 7th floor room as promised, they were 2 doors down from us. They put the adult only pool in the Towers in an area that hardly gets any sun at all; why is this please? The other pool is small and quite packed, the chairs are right next to each other and 4 rows deep with little room between rows. If you want to relax that is tough with all the kids. We were there New Year's Eve and it was probably the hottest spot in San Juan. They sold tables for tidy suns. They had an outside and inside venue and live music. The DJ between sets outside was good but he replayed the same music in the span of an hour. It was fun and we were happy we were in the Towers as the party was in the Courtyard of the hotel area. Final issue was they have no hospitality room for the day you leave. A large number of flights leave between 4 and 8 p.m. That gives you a good day in the sun but since checkout is noon they have no place for guest to shower and change. Most beach hotels I have been in, and I have stayed at many, have a place to shower and change just for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Holidays at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: AnnGHartfordCT
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at La Concha from December 23rd - 26th. We arrived early and the front desk staff was very helpful. Our room in the Suite Tower was very spacious and we were upgraded to a partial ocean view for no extra charge. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful and well maintained - lots of plants inside and nice landscaping around the pool. We enjoyed some time at the beach and the pool. There were plenty of place to eat within walking distance as well as a drug store for some items that we forgot to bring.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be going back to this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Monty54805
Reviews.Content: ....after our stay of Jan. 2-5. We had to make repeated requests to have our room cleaned. House keeping services finally got around to our room after 6 pm. While we waited, we requested extra towels so we could shower after being on the beach and were told to go to the pool and take towels from the pool area. In the Rewards Club, staff took away the silverware and food as we stood in the breakfast service line. As other patrons have stated, the hotel was on the dirty side. We had stayed at this hotel for the past three years, but I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Moises08
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and Staff Were 5 stars- This hotel more than exceeded our expectations.The room was very epacious and Comfortable.But the aspect that most impressed us was the Staff,From Cynthia the front Desk manager,to Felix the Valet guy,who send us to great restaurants.They will see us next year at the same time and hope to see all of them again.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced, Dirty and Expensive....find a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadianvicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha after our Christmas cruise and were looking foward to exploring San Juan Puerto Rico. We got our rooms, a room for our 18 and 20 year old and then one for my husband and myself. Our room did not have a toilet paper holder nor did it have a soap dish, or a bar of soap!! our shower head was leaking and the air vents were absolutely filthy. We complained and they did nothing!! This room cost us $341 a night and then they also charged us to use their pool and beach (a resort fee?!). The girls spilled ketchup on the desk and house keeping totally missed it and also didn't clean their room until 6 pm. When they do come to clean the rooms they use the door locks as door stoppers so all you hear all day is slam, slam, slam up and down the hall..The clerks at the desk all wear nehru jackets and are as clueless as the people who wore them in the 60's.. We had prepaid our rooms thru our tour company, yet the morning of check out they slide a bill for 2K under my door for the rooms! I went down and said whats with this and 20 minutes later, after I proved we pre-paid, they said "oh, well we wont charge you then" what jokers.. if you do stay there, I hope they have run over to the hardware store and bought a toilet paperhold for room 417. (or bring your own.) for this kind of money and attitude of staff you should get alot better service, The dirty diapers on the beach chairs at the beach ALL DAY was a nice touch for the resort fee... STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: joe10
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable experience during our recent stay at La Concha. The location is ideal because you are close to beaches, restaurants and neighboring areas like Ocean Park and Isla Verde. The staff is excellent and very helpful. We had positive experiences with everyone - registration, concierge, manager, etc etc. It is better than other resorts like El Conquistador or Rio Mar which are located in remote areas where you are captive to them alone! We stayed in the Tower with an Ocean facing room. We got same great pricing with AAA and Marriott Rewards membership. Rooms were of good size, updated nicely and had excellent Avedo brand soaps and shampoos. Alfred Arroyo (manager) was very helpful to us during our stay there (big Thank you). Since I read reviews before and after our stay, here are some things to consider: * It is Puerto Rico - so don't expect the hotel structures to be the same as New York or Miami. You have to factor in the environment and make mental adjustments. It is a fabulous hotel but if you take the stairs you can get a different view of how these hotels really look. * It is located in a "tourist" area, so all prices are higher than they can be. But if you do some research and walk around you can get everything you need at reasonable prices./..from Coffee (Dunkin Donuts across the street - 99c) to dinner at local favorites like Beebos, where you will pay less then 50% for a very tasty, local meal vs. what the chain restaurants charge for meager quality food. WalGreen's down the street has a grocery section and is open 24 hours. (rooms have fridges). * If you can avoid it don't drive into San Juan. Take the local buses (75c each way), though you may have to wait for it a bit. If you do drive in be creative and bold. We drove in on Xmas night with 1000s of people, yet found parking within 15 minutes by being innovative. * If you need something, ask for it. I needed pen, paper, towels etc and all appeared within minutes of a call. Also towels are liberally provided at the pool area. * We needed to rent a car. We set it up to pick it up from the Avis office down the street from La Concha and return it to the airport when we left, at no additional charge. Added bonus - renting from that area allows you to skip the 11% tax charged when renting from the airport. We also declined all auto rental Insurance and used our personal automobile insurance which worked fine. PR has a lot to offer from San Juan to other parts of which you must explore. We had a great time at La Concha and are happy to recommend it to others. Go there with an open mind and expect things to take just a little bit longer in PR...but you are on vacation so don't rush. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “South Beach chic without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for one night after a cruise. I can't speak to the cost of the rooms because we used Marriott Points. We stayed in the Suites Tower - the room had a fantastic view of the city. The suite itself was HUGE and had a lovely jacuzzi-style bathtub. The layout and design of the hotel is excellent - very South beach in appearance. What is most impressive is the proactive, friendly, helpful attitude of the staff. They have done some heavy-duty customer service training and it shows. Everyone went out of their way to be helpful. They also have a very nice (and large, for hotel standards) gym with classes for guests. Casino was great. The location is great - walk to lots of great restaurants and shops. Old San Juan is about 10 mins away by cab - about $12. There are some usual big resort issues - overpriced breakfasts, crowding at the pool, etc. But I would return here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - overpriced and underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: T-Knowledge
Reviews.Content: The most overpriced hotel I have ever stayed in. It is definitely not worth it. While the housekeeping staff was nice, the hotel in general is old, dirty, and in disrepair. The beach has been washed away. Pools seem dirty/cloudy. The concierge staff was overwhelmed and ill informed. As a frequent traveler, I've had my share of hits and misses - this hotel was an immense disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Resort: They're Good at Apologizing”
Reviews.Author: zarc
Reviews.Content: We began our stay at La Concha with a late night check in that was quick and smooth. We were excited to be staying at this five star resort. The hotel is located right on Ashford Avenue which is where you want to be in San Juan. You are within walking distance to great restaurants and shops. You will also find all the standard US brands there; Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Subway, Wendy's, Walgreens, etc. You can get anything you want on Ashford Avenue. The hotel and grounds were completely renovated about three years ago. The lobby is what I would call 1960's Miami but it is chic and very nicely done. The atmosphere in the lobby at night is hopping. Every night they had either a dj or live entertainment. The grounds and pool area are lush and tropical in feeling. The casino is large and nice. Our room was on the ninth floor overlooking the ocean. Strangely none of the ocean view rooms have balconies. They open up onto a one foot strip platform with a railing. The rooms are large and ours had two very comfortable queen size beds which you don't get in many hotels. The rooms are all new with 37" flat panel television but the furniture looks like it came straight from Ikea. Very sparse. The walls were all bare save for two small photographs above each bed. The bathroom is not huge but does have a nice walk in glass shower with both a rain head and a regular shower massage head. The rooms and entire resort have free wi-fi which is a big plus. Though the staff all over are very friendly and accommodating, the service in the hotel is inconsistent in several areas. At breakfast, the staff seemed to be disorganized. We waited on line to get in to eat, yet there were always plenty of empty tables when we went in. The breakfast buffet was very good. Good food and a great variety of things to eat. One morning they were so busy they set up another breakfast in another part of the hotel. The concierge told us to go over there to eat, that it was the same buffet and not crowded. We left our spot in line and went to the other side of the hotel only to find it was a much smaller selection of food. They were of course very apologetic. The inconsistent service carried over with lunch as well. One day I ordered drinks and lunch by the pool and had it within 15 minutes. The next day we decided to sit and have table service and it took almost 1/2 hour to get a drink after ordering it and 45 minutes to get our food. We complained to the manager who again was very apologetic and the food came shortly after. The lunch food is also very good. Great wraps and salads. They are not lacking for staff at all, they just all seem to be running around doing nothing. The other issue with service had to do with room cleaning. Two days our room was cleaned twice. One day they didn't come until I went up to the room around 3:00 to get something and noticed the room was not cleaned. I called and by the time we came up from the beach the room was done. One day the room was not cleaned until after 8:00 pm when we left for dinner. They showed up at 6:00 to clean when we were getting ready to go out. Friends we were staying with at the hotel went three days without their room being cleaned. They complained, got an apology and a basket of fruit. There are two major problems with this hotel. The beach has eroded away 75 percent. There is just a smallish section of beach left on one side of the hotel and it is not that great. The bigger issue is at the pool. There is one main pool area with two levels and two other smaller areas. None of the areas can accommodate the size of the hotel but to make matters worse, we discovered that the owner also owns a Double Tree hotel that does not have a pool. So the guests at the Double Tree can come use the pool at La Concha. Bottom line, no room at the pool unless you go down at 5:00am and reserve a spot. We came away with mixed feelings about the hotel. It is very pretty and has great atmosphere, but the service and pool/beach areas diminish the quality of your stay. At this time iId give it three stars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, super friendly staff and great value!”
Reviews.Author: TealTurtle
Reviews.Content: The valet staff, especially Felix, really put the icing of the cake! Always super friendly and really wanted us to have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, just dont park here”
Reviews.Author: beagles1013
Reviews.Content: I have been a Platinum Elite member of Marriott for many years. (75 nights/year to qualify for the next year). I have stayed at countless Marriott properties for both business and pleasure. Generally I am satisfied or very satisfied. This case is no different. The service was up to typical Marriott standards as was the room and the food. One day I had to call at 10:30pm that our room was never cleaned that day. Housekeeping sent two people to clean our room at almost 11:00pm and the room was cleaned very quickly. My big issue is that I rented a car to enjoy some time away. When you check in and pull into the lot, you receive a bar coded parking lot ticket that you bring to the desk for validation as a guest. Every single day (5 days), when I placed the ticket into the machine to exit nothing happened and I had to park the car in the exit lane to walk out and have someone help me. Fortunately, generally, the staff was accomodating and swiped their personal cards. Other times, I was forced to go into the hotel and wait my turn at the front desk. At no time did they every offer to comp my parking or do anything to make this better. it wa a real pain in the backside when you want to get out. This is a good hotel with numerous staff that is willing to help. They do a fine job of representing the Marriott brand. However, if you are planning to rent a car (and are not the most patient person), I suggest staying at the Marriott Stelaris just up the road by 2 blocks or at the Courtyard in Isle Verde if you want Marriott brand. Ritz Carlton is an option as well with their Marriott relationship. Next time here I will probably stay elsewhere so that the car is not a recurring pain.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! First class!”
Reviews.Author: Vcjg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room overlooking the ocean!! Gorgeous view! Awesome contemporary room! Location is somewhat away from populated venues but nevertheless it is on the strip and plenty of cabs and transportation are available if you are without a car. I certainly want to return and this is where I will stay!! Could be considered pricey but it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Really Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: yukob160
Reviews.Content: I came to Puerto Rico to propose to my girlfriend but after seeing how beautiful the hotel location was (on the ocean) I proposed at the hotel. The location is perfect and deserves all the great ratings it received.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: snickerseg
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on other trip advisor reviews and found it to be exactly consistent with what others reported - nice room, polite service with a smile, occasional slow or no service (typically at busier times). Waited in a line of 2-3 people to check in (around 6p). Polite service though they did not have the room type we reserved on Expedia (king ocean view). They upgraded us to a suite with partial ocean view and provided free breakfast buffet. Room was clean and huge. Balcony was really nice. Bed comfortable, maybe a bit on the soft side. Giant closet. Safe was available but not connected to floor. Liked having a kitchen and the appliances were clean. Bathroom was awesome, though, beware that the shower has frosted glass and anyone in the bedroom can clearly see the person in the shower. Not a problem for us but could be for some folks. Also about the bathroom... giant jetted tub is cool but may be difficult to use if you have trouble stepping over the 2ft edge to get in it. Also, controls are located on the far wall so you really have to get into the tub to turn the water on and off or drain the tub which was a pain. Anyway.. No maid service but thousands if towels so we didn't care. Can't say enough about the awesome free wifi. It worked EVERYWHERE - in the room, on the balcony, in the lobby, at the pool etc. Breakfast buffet was ok, would not have paid for it (hear it was $25 pp) but ok for free. At night they turn the main pool area into a restaurant called Solera (smart use of space!). Went there the first night and liked it so much we went back the second night. They serve light fare so we got two items and split them. We recommend the calamari sticks. Thought the food prices were ok but the drinks are 10-15 each so together, a meal can be quite pricey. As others mentioned, there are lots of food options within a short walk if price of the food in the hotel is an issue. About the pools, there are many. Liked the main pool best. Normally I hate the music at the pool but I though they did a good job with that here. Adult pool is beautiful but very shady after noon. Pool by the beach is very small but nice views. Could not find the hot tubs but I hear they have several. This hotel feels trendy and has lots of neat sitting areas and interesting decoration. Overall, really liked it. We only stayed 2 days (pre-cruise). Would be good for a longer term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view,Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: rtvj
Reviews.Content: The service was great...everybody were so friendly. The room was just like you see in the photos. and the view- AWESOME! We were totally blown away! The sound of the waves and the sea breeze- we did not want to leave our room!! Location is very good..u have a subway,dunkin donuts right opposite the hotel. A lovely mexican restaurant behind the subway called Cielito lindo or something like that..it had some authentic lip smacking mexican fare..and also a very good italian one too called ilpostino. Down the road is a walgreens which was a god-send! Do not rent a car..lots of taxis around and fixed fares. The resort arranged trips to the rainforest, kayaking and snorkelling and picnic cruises..it was awesome..affordable and well worth it! Do not shop around the resort because all are high end places..go to old SanJuan. Excellent shopping...super cheap and awesome finds! Overall I would def recommend this hotel! The head conceirge Ms. Louise was very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: annie35805
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 2 nights after our cruise. I'm so glad that my hubby decided to upgrade to the towers, oceanfront. The view was spectacular from our veranda, and we left the door open to hear the waves at night. My husband loved swimming in the big waves at the beach, I preferred the infinity pool. Very nice resort, and would definitely stay there again, in an oceanfront room. The only noise we heard at night was the ocean. The only thing we were surprised at was at Solera (the poolside cafe). We ordered 2 margaritas, and the waiter returned with 2 large glasses.(Everyone else had small plastic cups). Price: $15 for 1 glass....so you might ask some ??? about your drink order ahead of time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, would do it again!”
Reviews.Author: knottalot
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for both business and pleasure, so we brought our two kids! the resort was wonderful, very clean, our ocean front view was spectacular! I did not have any problems with the noise and most nights we were in early due to our running around during the day! We did not eat at the hotel much, but it was convenient to everything! I highly recommend it for couples or families!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but loud..”
Reviews.Author: azwurth
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, hotel, pools, restaurants, beach is sufficient...but, every night the music is very loud, early into the morning. Three o'clock both nights we were there. That comes from the lobby bar and the street(Condado Beach area I believe is where the hotel was) bars. Ask for a room on at least the ninth floor...believe there are only 12. The resort definitely trends young and the lobby bar scene is something to see for sure. The beautiful people do congregate there. If you're 30 you'll love it..we're not. But bring at least twice the amount of money you expect to spend. It's a city hotel on the beach. Oh...tough getting lounge chairs by the pool too. The beach was no problem that way. Another note: the pools on the beach side are NOT in the sun during the day, only the pool areas on the city/street side are. I guess I would have to say we would not stay there again. On the other hand, Old San Juan is where we would go again. We debated staying at the El Covento Hotel right in OSJ and saw it while we were there. Fantastic. I couldn't switch because it was a travel discounter packaged deal. (Which is another topic to discuss at some point) We will only stay there next time. It couldn't be MORE different from the LaConcha...think South Beach Miami for LaConcha area. OSJ is terrific..quaint, small streets, lots of cobblestone, hundreds of shops and restaurants all walking distance. When you think of San Juan and Puerto Rico, OSJ is it. And we didn't even get out to the west coast of PR where it is beautiful and unlike either OSJ or the Condado beach area. But overall...say "si" to Puerto Rico. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not MIss This Hotel - 5 Star in Every Way - Be Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: mmills615
Reviews.Content: We are in San Juan for a business/leisure trip and booked our first and last night at La Concha to be near the airport (we had a friend's villa near Luquillo for the rest of the week). We had no idea what to expect and were totally surprised by the excellence of this hotel. From the time we pulled up to the modern, upscale lobby we were given exceptional service and value. The hotel and the rooms are awesome - along the line of the W hotels but much roomier. Our room had a full size fridge and freezer, stovetop, large bedroom, balcony, living area with a sofa, chairs, desk, plus a separate dining area. Everything was immaculate and also cool. There are 3 beautiful pools and a beach with staff everywhere. Also, they have tons of outdoor living areas with sofas, chairs, tables, etc. where people were reading, napping, dining, or just relaxing. With all this we were already sold on the hotel, but as my husband is a Marriott Gold member, we had access to the ground floor Concierge Lounge. This was such a gift - they had a light dinner (they said snacks, but it was enough for a meal) each night with salads, sandwiches, artisan cheeses, appetizers, and a couple of hot dishes. One night it included a delicious chicken pasta that my family inhaled. Later, desserts are offered - cheesecake anyone? I think yes! In the mornings, another generous breakfast buffet is included. This was such a respite from fighting for a reservation or driving - our teens could eat and we could walk somewhere for dinner later - or not. The highlight of our hotel experience was the guy who was running this lounge when we were there - Pablo Rivera. He was so charming, warm, and inviting. He took the hotel experience from great to excellent. When we came back from a week in Rio Mar, he recognized us from our one night visit and welcomed us like family. This is even more impressive considering we came straight from ziplining and kayaking at Camp Rico and were mud covered and pretty grimy. Pablo treated us like valued guests and was so genuinely interested in our visit. He made sure we had everything we needed and is just one of those people who "make" a hotel stay and also make it memorable and personal. La Concha was a great experience - we travel constantly and it was way above and beyond what we usually encounter. Again, Pablo Rivera was "the face" of La Concha for us and took it to another level - all in all we can whole heartedly recommend La Concha to anyone heading to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, Courteous Staff; Convenient beachside location;”
Reviews.Author: kristofari
Reviews.Content: Spent about 10 days here. 12 minutes from San Jose airport, very convenient. Partial ocean-view room was very large with kitchenette, very large modern bathroom, with rainshower-type shower, no tub. However, the partial ocean-view rooms are also facing partial view of rather unspectacular local streets and housing. If that isn't a disappointment, no problem. Beach shared with public, but stretches for miles, so you can walk a very short distance for quiet area if desired. Usually waves for body-surfing in certain spots. Pool area on various levels with outdoor tapas restaurant, very nice. Breakfast indoors with view of ocean also extends outdoors looking over pool area. Huge chic bar area adjacent to casino in main lobby. Extremely attentive, courteous staff, from the valet parking staff, to the front desk crew, to houskeeper Emma, who kept the room in tip-top, immaculate shape. Oh, and they don't skimp on television channels for the occasional rainy day, with a very large satellite menu, not often seen in a lot of hotels in my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Moniemax
Reviews.Content: It is a must to stay in the newer North Tower. Only rent a car for the days you want to travel on your own to a site. If you want healthy great tasting food, eat at "Pure and Natural" right next door to the hotel. With so much to do, don't forget to save some time for just rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday trip to remember....”
Reviews.Author: LizO70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do alot of traveling, and we both agreed the small attention to detail at La Concha pushed it right up to the top of my list. From the sweet scented towels brought around pool side, to the sufficient staff that was plentiful but not annoying, we both had a great long weekend. Fun hip place, great for a weekend getaway....We saw several families with kids, but I would want to enjoy this property without my kids, (until they get older.....) Loved the restaurants around the hotel too!! Great little bar across the street that we loved, they mixed and mixed several concoctions until they came up with my favorite Patron drink. So fun... Ate at La Perla one night, and both agreed the food was fantastic...The wine list is really pricey, but they have alot of really nice wines. Sky is the limit on the wine there.... Would highly recommend Bar Rum Bistro two block down the street.....Unbelievable service, live jazz musician that was great, chef came out and talked about the food he prepared, great guava mojito and white bean soup!!!! Must try... Enjoy San Juan, we will be back with friends!!! We were on the 10th floor, ocean view and never heard a thing....very quiet!!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly resort, perfect location, modern room and hotel, awesome”
Reviews.Author: Jen75206
Reviews.Content: We dined at the Solera restaurant by the pool today. The food was fabulous and the ambiance is heavenly. Jomar Santos was such a good waiter. He accomodated all of our needs and special requests...and always with a smile on his face. We look forward to our next meal with Jomar as our waiter. This hotel is amazing. It's in the perfect location. You can walk across the street to the local bars and restuarants, and shopping are all around here. The hotel is located on Ashford Street, which is where all the action happens. You can walk up and down the streets to see everything. It's a nice leisurely stroll while you're taking in all the sights. The room was gorgeous. It's very spacious. We had an ocean view, so if you looked over you would see the ocean, going on for miles. When it's very quiet, you can hear the sound of the waves, which is really relaxing. This hotel has it all. The bar in the lobby turns into quite the hot spot at night. It's very modern and cool looking. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The concierge arranged all of our dinner reservations at night. They were very nice. For very nice dinners out, I recommend that you try Koco in the El San Juan Hotel and Pikayo in the Conrad Hotel. Koco is like Puerto Rican fusion type food in a cool modern setting. Delicious. Then Pikayo is a really upscale, fancy spot and the food is amazing. Then for a more casual spot, try the Tapas Bar/Cafe, which is across the plaza from La Concha hotel. It was delicous and not very pricey. Also try Buddha Thai, a fancy thai place across the street from La Concha as well. Be sure to make reservations at all these places. The concierge can do it all for you though. Then at night, be sure to hit up the Orate Guey (spelling might be a bit off). It's directly across the street from La Concha. It's a nice little dive bar. We were there on Thurs night and it turns into a karaoke bar, which was really fun to watch. Then on the weekends it's just packed. It's a lot of locals. The local beer, Medalla Light is a few bucks and free flowing at this bar. It's really good. It's a fun low key place to go. Then you can walk right back to the hotel after you've had enough. Overall, San Juan, Puerto Rico has been a blast. This was my first time here and I can't wait to come back. La Concha hotel is gorgeous and the best place to stay. Location can't be beat. So many thing offered at the hotel, you barely need to leave. Food is plentiful here, so be sure to try all the good restaurants. The people here are all really friendly and nice too. Had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha is a Great Hotel--Not to be Missed! Excellent staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: jvb1128
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha for over 4 months for business. It is a lovely hotel, with outstanding staff, beautiful rooms (particularly in the suite tower), great beach and excellent location. The rooms in the suite tower were fabulous and so roomy, particularly for business travelers there for an extended stay like myself. It has a separate kitchen/living room/dining area from the bedroom (stocked with all cooking utensils needed). A full size refrigerator/freezer. Bathrooms were large with either a shower with a rainshower head or a jacuzzi bath. Excellent internet connection as well. There was plenty of room for storage. If I needed anything, the housekeeping staff was quick to provide. The rooms, hotel lobby, pools (loved the aduilt infinity pool) were beautifully decorated. Although on weekends it clearly "rocked," I never heard the noise in my room. They had some great weekend entertainment which guests were invited to. Fitness center also was top of the line with a view of the ocean to die for. Staffing: From the minute you arrive, the valet staff are there greeting you with smiles. Most famous (and well deserved) is Felix who always is smiling and ready to give you a high five. Ricardo and the rest also were very kind. The front desk staff, too, were so kind and helpful. From John Mink, Kristina, Luis, and the others (I don't know all the names)--if you needed anything they were always ready to help and very accommodating. Sometimes the desk was busy and might take some time to check in but the smiling faces of the front desk staff made it much easier. As a Gold/Platinum Marriott Rewards member, I had access to the Ocean Lounge. Michael Tischler did an excellent job in managing an extremely well run and efficient lounge. It had a beautiful view of the water and great seating areas inside and outside. His staff was the finest I have met in a concierge lounge: Pablo Rivera always would get anything you wanted and was always there to help but he also had excellent people with him. While there, I saw Pablo first in the mornings and what a welcome delight. He then switched to evenings and never lost a beat and got whatever you wanted. The other people in the Ocean Lounge also deserve exceptionally high praise: Indhira Payano, Pamela Reyes, Janissa Colon, Christine Bimel, and Luis Perez. They all were very active and ensured that all needs of all guests were met, both inside and outside. The place was kept impeccably neat. and clean. On weekends I had breakfast at Level 25. The manager also could not have done enough as well as the hostesses, Janissa Rodriguez and the others as well. The wait staff also was excellent. The concierge desk with tireless Luisa and Viktor also deserve high praise. They would do whatever they could to make sure you arranged the right excursion or found the perfect restaurant. All recommendations were great! The management of this hotel also deserves commendation because without good management, this place would not be run so well. High praise to Alfredo and Jose Ceprero. The Condado area was great and what I thought was safe. It was great to walk around and many times at the park next door to the hotel there were some great concerts. I would often take walks along the street alone, sometimes late at night, and never had any hesitation. It is a perfectly safe location (not true for some other parts of San Juan). It also was relatively close to the airport and to Old San Juan in the other. I would highly recommend La Concha--a great hotel that I called home for many months.

Reviews.Title: “Our first kid-free vacation and it was great!”
Reviews.Author: sethandliz
Reviews.Content: We booked La Concha just a few days before our trip, when the price dropped dramatically (we also used Marriott Rewards rates). So glad we did. This was our first trip in 7 years without kids and, while I love kids, I didn't want to travel all the way down to watch kids screaming down the San Juan Marriott water slide for 3 days. I had read this hotel was virtually kid-free and it was true. So that's a pro OR a con depending on what youre looking for. At check-in, we were offered a free upgrade to a suite. We turned it down, though, because we did not want to give up the ocean view. That was a wise decision because the view was AMAZING. The floor to ceiling windows were fantastic because you had the full view even when laying in bed. We were on the 8th floor and we also enjoyed watching the surfers who were out there from dawn to dusk. The room was small but found it comfortable. I agree with the people who said the housekeeping was sporadic at best. ALL 3 days, I came up to the room between 3 and 4 pm and the room hadn't been cleaned. I called down to the front desk each time and they'd apologize profusely and send someone up immediately. The half shower door sent more water onto the floor and they took the mat the first day and never replaced it (I used a towel). Good variety of TV channels - even NFL network. But the satellite went down a few times - sometimes it lasted a few mins but during rain it lasted about 45 mins once. The lobby had a very trendy, modern vibe. Reminded me of the type of scene you'd find at a W Hotel lobby in manhattan. Everythng was white marble, geometrically patterned. Lobby bathroom had these space-aged looking toilets that actually freaked me out a little. We were there mid-week and did not experience any noise problems. The lobby bar was bustling and the "quality" of the patrons was very good. But once you were in the elevator, you heard nothing else. Spent a decent amount of time in the casino. The casino was pretty good. Variety of slots, plenty of penny and nickel slots. We preffered the casino at the Marriott which was a quick 5 minute walk up the street. (Now that place had a LOUD lobby, you couldn't hear yourself think and I was yelling to talk to my husband). Their table game scene was a little better. As for the restaurants - the breakfast at Level 25 is amazing. A little pricey, but not atypical of hotel food. We ate there every morning, it was so good we had no desire to go elsewhere. Lunch at the poolside restaurant was good. We also enjoyed the Sidewalk Cafe - their gelatto is fantastic! Pool and beach furniture was very comfy - daybeds!!! Plenty of seating. Two very nice infinity pools. Two hot tubs which were VERY hot. Free wi-fi (awesome) and our ipad connection was great by the pools and even at the beach. Walking distance to shopping and a big Walgreens which had a larger grocery section. Very good Mexican place just past the Marriott called Tijuana's. 10 min cab ride to Old San Juan. Cab drivers had a different price for that trip every time! All within 3 dollars of eachother, but kind of annoying. Plenty of good restaurants in Old San Juan - we went to the Parrott Club which was good but no outdoor seating and Al Fresco which had great people-watching outdoor seating. Someone also highly recommended Marmalade to us but we never had a chance to go. Between hotel and Old San Juan, we gave just about every meal an A! A great eating trip. All in all, I would recommend this hotel. We had a great time and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Service was EXCELLENT from Jannise Rodriguez hostess Level 25”
Reviews.Author: hambone69
Reviews.Content: Ate breakfast in the Level 25 restaurant where Jannise Rodriguez was hosting. She was pretty much running the whole restaurant seating people and taking care of other things. She could see that I was frustrated with not getting my food and stepped in to make me happy. After this she continued to come back to our table to check on us.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Resort”
Reviews.Author: travel561
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying over Thanksgiving at the La Concha Hotel after checking out of the Ritz (see previous review). From the moment, we arrived it was the most pleasant and engaging experience. From the official greeter Felix, one felt right at home. What was so pleasant about Felix was everything he did was with a genuine smile and we found the hotel followed this motto. Nothing was too much for the staff who made you feel as if you were returning home. From the cool hip vibe of the Lobby complete with Sushi Bar and open air atmosphere, the expeirence was delightful. The amenties of the hotel were numerous and the vistas of the ocean and the beach were magnificient. Also, if you speak Gucci or Louis Vuitton, their shops are minutes away in a very lovely neighborhood. There were several pools so if you wanted complete serenity that was an a option with lush tropical vegitation everywhere and private areas to sip a cool marguerita or read a book. If you wanted people ,they were there too. The service of the hotel staff was exemplary and opposite of what we found at the Ritz. You could tell the people right down to the concierges who introduced themselves really liked what they were doing. We stayed in the new area of the hotel and the rooms were suites and very comfortable replete with LCD Tv's , jacuzzi"s ,etc. The beach had many private areas to it and there were flat bed cabanas on the beach that were there to be used with no extra charge. The housekeeping of the hotel was excellent and the restaurants were fabulous as we tried them all and would highly recommend La Concha. It was an indulging experience and truly San Jan's better kept secret. Will return there again and highly recommended this to anyone not looking for a cookie cutter hotel.

Reviews.Title: “omg”
Reviews.Author: mimiSanSaba_Texas
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful time. Stay 2 nights before our cruise, took the tour to the rain forest. It was great. Gina out tour guide was excellant. Room was great, the bar downstairs was unbeliveable. Going back soon. Loved San Juan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as others”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: I had fairly high expectations for La Concha prior to my five night stay based on reviews here and the hotel website. I must say, however, after my stay I can't say La Concha comes close to being a five-star resort. The lobby and pool areas are very sleek and inviting. Perhaps being assigned a "cabana" room instead of a tower room accounts for some of my dissatisifaction. The cabanas consist of two floors with ten rooms each adjacent to the main pool. Not quite the oceanview I had hoped. The room was average sized and had some good features. There are lots of outlets and lighting options. The shower and bath area was nice, and was stocked with Aveda products. There was also an unstocked refrigerator but no microwave. The storage armoire was spacious and well-designed, although the sliding frosted glass door often became untracked. I was annoyed that no where in the room were the obligatory pad of paper and pen. I ended up removing a blank sheet of the New Testament when I needed to jot down a phone number. The telephone also lacked instructions for room to room calls and was not user-friendly. Also most of the furniture was glass topped. There were no paper coasters for the glass tumblers, so I ended up using a wash cloth. Three average size pillows sat atop my king bed. A bigger body pillow would have been nice. The hotel directory listed channel 41 to be the hotel channel--I found it to be the Discovery Channel on my flat screen. And you can't depend on the hotel satellite as signals come and go . Don't count on using the hotel internet either, as I had poor reception and instead used my own connection. The shower half-door has been mentioned in many reviews. It didn't bother me, but I was irked that housekeeping on two occasions did not replace the necessary floor mat needed to absorb the free-flowing water. I did like the natural light in the shower and the alcove for personal care products, but missed a bath fan. I did experience loud music on two occasions and it would have been more problematic if it had persisted later at night. Housekeeping was sporadic, particularly over the weekend. Bath product replenishment was haphazard--one fluid oz. of mouthwash provided for five night stay. And there was the bath mat that would come and go. I didn't realize my room was supposed to be stocked with two bottles of water until midway through my stay when they suddenly appeared, and upon departure I was billed $6.00 for bottles I hadn't consumed. By all means, make sure you visit the nearby Walgreens upon arrival. The hotel charges a ridiculous $12.99 for Benedryl and $3 for a muffin that can be bought in the expanded grocery section of Walgreens for at least half of that. I have learned from other reviews since my return not to use the concierge desk to book tours. I was mystified why the cost of a bio bay kayaking booked through the hotel was $85, when the brochure I got from the concierge clearly stated $45. Glad I declined. Must say I've been pretty critical of La Concha here, but there are positives. While the ocean is rough, the various infinity pools are very attractive. I also enjoyed a nice burger at a reasonable price at the poolside cafe. And there's the oft-mentioned bellman, Felix Perez, who's sure to leave you smiling.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel to stay at......”
Reviews.Author: Monkies76
Reviews.Content: There were a few snags with the hotel but not worth mentioning.. What I will mention is how good the staff is... Particularly Ismary Rivera. I cannot say enough about her... She is truly a gem, a genuinley nice, happy, personable person and she is what made our stay enjoyable. If you go to Solera Restaurant, please ask for her... You won't regret it!.. Thanks Ismary!!! Good luck with everything!!! By now you should be with LaConcha for about 2 months now...keep doin what your doin!!

Reviews.Title: “take me back!”
Reviews.Author: travels121586
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great trip to la concha resort. stayed in an ocean view room which was beautiful. the beach at la concha is not great, while beautiful, it is a little rough and not what i had imagined for this location based on photos. however, there are several gorgeous pools over looking the ocean to go to, and for our short stay that was perfect. food at the hotel is delicious, although pricey. i was on vacation so didnt mind paying for what i found to be delicious food. mojitos are my favorite drinks and the ones here are among the best i've ever had. the staff at this hotel is always smiling and very helpful. i didnt encounter a single unhappy person there! hotel is definitely more for a younger crowd as it can get a bit loud at night on the weekends, but if you're looking for nightlife, its great! would recommend la concha to anyone traveling to PR willing to spend a little bit of money for a lovely relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff, great view, okay room.”
Reviews.Author: toftsie
Reviews.Content: After reviewing the other hotels on trip advisor, this seemed like a safe bet that wouldn't break the bank (ritz)' was relatively new, and not next to the airport (noise). That's pretty much what it was. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Especially Felix. He helped us with our bags, directions, place to eat, then with our bags again when we had to add a couple to storage before our room was ready. The other bell boy was great too, worked after Felix, was, very helpful getting our bags, directions on where we were going, etc. Front desk too. Only real bummer was our room had a musty air conditioner smell. We had two beach front rooms, being a family of six. So we opened the balcony doors and listened to the waves all night and the ocean breeze while the room aired out. The view was great! Pool was nice, keep in mind, the surf here is really roughy. red flag both days we were here. It's about 20 bucks by taxi to the airport and 16 to Olde San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service- LOUD”
Reviews.Author: Annyuta
Reviews.Content: The good: Service was great Food was good Rooms were clean Centrally located The bad: SO loud and bustling! If you are looking for a relaxing break, this is not your choice. Parties every night, weddings, incredibly loud music and corporate conferences keep the place overly active. They even had a DJ by the pool Sunday afternoon. And the beach is nothing to write home about. Lastly, be mindful that the suites in the suite tower are kind of a waste of money, since the living room has no natural light and is kind of depressing. Also make sure you request an ocean room.

Reviews.Title: “All-Around Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrew B
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel. The Fall Promotion included a $25/day food and beverage credit. The room was awesome. Our view of the ocean and coastline was great, and the room itself was very clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. There was a big flat-screen TV, a fridge, and a small balcony. Food at the hotel is tasty, but a bit pricey (but the food & bev credit helped). There are restaurants across the street that are very reasonably priced and serve good food. Also nearby (within a 5-minute walk) are a Walgreens and a liquor store. The beach at the hotel is small-ish, but beautiful. The pools looked nice. I found all the service to be extremely friendly and reasonably prompt...both of which are rarities on other islands in this region. I think this hotel attracts a younger clientele, and may not be ideal for older folks and/or families. One Saturday night there was a large party at the hotel that involved music that was clearly audible from inside the room until about midnight. This wasn't a problem for me, and would be a plus for anyone interested in nightlife. The concierge desk was very helpful. At one point we wanted to do a tour of the bio bay at Fajardo (HIGHLY recommended), and the concierge offered to call several tour companies to find the best price. We got a very good deal and the tour was excellent. I've never encountered a concierge that was willing to do that before. The hotel is a $14 cab ride to Old San Juan, which is another must see. It's $15 by cab to the international airport. Overall I strongly recommend La Concha for a fun and exciting trip, and I recommend Puerto Rico as an ideal island vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mbagley
Reviews.Content: La Concha was beautiful. Not the typical looking hotel. We visited the other Marriott down the street and although very nice it looked like any other hotel. La Concha looked like it belongs in the tropics. The room was beautiful, the restaurants had excellent food and the service of the concierge was great. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel except for the maids”
Reviews.Author: hobokel
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Suite 769 this past weekend. I thought this hotel was beautiful, the staff friendly, and the grounds meticulously kept. The bed in the room was the most comfortable bed i've ever slept in. I only have one "con". Upon arrival (4:30am due to a bad flight), the attendant said that we would be upgraded to a suite. I thought this was awesome and highly appreciated it since we had the flight from hell. When we got to the room, we noticed that there was an opened can of iced tea on the counter and someone else's food left on the counter and in the fridge. The room was otherwise clean, but the opened food on the counter made me a little uneasy. Also, the maid never gave us new soaps nor threw out our garbage for our entire stay. We were only there for the weekend so i didn't really want to complain because they upgraded us to a suite, but really....the room should be clean without someone's left over food on the counter and their should be toiletries.. Thank god i brought my own. Other than that, I liked the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good with issues”
Reviews.Author: EdOverIp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha on 12/1 - 12/5. I am a Gold Elite member and got a free upgrade to a junior suite which was a huge plus. Pablo in the concierge lounge was a big help and gave us tons of great information. He even offered to take us to La Placita, unfortunately we were not able to take him up on his offer due to timing. Regardless, he is a great asset to elite members! Felize, bell hop, was great as well. He always has a great big smile and ready to offer directions and anything else we needed. If you are looking to party, look no further than La Concha. It was a giant party in the lobby every night that we were there. Our recommendation is to NOT fly out on Sunday morning because you will want to stay up late on Saturday. We did and it hurts oh so much to wake up early Sunday morning. As great as the hotel and their staff, we had two issues: - The house keeping was inconsistent. We got charged for 2 bottles of water that was never replaced from the previous guests' stay. We had a bathrobe gone missing after house keeping. One day we had one washcloth, next day we had none. Then most days we had a floor mat in front of the shower but one day we didn't. - The tour desks did not communicate sufficiently. We booked a bio-bay tour and was not told that we had to pay the vendor directly (most hotels just charge it to the room) and the price on the tour confirmation misrepresented the price of the tour. It said "$85" when it should have said "$85/person". None of the problems over shadowed the great things at the hotel but would have made our stay more enjoyable if we didn't have to watch out for the little things.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to start our vacation”
Reviews.Author: tigrrrl06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha at the end of November, as we arrived a day early in San Juan before departing on a cruise. As someone who works in hotels frequently, I wanted nothing to do with a typical business hotel, and we got exactly what we were looking for here. The hotel is very modern without feeling cold. We enjoyed the lunch we had poolside while we waited for our room to be ready, and they called just as promised. Our room on the 11th floor was spotless and the furniture was comfortable. We were also thrilled with the amazing view and the fact that the huge windows actually opened all the way up! The concierge staff were friendly and helpful in assisting us with making plans in Old San Juan for dinner. The doormen were able to get us taxis very quickly. The beach and pools were great for sunbathing and hanging out. We particularly reccommend the adults only pool area. Overall, we had a fantastic time at this property and would definitely return if we head back to San Juan in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just one word.......WOW!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WHR17
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in San Juan and after a horrible experience with American Airlines, this amazing hotel made us forget our worries in a hurry. We were in San Juan for my wife's birthday so they gave us a free room upgrade to a city view room. Keep in mind this hotel is were locals come to party and been seen. The lobby area is right next to the bar and main pool which basicly become a night club at night. We stayed in the new wing so the music did not bother us. There was alot of bars and clubs across the street so the loud music goes on well into the wee hours so if your a light sleeper you may want to get an ocean view room to avoid the noise. 3 pool areas the main pool in front of the original hotel and 2 infinity pools facing the ocean. The infinity pool in front of the new wing is absoluted desserted at night so we had it to ourselves and after a full day walking around old San Juan it was great. The beach was never crowded but it was a bit rough, so watch the little ones when they are in the water. The resturants in the hotel are a bit pricey but there are plenty of cheaper alternatives within walking distance. The public buse system has a stop right in front of the hotel just be sure to have exact .75 change. Taxi rides to Old San Juan will run you about $14 but the buse is alot more fun. Stephanie at the front desk was a huge help, she helped us reserve a trip to the rain forest (a must see). She also helped up plan a full day in Old San Juan and when we did have a minor problem with our room Jose the manager more than took care of us!!! I can't say enough nice things about the wonderful staff, they really made us feel special. Old San Juan is amazing and the old forts are amazing, just be ready to walk around alot so bring comforatble shoes and plenty of sunscreen and a camera with extra memory cards. Once in Old San Juan there is a free shuttle service that stops at all the major sites, so if your not up for walking its a good option (except on Sunday when they move at a snails pace). We really had a great time and would highly recommend San Juan and this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best 4 nights ever!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty800
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to get away for 4 nights by ourselves during Thanksgiving week. We had never been to San Juan, but we thought we would try Puerto Rico as we could get a direct flight there from Chicago. Being a Platinum Elite member with Marriott, I will always try to stay at one of their properties. La Concha looked very inviting to us and the rates were so fantastic, I elected to save my points. I have to say this: This hotel was FANTASTIC for a number of reasons. We had a Junior suite on the 10th floor overlooking the ocean. We kept the floor-to-ceiling glass doors open all night as we slept. With temperatures of 75 degrees in the evening and a beautiful breeze, I had the best sleep ever. Great room and decor - no problems here. The weather was consistant and the food great everywhere, including the hotel. We had access to the Ocean Lounge and if you are a Platinum or Gold Elite member, you will not encounter a finer lounge at any Marriott property. This is on the main level of the hotel with floor to ceiling glass over-looking the ocean and the best breakfast and evening snacks I have ever had in a Concierge Lounge. However, the absolute best part of La Concha is the staff. I have never written a Tripadvisor review, but I felt compelled to do so now. Jose Cepero, the front desk manager was extremely helpful. Michael Tischler, the Ocean Lounge manager and Pablo Rivera, the night time manager, were both extremely engaging and made us feel very welcome. Pablo had suggested a day trip to the rain forest as well as a trip to Guavate for roasted pork. He even gave us his cell number if we needed help. I looked forward to speaking to these folks every day. The manager of Perla Restaurant, Ernie Hernandez, made us feel special as well. We met him sitting at the bar of the restaurant and we became engaged in great conversation over a glass of wine. These are examples of people who truly love what they do. The Marriott is a few blocks away and we took a walk to check out this hotel. It appeared very nice, but I was much happier with our choice. The open air and modern feel of La Concha, as well as the staff, could not be beat. After never really considering San Juan as a vacation spot for us, I cannot wait to return. We will stay at La Concha next Thansgiving and I will bring my entire family.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in san juan”
Reviews.Author: solotravelor
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 day stay here and i can't begin to tell you how much of a class hotel this is! From the moment we got there until our departure, everyone and everything was excellent. If you go, please look up Felix Pere, the doorman. He is so helpful and happy to assist you. The casino was the only part we didn't really care for.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you don't care nobody responsible for anything”
Reviews.Author: AlSch123
