Reviews.Content: Stay away unless you don't care nobody responsible for anything. While there is glomorous decor and happy reception guys, it has nothing to do with touteous management of the hotel. When we left our goods in the room, we had to call them for four days until we stopped after that personally to reveal even more. First, we were not provided with the procedure to obtain the loss report filled. After calling they lied that the room was not cleaned the same day and they don't know if they found the goods in the room. After that general manager didn't returned our calls. After we appeared personally at the reception, they gave us a guy, who was chief, who didn't speak english. They didn't know who cleaned the room, whether they found our goods or not. They don't know nothing. Unless you don't care that nobody responsible for anything at that place, stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: smg1116
Reviews.Content: My partner and I picked LaConcha after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and other travel booking sites. Many of the reviews were spot on. The hotel looks just like it does in the photos. It is very clean, modern, and the outdoor area is lush. We stayed in a suite in the ocean tower. I would recommend it. The hotel has one hot tub and 4 pools: a main pool, a pool above the main pool that cascades down into the main pool, a beachside pool, and an adults only infinity pool. Although we were told that the hotel was close to full capacity, I never considered the pool and beach areas to be overcrowded. I only saw a handful of families with young children, the majority were adults and some families with teenage children. My partner and I are young (26, 28) with no children and we appreciated the upscale enviorment. We did have two small problems while we were there. We had a suite w/ocean views booked and pre-paid from Orbitz. When we arrived they had us as a deluxe room. After only an hour 1/2 they moved us to a suite, but it had city views (not what we paid for) and it took them several hours to get us into the correct room. This was a mild inconvienence as we wanted to unpack, change into our bathing suits and head out to the pool immediately and could not. We were stuck outside in our too-warm-for-PR travel clothes. We may have asked for our bags and changed in the lobby bathroom, but they kept telling us our room would be ready shortly--so we had no idea how long it would take. By 6-7pm we were finally in our room but since we got to the hotel at 12, I felt like we had wasted a day. My suggestion is to call ahead and double check the day before you travel to make sure they have your correct room reservation. The other problem we had was with booking a trip to the biobay through the hotel. The conceirge on duty, Stephanie, gave me a printout with everything I needed to know about the trip, including price and pick up location. We were at the pick up location 15 min early and the driver for the trip came an hour and a half late! Then halfway though the trip he asked us for the $85 (the trip's cost) , but the print out from our hotel said $45 so we were quite surprised! When we showed it to him, he yelled at us and threatened to leave us in the middle of nowhere! We had no choice but to pay the $85 a person (thank God we brought extra cash). The bio bay was beautiful. I would recommend it to everyone but do not book it through the hotel company (E&D) instead use one of the many other companies on Tripadvisor. The manager on duty that night Denisse was very helpful. She appologized for the room mix up the previous day and the biobay fiasco. She gave us breakfast buffet vouchers for Level 25 for the remainder of our stay and a $60 gift card for Solara, the hotel's outdoor restaurant. All in all, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like a noisy bar scene”
Reviews.Author: DJK81
Reviews.Content: We were here for a few days and enjoyed our stay. The bar area is hopping every night and quite noisy. If you like that kind of atmosphere -- and many do -- this is your place to stay in San Juan. If not, you may not like this hotel. It seems like a place that young people would enjoy. There were many young people hanging out in the lobby bar. The rooms are nice and I found the service to be very good. Much of the furnishings in the lobby and the room do not have conventional "backs" to the chairs, stools and even sofas. Both my wife and I were not comfortable sitting in them. We only ate in the outdoor restaurant near the pool. OK, but nothing special. The pool area is nice and we also spent time on the beach. We did enjoy sitting in the spacious lobby in the morning and at times during the day and evening. If you are a nightlife person, I think you would appreciate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Take me back to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: buzbom21
Reviews.Content: My spouse and two children, 4 and 9 spent 3 nights at La Concha before a Caribbean Cruise the week before Thanksgiving. I can't say anything bad about this place, except that the food is expensive. (Oh, and they forgot to tell us that our $25 nightly credit had to be used daily or it disappered!) The hotel is clean, fresh, modern, with beautiful marble as far as the eye can see. The new suite tower is PERFECT for families...we had a king bed in one room, a bathroom in between and a couch bed for the kids in a separate room. We didn't have an ocean view, but spent LOTS of time on the balcony watching the action up and down Ashford. The bathroom was big and modern, though it lacked a tub. The room had a neat little kitchen, so you could do breakfast or snacks, perfect for kids! The pools were cool and the hot tubs clean, and the waves on the beach were amazing...lots of surfers congregate there. The pool attendants were very polite and you could grab a dry towel and a cup of cold lemon-infused water as often as you desired. Our favorite place to eat was the Sidewalk Cafe, where the homemade soups and wraps were delicious and reasonably priced. The staff at the Cafe was very friendly as well. We met the infamous Felix the night before we checked out, and he did not disappoint! Wish we had met him earlier. DH made very god use of the casinos, unfortunately! I think one of the most memorable things for us was meeting Zugeil (don't think I spelled that right) at the concierge desk! She was one of the most warm, lovely ladies we've ever met anywhere!!! She made so many calls and pulled strings for us all over town!!!!! She even offered to make cupcakes for my daughter. She was simply amazing!!!!!! We love you Zugeil!

Reviews.Title: “Living in La Concha for 9 weeks”
Reviews.Author: Jdfbu96
Reviews.Content: I lived in La Concha for nine weeks and have a very good feeling about and knlwledge of the entire hotel. Starting with the parking valets, Felix, was outstanding, helpful, and very cheery every single morning as I headed to work in San Juan. So was Jose, of the parking staff. Sometimes there was a delay in the valet parking, but it was fixed halfway during my stay. Monica, at the front desk, was especially helpful on many occasions. The breakfast room attendants of the Ocean room, and Level 25, and cocktail hour personel, Pablo Rivera, Luis Perez, Christine Birriel, Indhira Payano, Pamela, Josian, all made me feel at home.When my wife joined me they welcomed her like a member of the hotel family. Service was excellent, and the hospitality and warmth- that we Puerto Ricans are known for- was on full display Jose Casanova, the Rooms Sales Manager, went above and beyond the call of duty to get me the rooms I preferred, and never said no to any requests. I was lucky enough to be the first hotel guest in a room in th new tower with a view and balcony to die for. I asked for it on each subsequent stay and was granted the request. The hotel staff is run by a manager I wish I had met, Luis Rivera, and it is a world class destination. John David

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, very attentive”
Reviews.Author: koala46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fun, bright, and edgy. The staff is extremely warm and attentive. They were so friendly. They made our stay great. The rooms are spacious and decorated in minimalist chic and very clean. Bathrooms are spacious. And the water front rooms have amazing views!

Reviews.Title: “The oceanview suite was comfortable, posh, and we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: MarknSue1977
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights at the La Concha and it was a positive experience. The room was a very nice suite with a separate living room and bedroom that also had a balcony right on top of the beach. The room was clean and the kitchenette was practical. Nice fridge with freezer. The location was within safe walking distance to restaraunts, convenience stores and most anything you might want while on vacation. Food available in the hotel was very good but was a bit pricey. Casino was very clean and non-smoking which was a pleasant suprise. Puerto Rico has much to offer and the Candado location is a good departure point. Multiple pools that cater to different customer bases (including adults only) is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at a great price”
Reviews.Author: madame2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a package with airfare and hotel through Priceline. It was a great rate. I booked the least expensive room and when I checked in, showed my Marriott card and hoped for an upgrade. We were originally given a great room with a view of a construction site. I asked again and was given a junior suite with a balcony right on the ocean. It was an amazing view and I could have spent the whole time just sitting on that balcony. We were in walking distance of great Condado restaurants and there was a bus stop right in front of the hotel. It was 75 cents to take the bus to Old San Juan. Eveyrone was very helpful and friendly. We booked a tour to El Yunque and Luquillo Beach which was great. The beach has some waves but is fun. The infinity pool was beautiful. We had a great vacation at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to do in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ape-a-dape
Reviews.Content: My wife, our two girlfriends and myself stayed at La Concha Hotel for 4 nights and did not have enough time to accomplish everything. Things about the hotel that were a plus: Modern, cool, breezy rooms were a nice touch compared to the normal "Downtown Marriott room style." The bathroom shower was spacious and stayed hot for extended periods of time through out the day. The room and beach balcony are small quarters in la concha's standard room for four people. The hotel is located just outside of San Juan in a slower more up beat area. The Hotel is approximately 2.5 miles from Old San Juan. Cabs are of plenty in front of the hotel that can take you over the bridge into Jan Juan. There are plenty of outside amenities in the area. My former college roommate now living in the same city of Condado, PR. We were spent after each day of non stop activities many in which the hotel concierge can set up for you. Be warned that the hotel rates for these amazing excursions are at a premium. My friend was able to call individual places making scheduling more geared for our plans. I recommend renting a car two days of a four day trip. 2/3 of a day spent at El Yunque national rain forest. Look for car turn offs from the one road that leads into the forest. There you should find swimming holes in the natural spring waterways many with waterfalls. Have you bathing suit and a towel and other survival gear. Many people frequent the area to loot and pillage tourist. The day we traveled to the rain forest that is 45 minutes away, on the mountain we were trapped on the road side for police activity. My Puerto Rican friend was able to get from the cops that the road was closed for forensics, two locals tried to rob a guy. It turned out the guy was a navel seal on leave with his two other seal buddies. While at the rain forest plan to kayak in the bio luminescent estuaries. Take the ferry from port #2 in San Juan on the other side catch a cab to The Bacardi factory and headquarters. It is free to enter, take the tour get drinks at the outdoor pavilion bar. Its a great morning activity. Its $5 cab ride to the ferry, 50 cent one way ticket on the ferry, and a $4 cab ride from the waters edge to the factory. Their is a guided tour, you can upload your own video at the tour end and email it to people, so have your contact available. When you return to San Juan there are many street side and sidewalk dining options. we found a small 4 table restaurant for lunch. The night life at the hotel is great as well as the near by walking distances places. My friend actually frequents the lobby bar on Friday nights for its crowd of people. There are multiple small bars across the street from the hotel and a couple more one block down. The weekends in San Juan clubs and bars is crazy. And the weekdays are more laid back and not as busy. While there for 4 days I ran into on television entertainer and a former NBA hoopster. The multiple pool decks and two infinity pools it was nice. The beach was about 50 meters long. one of the days on the beach you could not swim in the water at that location. It is a cove that attracts and collects a lot of water vegetation. Even if there were not posted signed stating you can not swim, you wouldn't want to get more than ankle deep. There is serious erosion to the beach just in front of the hotel. In fact the waves were crashing into the building at one time. IF you walk the beach east for about a half mile there is a wind surfing area. The sushi in Condado is excellent and recommend. Also ask around for a good place to get seafood Mofongo. There is so much more to do, sightseeing and adventuring.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth. Not only the hotel, but the people!!”
Reviews.Author: rinkernut
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. Just spent 5 days with my wife at La Concha Resort and could not have been happier. We have stayed at many Rennaissance Resorts all over the USA but this by far, blows them all away. The staff was unbelievable. Always happy to help, super friendly. Ate at La Perla (Five Course Tasting) and the food there was masterful! Thanks so much to Jose Torres! He is like family to us now! So many people went out of their way to help us find the right things to do, where to go, and how to get there, I could not recommend this any more then a perfect 10! Thanks to NefDavid, Manuel, Louis, Jose, Ricardo and so many others for giving us a vacation of a lifetime. We will be back! The sooner the better!!

Reviews.Title: “The employees make a beautiful hotel even better!”
Reviews.Author: joybel99
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at La Concha since the middle of August, 2010 because my husband has been working in Puerto Rico. Every few weeks we go home and then return here. Upon arrival, we are greeted by Felix with a huge "welcome back". Just walking around the hotel, every employee asks if everything is good or if you need anything. I must make mention of the wonderful men and women who work in the Ocean Lounge--Michael Tischler, Pablo Rivera, Janissa Colon, Christine Bimel, Pamela Reyes, Indhira Payano, and Luis Perez. They make everyone here feel so welcome. Can't wait to return after Thanksgiving! Joyce

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Juan, Felix was the best Valet in town!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenmarieanders
Reviews.Content: La Concha, was a beautiful resort with easy beach access and lots of pool space!! Very nice fitness center. Nice and very friendly staff!!! Felix is the best Valet in San Juan, PR. He is always smiling and has great advice on the best places to go in San Juan!!! The hotel lounge/bar is the best around town. Keep your eyes open you may run into someone famous!!! I will definitely come back to San Juan and I will stay at La Concha Resort.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, great service, lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: rehabocaratonflorida
Reviews.Content: my husband and i truly enjoyed our mini vacation at the la concha, the ocean lounge was a great midafternoon and evening time to relax, the service was wonderful mr tischler was a great host and saw to our every needs

Reviews.Title: “The Most Phenomenal Vacation Experience you will experience at ANY hotel, in EVERY way”
Reviews.Author: lbp_mbp
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived for our 1st Year anniversary, we knew this was going to be an experience of a lifetime. All of the staff were so nice to us and very accommodating. The hotel location was perfect, the room was absolutely amazing and the hotel experience really made our 1st anniversary SPECIAL. The hotel concept and setup was GREAT. The hotel atmosphere made us not want to leave the hotel. Two people in particular stuck in our minds and will never be forgotten....Roger Ritch (Bellman) and Victor Rodriguez (Concierge). Roger went out of his way to make us feel special and provided us with great places to eat and enjoy ourselves while we were in San Juan. Victor provided us with so much history about San Juan, recommended 2-3 excursions that proved to be everything and more....and followed up with us to make sure we made the most of our trip. I travel with my job every week and can honestly say that I have never stayed in such a beautiful hotel and experienced a staff like LaConcha. We visited San Juan about 3 years ago and stayed in another hotel. That experience could not even come close to comparing to LaConcha. If you come to San Juan and decide to stay at LaConcha, you will have the experience of a lifetime. If you decide to stay anywhere else, you'll regret it....GUARANTEED! Extreme thanks to Roger, Victor, Orlando and all of the LaConcha staff for making our 1st anniversary UNFORGETTABLE!! We cannot wait to get the opportunity to return to LaConcha. Monique and Lucien Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: alyssacm
Reviews.Content: We cashed in some Marriott points to stay at La Concha for two nights for our one year anniversary and were so happy we did. It is a beautiful, modern, Miami-esque hotel with a vibrant bar and great pool. The beach area is small but nice and worked just fine for us. The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Being Gold Members we had access to the lounge for snacks, drinks etc which is a nice touch. While we were there we saw Darryl Strawberry and Pedro Martinez, which pretty much validates that this is one of the nicest places to stay in San Juan. Reasons it is not four stars: We had a guaranteed King but arrived to a queen. Were told there were not kings left. Ok. We also requested a late check out and were told too many people had already put in requests. Part of the Marriott Gold Program guarantees you a late check out and your requested bed type. Also, the door to our room was above the pool grill so we always walked in an out to the smell of grilled beef. Oh well, we'd still come back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trip”
Reviews.Author: britabroad1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha with my girlfriend for 10 nights, our first time in PR and staying in a Renaissance. We loved the hotel, it was very trendy and looked great. I booked using Marriott points and was upgraded to an ocean view room in the suite tower. The room was great and had a separate living area and bedroom. From the balcony approx the left 30 degrees was a sea view, the buildings in front weren't the most appealing to the eye. As a Marriott Platinum member, we could take advantage of the lounge. The breakfast was OK and they also served some food and free soft drinks early evening. Big shout out to Paulo in the lounge who was fantastic in giving us advice and great service and Pamela who told us some good places to go. The infinity pool outside the suite tower is very nice and then just a few steps down you have the beach. It isn't very big but when it was as quiet as when we were there this was ideal. There are waves in the sea but they were just about the right size to enjoy. There are guys on hand with towers, chairs etc. We spent most of the time at the beach so didn't spend any time in the pool area which was also look great. I would like to recommend Ropa Vieja, which is a 10min walk to the right (as you're coming out of the hotel) - they do great Puerto Rican food, great services and their prices aren't too bad. Apart from breakfast, we didn't eat at the hotel as the prices are a bit too high for our budget. If you walk around Condado there are some nice restaurants. Opposite the Marriott Stellaris is a restaurant with a big happy hour sign (between 4-7) that do great sangria. On our last night we had a cocktail in the lobby ($12) but it was very nice. The rainforest is worth a visit, there is a waterfall that you can swim in at the bottom. Go to Old San Juan and take the free trolley around the city and then wander around the forts. We were pleasantly surprised at Tijuana's on the waterfront, our server was great, loved the food, it was reasonably priced and we had a table overlooking the harbour. There is also a Ben and Jerry's ice cream parlour with a very nice owner. We were bowled over by how friendly everyone in PR was. There is a high police presence in the tourist areas and we felt safe all the time. Service was great everywhere we went. People would see us taking pictures and stop to take one for us. We were worried before we travelled that rain was forecast every day but this usually only lasted for an hour or two. One night at the hotel, we were (randomly) treated to a room delivery service of strawberries covered in chocolate, they were delicious and a really nice treat that made us feel special. Overall a great trip and a fantastic hotel. Definitely on the list to come back to!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: waterfall789
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met my in-laws in Puerto Rico (we live in NYC and they in Boca Raton) and stayed at the lovely La Concha hotel. Although the weather was mostly unpleasant during our stay, we were fortunate enough to enjoy the use of the Ocean Lounge and find it necessary to comment on the staff there. The day shift; Christine Birriel, Luis Perez and Janissa Colon greeted us each morning with a bright smile and a friendly hello. They were attentive and accommodating and were quick to insure our coffee and breakfast were most enjoyable. It was our pleasure to begin each day with individuals who were genuinely happy to start their day with us. The evening shift; Indhira Payano, Pamela Reyes and Pablo Rivera could not do enough to make us feel more comfortable and welcome. The evenings were more active and the staff made sure the guests did not lack for attention or service. Mr. Rivera spread himself across the Lounge as if he were two people; attentive to guests celebrating a birthday while insisting service did not lack elsewhere. Staff of this caliber cannot be found in all resorts and not without strong leadership. Mr. Michael Tischler must be commended for the smooth and efficient operation of the Ocean Lounge. My wife and I hope to return to La Concha in the near future to enjoy Puerto Rico, its awesome weather and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrific service.”
Reviews.Author: CanuckLLB
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Puerto Rico and we enjoyed a wonderful 4-night stay at La Concha Resort. A modern, elegant (but not over-the-top) hotel with decent amenities and overall a very good value. We found the service to be exceptionally good for the level of hotel. The pool area is very nice - and not overcrowded - at least not while we were there. The beach was also nicer than expected. A very nice meal in a gorgeous setting at Perla... although not inexpensive. A special thanks to Ricardo at the front door who helped guide us to many fine meals in and around town. Great job - La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: msbrown76
Reviews.Content: This was our first time going to PR, so we weren't quite sure about where to stay (the city or the beach). My choices were the Marriott or the Renaissance. I was told both were nice, but the Renaissance was more for couples, which was what we wanted. When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted by the nicest bellman. Actually, they were all very nice, but this one in particular, had recently moved there from MD, and he was really friendly and gave us great info. The outdoor lobby area was very nice; lots of water flowing and beautiful landscaping. When we went inside, we noticed the Casino to the left. The indoor lobby was decorated very nicely, and once again we were greeted by a very friendly concierge. We were offered champagne, while we waited, which was a nice touch. I scanned the lobby and was taken aback by how beautiful everything was. I couldn't wait to get upstairs, change, and get back down to the pool area. The room was very nice. I've had better at the Renaissance, but it was clean, well decorated, and comfortable. The bathroom was a little small for my taste, but it worked fine. I loved the blue light in the shower too. We got a room on the 11th floor and the view was breathtaking. At night, we slept with the balcony door open so we could hear the waves. It was amazing. From the bed, all you could see was miles and miles of ocean. I felt like I was on a cruise. Also, the air conditioner cuts off whenever you open the balcony door, which was perfect. There were 3 infinity pools. The pool areas had a little more greenery than I need, but it was beautiful. I take it people don't do a lot of swimming here, but more lounging and wading. The grill/bar area outside was great. The food was pricey, but the drinks were very good. We had long island iced teas, which were not too strong, but had a good kick. I also had the best Patron magarita, which kept me tipsy for a good 6 hours. I think she put Grand Marnier or something in it. I wish I had gotten her name and that recipe! I had the chicken avocado sandwich, which was very tasty. The menu is limited, but they will be flexible and try to make you something not on the menu, if they can. There's also a sushi bar, and 2 restaurants (Perla and Level 25). We ate at Level 25 for breakfast, which was pretty good. The area itself is tricky. When you come out of the hotel (facing Subway), to the left are the other hotels and a somewhat seedy area. There are police on every corner, but I think that worried me more because I'm not used to that. There's also a Dunkin Donuts, Baskin Robbins, Haagen Dazs, Walgreens, Starbucks, and a few small restaurants and gift shops. We ate at Orozco's once. I wasn't impressed with the food, but happy hour was from 4 to 11, so that helped. To the right were Gucci, Louis Vuitton, Ferragamo, Cartier, etc. There was also a Cold Stone and some other restaurants, further down. Old San Juan is about a 5-10 minute drive and the airport is about a 10 minute drive. There is no action in the Condado beach area...just the beach and whatever parties the hotels may be having. Old San Juan was a great place to go to shop and sight see. Definitely visit Latin Roots for salsa dancing. The cab prices are set, no meters...so have cash. The ride from the airport was $17 and the ride to Old San Juan was $14. One lady said they charged her and her friend $18 per person to go to the mall (I think it was Plaza de las Americas, or something like that). We skipped that trip. The casino was cool, but very small. We gambled about $20-30 away and that was it. The beach was small, but very nice and relaxing. The tides were a little high because of hurricane season, but the weather could not have been better. I think we had 85-90 degrees the entire time, and we had a small sprinkle for a few minutes, but that was it. The worst part of the hotel would be the super slow elevators. Most of the time, only 1 of the 3 was working, so they were always crowded. Also, on our last night, we got a few mosquitoes in the room, but we got rid of them. Needless to say, we didn't open our door that night, for fear we'd be invaded by morning. And beware of all the pigeons...they seem to be everywhere. I almost thought I was in NYC. Condado Beach still has a lot of rebuilding to do, but in a few years I can definitely see it being a new South Beach. We are definitely planning on going back to PR, but my hubby wants to stay downtown. I think I'm already too spoiled to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better Than We Anticipated, And We Anticipated A Great Deal!!”
Reviews.Author: sjr27
Reviews.Content: Based upon so many Trip Advisor reviews that rated this hotel so highly, we had high expectations for our 5-night stay. Our expectations were more than met, and then some!! The hotel is lovely, with a light and airy feeling that contributes to one's relaxation and general well-being. We were told that the hotel was at capacity, and yet we never sensed lots of people. The beach is great, and so are the pools. The lobby bar is terrific; head bartender Manuel REALLY knows how to make a drink, whatever that drink might be! We loved our room, with its full ocean view, and the general staff goes out of its way to make sure that guests are content. We cannot wait to return, and we hope to do so very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: chooz2cruz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before and one night after our cruise. As a Platinum rewards member, we were treated wonderfully. We were able to check into our room on both occassions before noon. That was great. On departure day we also were able to have a very late check out, as our flight was not until 6pm. The hotel is beautiful. We booked a one bedroom oceanview suite on a high floor. We we very happy to have that fulfilled. We did not have any issues with noise. The ocean lounge for elite rewards guests was very nice. Although it would have been nice to have some type of snacks available in the afternoon. They served a nice breakfast and evening dinner. One of the days, they had had a problem with electric in the elite lounge, so they gave us vouchers for the breakfast Buffet at Level 25. That was very nice. It is a $25 pp brunch style buffet that includes unlimited mimosas. If only we could have taken more advantage of that. We were not very hungry. The staff is very friendly everywhere on the property. The beach is very nice, with lounge chairs and umbrellas available without a fee. The pool areas are very nice with very comfortable lounges. As a matter of fact, all areas of the resort has very inviting seating. There is a very soothing atrium area. We did not eat at the resort outside the elite lounge, but did find a very nice little cafe a few doors down. We were recommended this by Felix at the door. We wanted something healthy and light. "Pure and Natural" was the perfect place. Very healthy, natural, foods. DELICIOUS! They have salads, wraps, full p[lates of great interesting foods. They slow roast turkey everyday, and it is fantastic in their salads and sandwichs. Wholesome breads and wraps. We even ordered great mediterranean style sandwiches for our plane ride home. I would highly recommend this resort, and will plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame...”
Reviews.Author: VipB
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am aware that my experience appears to be an atypical experience. However, I have to call it like I see it. I was attending a party at the hotel (local resident). As a surprise birthday gift for my girlfriend I decided to make a reservation for the night of the party. When I was checking in I was given a $25 food and beverage certificate to be used at the hotel. However, a minute later that certificate was taken away from when the check in staff member realized my reservation did not include such a certificate. I was not happy about having the certificate taken away like that, but that was not a huge issue by itself. As a Marriott Platinum Member, I was upgraded to a room on the PH floor with an amazing ocean view and was told that breakfast would be served the next morning at the elite membersâ€™ Ocean Lounge. Later that evening I suddenly realized that there were over 25 mosquitoes on the ceiling. I called the front desk to inform of the situation and ask for a room change. About ten minutes later I was already in my new room, which was on the same floor but a little more worn down. When we returned to our room after the party at about 2:15 a.m. we realized that the party music could be clearly heard at the room, notwithstanding that our room was on the 12th floor! This made it very hard to fall asleep. The next morning I was awoken by sunlight at 7:00 a.m. because the curtains do not completely shut out the sunlight. Even 2 star hotels have curtains that shut out the sun completely. Furthermore, the curtains even had a hole in the middle! Later that morning I called the front desk to verify until what time breakfast was served at the elite membersâ€™ Ocean Lounge. Nonetheless, much to my surprise considering what I had been told when I checked in, I was told that the elite membersâ€™ Ocean Lounge was closed on Saturdays. By now I was completely disappointed with our stay, but the worst was yet to come. When I checked out I was asked how my stay went and I was very honest explaining everything that had happened. However, the front desk employee did not really seem to care about the problems I experienced and definitely did not do anything about it. I proceeded to request my car at the valet. When they brought the car (owned by me, not a rental), the car was completely covered in bird feces and feathers. Furthermore, one of the tires was covered in yellow paint. After having to spend 50 minutes waiting for a â€œParking Incident Reportâ€� to be completed, the only thing the hotel did for me was reimburse the $20 valet parking fee (wax and car washing expenses afterwards totaled $70). I am still awaiting further resolution. Itâ€™s a shame because this is a beautiful hotel, with a great location. If you are a Marriott Rewards member I suggest you stay at the Marriott which is only a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort and Services”
Reviews.Author: ScottLPR
Reviews.Content: This resort was fantastic! We were there to celebrate a birthday for a 3 day stay and the service, the rooms, the food was all fantastic. I had also called prior to arrival to have a number of things done and Liouse, I think that was her name, handled everything exactly the way I wanted it. There was a doorman who was also very helpful I believe his name was Ricardo Lopez and he too went above and beyond the call of duty helping us a number of times with questions we had on where to go and what to do. We could not have asked for a better experience and we will return soon! I highly recommend La Choncha Resort the service was the best in Puerto Rico! Even better than the Ritz Hotel which we have also stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “"Business trip", shhh, seems like a vacation paradise to me”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Cove_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago I returned to San Juan for business and some how managed to "suffer" through another fabulous visit to the beach-side oasis called La Concha... I stayed here about a year ago and I can't compliment this place enough! This maybe the best trained staff on the island and I have stayed at each of the top 5 hotels on the island over the past many years (yes, I dare say even the service at the Ritz is rivaled here). My 10th floor suite in La Concha Towers opened onto a nice terrace and looked out to the ocean and down to the long private beach below. Dual flat screens, a sleek living and dining area with kitchenette, large and extremely comfy bed, big closet and inviting heavy glass shower coupled with rain-shower-head made for a terrific space to spend a few days. Check-in was utterly painless, not unlike some other top insland hotels, and there is that instantly cool vibe of the lobby bar with those beautiful people and both pool and ocean beckoning you to part take. When I arrived Sunday I dined pool-side and it is quite a calming and special setting there with the main pool's evening lights cycling thorugh a spectrum of sea-foam green color to almost permanganate (there's an upper pool kinda of an adults only area) and the ever-present "Cocqui" churping almost in rhythm with the music that made the Don Q Cuba-Libres all the more quenching. Lush tropical planting hide day-beds that are spread out around the poll area. For dins I had the duck quesadilla followed by Latin Sliders (three tasty burgs with blue cheese, garlic aoili and carmelized onions) which were a perfect combo... I asked for some Jicama slaw on the size so could claim I had my ruffage. The breakfasts were solid, coffee is yummy but my only complaint is bacon. Bacon, you say, well yes, is there anyone on PR who serves great bacon? Between work and meeting I hit the beach and it was uncrowded, peaceful and soft-sanded. Everything was terrific here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , Great people....”
Reviews.Author: teddoalex
Reviews.Content: First time in Puerto Rico.... A quick ride from the airport to the hotel..... Busy Friday afternoon, door man (Felix) Bell man (Luis) were very comforting and welcoming... Front Desk experience wasnt that bad either..... They probably had a busy Thursday as far as checkout as our rooms weren't ready when we got there around 4 pm The wait was worth it as we were upgraded to a sweet and an Ocean front room.. Outspoken front desk staff made the check-in process seemless. Room cleanliness is impecable... nothing to comment about .. from the bathroom amenities to the ipod dock next to our bed.... wonderful. I must say i wasnt too impressed with the servers and the bartenders by the bar during the DAY TIME... service was somewhat slow... took their time in the world to get your order.... During our stay, we decided to envolve ourselves in some tours and touched base with the concierge. I must tell you that "Christina" at the concierge desk went above and beyond to explain each and every detail as well as contact the rental car company to come pick us up. All of that with a genuine smile that never left her face. Just like to say thank you..... "Daniel" by the Pool bar was very sociable and good at what he did..... Was always paying attention to the small details and anticipated our needs like no other. One thing that really impressed me was the fact that our room was located 2 levels up infront of the pool where there is constant music until 3 - 4 am in the morning which would make you think of sleeping being impossible. Their sound proof doors and walls make your day and night an as quiet as it can ever be.... Perfectly thought of.... Had a little stroll to the Marriott Stellaris a couple of blocks away and LA Concha was by far better in every aspect of the property..... La Concha is more for the younger crowd.... if you want a little laid back and quiet place to be the Marriott would be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort! I did not want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: tabasco_darling
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha from 10/23-10/26 and boy was I glad I did not listen to all the negative reviews! The Room: When I checked in, the clerk said, "Oh, you got a really good room!" She was SO right! i was on the12th floor, overlooking the ocean. The view was really nice and the breeze coming off the ocean was so nice that I hardly used the room A/C, I just left the glass sliding door open. The room was also very clean and the bathroom well maintained. there is free wifi, but its a little spotty. NOTE: If sharing a room with friends, the shower portion does not have a door, just a clear slab of glass separating it from the toilet. Hotel Grounds: Everything was really easy to get to and the elevators are really fast. There were tons of beds, lounges, and chairs for you to sit poolside or on the beach. I dont know how crowded the hotel normally gets (didnt seem crowded during my stay) but there were many people enjoying the lounges with many still available. I liked that there was not another charge for a cabana or bed, unlike some resorts. Also, the pool areas are 24 hours. I went down by the Infinity pool at 11pm, and watched the waves. There was a security guard in the area the whole time. Food: Yes, the food is expensive. I had breakfast at Level 25, and it was pricey, but very good. I did not go to the other restaurants. There are local spots nearby with awesome food at great prices. I would recommend Waiters Bar & Grill, which is a 5 minute walk down Ashford Avenue. (Looks like a dive bar, but has great food, drinks, and music) Staff: Everyone was really friendly and helpful. For those worried about a language barrier, dont be. Everyone spoke and understood English. But if you want to practice your Spanish, go for it! Nightlife: The lobby bar was nice, but in my opinion, did not turn into a hotspot at night. I went downstairs at 11pm on Saturday, and people were sitting and talking. No one was dancing and it certainly was not loud. Perhaps I went too early? There are other bars on Ashford and even a pool hall down by Walgreens. The casino was small and the machines had very little payback. Youre better off spending your money at one of the local bars. By the end of my stay, I did not want to leave and am already planning my next trip back! PS. If going to PR, book an adventure with EcoQuest tours. They pick you up from the hotel and we took a full day trip in Caguas. See my review on their page.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: MegaWat0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for 1 night prior to a cruise. It is pretty close to the ship terminal and cabs are easy to get. The hotel has great rooms, great beds and updated bathrooms! Their beach/pool area is very relaxing. My favorite part was the incredible bar in the lobby -- it really pops at night! If you want to save a few bucks on nightlife or food, walk directly across the street, I forget the name of the bar/restaurant but it is great and crowded ... very inexpensive! Also, Subway is right there too :)

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place in PR”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler17
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay with my spouse and we had a fantastic time at La Concha. Upon arrival we were warmly greeted which was a very nice start to our vacation. We were a few hours early but a room was found and we were able to check-in. The hotel lobby was impressive, very open, hip and had a good island feel. The room was clean, comfortable and had floor to ceiling windows allowing a full ocean view. We loved opening up the windows and listening to the waves. The bed was really comfortable, we slept very well. Bathroom was fine and shower pressure was ok. Overall decor of the room was modern tropical. The pools at La Concha were fantastic with a few infinity pools including an adults only pool. The jacuzzi was also nice. There were plenty of chairs and different spots to relax including an area with outdoor beds and couches to take a nap in. The beach was great too, just the right amount of waves. We used the fitness room which had a nice variety of machines, treadmills and weights so no complaints there. Nightlife was good, we spent parts of each evening at the lobby bar and one night at the ouside restaurant having snacks and a beer while lounging on comfortable couches. The casino was fine, not huge but with a good variety of machines and table games. We ate at the Sidewalk Cafe which had some good deals on sandwiches and wraps for lunch. We didn't get a chance to try the main seashell shaped restaurant this time but maybe in the future. Overall, the hotel was a very "cool" place to stay. All the employees we met were friendly and eager to help. I will say that it definitely had an adult vibe to it. Not that we didn't see any kids but there were a lot of couples and adults. I would defnintely recommend La Concha and will most likely be staying here on my next trip. Were there any negatives? Well, it's not cheap for food and drinks but that is expected. There are plenty of other restaurants on Ashford Ave. to check out. Also, housekeeping forgot to replenish our coffee, shampoo & soap but once we called it was brought up immediately. My advice....go and have a great time. Puerto Rico is a wonderful island!

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE, SAYES IT ALL !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EssexBigChaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Oct. 4th to the 9th that turned into the 10th and the first thing that pleased me where, I guess you whould call them Bell Hops. But Felix Perez and Alexis Figueroa where so much more then that. From day one they made us feel like FAMILY.They did so much more then ther jobs they even gave us hugs when we left. I don't know what you pay them but it's not enough. The men out front are always on the go, always there to help, always with a kind word and a smile. They are the first impression one receives and because of them and Louise the best concierge person I have ever met. We booked a tour Sat. the day we where to depart, I asked the driver four times can we be back by two so we can make are flight. He asured me yes no problem well we got back at four and I was pissed because we missed are flight. The tickets are non-refundable three hundred out the window. Mrs Louise whent in the back came out and gave us a room and payed for it herself. How meny employes would do something like that, not maney, very dam few. I do wonder if she went in the back and asked about the Hotel comping us a room, they said no, and if that is the case then management needs to take lessons from ther employees. Because of the employees we are comeing back Nov. fifteenth and because of the people mentioned and all of the people that work for the Hotel like hotel security officer Reynaldo Viruet Lopez I will recommend this Hotel to every body I talked to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KrisPena
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and loved it. The pools are awesome with great couches and lounge areas. Casino is decent and it is a good location with a lot of great restaurants (recommend Jam) in walking distance. Rooms were comfortable. We did not eat the hotel restaurants - quite expensive. Beach area is very nice. Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay @ La Concha for 30th Bday”
Reviews.Author: DCMetroArea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha Oct. 7-11, 2010 and couldn't ask for a better stay for my 30th bday! The grounds of the property were absolutely stunning and the service was top notch. There are several stunning pools to choose from and more than enough beach chairs an umbrellas for everyone. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. We booked using a fall special with a $25 a day food/beverage credit -- upon checkout the bill was less than expected which is always a welcomed surprise! As stated in other reviews -- Felix is a pleasure! Also the nightlife on Friday and Saturday's in the lobby was very convenient -- dance the night away then head upstairs to sleep! I wouldn't recommend for those staying with kids, as it's more of an adult hotel. Overall, I highly recommend the La Concha and have in fact recommended the hotel to several friends looking for a great girls getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel - Celebs here”
Reviews.Author: televasquez
Reviews.Content: J Lo and Mark Anthony were staying here last weekend. We saw them run through the bar a few times coming from the car with all sorts of flash bulbs and security. This hotel is big and new, and is 1st class all the way. The bar is bumping on Fri/Sat until super late. Pretty chill during the weekdays however- much less busy.

Reviews.Title: “You bet we are coming back!”
Reviews.Author: JulioCesar_10
Reviews.Content: We are glad we chose La Concha for our vacation. When we got there we had to wait for about 30 minutes until our room was ready but we spent a very pleasant 30 minutes having a pina colada at the bar (perfectly prepared by the way). Our room was 720. Amazing view! We just stared out of the window into the beach below and we were delighted. The view was fantastic! We also ate at La Perla Restaurant. Excelent food. Excelent service. Pricey but not outrageous! We played at the Casino. OK.....we didn't win but we didn't lose either! We are definitely coming back next year. The employees were friendly and went out of their way to help you. What a nice hotel! I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Damn nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayLKay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha Resort which is an old hotel that has been beautifully updated. Most rooms are ocean view. The rooms are large with desk, couch and a wall windows overlooking the ocean. The outside is lushly planted, and smartly done to create a number of different spaces to enjoy the outdoors.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and we would return in a heart beat”
Reviews.Author: odonnellpaulod
Reviews.Content: The La Concha is a wonderful resort. Besides being a beautiful hotel in a wonderful location, the staff makes the difference. The staff is so friendly and helpful. I have travelled all over the world and I will have to say that the staff at the La Concha is one of the best, if not the best, I have ever encountered. We would like to give special recognition to Omar Hernandez for the great job he did in providing us with first class service. Paul & Ellie O'Donnell Chadds Ford, PA

Reviews.Title: “If on a deal, then its a steal.”
Reviews.Author: wifey_and_I
Reviews.Content: Wifey and I, along with another couple recently stayed at La Concha for a long weekend. On first arrival we were greeted by warm staff from the get go. As soon as your cab pulls up to the hotel you are welcomed in with smiles and laughter which immediately makes for a relaxing stay. This is a good hotel for the area and a really fun hotel for PR. Is it the best? No. If you get it on a deal then i would recommend this place over others as you do feel as though that you are getting a steal fo a deal when discounted. One thing i cannot stress enough is that this hotel is for the younger crowd. It is great for everyone from young friends to young families and everyone (who is young) in between. The lobby is one of 'the' places to be on Friday/Saturday evenings and the area surrounding the hotel is also full of bars with people partying late into the night. The only thing we found annoying is that all the locals who come and sit in the hotel lobby at the weekend tend to act as though they are better than most people there, but for us, that was just something else to laugh at. Expect to be annoyed if you don't like hearing loud music at 3/4 am, even if the bar is empty and the dj has packed up. The drinks are reasonably priced at $8-12 each and free if you are gambling. However i do think the cocktail list at the main bar should be simplified a little for the bar staff - why have 20 drinks if you can only make 4 of them! The food is a little on the pricey side but it is good and not that much more than surrounding options. Extras: Gym is good. Pools could do with a clean. More sheltered outdoor seating required as it does rain at least once a day. Did not find much difference between Ocean View and Pool Side rooms (one has Ocean view whilst the other is bigger) Casino is good and has a fun evening crowd. All in all i would recommend this place to my friends but only my friends who are going to party.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Hotel, Gorgeous Beach, OK City”
Reviews.Author: AileenMolson
Reviews.Content: I cant believe the bad reviews Im reading on this hotel. I just returned from a mini vacation with some girlfriends and the hotel is fabulous. The rooms are large with a great modern decor. The bathroom is amazing with beautiful tile work. The staff was very friendly, from beginning to end. The bellmen helped us out of our taxis, brought all our luggage to our room and gave us some great restaurant ideas for dinner. The pools are resort worthy and beach was gorgeous. The beds are super comfortable with down filled pillows and comforters. We blew a fuse twice while we were here ( four girls-2 blow dryers, curling irons, tv, and a fan on) and they immedietly fixed the problem and gave us vouchers for a free breakfast buffet. The only complaint I have is the price of food!! It is extremely expensive to eat or drink here. And if management is reading this: You NEED to have towels down by the beach, its really frustrating having to walk all the way back to the pool area to grab a towel. I would definitly recommend this hotel to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Best in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RJATX
Reviews.Content: I surprised my fiance for his birthday. I debated between La Concha and the Ritz. Glad I went with La Concha. It modern, chic, centrally located, had fantastic beach access, an amazing fitness center, beautiful mezzanines, lounges, and restaurants (try Level 25 for breakfast and Perla for dinner). We got an oceanfront suite for the price of a Ritz city view room. I'd return. It rains alot in the off season, so have a non-beach plan-B.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned... Might be great, might get screwed!”
Reviews.Author: LASteve1977
Reviews.Content: When my wife and I arrived at this hotel and attempted to check in to the room which we had already paid for (an ocean front king bed room) we we're told, "We ain't got any more of those rooms, you've been moved." WHAT????? I had to argue with the manager, and was told that other quests extended their stay and the hotel was at 100 occupancy. So they basically gave my room away and didn't honor my reservation. So they put us in a room which they claimed was better (a king suite). the room overlooked an alleyway with a dance club that keep us up until after 4am. We complained and the next day were moved to the ocean front room, in their main tower... the room we paid for. That room was very nice. Overall, the whole hotel is like a nightclub. Very noisy, the restaurants could be better, the casino small, the pools small, the ocean rough, and the customer service insincere. If you're in an ocean front room on a high floor, in their main tower, you will enjoy the stay. If you're anywhere else... you're screwed!!! and frankly is it worth the risk? I think not.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, great location, & fabulous staff...”
Reviews.Author: 1sav
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort with fabulous, friendly, and extremely helpful Staff. In particular the concierge Victor was extremely knowledgeable and exceptionally helpful in planning our daily adventures/ day trips. The resort is in a central location that is very close to Old San Juan. La Concha also has a beautiful beach with small to medium waves, which was so enjoyable to swim in.

Reviews.Title: “This is an awesome hotel and I would recommend it to everyone”
Reviews.Author: sarrih
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. The pictures from their website is exactly how the hotel looks. From the minute we stepped out of the taxi, the customer service was magnificent. The food at the different restaurants located within the hotel was delicious. The hotel staff was very accommodating and pleasant. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. I plan to travel back in a couple of months and there is no other place I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to come if you appreciate trained staff that pays attention to details!”
Reviews.Author: KareninCanonsburg
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in this resort while my husband attended to business. My children are 14, 13, and 11. We travel extensively, so I can offer these opinions from a perspective of comparisons. The lobby has the stunning beauty and design you would expect from this level of hotel. We checked in professionally and quickly. The rooms were well appointed and comfortable. The view was outstanding. So far, there was nothing unexpected. Then we had breakfast... It started out as a simple Diet Coke while everyone was drinking coffee. Pablo, the waiter attending to the buffet for the elite members of the Marriott, noticed I wasn't drinking coffee and offered me the breakfast drink of champions. And that started the week of outstanding breakfast service. With his fluent English, his knowledge of all of the places to go with kids my age, where to snorkel, where to find shells, we had our own travel advisor and with excellent results! And he always seemed happy to see us, every morning. He went so far above and beyond what I percieved as his job, it reflected this hotel's ability to attract, train and retain a staff that makes customers want to come back. I would choose this hotel again because of Pablo, because his talents reflected extaordinary professionalism within the hotel. And when we are so spoiled by expecting the outstanding decor and lavish surroundings, it is this unexpected surprise that makes all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Boutique Hotel on Beach”
Reviews.Author: jujufer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Concha for a night before leaving on a cruise. It was a nice choice. The hotel was very modern and attractive. The price was appropriate for the hotel. It was a hopping place! It seemed like the lobby and bar was a place where locals came to hang out. They had a live band playing most of the evening and the hotel seemed to never slow down. The pool area was attractive and never closed. I can see where lower rooms would maybe have noise issues. We were ocean side on the 10th floor, and didn't hear any noise. The food situation is probably my biggest complaint. The hotel food was pretty fancy and expensive. There were not many options near by. We did try Cafe Del Angel across the street (Puerto Rican food). It was bad, but a little pricy. All food we came across seemed on the expensive side. We ate at the hotel's sandwich place, which was tasty, but $26 for a sandwich, flat bread (really french bread) pizza and 2 drinks (no sides). Getting around was pretty easy. Taxis were always available at a moments notice. Also, the price is fixed depending on which regions you are traveling to/from. A cab ride to the mall (the largest in the caribbean) was $14. To the cruise pier was $15 plus $1 for each bag. Overall, would stay at the hotel again for a short stay. Not much to do around the hotel unless you like clubbing. The hotel was nice, clean and had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel, Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: elenanis
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a girl weekend getaway at La Concha and our experience was absolutely amazing! The hotel is beautiful from the rooms to the lobby and the pool, but most of all, the service was outstanding. I would like to extend a special thank you to our server Omar Hernandez, he went above and beyond to ensure that our every want and need was met. He was incredibly friendly, accomodating and did everything with true pleasure. I will definitely come back to La Concha and Omar made the experience that much more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Magical”
Reviews.Author: storminbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I would like to take this moment to say that my stay at La Concha Resort, is an incredible place to stay. What makes it incredible is the staff. Louise the Head Concierge specifically was amazing in helping me with some romantic details for my room. She not only was attentive to detail, she carried out my every request to the letter on a moments notice. Because of Louise's creative help our stay there was above and beyond what we had imagined. If you plan to visit Puerto Rico, this is the place to stay. If you want to get some romantic plans set up for you stay, you have to ask for Louise!!! The hotel is beautiful and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: nlentz8038
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon in mid-September. From the time we arrived at La Concha until we headed back home we recieved amazing customer service. I will never forget the gentleman who greeted us upon arrival and also gave us a farewell when we checked out, his name is Felix Perez and is one of a kind. Each day when we left the hotel to tour Puerto Rico he was out front greeting other guests and was always interested to hear what our plans were for the day, upon returning from outings he always asked if we enjoyed it and wanted to know exactly what we did. Felix aside there were several other memorable people from this hotel. At Solera, which has amazing food there is a server by the name of Griselle who was wonderful. Actually most of the staff there were fantastic but she especially stands out! Since the ocean was fierce on most days of our vacation we spent many days poolside which was fantastic, and there was a guy there by the name of Chris who handed out towels and supervised the pool area. He also was wonderful, from the first time he and I met he remembered my name and we talked everyday about what I was doing on vacation. One day I really wanted to lay out in the sun and the clouds were filling the sky so he checked the weather for me and gave me the full report and "spoke to the sun" (it was hilarious) the funny thing is, the sun came out after that. Anyway, I think I have made my point clear, the staff here are ver special. My husband and I would certainly consider Puerto Rico again just because of the people there! Thanks for making our honeymoon the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and ocean front rooms..”
Reviews.Author: IOTexas
Reviews.Content: The ocean front room I was in was amazing.. the view and the ocean right below your window is worth the price.. The room was clean and very 'chicky'.. kinda retro.. kinda modern and very comfortable.. The service was less than desirable as it took 3 phone calls to the front desk to get foam pillows and approx 90 minutes wait.. The service in the bar was unfriendly and slow.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST vacation I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: DandT_30088
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at La Concha 9/21/2010, and was immediately taken aback by the beauty of the resort. The receiving area, lobby and room were very contemporary, modern, open, inviting, and BEAUTIFUL. Every bell boy greeted us with a smile and firm handshake. Without even uttering a word, we had 2 bell boy's loading our luggage on to luggage carts and waited for us to enter the lobby. They even offered to take a picture of us in front of the fountain. Concierge staff was warm and friendly. I never once had a doubt about the service, as every time I even so much as called downstairs, my questions were answered. Each day the room was cleaned to perfection, and fresh new towels were provided. We had the best room at the resort -12th floor ocean view. There is nothing more relaxing than to wake up each morning to the sound of the ocean. The pool ground, open veranda and beach area were well kept. You never had to search for wait staff, as they always made sure you were comfortable. The bar was great as well. All in all, this is the best place to stay if you visit San Juan. It is close to everything and the staff treat you like royalty. The best part was absolutely no bed bugs!! Hallelujah! Many shout outs to Felix, Ricardo, Ruby and Anna. I will never forget any of them, and they each made our trip memorable. We would definitely come back. I wish there was a La Concha on every Caribbean island. :)

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawn14505
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Concha last week and in one word it was AMAZING. We had an ocean view room we got for under $200/night and it was worth every penny. This hotel has 4 pools (2 of them infinity pools overlooking the ocean), 2 hot tubs, a million outdoor lounge chairs, tables and even outdoor beds. Also 4 different resturaunts (Try Perla, it's excellent) and a casino. Great beach with protection from the waves because of the pier. I can't stress how great our ocean view was from our window. The hotel is in the perfect part of San Juan, close to great shopping and everything else you need - even a 24hr Walgreens within 5 min walking distance. 5 minute drive to beautiful Old San Juan, a 45 minute drive to El Yunque rainforest, 1 hour drive to the city of Fajardo where you can catch the ferry to Culebra island and Flamenco Beach - all a must see. Stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Each stay is a rediscovery of a great place.”
Reviews.Author: LocoOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at La Concha in the summer of 2008. You can read my previous review of that experience. Ever since, when in San Juan I stay at La Concha. Each time I stay there, I leave with great memories and another delightful experience. In 2009, I stayed for a weekend in June, and in 2010, I stayed a weekend in August and extended stay during Labor Day Weekend in September. I now am heading back again in October, for Columbus Day weekend. La Concha has been offering some great deals in the last few months. During peak season, it can be a bit expensive to stay at La Concha. La Concha service never disappoints. It is a popular spot for travelers and locals, so you may spend extra time at check-in and check-out times, but the staff does their best to get you in and out ASAP. If your room isnâ€™t ready, they take down your mobile number and call you as soon as it is finished, and in some cases some drink tickets to help you start your vacation. My last two stays (August 2010 and September 2010) I arrived early and luckily my room was ready! I never had a problem with room service and the room was clean and ready every time I returned to the room after enjoying the pool and beach. The property has expanded, since I first stayed there in 2008. There is now a small casino, which attracts a nice crowd and a new Suite Tower. Although, I have not stayed in the new suites in the Suite Tower, I hear very excellent things about them from other guests I have encountered during my stays. As well, for Marriott Elite members and others on the Concierge Floor, the breakfast and evening drinks and tapas are quite satisfying in the Concierge Lounge. I must say a very nice addition to the hotel. La Concha remains a destination spot in the evenings, especially weekends. It is not uncommon to have a live band or DJ late into the evening, and lots of fun and dancing. Because a lot of this activity happens in the lobby and courtyard area by the main pool near the lobby, some guests on the lower floors may hear the fun activities late into the night. But I think the rooms are well insulated that it is not too overwhelming once you have shut your door and turned in for the night. If you like to be amongst all the fun, ask for a â€œCabana Room.â€� They are smaller rooms with larger balconies that overlook the pool and courtyard. They can be lots of fun if you donâ€™t mind being right in the action and hearing the great music into the night. La Concha is definitely not a quiet hotel, but I like this festive atmosphere. Some travelers do not, so you may want to weigh out your options. But if you are looking for a fun and great timeâ€¦you will like this place, and after a few cocktails the music wonâ€™t bother you anymore. Relax and enjoy. The central location of the hotel canâ€™t be beat. You can walk to many great restaurants â€“ Ropa Vieja comes to mind â€“ and of course there is a Starbucks just two blocks down from the hotel. Next to La Concha there is a park that often hosts weekend events, which can be a nice addition to your stay. If you are looking to stay at a place where you donâ€™t have to go far to have a great time, La Concha is for you! And donâ€™t forget to try one of their Sangria Pitchers â€“ the Cava Sangria is quite delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, uncomfortable room furniture.”
Reviews.Author: Dennis395
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research in San Juan before choosing La Concha to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversay. Overall, we had a great stay until Hurrricane Earl started heading toward the island which encouraged us to cut our stay short by one day. It is a beautiful hotel, but quite expensive when it comes to alcohol and food. A Seabreeze in a short glass at the bar was $9.00 plus a lot of tax. Lunch one day $40 without alcoholic drinks. There is an outdoor cafe adjacent to the casino that had great salads, sandwiches and gelato at fair prices. The common areas, especially the lobby and lobby bar are spectacular. The garden areas are beautiful. The main pool was very busy and noisy at all times. All the guys that work outside, bellhops etc., are really friendly and very helpful. The biggest area of opportunity is the ammenities of the room. We stayed in a premium oceanfront room with a gorgeous view, room #611. There was limited drawer space. There was no tub for bathes which my wife enjoys. The rain shower which everyone writes about was nice, but had very little water presssure. With the remodel of the hotel came a very uncomfortable low back white leather couch. Other than the desk chair, there was really no comfortable place to sit. The dresser and desk were not replaced, so you have new chic(?) furniture with older worn wooden furniture. There is free wireless, but we constantly had a weak signal. The flat screen tv was on satellite but did not always have the best reception. There is an in-room refrigerator where we stocked drinks from Walgreens. The hotel was conveniently located in the city. With that comes city life which after dark brings out all types of people. I would recommend not walking far once darkness settles in. It is true that Walgreens, Starbucks and Dunkin' Donut are within walking distance. There is a large grassy plaza located right next to the hotel which featured a huge jazz fest one evening while we were there. Il Postino and Miro are two restaurants that we walked to. Il Postino, Italian, has a great breakfast with huge portions for the money. Miro had several choices. Al Dente, Italian in Old San Juan was definitely worth the ride. It is one of the oldest and highest rated restaurants in Old San Juan. The prices were very modest. As a matter of fact, most of the better restaurants , bars and clubs, historical attractions are located in Old San Juan so you may want to consider a hotel there over the city of San Juan. Just research the quality of the hotel beaches in both areas. All in all, we had an enjoyable time. We typically stay at an all-inclusive resort, but unfortunately Puerto Rico does not have any on the island. Therefore, I don't see us returning any time soon to Puerto Rico. If I do return, I would probably stay in the Old San Juan Area.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place, but not for those who want quiet!”
Reviews.Author: nasbuck
Reviews.Content: Very, very nice place to stay. Good location for touring. Food and service was outstanding. We loved that this was a "happening" place, but the only complaint we would have was that the music/partying noise remained until 5am! Admittedly, this was not as bad from the rooms that did not have the suite attached to them, but our suite room was ridiculously noisy...from partying to a power washing noise in the wee hours of the morning. Fortunately, there were plenty of places to relax and catch up on rest during the day. Loved the local music in the early hours of the evening, but the switch to the latin-beat dance music seemed pointless (and too loud), since there was no actual dance floor. Overall, it was a good resort if you want the action of San Juan. Shout out to Felix, the doorman and Omar the poolside waiter!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay...loved "Orale Guey"”
Reviews.Author: spontangrl
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Renaissance La Concha for two days before our cruise. I was really worried about getting a room with double beds, and at checkin they started off by saying, "We don't have a regular room with dbls....so we have upgraded you to a Suite!" The room was huge. A seperate kitchen and dining area, living area and then the room itself. The style was all very modern and contemporary. It even had a jetted tub, 2 different shower-heads, and a semi-see-through shower! We were in the new all suites building which was open air and quite humid in the hallways, but the room stayed quite cool. Our room faced out to the street, and it was a little noisy at night with the "boom boom" of a nightclub, but the rythym kinda lolled you to sleep. The clubs stayed open to around 5am! I looked out on the balcony after going to the bathroom, and people were still wandering the streets like they do in Miami! I also liked that internet was free in the business center, a big help in finding out what to do in the area and keeping in touch. The restuarant/bar "Orale Guey" which means..."Come on Dude" was where we ate both days because of the good prices, and great location to the hotel...directly across the street. The burritos were HUGE! I really liked the Medalla local Beer and it was only $2.00 there! The hotel charged $7.00! The owner/bartender Julio was very nice, and even gave us a couple of free ones and a lot of advice about what to do in San Juan and the surrounding area. I told him I would write a review on trip advisor, so if you pop in tell him you heard about him from here, from the curly-haired girl. He'll know!

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Hotel was amazing!! The customer service was perky & alert even at 3am!!”
Reviews.Author: Aar0n219
Reviews.Content: The hotel by itself is very impressive. The lobby just screams "PARTY OVER HERE!!" and party we did! I fell in love with a drink called "Sin" made to perfection, delicious & refreshing!! Jimmy assisted us to our hotel & was very knowledgeable about the city & gave us directions to several hot spots throughout our stay. I got a great haircut at the salon across the street...thanx Jimmy!! And Ruddy helped me find a hot tub at 3am, he was bright, cheerful & friendly....at 3am!! We are hoping to come back in Dec for new years & told all our friends they must stay at La Concha in San Juan!! Sincerely, Aaron Shruby

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I have ever received”
Reviews.Author: RobertNieves
Reviews.Content: So we arrived at La Concha parked ourselves. Had 5 pieces of luggage, I thought I'll just take the elevator from the third floor, well there was no elevator (at least not that I could see) so my girlfriend and I carried our luggage down three flights of stairs, which at the bottom were three workers (I believe one was the manager) I asked them (as I was carrying the luggage down) where the lobby was, and the manager just pointed around the corner and continued talking with his employees. I finished taking the luggage down and finally another worker saw us and said he would get a bell man. We proceeded to front desk (very nice) and were taken to our room (bell man was very nice) and then went down to the pool. At the pool it took me about 20 minutes and to the point where I had to wave my hands up in the air to get some service, 2 drinks a hamburger and some chips and guacamole for 56 dollars, wow! The following night we went out to the pool to have some dinner, I was given two complimentary drink coupons (part of the package, not something nice they did) and I asked the girl if I could use the coupons with her, and she said no I had to use them at the bar (only steps away, it would have been nice for her to say... but I'll get it for you this time) so I just said, ok we'll take water. The girl turned to another girl and told her, they're going to have water (in Spanish which I speak) and the other girl said "Agua ardiente?" and they started laughing and left, I don't know what they meant by it (translated it means scalding water) but it could be used for other things. The next night went down to the lobby to have a drink, waited at a table and waitresses passed us but not ONE asked us/looked at us to see if we needed anything, so I got up and went to the bar (and waited/flagged a bar tender) and ordered two drinks, used my two coupons I had (very very nice guy, didn't think I would tip him but he was very nice, but I went after him and gave him his tip) from there we proceeded to the sushi bar and were helped by a nice girl, but too slow, I had to get up and get my edemame and then again to get my sushi rolls, but I was having a good time so I didn't let it get to me (one sake carafe and two delicious sushi rolls 65dollars). The next night was the worst and the one that made me write this review. We went down to the lobby again on our last night waited at a table near the bar, no service (as expected) walked to the bar and flagged down a bartender (as expected) order a couple of drinks and went back to my table. Decided we wanted some sushi again so I alone walked (from a table at the lobby bar) to the sushi bar and asked if I could order some sushi, the guys behind the bar (very nice guys one with glasses) said I had to order it from the waitress, I told them I had been waiting but no one has approached me, so they agreed to take my order and tell the waitress when she went over, she never went to my table. I got up to get my edemame, and they asked me if she had gone over (she being a curly haired waitress) and I said no, they were very surprised to hear that. So took my edemame and went to my table, about 10 to 15 minutes later (furious) I got up and went to get my sushi, I asked the guy if he wanted my room number to charge my room and they said no they would tell the waitress to go over, so I took my sushi to my table, went back to get the little cups for the soy sauce (along with the soy sauce) and then went back to get chop sticks and napkins. At this point I was about to explode and debating about whether or not write a letter to the manager, I decided to do so and went to the front desk and ask for a piece of paper and a pen. As I started writing the waitress goes over (finally) and asked if everything was ok. My girlfriend said that the she had seen I was writing a letter and looked upset, about ten minutes after that in the middle of eating our sushi the girl goes and literally drops the bill next to me, did not ask if we needed anything else, or if I was ready for the bill or anything, didn't say a word and literally dropped the check next to me. I was finally finished with my long letter (first one I had every written for anything, just like this is the first review I write for anything). I signed for the bill but under "tip" I put "zero, I served myself." (first time EVER I donâ€™t tip someone) I took my letter to the concierge, I told Louise everything that had happened and she was extremely nice about it, she offered to buy my girlfriend and I drinks and some sushi, but I politely refused. I thought, we have gone through too much to even be around that staff any longer. She said she would tell her manager, and that he would get back to me, but to this date I have not been contacted by him. A simple apology would do, but I guess this type of service is expected here (NOT!!!)
