So to sum it up, the hotel is beautiful, the food is good but not for that price, the drinks the same, housekeeping just make the bed and replace most (most) of the towels and leave, and the entire staff with the exception of the girl waitresses and the first three guys when we first got there, were very nice and friendly. (oh one last thing, on our last day, we took our bags down to valet and I went to get the car, because I had self parked, and I was struggling to get 5 big suitcases into a mustang and not one person offered to help) But needless to say I will not be staying there next time I visit Puerto Rico. So if you got to reading this far, trust me when I tell you this, DON'T STAY HERE!! Look for hotel number 4 or number 2 even if it cost a little more. Nothing is worth losing your dignity.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Family, top-notch exceptional customer service--Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: christy91254
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially the ones behind the concierge counter, headed by Manager, Louise Graulau provided the 4 of us with "out of this world", exceptional customer service. We were faced with a predicament that we would not wish on anyone, by Royal Caribbean Cruise line. This was supposed to be our vacation, but thanks to Royal Caribbean, our vacation turned into a nightmare. La Concha Manager Louise G. and her staff cared and understood our plight and made every attempt to help us make the most of our trip. They treated us like we were their own, like family, by making our stay as comfortable, pleasant and burdensome as possible. Louise specially selected our accommodations to where the view from our room will help us forget about the bad experience we had with Royal Caribbean. The rooms are fresh, clean and well-equipped. The lighting, the furniture and amenities in the room are perfect. The bathroom is different from most hotel--very novel ideas and well-designed. If you like nightlife, there is plenty right in the hotel lobby. The amenities such as the pool and fitness center are strategically located, so that no matter where you are, you will see the view of the ocean around these amenities. The hotel, of course, is located right by the water--the water is so clear and blue/green---absolutely perfect, sexy and romantic. The greenery/plants are also well-chosen and really adds to the ambience of the areas. The business center is also located where you can see the blue ocean from inside, as the clear glass enclosure allows for this. It's a perfect hotel: great service, very professional staff, great location with God-given wonderful, natural beauty just outside your window. The icing on the cake is really the Manager, Louise and her staff. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to write this review. La Concha is definitely worth it !!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, as always”
Reviews.Author: Keriz1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the La Concha resort a few times, and will continue to stay. I travel to Puerto Rico twice a year for my vacations, and I love it! La Concha is my favorite place because of many things: The rooms are great, especially the ocean tower. The rooms look out onto Condado beach, and over the seafoam green ocean. The Staff is amazing there, they are accomedating and go out of thier way to make sure that you are happy. Especial thanks to Ruby in Solera Restaurant and Felix in Valet. They both made a huge impression, and I can't wait to see them the next time i go! My only negative about La Concha is the housekeeping staff. While friendly, they take forever to clean the rooms (although i am sure it's because there are lots of rooms), and they don't clean very well. When I stayed, there was a toothpaste cap on the floor when I arrived, and it was still there when i checked out. I was there for 5 nights. I love this hotel, and the staff. Great customer service along with a beautiful beach make this hotel a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCMD
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel! The staff is amazing, specially Felix the doorman. He is adorable and super friendly, he helped us a lot with touristic informations, and he really made us feel like queens! The pool staff too was amazing, Bryan and Ovi, they are so nice! They took the time to give us informations about almost anything we asked haha, and it really helped us have an unforgettable trip. Actually, everyone was amazing, the food was great, the drinks were great, the room with ocean view...OMG! The hotel has Radios and you can plug your Ipod, there's a dvd...so its nice! The only thing i didnt like was the shower door. It's like...half a door, and I personally don't like it. But I guess that little details is not really important when you look at what the hotel has to offer. There are many restaurants near by, portorican food (and the food is gooood...try the "canoa") or fast food (subway and wendys)...there's a wallgreens and old San Juan is approx 10 min from there in taxi, wich will cost you approx 15.00 USD. In general, I'd give a big 10/10, and I will definitely go back to Puerto Rico, because the island is B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L, and the classy hotel is GREAT GREAT GREAT! By the way, make sure you have a credit card because when you check-in, the hotel charges you an extra 125.00USD /night just in case something happens to the room while you're staying there, and they refund it when you check-out. It's just a good information to have...

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: fischwave
Reviews.Content: I'm new to the phrase "infinity pool." For those of you like me, La Concha has a pool where you swim out, say, 15 feet and look out into the expanse of the ocean. It's a great view and feeling. In pictures it almost looks like you're in the ocean, which explains the infinity pool idea. The pool attendants were great-- so much so that I'm killing a few minutes on a busy work day to thank Ovadis and Chris Ruidiaz for helping make our vacation with a 6 year old and 3 year old more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable”
Reviews.Author: latonyabennett
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LaConcha for seven (7) days recently and loved it. The resort is laid out with amenities that a vacation should have. No place is perfect. However, this resort is way up there to perfection in my eyes. There will always be things that we find to complain about, but at the end of the day this resort does it right. I am a 31 year old very very picky woman who enjoys the finer hotels-restaurants-shopping. The LaConcha service-layout-and staff were all great. Did I say how great the staff was? Beyond courteous-well mannered-helpful. The Hotel does a great job at keeping entertainment around the clock. Never a dull moment. The location is great for tourist. For the times when you want to have a taste of other foods just walk down the street. Needing toiletries...Walgreen's is a few blocks away. The private beach in the back is more than wonderful just as the 4 pools they spoil you with on a daily basis-the casino downstairs in open 24 hours and is fun in itself. If I were to ever go back to San Juan I would only stay in Condado at The Loconcha. It is a great great resort.

Reviews.Title: “The service at La Concha is top notch”
Reviews.Author: PenelopPitstop
Reviews.Content: I had three wonderful interactions with the staff during my stay at La Concha Resort. First was with Yary during breakfast in the lobby, second was with Ali at the bar and lastly was with Pablo from the Concierge desk. They were engaging, attentive and friendly. I also had the pleasure of meeting the F&B Director, Jose Torres, who took the time to share with me information about all of their outlets housed in the hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Boriqua445
Reviews.Content: Felix the door man is awesome!!!! I saw many reviews about him and everything people say about his is true! I have stayed in many of the hotels in the San Juan metro area and I have to say that this place was my fave! I see a few reviews on here that don't like it but that's because they didn't look at the reviews! This place is not for those looking for a family friendly hotel to relax at. If they had looked at the reviews the most likely would have booked a different hotel. However this hotel was everything I wanted and more. It's up beat. Saturday nights they have a DJ at the hotel lobby playing electronica/trance/house music with a young crowd of both locals and tourist. The art deco style with modern decorations was amazing. I have to say that I had the best birthday weekend ever at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: HLI1014
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Concha over the Labor Day weekend. Throughout the entire stay the bellmen were extremely friendly. The lobby of the hotel was very nice. The local restaurants were excellent. Anna was amazing! She made me feel right at home. Shout out to Anna! Louise, at the Concierge desk was amazing! She suggested that I take the Flavors of Old San Juan tour. The tour was wonderful. It's a 2 hour walking tour. You get to see the historical sites and visit a few of the restaurants and dine on local cuisine. If you're looking for something different to do, I highly recommend it. Ladies, don't believe the hype, you're not getting a better deal at the Coach Outlet here. The prices may end up being a bit higher due to the tax rate. Never thought, I'd be surprised and somewhat displeased with the service at a Marriott Hotel. However... I requested early check-in when I made my reservation in July (not to mention that I am long standing Marriott Rewards Member). I was told my room wasn't ready. After I explained that I am a rewards member and that I requested early check in, I was told "I will give you the room now". It felt as if it were being done as a favor. I was extremely disappointed with the room. It very small. The desks and the furniture were a bit worn. I requested extra foam pillows. I had to ask two nights before I finally received them. The linen on the bed was changed every day. I wonder where the pillows came from. I had to have them replaced as they had a strange odor to them. I have stayed at several Renaissance Resorts and expected better quality, level of service and size of the room. The wait staff at Solera the poolside Tapas Lounge were rude! I sat at a table today (9/8/2010) for ten minutes, while people walked past me. They never acknowledged that I was there until I finally stopped someone and asked if I could be served. Overall the grounds are beautiful. There are several pools that are open 24 hours. If you're looking to relax, the adult pool is the place to be. It is very secluded and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff--beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Melissarubino
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely friendly. Jonathan and Felix were two of the many friendly staff members. Beautiful and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply put, it's Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: Aaron-Michael
Reviews.Content: This resort was fantastic from start to finish! It has an amazing grand entrance that really starts off your stay in the right direction. I found the staff to be very attentive, and well mannered. They treated me like they wanted my business and I greatly appreciate that. The rooms are exactly as they are shown on the website, very modern, clean lines, and updated furniture and fixtures. There are flat screens in each room and the walls are pretty good at blocking sound. If you plan to stay here I would certainly recommend upgrading to a Ocean View Room. We woke up every morning to the sound and sights of the waves crashing aganist the rocks and the shoreline. Our room literally opened up to the ocean. The entire wall in the Ocean View Rooms is a large window that you can open and truly feel as if you are on Condado Beach. The resturants in the resort were fantastic. I read a voluminous amount of reviews on Tripadvisor about the food and I must say I think it was worth every penny. I am a foodie and I write a few food reviews for new restaurants and the food at La Concha was great. Their poolside bar and outdoor grill had anything from burgers and sandwiches to flank steak. Everything had a Puerto Rican flair to it, which I loved. For breakfast we ate in the Ocean Lounge which overlooks the infinity pool and the ocean. This lounge is for Marriott Platnium members and was excellent. One morning we ate brunch at Level 25 where they had an exquisite buffet, waffle, pancacke and omeltte station. The food at Level 25 was superb. On our last evening we dined at their formal dinning facility, Perla. It is on the water, it over looks all of Condado Beach and it's ceiling is an ornate shell which also happends to be a local historic landmark. I had the Filet Mignon and it was simply fantastic...melts in your mouth. The ambience was remiencent of something you'd find in a swank hotel in DC or NY, great music and lighting. We went during the Labor Day Holiday so there was a DJ in the hotel lounge each night during the weekend and a good looking crowd of well estabished trend Puerto Rican trendsetters. The music was ok, but the crowd was better and the drinks were stiff! The staff was wonderful on the beach as well. They were very attentive to our needs, they always hustled to get us some lougne chairs and umberellas. Again, I can't say enough good things about this place. The resort is directly on Condado Beach just as it says which is one of the most beautiful beaches I've stayed on. I travel to the Carribean a lot and this beach is by far one of my favorites. The water was crystal clear, the sand was warm and inviting and the property is set up so that anyone you are you can see the beach. And the pools were amazing!!! The pools went up to 5 feet so you couldn't dive in, but you could surely be submerged in water as you looked out at the ocean. The infinity fool was fantastic... The one and only complaint I have about this property (and PR in general) is the piegon problem. These nasty, germ-filled birds were everywhere...anytime we tried to eat outside by the water they would swarm around our feet trying to catch scraps. It was a HUGE nuisance! They were relentless and every timed we shooed them away, more would soon follow. So stay indoors when you eat if you don't like birds.

Reviews.Title: “Im gonna give the La Concha a exellent rating for one big reason.....”
Reviews.Author: namebrands777
Reviews.Content: Felix P. The hotel bellman. He is my reason for giving the La Concha a excellent rating. And here's why, Sure the La concha is beautiful, the beach is beautiful , the rooms were very clean and comfy...But this can be said about thousands of other Hotel/Resorts. And that's where Felix made the difference for us. He made my entire family feel at home and welcome. Even my 4 year and 2 year old daughters loved him! When we would come home after a long day of sight seeing he would welcome us back run to open the door for me and my mom and sisters. He even went and picked my mom up supplies at Walgreen's because hurricane earl was coming so she made a list of emergency things she thought she might need. Felix is the kind of person that's makes staying at the La Concha resort a pleasantry! Because to me there's nothing worse than going to a hotel and feeling uncomfortable. And to be perfectly honest almost every person working there was just a delight to be around almost like you were always amongst family and friends. I highly recommend the La concha for there friendly staff alone ..Everything else about the hotel was just icing on the cake for me and my whole family. P.s we were in the newer side on the 4th floor and it was very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff - maintenance and housekeeping, eh”
Reviews.Author: smkm1023
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha for 7 days and have to say that it was a great hotel. The staff were all very nice, especially the men fetching the taxis, they were very nice, chatty and extremely helpful. The towel boys were also very sweet and accommodating. I cannot give all 5 stars though. We had been upgraded to a suite (score!) however the sink wouldn't fully drain so we called maintenance to come fix it and they said they would be right up. Well if by right up they meant never I guess they were honest. Housekeeping decided to not come the one day we absolutely needed towels and we had to go downstairs to the front desk and wait for them to give us towels. It was extremely frustrating. The reviews about the noise - I couldn't hear the partying from our room, it was very quiet actually. There was construction going on in the mezzanine right out our room and we never heard it. Our suite had 2 flat screen tv's! The only odd/annoying thing about our suite was that the shower had NO door and was completely see through into the bedroom. If you are a couple, I am sure this is perfect for a good time but with friends this was extremely annoying because no one could be in the bedroom without seeing the person in the shower completely in the nude. Overall this is a great hotel and would stay again. Expect nothing from maintenance and you won't be disappointed. The beach is great and the pools are very nice. Lots of places to eat nearby (the hotel itself was affordable to sleep but to eat is an entirely different matter). I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: flexcrac
Reviews.Content: Service was impeccable. Everyone is extremely courteous and helpful. Our room was not ready when we arrived so they gave us some drink coupons and the room was ready in about 20 minutes. The cleaning staff did a great job in preparing our room each day. All of the food was excellent at the pool bar and La Perla. The prices were about we expected and similar to any major hotel in a metropolitan area. The pool staff and beach staff were eager to please and Felix at the door is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lsbaylor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the La Concha after receiving a recommendation from our friend who used to live in Puerto Rico. The place lived up to our expectations and exceeded them on several levels. The staff was welcoming, friendly, and made us feel as though we were a part of their family. Louise, the head Concierge, recommended the Flavors of San Juan tour which was awesome. I travel quite a bit for work and pleasure, and it has been a long time since I've stayed at such a great hotel. As far as the property is concerned, the location is great. Candado is wonderful for shopping and has great restaurants. The rooms are clean and well kept. If you have to do any working on the trip you are set...wifi access in the room is high speed, and the phones in the room are excellent for conference calls. I was happy to find out the costs for using the phone are included in your resort fee charge. The rooms have Aveda products, which my husband and I love. In the evening the lobby bar turns into a nice little hot spot with great DJs and dancing. Overall, this hotel exceeded our expectations. We are already planning our next stay at the La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: WvMountie
Reviews.Content: I visited the La Concha for nine days in July/August and we had a wonderful time. Traveled with my 16 year old daughter and 12 year old son while my husband was there on business. We were in the mood for a totally relaxing/laid back vacation (we had done Washington DC at spring break and were super busy with running and touring) so we were looking forward to a totally chill vacation - relaxing by the pool and ocean. The La Conchaâ€™s outdoor pool area and beach location are fantastic. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather every day and enjoyed the wonderful pools and lounging in the sun. They gym is very nice also with great views of the ocean. If you are interested in ocean swimming/boogie boarding etc. there are beaches nearby to do so. You can play in the ocean here a little, but there are dangerous rip currents in the area, so we didnâ€™t get out to far in the water. The restaurants and hotel food choices are a tad on the expensive side (think NYC prices $16-20 lunch, I prefer the $8-12 lunch range â€“ but you are on vacation and in a tourist area) but there are many less expensive options within walking distance of the hotel. The towel-staff were always helpful and friendly. The valet staff were also friendly and willing to help. We had a couple minor issues with check-in reservations, but everything was rectified in a friendly manner. We really enjoyed the hip/relaxing vibe of the hotel and it is a great location near Old San Juan, the airport and for taking day trips. We also found Michael Tischler, Head Concierge to be extremely helpful and knowledgeable of things to do in Puerto Rico. He went above and beyond in helping me make preparations for my daughters 16th birthday, which we celebrated wile at the La Concha. He was also a pleasure to get to know. Pablo who worked in the Concierge Lounge was also a joy to see each morning. He was always helpful and made us feel welcome and well served. During our stay we took a couple trips to Old San Juan and did a snorkeling and sail boat charter with the Erin Go Bragh http://www.egbc.net/ which was absolutely fabulous and probably the high-light of our trip, but I actually found it a challenge to leave the hotel. It met all our needs for a beautiful and relaxing get-away.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: wallacegloria
Reviews.Content: upon arrival the front desk was unable to provide me the the room I comfirmed on August 8,2010. After being passed from agent to agent I finally got a gentlement that seemed very concern to right the wrong. But he too tried to sell me rooms that were below my standards and not what I paid for and had expected. I then left the property frustrated, and was looking for accommodations elsewhere (eg Carribe Hilton where my friends were). The reservationist at the Marriott reservation center, was very specific in the description and location of the room I reserved; which was to be a Ocean front view, with double beds, on a high floor . I my room was given to another client that exteneded their stay , So I recieved a deluxe room with a ocean front, and a balcony with a kings size bed @ 6:00 pm that night. ( I arrived @ the Hotel @ 1:30 PM). NO fLOWERS, NO ADDITONAL DISCOUNT OR CHAMPAIGNE given.). A few days letter I met a man that was given a bottle Champaigne for his inconviences. Well any way I had a deluxe room for two days and and suite for two days which interfered with my comfort because I had to PACK AND UNPACK TWICE. DISPITED THIS THE SERVICE STAFF WAS VERY GOOD. i WOULD LIKE TO GIVE KUDOS to the following STAFF MEMBER FOR THEIR OUTSTANDING WORK AND EFFORTS IN MAKING ME HAPPY AND COMFORTABLE. They are: Pool Attendant Chris Ruiduaz, Raymond Aqiino, and Abel Perez. I would visit your property again and reccommend it to others. I'm also a travel agent) I just hope I wouldn't be embrassed by a room mix up etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ill come back, for sure!”
Reviews.Author: MstLam
Reviews.Content: Ive gone to many different hotels, right now Im at another one with my colleagues and we keep talking about how awesome was La Conchas @ Puerto Rico. I dont know what makes it so special but definetly people like Coral from the lobby bar crew, make you feel at home and special. You just need to tell them what would you like to eat and even if its not possible, they will make it happen. Everytime you go to the lobby they will treat like a special guest, Im telling you the servers and the bartenders are awesome. When I had trouble with room service I just needed to go to the bar and they knew how to put a smile in my face. Im really looking foward to go back and take my family! I love Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the La Concha”
Reviews.Author: megstef2288
Reviews.Content: Considering we extended our 7 day stay at the La Concha to a 10 day stay we highly enjoyed our experience. It was made even more enjoyable by a staff member of the hotel, Omar, who went above and beyond to make sure my partner and I always had a drink in our hands and something to snack on. His great service made for an even more relaxing and enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: aydiomiopr
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Hilton but that was before staying here. My wife & I spent 2 nights, just to check it out and we were blown away with the property and ambience. After it was renovated, the change is impresive.We got an upgrade to a ocean view suite and that alone made our stay. The view and soud of the waves was so amazing that we had to force ourselves out of the room. The lobby was turned into a lounge/club and right now is the center of the nightlife at the San Juan/Condado area. If you are a couple looking for fun, you must stay. Or, if you want to relax, you'll be able to do that as well. Althought we saw families, our impression is that the hotel is more for adults. Which it worked perfect for us since we were going "childless" at least for a couple nights. I think the service could've been better but it seem that the hotel was understaff and overworked sometimes. That was not a concern or an issue for us, just something I noticed. Last tips: Try the valet prkng if you can. Get a room at the Tower and get ready to party!! THANKS for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection by the sea”
Reviews.Author: mrkz
Reviews.Content: La Concha is exquisite -- a beautiful renovation of a fifties icon, great style, and wonderful staff. We stayed five nights, and nothing was too much trouble -- from poolside dining to the towel boy. Every morning we woke to the wonderful Caribbean views in a well-appointed, luxurious room with high quality appointments and toiletries -- such a joy. My only warning note is the fancy restaurant, La Perla -- great building, but very average food. You can do much better in Old San Juan or on Ashford Avenue if you want a special night. The rest of the food options were good though.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular hotel - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: DEEFLO969
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel a thumbs up-the hotel was very clean, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the ambience is awesome, location is great many shops and restaurants -the staff especially Felix Perez (doorman) and Roger Ritch (Bellman) made my stay a blast, they were courteous, professional, helpful, they always had a smile on their face and a kind word. I looked forward to seeing them every day because they made me laugh. There is plenty of seating in the pool areas, the beach is nice and clean. I plan to stay at t this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge staff is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Zanione
Reviews.Content: The Concierge staff made each day delightful with their hands on attentive style and extremely friendly and professional staff. If you visit this hotel please stop by Concirege and say hi to Pablo Rivera, Janissa Colon, Indhira Payano, Pamela Reyes, Luis Perez, and Michael Tischler - I can guarantee they'll treat you like a star and make your stay a wonderful experience. Thank you guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bachelorette Getaway Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JenWalsh
Reviews.Content: La Concha Resort was a fantastic place to stay for a bachelorette getaway weekend! Our group consisted of 8 ladies, flying from NY, NJ, FL, and PA. Direct flights, and a quick cab ride ($15) made it really easy to get to La Concha by lunchtime. Once there, we had lunch (complete with delicious sangria), checked into our rooms, and went to the beach. After some late afteroon cocktails and gourmet munchies at the pool we went back to the rooms (great view of the ocean - even watched a wedding from our balcony), and got ready to go out. Although we already had reservations for dinner both nights in San Juan, Felix, the doorman helped us to quickly get taxi's wherever we needed to go. Felix was one of the highlights of our trip; he was happy, friendly, and enthusiastic about his job (see attached picture). Our second day was spent lounging by the main pool. All of the servers were prompt and helpful. We went to the hotel bar after dinner on the second night and were happy to find a fun croud and great music. We spent the third day at the small, adult only, infiniti pool, had lunch there (highly recommend the steak wrap), and sadly left for the airport. Overall, a perfect girls getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Staff is top shelf! Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JDM210
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a week and loved everything about it. The staff is extremely courtesy and the hotel is gorgeous. All employees are there to make sure you're stay is the best possible. If they ask you how your stay is going so far and you reply "it's good", their response is "how can I make it great?". I highly recommend this hotel for any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Felix Perez...quite possibly the friendliest person I have ever met”
Reviews.Author: JeannieGilbert
Reviews.Content: Felix Perez, is the best their is. Louise our concierge was the sweetest I have ever experienced. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JLWORD
Reviews.Content: After heavily researching San Juan Hotels on TripAdvisor - we chose La Concha based on its location, reviews, etc. GM Eddie Sipple, Director of Guest Services Luis Forty, and the staff from all departments of the hotel delivered a spectacular Easter Break that met or exceeded our expectations. Immediately on arrival, the bellman was very helpful and friendly. He gave us a good orientation of the property and great suggestions for dinner in the neighborhood. He was also a freindly face that welcomed us "home" every time we returned to the hotel. When we sadly had to leave - the bellman came to our room promptly at the time I had arranged the night before and had all of our baggage in a cab for the airport before I could do the final check-out. (By the way the bill was in perfect order unlike comments from some other people on this forum) Because we were with our 12 year old son and 3 year daughter, we were concerned about the music from the nightclub keeping them awake at night. The staff arranged for us to stay on the 5th floor in a junior suite overlooking the beach which was far enough away from nightclub area that the noise was not really a problem at all. Our room had an amazing view overlooking the Beach and the Ocean and was an absolute pleasure to stay in. Our kids argued about who got to sleep on the couch by the window to be able to wake up to the amazing view. The lobby and public areas were as great as they look in the pictures. There is always an electric feeling in the air in the lobby and you want to take in everyting that is going on. There are lush plants throughout the hotel that are maintained on a daily basis. The accommodations were very clean, well maintained, and comfortable. We did not experience any issues with the air conditioning not keeping up with the humidity even though it was a rainy time of the year and very warm during the days. The housekeeping staff serviced the room early in the day and went above and beyond to make animals for the kids and a "shirt and tie" for me out of towels. A very nice touch that made us rush back to the room every day to see what was going to be there. The concierge staff were very helpful in planning outings to Old San Juan, making dinner reservations, and helping us find a great Catamaran outing (highly recommended) as a day trip. The restaurants in the lobby, poolside, and the breakfast room all had a good offering at prices I would expect at a resort. We did not have dinner in the upscale restaurant for dinner so I cannot comment. We always felt safe at the property through the ever present security guards watching the beach area. Also, our daughter fell and hit her head at the poolside restaurant on the first day. We were impressed at the responsiveness of the staff and the arrival of a medic with a first aid kit within 2 minutes. The health club was a great facility and very relaxing to use the state of the art treadmills overlooking the Ocean. We would recommend choosing the La Concha property to anyone planning a trip to PR and are looking forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is TERRIBLE. Let me say it...”
Reviews.Author: RRinFLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is TERRIBLE. Let me say it again: TERRIBLE! after a renovation exceeding $200 million, one expects to be wowed by an experience. Beyond the oh-so-trendy lobby that struggles mightily to imitate W Hotels' Euro-chic, this property's management and staff would find it hard to hold jobs in fast-food restaurants. The service is non-existent and no one, from the hotel manager (one Mr. A. Arroyo), on down, even pretends to care about their guests' needs-- let alone what one's confirmed reservations suggest you should expect upon arrival. Unique to this property is the staffs' attitude that they are doing their patrons' a favor by merely showing up and taking up space. Yes, the lobby and pool areas have a great vibe, but do yourself a favor and check into another property and come here for drinks in the lobby bar or poolside, but then only if you can wait a minimum of 30 minutes for a cocktail server to bother to come to your table. This is a Renaissance/Marriott property. I'm a Marriott Platinum member. Loyalty means NOTHING at La Concha. Stay at the Conrad down the street. That hotel gets it.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha”
Reviews.Author: DrMott
Reviews.Content: Its a hotel and and nightclub all in one its amazing

Reviews.Title: “LOVE La Concha!!!”
Reviews.Author: KimFerguson
Reviews.Content: We have traveled all over the world and we both agree that we have never been treated as well by all of the hotel's staff than at the La Concha Resort. We did have to change rooms due to overscheduling and our particular room of choice was not ready on the day we arrived but everyone was so accomodating that we were not upset at all. The location pictures are a little misleading when you view the photos on their website. La Perla was not what we expected at all and we only ate there once. The property does seem to be in a renovation stage. We stayed 6 nights in the new building and it is definately worth requesting. We did enjoy 5 meals outside of the resort but honestly we enjoyed staying around Solera (the pool restaurant/bar, must try duck quesidillas) most of our visit. David Garcia was our most consistant waiter and he was fabulous!!! So friendly and attentive with genuine concern about our happiness during our stay (Hi David! from Vergara in 757!!). If you are going to totally relax and be made feel special La Concha is the way to go!! The beach is by far not the most beautiful but the staff more than makes up for it:). Another Tip: Champagne Sangria;)

Reviews.Title: “My 30th Wedding Anniversary proved that I'm NOT a Renaissance Man”
Reviews.Author: rfamily9
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that i have been a Platnum member in both the Starwood AND Marriott reward programs for many years which admittedly skews my expectations for hotel stays. However given that this was my 30th wedding anniversary AND the amount of prepartion with the hotel prior to my arrival, i felt this was an inexcusable experience. My wife and I arrived at the La Concha Resort 30 minutes sooner than I had told the hotel (in one of my 10 conversations leading up to my visit). So when we got to the front desk (which was very busy and stayed that way our entire visit) and they said "as a platinum Marriott member, your ocean view suite is currently being cleaned so you will need to wait a few minutes", we were not concerned because we could eat lunch in the restaurant and even gamble a little!!! Ninety minutes later, I decided to check back with the front desk since I had not received a phone call and to my surprise they told me that they REALLY didn't have an Ocean view room, but they could give me a "city view". I was a bit disappointed because I had told them several times the importance of my 30th anniversary and they had assured me "that they would make it VERYspecial", however we agreed to take the room because it was getting late in the day....BIG MISTAKE!!!!! We walked into a living room/kitchenette, and I could see that the entire room just wasn't "my style" because I like more traditional rooms instead of the urban modern style but regardless your taste, things weren't right in this room. For instance, three VERY small drawers to unpack into, REALLY? No luggage stands for luggage ( so I had to use our bedside end tables). No shower doors on the shower so water sprays out onto the bathroom floor, I asked for a feather free room due to my wife ( which is different than MY profile, but when she does travel with me, EVERY OTHER Marriott gets it right) our bed had feather pillows so I called down for foam pillows, only to have ONE Feather pillow delivered. Our view was absolutely awful as it overlooked a very noisy road with an endless supply of muffler free cars. The rest of our "CITY VIEW" was a Malaysian restaurant with rusted out billboards and a "Ocean" of rooftop cement buildings. Since we had pre-arriangned dinner reservations we got dressed and on my way out i went to the same front desk agent who checked us in and explained how unhappy we were plus they needed to deliver two luggage racks, several foam pillows and they needn't bother delivering the platinum "arrival gift" because we were going out to dinner. I even told her that if I could figure our how to change our flights (to Vieques Island) we would be leaving early. Well after a wonderful dinner outside the hotel I realized that at check-in no one told me about the components of my package, so I went to the front desk and requested my "matching money" for the casino (of course it would have nice to have that when I was IN the casino for an hour waiting on our room), and the VERY nice front desk agent (sorry i didn't get her name) not only gave us our coupons but also informed me of the breakfast area for platinum members that no one told us about at check-in. We went back to our room and two foam pillows HAD been delivered plus the "platinum arrival gift" which we had canceled and still no luggage racks. Other observations about these rooms were, they spent big dollars on kitchenettes but have no glasses, pots, pans, knifes, forks etc so basically it's useless. Furthermore if your fridge icemaker doesn't work (like ours), your out of luck because we NEVER found an ice machine on our floor. What we DID find on our floor (and in fact outside our room) was housekeeping carts!!! I guess they have no storage for them because they were outside our room the entire two days and between 7:15 and 9:00AM, I was apparently apart of a multiple person conversation with the housekeepers because I could hear every word they said as i sat in my bed.......if I only spoke Spanish!!! :) Believe it or not, i actually had two people who went out of their way to help us during our stay. First was Ricardo in Valet and Luggage. He was clearly the brightest spot during our stay and if everyone in the hotel had his attitude, they could really become a first class resort. Second was Michael Tishler who tried to fix my disaster on day two of my stay by having Champaigne and flowers delivered to my room. I must admit he took the brunt of my complaints and tried to resolve my issues but we already had a bad taste in my mouth however i absolutely give him a "A" for effort. I have been in business upper management for 30 years and i know one thing, experiences like this don't "just happen", they are excepted as an excuse by the General Manager (whom i asked for but never heard from during my stay) and I believe if he or she must except mediocrity so this is the type of experience EVERYONE will get. I will admit that i believe Renaissance appears to be trying to change their image (at least in their room decor) to attract a younger "more hip or trendy" clientele which doesn't suit my 50+ more traditional needs (and that's my fault for selecting a Renaissance Hotel) but the customer service was inexcusable and that shouldn't fly at any Marriott Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the beach! Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overview: We stayed her for a friend's bachelorette party and could not have been happier. We got 2 rooms last minute and found this hotel to be a great value. Highly recommend! Location: Right on the beach. This hotel is on a strip with many others. It's not too far from the airport and a short cab ride away from Old San Juan. Across the street from the hotel are some nice restaurants (highly recommend Budatai), as well as other quick eat places like Subway and Dunkin Donuts. I believe there's a grocery store nearby as well. Rooms: We got 2 queen rooms on the 6th floor. Each room was HUGE. There was a bedroom area with a balcony, a large, beautiful bathroom, and a living room area with microwave, fridge, pull out twin sofa bed and an eating area. The room is big enough to have a little party of your own in. The only thing to be aware of is that the shower side of the bathroom wall is kind of see through (although not completely), so you can basically see the person showering. TV in the bedroom was flatscreen and the room had free wifi. The design and decor were both excellent. Hotel grounds: Pretty big hotel. It has a nice workout facility. The hotel has several pools (including 2 beautiful infinity pools), so we never really had a issue finding a place to lay down - either by the pool or at the beach, where you get free lounge chairs and umbrellas. The pool area also has a restaurant and bar. The hotel also has a lounge, which looks like a regular bar when you enter the hotel, but at night, they bring in a DJ and it becomes more of a lounge. The hotel also has a mini casino and an arcade/game room for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: SonofBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights at La Concha during early August. While we stayed there the following other folks stayed there as well: the worldâ€™s richest man (Carlos Slim Helu), the LA Galaxy soccer team and its coach, Bruce Arena (ex. USA team coach) and most of the cast of the new Fast & Furious movie (how could someone on this forum say B-cast actors; guess you have never seen their past movies!!). Was an experience to ride the elevators or work out in the gym with a lot of them! So it was just fun to stay at the hotel and mingle with these folks. But the hotel was good for many other reasons. The room and beds were big enough for the 4 of us and we enjoyed the huge sea facing window/view. All staff were friendly and we did not have any check-in/out issues. The walls are also fine: we did not hear anything from the neighbors. We enjoyed the big waves in the ocean and the nice sand on the beach. It is a public beach but was kept very clean contrary to the many other public beaches we visited on the island. At night we swam in the nice hotel pool with the changing colorful underwater lights. Could not get towels after 6pm but the pools never closed. The hotel is very nicely situated near many restaurants. Best one we found is only 100ft away (Jose Jose). We actually first went to the nearby Walgreens and stuffed our hotel fridge with drinks, etc from there. Dunkin Donuts is across the street; we had breakfast there once and bought from them donuts which we took to the beach. We also enjoyed the Hotelâ€™s $12 Heaven cocktails during sunset but most of the drinks and food consumed on the beach we bought elsewhere (thatâ€™s the advantage of a public beach!). On weekend nights musicians played alongside the pool and we sat in a very cozy corner on comfortable couches (of which there are many) and listened to the nice music and had some good drinks. We really enjoyed that evening! The shower was great; you have 2 options: massive rain flood coming straight down or a traditional hand held device that can also be attached to the wall. When light bulbs had to be replaced they were replaced quickly. Felixâ€™s great smile was also always welcome. However, we had 3 issues: we arrived at circa 1am but never got our room cleaned that day during regular hours. Took several phone calls until finally someone came at 7pm. Then one day suddenly 4 of our 8 pillows disappeared. Ended up getting 2 back but the hotel did not seem to have had sufficient pillows for all guests?! Then one day we came back to the hotel room at 4.30pm after a day in the jungle, and found the door latch wedged between the door so that the door was not locked. Saw the maid on the other end of the corridor so it could have been like that for many hours (she must have left it like that after cleaning the room). Fortunately nothing had been stolen. So we loved the hotel and location but it is clearly not a 5 star experience. But we will go back definitely if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in a hotel EVER, stay anywhere but here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller13
Reviews.Content: The staff and service in this hotel are unparalleled in their incompetence. Adult pools are not informed, no towels are ever at the pools. If you want to stay on the beach you have to chase someone down to get chairs and bring your own towels. There is nothing upscale about this hotel. A significant portion of the rooms have a view of the getto or an atrium. The overall design is extremely poor! Poolside food is inedible!!! Do not ruin your vacation, stay anywhere but here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ! Top holistic service culture top to bottom!”
Reviews.Author: mejiau
Reviews.Content: From the first impact of eh Bell/valet parking staff all of them. SeÃ±or Felix Perez, extraordinary service goes beyond the extra mile to make the guess feel at home away from home. The five days stay was a great experience thanks to all the hotel staff culture of service. Keep it up La Concha !!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but the beach is not that good.”
Reviews.Author: alemargo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very hip, modern, and very clean. It is in Condado area which has touristy feel to it but not as much as the hotel strips by the airport. We walked around the neighborhood and totally felt comfortable and safe. We did have a certain LA soccer team staying there at the time and one of the B-list young actors as well. So it canâ€™t be that bad for this area. The hotel has white leather couches and light-wood furniture everywhere. No bathtub but great hand-held shower and overhead "rain" shower. Very romantic blue light right there in the shower. Very beautiful lighting on territory at night. Great pools open 24 hours. We swam every night in the gorgeous main pool with changing underwater lights. The service was great. We needed some extra sheets and then extra bath robes (very clean looking, provided) and both times the response was within 10 minutes. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive. Breakfast $12-18. Go outside. There are plenty of places for cheaper and the food is delicious. The Pearl restaurant is gorgeous but very high class. Prepare for $11+ for dessert and $30 for main course. You need a reservation. We went for dinner outside of the hotel but made reservation for dessert only. The portions are tiny but tasty. I wonder how big their main course portions are. There is a bar in the evening. DJs in bar and by the pools. Couldnâ€™t enjoy it much since my kid was too tired to stay up. Complimentary luggage storage is always a plus if you arrive before check in or leave later than check out. The beach is clean, beautiful. Chairs, umbrellas are complimentary for the guests. No vendors on the beach except a guy selling ices. The only complaint-the water on the beach was very rough. Not good for swimming. Water was very warm but big waves even for an adult. We walked to the Condado Conrad hotel beach. Step out of the hotel and walk to the right. It's about 15-20 min walk. If my 7-yearl old can do it in 90á´¼ weather- anybody can do it. Or you take a bus ($0.75). There is a great creamery on the way. Blueberry ice-cream was to die for. The water there is very still and clear, lots of fish. Good for snorkeling. The bad part is that itâ€™s 10 feet away from the road. If you continue walking further down, pass the bridge and walk through the Hilton hotel. There is the Escambron public beach. Also great for swimming (especially for little kids) and snorkeling. Just donâ€™t go during the weekend- very crowded and you wonâ€™t find a single spot under the trees for the shade. To summarize-I loved La Concha hotel. Highly recommend it and will definitely come back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Felix Perez and the Entire Crew were Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: ChiChoMeewah
Reviews.Content: The La Conch Resort is really awesome. This Renaissance has a lot of local flavor and they GET customer service. Felix Perez was so nice and provided us with local recommendations and any information we needed. He was genuinely excited to see us and provided us the best service. Thank you La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and staff but you should avoid the breakfast buffet at Level 25”
Reviews.Author: Dahyls
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a wonderful time at this hotel...excellent location, nice beach and very well maintained facility. The lobby is fabulous with water displays everywhere. I think this might be the nicest hotel in Condado. My one and only complaint was that they "allowed" the local birds to feed on the fixings at the omelet station at one of the restaurants Level 25. It was the most disgusting site I have ever seen. We were the first to arrive for an early breakfast to met by a bunch of birds picking thru the cheeses, tomatoes, and other fixings. I saw bird droppings in the cheese. The staffs response was only to chase them away and didn't throw the stuff out OR put a cover on it. My guess is these birds come here every morning for their breakfast and the staff seems fine with that. In fact, the person working the station was the ONLY person we met that was not pleasant and really seemed to hate their job. I would rate this hotel much higher if not for this total lack of management and concern for the customers health which virtually ruined our last day at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: loaded4bear
Reviews.Content: Yes check in is slow and yes the walls seem to be paper thin, but the staff, location, cleanliness, and pools make up for these shortcomings by far. For example, we had an issue with a cabinet door coming loose from the hinges in the room. Within minutes mainenance had come to the room and fixed the issue. When he was done, he thanked us for staying at the hotel and told us he hoped we would come back. A nice touch. There is a Wendy's next door, a Subway across the street, and a 24/7 Walgreens with a mini-grocery store three blocks away. Good dinner places are within four blocks either way of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You just can beat class.”
Reviews.Author: Maduro858
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and were very impressed from our arrival all throughout our stay. All encounters with staff were very pleasant and professional. We have been to several hotels that purport to be of this caliber but do not meet our expectations. Thanks for the wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: sarahg212
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is that I truly enjoyed my stay at La Concha. My friends and I were treated like VIPs. We were commenting on it our whole trip! Felix greets you the second you pull up to the hotel with the biggest smile and personality, Louise in at the concierge desk is very friendly and has great suggestions, Nefdavid makes sure every guest is taken care of and enjoying their stay. The pools are refreshing, food is yummy, the scene is vibrant. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY GREAT THING WAS THE FOOD”
Reviews.Author: arcsanciel
Reviews.Content: Having read good reviews of this hotel we decided to experience it ourselves. The hotel itself is in an excellent location and we found food to a very high standard. Everything we ate from breakfast, sandwiches, to tapas and even sushi were marvelous. I have no doubt that the kitchen staff and executive chef at La Concha are in between the best in Puerto Rico. We ate at other local restaurants around Condado but when we compare there was always better quality food at the Hotel. The service was terrible but the food was a real epicurious experience. Alcohol was too expensive, even local beer was $7. Local beer and rum should be cheaper. Check in process was too slow, we waited for our room until 8:00 pm, because the rooms where not ready. Also, while we waited at the bar paying expensive local beer we percieved a repugnant smell coming out of the bar. Can you belive that a gorgeous bar at a luxury hotel in front of the beach at a paradise island has not been cleaned!!! Where is the manager? At the pool area we had to wait for service like an hour to be notice and another hour to be served, and she was not even nice. Rooms were nice presented, but not necesirely perfectly cleaned. We found dust in some areas and hair on the bathroom. Beautiful location and property, but needs better staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for any persons of a variety of ages”
Reviews.Author: mbaxter44
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very plesant and treated us as friends...the doormen (Alexis [--] & Felix [--]) were very helpful and gave us great recommendations for dining and recreation...The concierge desk was happy to book all activities we had interest in pursuing, they even went as far as to contact us after hours for a snuba trip we we interested in. The pools were great for kids and adults and those traveling w/o kids there is an adult only pool on the backside of the hotel. Location of this facility was very convinent because it was close to the airport and Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was absolutely outstanding in every way.”
Reviews.Author: cgoomies724
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose La Concha for our friends and family to stay for our destination wedding in Puerto Rico. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are exquisite, and the staff and service is impeccable. However, the best thing about this hotel was how accommodating, friendly and welcoming the staff was. When we first arrived, the Doorman, Felix [--], made us feel so welcome it was like we were a guest in his home. He got to know everything about us, and took the time to greet us warmly every day. He also had a lot of great advice for places to go and things to do in the Condado and Old San Juan. Overall, he helped make our stay at La Concha so much better. Also, if you are planning an event at La Concha, Jessica [--] is outstanding. She made sure we were able to entertain our guests the way we wanted to. Her food and drink suggestions were a hit, and she made the hotel and its staff exceedingly available to us. Furthermore, housekeeping did a great job, and was always available when we needed them. La Concha is a great resort, not just for the scenery and accommodations, but for the people that made us feel so much at home.

Reviews.Title: “The real pro and cons”
Reviews.Author: Ama12
Reviews.Content: First, I'm puertorrican living in US and I was astonished on how such a beautiful place have such a terrible service in the front desk. I travel with a group of friends and is the first time in my life that a hotel delay the check in for FIVE (5) hours, and that happen to me and 3 more rooms of my group because the hotel apparently doesn't have cleaned rooms for the whole time. I got my room at 9:30 pm!!!! and believe me they're good remembering you the check out time. The other cons is that the new tower is so nice, but isn't clean as expected, there were not- mine- hair and the cleanliness needs improvement. The housekeeping was late every day. The bar is expensive as hell, even in Miami you will pay the price you have to pay here: $13 to 15 drinks n $7 local beer Medalla, and the service is quite slow. In the pool during the day you can easily wait 30 to 60 min for a drink... that's all my critique. PRO: The hotel is beautiful, great location, and the lounge at the lobby have a great trendy enviroment. The guys in the valet parking, pool service and luggage handling are excellent. Facilities, Pools, views and vibe are awesome. Casino, very nice. I just try to stay positive and I enjoy my trip, but I will think twice on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel...absolutely one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: malora003
Reviews.Content: With the negative reviews floating around trip advisor about this hotel we were reluctant to stay here. Im am glad we decided to stay here. We had a great experience at this beautiful hotel. The service, the food, and the hotel were top of the line. The hotel employees we encountered from the valet to the employees at the beach giving out towels were very friendly, helpful, and efficient. The room we originally booked online was the ocean view with balcony. When we arrived at the hotel at 9 pm we were told that the rooms were sold out. Without having to ask, she upgraded up to one of the condo suites in the new tower. The room was beautiful with amazing views to the ocean. The only thing i found weird was that the shower did not have a door and the floor kept getting wet. For us it wasnt a big deal just something worth metioning. The Lobby bar and the casino at night was fun and definitely a cool place to hang out. I could not see myself getting bored here. The hotel is in a perfect location with a variety of things to do in walking distance or a few mins by cab. The hotel facility was very clean, new and modern furniture and well kept up with. The pictures online of the hotel look nothing like it does in person. The hotel was absolutely beautiful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel-nice lounge!”
Reviews.Author: phillyphlyer40
Reviews.Content: Had a recent 2 night stay at this hotel. As a PlatPremier, had a nice upgraded room. Never noticed the noise many have written about. Conceirge lounge was EXCELLENT. Check-in staff kinda (island) slow. Lounge had 2-3 hot offerings nightly, and quite a spread. Mornings were superb as well. No free alcohol though. Did notice the casino was VERY empty and most table games were shut down, including roulette. Ended up walking to the Marriott to play a few bucks. Never used the beach so can not comment there. Overall a great, solid stay. Will definately be back to this hotel next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation experience!”
Reviews.Author: babipple
Reviews.Content: We're a couple in our 20s who came to Puerto Rico for a relaxing yet exciting vacation and chose La Concha based on the reviews that described it as a good place for young adults. We were not disappointed at all! However, the resort seemed far from a place for young adults only. We saw many older couples and families with small children, and all seemed to be having a great time. We were a little nervous about the service after reading several reviews complaining of poor service, but saw NOTHING to back this up. The service we received was nothing less than phenomenal, from the bell boys, to the guys working valet (especially Ronald, who introduced himself as "Ronald, you know, like Ronald McDonald!"), to the housekeeping staff, to the front desk workers, to the wonderful concierge. We were especially impressed with Lily at the front desk and Louise at the concierge. We asked for an upgrade upon arrival at the hotel and were offered an oceanview room on a higher floor at no extra charge if we did not mind waiting for them to finish getting the room ready (we arrived late in the afternoon). She was not able to give us an exact time of when our room would be ready, but we didn't mind waiting and took the time to explore the beach and pool areas. Our room ended up being ready in about 30 min and we were so happy with what we got. Beautiful, very clean room with a gorgeous view of the beach. We also did not have any problems with always having plenty of towels, which were restocked daily without us having to ask- though this seemed to be a problem for some other guests in the previous reviews we read. Louise was beyond helpful in helping us book our excursions of choice... She couldn't have made it easier for us! We did not eat at the hotel much except for lunch at the poolside bar, but we were expecting that based on what we read about the resort prices. There are some great restaurants within walking distance with much more reasonable prices so we didn't mind at all. Pools are very clean and well-kept. Our shower head was broken and the shower could have been just a little cleaner, but other than that-- an absolutely great hotel! Spend a little time in the casino, too... pretty mellow for a casino but very FUN environment; the dealers were very personable and there to make sure everyone at the table had a good time. The icing on the cake was that a movie was being filmed nearby so there were a few famous people staying at La Concha at the same time as us. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is very highly recomended.”
Reviews.Author: tavo6969
Reviews.Content: all the staff was very nice and everybody when out of their way to serve us better. the security team was out of this world outstanding. my family and i felt very safe and secured. especially security supervisor jose rivera and his officers team. security when out of their way to help us with directions and chosing the fine restaurants on the property. i have three girls and every time they were at the common areas they felt very safe. we travel alot around the world and we never felt so safe like being at la concha. thank you for the awesome service and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Kids and Adults in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MisterBentley
Reviews.Content: My family recently stayed at the La Concha hotel in San Juan. My husband had business in the area and my daughter and I came along for the ride. The hotel was very reasonably priced. We had a suite for less than one would pay for a regular room in NYC. The hotel is situated a short drive from Old San Juan which is great for shopping and eating. Pros of the hotel: 1. Reasonably priced 2. Ocean view rooms have floor to ceiling windows which give a great view. 3. The hotel was quiet (we stayed on the 10th floor) 4. Great steak sandwich available by the pool. 5. Hotel is on the beach, and the pool is not crowded. 6. The staff was all very nice. I particularly liked the valet named Felix Perez, he was very happy and recommended some good restaurants. Also there was a woman working the concierge who was a ray of sunshine. She helped us book a trip to the bio bay. 7. There is a kids menu at the pool restaurant, breakfast, and room service. It is reasonably priced. 8. Free wifi in the rooms! Cons: 1. Could have been cleaner. 2. Room service takes a really long time. 3. Food is expensive for adults at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “liked it but....”
Reviews.Author: madisonavenu
Reviews.Content: my husband and i were there for our honeymoon. we arrived sunday nigt and were immediatly upgraded to a partial ocean view room with a balcony so we were happy. the hotel is in a great location lotsof small shops nearby. duncan doughnuts, subway, wendy's and a wallgreens within walking distance and right across the street! we eagerly woke up the next morning for our free continental breakfast, but got to the stand and was told our corporate discount only gave us $15.00 per person and only included orange juice, fruit coffee and croussants that were room temperature. each item had a price on them so we were limited to what we could get. so every morning we left hungry. thankfully duncan doughnuts was across the street!! around the corner there was breakfast with eggs, biscuits, sausage..the works. we went there thinking it was continental too only to see on our bill when we left charges of $38.00!!! and all we got was eggs and oatmeal!!! For the money we spent that was so rediculous that we couldnt get a real continental breakfast. the food outside of the hotel is much cheaper although we did try the burgers and they were great although overpriced. To be honest the hotel itself is wonderful. the staff is great very nice and overall we loved it. the casino was so much fun!!! the only other problem is that we would leave our room at 8am and come back around 1pm and our room would not be changed over or cleaned. we would come back arond 3 and still no clean towels. we had to call down to the front desk everyday to have someone give us fresh towels. we had to complain about this at the end of our stay and we got a credit off our bill. For the money we paid the breakfast was lousy and the room service was lousy but the hotel is great however there is no spa.. we would come back again if they fixed these issues.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Service outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: mammec01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great amenities and food! The Concierge staff was excellent and made great recommendations on various activities ranging from excursions to fine dining in the San Juan Area! Would stay there again! Louise, Sebastian, and Francisco provided outstanding concierge assistance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service”
Reviews.Author: picozzilovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My stay at the La Concha was a great experience the staff at the Ocean Lounge Luis, Pablo was very nice and Michael Tischler was excelent and alway was available to help. I am looking forward to coming back and will recemend it to my friends & family .I love this hotel . Best regartds, Reha Picozzi .

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ReineS
Reviews.Content: My brother in law knew of this hotel because while he was staying with a friend in San Juan on a previous visit, he had drinks in the lobby. He said the hotel seemed very luxurious, so after checking out the pictures, we decided it was a nice enough place. I traveled there with my sister for a girl's getaway. We arrived a little bit earlier than check-in and were told that our room wasn't ready yet, so we decided to to out to eat. When we returned after lunch, our room was still not ready...so we explored the hotel grounds, during which, we ran into a very well known, very big name celebrity! Turns out, he and two other very well known, very popular celebrities were staying at the La Concha while filming a movie in San Juan! Very cool experience. When our room was finally ready (45 minutes after check-in), we immediately changed into our swimsuits and went back down on the beach, which was pretty impressive. Of course there's trash, but you can see that the hotel workers are trying to keep it clean....but I guess you can't stop people from throwing cigarette butts/trash on the ground. The workers on the beach were very helpful and kind. One of the best features of the hotel was that you get free use of the beach chairs and umbrellas all day. I also loved being able to order food and drink while lounging on the beach. Our 11th floor room was lovely. The room featured a full wall of windows, which showed off an amazing view of the beach and ocean. The people were lovely and helpful and seemed very eager to please no matter what the request or inquiry. The fitness center was clean and stocked with advanced equipment. My only issue was that the food and drinks were EXTREMELY expensive (cocktails seemed to start at $11)...although they were delicious, you can find local restaurants that provide better food at a cheaper price. It was the nicest hotel I think I've ever stayed in...and seeing as though I always only stay in Starwood hotels, I was pleasantly surprised by this Renaissance establishment. Will definitely go back if I'm able to make it down to San Juan again!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel's manager and staff offer top-notch customer service on every level”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelers13
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have returned to this lovely hotel, due to Michael(Manager) and his incredible staff. Each and every time we are blown away by their hospitality, attitude and amazing customer service. It is truly for these reasons that we keep returning. We would high recommend this hotel due to is managerial staff who really care. Michael is just fantastic!!! Jill Fleekop & Dennis Isaacson

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerrysempre
Reviews.Content: I visit PR for work every six months or so and this was my third stay at La Concha, This is a beautiful and well maintained property. The staff are friendly and the beach is the best in San Juan. While all the staff are extremely friendly, two people stood out for me - Sebastian at the front desk and Alberto at Komakai sushi bar (part of the resort). If the general manager or the owner are reading this - congratulations on the great hire.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bill_s96
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 5-8, 11-12. Great hotel, loved the Adult only pool on the beach outside the Ocean Club. Got a suite with a spectacular view of the ocean and it was so comfortable. Great friendly staff. Use the C53 or B21 bus to get to Old San Juan it's only .75c. There is a free trolley that runs in Old SJ ride it all the way around. Eat Mufongo at Cafe Puerto Rico. From Old SJ take the free ferry across to tour the Bacardi Rum.

Reviews.Title: “One mans treasure could be another mans trash”
Reviews.Author: xfactor00
Reviews.Content: So I just got back from 10 days in San Juan at the La Concha resort. I am a Platinum Premier member with Marriott so I had the choice of staying that this resort or the Marriott about 2 blocks down for the exact same number of points. Reviews of both hotels were very positive and most of the guide books gave both hotels one of their "favorite" awards. I choose the La Concha because it seemed a little different from the regular Marriott properties and most reviews said it was a romantic setting that was more adult focused. After staying at the hotel - I can clearly see why many view it as a very romantic hotel. On the weekends there are candles placed around the walk ways while a live band plays by one of the pools. There are lots of oversized chairs and couches to lounge on while you enjoy the night. There is also a nice "adult" pool that is away from the other pools and it is very peaceful at this pool. The bar area in the lobby is very open and the set up seemed very nice compared to most other hotels. We went down to the Marriott - just to see how it compared. The lobby in that hotel was much darker and felt a lot more crowded (not because of the people - just a lot of furniture everywhere). The hotel itself looked fine - but you could clearly see a big difference in the openness and colors of the La Concha resort. The hotel is broken into two sections - I assume that the first section (facing the ocean) is the original hotel and the other section (only the end faced the ocean) is the newer building. We were given a room on the top floor (12th) of the older building. Only the 12th floor has a balcony with a table and chair - the other rooms either had a small walk out balcony or nothing at all. The rooms themselves were very clean and everything seemed to be in good condition. The view from the balcony was great - straight out to the ocean with the shell shaped restaurant below us. Every employee we spoke with was very friendly and always quick to help. We never had anybody working on "island time" - either at the hotel or around the island. So that is all the good. As I said - trash and treasure. So every weekend the have a live band playing out by the pool - which is great if you want to listen to the band - not so great if you don't because the way the hotel is designed - you hear everything that goes on around the pool. Also - the pools do not close and for some reason people like to take their children out to the pool at all hours. I remember one night I woke at 2 am to hearing kids screaming with excitement as they enjoyed their time at the pool. We were on the 12th floor - I could only imagine how much those on the lower floors enjoyed the kids excitement. We spoke with the hotel after a couple of days - they suggested we call down if it happened again - but since there is a security guard at each pool 24 hours - not sure why they do not enforce a decibel rule after say midnight. Also for those that love wild life - birds are great - for those that like sleep - birds that have an ear cracking mating call that started every morning at sunrise until about 9 am - not so great. Let's be clear - I am not talking about some chirping either. This was a constant sound that rivaled any car alarm. The first time it happened - people went out the front balcony to see what the heck the sound was. We could not figure it out until we went walking one morning and figured it was coming out of the trees. After listening to it a couple of days - you could actually start picking up on when one bird finished and another would either "respond" or start their own call. So bottom line - if you are one who goes to bed very late and gets up very early - none of this will be an issue for you. Or if you are a very heavy sleeper - not a problem as well. But if you come out of that deep sleep - it does get old quick. Oh about those very friendly employees - another trash/treasure - they are so friendly - when the cleaning staff is working - they will stand just outside your door and talk about what ever is the subject of the day (of course in Spanish so I have no clue what they are saying). All in all - nice hotel but if you are in the older section of the hotel - you will most likely hear a lot more noise than you want. If you want a hip place to say - I would say it is the place. If you are a little older and not as "hip" - pick another location. BTW - there a lots of small dive like places to eat around the hotel- we tried a lot of them and found all but one to be very good. For the one bad - my guess is I just picked the wrong dish. But the prices in this area are much higher than they should be.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip and fun with great blend of beach and city”
Reviews.Author: utfiero
Reviews.Content: Arrival experience: We arrived around 10:00 p.m. during a huge party in the lobby. The place was hopping with a techno DJ and people dressed to the 9s (including a ton of women in min-skirts and well-dressed men). Staff were very pleasant and welcoming. Room (general): Super modern, nice flat screen TV, good use of limited space, great windows that actually open. We had an ocean view room, which was very nice. Mini refrigerator was nice, but one cup micro coffee maker wasnâ€™t great. Bathroom: Shower only in bathroom and the shower was only partially enclosed resulting in a very wet bathroom floor after every shower. Shower looked cool but was not practical. One light in the shower was burned out. It had plenty of shelf space. Bed: Good bed. Houskeeping: Horrible! Housekeeping did not believe in vacuuming. Restaurants: n/a We didnâ€™t eat on site but were impressed by the variety including a sushi bar. Awesome Malaysian restaurant is right across the street. Bar: Very cool. Also, bellman directed us to a liquor store two blocks down the street. Grounds: Well maintained Pool: Multiple small pools including an infinity edge pool overlooking the beach. Staff attitude/service: Excellent staff from valet to concierge. Concierge lined up a scuba dive for us. Perks for status: Free breakfast and evening snack in the club but no room upgrade. Parking: Valet on-site had great service. Misc: Everyone in the hotel speaks English. Beach is great but not limited to hotel guests. Ice cream vendor had great local coconut ice cream and delivered to our beach chairs. All the locals know the hotel as â€œLa Conchaâ€� so donâ€™t call it Renaissance. For some high-res photos of this hotel, check out my photos on Flickr. My username on Flickr is utfiero.

Reviews.Title: “A great base camp for an awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: publius358
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the July 4th weekend and I must admit it was just great overall. When we checked-in, for some reason our travel agency didn't pass along my Marriott Rewards info or my room preferences. So the manager (who checked us in because the lobby was full of folks doing the same) complimentary upgraded us to an ocean-view suite in their newer tower. The room was absolutely huge! Very clean, spacious, and modern features all around. The resort itself is huge with multiple swimming pools, several restaurants and bars, a casino, a fitness room, a private beach with service, etc. I don't think that I even found all of the service areas. The resort is also very conveniently located in El Condado along Ashford Ave. so it very close and in walking distance to several trendy restaurants, clubs, shops, etc. Another great service La Concha had was the concierge desk, and esp. Sebastion. He worked the PM shifts when we were there, but he was always courteous and always without fail gave 100% great suggestions on where to eat, stay, see, etc. I hope that he gets a raise or promotion! Even though La Concha was fabulous overall, there were some not-so-great experiences: -Valet was slow in bringing our bags to our room (2 hours) after check-in. I think that it was because they were swamped with new guests coming in for the holiday weekend. Nonetheless, 2 hours is a little excessive esp. after two phone calls. -HVAC system in the room initially did not cut off after reaching the desired temp. We told the front desk and it was fixed the next day. However, due to the fix, whenever the desired temps were reached and the compressor cut off, condensation began to form in the room due to the humidity. -During our entire stay, there was no hotel directory/guide. We notified the front desk of this twice and both times they said we were supposed to have one and would fix it. However, we never did get a guide book. Again, overall, the resort was great and I'd definitely stay here again if in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MACJacksonville_FL
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the La Concha in June for a friends wedding weekend. The hotel was pleasantly beautiful, and located right on the beach. Being from Florida and living at the beach we were pleased. The service was very nice, we did have some problems with check in and with our bill ( but we noticed that others were having the same problem, but the staff compsensated us properly at the end of our stay. which worked out fine) The room was great, we had an oceanview room, which was beautiful The room had a king bed and flatscreen tv, & full stero system.
