The best part was the bathroom was huge!! Did have some issues with the shower, but once we discovered it's "quirks" we were good. The hotel has a casinowhich we used on night and several differnt restraunts and bars. We ate there some but it was very pricey. I highly recomend this little mexican place across the street that my husband and I ate at, we had a few beers and some tacos and it was great! & cheap! There are several other places close by like a subway, dounkin doughnuts, and even a Walgreens on the corner if you forget anything. This location is also very close to Old San Juan. We took a cab into the city where there you can walk around...fare around $15-20. Overall stay at this hotel was great!!! The best part about it while we were there we had several celebrities staying there that we got to get some great photos of!! We would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: knikatknight
Reviews.Content: We decided on La Concha despite some of the mix reviews and glad that we did. We traveled with our two children ages 10 and 15. The staff are friendly and welcoming the moment we stepped out of the cab from the airport. Check in was a little slow but worth the wait. Booked trip with Orbitz and experienced some problems booking the room but once arrived they handled everything and was given an ocean front room at no extra charge. The staff went out of their way to handle any issues. Hotel decor was very South Beach and location very convenient. Short distance from Old San Juan and walking distances to several restaurants. Several swimming pools but were smaller than expected based on website photos. We had no issues with housekeeping. We left for the beach early mornining and room was cleaned with plenty of towels by noon each day. Food was good and little overpriced but expected for this type of hotel. Service was great at the pools and beach. Tips are appreciated and a few dollars goes a long way. Never had issue with chairs or umbrellas. We did stay during the week so it may be a problem on the weekends but I am sure if you brought it to the attention of the staff they would handle. Overall a great hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the 'upgrade'. Mixed experience - friendly, but wanting more.”
Reviews.Author: Talaga_LA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights over 4th of July 2010. Doubt I'll be back. Arrived very late thurs pm & front desk thanked me for being good Marriott rewards cust (nearly 40 night so far this year). As such told they 'upgraded me to a suite'. Nice room (bit Spartan in the living room, nice bath & bedroom), but missing the oceanview I paid extra for. Instead, I had a lovely view of a parking lot & a noisy street (loud bar music & car scene). At least it had a balconey. It was past midnight, but I went to the front desk to ask for an oceanview room. After some hassle, they gave me a decent room w/ 2 queens instead of a king (no 'upgrade' w/ the oceanview & no balconey, but a nice wall of glass overlooking the ocean. Overall pleased w/ the room- nicely updated in retro style like rest of hotel. But it was bright as hell in the morning, even w/ the shades pulled. Nice towels, linens, tv, etc. There are 3 pool areas available w/ 1 small pool dedicated to adults. Biggest pools & main beach access loaded w/ kids (hate to see this place during busy season). Lounge chairs ran out on Sunday & I assume they will during the busy season. Plus there are few umbrellas that are taken quite early (before 9am during slow season) At least the staff is very friendly & there are plenty of chairs available on the beach (be sure to tip the staff for setting up the chairs - staff is very good here). Drinks & food are typical resort prices ($5-10 for drinks, $20 for lunch sandwich/wrap). Overall, I'd say this is a decent place if you only want a beach vacation, but beware the 'upgrade' where they'll try to give your oceanview to higher paying guests. Plus there are better (& mucho cheaper) places in Mexico. I'm not really sure why people come here, unless you're a newbie like me or in search of an apparently good gay scene (shared taxis w/ some DC guys who filled me in on the skinny). If you're looking for culture/architecture/restaurats/nightlife, I'd recommend staying in Old San Juan ($12 + tip cab ride away - where I'll stay if I come back). Overall, I think La Concha is a typical beach resort. Nothing stands out & it is beach resort expensive.

Reviews.Title: “awesome bachelorette party”
Reviews.Author: nubiadowns
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best trips I have ever taken, the resort was amazing. The service was helpful and friendly, everything we asked for was provided for our party. We all felt extra special, the location is just a few minutes from everything, beautiful view of beach and city. A perfect combination of fun, excitement and relaxation. The staff was extraordinary got to know them all by names that's how welcome they made us feel. A special thanks to the Bell/Parking staff, always giving us a smile Felix, Noel, Henry. and of course Mr. Torres for managing a great team. Thanks to all, you made this a experience we want to relive. A resort like this with such wonderful service and sites is hard to come by. I totally recommend everyone to try it, you will not forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: JayPS78
Reviews.Content: We went to La Concha for our honeymoon and stayed in a 2 room suite. The views from the room were gorgeous overlooking the atlantic ocean. The staff was friendly, but the front desk always seemed to be understaffed. They have a couple of infinity pools that overlook the beach and a large pool attached to the lobby. It reminded me of a trendy hotel you might stay at in South Beach. At night the lobby turns into a music hot spot with bands and a dj. We had dinner at Perla, the main restaurant at La Concha and the the food was excellent. The food at the pool bar is also very good. They also have a sushi bar in the lobby. I'm not sure Puerto Rico is known for it's sushi, although there are a lot of sushi restaurants in San Juan. We tried a highly recommended sushi bar nearby, and the one at La Concha was much better. They have a casino attached to the hotel, with all the usual table games and slots. We didn't spend too much time there, but it was a nice option to have. I would recommend this hotel for younger people that enjoy nightlife and don't mind loud music at night.

Reviews.Title: “SoBe in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: simplecity
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in San Juan but the La Concha resort was a fabulous place to stay. It felt like we were in a posh Miami resort with free cabanas on the beach, multiple infinity pools, and great drinks. The rooms were very clean and modern. And the concierge was very helpful in helping us coordinate excursions and give us directions around PR. There are also high end shopping strips near by and some great restaurants. The small place across the street had some great mofangos!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: jph51350
Reviews.Content: Resort Hotel on Ocean in San juan. 60's architecture- the building resembles "The Jetsons". The neighborhood is marginal-grafitti all around, trash in streets. Alot of Puerto Rico is this way, and seediness can be offset by good cheap restuarants on the street. Room was fine-. Room was great- ocean front with terrace. Casino is fun. Employees pleasant. Signature resturant is very good-"gourmet" style presentations and portions. Fitness center excellent. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christianrocafuerte
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel. i think it is the best choice for san juan. I recommend this to everyone. It has a great pool and food. It also has a great beach and excellent location. At first i was concerned about this hotel because the reviews say that they had a lot of noise but i did not think so i did not hear any noise and had a great night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “More form than function”
Reviews.Author: Kareneez
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful hotel (except for the Xmas-y green and red light scheme in the lobby) and nice looking rooms. Great fitness center. We found the staff to be very nice. However, much of the public space (bathrooms) and surfaces were not very clean. If you're going to use slick glass and metals to give a contempory look to everything, they have to be clean and polished always. Guests should know that if they have a preference for firm beds, they won't find those here-they were the squishy (not fluffy) type. The phone next to our bed wasn't working and they were unable to fix that. And there were hordes of high school prom kids staying in many of the rooms, many to each room. Isn't there some standard for renting rooms to under-age children? Also, bar glasses and cigarettes in the pool are a health-hazard.

Reviews.Title: “First time in PR and loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: apokeguy
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott's rewards member and they had a promo, stay 2 nights get the 3rd night free. I decided to splurge a little and upgrade to the oceanfront room, about $175 a night. I'm glad I did. The view from our room was beautiful. Cab ride from the SJU airport was $15 and was about a 10 minute ride. Just walking into the lobby you're already in for a treat. Zen like designs and very modern looking and the bar with the giant screen with the World Cup on was enticing. Check in was rather slow but I can't complain as I was checking in early (around noon) and lots of people were checking out. They were very accommodating and checked my bags and took my phone number so I would receive a call when my room was ready. That gave me time to walk around the area and grab a bite to eat ( I highly recommend the Latin Star restaurant which is 2-3 blocks away). I received a call about 2 hours later saying my room was ready. The concierge we had was helpful and courteous. Not bad looking as well. Her name is Alejandra. The room was more than I expected. Not your typical hotel look, but very modern looking. King size bed (most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in yet) with a leather headboard, a leather chaise and ottoman. Modern looking desk with leather seat chairs. Nice flat screen tv and plenty of closet space and an in room safe. The room didn't have your typical lamps with on/off switch. Each lamp had a sliding dimmer switch, very nice touch. The AC worked like a charm. Only complaints about the room were: the balcony door didn't lock, the walk in shower had no door and the tiles were somewhat dirty (but the rainfall style showerhead made up for it) and the sink stopper needed to be fixed. Housekeeping was a little disappointing. They didn't restock the toiletries the second night nor did they replace the bathmat. But we had our own toiletries and just used a spare towel as a bathmat. The pools should definitely be checked out. There are 3 infinity pools, 2 of which have a view of the beach/ocean. You can actually go right from the beach to the pools (obviously using the showers to clean off first). Didn't get a chance to use the outdoor seatings by the pool as it was raining on/off during our trip. I actually enjoyed the intermittent rain and I've never experienced being in the ocean or pool during rain (but once I heard thunder, I got my butt out of the water). The beach seemed like a private beach as there weren't that many beachgoers, maybe 15-30 people at most. The beach chairs are free to use if you are a guest at the resort. The water is a little rough as you would expect since it is the north side of the island and there weren't any rock lines to break the waves. But the waves are perfect for bodyboarding. Location was great. Condado is not too far from Old San Juan. There is a bus stop (take B21 or C53 to the last stop in Old San Juan) right in front of the hotel that brings you to Old San Juan although their buses left a lot to be desired. They run about every 20-30 minutes and are old running buses. But I'm from NYC, so comparing NYC bus system to PR is like comparing apples and oranges. The ride cost $0.75 each way and the ride itself was about 10 minutes. I did not try any of the hotel restaurants as you would expect any hotel restaurant to be pricey. Business center had 3 terminals available. But there is free wireless internet in the hotel. I would have loved to stay longer than the 3 days I was there but I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I was in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has very, very serious service problems.”
Reviews.Author: BlueEyedMavrick
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I used to be not only be a manager in the hotel guest service business, but I used to work for the Marriott and Ritz-Carlton branded hotels. As a gal that usually is 110% content at a very value-based hotel such as La Quinta or Holiday Inn, I urge this hotel to clean house and get stronger leadership from the very top. My experience should be an embarassment to the Renaissance brand. I also want to say that the Front Office Manager Michael Tischler did his very best to work with me on my negative experiences. He was empthatic and helpful, and I am grateful for his assistance. But I know from experience that this hotel is in over its head and has bitten off more than it can chew, and I feel badly for Michael because I know that dealing with these large issues is exhausting and unrewarding. I did so much research on this hotel, drooled over the photographs on Trip Advisor, and I could rattle off the details of the hotel before I arrived. I was intensely excited to arrive at La Concha for my solo trip, a 4-night, 5-day stay. I bragged to my friends the accolades of my guest room and the service I would receive. Check-in was a nightmare. I was told that I would not be getting the oceanview room that I had paid for on Expedia. I was asked to show proof I had booked it, so I logged into my Expedia account *at* the front desk to prove that I had booked it, since it was not in the hotel's system. They said they were sold out of the oceanview rooms, and that it was impossible for me to have one. So, I was given an 'upgrade' in the new wing, not facing the ocean. I thought, sure, I'll work with the hotel, not against it. So I go into the room, isolated in some creepy corner. No curtains in the window in the shower which faced other buildings, no garbage cans, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, no desk, no chair, no place to put a laptop. No directory, no clock, and behind some slated wall was some sort of engine or pump that was very loud. This was no upgrade; it was 1/3rd of the size of the room I had paid for. After trying to deal with these issues over the phone without success, I went back down to the lobby. I had to be a squeaky wheel. This was not the experience that I had paid for. Michael Tischler helped me get the oceanview room that I had booked. I was very content. This is the room that I paid for. Michael did his best with service recovery. He sat down with me and apologized and offered to treat me to dinner at Solera, which is the restaurant outside near the ocean, off of the lobby. Unfortunately, this experience made my blood go back to a boil. I awkwardly seat myself after 20 restaurants workers mulling around socializing give me weird looks. I was expecting a warm welcome; Michael told me that the restaurant staff was expecting me because I experienced some troubles upon check-in. I was the *only* person there. I wait 10 minutes for the waitress to sulk over and reluctantly take my order. 10 minutes later, I still hadn't received my soda. So I went to the bar to get it. The waitress watches me do it. I go back and sit down. 10 minutes later, the food arrives. It's fine. I need more soda. I wait for waitress to come back and check on me so I can get more soda. She never does. I go back to the bar to get more soda. The waitress watches me do it. I go back to my food, take a few more bites, and at this point, I'm seething mad that I had chosen to come here, I walked out and told Michael Tischler what happened. Again, he tried his best to soothe me, and I was grateful, but honestly, it failed. Beyond this, the rest of my experience was very disappointing. I can honestly say that there was only one employee who smiled at me the entire time. It was one of the doormen/valets. He was so friendly. After years of giving out warm smiles to weary travelers dumping money at my place of employment, I got none from the desk attendants, barstaff, nobody. So disheartening... isn't anyone interested in making me feel welcome? Housekeeping service was mediocre, inconsistent and spotty. Some days I received replenishment of water and toiletries, sometimes I didn't. Sebastian at the concierge desk was helpful, as was another gentleman that I cannot remember his name. Honestly, readers, the only thing that lifted my spirits were a few of the excursions. I LOVED the horseback riding in the foothills of the rainforest and on the beach. The guide even understood how important photos are, and we had a photo op with our horses right on the beach! Very, very exciting, please try it! I also did a snorkeling trip to Flamenco Beach on the high-speed catameran. The boat crew and the lunch were phenominal. Great value; all you can eat food and DRINKS for something around $100 which includes snorkeling and a trip to the beach. I recommend without reservations!! Also, Tantra indian restaurant in OSJ was excellent, as was the PR food place directly across the street from the hotel. Delicious. Also, the spa across the street does in-room massages for $85. Mine was excellent, I also highly recommend that. The Italian restaurant Il Postino behind the Subway is also outstanding; went there twice. The hotel too many bar backs, servers, busboys mulling around, but not enough front offifce staff. There was always a back-up at the concierge and front desk. PBX (aka the people who answer when you press "0") seemed to be staffed pretty well. My last night on the way back from dinner, I witnessed a Marriott Platinum Member still trying to get into his oceanview room. It was 7 PM, and he was still unable TO BE CHECKED IN. Here is a PLATINUM member unable to get any level of service. I spoke with him and his wife and urged him to speak to Michael about his issues. They were appalled, as I was. Platinum members are the cash cows of Marriott, and he should have been assigned to an oceanview room by the Rooms Controller, which I doubt this property even has, given as though he can't even check at such an absurdly late hour. Sad. Very sad. For 4 nights, I spent almost $900 to stay here, and I didn't split that with anyone. Knowing what I know now, I could have saved myself the trouble, booked at some value-based property, and spend the extra $500 on something else. If you are expecting warm, welcoming, well-executed service, I don't feel this is the place for you. Sure, the property is gorgeous, but quite honestly, I've had superior experiences at bare-bones properties. To the GM of La Concha; you have a deeply troubled hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to wait hours for what you...”
Reviews.Author: Lucycanyon
Reviews.Content: If you want to wait hours for what you need, stay here, if you have tons of money to spend in order to be treat right then stay here, if you want rude employees then stay here, if you want a noisy place then stay here, if you want to keep calling house keeping for everything that the room is missing, then be my guest and STAY HERE. This place even get flooded when it rains!!! If you want Good service, nice people and have peace then stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 30th Birthday! THE HOTEL IS A MUST STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NWilder
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha to celebrate my 30th birthday this past winter (january), and not only was Puerto Rico gorgeous and the people so friendly, the hotel staff and our room made it the best birthday vacation ever! I must start with that my husband and I ventured all around the island on foot by bus and by car, and the location of La Concha is so perfect. Its a great little shopping area, but it is also close to Old San Juan, great restaurants, and places to go (dance, etc). Since I am a frequent traveler on business and leisure my expectations are very high, well if it was possible, it was surpassed! Upon arrival, we were a little early for check in, but the ladies at the front desk were very helpful. We were upgraded to the little villas located adjacent to the actual hotel. It was like a little private getaway from the hotel. I loved it..Your own entrance, awesome balacony, beautiful decor, and a feeling of seclusion. I can't tell you how often we utilized the hot tub that overlooked Condado. It was sooo relaxing, the beach was great, and even the workout facilities get a thumbs up. The fitness room is equipped with a trainer and even classes such as spin or pilates!!! I will never stay anywhere else. This hotel has everything you could possibly want!... I must say a few times we went across the street to the subway for the frozen drinks!...thats something you don't see stateside...alcohol sold in a subway!...However, we tried many many restaurants in the area and so we did not have a chance to test out the hotel. La Bambanera (sp) in Old San Juan is a breakfast must! The best coffee and "toast" you ever had...But the best restaurant of all was JAM! OMG the cuisine was divine!!!! I wish I could have bottled up the food/recipes and took it home with me! I am so thankful for the spunky red head at the front desk that suggested it! BTW she was so awesome, I enjoyed her stories, her kindness, but most of all her helpfulness. She truely went over and beyond! All in all I must say my 30th was very memorable, not only for reaching a milestone, but for one of the greatest vacations we've had and first post baby :) ....I was so in need of relaxation and luxury and that is definitely what we got!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: lelepolish
Reviews.Content: I just came back from San Juan yesterday and we stayed at La Concha Resort. This was the most amazing hotel I've ever stayed at and I travel quite a bit. My friends and I were there for a bachelorette party, had our room on the 8th floor, ocean frong, it was amazing. Food in the hotel was incredible, especially eggs benedict:) When we first got to the hotel, the lobby took my breath away, so clean and beautiful, very contemporary. The staff was so nice, went out of their way to satisfy our every need. The hotel has 3 different outside pools, one in the middle, and two infinity pools, and lots of cabanas, enough room for everyone to have their own get away and relax. The beach is so clean and private. The moment the staff saw us going to the beach, they would bring us the beach chairs, so accommodating. I will definitely go back to the same hotel, it was an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_S_1963
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Concha with my college age son in June for five nights. The staff was the most friendly and professional we encountered in Puerto Rico (the concierge (Freddie) was outstanding). Food was top notch and the rooms were very nice. The common areas are well kept and lively. Casino was amoung our favorites. Don't miss the small Mexican restaurant across the street - good food and cheap beer. Side trips included rain forest, bio-bay kayaking, Culebra snorkeling/kayaking and San Juan siteseeing. Would highly recommend a rental car and all of our sidetrips. View from fitness center was best I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lyndiva
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Marriot properties as much as possible when I travel for either business or pleasure. My new husband and I were on our honeymoon and decided to stay a week at LaConcha. It was in a great location - walking distance to shops & restaurants, decent driving distances to old San Juan and other activities and of course right on the beach. The hotel is very modern & beautiful with plenty of amenities, except a spa, but there is one right across the street. Our only complaint of the entire trip was the service. It didn't really seem like anyone really cared all that much about pleasing us. We are not high maintenance travelers, but we do expect a certain level of service from hotels and this hotel's service did not match the quality of the hotel and what you would expect from a Marriott. It wasn't BAD service, but when you are on vacation, you would like a little more pampering than what you would be used to at normal hotels. Drinks are slow, no one really smiles or looks like they enjoy their job, the waitstaff on the beach was few and far between...basically it was adequate. I do recommend this hotel....as long as you don't expect to be waited on hand and foot.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous modern funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: FabergeLondon
Reviews.Content: We paid $129 plus tax and got a lovely big King bed room with a full balcony overlooking the pool. I thought the service was excellent in all respects and I'm fairly demanding! Food by the pool was very good and quick, but cocktails in the bar were overpriced. Pool area is gorgeous though with loads of sofas/beds/semi private areas etc, really nice to hang out - but I think you can do that even if you're not staying here. Good restaurants in walking distance and nice buzzy area. Highly recommended at the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: kaikai80
Reviews.Content: So I planned a trip with 8 of my girlfriends and we stayed at La Concha.... the ambiance is beautiful.... We stayed on the tenth floor /beach view and it was stunning... The staff ( front desk) was oddly cold to us which was strange for such a beautiful place. The rooms in our oppinion were very small and it took forever for our rooms to be cleaned /fresh towels. The hotel Lobby on Thurs, Fri, and Sat turn into a hot spot so if your looking to sleep make sure your room in far from the lobby... The crowd that gathers is not so much a party crowd..... They sort of just stand around and look gorgeous to great music... We traveled to Isla Verde in order to party !!!!!! and had a wonderful time... The guys who run the cab stand are awsome we had a cab at our whim whenever we left the property and all of our drivers were awsome !!! The beach and pools were awsome as well...!!!!! The food is pricey and so are the drinks but there are alot of bars outside of the property that were reasonable !!!! I'd definately go back but maybe with my boyfriend ... Its a beautiful place for relaxation........ so if your looking for a beautiful hotel on the beach with lots of ambiance this is your place ..... If your elderly this may not be the hotel for you because it is noisy but with a great vibrancy !!!!! Be sure to go to old San Juan for shopping ( Loved the Coach factory) Be sure to go to the Bacardi Factory !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: parluk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha over Memorial Day weekend 2010. The room was very nice--very cool with flat screen TV, funky furniture. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The beach was absolutely beautiful--very calm waters, nice sandy stretch. Very short ride into Old San Juan and walking distance to lots of shops and restaurants. The only negative is the food at the hotel is very expensive for breakfast and lunch. However, there are lots of places close by--for breakfast--Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts very close.

Reviews.Title: “Good for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: miumiu4me
Reviews.Content: After a disastrous time at the HoJo in the Plaza de Armas, my husband and I relocated here. Food- Good. There's a large variety of restaurants. The drinks were strong, especially at the sushi place by the pool area. Rooms - The rooms were nice and tastefully deocrated. We had a pool view room. The wireless signal was a weak though and the tv kept going out (this is a common issue w/hotels in the area though). The room was very clean and the bed was absolutely amazing. Pools- Very nice pools and whirlpools. My husband and I enjoyed them. They were clean and well maintained. Service- Everyone was nice, but the left our luggage outside for 15 mins while they were waiting for a bellhop. My husband waited outside with it and was almost mugged (a guy tried to grab his laptop bag and my husband hit him in the face).

Reviews.Title: “Fair & Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: rrw715
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews prior to staying here and knew what I was getting into. Honestly and to the point, the hotel is beautiful. The lobby, the pools, the rooms are some of the nicest you'll find in the conado area, and service was what I would expect. The rates and prices of food/drink are on the "resort" end but I would argue that the premium you pay is worth it in quality. HOWEVER, if you sleep light, or want a quiets night rest, this is NOT the hotel for you. Everything you've read about the LOUD MUSIC is absolutely TRUE. Doesnt matter how high your floor is. The hotel staff knows that the music levels are loud and disturbs most of its guest. BUT they do not care, they are making the incredible money from bar sales and could truly care less. Its a tale if you cant beat'em join em. Hope you have a clear understanding before booking here, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “can't fathom the good reviews - read this”
Reviews.Author: carrie1223
Reviews.Content: i spent a lot of time reading trip advisor while planning this trip, and the ONLY hotel that did not have an abundance of negative reviews was this one. unfortunately, this one was terrible. a number of aspects were way below what we expected, especially since we paid about $400 per night for a so-called "suite". From the amenities in the rooms, to the three small pools with not enough umbrellas to the overwhelmingly loud techno music in the lobby on sat night (we are young and love this music too but not in this context). The food was good overall. There is no spa in the hotel, you have to use one down the street. The spa services were awful. The worst part was the room. We tried to fit three people in a "suite" thinking two on the king bed and one on the pullout couch. But the couch was tiny, uncomfortable and right by the entry door with the noise from the hall preventing sleep. This same couch was made of fake leather i.e. plastic and therefore unusable as anything other than a place for luggage. the floor tile in the "living room" made it feel totally cold, sterile, and uncomfortable. the 7th floor in the "new wing" where we stayed was just being opened and NONE of the kinks had been worked out. The AC never worked properly and the room was always warm and muggy, despite 3 calls to engineering. the "suite" was tiny and couldnt fit more than 2 people. The bathroom walls were all cloudy glass, without a door on the shower, so when you showered, the entire bathroom floor got wet. Also, the glass walls offered to privacy to those in the bathroom from those in the bedroom area. On our 2nd night, we found a huge cockroach in our hallway. I know its starting to sound ridiculous by now, but this is all true, without exaggeration.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: aliciafun
Reviews.Content: We started off our vacation walking into absolute beauty. La Concha's lobby is beautiful, not only the hotel but also the people. We checked in and our room was perfect. Oceanfront view is definitely the way to go, one whole wall of windows and you can open the top window to have a true ocean experience. We didn't even have to leave the resort if we didn't want. We did venture out to Plazas Las Americas and it was a great mall.The pools were amazing and so was the service. La Concha also has a very romantic setting at night you can have drinks by the pool in secluded little sitting ares. My favorite part was being in the top infinity pool drinking my pina colada.It doesn't get any better than that! We love La Concha adn would definitely recommend it to anyone. Puerto Rico was a great time. The people were just as nice as they were beautiful. If you want a laid back and relaxing vacation this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed a week. Nice hotel. Not perfect. But certainly not warranting the level of complaints here either”
Reviews.Author: LQGuy
Reviews.Content: A few things so you can gauge how much stock you wish to put in our review of this hotel or not. We are a low-key couple who enjoys a quiet location, calm poolside experience, a nice/attractive beach, safe neighborhood, and good quality room with good service. For the purposes of rating different elements, I'll use a scale of 1 to 5, where 1 is horrible, and 5 is outstanding. Pre-Arrival: I'd have to give this a 5. I corresponded with Ana Aponte via email over the course of about two months. I was rather concerned about the complaints of noise, and had a series of questions ranging from hotel location, to size of room safes, etc. Ms. Aponte always had a response available for me within 24 hours of sending my emails, and the responses were sufficient to answer my questions. She helped to allay some of our fears. Needless to say, we were still a bit apprehensive about the noise issues reported on TripAdvisor and thinking of booking at another hotel (we had stayed at a decent one over in the Isla Verde area several years back, but wanted something newer). But, we moved forward with out plans to stay at La Concha, and we're pretty happy with that decision. Arrival: Bellmen gets a 5. They were quick to respond, friendly and didn't appear to be "hovering" like many do because they want a tip. Check-in was pretty efficient. What really made us extremely happy was that our flight arrived VERY early and we were at the hotel at 10:30 AM...and they actually had our room ready for us! We didn't expect that (nor should knowledgeable travelers expect this if the hotel was at capacity the night before. People don't exit rooms until near noon). So having access to the room was a very pleasant surprise, and a VERY welcome relief, since we had to endure a 7 hour red-eye from LAX! Room: This, I would like to give a 5, but I just can't. It's a solid 4. Beds were made, furniture was in good working order, bathroom had been cleaned. And the room was a good size (we had room 920) with sofa, workdesk/chair, large flat-screen TV, and very large storage spaces! The bathroom was pretty cool as well. The shower was a walk-in with ambient lighting. There is not a bathtub, however. Here's why I couldn't rate it a 5. There were indications of water intrusion in the ceiling (painted over mold spots). Near the a/c vent, there was visible mold on the ceiling. There were also mold stains (not actual mold, but the stains from where the water pools in the shower) on the shower grout lines. Lastly, the furniture was a bit banged up. On the night-stand, it almost looked like some previous tacky guest tried to carve something into it. Since it's blond wood, it shows everything. Housekeeping. Gets a 4. When they showed up, they did a super job! No issues to note! The reason I can't give it a 5 is because on two of the seven days, they just didn't show up at all. When we returned to the room one evening, we called and a gentleman promptly brought up towels and soap, but said the maid would stop by shortly. She again never showed up. No big deal since we still had toiletries from the previous night. Restaurants: I think this needs three scores. One for the staff (a 4), and one for the physical space/furnishings, etc (a 5). Most of the staff were very attentive and friendly. We had breakfast almost every morning at the Level 25 restaurant and enjoyed the staff and space quite a bit. The omelette guy could afford to smile once in a while. But hey...I just wanted to eat (just noticed he didn't seem too thrilled to be there each day. Or maybe it was just me). I think the biggest disappointment though has to be the food quality. This, I have to give a 3. The reason is pretty simple. While one would be foolish to not expect to pay resort fees ($20-25 for buffet breakfast) at a resort hotel, one would not be foolish to expect good quality food. Unfortunately, the quality of the food was just not up to par with the pricing. One evening, we walked down to Chili's and on the way back noted, to be fair, that Chili's food quality is exactly on par with what was served at La Concha. Only, it was well under half the price. Same held true for lunch at the poolside restaurant. Just not worth the money spent...every time! (Had some FABULOUS dinner experiences nearby though...Ropa Vieja, Budathai (though don't order the Lo Mein), and in Old San Juan, Raices). But as mentioned, the staff working the restaurants certainly made our time there pleasant enough. Renaissance/Marriott need to upgrade the food quality though! Public Spaces. Definitely gets a 5! Clean, tastefully done to that art-deco to mid-century modern look. Pool areas spotless. Plants lush, grounds well taken care of. Just top-notch public areas! Concierge. Definately gets a 5! During the first half of our trip, we spoke with two young folks who did their level best to help us. In fact, they recommended some of the restaurants mentioned above that we enjoyed. They were always prompt and courteous. But we really have to commend Louise! Having been fortunate enough to travel the world and stay at some pretty top-notch places, I have to say that she is one of the best concierge staff we have encountered. A good concierge can "size people up" with just one or two questions. She was able to ascertain exactly who we were, what our tastes included, what our dislikes were, etc. Every recommendation she provided was spot-on! What surprised us was that she had even recommended places that had only been open for two weeks. These too were excellent. Just a fabulous concierge, and someone you feel like you could easily be friends with...very down to earth! She knows her business! Check-out was a 5. There were a lot of people, but they had ever station manned and were doing the best they could. We only had to wait about 5 minutes and they moved the line quickly. Okay....what about that noise issue? This was by far a most nerve-wracking decision whether to stay at this hotel or not. The last thing you want is to dish out a large chunk of change, only to have your whole vacation experience ruined. And I have to tell you that I have to be one of the lightest sleepers around. I sometimes don't think I actually sleep at all...just sort of lay in semi-lucid daze. Anyway, we arrived on a Friday morning and stayed clear through seven nights. NOT ONE TIME were we bothered by noise! Yes...they had a party in the lobby (there's a large bar in the middle of it and people spill out in to the pool area adjacent to it). But the only way you're going to hear anything is to turn your TV off, get up off of your bed, and go rest your ear against the door. Granted, we were on the ninth floor and maybe that had something to do with it. But even then, I went down the balcony hallway to take night pictures of the pool (lit up in really cool colors) and the noise was just not that bad. If you're someone who focuses in on the slightest potential irritant and then amplifies it in your mind, then maybe this is not the place for you. Likewise, I'm sure if you had one of the rooms that's right next to the pool area, that's probably not the best experience either. But the vast majority of rooms are in the tower, and don't start until the third floor. In retrospect, we just don't understand what all the fuss is about! The hotel is definitely "the in place" for the 20 to 30 something year old set. But we think it could also be a very relaxing and (yes) quiet location as well. Condado is not known for being a low-key, quiet area anyhow. If we were to return to San Juan for a third vacation, we would certainly consider a return visit to La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Andrew030
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, if you don't like sleeping. The problem is that the corridor to the bedrooms looks over a courtyard which contains a large outdoor bar / club, and is not separated in any way whether by walls or glass. It meant that there was little more than a thin door to keep out the noise. It was inadequate for that purpose. By about 2am I tried muffling the noise with towels at the bottom of the door. That didn't work. I had asked for a high room, but didn't get one. I see from the other reviews that noise seems to be a consistent complaint at the weekends. On the basis that if you can't beat them, join them - I paid the bar a late night visit. The cocktails were good, the bar was great - it seemed to be the place to be in Condado. Noise problems aside, it was an attractive, contemporary hotel with reasonable service. The rooms were small, but well appointed with modern fittings. I didn't really use the other facilities, but there was a nice view of the beach from the room. From what I saw of this hotel the only thing which this hotel got wrong was the most basic thing it should get right: providing a comfortable place to sleep. I will be visiting Condado tomorrow. On this occasion, I will be visiting the bar but sleeping somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: adaddario
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I have traveled to Puerto Rico, and I could not have been happier with my stay at La Concha. The hotel feels very chic from the moment you enter the lobby. I requested an early check in, only half expecting it since we landed in San Juan at 9:30 am. To my surprise, our room was ready the moment we arrived at the front desk. The rooms itself aren't anything too special. They aren't that big, but they are very clean. The view from the room was spectacular, and the windows opened quite wide, giving us a great view and sound of the ocean. The beds are soft and very comfortable. Never had a problem with housekeeping, one day they did come around 3:00 pm, but the other days they got the room cleaned much earlier. The beach is beautiful, but like another reviewer mentioned, the surf is very rough. I spent most of the trip by the pools, which were beautiful and clean. Just the right temperature for cooling off in the hot sun. The salads at the restaurant by the main pool are absolutely to die for, very refreshing and flavorful. Every employee that I encountered was friendly and helpful. It was the perfect vacation to relax and re-energize. The hotel does not have a spa, but they do set you up with appointments at the spa a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most beautiful property on the island.”
Reviews.Author: Lin67
Reviews.Content: This is thee place to stay in San Juan. The service, the rooms, the pina coladas, are so much better the run down Hilton Caribe. The rooms are modern, fresh, and so very comfortable. Plenty of room to do your work on the desk or do your work with your spouse :+) People who work here could not be nicer. But seriously, the Pina Coladas are 2 dollars cheaper and 10 times better than the ones at the old Hilton Caribe. Only negative thing I would say is don't eat at The Pearl - small portions and over priced.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in all of Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: Romero161
Reviews.Content: Please do not be fooled with the lobby appearence. This hotel has horrible rooms. The rooms are so small and compact. My husband and I are staying here right now and we are considering going to another hotel. As for the food, my husband ordered the pizza which cost $16 and he got a stoffer frozen pizza. I ordered the salad and it was missing 2 out 5 things it came with. Our room is connecting room in which u constantly wake to a slamming door. We do not know why we were given a connecting room but here we are. We have stayed in the Condado hotel and casino and had a fabulous time EVERY time we stay there but they were sold out. Please do not be fooled About the private beach. This Hotel is NOT worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SafariTu
Reviews.Content: Modern, fun hotel with a great pool, beautiful views, friendly staff, and great restaurants/drinks. Stayed using Marriott points - a very good value. They treat platinum members very well - gave us a good room on a high floor and the free breakfast was pretty good in the lounge. Great mohitos at the lobby bar, and we ate a few times at the poolside bar Solera, where you can also get sushi. Dinner at La Perla was very pricey but good, would probably skip it next time. Don't stay here for the beach - the waters are rough and the nearby buildings are run down and sort of ruin any walk along the beach. $15-20 cab ride from the hotel to both the airport and old San Juan. No real spa inside the hotel - they can set you up with treatments at a small place across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect - a few weak points”
Reviews.Author: Debba17
Reviews.Content: I organized an 80+ person 3+ day meeting at La Concha and was generally very pleased with the service and the facility. The staff is very friendly and helpful, albiet sometimes not "speedy quick." Housekeeping needs to be amped up a bit as some days rooms were not cleaned until 6pm or later. Construction was still occurring in the new tower and I had to ask more than once to make sure the noise would not be heard in our meeting space. Food was very good, but somewhat expensive for breakfast and lunches. Fabulous dinner for 90+ people on the pool dec was a big success. The lobby and bar area are gorgeous as well as the other common areas in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha is other-worldly, a savvy traveler's spot, albeit a funky one!”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Cove_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay, my second visit to La Concha in 9 months and from the moment I arrived you feel this subtle touch of a very attentive and well-trained staff; this level of consistent service is often found in only the top hotels. The bellman escorted me, or I should say, transported me from a balmy San Juan day into a cool audio, visual and sensory oasis that is La Concha. You just kind of downshift as you walk into this large and airy white expanse â€“ floor to ceiling glass pulls you out to the multi-tiered pool scene; very contemporary white leather furniture and a funky bar at center immediately adds another line to your to-do-list, â€œReturn here after 5pmâ€�; and soft hues of sea foam lighting gently moderates the atmosphere while rhythmic background music calms the senses and sets the tone for the pending decompression. Though the lobbyâ€™s enormous glass walls were open to the pool, the lobby is both fairly quiet and cool. Then, for a moment, a shock out my island calm: they are â€œover-soldâ€� (I had a confirmed reservation) and I would be staying in La Concha Towers. Was this a bait and switch to some lesser property? It happened at the Loews in Miami, BUT NOT HERE, I was immediately escorted not to some other lesser hotel but instead, to a large natural lighted breezeway just beyond the front desk. Rich white paint, hearty walnut wood and large panels of ocean-side glass led to a condo-hotel tower with full services from La Concha. I paused at a water fall as all of the sudden everything became quiet, there literally was no other noise but the cascading water and I almost thought I was heading to some tranquil spa. Inside the condo-hotel was large atrium being prepped for dozens of pots of greenery. My 8th floor room was a brand-new ocean-front suite with a living area and full kitchenette, angular yet comfy modern leather furniture with a flat screen TV, a set of long closets on across from the bathroom which had a heavy glass walk-in shower and one of those overhead rain-shower showerheads (what are those things called??) and a separate water closet which I always think is a nice touch, as are Aveda bath products. The bedroom was fairly good size, with what I soon learned was a fabulous bed and linens, and floor to ceiling glass sliders lead out to a terrace with hearty chairs and a table. From my perch I can see one the great benefits of La Concha: no other hotels abut the property so the beach is really yours. Once on the beach, there is a partial jetty that protects the eastern side from waves. Bronzing guests spread out along the beach and I didnâ€™t feel crowded in any way. Staff lead me out with a chaise and towels and within 10 minutes a server arrived. She returned with my Don Q and diet coat and menu. Duck quesadillas were terrific, get them with extra sour cream. A spa and/or masseuse was located just up from the beach but I didnâ€™t partake. The next day was a little windy and I stayed at the pool; they served an excellent burger, poolside from Solera restaurant, dark and hearty fries too. The first time I stayed here I didnâ€™t even notice that there was an upper level pool, I just walked past main pool area with its vibe, and didnâ€™t notice the steps in the back to this hidden gem, as I went to the oceanfront pool to imbibe. There are four different and distinct pools on the property. I had a terrific breakfast sitting outside on the patio of Level 25, the second floor dining room overlooking the pool and ocean. Great coffee! The bar scene at was rather enticing, funky music and quite a crop of people, and while I passed on the happenings I can see why the bar is known as THE happening scene in the area. We dined at Restaurant Compostela which was just a few minutes away and it was fabulous. Roast suckling pig is a killer as is their wine list, perhaps the deepest on the entire island. The next night dinner we had an extraordinary meal at hotelâ€™s main restaurant, La Perla which is something you simply must experience. The hotel is named for the enormous conch shell which sits suspended above the beach in a pool of water and serves at the hotelâ€™s main restaurant. Once inside this wavy ceiling affect of the conch shell is spectacular! The entire space is white and dominated by its conical shape which is probably is 30+ feet at its peek. Well-dressed guests were admiring the fading light and stunning views through glass windows to the blue ocean. Once it was dark, the white room becomes almost other-worldly, where are you, you think? It really is kind of breathtaking. No-one seemed to be in a rush to go anywhere. Look at the pictures on the web-site, put this restaurant in Miami or LA it would be the place to beâ€¦ put the hotel with it and you might never get an open room. Other subtle details: I donâ€™t gamble and didnâ€™t even notice the casino as sometimes you hear the noises of the slot machines in hotels with casinos. When two shirts were not delivered when promised, I called downstairs and 15 minutes later they called back to apologize and shortly afterward my shirts arrived. I never mentioned it but when I checked out the laundry bill was removed. I noted below in the rating that the hotel was "quiet" because my room, the pool, the time of the beach, lobby area et al is quiet , you don't feel intruded on at all, which to me is a big plus, but the bar scene at night is electric so keep that in mind. The look and layout of the whole property from rooms to lobby, pools to restaurants is terrific, and the professionalism of the staff is commendable. The hotel has most everything one would need, and given that you arenâ€™t paying quite the high tariff of other hotels, I am not sure you can beat this place, period. I will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Gigi028
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend there, we traveled with our young kids (ages 6 and 11). While the pools and lobby are nice and well maintained, I felt that we paid way too much for the size of the room. The furniture and accesories are high end and might be a good fit for a couple or young professional, stay away if you are travelling with kids. None of the staff ever asked us if we were having a good time and/ or enjoying our stay, even though we were there for Mother's Day, only the valet parking attendant was nice enough to wish me a nice day. This was our first travel to Puerto Rico, the beach was nice, water warm and great weather, but if you are looking for service and pampering I would recommend Mexico hands down. If you want to try typical food, we would recommend Ajili Mojili and Orozco's restaurants in Ashford Avenue, Condado; the first one is nicer but the second one has great flavor and you can tell food is made to order.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: scottfamilytravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for 2 days in May, prior to sailing out on a cruise. We arrived at 1:00 p.m. and were told our room would be ready in a few hours, the front desk took our cell number and said they would call us. They checked our baggage so we could walk around. At 3:30 they had not yet called so we checked at the desk and our room was indeed ready and our lugguge was to be sent up. We waited for our luggage, anxious to change after an overnight flight from CA. Evidentially they were searching for it and could only locate one bag, not the other two. After a little over an hour, they located it and brought it to our room. The room was beautiful!! On the 12th floor with a balcony overlooking the ocean. We spent a lot of time on that balcony enjoying the view...amazing!! We did not realize there were only a few rooms with the balcony until we were laying on the beach the next day, glad we booked the deluxe room. The only complaint about the La Concha was the price of the drinks and food. I had one drink and guacomole at a cost of $26, although the chips were different and very good. Wow!! Everything about the resort was top notch. The gym had great equipment, a plus for us. It was a bit noisy as there were many weddings on site on the Saturday during our stay. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance. We ate lunch at Pure Natural, a small sandwich and smoothie shop on the same street...fabulous!! We had dinner at Tijaunas on the same street which was one of the best Mexican meals I've had and I live in CA so we eat Mexican a lot!! We walked to a grocery store...(less than a mile?)something MAX, at the recommendation of the concierge to get our wine for the cruise. They had a great selection and reasonable. The beach was wonderful and relaxing. A short cab ride into old San Juan. Staff were all friendly and helpful. Surprisingly most people in San Juan that we encountered, including cab drivers and restraunt staff, did not speak english.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE TRIP!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jerseydominican
Reviews.Content: First ima start by saying that its extremely close to the airport....it is literally 15-20 minutes away depending on traffic. Our flight arrived to san juan around 12pm, we arrived to the hotel around 1:30, upon reading the reviews before, i knew i would be unable to check in until 4, therefore i was prepared. When we got to the hotel, we left our bags with the receptionist and was told that they would call when the room became available. The initial perception of the hotel once you get there is very modern and chic. It was a mixture of South Beach and the Dominican Republic, very very beautiful sight. Upone checking in at 4pm, the room was very nice and clean....we had a room in the first floor, poolside and were very close to the lobby. I really didnt care about the noise to come from the lobby at night....especially since i was prepared for it. I would def recommend a room by the pool, first cause its cheaper, second because I actually like hearing some sounds and music. Get this room if you love to be by the pool and listen to music at night from the lobby. The pools were very nice as well as the the walkways to the beach (its like a mini lounge area with sofas). The drinks and food were excellent, but a bit expensive. This hotel is great for young couples in their 20s or 30s. Loved the locaton of the place....dead center in the Condado region of San Juan (very affluent area). The only complaint was the bus to old San Juan. It rarely comes and when it comes and you dont have change for it, they kick you out. (This happend to me) Make sure you have exactly .75 per person. All in all, great impression of San Juan, and would recomment it to anyone. Also ONE BIG THING...IF YOU LIKE TO DRINK...BUY YOUR OWN DRINK OUTSIDE..DRINKS GET TO BE EXPENSIVE IF YOU LIKE TO DRINK LIKE ME...AND KEEP THE BOTTLE IN THE ROOM. IF YOU GO TO THE LOBBY AT NIGHT, REFILL YOUR DRINK IN THE ROOM!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Family_2010
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one night at La Concha following a cruise with our 10 yr old and 6 yr old children. We left our cruise ship on Sunday morning and arrived at La Concha at about 9 a.m. Knowing check in time was at 3 pm, we were prepared to leave our bags secured there and tour San Juan in the mean time. We were pleasantly surprised when the front desk clerk informed us that our pool view room wasn't ready but they could check us into an ocean view room for no additional charge! So we were in our room by 9:30 and had a whole day to enjoy! Our children enjoyed the pools and I loved lounging near the infinity pool enjoying beautiful weather and unbelievable views. The grounds and hotel decor are truly a sight to see. There are different pool areas to choose from as well. All have beautiful trees, shrubs & flowers surrounding them, with lots of lounge chairs to choose from. The hotel room itself was clean and roomy. Tons of closet space, flat screen large tv, comfortable beds, rain type shower head & walk in shower. Aveda products were a treat as well. We were on the 5th floor and had a great view of the beach & ocean with nothing to spoil it (no other buildings, etc.) The prices of drinks were quite high - $10 to $12 each. Breakfast buffet was $25 and for the kids it was $12. I do highly recommend it as well. Delicious! Subway is directly across the street, where we chose to have an affordable lunch. Found it funny that they serve alcoholic beverages - slushy type tropical drinks for $5! Touring and shopping in Old San Juan was a quick taxi ride away for $14 I think. We enjoyed that very much as well. It was a wonderful way to finish our cruise. Only regret is that we couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kitkat77774
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Juan so I cannot compare it to other hotels as some of the other reviewers have. Overall I was satisfied but there were some cons- NOT a beach hotel. If you want to lay on a relaxing, beautiful carribean beach then this is not the place. The beach was small but with all the hotels so close together I guess that is to be expected. My biggest issue with the beach was the huge eyesore right next door. There are a few abandoned, run down hotels covered in graffiti directly next to the hotel. My fiance didn't see this as a big issue but when you're laying on a beach on vacation why do you want to look at that? Another con was the outlets in the bathroom didn't work, the drain in our shower didn't work either so the water piled up after several days and never went down so after a while it was a small wading pool and we lost about 45 min one day because our key didn't work. Pros: Very nice, clean room with gorgeous view of ocean. I booked directly through the hotel and feel I got an amazing price for the room. Also, food was great. Beautiful lobby and hopping at night...very Miami ish. I don't think I'd ever go back to San Juan and if I did maybe try another hotel just for another experience but I would recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: loveslife2fullest
Reviews.Content: If you want to relax but also have some fun at night this is the place. The beach and pool area are great to relax, but on Fri and Sat nights the lobby comes alive and it is the place to be in Condado. La Concha has a great vibe. It has a South Beach feel to it. One tip that I can give is that is different from other Caribbean locations is people hear love to dress to impress. Most women wear dress and heels. You don't see many wearing shorts past 6. It is very stylish here. You do have Gucci, Louis Vuitton and Cartier across the street. The staff was extremely friendly and always willing to assist. Luis on the beach is always smiling and fired up to get you a chair and umbrella. If you like dirty martinis, La Perla has the best! They will add olives stuffed with blue cheese if you ask and they are awesome!! All the restaurants at the hotel serve great food too. We enjoyed sitting outside on at Solera. It was like eating in your living room. Great with date or friends!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Linda2231
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 7 days at La Concha using Marriott points - a bargain! Hotel met all our expectations with great service, friendly staff with no "attitude", relaxing atmosphere and beauty all around. Our room was ocean front, 5th floor and we listened to the waves crashing to the shore each night. Rooms offer free coffee and maker, refrigerator, and bottled water, plus wonderful Aveda products. Plenty of closet and drawer space, for a change! The air conditioning was excellent and a couple of minor issues were taken care of promptly with a good attitude and caring by the staff. Everyone had a smile on their face and wanted to help and spoke excellent English, though we love to try out our meager Spanish! Located in perfect spot on Condado Beach with numerous terrific restaurants of all price ranges within easy walking distance. Only minor complaint is no hooks in the bathroom, room, or closets to hang up anything which creates a messy situation in the bathroom, and half door showers that may be glamorous, but made for wet floors. We would stay here again most definitely and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorikAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled last month with our teenage son to Puerto Rico and spent 5 days at La Concha. I first have to say the reviews for this hotel were accurate. We requested an upper level one bedroom suite based on the complaints that I read on trip advisor. While we didn't hear noise from the lobby, the construction on the tower next to us began each morning at 7am. Our particular room was just average and quite honestly was a little worn. But the ocean view from the bedroom was amazing! It needs to be said that the bathroom was incredibly small. The sink, toliet and shower are all in the same small area. I was scoping this hotel out for an upcoming girls trip, but this was a major drawback. The definite positives of this hotel are the beautiful south beach like lobby and pool area. While I didn't feel totally safe venturing too far from the hotel late at nite, you can't beat the La Concha for it's location in the Condado district for shopping and restaurants. My last observation would have to be that the atmosphere of this hotel is really better suited for adults or couples. The few children I saw on the property at the pool seemed bored and out of place. Forgot to add the staff was very helpful in planning our side trips. I was asked countless times by various employees if we were enjoying our stay. They seemed genuinely interested if we were having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Eva080
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at La Concha Hotel in San Juan, PR. From the moment I arrived I was impressed by the service and the ambience. Sebastian at the concierge desk was extremely knowledgeable about the different activities in the area, helpful, and often went above and beyond his duties to make sure that I enjoyed every minute of my stay. The view from my room was breath taking as the hotel is right on the beach and the room itself was spacious and comfortable. All of the hot spots including Old San Juan were only minutes away by taxi which were always available upon stepping out of the hotel. The food and drinks by the poolside were delicious and the staff was very friendly. At night the lobby was filled with beautiful people enjoying good conversation at the bar and there was a live band by the poolside. I visit Puerto Rico often and always stay with family. This was my first experience in a hotel in PR and I felt like I was with my extended family. Un millon de gracias!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but housekeeping left a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: reinitaHolt_Michigan
Reviews.Content: First, we stayed at La Concha after spending most of a week at El Conquistador in Fajardo, which we absolutely fell in love with. By comparison, La Concha was nice, but fell short. And it was more expensive, which left us shaking our heads. La Concha is gorgeous. The infinity pool is just beautiful and one of our favorite features. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food at the restaurant by the lobby was very good. Expensive, but we expected that. The burgers were to die for and - bonus - huge. We had one lovely meal at the Perla restaurant. Highly recommend going at 6 when they first open because we got the best table in the place, overlooking the ocean. Very romantic and the staff was incredibly attentive. Food was amazingly good. I had the sorullos with black beans. I was intrigued by the combination. Glad I went with that dish. Portions are on the small side, but we had ordered salads, so it was plenty. Our biggest gripe was the housekeeping. We had to wait two hours to get our room the first day. Worst part was they wouldn't give us an idea of when it would be ready, so we kept waiting and waiting in the lobby. Liked the free wi-fi. Then, the next day, housekeeping didn't show up until 4 p.m. Seriously?! We just wanted to shower and get ready for our dinner, but had to go entertain ourselves at the pool while she cleaned our room. When we got back, she hadn't left enough towels. The towels we got were rough and were very frayed. Not impressed. The room was small. And none of the rooms have a balcony. In order to enjoy the ocean view (we paid extra for), we had to stand by the window. And because we were in a lower floor, and the window is so big, we felt like anyone could see into our room. So we shut the curtains, which meant we couldn't look at the view. Ugh. The beach right outside the hotel is beautiful, but know that it's really not great for swimming. It's too rough. Do walk down the beach a bit for better swimming. Next time, we'll spend our whole vacation at El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “Best of four hotels I've experienced in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been artfully updated from what was probably a very hip place in the 1960s. The open-air lobby is extremely well executed, with an inviting all-white marble floor, gorgeous in-floor LED ambient lighting, and a big, open bar in the middle. The first two nights, we were in the two-story, pool-side rooms. These are vastly less preferable to the tower, beach-facing rooms for obvious reasons, but even still, the room itself was nice and modern: blonde furniture, inviting desk chair, very updated bathrooms with rain shower and hand-held water sources (though it makes for a messy floor when showering, and there's no tub if you're a bath person), and a spacious terrace overlooking the pool. The Aveda products are great. The ocean-facing rooms offer jaw-dropping views of the Atlantic and a secondary pool, though on this side, only the corner suites have a terrace. The view and the sound of the crashing surf are lovely. The first two nights we paid $300/night (well, someone paid), which is pretty dear. The ocean-facing nights (two for a total of 60k Marriott points) were obviously a better deal. As others have noted, the hotel is LOUD at night, especially on the weekends. The hotel has a casino that I didn't frequent, and a new tower over the casino is slated to open soon. Yes, the restaurants are expensive, but I expect nothing less in a resort. The pool-side bar food isn't bad, actually, and the service is good. But what I really like about this hotel is that it's in an urban location, with street life--albeit catering to tourists. But compared to the remote Hilton Caribe, a far-away Westin, and the Isla Verde Intercontinental, this is easily the best location I've experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel--Great Staff--Louise is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: maryglennon
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and I just returned form a 5 night stay in this hotel. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was great and we had a fantastic time in PR. I absolutely recommend PR as a family vacation--between the rainforest, old San Juan, beaches and all sorts of activities, it's a great place for everyone. The people are lovely and we always felt very safe. I have to give a special shout-out to the La Concha's concierge, Louise. She was AMAZING! She completely helped us figure out all of our activities and she took care of everything! She even provided the mapquest directions for our day trip to Ponce. The only other concierge who I would put in her category is the concierge at the Ritz Hotel in Madrid. The Housekeeping staff was very obliging too, responding wonderfully to all of our requests.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Stay.”
Reviews.Author: jmb16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha the last week of March. We will stay at this hotel in the future. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was a junior suite, and had a nice view of the ocean and one of the pools from our balcony. Unlike some previous reviewers, we were able to sleep fine at night. Our room was on the 3rd floor and the music from the lobby didn't bother us. One day one of the closet doors broke at the hinges, but we called the front desk and a nice staff member came up to fix it. The door didn't give us any other problems. Overall we had a very relaxing and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only gettting Better!”
Reviews.Author: TNSA
Reviews.Content: With the opening of the beautiful Platinum lounge, this property is only getting better. The staff is what truly sets this property apart, from the front desk to the pool staff, they truly are first class. ( actually go out of the way to make the stay special) This is my 4th visit, and I will continue to make LC my only choice when in San Juan. Cheers to another stay soon.. ( only wish the beautiful restarant would "hip" up the classical music, could be such a hot spot, food is fantastic, just WAY to stuffy for this location) Best, Tom McDermott

Reviews.Title: “a great renovation”
Reviews.Author: cruz30
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a great example of a great renovation, a traditional hotel in Condado that has experienced a re-birth. Stayed a fews days as a weekedn getaway, had a great time. Nice pool area and close to several restaurants in the Condado area. Liked the rooms, very modern and well kept. Very recommened for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: freqtravellerNewYork
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five nights at this hotel and had a wonderful, relaxing time. Lovely pools and beach, food and drink just right at Solera, and the room decor was modern and aesthetically pleasing with a breathtaking view of the ocean. Housekeeping was very prompt in cleaning our room, no matter what time we left in the (mid) morning. General service was warm and attentive. Only complaint would be that it is in a busy neighbourhood (there was a loud, noisy free concert right next to the hotel on Palm Sunday). That said, it was nice to be able to walk out to good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for San Juan”
Reviews.Author: tohhall
Reviews.Content: As other reviews mention, there are many pros and cons about this hotel. We arrived early, but we knew check-in was @ 4 so were not disappointed to have to wait. We were disconcerted that our room choice was not available all 4 nights as my husband had specifically called the hotel to book/confirm. We were told we would have to move halfway through the stay, however, when my husband mentioned he had called and said he'd prefer not to move, we were upgraded to a larger room for all 4 nights. Great room with a beautiful bathroom, plenty of storage space, view of the ocean and small balcony. Pros: Staff is very friendly. In fact, everyone we dealt with in PR was exceedingly friendly. Concierge desk gave great dining tips. Great beach, we had no problems with service. They set up the chairs on the beach when you arrive and we never had to get there early to reserve a spot. Nice touch that they had water available free an weren't picky about you bringing your own. La Perla dining exquisite. Breakfast buffet extensive but (as they always are) pricey. Other great food options within walking distance. Bus to Old San Juan in front of hotel. Cons: Our room was never cleaned before 5 p.m.(many have mentioned this). So you never really have the feeling of a clean room as we usually returned and showered from beach around then. It can get noisy at night on the weekends-live music at the pool area ended at 10 but some guests were loud. Guests are a bit of a mixed bag; lots of families with young (some poorly behaved)kids but also mid-20s/30s singles. Hotel may be trying to be hipper than it is. Overall we were happy with our choice and had a good vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mdstollow
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at La Concha and we loved every minute of it. The hotel lobby is beautiful with service to match. Our room had a gorgeous view of the ocean. The pool, warm and relaxing. Pros: the food was delicious and surprisingly NOT overpriced. However the drinks were a bit $$. We ate outside at Solera 2 nights, lounging on couches. Their paella was delicious as well as the marinated skirt steak w/ seaweed salad on top. Lunch was from the same restaurant with lighter fare- good kids menu with more than just chicken fingers. Salads were great too. Yummy drinks- Berry Berry martini and coconut martini from the inside bar- too good. The staff was very attentive and helpful all the time. Cons: Weird bathroom set-up in the room. The shower soaks the bathroom?! The pool was great for relaxing and was set-up so you good lounge in a chair while watching the kids play in the pool ONLY if you got up early and laid your things on a chair to "reserve"it. we ventured out for dinner a few night and HIGHLY recommend Ropa Vieja for authentic Puerto Rican food(risotto w/ black beans and filet mignon was fantastic), Bodega Condado which had the best service (yummy lobster orzo), and Tijuana's for great Mexican. Overall, a fantastic vacation, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “An All-Around Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Octavia82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a delayed honeymoon to Puerto Rico and ended up choosing La Concha for most of our stay. We got an ocean view room and the view was spectacular! The room was clean (though housekeeping did fail to come back one day when we left the room late) and the bed was very comfortable. We loved the pools and the beach location (the best along that strip of hotels, in my opinion, since it's partially sheltered by a pier), and although the decor is a little loud and funky, it's fun. The concierges also did a fantastic job, from recommending good restaurants to trying to find us a rental car last-minute. Downsides: there was construction going on in the new towers that should be opening soon, which did awaken us on occasion. Hopefully that will be done soon, and it wouldn't stop us from staying there again. Also, the price of the room per night more than tripled on Christmas and the two days following, so we couldn't spend our entire vacation there. I understand charging a bit of a premium for the holidays, but the difference was ridiculous and the hotel, while good, was NOT worth what they were trying to charge. We were sad to leave, though. The neighborhood right around La Concha (Condado) is nice enough, but some of the nearby areas aren't great. My husband and I are pretty seasoned travelers and had no qualms about wandering around and exploring Santurce and Hato Rey, but some travelers wouldn't feel safe doing so. We also walked down Ave. Ashford in the direction of Old San Juan, which is dotted with some nice hotels but isn't very exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gillebe
Reviews.Content: I travel every week for business and have been to many hotels. This hotel had the BEST pools I have ever visited - FOUR pools, two of which were Infinity Pools with fabulous ocean front views. We stayed for a week and enjoyed fabulous weather to enjoy the pools and beach every day. The location was great if you don't rent a car: walkable distance to a wide variety of restaurants and a bus ride away from Old San Juan. The main lobby is very trendy with a terrific bar for spending the evening or a quick one on the way for dinner. If you have any questions about restaurants or things to do, ask for Michael Tischler. He's the Head Concierge and has wonderful ideas of things to do. He was very informative, provided quick directions, great suggestions, and took care of us on more than one occasion. A pleasure to work with!

Reviews.Title: “Well, you will definitely be on "island time"”
Reviews.Author: NaperVillian10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, but having to wait until 5pm or later to have my room cleaned - even though I had raised it as an issue the first day - I found disconcerting. For what I was paying for my room, I felt I should have had more access to it. On the third day - we were stuck in the (albeit, beautiful) lobby for more that 2 hrs starting at 3:30p waiting to have our room cleaned - and the staff was really not that helpful. Food was OK, location was great - despite everything we had a great vacation, but it should have been a better experience. When you get only one fun family vacation a year, you expect a lot, perhaps, but I definitely felt that this hotel fell down on their responsibility to provide an oasis from day-to-day demands - I felt like I had to work too hard to make my stay acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “tranquilo”
Reviews.Author: Sarahpo77
Reviews.Content: I went to Puerto Rico for a girls long weekend and we got exactly what we were looking for: relax by the pool or beach, fruity drinks and some R&R. La Concha fulfilled this. It was a great, relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels2028
Reviews.Content: I have lukewarm feelings about this hotel. Poolside service was nonexistent...although there seemed to be at least half a dozen of the pool staff standing around socializing by the bar at all times. My husband ordered a drink and the bartender kept smelling one of the bottles, then poured the contents into the drink he served us....pretty unappetizing. All food & drink items were pricey, and drinks were small.
