Casino service was not great either...one night we sat at a Blackjack table for an hour without a waitress ever approaching, and another night we ordered from a waitress who never returned, with our drinks or otherwise. Our last night there, someone on the top floor decided to have a huge party in their suite and the bass from the music was vibrating into the floor below and their guests were screaming out the windows until early morning...we called a couple times to ask the hotel to handle it, but it didn't seem to get any better. The bathrooms by the beach had broken soap dispensers and not all the sinks worked. If the hotel recommends Zen Spa to you, do not go there...it is a complete rip-off: mediocre facilities, terrible massage therapists, high prices. On the plus side, the Concierge Lounge had a great breakfast, and the front desk & Concierge were very pleasant and accommodating. Bartender Alexandra was great, and another guest told me that she was impressed with the babysitting services there. The beach attendant was helpful in setting up chairs, and quite friendly, as were the valets. The casino was fun. Good shower fixtures & water pressure, nice Aveda products. So overall the experience was fine, but that was it...not great, just fine. We used points, so I probably would have expected more (and therefore been more upset) if I had paid good money for sometimes lackluster service and a somewhat cramped room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - a complete oaisis”
Reviews.Author: decembergirl5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 young children and had a corner suite. Our room was lovely, just the bathroom was a little small, and only had a shower (no tub). The pool is wonderful, the hotel is clean and very hip. They have a nice kids menu, and children 5 and under eat free from the breakfast buffet. We will definitely return and recommend Ropa Vieja restaurant down the street on Ashford for a wonderful dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: BusinessManTX
Reviews.Content: On my busines trip to San Juan the service I receive when i got in to the front of the Hotel at La Concha was great, Jose at the valet was very courteous and helpful, very nice hotel, rooms nice and clean, and after various meetings, a relaxing moment at the lounge was great, where Michael and the staff give a great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great views from the room, good value or money, air conditioning sucks”
Reviews.Author: Tidemaker
Reviews.Content: We spent about 5 nights in this hotel during our vacation to Puerto Rico in Dec 09. There are three things which I want to talk about specifically in this review: 1. Location of the hotel: The resort is strategically located in Condado, which is a very nice and touristy part. It is in walking distance to many restaurants and pubs (thereby you avoid expensive dining in this resort). The bus stop is right in front of the hotel (though the bus frequency is slightly questionable). We took buses most of the time to go to old San Juan, which saved some $$. The beach is right adjacent, so you can take nice long walks along the ocean. 2. The room itself: Our room was nice, small, and clean. It had big glass windows which could be opened to hear the ocean waves. The view of the ocean from our room was pure awesome. One thing which bothered me was the air conditioning of the room. Puerto Rico is humid, so a good air conditioner becomes even more important for a good night's sleep. In this case, it sucked!! So, most nights were sleepless. 3. Ask for Louise Graulau: She is a staff in the resort and is probably the most helpful resource you will find in terms of guiding you to the best places in Puerto Rico. When we just asked her cursorily about what the more interesting places around were (expecting she will probably give a laundry list of places to go), she actually asked us if we had a specific plan. Based on what we said, she printed us detailed maps and driving directions with suggestions for what to do where and the whole itinerary for the day. She also suggested us the good restaurants around the resort which were not expensive. All, in all, she pretty much planned 2 full days for us during our vacation, which was clearly above and beyond what the staff is most hotels do.

Reviews.Title: “My Visit to the La Concha”
Reviews.Author: travellady010
Reviews.Content: I wanted to express my great stay at the La Concha Resort I had a very relaxing week at enjoyed with my family. Liza at the front desk was great and very helpfull. Hotel and amenities were great. The Concierge Lounge was beautiful and I liked it much better then when I stated at the Marriott down the street from the La Concha. Michael at the Concierge Lounge is great he is very helpful and very perfessional in his work. Also his staff is very nice. For all that will read this message check at the best place to stay in San Juan P.R. La Concha Resort.

Reviews.Title: “EASY”
Reviews.Author: dhardin3
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an easy get-away for a long weekend then look no further. in addition to mutliple non-stop flights to San Juan, you can't ask for a better set-up than La Concha for the ease and convenience of enjoying a quick vacation. La Concha offers the look and feel of a trendy South Beach Miami hotel with the bonus of being in the beautiful Carribbean. You get a great feeling the minute you walk into their vast and contemporary lobby with high ceilings and an atrium-like design. With La Concha situatued right on the beach, the ocean view rooms make you feel like you are hanging out over the ocean. The service is absolutely fantastic from the time you are checkin in, to seeking guidance from the concierge, and to the time you get to the pool and have a drink in your hand. The staff at the beach, the pool, and the pool bar (Solera) are especially good. They truly ensure the full tropical island experience and are super friendly. My wife and I have a 2-year old and another on the way in July and we both work so we needed a quick 3-day getaway to recharge the batteries. La Concha proved to be the perfect option.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ihearthomer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because it was the location of a friend's wedding. We arrived early, but could not check into our room until 4pm exactly which was a little annoying. We had requested extra towels upon check-in (because we were told the room had not been stocked with washcloths yet) and they were never brought to us. However, the room was nice, basic, more on the modern side. Fabulous view. The shower has no door, so water ended up everywhere and the slits in the bathroom door do not allow for much privacy. The hallways are outdoors, so you get hot on the way to the lobby. It was rainy our first night and my hair frizzed up on the way downstairs. Hotel set up a great tour of the rain forest for me and my friends which I highly recommend. Sushi in lobby was expensive but good. Bar is very popular in lobby which was nice to not have to travel far, and to have something to do when we came back from going out in old town. Upon checkout, the hotel held our bags for us while we explored the city more. But check your bill, we were charged for some miscellaneous things we did not get.

Reviews.Title: “What a fraud- this hotel couldn't care less about its guests and has security issues to boot!”
Reviews.Author: JMGJD
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a family vacation to La Concha. My husband and I were traveling with our 5 month old baby, my parents and my siblings. My parents stayed at La Concha in January and had such a nice time that they decided to take us all there in March. Having previously read reviews where people complained about noise from the lobby, my parents informed the hotel during their January stay that they would be returning with a baby and received assurances from the hotel that this is a "family friendly" hotel (to the hotel's credit there were plenty of kids and families staying there during our stay) and that it is very unusual to hear noise in the rooms and in any case we would all be placed in rooms where there would be no chance of hearing any noise in the "unlikely" event that there was noise. When my parents called a few days before we arrived for our March trip, the hotel said that they would honor their request to put us in rooms on the 10th floor (where they stayed back in Jan). However, when my parents arrived one day before the rest of the family, they were told that all of the rooms on the 10th floor were taken. To make matters worse, they put my parents in a room the size of a broom closet. When my parents complained, the hotel did do the right thing and offered to change their room the following morning. The next day (when the rest of the group arrived) they gave us all nice sized rooms on the 6th and 7th floors. I really was all ready to write a nice review on tripadvisor based on our experience at the hotel on a Wednesday. The rooms have incredible views of the ocean and we fell asleep to the waves crashing. The pools and grounds are lovely- different pools on different levels with a mixture of beds and lounge chairs and you never have that feeling of being piled on top of each other like at a lot of resorts. Condado itself is very up and coming- great restaurants and some cute shopping. However, on Thursday night the lobby turned into a club and things got progressively worse from there. First of all, in order to get to your rooms, you need to walk through the lobby "club". The hotel does not offer any other means of getting to the rooms for guests who don't want to be subjected to the club. The noise was deafening, but luckily we could not hear anything in our rooms. Unfortunately, I can't say the same for Friday and Saturday nights, where we were kept up the entire night by unbelievably loud club music in our rooms. And, as if the club music blasting in our rooms (on the 6th and 7th floors!!!) was not bad enough, there were drunken people running through the hallways making a ton of noise at crazy hours too. The hotel has ZERO security with respect to who has access to the different floors. In other words, people who come for the lobby club (non guests) can easily walk into the elevators and go up to any of the floors with guest rooms. There is heavy drinking and partying at the club and any of these drunken individuals can come up to any of the floors that you may be staying on because the hotel has no security personnel checking room cards to ensure that the only people using the elevators are hotel guests. We feel lucky that we only had to deal with the noise of drunken people running through the hallways.... it could have been so much worse (fights, crime, etc.). When my parents complained to "management" about all of the noise in our rooms on Friday night, they received an apology and were told that there was a DJ spinoff and that Saturday would be much quieter. Not surprisingly, this was just another lie, as Saturday night the noise in the rooms was 10 times worse (to the point that I tried to put towels in the door crack to dampen the noise). When I called at 1 AM to ask how long the music and noise in the rooms would go until, I was told in the most casual manner "until 4 AM," as if it was perfectly normal to pay upwards of $350 a night to be kept awake until 4 AM by ridiculously loud music in your room. When I asked to speak to a manager, I was told that the manager would call back but (again, not surprisingly) he or she never called. I see that a manager named Eddie often responds to people's reviews on this site. We tried to speak to Eddie on Saturday to complain about our experience on Friday, but were told that he would be available to speak to on Sunday. When we tried to speak to him on Sunday (the day we were all departing) we were told that he was conveniently "off the premises." So don't be fooled like we were by his seemingly caring tripadvisor responses.... when all is said and done, Eddie could care less about his guests experiences and satisfaction. Interestingly, when my husband went to the front desk on Sunday to ask for change, he saw a notepad with multiple room numbers and complaints from those rooms. All of the complaints were about noise in the rooms from the club in the lobby. Obviously, this is not a new problem. The hotel is completely aware of the noise in the rooms and is doing nothing about it except lying to its own guests and people on tripadvisor, leading us to believe that they are taking steps to change things or that one person's bad experience with noise is a highly unusual occurrence. If this hotel wants to be like the Shore Club in Miami (which is not the type of place you'd bring the kids to), that is fine. Just don't lie to your guests and make it seem like you are a family friendly hotel when it's clear that you are not and have no desire to be. And even at the Shore Club or other "hipster" hotel, I don't think guests would be happy to hear music blaring into their rooms at all hours of the night! The hotel did give my parents some compensation for our terrible experience, but not nearly enough in my opinion. My husband and I are avid travelers with friends who love to travel and will never recommend this hotel to anyone. Although, sadly, I don't think La Concha will care too much about this because my guess is that they make more money off of the club than anything else since they definitely value it way more than the guests staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Service!”
Reviews.Author: mdisc22
Reviews.Content: As a relatively frequent traveler, about 100K airline and 75 - 100 hotel nights, I have experienced a full range of service levels at various properties and airlines. La Concha rates #1 based on my recent experience. I stayed for 6 nights in March with my then girlfriend and now fiance. Since I was surprising her with an engagement ring at the hotel, I wanted the stay to be very special. I e-mailed the general Concierge inbox well in advance of my stay and very luckily got a response from Emily Vallejo Rivera. She was absolutely spectacular - setting up all of our excursions (which were plentiful and frequently changing), receiving my flowers and having them and champagne in the room upon arrival, having the ring secured in the hotel safe during the stay. She even called our tour guide when she knew I was proposing to make sure everything went OK - and she was done working for the day! Wow. The rest of the Concierge staff were just as good and the manager, I believe, Louisa, was a tremendous help as well. The room was fantastic - 12th floor junior suite. The food and drink were pricey, but relative for high-end resorts. The best part is that there are tons of food and drink options just a short distance from the hotel. Typically when you travel to a resort in the Caribbean, you are pretty much stuck at the hotel and feel gouged. Here you had the option to leave. Very nice. The last part was the newly opened Concierge lounge. For Gold and Platinum Marriott members, you know how nice this amenity is. Typically resorts do not have them, but our arrival date was the opening day for La Concha's. Overlooking the ocean with beautiful wicker furniture, breakfast was served in the morning and appetizers and drinks in the evening. We took full advantage of this and ate every morning in the lounge and had a beer or two each evening. As it was their first days open, I believe they underestimated the demand for food as they ran short a few times during the week. I think it was just opening issues, but I feel it needs to be expressed. However, the staff here were just as great as the Concierge. The manager, Michael Tischler, was fantastic and very approachable. His staff (Janisa, Johanna, Arcino, Dorian, and Luis) were also extremely friendly! All in all, I would recommend La Concha to anyone and we look forward to returning next year to celebrate once again! Also, if you do go to San Juan do NOT miss dinner at Pamela's Caribbean Cuisine - maybe the best meal I have ever had. You can find them on Open table.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic experience - thanks to a great hotel with EXCELLENT customer service.”
Reviews.Author: sarahjbh
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone .... it has been one of the nicest stays... very relaxing yet with a vibrant atmosphere. Everything was great, the rooms were modern and clean, our oceanview room had a fantastic view. I loved the atmosphere because it was mixed between young people having fun, couples and families.... great use of space and the pool areas are fantastic. I think that this is potentially the best customer service experience I have had, the staff are really helpful and extremely pleasant. My husband and I are lucky to be able to stay in really good hotels all around the world so I can honestly say that value for money, great location, great staff, great food - WELL DONE, my husband and I are coming back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our San Juan trip”
Reviews.Author: Homersdad1
Reviews.Content: The La Concha provided a wonderful respite with the relaxing atmosphere, courteous, helpful staff and nice amenities. For a trip to Old San Juan, we took the bus right in front of the hotel, a real value at 75 cents for the ride. We rented a car for the trip to El Yunque, a wise decision because we could travel on our own time. Roads were fine and traffic outside town was not bad. We then drove the car around San Juan and back to Old San Juan, not a wise decision. Do NOT venture into traffic down by the cruise terminal. The bus or a cab are your best bet for in-town travel. One word of advice: do not eat at Raices. The food was terrible and the atmosphere touristy. Our favorite part of the trip was lounging at the hotel on the beach. The poolside lunch was great, especially the fresh tuna salad with the tropical dressing. Staff were helpful and very service-oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnny28
Reviews.Content: Just got back from six wonderful nights at the La Concha, March 11th -17th. This Hotel has the perfect location, excellent service and staff. The food is top notch, everything! From the guys outside getting you a cab, to the staff checking you in, pool staff, i mean everyone is friendly and helpful. You can not pick a better place to stay. On top of all this wonderful service, the hotel grounds and pools are beautiful. All this right on the ocean. Marriott out did themselves on this one. It is very rare to get the right formula, beautiful hotel and tremendous staff, La Concha DID IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaways”
Reviews.Author: remba03
Reviews.Content: This is a great property with an most attentive and friendly staff. The location is terrific and most rooms have ocean front views. Food is exceptional with a number of restaurants to choose from it's only minutes away from Old San Juan. A great place for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “What an UNBELIEVABLE EXPERIENCE - La Concha is the Place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Testify202
Reviews.Content: You have no idea what you'd miss if you book a hotel in Puerto Rico and it's not La Concha! From the moment we arrived, greeted by the kindness and friendliness of Mr. Ricardo Lopez to the fast and almost heart-wrenching check-out assisted by Karla, we were in absolute HEAVEN! The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms amazing, and the staff, well, the most beautiful, loving, kind, peaceful, fun people you'd ever want to meet in your life. I will NEVER stay anyplace else ever in Puerto Rico. Do yourself a favor and book a room NOW!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: McLeanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. It's the epitome of Latin chic. Our room (Jr suite) had a great view (right in front of the beach), spacious, quiet, and great amenities. Pools were great. Every staff member was very friendly. If you're looking for an urban, yet beach-feel resort, this hotel does fit the bill. If you're looking for something more quiet, then you'd probably want to look for a hotel in Isla Verde or some other part of the island. My daughter and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay.”
Reviews.Author: Agarcia08
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ LaConcha for 5 nights, 6 days and liked the hotel a lot. Pros - - On the beach - Nice pool area - Internet available - Friendly staff - Clean - Restaurants - Food at the lounge/restaurant by the pool is really good! Perla was okay, kind of expensive for the amount of food you get. - Walking distance to shops, restaurants, bars. - Can book tours @ the hotel. - Casino - Parking Cons - - Room wasn't that big - My only major complain was when we checked in, they asked for a credit card on file for incidentals. The ended up charging my card $500 right of the bat when they told me they weren't going too. It took 2 weeks to get that refunded. - Air conditioning in the room wasn't that strong, room would often get hot/muggy. Overall, we enjoyed our trip to Puerto Rico. We went during "rainy season" and to be honest, it wasn't that rainy. It would rain maybe 10 minutes at a time and the sun would come out right after. It was in the 80's and we loved it. We went on 2 tours and both tours were great. We did a zipline/rapeling tour and loved it. We also went on a tour to El Yunque where you do a little hiking and then we also went to Luquillo Beach which was really nice. The zipline tour was did with EcoQuest and had a wonderful time. We went with a good group of people and the tour guide was knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The only consistency is inconsistency”
Reviews.Author: rduszak
Reviews.Content: Three days into our 6 day family vacation, I continue to be amazed by the paradox of consistent inconsistency of this property. The physical plant is very nice--recently refurburbished quite contemporary--not our taste but nice nonetheless. The folks at the front desk were great when we checked in, but when we went back, it was only so-so. The bellmen were great one time, so-so the next. One day we had a fabulous housekeeper and night time turndown. The next time, the housekeeping was barely adequate and there was no turn down. We're paying full rate in a corner suite, so sort of expected real service. The same applies at the pool. Great service one day, just so-so the next. The level of inconsistency indicates a big failure of management in appropriate oversight. That said, the view from the ocean front room is nice, and the people overall are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facilities, Great Views, Superior Service, Expensive Drinks”
Reviews.Author: jklancke
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 night at the La Concha Resort before our Caribbean cruise. The hotel was extremely nice. The grounds were very fun. There are water features every where, trees and bushes are worked into the spaces nicely...creating intimate and interesting seating. Everything is open and inviting. The pool area is great for relaxing...it is terraced with a lot of opportunity to cool off. The drinks are very good, but a little on the high side ($10-20 USD). Even though they were pricey, I did not mind paying for it since everything else was so nice. The rooms were very comfortable. The bathrooms were updated with glass showers and blue lights that put a different spin on things. They had iPod docks to play your music which was nice for the little time we spent in our room. The windows opened up to let the nice ocean breeze in and provided a great view of the beach and ocean. The beach was OK. I would not go here strictly for the beach. It is a nice play to lay out....the staff will take care of umbrellas and chairs. Swimming was not the best. Small waves and a little dirty. While service in the bar areas was great....beach service was sporadic. With all the local restaurants to eat at...we did not choose to eat at the hotel at all, except for an appetizer or two with drinks. What really set this hotel apart from others I have stayed at was the service from the front desk. On our way back from Africa, we lost a bag. Normally this does not phase us, but since we were leaving on our cruise we were a little concerned. In addition, it had about $500 of liquor in it from London (single malt scotch) and South Africa (vintage wines) that we were bringing back for special occasions. To complicate things, we changed affiliate airlines, Delta to American, so both airlines were telling me to talk to the other airline since it was the other ones responsibility. After a hundred dollars of roaming cell phone calls, I went to the front desk with my problem. They aggressively attacked the problem. Once they found out were the bag was (giving me updates every time they made any progress) they sent a driver to the airport to retrieve the bag. It was then immediately delivered to my room, followed by a call telling me my bag was safe. They did not have to do any of this, but took care of everything with a smile. The interesting thing was this was over a 36 hour period. Each staff member passed all the notes onto the next shift. Each person took personal ownership of my problem until it was resolved. I can't thank them enough. It made it so I could relax and enjoy Puerto Rico and not have to spend hours on the phone or drive around. The hotel is located a ways from the key shopping centers, but there were nice shops all around, and great restaurants to experience familiar foods as well as local flavors. Overall, it was a 5* experience.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: melby76
Reviews.Content: I came here with my sisters to relax. We are all in our 30s, My younger sister was scheduled to leave tonight but called the airline and changed her flight to the first one out this morning. The facilities are beautiful and the staff is very friendly. I knew that the lobby turned into a club on the weekends so we requested and a got room away from the lobby. The music was still so loud that I thought that someone had left the radio on next to my head. This morning, I was woken up sometime near 6am by someone yelling into a microphone followed by "eye of the tiger." The music hasn't stopped and I'm guessing will continue until early afternoon. Apparently there is a triathalon going on with the hotel as the start/finish. If I had known in advance what time the festivities were starting or even that the event was taking place I would have been more forgiving about being woken up before the sun. I would not recommend this hotel for a weekend getaway for anyone who is a light sleeper or plans to go to bed before 2 am.

Reviews.Title: “awesome for young partiers, but not families”
Reviews.Author: wfakih
Reviews.Content: spent the weekend here with my girlfriend. we like to party and so this hotel fit our needs. u walk in and its an open space lobby. there is a huge bar in the middle, with a sushi bar next to it, lounge seating. casino. at night the lobby turns into a club. there is loud music, dancing, etc. they dont stop the music til 5 in the morning and you can definitely still hear it in your room. even with the doors shut. its loud. make sure you are good and drunk at night so u can go to bed :) or maybe ear muffs. one night the lobby turned into a fashion show. one night it was just a full out club like scene. young. fun. everyone looking good. this hotel is definitely hipster. if you are older i would definitely go to the waldorf instead. that hotel was awesome. we went to the club there. bravo. make sure you dont wear sneakers there. i had a pair of donald pliner 400 dollar sneakers and they wouldnt let me in. the staff there was very nice though and a waiter said i could borrow his shoes. lol. we went back to the concha, only 10 min away. greeted by 100 puerto rican models. hot hot hot. i thought i was in a movie or something. have fun :) btw. even though we prepaid, the hotel was giving me pending charges of over 400 dollars a night. all that was taken care of on checkout though.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cookiesaber
Reviews.Content: A friend and i just returned from what was supposed to be a four day trip to Puerto Rico. We extended our trip another day in large part due to the excellent service we received at this resort! The lobby is absolutely beautiful with it's open air concept. The bar in the center of the lobby serves as a nightly hot spot just an elevator ride away. The grounds were gorgeous with it's three pools, two jacuzzis and cozy sitting areas. Our room was wonderful. We stayed in a two room suite which had floor to ceiling windows throughout that you could open to enjoy the sounds of the ocean, pool or city. The suites are located on the corner of the hotel and provided excellent views of all three. Last but definitely not least, all of the staff from the concierge to housekeeping were beyond friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business”
Reviews.Author: joesimon
Reviews.Content: Meeting a client at this hotel was not a good idea. Despite my frequent stays at Reinassance and Marriott, going forward I will look for a more welcoming hotel chain. In this hotel we (myself and client0 had (avoidable) noise issues which impeded our rest. My bill was not ready when I left in the early morning and, once back home, I realized the already unreasonably high bar charges were also over billed. Will not recommend this hotel to anyone and, since this is the second time I encounter issues with Marriott (first one in Virginia) I will opt for alternate companies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Beach, Great Location, Fun for Couples!”
Reviews.Author: jhf14
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a vacation from 2/22 - 2/27 and had a fantastic time! We are in our 20s and found the activities and layout of the hotel were adult friendly... in fact there were hardly any kids (which was nice). The rest of the crowd was a bit older than us...i'd say the average age is 40, but that didn't bother us much. CLEANLINESS: Place was very clean, including our room. Only complaint here is that it takes housekeeping a long time to get to your room. LOCATION loved the location... it's close to a handful of local restaurants. Had a great italian dinner at a place called Postino. Also, make sure you try some authentic Puerto Rican food (fried plantains and chicken)... so good. The location is a cab ride away from Old San Juan. We spent 2 days cruising old San Juan which was fun, but crowded on one day because of a cruise ship. Seeing the old Fort is a must! (cab ride is $15 with tip)... or take the bus for 75 cents! ROOMS We had a room on the 11th floor overlooking the ocean. It was very spacious and clean. Not sure if this is the norm though from other reviews I've read... I asked for a room that was higher up b/c I was under the impression that the lower floor rooms were a bit smaller. SERVICE Can't say enough about the service. I am a Platinum member for Marriott and the staff was very responsive to my requests. When I arrived, I asked for a room on a high floor and got it. I had free breakfast everyday b/c I am Platinum, but my girlfriend didn't... All I did was ask for her to have free breakfast and they gave her coupons for every day! I was given two free drinks for my birthday plus was bought a shot. One day I chipped my tooth after being rocked by a huge wave... I went to the bar and they gave me another 2 free drinks... which helped with the pain ;-) VALUE Very good value for the stay... I didn't pay for the room since I used my points but I would still think it was a pretty good deal. I will say that it can get pricey. Drinks are between $7 (beer) and $14 at the bar... which is a bit steep if you're from the midwest like I am. Either way, we had $250 free b/c of Marriott gift cards I exchanged some of my credit card points for so it made it pretty manageable. SLEEP QUALITY No problems here... we were up high and never heard anything as far as "club" music that people have reported... I was a fan of their pillows too. Room was a bit warm in the morning, but we don't sleep in too much so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected for service and friendliness of staff”
Reviews.Author: bignabe
Reviews.Content: This is the ultimate resort for amenities. We were upgraded to oceanfront room which had the most beautiful view of the beach and ocean waves rolling into the rocks offshore. We enjoyed the hottubs which were poolside. Rooms could be more sound proofed due to doors slamming. Dinner at UMMO (lamb) was great. Dinner at Ropa Vieja super (cabrita). Liquor store down the street for in room use. great prices on liquor to bring home at the airport duty-free. Thanks to Carla Maldonaldo for your suggestions and directions to Rainforest and Old San Juan historic sites, to Roger Fitch (attendant for front entrance) for taking care of luggage repair. Johanna, thanks for your pool service for food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Trendy Hotel- Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glittery84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at La Concha for six nights this February. We had a great stay here and would recommend the hotel to other young couples and our friends. Our room was very trendy and mondern with a great and efficient layout. We didnt use the T.V. at all during our stay, but there was a large LCD in the room. Also, they had an ipod docking station alarm clock that we used to play our own music at times. The bed was the highlight of the room. Both of us have spent a lot of time in hotels for our jobs, so neither of us have trouble sleeping in hotels. However, this bed was amazing and we really got great rest and felt completely recharged when our vacation was over. The resort property was very luxurious and was great for relaxing on the beach or near the pool. The beach at the hotel is a little "cove" like. There is a jetty that sticks out into the ocean that causes the surf to be a little rougher than other areas of the beach. Also, as a heads up for oceanswimmers, because of the increased surf near the jetty, this spot seems to be a favorite for local surfers. There were approximately 5-6 surfers there during the weekend of our stay. They didnt bother anyone, but it was a little nerve wracking because it would be very possible to get hit by one of them if you weren't careful. The property has three pools and two hot tubs. In the courtyard area there are two pools, an upper and a lower that flow into each other. This is the most popular spot to sun bath if you are looking for direct sun. There are waieters and waitresses that will serve drinks poolside here and near the beach. We observed this, but didnt use this service during out stay. The one thing we liked was that the wait staff would only come if you did to you if you flagged them over. They didnt hound you to buy drinks if you weren't interested. To some people this may be annoying, but we were happy with this. We booked our stay using Marriott Rewards points so the value for us was great, but without using points the hotel would have definitely been a splurge. The bars at the hotel are awesome and the drinks are well made and very big. I was a huge fan of the mojitos. Just be aware the drinks are pretty similar to NYC prices. We would usually get a drink or two every night and sit in one of the outdoor seating areas in the courtyard bar area. There are lots of spaces that are very private to have a drink and just talk. Also, many nights the hotel had live music or a D.J. We ate lunch at the hotel once and the food was very good. However, we didnt eat at the hotel restaurant or get room service during our stay. At night our routine would be to walk to one of the local restaurants and get dinner and drinks. There are a number of decent restaurants near by. However, I wouldnt say that the food in Puerto Rico was the high point at all. We ate and drank well, but the food was average. For breakfasts in the morning I would usually walk to Starbucks (5 min walk) or Dunkin Donuts (across the street) to grab morning coffee and something light to eat. During lunch, if you wanted to get something less expensive there are a lot of local places and some fast food places like Subway or Wendys nearby. The concierge staff was attentive and will suggest restaurants for you. Also, if you are interested in doing any activities they can help arrange that for you. We drove to the rainforest one day and they provided us with a trail map, background information, and driving directions. The only annoying thing that occured during our stay was that we got stuck in Puerto Rico an extra day due to a snow storm in our area. The front desk made extending our reservation a little difficult. They were polite and courteous, but because we wanted to use Marriott points they gave me a little bit of a run around. I ended up being able to successfully extend my reservation with points, but it was just a little annoying to have to deal with the back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Un-Organized”
Reviews.Author: trvlr50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found La Concha Hotel last year while visiting San Juan. We were intrigued by the openness, architectural design and outdoor areas. We decided to book a trip there for this year and were excited about our stay, short weekend that it was. We were bitterly disappointed from the start of arrival. We arrived in the mid-afternoon and were told our room was not ready. We ended-up waiting an hour and a half just to get into the room. They had held our luggage and at the time our room was ready, we asked to take our luggage ourselves up to the room. They insisted they would deliver it for us. Thirty minutes after we were in the room, the luggage arrived but only 1 suitcase. They did not know where the other luggage went. My husband ran down to the front desk (yet another time) to find his luggage as part of the lost luggage was his briefcase with his laptop and other expensive equipment. They did not know where it went. We found out it had been delivered to another room and the gentleman was kind enough to inform them it was not his luggage. This entire fiasco cost us our afternoon of 3 hours which would have been spent visiting San Juan. Additionally, since my husband is a Platinum member with Marriott, we were offered a room amenity basket. We chose the items we wanted and it did not get delivered. We had to ask for the delivery and when it came, the items were incorrect. To add fuel to the fire, they ended-up charging us for the free amenity! We did get that resolved at the time of check-out but the entire experience left us very disappointed. Also, as insignificant as this complaint might be, I wanted to add that while we were waiting for our room, I used the ladies room in the lobby. It was dirty and smelled horrible. For a Marriott property, this hotel was not up to Marriott standards. We stayed at the other Marriott property on Ashford last year and had a much better experience. We are not interested in returning to La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible front desk almost ruined our trip”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaPlum1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful-3 pools, 2 hot tubs, amazing outdoor area, right on the beach, beautiful, trendy lobby bar with great music and excellent service. The room was very modern and clean. The food at the pool side restaurant was great, so was breakfast. Our only complaint was the front desk. We had a problem with our reservation and the staff was unwilling to help us until we contacted Marriott's corporate offices. Then they delayed/botched our housekeeping requests for towels and blankets. The last straw was when they errouneously called us at 6:30a.m. on Saturday for a wake up call! Two days later they called the room at 9:30a.m. to advise us of a fax received the day before, and to confirm the 11:00a.m. wakeup call. I'm still not sure if the staff was rude or just incompetent, but either way their service was consistently terrible. If you are staying in a hotel in this price point, I would recommend trying el condado down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been so much better”
Reviews.Author: Minnesotaguy82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Condado area with great view and access to beach. Puerto Rico on this side of the island is not known for their beaches, but the warm temps and sun the best sunbathing is done by the pool but don't expect stellar service, or attentive service I have expected at other "resorts". Service is ok, but during my stay it seemed the staff had many opportunites to circulate around and help, like taking drinking orders around the pool - they did not. You had to schlep to the "bar" area to get what you needed. The hotel is an area that is a bit distressed and trying to make a comeback. La Concha gets some details right, like the Casino, well appointed, hip, modern. But misses so much more. For $399 per night for a 12' x 24' size room (with view) I found the room details lacking such as a broken remote control, desilvered mirrors, only one bathroom, an iron that was rusted and missing Do Not Disturb sign. So the higher price I guess I was expecting more from the quality and the service which did not deliver. When told about the lack of service (esp. no room service after 11 PM! - WTF?) despite their menu saying cold items availiable, the stay recommend I walk across the street at midnight to the Subway despite them still serving drinks at the bar and the Casino going at all hours. Amazing that not one Pizza joint in all of San Juan would deliver to this hotel. I guess you get better response out of hotel in Duluth, MN than this place. Disappointing. I would recommend this hotel if you are young and single and have some money to burn,but don't expect too much service and a distant attitude to most employees (except valet service - they were great). Also if you have kids be careful about a potential dangerous undertow at the beach area, which had security present but seem to be absent of any lifeguards. Overall I would say I recommend but with reservations and a bit of downer for any special occasion where you would expect above and beyond service. Oh, and side note, never sent a follow up email by Marriott or the hotel asking about my stay. I guess they deleted my email after I complained on how much better this hotel could have been. That about captures the attitude here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahop
Reviews.Content: I loved my trip to Puerto Rico. I took a lot of time researching which hotel we wanted to stay at. I am very happy I picked this one. My friends let me do the planning and I was nervous the hotel would not meet my expectations. I really wanted them to be happy with what I picked. La Concha was so nice we did not ever want to leave the hotel. We had a hard time motivating ourselves to do some sightseeing. The main pool with great city views was a fun place. The beach was great. The rooms were clean and trendy. We had an amazing ocean view. There was some construction going on while we were there, but it was never a problem. We didn't have issues with noise or anything. Food and drinks were great. They weren't cheap, but food and drinks at hotels never are. The location of the hotel was perfect too. You're close to restaurants, shopping, casino. You're also a short bus/cab right to Old San Juan. We were a group of single girls, but there were families there too. I think it's a great hotel for all types of travelers. If I go back to Puerto Rico, I would go back to La Concha in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: EG2003
Reviews.Content: The positives: - The hotel has beautiful architecture and a sophisticated, modern vibe that is very nice. It is in the Condado area, which is very nice. - It has 2 swimming pools and a hot tub. It is also right on the ocean. - Our room had a nice balcony with a table for two. - You can walk right out of the back of the hotel and be on the beach. The hotel provides free beach chairs and umbrellas, although the umbrellas go quickly. - The concierge was very helpful with helping us to find good restaurants that could accommodate our vegetarian diet. All hotel staff were attentive and friendly. - There are many great restaurants and bars that are walking distance from this hotel and you can completely get by without eating at the hotel, which is overpriced. The negatives: - If you are on a low floor by the pool, the noise of the night club may disturb you if you are a light sleeper. I could faintly hear it in the room until between 12 and 1. - Almost everything in this hotel is outrageously overpriced. A Bud Light beer cost around $8 at the night club, and a buffet breakfast that was nothing special was $25 a person at the restaurant. The only decently priced restaurant in this resort is the sandwich shop by the casino. - If you rent a car, they charge you $15 a day to park it at the resort. I give this hotel an overall positive review and I would stay there again. You can get around the negatives by asking for a room on a higher floor or adjusting your schedule so that you go to bed late (things quieted down between 12 and 1) or wear ear plugs! This is probably only a problem if you are a light sleeper as I am. It is not terribly loud, but you can still hear the music in your room. As for the $15 for parking, there are so many good restaurants and bars in the area that you won't really need a rental car. Drivers in Puerto Rico were pretty scary anyway! It cost $11 (set rate) to go from the Condado area to Old San Juan (price for one way without tip). However, it's still cheaper when you add up the cost of the rental car and the price to park it at the resort, especially if you stick around the hotel for part of your trip and don't use cabs. The location is nice and you can avoid easily avoid the overpriced food and drink at the resort. The beach is great!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, hip, trendy”
Reviews.Author: kipepeopeo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern, trendy and absolutey beautiful. Very south beach.We had gorgeous, roomy clean rooms with amazing decor and even better views out to the beach and ocean below us. Its a great place for young 20 and 30 somethings. We loved the lobby and pool areas with great music . The drinks were delicious and the food was great albeit a little overpriced. We took to eating at the neighborhood puerto rican food joints that were also very good just more traditional. They had a couple of happy hours while we were there with free cocktails. THe beach itself was not great but the really nice beach is walking distance. I would go again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny overpriced rooms, terribly inconsistent service, cramped pool and beach area.”
Reviews.Author: Rhihan
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for this relatively nice hotel at a nice location, the tiny rooms and terribly inconsistent service does it in. I'm here right now and each day that I'm at the over crowded pool, service is inconsistent. The first day I had a female waiter who was terrific. She was very attentive and came by frequently to take orders and check on us. The second day, it was mediocre at best with service we had to flag down. Today, though, was the worst with us sitting by the cramped pool area for an hour trying to flag down service. I even walked over to the bar and tried to place a food order, and was denied being told they would send a server over. Then I walked out and intercepted two different waiters to try and place and order and was told both times that I wasn't sitting in their area and they would send someone. No one EVER came over to help us. I finally intercepted the third waiter who apparently was suppose to serve our section. He basically said that he was busy. Really, that's quite frankly the worse service I've ever had in any hotel, particularly for one with a price as inflated as this, and I travel very frequently. This experience almost turned me off to Puerto Rico entirely. And the room, which I paid a premium for, was tiny. Really really small with a stand up shower that was so cramped that everytime you had a shower someone standing outside the bathroom would get wet if the bathroom door wasn't closed (since the shower had no door or curtain). Terrible. Will never stay hear again and will tell everyone I know to stay away.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha Resort was not peaceful or relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Diana94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with 2 other couples, stayed at La Concha Resort for a weekend in November. We were very excited to go to Puerto Rico to enjoy a relaxing weekend on the beach. When we checked in we were very impressed with the hotel. The pool area and beach area were gorgeous and our room was large, clean and had a great oceanview. My initial thought was I had picked a great hotel to stay at. However, by 11:00 p.m. on my first night there, I realized I had made a HUGE mistake by staying at this hotel. What the hotel does not advertise to it's guests is that the lobby/bar area of the hotel turns into a nightclub on the weekends. They bring in a DJ for the night that spins music until 2:00 a.m. - 3:00 a.m. And since the bar / lobby area that they turn into a nightclub is in the open area of the hotel - the noise from it easily carries to all the guest rooms. Although I was in my hotel room, the party could have been in the room with me. The music was so loud that my room was shaking from it. When I called the front desk to explain my dismay with how loud the music was, (considering it was past midnight and i had gotten up at 5:00 a.m. that day to catch an early flight into PR) the front desk explained the music would probably go to about 3:00 a.m. and unfortunately, I was in a "bad" room when it came to being disturbed by the music. And my favorite part of the nightclub was that it caters to people who live in Puerto Rico and cares more about the people at the nightclub than the guests who are actually paying to stay in the hotel. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone and would suggest staying at another hotel in Puerto Rico that actually cares about the guests who are paying to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: cheerchicknj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for 7 days, all of which were wonderful. The staff were very helpful and caring. The only downfall was the construction. We were put in a room that had was above the construction of the timeshares. At around 8:00 every morning we were awoken until we moved rooms to the left side of the building. If your an early riser then its fine. The rooms and views were beautiful and clean. Staff went out of their way to make our stay better. At the pool and beach you are treated like royalty when staff walks around handing out cold face towells and spray you with cold aloe lotion. Good location, walking distance to many great places. We are looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: jennamack
Reviews.Content: This resort was great overall. First the good: huge beautiful modern room (jr suite facing ocean) with a fantastic view. We were worried about the noise that others described in their reviews but it was very quiet on the 11th floor facing the ocean--no problem at all. The breakfast buffet at Level 25 is fresh and delicious. The homemade waffles at the waffle/omelette station are seriously the best I ever had. The chef was wonderful. The pools and ocean were great. All outside areas were clean with different types of seating options (covered "double beds", lounge chairs, etc. The food was very good at Solera (outdoor bar) but very limited. After 2-3 days you were tired of eating the same items. Gym was very modern and nice. Lobby was beautiful. Concierges were helpful. Greeting upon arrival was extremely friendly. The negatives: While many of the Solera staff were attentive and wonderful there were a few overwhelmed servers at times. Also, we were being stalked by one of the staff for not paying for 2 drinks on one afternoon which we did, in fact, pay for. They continuosly called our room and it was very annoying. We spent thousands of dollars at this resort and it was insulting that they thought we were trying to get away with not payinf for 2 lousy drinks. It wound up being some kind of computer glitch/communication between staff. It got to the point that I felt uncomfortable ordering drinks/food which definitely took away from my enjoyment. Perla restaurant was way overrated. Service was terrible--we are good tippers & left only 10% to show our disappointment. Food was good but very expensive for very small portions. The one thing that could make La Concha better would be the addition of a spa. The spa they recommended across the street was average. Overall we liked San Juan a lot--very clean and friendly people but I don't think I would stay for more than 4-5 days. Not much in the way of unique original shops except a few in Old San Juan. Great for laying out in the sun and some nice restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: caristocrat
Reviews.Content: La Concha was great. If you're familiar with the Shore Club in South Beach, very similar. Condado area is a lot like Miami, with some more upscale stretches (esp. to the west of the hotel on Ashford - Gucci, etc) and some just regular/whatever areas right around the hotel and to the east (Walgreens, Subway, etc), just like you would see in South Beach. Hotel is modern and stylish, but not overly done or pretentious. Lobby is beautiful, pool areas are excellent. Directly on the beach (as in - RIGHT on it). Service was courteous and efficient, never attitude-y. Room was comfortable, bed very much so. Beautiful ocean views. Definitely do an Ocean View room on a high floor to avoid excess noise from the pool/lobby party at night. Slept very well here as did my friends. Surf at night was lovely white noise. Not too many kids around, and those that were were well-behaved. Only negatives were room carpeting is a bit musty from all that ocean air, but not too bad at all. Kind of nice after a while, actually. Room safe code had to be entered a few times before locking, but then seemed to fix itself. And A/C was off one evening b/c of issue with windows being open, but again self-corrected after opening and closing windows a few times. No big deal. Construction still happening on the condo tower, but looks like it's almost done, and I was never bothered by noise. Condos look like they're going to be nice. La Perla restaurant was excellent - exceeded my expectations. Not cheap, but not overpriced for the quality of the food, and the space is gorgeous. Lamb was the best I've ever had! Service could perhaps been a bit more attentive, but very polite. All in all, a great experience. I'd definitely return. My overall stay in San Juan was a lot of fun. Great balance of relax at beach/pool and stuff to see and do in old San Juan. Recommend Toro Salao (casual tapas-ish, nice outdoor seating in a good people-watching area) and Baru (also shared food, bit more upscale, but not stuffy) in OSJ for food. There's also a good authentic Puerto Rican place for breakfast not far from the hotel, about a five minute walk inland from the beach. The historic fortresses in OSJ are incredible, esp. el Morro. Have lots of room on your camera for pictures. PS Also seemed a gay-friendly hotel. A plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: comments37
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet place to relax and enjoy the warm sunshine while the northeast US got pounded with snow. Comfortable room overlooking the ocean, complete with a terrace and free WIFI/wired internet access. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, especially Kenneth Aguila (Food & Beverage Manager), Luz Gonzales, and Sebastian (Concierge). Excellent local restaurants within walking distance (Ommo and Jam were outstanding). The neighborhood is going through some renovations, but you have to remember, you're in the middle of the city. The beach is great, although the water is usually rough. Plenty of chairs and places to relax at the beach or pool.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Honestly-M
Reviews.Content: After my flight back to the US was cancelled due to snow, I wound up at La Concha for two nights. At first I was very upset because of my cancelled flight, but once I arrived at La Concha I immediately settled down. The ambiance at the resort is quite soothing and the drink coupon helped. My room, on the 11th floor overlooking the ocean, was quite... nice- 4 star, I would say. The front desk staff members were very nice, especially Tanya. The pools were quite nice and the beach was beautiful, but rough. I would not recommend this beach for small children at all. I couldn't quite figure out how I felt about the surrounding area since I only staying there for one full day. There seemed to be several broken down or abandoned buildings very close to the hotel. Although the cab driver told us it was a safe place to walk around at night, I did encounter men sleeping in the doorways of adjacent building and beggars. Overall I really liked the hotel, but am a little suspicious of the surrounding area

Reviews.Title: “Love the La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: mcintd02
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've stayed in was the La Concha Renaissance Resort in Puerto Rico. Great room, awesome food and night life, fun casino, and the service was spectacular. Saw it on Travel Channel worlds Top 10 luxary resorts a couple weeks after I returned. I am a Marriot Platinum Elite member so I used points to stay there, in fact, I got 2 rooms, one for my brother in law. Even though I used points I was still upgraded to a suite and treated like royalty. The staff not only got to know me personally, they also got to know my brother in law by name. One of the best experiences at this hotel was going to Old San Juan. We took the public bus and what a ride for .50! It was great hanging with the locals. The concierge also arranged for a kayaking trip in the bioluminescent bay. We were picked up at the hotel, right on time, and had a spectacular evening. I will return to PR, and to this hotel, again and always reccomend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Qilobaby
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a short Labor Day trip with friends. Needed something budget friendly, but worth the trip to Puerto Rico. La Concha was recommended by a collegue and I have praised her ever since as this was the perfect spot for me and my friend to do a quick, relaxing, fun filled 4 days. The hotel is very trendy. But not to a pretensious type of trendy. At night the place comes alive with locals and tourist hanging out at the many bars in the lobby. The first night we were trying to get some well deserved sleep and had to come outside on our balcony to see what was going on outside that we were missing. As we danced in our robes on the balconies and eventually went back inside to sleep we were estatic that our hotel always had something going on. The hotel is in the Condado section which was wonderful because you could walk out of the hotel and walk the streets for different shops and restaurants so there was no use for a taxi. We took a day long trip to Old San Juan and after 3 attempts to the Bacardi factory we finally made it. I would suggest calling and confirming they are open and how long they will be open for the day. We took the ferry from Old San Juan for 50 cents, couldn't beat it. When I go back to Puerto Rico, it will definitely be to stay at La Concha, even if it is to just sit on the beach. I want to sit on the beach at this hotel. All of the staff that I encountered, mainly concierge was fabulous. All recommendations but 1 were great, and I think the recomendation for 1 restaurant had to do with us being the last ones in the restaurant :) Definitely stay here if you are looking for a trendy but down to earth place to stay in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Grounds, Rooms are Suspect...”
Reviews.Author: Lis100
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of our vacation. We were very impressed by the hotel lobby, bar, pool area and beach. The room appeared nice upon first entry, however after staying a few days it would be nice to get better maid service. I'm all for going green, but when I have sand in my sheets and request them to be changed I except to receive new ones, especially at a hotel of this caliber. We had a very bad experience with getting our room cleaned and getting clean towels which is the reason I would not reccomend. After being gone for most of the day we returned to our room around 3:30 to shower and regroup. We found it had yet to be cleaned. We called and requested maid service as we had no clean towels. Were told someone would be there within a half an hour. We left for an hour came back to find no one had come to clean. Called again and they sent up someone who brought new towels and made the bed (nothing else no clean sheets, no new tolietries). Just glad we weren't paying cash to stay there! On the plus side, it's less family oriented than the other Marriott, so there weren't kids everywhere. As others mentioned if you try to go to bed early on a weekend expect it to be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Hot spot in Condado!”
Reviews.Author: Ghanamerican
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! From the lobby to the grounds to the room. We got a standard room that was oceanfront. We even tried leaving a tip for housekeeping and they didn't take it until we wrote a note that it was for them. The concierge was very kind when we arrived early and our rooms were not ready. They held our bags while we roamed around and called us as soon as our room was available. The restaurants are a bit pricey, but the atmosphere is beautiful. We took the bus a couple times to Old San Juan (75 cents and the bus stop was right in front of the hotel). I would definitely come back again and bring more of girls!

Reviews.Title: “Watch Your Belongings”
Reviews.Author: EdTech101
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a nice hotel in a good location. We had a very good time while at the resort and I would probably return, but I'm not sure I trust the employees. I had the charger to my iPhone stolen by a housekeeping employee that was returned when I filed an incident report with security. We had requested towels for our room and went to dinner. Upon our return, the charger was gone. Security indicated they could check to see who had come into the room while we were gone. At 1 AM, security came to my room with a charger in hand. While he told me it was one he had in a box, I immediately recognized a mark on it signifying it, in fact, was mine. In other words, the employee had been caught red handed with the charger. Nobody from hotel management or security followed up with me after the charger was returned. While in the elevator, another guest indicated her wallet was stolen from the locked safe. I have no idea what the outcome of her situation was, but this incident and then hearing of hers made me feel very uncomfortable the rest of our stay. I am a Marriott Gold member and stay in Marriott hotels in excess of 60 nights per year, this is my first such incident. Bottom line here, enjoy the resort, but watch your belongings.

Reviews.Title: “Eye candy”
Reviews.Author: MishkaNewYork
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at a nearby hotel but came to admire the lobby and pool area. We don't know what the rooms are like, but the grounds are gorgeous and styling of the lobby simply alluring to my architect-wife. The top-notch restaurant on the grounds is only open for dinner, apparently, but comes highly rated. Clientele seemed considerably more hip and beautiful than our hotel's.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel - rooms are a weak spot - fantastic Perla restaurant”
Reviews.Author: aBitParticular
Reviews.Content: The lobby, the bar, the pool, the beach & the location are all big pluses for this property. The shining star is Perla restaurant serving truly world class food in an amazing setting (it's inside of the giant shell room on the beach) - it feels very retro-chic but the food is 100% modern and delicious. The bar turns into a real hot-spot at night - which some will enjoy and other with loathe depending on who you are. The only sore spot is the rooms. They smell moldy because they are carpeted. In such a humid climate this seems like a really odd choice, wood or stone would have been less damp and stinky. The bathroom seemed dirty or moldy (even though it wasn't, it just looked that way due to sloppy installation and poor choice of materials). The rooms are standard issue, smallish chain hotel rooms, nothing original or unique here. The pluses are that all the rooms face the ocean so nobody gets a bad view no matter what room you're in. If you can overlook the weak spot of the rooms, it's a really nice hotel and a fun place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Hip - not cheap”
Reviews.Author: mdqjr
Reviews.Content: If you like trendy fun places you'll love this hotel. But, bear in mind that it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “No one wanted to go home!!”
Reviews.Author: 5BERGS
Reviews.Content: La Concha was everything I thought it would be and more!! The location, the waves, the pool, workout room, views were perfect!! Our family loved being able to walk to great restaurants, short trip from airport, short trip to shop in Old San Juan!! The only tip that helped me in all the reviews was to get a high room, so the bar noise would not travel up and keep you awake. Would recommend this hotel to everyone and will return again next year for Christmas break! Water is rough, but my kids our High School swimmers and they loved the waves.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel...hottest crowd in town!”
Reviews.Author: pikus
Reviews.Content: We are glad we flew from NYC's overrated NYE parties to one of the best parties we've ever been to. This hotel really sets the standard of what a trendy, modern hotel in the caribbean should be. The staff also makes you feel like royalty. Specifically, ever since Sebastian Sagardia from the concierge and Elia Ortiz from the front desk learned that my girlfriend and I got engaged recently, they helped us celebrate our year by making our stay extra special. Special thanks go out to Sebastian for making sure our stay was very pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: pepperbluemd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for our last night in PR. I wish we had stayed there longer. The staff was very helpful, friendly, our room was great. Everything is so modern. I guess that the shower wall is esthetically pleasing, but we had some water on the floor after all our showers. The breakfast a la carte added up quickly, but the food was good and service great. Didn't have time for the fitness center but the pool and beach were great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: fidds_8
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel. We stay over New Year for 3 days - we moved there from the Conrad which was the most terrible hotel. The hotel, facilities, rooms are all fabulous. The food in the restaurants delicious, the lobby, pool, beach - everything was so great. Best of all, service was excellent and all the staff just lovely. And as a bonus, they had the hugest New Year's eve party which was exclusive - you couldn't attend unless you were a guest, had booked dinner in the restaurant or were invited, it was lots of fun. I will definitely go back and love that you can just stay in the resort if that is what you want to do. I can't say enough about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, very hip, close to Old San Juan....”
Reviews.Author: SunluvaBoston
Reviews.Content: We stayed w/our 10yr. old son & 14 yr.old daughter for 5 nights in December. The weather was perfect, and the beach provided lots of entertainment for the kids with just the right size waves for body surfing and swimming. The wall of rocks that protects part of the beach also provides a calm area for swimming. You must be aware that you are still in a city with the property adjacent to a public park and well traveled streets. The beaches are public, and on our last day, small tour buses kept pulling up to the park and vacationers from the cruise ships would be walking right past our beach chairs. A couple sitting near us had their wallet taken while they were in the water even though there is hotel security on the beach. I want to stress that we did feel safe at all times. The morning buffet breakfast was delicious as were the evening cocktails we enjoyed by the pool. There is a very sophisticated atmosphere to the hotel. I must mention something that happened to us while there with an amazing outcome. Our son left his backpack in the taxi when we arrived from the airport late the first night. We did not discover this until the next morning when he was looking for his Nintendo DS w/all his games. We assumed it was long gone, but reported it to the bell-man and front desk anyway. Jose Rivera went above and beyond normal expectations to make every effort to help us get it back. Only in PR have we experienced where at the airport the head taxi service person gives you a receipt w/the car's license plate written on it as you depart the airport. This all occurred on a Sunday when no one could be reached, Jose tracked down the taxi company name and drove to the airport after his shift and eventually retrieved the backpack from the driver (who hadn't even realized it was still in the cab!) Jose then made a trip back to the hotel and personally delivered it to a very happy 10yr. old boy! The only improvements could be in housekeeping. Our sofa bed was supposed to have been made up ahead of time due to our late arrival, so we had to wait for 2 sets of sheets. One for the pullout and one for the chaise. The air bed they brought was way too big to fit anywhere in the room even though we had a suite. The modern furniture is not designed well for the space, not enough storage and the desk is curved so it sticks out into valuable space. All in all though an eye-pleasing decor.

Reviews.Title: “Choose the La Concha over the Marriott in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: karolinakev
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the La Concha resort in san juan--it is just down the block from the Marriott--the two hotels are totally different--the La Concha is cool, modern and hip--the Marriott is staid, old and stodgy. The pool and beach at the La Concha are very well laid out and there is no feeling of over crowding. The Level 25 restaurant (where we had breakfast each morning) is open on both sides to the pool and the ocean-- a great place to begin the day. The staff at the la Concha are great and accommodating. I am a Platinum and received upgrade, breakfast for my family, drink coupons and more. My friend who was staying at the Marriott was told the Concierge room was closed and received nothing. One La Concha negative--it is pretty noisy because there is an incredible bar scene with live music and DJ almost every night and the lobby is open air--so request a high floor! Also, room service is exceptionally slow. Their gym is well-equipped and has great staff. It looks out to the beach--they even offer spinning classes for free. The casino is small but nice and has a $5 blackjack table. In all a fantastic experience during a very busy holiday period.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, horribly noisy room”
Reviews.Author: S-Dubb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Concha for one night in December before we left on a cruise out of San Juan. We always stay at Marriotts, so we thought we knew what to expect. Upon arriving, we were thrilled with the location and also with the exceptional lobby. Its very trendy with a handful of bars all within the hotel. We took the elevator up to our room and were surprised that the hallway was actually outdoors. The room is nice (the floor to ceiling windows overlooking the beach were great) but it seemed a little dirty. The biggest disappointment came at nighttime. We went to bed around 1am, and I think we were the only people in San Juan who did. There was some sort of fiesta going on outdoors. There was screaming and so much noise - all of which you heard through the paper thin doors. If someone got off the elevator and walked down the hall to their room, you could hear them even if they were wispering. We both slept with pillows over our ears to try and block out the noise but it was still not enough. That was enough to completely ruin our night and our overall impression of the hotel. They really need to get better insulation or build a wall between the outdoors and the hallway that leads to your room.

Reviews.Title: “The only place my Abuela will stay is at La Concha in Condado PR!”
Reviews.Author: BauerGoalie31
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at La Concha and it still amazes me and my Abuela every time! I highly recommend staying at this hotel! As soon as you walk in the hotel lobby, you know you picked the best hotel in San Juan! The views from the room are amazing, high level of service from the staff, the beautiful beach location with crazy waves, and the atmosphere of this resort will make you want to come back for more! The staff: Louise - is the best concierge services staff member ever! If you need help going anywhere, make sure you meet up with her each morning! She gave us detailed directions with maps, printouts, and advice to catch the ferry to Culebra and also recommended Lago Dos Bocas in Utuado on another day since we were trying to find something new after visiting Restaurant El Nuevo Guayabo in Arecibo (home of the ceti). We had dessert and cafe con leche at another Restaurant in Lago Dos Bocas after enjoying an amazing ride with spectacular views on this little boat! Eddie Sipple - GM Make sure you take note of his contact information on this website! He really means it when he says if you have an issue, make sure you let him know during your stay! I had his email address and his cell number on my blackberry when another front desk manager couldn't pull through my request and it paid off! He was very professional and had another staff member contact me ASAP when he wasn't even on the property. Alfredo & Luis - thank you for making it happen! My Abuela knows you take care of us! Tacia - always a pleasure being greeted by her on the phone making sure we received our extra towels, special requests, and finally meeting in person! Raquel - we didn't catch up with her this time around but if it wasn't for her amazing hospitality during the crazy soft opening back in 2007, we probably would have stayed elsewhere the last 2 stays. Miguel - stay away from this guy if you need anything resolved, he kept making promises for our next stay. Not to mention, he had the same attitude back in 2007 when we needed help. Fortunately, we ended up with Raquel! top places to visit: #1 Culebra (stay all day at Flamenco Beach #2 top rated beach in the world!) #2 La Parguera (rent small boat, ask for tour guide, Kiko, at Fondo de Cristal in morning) #3 Lago Dos Bocas (catch the free boat for a ride on the lake and eat at restaurants) #4 Gilligan's Island (launches from Copamarina Beach Resort, 1 hr visit is plenty time) #5 Ponce (visit La Guancha, lookout tower from La Cruceta, plaza horse carriage ride) #6 Parque de las Cavernas del Rio Camuy (wow this place is breathtaking!) #7 Rincon (enjoy this surf town! the waves here are perfect!) #8 Arecibo (visit the largest observatory in the world, eat ceti by the lighthouse) #9 Isabela (watch the waves crash here in amazement, it's like watching fireworks) Rent a car and just go exploring! I left out so many places... Luquillo Beach, La Playuela Beach at Cabo Rojo Lighthouse, Mayaguez Zoo, Isla Verde casinos, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel-awesome from check in to check out”
Reviews.Author: sanfran58
Reviews.Content: La Concha was wonderful. We only stayed one night, after a cruise (would have loved to stay longer, though, and will return); I called early to see about early check in. The front desk clerk (I did not get her name) was WONDERFUL. We paid for a pool view and were upgraded to the most amazing suite (505). She said it would be worth waiting for, and it was. Every staff person was wonderful, the food at the poolside was delicious, the grounds are just fantastic, beautifully done, hip, architechturally interesting--even my teenagers were blown away, and appreciated the asthetics, because they are so unique. Many different pool areas, with big couch/bed lounges; the beach was beautiful, they set up lounges, umbrellas, provide ice water. Basically, the staff is threre to pamper and does a great job. The room was also fabulous decor. Smallish bathroom would be the only "comment." Beds comfortable, floor to ceiling sliding doors, open to the surf. Can't wait to go back. This in stark contrast to our stay at the Wyndham Rio Mar in Rio Grande on the front end of our trip (see my review there, and read the "good" reviews with my comments in mind-the place is in disrepair and service horrible). Thank you La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good choice all things considering”
Reviews.Author: familyfunx202
Reviews.Content: The Good... We arrived way early and were dead tired. The front staff found us a room STAT and gave our twin 4 year old girls beach toys, lip balms, sunscreen, and sunglasses. We were happy to find that the hotel's Restaurant, Level 25, has a decent breakfast buffet and children under 6 don't have to pay. We weren't as happy because we saved any money, it ends us being around the same, but at least we didn't have to wait for the food to get cooked in PR time. Another convenient thing is that the hotel is central to everything and Old San Juan is just a 10 min. taxi away. Last, but not least, there is a boardwalk-type pier in the beach directly in front of the hotel which works really well to break some of the rough waves that could keep kids from enjoying the beach. The Bad... Room service took some of our personal beach towels and when we brought it up there was never any follow up from anybody. When we went to the lobby to try to have the concierge help us plan our stay, we did not find him very helpful. Gratefully, we had read something about this and had an idea of what we wanted to do, but it's a shame that more time is not taken to help promote PR. Just so you know, you MUST do Isla Culebra, Isla Vieques, the Bioluminiscent Bay, and Old San Juan. Have the taxi drop you off at the "Morro" so you can work your way down the hill to restaurants, shops, etc. The Ugly... Apparently La Concha is the party place in San Juan. So there could be some partying going on and if there is be prepared to go without SLEEP! It seems that the hotel is unable to contain the noise to any one area, that said we had one night of partying where at 2am it felt like the band was right outside our door (and we were on the 7th floor)! We were able to just roll with it because it was only one night, but if it had been more than one night we would have had issues.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want for an adult vacation”
Reviews.Author: LRaven
