Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, we were automatically upgraded to a full suite instead of the junior suite we had booked since the hotel was 99% booked. The desk clerk told us how lucky we were the 3rd best room in the hotel - it was gorgeous - 1001!!! If we ever go back we will ask for that room - it had a balony facing the pool and the park next door and windows front facing the beach. The service at the hotel was great! We arrived at the pool bar about 11:55 after checking in on a friday and were told that the kitchen was closed by the hostess, not 2 minutes later the bartender said what would you like Ill get the kitchen right on it! and so it went our whole trip - the service was slow around the pool and they gave us free drinks as their apolopgy. It can be loud so I agree with those folks especially on the weekend nights, so you should ask for a quiet room - high up. Definitely the "in" hotel! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every moment!”
Reviews.Author: futbol01
Reviews.Content: Having never been to San Juan, my wife and I really weren't sure what to expect. We had heard several different things, some good and some bad. Let me just say that our trip was wonderful and one of the few locations we are planning to return to in the very near future. The hotel was everything we could have asked for and more. Seemingly located in the center of the Condado area, the hotel was clean, trendy, and close to many different attractions and/or activities. Although there is some building going on next door the noise was very minimal and didn't take away from the hotel at all. The room was clean and cozy with a terrific view of the ocean. Our trips always involve a little travel throughout the area and usually entail riding the local bus or just walking down the streets to mingle with people and see the sights. On several occasions we were in need of either directions or advice about which way to go. We were always greeted by the staff with a smile and the needed advice. In particular, Sebastian Sagardis, a La Concha employee, went above and beyond his regular duties to make sure that we found everything we needed to make our trips successful. I personally want to thank him and the rest of the staff that helped make our trip "worth every moment". Thanks and hope you enjoy the stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikester781
Reviews.Content: i stayed there in november 2009, and it was amazing. you have oceaview from every room. the ocean is literally under you, when you stand at the window. rooms are big, very clean, with flatscreen tv and wireless for free. in front of the hotel is the best beach in condado. (if you have nothing against high waves though). The staff extremly friendly (special "thank you" to elia: you are the best) and very helpful. there are a lot of young people (20-35) in this hotel and at the weekend the lobby is THE party spot in condado. so if you prefer quiet nights, get a room on the 10th floor or stay in different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: albinatl
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write this review for awhile. We love the hotel - it's very boutique chic which matches the overall vibe of Condado beach. The pools and the beach were very nice. The food was a bit pricey but well prepared. The lobby area was fun, the drinks were great, the hotel was pretty clean...the only thing is that housekeeping only changes the sheets every 3 days. I kept requesting that our sheets be changed but when we'd return after being out all day, they never were. We were there for 4 days! It was very annoying!...We always shower before going to bed but still there's nothing like fresh sheets when you're on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with beautiful spaces”
Reviews.Author: SFtravelsoftern
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Thanksgiving week with my partner. La Concha is a great hotel, but room location is very important. There is a 12 story tower that faces the ocean and a 2 story structure that faces the pool. The rooms are large, modern and very comofrtable. Great linens, sheets, and towels. Complimentary coffee in the room and Aveda bath products. There are events with loud music on weekend evenings and if you are in a room by the pool, I 'd suggest that you bring earphones. The grounds are spectacular and the vibe of the hotel is very much like the W without the attitude. The architecture is mid-entury modern and the story is that the government gave this hotel to Renaissance and they spent $100 million to renovate it. It really is beautiful and the place to be in Condado. Overall the service was good. The staff was very friendly, but sometimes it felt like the hotel was a bit understaffed. The pools, beach, and outdoor lounge areas were well situated. The gym was new and excellent for a hotel....about 10 cardio machines, weight machines, dumbbells, spin room. I loved the experience and would highly recommend it if you are a fan of the W experience.

Reviews.Title: “Poor construction and inattentive staff”
Reviews.Author: SonnyInNewYork
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at hotels on the Condado strip in the past and decided to try La Concha this time because of the location and some good reviews about its new renovation. Clearly, the renovation is incomplete, including our room. The workmanship is poor throughout the hotel and it was evident in the incomplete and dirty hallways leading to our room and the room itself. The shower was moldy and the grout was dirty. The tiles were uneven and many looked like they were slapped on. I took several pictures to share with management â€“ they looked like the â€œbeforeâ€� photos of a home renovation.Photos are attached - and this is when we checked in! The carpets were filthy. We stayed 4 nights and housekeeping only came once. We had to finally ask 3 times for housekeeping service on our last night. When they finally came, I knew they didnâ€™t clean anything because the toilet was still dirty, the old towels were still on the floor. I had to go to the lobby at 8pm and ask for towels and soap. The girl at the front desk looked at me like I had 3 heads and took 15 minutes to come back with ONE tiny bar of hotel soap! The bed was so lumpy, it felt like I was sleeping in a big crater and the middle of the bed was a mountain. Also, the hallways are in poor shape, with cracks in the tiles and filth. Cigarette butts and dirty drinking straws all over. I kept note of these to see how many days it would take before they were removed. They were there the entire time of our stay! The halls also constantly smelled like bacon or food from the kitchen â€“ even though we were on the 6th floor. Our TV remote control was broken â€“ again, we had to ask 3 times for a fix. The only good thing about the hotel was the beach access, the proximity to transportation and some local attractions and the concierge â€“ Luis. She was a big help. Otherwise, until they clean up their act, we will not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great atmosphere, great service”
Reviews.Author: Mac70
Reviews.Content: Recent remodeling is well done. The lobby is huge and well appointed. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well appointed. The view is spectacular. The 3 pools are attractive and clean. The health club is large and well outfitted. Wireless internet was outstanding. The service was terrific. The guest service agents at the desk made us feel at home immediately, and continued to be friendly and customer-oriented throughout our stay. All La Concha personnel we came in contact with were friendly and helpful. The Perla Restaurant was good for the first meal, but the second meal was only average. The Level 25 breakfast buffet restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “If you like SLEEP, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here on our way home from a BVI sailboat/resort vacation. When we arrived we were asked if we were here for "THE FIGHT". Since I had to walk out of the movie "Rocky", we said no. Problems: 1. No amenities in our room, not even soap. Call the front desk. 2. Tried to sleep with pillows over our heads, but the "FIGHT" from Las Vegas was being broadcast in ultra volume on a big screen by the pool. Call the front desk at 1:30AM. Called 8 times. No answer. 3. Husband gets dressed and goes to the manager who apologizes profusely. No other rooms available. 4. Get to sleep at 2AM. 5. Cheerful wake up call at 6AM 6. Have to take a shower and wash hair. NO HOT WATER! 7. Get out of freezing cold shower... no hair dryer. Call front desk. 8. No creamer for in-room coffee. Call front desk. When we checked out, they did not charge us for the room. Take your chances!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place Wed to Sat if you want to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Gomdandusc
Reviews.Content: It's currently 2:25 am and it sounds like a party is going on in my room. The music is absurdly loud and I'm on the 4th floor. It's actually gotten louder as the night has gone on. I really feel sorry for those poor people on the 3d floor that must be deaf by now. I'd leave now if I could and certainly plan to request a refund for tonight's stay. From the other comments noting this, it's clear that the manager does not care despite his responses otherwise. I'm in town for business in San Juan frequently and decided to take a chance on La Concha; I'm sorry I did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: LollyMoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the La Concha for one night (10/31/09) before we went on a cruise. We picked La Concha after having seen it in 2008, while it was till undergoing renovations to the casino. Back then, even with the renovations going on, we loved the hotel and couldn't wait to come back and stay. We used Marriott points for the stay and unfortunately for us, our flight from FL was delayed to the point that we did not arrive in San Juan until after 9:00 p.m. and didn't get to the hotel till around 10. So we didn't get to utilize the pool or spend time walking the beach, etc., the way we had originally planned to do. What I can tell you is that from the very moment we walked into the lobby upon arrival, the staff and service was exceptional. I don't know if it was because I told our sob story to the gentleman at the front desk who checked us in, or what, but for some reason we ended up in a Presidential Suite on the 11th floor. The views were nothing less than completely spectacular! The room itself was very nice with a good size balcony that had views of both the ocean and the city. Room decor is contemporary - which is not particularly my taste, but if that's your thing, you'll like it a lot. The carpet had most definitely seen better days and was pretty stained. The bed was ultra comfortable! Both the front and back walls of the room are floor-to-ceiling glass. The living room is sliding glass doors that open (wooden slats prevent a clear view from the living room, but there is always the balcony). The bedrom wall is also floor-to-ceiling glass with the upper panels opening completely (no screen). Good closet space. Very small bathroom with shower only, but the shower has a rain-shower type head that is quite wonderful. One thing to note - the shower does not have a traditional door or curtain, but is instead a walk-in type shower only half covered by a glass panel. The floor in the bathroom does tend to get wet, so be sure to put down a bathmat or towel to avoid slipping. I loved the bathroom mirrors, which had lights actually embedded behind the glass - way cool! We did not elect to use the coffee pot, but if we had we would have had to call downstairs as our coffee pot had no actual pot - just the machine. I'm sure it would have been immediately remedied had we called. Since it was Halloween, we went down to the lobby to watch the party. By now it was near 11:00 p.m. and the party was definitely gearing up. Lots of fun costumes and beautiful (and I do mean beautiful) people to watch. We had a cocktail from a very busy cocktail waitress, and enjoyed the sights before retiring around midnight. The next morning we were up fairly early and were downstairs at around 7:30 a.m. The same cocktail waitress who had helped us the night before, was just counting her money at 7:30 a.m. Amazingly, she still looked fresh and energetic. I must be getting old is all I can say. The place was being cleaned up, but there were still plenty of party remnants at that hour. We went in to breakfast and enjoyed a wonderful buffet with a made to order omelet, sitting outside gazing at the spectacular pool views. A couple of party-goers from last night were at breakfast (still in costume) and one "gent" felt compelled to lie down across his bench seat. I guess the party was lots of fun! After breakfast we walked down the street to Walgreens - this hotel is ideally situated within easy walking distance of almost anything you could want from ultra high end shopping, to Walgreens, Dunkin Donuts, and the typical souvenir shops. Upon returning to the hotel, it was time to think about getting to the cruise terminal so we gathered our belongings and called for a bellman. Very prompt, extremely friendly and courteous; he hailed us a cab and we bid the La Concha farewell. The hotel is a party hotel on the weekends (we saw this last time we were here as well) and the vibe is energetic and fun. The people who frequent the lobby at night are seemingly young and gorgeous. Cocktail prices are a bit on the steep side, but that is to be expected. The breakfast buffet was $25 but you could make that your meal for the whole day with all that they offered. The pool area is spectacular and I truly regret that we were uable to spend more time there. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is not particularly inexpensive, but I believe there are deals to be had. Main points: gorgeous, sexy lobby and pool areas; great beach with good waves; great location; $19 cab fare from airport; very comfy bed with lots of pillows; unbelievably outstanding service and staff; pricey, but in my opinion worth it; happening vibe on the weekends; great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ... Hip Hotel .... Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were in San Juan for 3 days to visit friends, and booked La Concha as we had stayed there just after it opened and loved the feel of the property. The room was modern, with an outstanding view of the beach & the water. Free wireless internet in the room was unexpected. Throughout our stay, the service was good. The bellmen were always helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good; but didn't otherwise use the restaurants. We aren't gamblers, but the casino was busy and looked good. Friday & Saturday nights the lobby area is a hip night spot, so for people that want a quiet getaway, this isn't it. Still, I thought we would hear more noise from our room (we aren't late night people). Overall, the experience was great. The only negative we experienced was 1 day when the cleaning staff were a bit noisy outside our room, but it wasn't anything that ruined our day.

Reviews.Title: “A visit to northern Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Antietam_Wader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to fly into San Juan from Pennsylvania and take a week to visit some different areas in Puerto Rico. We had read many of the reviews on Trip Advisor, which gave us some great ideas. One fellow had said how easy it was to rent a car from Charlieâ€™s rather than pay a taxi to take us to some of the special sites. He suggested even places to park. We emailed him with a couple questions on Trip Advisor since he had just recently been to Puerto Rico. He was still on a cruise and emailed us back quickly with some advise which was great. The one thing we really wanted to try was the Zip Line ride in the El Yunque Rain Forest. After connecting with a couple that had commented on Trip Advisor via email, we found it was going to be too strenuous for our age and physical shape. When looking at hotels and places to stay no one offered a shuttle to your hotel in San Juan. By Taxis it would have cost for the two of us $30 just to get to our hotel and another $30 back to the airport. Charlieâ€™s car rental had great prices, picked us up at the airport and then back for our return. They also provided us with a nice map and great directions. One thing to remember though, almost everywhere you stay charges you another $15 a night to park, but this is still cheaper than taking a taxi everywhere you want to go. Remember too, that you can take a copy of your own car insurance so you donâ€™t have to buy theirs. We looked a many places to stay, but while you are in a place along the ocean it is just perfect to stay where you can lay in bed and look at the ocean and also one that has a pool. We chose La Concha after reading all the reviews. It is a beautiful old but remodeled hotel close in the Condado section of San Juan. The atmosphere is impressive from the time you pull up and all the men dressed in white come to your assistance. All were very kind and helpful. The lobby is open, airy and beautiful. The main restaurant the Perla has a huge seashell shape, great meals but I am not so sure they are worth the price. There is a poolside lounge surrounded by beautiful palm tree, tropical plants and very nice seating areas under umbrellas, which is a nice place to sit and chat or read a book. There is an open passage from the tropical garden to the ocean side where you can pull up a chair in the sand, or relax in the infinity pool under the palms and watch the ocean waves. Wonderful place to relax! The ocean shore along La Concha was very rough when we were there in May. There is a large stone barrier which protects you from the rough water, but this not a place to swim in the ocean. One evening next to the La Concha Hotel is a small city park right along the ocean, where the Puerto Rico Tourism Company put on a great show about the history of Puerto Rican music and dance. They had a great show of singing and dancing for the tourists from the nearby hotels. Of course the Salsa is what they are famous for. There were also many local artisans displaying their wares with many unusual crafts and jewelry. The concierges were extremely helpful with providing us directions and more information about different places we wanted to visit. Our main problem at La Concha was knowing how to use the parking ticket. We got stuck three times at the gate going out when it wouldnâ€™t take our ticket. Finally a concierge was able to explain that we were to use the same ticket all weekâ€¦. You canâ€™t stay in San Juan without visiting â€œOld San Juanâ€�. San Felipe del Morro Fort is a must see! It is such a great place to tour and reminisce what it must have been like to be there during the battles. There are just breath taking views. It was a Saturday when we were there and many families were flying dozens of kites on the hillside of the fort capturing the ocean breezeâ€¦ just beautiful! The old San Juan area is a wonderful place to spend a day, just strolling through the town and enjoying the blue cobble stone roads, colorful house and narrow streets. It is a great place to shop for touristy things and also enjoy where the tour ships dock and some of the local shopsâ€¦I even found some great buys at Marshalls! Take advantage of the locals who are strolling around Old San Juan and waving to catch your attention that they have found you a parking place. Parking is not always easy and we just gave them a tip and they were happy to help us! We like to take our time, get out into the country and drive to see how the locals live. A reminder here on the high ways â€“ directions are pretty much in Spanishâ€¦. So make sure you know that West is Oeste and East is Este, North is Norte and South etc. We got stuck several times paying one or two dollars on the toll road when we found out we were going the wrong direction and then had to pay the same tolls to come back and get on another road. I would recommend finding a VERY good map that shows the toll roads and directions and read it closely before you get to intersectionsâ€¦ very tricky! We drove to El Yunque Rain Forest. It is free to get in and beautiful. Make sure you go to the El Portal Visitorâ€™s Center first â€“ nice walk down to the beautiful education center is kinda like walking on the forest top with a great view of the rain forest. There is a short movie describing the rain forest and the ecosystem. The area is beautifully landscaped with flowering plants and trees, many with signs describing them. Make sure you pick up a map of the trials here. We did decide to take the trail down to see the La Mina waterfall. Too late after we had started the beautiful trail did we find that it is not a very easy trail at all! It has many steps, steep in places, narrow at times, and it says about a mileâ€¦ but it sure seems longer! Wooded plaques said it was about a mile walk to the waterfall, down through the rain forest. It is beautiful trail - take your camera to capture pictures of all the trees, flowers, roots and interesting things along the way. Our movie camera captured the beautiful sounds of the rain forest â€“ nice memories to look back on. Donâ€™t start this trail too late in the day or you could get stuck being closed behind the gates in the rain forest. We could hear the falls off in the distanceâ€¦ but we only had enough time to stay a minute and had to hurry to get back to the car. We were exhausted from hurrying up and down the trail! The beauty of the forest and the sounds along the trail far outweighed the beauty of the falls. Make sure you are able to go up and down many steps before tackling this trail. It would be much better to start early in the day with a packed lunch. There are places to stop along the way. Donâ€™t forget your bathing suit, many were swimming at the base of the waterfall. It is beautiful. We also drove up to the old Mt. Britton Tower rather than to hike to it. This old tower provides you a wonderful view over the rain forest and out into the oceanâ€¦ gorgeous views! It is 3088 ft high up in the rain forest. It was great to hear the little Coqui frogs sing as the sun was going down. If you want to swim in the ocean Luquilla beach is the place to go. It is only about a 45 minute drive from La Concha. There is wide sandy beaches, soft waves and a great place to stroll. You can park right next to the beach and there are many place to relax and enjoy a picnic. There were many locals enjoying their dogs playing in the ocean in the one area. We stopped here on the day we went to El Yunque Rain Forest. We also went horse back riding along the foothills of El Yunque Rain Forest at the Hacienda Carabali. The hotel recommended Hacienda Carabali by as the best place for a trail ride, and it was. I would have enjoyed riding on the beach, but the forest was also beautiful. The best thing about this place is that they suit the rider to the horse. I hate to go on a trail ride where the horses are stuck nose to tail and you canâ€™t really control the horse. I am an experienced rider and it was great to have a horse that I could enjoy. William was our guide on the two-hour ride. There were only three of us on the trail ride. It was wonderful to be able to really enjoy ourselves! We highly recommend Hacienda Carabali! As a reminderâ€¦ the two hour ride requires reservationsâ€¦ but well worth it! Most of the tourist areas speak English well in Puerto Rico but once you are out of the tourist areas most spoke Spanish. We had stopped at several local markets and restaurants along our drive to Arecibo. Most of the adults could not speak to us, but would go gather up a youth to take our order or answer our questions. The teenagers were very pleased to be able to assist us. Most of the adults just seemed shy and would not try to assist us. We drove West â€œOesteâ€� to visit the Lighthouse in Arecibo. It was an interesting drive across the northern part of Puerto Rico from San Juan. You can take the toll road 22 or a local road Route 2 through some of the towns, Manati, and Vega Baja. The restored Arecibo Lighthouse also has a small little village for kids (and adults) to play and learn about the Spanish Conquest. There are replicas of the Nina, Pinta and Santa Maria. There is a small playground, small animals to touch and a small little Arasibo Indian Village where children and learn and play. There is also a nice small salt-water aquarium to visit. There were lots of school children there that day. This would be a great place to take children. We enjoyed the spectacular views from the lighthouse and the iguanas that scurried along the trail up to the lighthouse. We got some great shots of them! There is so much to see and do in Puerto Rico you canâ€™t do it all in one week! But a wonderful place to visit. Using Trip Advisor is a great place to find deals on hotels and flights! Puerto Rico is a short flight from the mainland where you can enjoy a warm ocean vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: Izmirgirl
Reviews.Content: Loved it, can't wait to go back. Staff was very friendly, especially Sebestian at the front desk with his great tips and directions to places to see and eat were very helpful. He has superb customer service skills. Wonderful gym, with extra touches like ginger tea, young lady that teaches classes there also very friendly. General manager is hands on, down to earth, and very professional. His management style shows in every delightful corner of this hotel. My only complaint was mattresses and I found out that they will be renewing those in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip hotel, great brunch”
Reviews.Author: Cruzangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at the La Concha Resort, but it was great. Our room was on the 11th floor with a gorgeous ocean view. The window was huge and we felt like we were right on the ocean. The bed was very comfortable, and the decor was perfect for a beach resort (modern with clean lines) There was a huge flat screen in the room and my husband was wishing we had one like that at home. The bath was large with a walk in shower. We had brunch at the Level 25 restaurant. and it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: shivie28
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier with La Concha. I traveled with my longtime boyfriend and another couple. Upon arriving they didn't have a room at the price we booked so we received a free upgrade-SWEET! Our room was on the 9th floor so we did not experience the musty scent of the ocean as mentioned in several previous posts. The room was pretty standard, but it was nice. The pools were beatiful and it was so nice to wake up and see and hear the ocean. The staff was friendly, especially Louise at the concierge desk. She helped us map out our driving routes and gave us good advice on dining. Also, the turn down service workers were nice enough to leave lots more towels for us everyday. We were so tired every night that we completely slept through the clubby music blasting at the lobby club. I can see how that may get annoying, but it didn't bother us. We ate at the hotel once, at La Perla. AND WHAT AN EXPERIENCE! If you decide to stay here, definitely dine at La Perla. Other tips-rent a car, it came in handy to get to the Camuy Caves; go on a rappelling/zipling/hiking excursion in the rain forest; see the Camy Caves

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amenities but poor service”
Reviews.Author: rlouisa
Reviews.Content: We tried La Concha after looking at different locations around the world with good beaches, Carribean feel and great service. Unfortunately we were only able to get 2 out of three. We loved the rooms and the view, and the beach was wonderful, but unfortunately the service we received from the hotel was absolutely horrible. When we arrived, we received a nice room and called down to get extra linens for the pullout bed for our children. After calling down we went down to the grill to have dinner. Well dinner took 1.5 hours just to receive all of our meals, and when we came back we still hadn't received the linens. It took an additional 4 calls to get them up to our room. The following day we started having issues with housekeeping, and issues they were. After asking for a 10am clean up with the manager Eddie Sipple, this only happened twice, the rest of the time housekeeping didn't show up till at least 4:30 pm. We then only received turn down service twice out of 7 nights. On the third day the wife took the kids down to the ocean to play in the sand and to play in the ocean. The beach attendant told her that she wasn't allowed to play in front of the meeting room as they wanted a clear view of the ocean. This was uncalled for especially on a "Public" beach. Twice while there I contact Eddie to try and correct the problems yet the service still lacked any personality or sincerity. On the last day we were there, everything came to a head and we came home after swimming for 2.5 hours to our door open. We called down to the front desk and we were told that there must be an issue with the door and that it was our fault. After explaining to her that they came in for turn down service and left the door wide open, they young lady didn't even say sorry. I think talked with the manager as we were very unhappy that our valuables have been left available for anyone to take. We were lucky that nothing was taken, but this was unacceptable. The next day we called for a wake up call that never came, and left the resort for back home. Needless to say this day didn't come too soon. We travel the globe to fine places everywhere, and this was absolutely the worst experience I have ever had at a resort. The lack of sincerity is what confused me. In my opinion, this is a 5 star hotel amenity wise, but 2.5 stars service wise. If you are looking at wanting a vacation of service, fair warning you might now find it here. If they could update the service, it would definitely be a great place to stay. Buyer Beware.

Reviews.Title: “OVERRATED”
Reviews.Author: soshymar
Reviews.Content: Not Family friendly. Plenty of "suspicious" women lingering around to be "hired" at the bar/lobby area. Not clean- The sheets smelled bad and my husband stabbed his foot on a "foreign toenail" on the carpet the first day we were there. We had the double queen beds and the the desk attached to where the TV was located was a triangular shape with the corner sticking out where my kids kept getting injured. There were what appeared to be security guards sitting in front of our room the first 3 days. Not sure who was staying there, but they would talk on their phones and you could hear everything. Not to mention the last Sunday of each month a jazz festival is held next door where music is overwhelmingly loud.We were unable to sleep because the music was more loud than the air conditioning coming from the vent and the leaky toilet that would refill its tank every five minutes so it sounded like some was turning on a sink every five minutes for 2 minutes and then turning it off. The service by the pools was awful, we would wait at least 10-15 minutes each time we went for a drink. Overrated and overpriced for what you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: MeganQ
Reviews.Content: Our stay at La Concha in San Juan was nothing short of perfection. The facility is beautiful, the staff is friendly, and the location is excellent. The concierge was very helpful. The highlight of the property are the many pools and areas to lounge and enjoy the beautiful view. I would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Beat my expectations”
Reviews.Author: KCwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Although most reviews I read were good, I still wasn't getting my hopes up for the amenities at La Concha. The pictures don't do it justice. It was a top notch place. Breakfast is pricey, but usual for renaissance's. The restaurant was great, drinks are $10 each - but wonderful. I recommend getting a pitcher when by the pool...a better deal!. Great location, with plenty of restaurants to walk to nearby. And the pool was 24 hours, which is a definite bonus over other resorts! The concierge (all of them) were also very helpful in suggesting activities and went above and beyond to help coordinate and book them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: smithca37
Reviews.Content: Our front desk clerk liza calzada went above and beyond to assure that we had a great stay. She exemplified excellent customer service and because of her i will be a loyal customer and reccomend this establishment to everyone headed in the puerto rico area!

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: niceyd53
Reviews.Content: My stay at the La Concha was first class all the way. The service and ambiance rate A+. The food was top notch. Actually the restaurant's located at La Concha was better or at least as good as anything on Ashford Avenue. The trade winds coming off the ocean were just a good as those in Aruba. The beach and premises were safe and well maintained. I will definitely stay at La Concha on my next trip to P.R. in 2010 and recommend that my friends experience La Concha as well.

Reviews.Title: “A good time was had by all”
Reviews.Author: Traveler65
Reviews.Content: Three of us (parents and a 13-year old) stayed 4 nights early October, 2009. - Two out of the 4 nights were free (through Expedia) but note that you would not get Marriott Rewards points for the 2 paid nights. - Great location. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. - Valet parking ($20 daily charged to room) was efficient and helpful, even when we lost our claim ticket upon checking out (they had to fill out a form but did it fast and found the car anyway). - Beachfront. Hotel set up beach chairs and umbrellas for no charge. - Nice pools and hot tubs, one beach front with infinity edge. Contrary to hotel information in room, pools are 24-hours (no life guards) according to the front desk. Towel kiosks at the pools are not 24-hour so if you think you are going for a midnight swim, get towels in the morning and exchange them every morning at the kiosks. - Housekeeping maids forgot conditioners last two days but hotel was quick to bring extra up upon request. - Buy bottled water and sodas at Walgreens or minimarts in the neighbourhood - fridge provided in room. There were in-room coffee. - Ocean front rooms have a beautiful frontal view of the sea. Hotel gave it to us without asking. - Free wireless high speed internet throughout hotel, good signal strength, but not enough IP addresses - connectivity was sporadic. - Bring ear plugs! Or ask for high floor. We were on the 5th. Loud music and parties in the lobby every night (e.g. Wednesday night was Sushi Disco - don't ask), Saturday till 4 am. It wasn't bad for us, room was quite well insulated and we only heard it faintly, but lower floors might be worse (or other folks might have better hearing). Note we're not complaining, we were there for a holiday and were glad everyone seemed to be having such a good time (and a lot of beautiful young people at the parties, it looked like).

Reviews.Title: “One of the top 5 hotels in PR.”
Reviews.Author: AndyRNewYork
Reviews.Content: I rate this hotel almost as good as I would the following:El San Juan, Ritz-Carlton, El Con/Las Casitas, and Hyatt Hacienda Del Mar. I've stayed at all of these hotels. I must say I was really impressed with what they have done with this older hotel. Only issues I had was the weak and over-priced drinks they serve at the bar. Also, they should warn guest when the ocean tide is dangerous or post red flags like most upscale hotels before someone drowns.The service is as good as the hotels I mentioned and the young guy with glasses and spikey hair who checked us in was amazing. Thanks La Concha for making my stay one of my most memorable. I will definately stay again.BTW I stayed 4 nights and you can find great Puerto Rican food in Orozco's less than two blacks away. Andy R.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lycDc
Reviews.Content: You get a view of the beach from your hotel room with nightlife right downstairs and 2 huge pools. The staff is friendly and can direct you to local attractions. You'll feel like you are on a resort, and i highly recommmend it!

Reviews.Title: “One Of the Best Hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: sergej
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, friendly service, clean.. it is worth it, for you to stay there Trendy, and the bar area is great, beach is right behind the hotel and pool area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: svgowens326
Reviews.Content: Contemporary hotel with amazing grounds, spacious rooms, three great pools, plus the ocean views are to die for. Staff and service are the best! Restaurants have good food and drinks, but can be pricey. Visit local restaurants to offset costs. Fantastic fitness facility. Good location in close proximity to stores, shops and restraunts. Casino on site. Take a bus to Old San Juan (name is a misnomer; doesn't look old at all). Ride is 20 minutes. Many, many shops and restaurants there. I was worried about forecasts of thunderstorms all week, but rains were not bad and did not last long at all. Even cloudy days were okay, just lounged at the pool. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, Authentic Retreat in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: anycguy32
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel is newly restored in 2007, and it shows. Everything is modern, chic, comfortable, and stylish. As the hotel is a renovation of a 1950's hotel, the rooms are reached via a balcony walkway outside. It just adds to the ambience of being in a tropical island. The rooms are spacious, flat screen TV, ipod station, computer desk, nice comfy beds, amazing views onto the beach, and even a dvd player. The hotel lobby is a happening place for fun and hanging out at the bar. If your looking for relaxation but no nightlife, this is not the place to be. While we did not participate in the night life, it was fun to have it going on around us, available if we wanted. The pools, chaise lounges, food, and beach are all wonderful. You can truly be in an oasis of relaxation during the day with no distractions. And the steak wrap at the pool is amazing, granted $16 bucks, but when on vacation splurge a little. The hotel is located right in Condado and it has nice stores nearby, a starbucks, walgreens, and other places in walking distance. Some one wrote that the hotel casino was dingy? not at all. and the cafe attached to the hotel off the casino has affordable wraps and food. So, all in all it was a great place to stay, I think the best in the area if you get a good price. Best time to go is during Sept-nov when they have the PR tourism board incentives. We stayed for 4 nights but paid only for two, turned out to be $129 a night. And unlike other hotels, we did not have to pay the additional %14 resort fee. We booked on Travelocity, but all the major sites offer this incentive, you cannot get it from the hotel. Good: Amazing views Spacious Rooms with new amenities Great Staff and good food Relaxing pool and wonderful beach Good safe location Bad: Internet wireless is non-functioning (but when your trying to get away this actually is helpful. They have a laptop in the lobby and computers in the business center if you need to get online) Loud on Friday and Saturday Nights, but gets under control around midnight CAUTION: BEACH WAVES BEWARE-the beach is amazing, and one day we were our the waves were small and fun to play in, but the next day the waves were larger and treacherous. I found this out the hard way when my 325Lb body got tossed like a doll, slamming me into the sand underwater, twisting me like a pretzel, then spitting me up on the beach in a world of hurt. Later I found out from the locals that this section of the beach can be deadly. So please use caution and common sense, unlike me!

Reviews.Title: “Louise Rocks”
Reviews.Author: sydjack
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit this year to La Concha. Although the recent renovation is incredible, the rooms are showing some wear and tear. Aside from that, we had another enjoyable stay and we are looking forward to returning in in early 2010. There friendliness of the entire staff from the parking attendants, pool attendants and front desk continues to amaze me. The pool and public areas remain spotless and well attended. The rooms remain pleasant although some fresh paint is needed. The ocean views are great and you should ask for a "step out" balcony. The bathroom, athough small, is comfortable and the bath products were great. Beware of the hand held shower as you can flood the bathroom if not careful. Believe it or not the food and drinks at the pool were wonderful. Louisa at the front desk is a joy! She remembered my partner and I from our last visit and was extremely helpful getting our room ready even though the hotel was fully booked. She always smiles and was very helpful with reservations and San Juan City advice. We look forward to our next visit and seeing Louise again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Tropicsgirl101
Reviews.Content: After months of researching hotels on this site and others, I picked La Concha for a one night stay before our cruise. When we arrived we were told that a convention had extended their stay and that we would not be able to stay there. La Concha told us that we would be placed in another hotel and that they would cover the payment. The hotel transferred us to The Doubletree which was fine as hotels go, but was not ocean front (or even oceanview), did not have a balcony, had a very small pool, and had no nightlife whatsoever. These were all things that I picked La Concha for. They did let us come to the hotel the next day to use the pool so I was appreciative of that, although it really rubbed in how fabulous the hotel was that we were not able to stay at. I was so upset because I really had wanted to stay there and 2 weeks later I still feel mad. The day we left after using the pool, a staff member said he hoped that we would stay with them on our next stay, but I would not book with them again and take the chance that we would be moved somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for every purpose travel to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Luz1980
Reviews.Content: The first great impression was the hotel lobby. But it didnÂ´t end there. The room was beautiful too, although not too big, and I was surprised to find none of them had bathtubs, just showers. On the other hand, the ocean views were spectacular... and I was only on the 5th floor! The pools are beautiful and the beach is quiet and comfortable. The staff was VERY courteous and helpful at all times, and greeted me with wine and truffles on my first night. The only thing that I could point out if I absolutely had to complain about anything at all, is that wireless internet was down in my side of the tower for the whole week, and the alternative provided (a cable) made internet access not Vista friendly, and depending on having to use the computer only on the room desk area. Tasia Ferrer, from the front desk staff was an absolute darling, and she was able to finally help with the cable connection in my room (which nobody else seemed to know how to figure out), and that way I could get some additional work done on the last two days of my stay. Something else: DONÂ´T mind all those comments about noise coming from the lobby bar. There is a lively scene all week around, alright, but trust me, you just listen to it for 10 minutes or so after you go into your room... just because you know itÂ´s there. Besides, if you want a silent solemn environment for your vacation, this destination altogether probably just isnÂ´t for you! Just have fun!! And if youÂ´re travelling on business like I was, youÂ´d probably fall sound asleep in 5 minutes out of tiredness!

Reviews.Title: “great with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: mike145
Reviews.Content: My experience at La Concha was similar to the previous reviewer's. First, the good: fantastic and basically private beach, amazing views from the room, attentive service, great fitness center and incredible location. The not-so-good: the WiFi was consistently out in my room and numerous calls to the front desk were met with disinterest and ignorance. Also, I found the food average at best and the mixed drinks very weak. The casino was decent but minimal $5 blackjack tables kept me out of there for the bulk of the trip. Finally, the lobby turns into a huge disco at night with loud, thumping music (did I say LOUD) so if this isn't your type of scene, I'd choose a different hotel. Overall I'd love to revisit once the construction is done as this is a **** venue in the best of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: AppliedAquinas
Reviews.Content: Nicely located on Condado, and not a bad place for leisure; but, one of the most difficult places to conduct business. The wireless internet, when it worked, was as slow as Old Town San Juan traffic.; although there's a variable thermostat in the room, there seemed to be only two settings...Arctic and Rain Forest; lively (and I mean lively) entertainment in the courtyard wasn't all that bad, except the singers seemed to be singing to people located in the Dominican Republic, and only knew how to sing in one key. These irritants aren't all that bad, I suppose, if flip-flops, coconut oil, and Ray-Bans are the only things in your suitcase. If your stay requires anything more formal around your neck than a Puka-bead necklace, then this place is a bit difficult. With all that said, there are merits to this place with the goofy, black-light saturated central bar and the ever-popular "Disco-Sushi Night". First off, the gym in top-notch. One of the best I've used in Puerto Rico. Second, the beach really is beautiful and the hotel showcases it well. The large, sliding doors in the room opened up to a mini-balcony and allowed the soothing wave crashes to be heard (if you don't mind having your room feeling a bit damp from the humidity). Third, it is a nice place to relax after a long-day of work. Don't expect a quick check-in or check-out if you have questions. The on-line check out system (accessed from the TV) wasn't working, which was on par with the rest of the technical infrastructure. And, even with a negotiated corporate discount, La Concha is still rather expensive, when compared with similarly appointed places, which makes it a no-so-great value for the money. The one exception is the little cafe adjacent to the rather tired Hotel Casino. The really friendly staff will whip up a made-to-order salad or pizza in no-time. And the value is pretty good. Also, there are several, really great restaurants within 2 min from the hotel. If purely on business, consider the DoubleTree (owned by the same hotel group). If for other, then channel your inner-John Travolta, grab your chopsticks, and guzzle Don Q rum under the spinning mirrored ball. And enjoy the scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid- construction”
Reviews.Author: HankWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terribly impacted by the construction of a second tower that adjoins the existing hotel on 2 sides. Jackhammers and cement saws at 7 am literally feet from guest rooms they are using. Business center physically vibrates from drilling from the floor below. Unpleasant experience all around. Booked through the Marriott website which made no mention of ongoing construction. Trip came up at last minute so selected a hotel in a hurry. Looked at first couple pages of Trip Advisor and didn't get to July review that mentioned noise. Hotel staff says they hope to be finished by T'giving- STAY AWAY !

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!"”
Reviews.Author: micr2131
Reviews.Content: Hi! My husband and I recently stayed at La Concha to celebrate my birthday. ( We stayed from August 28-Sept 1.) Originally we had planned to stay at their sister hotel, El Convento in Old San Juan, but at the last minute changed our minds to La Concha. Boy, I am glad we did it! From the moment you first walk into the lobby area, you already know you are in a for a treat. It's absolutely gorgeous! The resort recently went under renovations so everything is sparkly and new. The architecture and the layout of the entire resort is amazing. When we first arrived we found out that our room wasn't ready, however, Linnette at the front desk was a complete doll in making sure we were taken care of. We received free drinks at the bar, and our wait for our room wasn't even ten minutes. The customer service is impeccable. The room: Okay, so the rooms are lovely, very modern, it's a mixure between luxe/Ikea. The color palette is very fresh with hints of green, blue and white. Honestly, the rooms while beautiful, aren't going to be on anyone's top ten list. But, let me get to the point: The view. Omigod, the view. Most hotels have ocean view rooms, however, whenever you get the there, ocean view, usually means "halfway blocked by building, sliver of ocean view". At La Concha, when they say ocean view, they're not playing. The view can only be best described as panoramic. It takes your breath away. The ocean is crystal clear, and the backdrop of the perfect sky is postcard worthy. The resort is full of amenities. There are two very sexy, well placed pools located in the main atrium of the resort, and right next to the beach. There is also an excellent fitness center, which is far better than average hotel. The casino is lively, and on any day you can find an array of people trying their luck at the slots and card tables. The nightlife at the hotel is awesome. Let me clarify something though. I see a few reviews that say the hotel is very noisy, and you can hear the music from the lobby at night. Not so much. There were plenty of times my husband and I would come from the lobby after getting drinks, and you can't hear the noise past the first floor. My husband and I are a young couple who love to party, and be in the center of everything, so that may explain why we are okay with the noise. Besides the lobby,( which by the way, there are absolutely no ugly people in Puerto Rico. everyone is absolutely gorgeous! It's a definite ego boost to be compared, or mistaken for Puerto Rican, as my husband and I were many times.) Things to do: I would definitely suggest getting off of Condado beach and exploring the touristy, and not so touristy areas of Puerto Rico. If you are driving, try to check out the rain forest, and Carolina. Don't go to Wendy's or Mcdonald's, instead try local cuisine. The best places are the hole in the walls. Our favorite food spots were Stop and Go, which is a local convenience store/restaurant located directly across the street from La Concha. It's a very mom and pop style store, with amazing authentic Puerto Rican food. Another favorite was Crozcos, which is located on Ashford avenue. They serve a heavenly breakfast. If you are in old city, try Mojitos, which is a restaurant, not a bar. Let's see,, other things to do..... During the day you could frequent one of the many beaches, or travel down to Old City, and spend a half a day just shopping and taking in the culture. It's a very historic area, so many of the buildings and streets still hold a turn of the century style charm.. Also, there's always the famous Bacardi Factory. Another thing I would suggest is, TAKE THE BUS! There's no better way to explore a place than to take public transportation. We found out so much about the island as as result of this. The bus is only 75 cents, and there is a bus stop located right outside of the hotel. (The route number is B21.) There are cabs everywhere, however, I suggest you negotiate the prices. Many of the drivers add on a few dollars to the regular fare in an attempt to get a better tip, and charge you more, but try to knock down the price some. For instance, not including the tip, you should not have to pay more than $10 or $12 to get from La Concha to Old City. Nightlife is awesome in Puerto Rico . Saturday night we went to Club Brava, which is located on the Isla de Verde. It's a very flashy crowd. Come dressed sexy and fashionable. If you are not a guest at the hotel, then the wait will be very long. (Just jump into the line for the guests, security doesn't check for hotel cards or passes, and the line goes by much faster.) The music is a range between house, reggaeton, and hip hop. There are many bars and lounges in the area as well. The best ones are in Old City. I think that anyone can come here and have a good time. La Concha, and Puerto Rico in general is very family friendly. I don't think it matters if you are an elderly couple or just here solo, you'll have a great time either way.

Reviews.Title: “Lively!”
Reviews.Author: MineralKing
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early August for 3 nights at this hotel. It has the liveliest lobby I've ever come across... so lively that if you are a light sleeper it can be distracting, no matter what floor you are on in the hotel. It is obviously a center of attraction for locals who like to party in the Condado area. The grounds are beautiful and well equipped. The private beach is in a perfect setting with several pools and attentive staff. Overall it is an attractive hotel. Buyer beware though, because as trendy and gleaming as the lobby and grounds are, this is still very much an old beach hotel. Our first room was very musty and we had to move because the smell was so strong. The rugs were dirty from the usual salt and sand and moisture, giving them an unsightly appearance. The bathrooms are designed without a full shower door (just half) and so with your first shower you learn quickly to keep your clothes and towels on the other side of the bathroom. It also leads to the bathroom floor getting excessively wet which is probably part of the mildew issue. Entry to the rooms is from a common outdoor walkway on all floors, similar to a motel. The doors aren't sealed sufficiently to keep out sound, and if there's a party going on, which there almost always is, you're gonna know it. The beds and linens are very nice and the oceanviews are fantastic from the rooms. The bathroom amenities are nicely scented and well stocked. Towels are crisp and clean. The large flat screen TV's have plenty of English language prgorams to choose from. The wireless sginal, while free... was very weak in our room. It was much more accessible in the lobby. Our second room was much better than the first, there was no noticeable odor except for the scent of the sea with the windows open and that was very pleasant. By far the strongest area of the hotel is it's staff. Every employee, from the concierge to the check-in people... the bartenders, servers, porters and housekeeping... management... everyone was top notch. It is obvious that a premium is put on service here and was the nicest touch of all. Overall, I'd say that this is a very nice beach property... with BEACH being the operative word... that has some nice bells and whistles in the areas that you should be spending your time... that is OUTSIDE your room. The nightlife is a focalpoint, so if it bothers you, think elsewhere. But if you want to feel a strong local vibe and enjoy the nightlife and the sun, surf and sand... La Concha has a lot to offer for an authentic Puerto Rican experience.

Reviews.Title: “Ten minutes from the airport, a perfect place to pamper youself in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: victor9000
Reviews.Content: With recent renovations complete, La Concha is a great destination for those wishing to escape to an urban resort. It feels much more secluded from Condado than it is, with a wonderful pool patio and lounge area nestled in a large courtyard, and rooms facing the sea. The service and staff were top notch and friendly as all get out (very attractive too), and the rooms were fantastically appointed with stylish modern furniture, lots of light, double showerheads and great bathroom decor. We saw a couple of movie stars taking it easy at La Concha, and Friday night brought out the beautiful people of San Juan for cocktails and flirting in the chic lobby and bar.

Reviews.Title: “what is this all about!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom196
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, employees very helpful, unfortunately our room faced some really ugly construction going on which was very noisy! AT the end of our stay we were hit with a $40 resort fee everyday!! what is that all about. since when do you have to pay for pool chairs and towel at a high priced hotel. I would not go back there, there are plenty of other beauiful hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place in puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: minshewk1
Reviews.Content: We went to san juan puerto rico in july of 08. To date it is one of the most beautiful places we have went.They have beautiful beaches and extremely clean a tractor came every morning and leveled them and there was never any trash.We stayed at the La Concha Resort it was a wonderful hotel rooms are small but very clean and the best view you could ever imagine.The only thing that dissapointed us was we didnt find alot of resturants that had really good food.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! Totally loved this place! You can't cheat yourselfe out of it!”
Reviews.Author: so_ready2go
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! I loved every single thing about it with the exception of the prices (lol, joke) Food and drinks are a little pricey, but worth the money. The hotel is gorgeous, very modern, clean, relaxing, refreshing and everything you would expect! So let's break it down Service - I can't believe I can't remember his name, but the guy who checked me in was great! Service all together was extraordinary. Very professional, amicable, fast, concierge were knowledgeable of the area, attractions, places to eat and dance and offered me a map with specific directions to every location that I wanted to go to. Shortly after I got the the breathtaking room I received a phone call from the front desk to ensure that I found the room ok, to welcome me and thank me for choosing them and to offer their help with anything that I needed. Room - I almost dropped when I walked in my room and saw that "ocean view" was in fact ocean view! THEY MEAN IT! The entire wall parallel to the bed was glass from to to bottom and the room was head on with the ocean! OMG! I couldn't help to to stare at the beautiful beach that is just 3 minutes away right behind the hotel (walking distance). Everything was well organized, clean, no smells at all. Nice big flat screen TV, two telephones, big closet for 2, iron/ironing board, plenty of lamps/lights in the room and a safe which was free of charge to use. Water in the room is 3.00 a bottle so don't drink it! lol. The bathroom- totally kool! TWO showers! Yes, two showers, a hand held one and a big one from the ceiling. Regular lighting available or two little blue lights in the shower would make it romantic if that is what you were looking for. Weird enough there is only one door to the shower that covered only half of it so water does go all over the bathroom floor when you take a shower. However, there are plenty towels in the bathroom to take care of that. Ladies, a magnifying mirror was in the bathroom, a hair drying put away in a drawer and plenty of counter space for make up bags and all that we use when we are getting ready. Pools- there are 3 of them, two infinity ones and a regular one! AMAZING! Lights change at night inside the pool and set the mood just right. There is a secluded jacuzzi that overlooks the city which is great too. Plenty of pool chairs, they provide pool towels so you don't have to use your own or the ones from the room. Service is available around the pools for food and drinks if you wish. White lounge chairs/beds also available by the pools. Lobby- it's a bar/lounge that even the locals come to enjoy. No, don't freak out because there is security and the crowed that comes isn't anything to worry about. Music that's played is dance music and also some live bands which I thought was great. Restaurants- there are two. I only utilized the one by the pool and food was great and so was the service. A little pricey though, $80.00 for 2 of us. Parking - is 15 a day for self parking, The ticket must be validated every time that you are going to leave the parking lot or else you can't get out. On one occasion I had the ticket validated but it didn't work so I had to tailgate someone out of the parking lot. It could be a little aggravating, but nothing to ruin my vacation. This is the place to stay! Nothing would make me not come back here. I was actually sad to leave. I am definitely coming back here- NO DOUBT! Suggestions to management- Hotel is in great shape overall and I would hate to see it get ruined. It has been newly renovated I understand so I'd love to suggest to you to attempt to keep it looking nice, new and clean as much as you can. My observations were minor details but with time they could give out the wrong impression and affect how the guests feel in the hotel. Bathrooms and Rooms- make sure to have the cleaning staff spend a little more time in the bathrooms as grout could be cleaner in certain areas. I noticed a few spots/ stains on the carpet that I think should be removed to keep the clean look and feel, furniture wasn't cleaned the second day of my stay. I hate to admit that I was making sandwiches to take to an excursion and because I was running late I left bread crams all over the coffee table and found it there when I returned. Also, air vents are starting to rust - Worked in hospitality at some point so I know to look at these things. Swimming pool by the restaurant is missing a few tiles by the stairs and i hurt my toe there so I suggest you guys take care of it before something else happens. Pleasee keep up the great place it already is! Pictures will follow!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: beantownboy1
Reviews.Content: My stay at La Concha was a nice one. My cousin & I had a great time. From the time we arrived we were treated with the upmost respect by concierge Francisco. The room was immaculate & our every request was granted quickly. Carlos Alvarez from housekeeping was a big help in every aspect imaginable from good hospitality, service, conversation, tips, & directions.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sandwoman1977
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a splendid place to stay. I went there with my husband and 4 year old son. We arrived a few hours before check in and the staff was kind enough to arrange an early check-in! Our ocean view room was truly an ocean view room! The rooms were clean but there was a slightly musty odor. There were many little private areas within the hotel to relax. The hotel has 3 clean pools....so there was always a place to splash around. The beach is clean and the water was perfect! Food was pricey but that is to be expected. There were plenty of other nearby dining establishments from Wendy's to five star dining! The staff was very friendly, polite and attentive. I just have one suggestion. I think it would be nice to have some scheduled activities.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: jasinstorey
Reviews.Content: " The Best Hotel Experience Ever "............The La Concha in San Juan PR has never let me down. For the pass 3 years, our experience at La Concha has been nothing but suburb. The customer service most of all is exceptional.......... Louise Graulau Guest Service Agent has always gone above and beyond her duties to make our stay the best. Erica Maldonado is very knowledgeable, she can get you into any tour around this beautiful island in mins.This hotel offers you very convenient beach entrance. Great locate for restaurants and a few mins from Old San Juan and El Morro. But to get a real feel for this wonderful island is to travel down to PiÃ±ones.....you will find some great food and cool environment. The Local's are very friendly and most of the venders speck English.

Reviews.Title: “Our Perfect Wedding Ceremony at La Concha Couldn't of Been Better!”
Reviews.Author: Newlyweds52209
Reviews.Content: We've known each other for 21 years and decided it was time to marry. We called La Concha, met Michael on the phone, and asked him to plan our wedding. We flew in 2 weeks later. Room-gorgeous, ocean view-breath taking, pools/hot tubs-refreshing, bar/ food-delicious, nightlife-festive, location-terrific, staff-extremely helpful & friendly. On our wedding day Michael had arranged for a professional wedding coordinator, who arranged our professional photographer who took over 500 beautiful pictures, a professional videographer who recorded a 2 1/2 hour DVD, a wedding officiate, our flowers/bouquet were beautiful, our cake "lit up" with lights, champagne & chocolate strawberries were waiting in our room, you name it - he planned it. Awesome job Michael!!!!! Way more than we expected. Your hotel is beautiful, location is perfect, and staff is delightful. Wouldn't change a thing. Thank You for helping us make our wedding day perfect. La Concha went above and Beyond! For anyone trying to decide where to go: check out our pictures, this is the place! You can't put a price tag on sincere warmth and kindness!

Reviews.Title: “Sets new standard for tourism industry in PR”
Reviews.Author: matzbravo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spectacular . Pound for pound, I'd match it up with the swankiest hotels in Vegas. The hotel, of course, is much smaller, but it packs a punch to remember. The most notable, however, is the well-trained friendly and ATTENTIVE staff. This is a striking positive change for Puerto Rico that I hope others will follow. A running joke about a major nearby competitor hotel (that I will not identify) is that it is one of the few hotels certified by Alcoholics Anonymous because you can never get a drink at the bar. That's not the case here. The young, energetic staff is a fresh change from my historical experience visting PR. Keep up the customer service training. It's everything to the visitor who wants to be treated well by happy employees. Only suggestion - use the pretty girl bartenders as often as possible. You'll sell more drinks and hardworking guys who can afford to stay at the hotel love it.

Reviews.Title: “WILL DEFINITELY GO BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: fmrnyr
Reviews.Content: I am Puerto Rican and have visited PR many times -- but never stayed in a resort, always w/ family. This was my husband's first time visiting. WE WERE BLOWN AWAY BY LA CONCHA!! Everything was excellent -- no complaints. Great atmosphere, rooms, views, pools, food, location. The staff is polite, cordial, always willing to please. Everyone speaks English -- which helps. Food and drinks pricey but it is to be expected at a resort. Laptops in the lobby - what an AWESOME convenience. Great to have a fitness ctr right on the beach. The little tucked away lounges in the pool area are great. Our purpose for the trip was to attend a wedding which was also held at La Concha, so our return visit will have no agenda but to relax and enjoy the surroundings. Nearby restaurants have great food at great prices -- try them. Walgreens on the corner is a blessing!! Will be back in November of 2010 to enjoy it during the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but had probably one of the worst hotel rooms in all of the hotel. Prom time”
Reviews.Author: Missmaybebaby
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but I was dissapointed in the room . I would love to come back but would only do so with an upgrade to ocean front view. I was there for business but would love to come back for leisure. The beach was terrific and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “The place to re-connect!”
Reviews.Author: casoenna
Reviews.Content: WeÂ´re repeat customers, visiting annually for our anniversary. The hotel is as good as it was last year. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and well-kept, and the views are gorgeous. The lobby areas are very pretty and relaxing. The beach is at the end of a strip, so there is very little through traffic going on. The pools don't have bells and whistles like slides, etc., but are very relaxing and clean, and just the right size. Food is great, but excellent outside dining is a short walk or cab ride away too. The gym was very well equipped. Service with a smile is a plus. The casino is a bit small but has good traffic. Most guests are adult couples or families with very young children, so it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “PHENOMAL”
Reviews.Author: samarf
Reviews.Content: At first we were going to stay at another Hotel and Casino in Isla Verde. Then someone suggested La Concha. At first I didn't see the difference especially judging by the website. But the moment I step in there we felt like we stepped up in class. The resort was very clean and modern classy. With the sweetest employees, they recommended several places to go to eat and entertain. One thing though if you have children you definately want to rent a car. Because La Concha is in a secluded up in coming neighborhood in a upscale enviroment.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Reactor1966
Reviews.Content: We were staying with family on the west side of the island, and my wife and I wanted a quick getaway for just the two of us. We booked a short stay at the La Concha and it turned out to be the perfect getaway. I will say that when we first arrived I was a bit concerned upon seeing how close the hotels were together, but after touring the grounds it's obvious that they put a lot of thought into the design and landscaping to create a sense of privacy while you are there. Start with the lobby. I wouldn't normally comment on a lobby but this one deserves it. At the very front there are some beautiful fountains that greet you as you unload your luggage. Once you go inside, the main lobby is quite beautiful. You can't help but stop for a moment to look around. There's a bar in the middle, comfortable seating all around, and various works of colorful art. To the left is a wall of glass doors that are all open to the pool area (but lets not get ahead of ourselves yet) Checkin was simple and quick. We actually arrived at 11:30am and I fully expected to have to wait several hours for the room. We were told the room was ready but needed a final inspection, so we took our free drink vouchers and headed to the bar (yes, it was before Noon but hey we're on vacation). 10 minutes later the front desk called my cell to tell us the room was ready. The room was fantastic and the view was breathtaking. We were on the top floor and when you look out the window you see the beautiful blue ocean. Tons of comfy pillows on the bed, huge shower with the showerhead that rains down on you, big flat screen tv, etc. Since I am a Platinum member they delivered a fruit basket to the room, and I must say it was one of the nicest fruit baskets I've received in my many stays at Marriotts. For our first day we decided to completely veg out by the pool. Once you do head out to the pool, you first make your way through an area of lounges hidden within the foliage. Lots of places to hang out and read if you wanted to. A little further and you see the main pool, which is actually a two level pool. There wasn't many people there and you could easily get a seat. We went to the top level and found a perfect nook for our laziness - off to the corner was one of those big outdoor beds, and right next to it was one of the hot tubs. My wife was in heaven. We picked up some really soft towels from the towel station and within minutes the waitress was by and we ordered drinks. The rest of the afternoon was pure heaven. In the evening we went down to Old San Juan for dinner and we were hoping to see some lively nightlife. While we did have a very nice (but expensive) meal at "311" the rest of the area was pretty dead. If I had known this, and knew that the cabs were going to be very expensive ($15 one way from Condado to Old San Juan) I would probably have just stayed by the hotel since there was plenty of places nearby. We finished the night with a visit to the hotel casino. From a previous review I expected a tiny room but it was actually a decent size, with a number of table games available. We played blackjack and were pleasantly surprised with the $5 minimum. We like to play but we are by no means high rollers. Waitress service was great and we easily got our money's worth in drinks (for the uninitiated, if you are sitting at the tables drinks are free, you just give a small tip). The next morning we wound up going to the buffet in the hotel. To be honest we were going to just go and get some pastries down the street, but since I was given a 2 for one voucher it made for a great deal. The buffet is $20pp which seems a bit high, but if you have a big appetite it is well worth it. Fantastic selection of everything - pastries, fruit, juices, healthy stuff (yogurts, egg white quiche, etc), omelete station, waffles, etc etc. The restaurant also has a great view of the ocean. From there we decided to hang out by the pool by the beach, which has a vanishing edge. So from your chairs you can see the pool with the beach beyond. Service again was great - there is always someone around asking if you need something. I could go on and on, but I will close with some last comments/tips: 1) If you have forgotten anything, there is a Walgreens right down the street that has pretty much everything you could need. 2) A nice touch is that the hotel provides laptops with internet service right in the lobby. This worked out really well for my wife so she could check her email 3) If you have a car, and want to visit El Morro or Old San Juan, definitely take the car and not a cab. We went for an afternoon and it was $6 for parking. Beware - only park in legitimate lots and don't trust anyone on the street who directs you to a street spot. I started doing this and then noticed all the other cars around us had tickets on them. 4) The nicer restaurants seem to have a "No shorts" policy, but nice jeans were ok. 5) Parking at the hotel is pricey, which might factor into your decision to get a rental car. Valet parking was $20/day, but self park wasn't much less at $15/day. Cheaper options may be nearby but I also didn't look.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LizabethRose
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from a 4 night stay at La Concha. This was my 12th trip to San Juan and the first time staying at La Concha. Of all my stays, this was by far the best. The hotel property is beautiful, the rooms are spacious and well-kept, and the beach was great. However, what really impressed me was the the staff! I travel often, and the people who work at La Concha have got to be the nicest I have ever met. Everyone was so gracious, helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “AMAIZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: cookylooky
Reviews.Content: WOW.. It's the first thing im going to say.. My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple of days, and all I can say is that it was an amaizing place.. I loved La Concha!, from the first time I saw it on the internet, I fell in love with it, not knowing that i was experience the best time of my life there..the place is clean, with good tasty food and with a great staff crew that will carter to you, and all of your needs..its was soo romantic when between my boyfriend and the stff managed to fill our room with rose pedals, and set the whole room with the best romance ambiance....Eating at their restaurants was also great..especially La Perla! overall the entire place was an Incredible, Amaizing, and a Romantic Experience...you should try it..YOU'LL LOVE IT..!! p.s THANK YOU BABY FOR TIME OF MY LIFE.. TE AMO!

Reviews.Title: “to much noise”
Reviews.Author: Vinny617
Reviews.Content: Construction starts at 6:30AM and can be heard from the rooms and pool area and of course the beach. If we knew we were gonna hear jack hammers and metal crashing into each other we would of stayed at the Marriot!

Reviews.Title: “Chic - but dirty beach”
Reviews.Author: ny-traveler81
Reviews.Content: We went to La Concha Renaissance bc i had Marriott points and we could get the rooms for free. The hotel is very nice, modern and clean. The breakfast buffet was delicious, and one of the best foods I had in PR probably was the steak wrap by the pool (YUM!). The lobby turns into a lounge in the evening. with music and beautifully dressed people. Rooms were clean, and service was great (albeit slow). Unfortunately, the private beach is kind of dirty, and the sand is not nice either. The pool was nice, but why would you want to spend time at a pool, when you are in PR (well, if you stay at this hotel, you will want to spend time at the pool bc the beach is dirty). One day, we had the opportunity to sneak into a private beach (I think it was the private beach of Intercontinental hotel) in Isla Verde. Isla Verde has the most beautiful beach ever! the sand was soft, the waters were calm and blue and clean!!!. If you go to PR, try to stay at a hotel located in Isla Verde. I have nothing against La Concha Renaissance (in fact, it is a really nice hotel)., but I will DEFINETELY stay at Isla Verde next time I go to PR. I LOOOOOOOVED PR!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, friendly but slow service”
Reviews.Author: bridge4980
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and stayed here for 5 nights in January. Overall, we liked the hotel but there was defintiely some room for improvement. I will just go through the pros and cons. Pros - good location, walking distance to many restaurants, bars, big rite aid for last minute sunblock and cheap bottled water. We really like authentic puerto rican food so we ate at a lot of the local restaurants. We did not eat a ton at the hotel itself. We had a snack one day at the bar one day (cheese and meat platter - not very good) and brunch (standard but good) and there are typical salads/sandwiches at the pool. Aside from the brunch, i would say go out for lunch. there are some really great places and they are obviously less expensive. There was one really delicous asian fusion place right across the way. dont remember the name, but its obvious. The grounds of the hotel were well maintained and pretty. The decor was very trendy but cool. The service was very friendly. Our first room was sub-par, but the room we eventually switched to had an absolutely gorgeous view. The pools were pretty and clean adn there were not many kids there. The beach is ok...water is a little rough. Cons - even though the hotel was not nearly full, we were put in a terrible room. first floor directly across the way from the vent from the pool grill. so our room smelled like hamburgers constantly. we actually joked that we must have literally had the worst room in the hotel. We're not really the type to complain, but after the second day we were admiring the rooms on the high floors with the huge windows that overlooked the ocean we decided to move. they were very gracious about moving us, however they were VERY slow. We didnt really mind because we just hung out on the beach, but if we had somewhere to be this would have been super annoying. Overall all of the service was VERY slow. very nice people, but we are from NY and are used to a much more fast paced life.
