I think this is just the way it is down there so we tried not to let it bother us to much. The rooms were a tad musty, but i think this is common with waterfront hotels. and one last con - one of the pools NEVER got sun, and the other got it for about half the day.

Reviews.Title: “Service Fees”
Reviews.Author: Jerrytb1
Reviews.Content: Everything was incredible. The only thing I didn't like was the $20 service fee per day added to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, sexy and cool like they bill themselves”
Reviews.Author: pkcasa
Reviews.Content: Went to La Concha with friends for a girlfriends' weekend. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. We were upgraded to beachfront view on a high floor. Rooms were modern with lots of storage space. The pools and drink service as well as the night scene were amazing. Scene was perfect for our age group (30s). Proximity to Old San Juan was very good. Delicious continental breakfast included and they even made us some items not officially included in the free breakfast. La Perla restaurant was delicious but quite expensive. We went to a Puerto Rican restaurant across the street that the staff would eat at and enjoyed it just as much. Zen Spa is across the street which we booked for treatments. This is a couples and friends leisure vacation place. It might not be well suited for business travelers or those with little kids.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: bigmar7
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I had a great time at this hotel. We arrived a little early at the time. Spoke to the concierge (can't remember his name) however he was extremely nice. Said that he had a room available but it was near the construction and if we wanted that room we could have it or we could wait until another room opened up. We said that we would wait and he said he would give us a call when a room that was high floor in the center of the hotel was available. He called about an hour later while we were walking around. Also provided us with breakfast vouchers for the day since we were early. These guys treated us nice from the moment we arrived. Bellhop was really cool. I think he was from Chicago originally. Very helpful and informative. Made sure we really new what was going on in PR and in the area. Also room service was on point. Not only did we get extra towels when we requested or had our room cleaned when we called, but housekeeping also called to make sure it was too our satisfaction. Great customer service. Gold star for that. Rooms were very nice. Floors were slippery at times but you are in a humid country. The only drawback was the bathroom. Then need to figure out a better solution to the showers. Everytime we took a shower the entire bathroom was soaked- actually it was like a little lake. If you put a towel or two by the shower it will catch the water, but it defeats the purpose of trying to conserve water. I am sure that a $4 dollar piece of rubber put on the shower floor between the glass and the tile would probably do the trick and minimize the complaints from flooded bathrooms and using so many towels. The gym is also nice. Spa was across the street. Place is safe to walk around late at night. I would recommend it and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Hottiee009
Reviews.Content: I'm a young outgoing female in early 20's and i rarely complain. I was so excited to go to La Concha, I had great expectations for this hotel. I wouldn't say i was disapointed but it wasn't all that. Its a place for young people since the lobby is always loud and fun at night especially thur-sat nights, I must say they decorate the lobby super great. The pools are small ( only 2 pools). Hotel has a great location. The rooms are small but comfee. Shower is WEIRD, staff is young and friendly. There's a construction noise that begins very early in the morning so prepare yourself for some loud noise. Food is good, i mean it's an average 4 star hotel, nothing special. If you're going to pay such price for any hotel in PR, book EL SAN JUAN HOTEL & CASINO. Oh and FYI La Concha casino is the size of my bathroom. Hope this helps =)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location! For night action and beach.”
Reviews.Author: aholmes
Reviews.Content: A wonderful and beautiful hotel right in the heart of San Juan action. The positive comments made about this hotel are true! Considering a person's perceptions, I can't deny any person's negative experiences, but I feel compelled to say that one must consider where they are when not satisfied by something. Please remember that PR is a TROPICAL climate and hence certain effects will be hard to avoid (i.e. rust)! I have visited many family in PR and often their complaints were the effects of the year round humidity (and salt) on anything metal, particularly cars! Secondly, when travelling, one MUST consider the culture and lifestyle of the area they are visiting! P'Rican's, stereotypically, have a much more laid back, devil-may-care attitude than most Americans! Although hard workers, a P'Rican's priority is family/friends, food, drink and dance. So, take that into consideration when you feel that the service is too slow. Remember, you're there to RELAX!!!! BTW, I am a P'Rican, so I know how my people are. I have to say the staff were wonderful, very willing to help. The valet staff made me feel like a celebrity. They spoke English very well, even when they were spoken to in Spanish. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. Although there is much to do at the hotel itself, make sure you take time to check the island out. Get to know the Puerto Rican people and their island. There are many diverse areas in PR that warrant exploring. Many people on this forum complained about loud music and construction. From where I was (6th floor), I could hear the coquis (Puerto Rican frogs) louder than the music! Having said that, La Concha is the place to be if you want to see beautiful people walking around in very sexy clothes! This is the place to wear clothes that you wouldn't dare wear in the states. Although touted as an adult hotel, not suitable for kids, there were quite a few kids and couples with babies. Observing them, they seemed very pleased, their kids looked like they were having a blast. SInce the hotel has many comfy "beds" and couches outside by the beach and pools, I saw several moms with their infants laying on the beds with them soaking in the warm Caribbean air (the beds had canopies). Overall, no disappointments with this hotel!!!! P.S. eat at some of the nearby "hole-in-the-walls" for great PR food.

Reviews.Title: “Service and the overall experience are what makes a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Horizon438
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, we have made La Concha our primary hotel in Puerto Rico. All the friendly people I've met (Luis, the front end supervisor, Juan and Jose, the valet, or Rose Mary and Linette, the front desk service reps) have made my frequent stays enjoyable and less business-like. They DO always go out of your way to satisfy your needs and make you feel like you're at home. The hotel is still going under some construction for the 2nd tower but it'll be finished soon in late '09. I hear that the Concierge Lounge for Marriott frequent travelers will also be housed in this tower. The view....you can't beat the view of the ocean for most of the rooms on the ocean tower. The decor....contemporary but not overly excessive. The bar....I'm watching a bikini fashion show right in front of the bar...need I say more? Like other people have said, its got a Miami-Vice feel to it but its truly an enjoyable experience and I will continue to frequent La Concha for my business needs as well as personal vacations! *i have stayed about 40 nights in '08 and stayed for about 30 nights so far in '09 here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time!”
Reviews.Author: scooterz1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Juan with 15 friends to celebrate my 40th birthday. I literally read hundreds of reviews before picking this hotel. The hotel was so great we spent the almost the whole trip onsite. The decor is fabulous, the pools fabulous, the pool and beach service fabulous,the food and drinks from Solera were excellent. We lived on pitchers of sangria and mojitos. The blended drinks were also excellent at the bar. In addition, the pineapple marinated strip steak wrap, duck quesadillas and sliders were absolutely mouth watering! The breakfast buffet was lacking and not worth the money. They needed more variety and one more chef at the omelet station to make this worth it. After the first day we grabbed breakfast sandwiches from a place down the street near the local drug store. The rooms and view were awesome. My guests have stayed at 4 and 5 star accomodations around the world. In fact a number of them have have been known to check out of unsatisfactory hotels in the past and they all seemed more than satisfied with my choice of hotel. However, I strongly suggest the management rethink the carpet and remove it. My group had 7 rooms and each had an underlying mildew smell that they tried to mask with orange spray. Most caribbean locations just have tile on the floor because carpet does not do well in the humidity. In spite of the floors the rooms were great. No they did not have balconies that you could sit on them but why stay in the room when the beaches and the pool were so great! The rooms do not have tubs so if you are looking to soak this is not your hotel unless a hot tube will do. The hot tubs outside were fabulous! They were a little too hot but fabulous. They also have a great gym with treadmills that face the ocean. I'll say it again, Fabulous! Sadly, the economy has also seemed to hit Condado hard. Many of the storefronts along Asfhord ave were closed. The high end stores however, were open and ready for business. We did not feel unsafe but the site of some of the buildings was not comfortable. We had a spa party at Zen Spa in Condado which is less than a block form the hotel and it was absolutely wonderful. The facilities were extremely modern. Ivette at Zen Spa worked with me by email and phone to prepare a great time for my guests. We had dinner out with our group twice we went to Miro across from the Marriot which is 3 short blocks away and Pamela's restaurant in Old San Juan. Both were awesome and I highly recommend them. Pamela's is on the beach and the staff was so knowledgeable and wonderful. I planned to eat at Perla but the restaurant manager was not very great at returning messages. That turned me off so we ate our more formal dinners elsewhere. We did have a cocktail party in the patio by the pool that I planned on the day of my arrival and the bar staff was incredibly helpful. Finally after reading reviews here I was a little leary of the concierge and I researched a lot of activities myself. I went to the concierge desk for assistance out of curiosity and I figured out that it is not that they don't know where to go but that they must recieve incentives for certain tours and those are the ONLY ones that they recommend. That was a little disappointing because the tours they recommended were overpriced. Search online and you can find better deals. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed La Concha and I plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed-It's All In The Details”
Reviews.Author: msritajd
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at La Concha during a recent trip to Puerto Rico. To sum things up, I was not at all impressed. I overheard one of the bellmen tell another guest that La Concha was the number one hotel in the Carribbean. I really find that hard to believe unless being number one means that La Concha's guests find it perfectly okay to have a layer of dust of the tops of the dressers and the white sofas. Maybe being number one means that guests should overlook the fact that the outside of the buildings ooze with rust and dead foliage or that rust is on all the metal accents in the room including the furniture, lamp posts, and edges of all the mirrors. The carpets were dank and damp. We paid extra for a room with an ocean view...however, the balcony barely had enough room for a person larger than the size of a small child to stand comfortably. The patio furniture was plain gross and had obvious signs of mildew and wear and tear. Our bathroom was mildly clean. Meaning that if one quickly glanced into the bathroom, one may find it to be adequate. However, bathrooms being very intimate spaces and upon a good inspection, the bathroom was not at all acceptable. The grout had mildew, the toilet tissue was damp and the floor had dust on it. I felt completely uncomfortable because I didn't want to touch the floors, the bedding or sit on the furniture. I did not allow any of my personal possessions to rest upon the dust covered furniture. I could write more, but it will only result in reliving the La Concha experience and I choose not to waste another day dwelling on that place. If you want my advice...there is a Ritz Carlton in Isla Verde..stay there. The Ritz rarely disappoints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: LeonNY
Reviews.Content: Ok people write really complete reviews here so I am not even sure whan exactly I could add... I guess the first thing is that this place is for young couples not for families with kids and elderly :) So if you are going with kids I am not sure if this is the place for you. The rooms are nothing short of amazing...We had an ocean view room that was just amazing...very nice beds..very clean nice shower I guess the only thing the room was lacking is a nice bath tub. Everything else is great. We didn't eat in the hotel because prices there are pretty expensive even tho I am from NYC. Pool area is amazing...Location is very nice as well there are pleanty of restaurants to go to around the hotel. Staff was very nice and helpfull in every way possible I disagree with everybody who is saying that staff wasn't good. What else can I say? :) It a really nice place specially for the money ( we paid about $200) a night. One negative thing I can say is the Resort Fee. They were trying to charge me some $16 a day resort fee...? I booked my vacation through Orbitz apperently Orbitz does not cover that fee and didn't notify me in any way. So I called them spend an hour on the phone with them and they promise to refund me that fee. Other then that I can't think of anything negative I can say about this hotel. I would recommend it to anybody who is going on vacation to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms, Great Location, Service Fair”
Reviews.Author: 42ndstreet
Reviews.Content: Great design, excellent location, a true resort, sexy & young. It is a hotel where you really can remain on the property and be satiated. It's a new hotel so be prepared for erratic service. We arrived on a Saturday evening around 10:30 PM, the porters were playing around so we dragged our luggage to the desk and there encountered a surly desk agent. Room Service was on par for a great hotel - from ordering, to delivery and clean-up. We needed to ask for towels and room cleaning - very erratic service! Forget the breakfast buffet, mediocre. The La Concha Rest has is nice, for the money we'd recommend eating in Old San Juan. We elected to eat in the lovely gardens by the pools. We ate almost all our meals there - very good and for a resort hotel it is very reasonably priced. It was really, really annoying to hear people just off cruise ships complaining about the tapas menu and prices - this is a resort hotel not a carnival cruise ship with fixins' bars and all you can eat processed food. The prices are very reasonable, service attentive, and the food original. We loved our room overlooking the pool, it had a terrace and was wonderful. You need to be in a "vacation" spirit insofar as Thurs - Sat evenings are loud. If you like night life these great rooms are for you. Sun- Wed nights it was quiet. We live on 42nd Street in NYC so not a problem - slept like babies on a really great mattress! The kids on staff at La Concha have the potential to make this a truly great hotel, but the managers need to manage. We look forward to heading back for another visit in the Fall and hope the service has improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great FACADE, but thats it :(”
Reviews.Author: lilbitfinicky
Reviews.Content: The staff was fabulous from the minute we got out of the cab, the gentlemen who greeted us were energetic and friendly, the lobby was beautiful, the front desk clerk was fast and courteous. The bellman who brought up our luggage was friendly and thorough (almost too thorough, but a really nice young man) But the awe and wonder ended right after he left the room. Yes we had an ocean front room, but the window was so dirty it blurred the view. Judging by the rust marks running down the inside of the window and the overwhelming moldy/mildew smell, I am guessing that it leaked. The room was lovely, nicely decorated, a bit small, but it was just the 2 of us so we didn't mind. We ventured down by the pool to look around and grab some lunch. After travelling most of the day we were hungry and dying for a tall cool refreshing glass of Iced Tea. After waiting what seemed like forever, we were served a flimsy small disposable cup of tea which they charged $3.00 for and another $3.00 when you ask for a refill. Ridiculous! As far as food, it was completely over priced and mediocre at best. DON"T fall for the breakfast buffet scam, $20.00 per person and more than half, no exaggeration, of the hot food entree bins were empty and although many people were complaining, and removing the metal lids to expose that it was empty, the staff really did not seem to care, and just kept putting the lids back on the empty pans. Being allergic to mold and waking up with a splitting headache due to the mildew smell in the room, the breakfast fiasco was the last straw. We went back to the room, called Expedia and cancelled the reservation we had booked for the night we would be returning from our cruise. For a fee they let us switch to the Marriott Stellaris. We returned from a fabulous 7 day cruise, checked into the hotel and the Marriott saved the vacation by doing everything right where the LaConcha fell short.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the Naysayers.”
Reviews.Author: Tahj
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at La Concha in late March '09, but almost didn't. I must admit, I was rattled by some of the bad reviews on here. In particular, I have a low threshold for questionable neighborhoods. So I was concerned. But we found a solution. We toured this, and other, San Juan-area hotels first before making a decision. We were heading out to the west side of the island for "Leg 1" of our trip, so we reserved a few hotels in the San Juan area for "Leg 2," but checked them out the morning we landed in Puerto Rico before heading west. La Concha won the tour, hands down. And when we stayed there later in the week, we never had a second thought. In sum: The Ritz was an unremarkable, low end Ritz; one that you'd forget a week after staying there. Quality was fine. Beach and pool way too windy. Clientele was Americans between 50 and 70, for whom the Ritz was the obvious and only choice. Intercontinental was like a mid-range Sheraton. Bar was a joke. Ate lunch at their beach restaurant, food was a joke. Beach was nice though. El San Juan was a Vegas strip wannabe. If that sounds intriguing then it's the hotel for you. La Concha was the best by far. Here's why: 1. Ambiance. I wanted to stay there as soon as I walked through the lobby. It has a subtle elegance, a subtle feel of excitement, and loads of time-warped charm. You feel like you're in 50's era Havana. There's a little bit of artificiality to it all -- the hotel does try hard to be a chic throw back, perhaps a bit too hard. But so what, it pulls it off. Fashionable Puerto Ricans clearly like it, as they flock to the public areas every night. That in itself makes it worthwhile, if you're traveling to experience something different from home. 2. Location. Condado was not sketchy by any means, but actually a really interesting area. I liked it because it is an actual "rejuvenation" success story-in-progress, rather than a fake rejuvenation non-success story. Everywhere you look there are new buildings and major development -- all high quality. There a plenty of restaurants within walking distance -- much more interesting ones than what we saw in Isla Verde. Tons of pedestrian traffic -- tourists and affluent locals. Not a concern about safety. And I am the squeamish type. And the few "abandoned buildings" people here complain about are merely the last remnants of the area's old days, which will no doubt be swept up shortly by developers, and at high prices. Also, the pool areas were a solid A-, the pool service and food was quite good, the beach was nice but rough, and the rooms had the same 50's-style charm as the public areas with furnishings/fixtures of good but not outstanding quality. An eating in the clam-shaped waterfront restaurant, La Perla, was memorable and fun. Finally, despite what the naysayers here say, the hotel was perfectly clean. I am a neat freak, and frankly have no idea what the complainers are complaining about. Go for the ambiance and the location -- especially if the thought of Isla Verde strip malls and Sheraton-like "resorts" bores you. Admittedly, it's not for everybody. I wouldn't recommend it to my 78 year old mother, for example. One hilarious commenter here wrote about how she and her family were horrified by the late-night Latin music and wound up speeding away at midnight by cab to the Ritz -- where it was thankfully quiet and civilized. The image makes me chuckle every time. No doubt that story's entirely true; at midnight you can probably hear a pin drop at the Ritz. So if that's you, skip La Concha. But if you're just scared because of all the wild, unfounded complaints on here about cleanliness, location, etc., etc., don't believe the naysayers for a second. We are so glad we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, but for the party in the lobby”
Reviews.Author: Travelsfar1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double queen room with my mom and sister for a girls vacation in Feb. 2009. The hotel was stunning. We were on a high floor with amazing views of the ocean. The hotel staff was fantastic and very helpful. My sister got sick and the hotel was able to call a doctor for us to come to the room. The breakfast was great - but typically expensive. The pools were fantastic, not big though just relaxing. Honestly, the hotel isn't very family friendly at all. I would have been very dissapointed had we had children with us. I think the pools were so nice for the adults because there were harldly any children. The hotel bar does turn into a night club. While we were there the music was blaring on Thurs. night until midnight and on Friday and Saturday until 1 am. It was really hard to sleep - we are all light sleepers. I think it would be difficult to sleep even if you aren't light sleepers. There was construction going on at the hotel that started early. Fortunately, our room was the furtherest from the construction as you could get. I think if we were closer to the construction this would have been a very different review, especially since we were kept up by the noise from the bar in the lobby. I am not sure when the construction is set to be complete, it looked about 1/3 done. The beds are comfy, the rooms are clean and decent size for three adults. Great spot for catching the bus to Old San Juan or just walking along the beach. The restaurant across the street is great and has some great traditional PR food. But make no mistakes, this hotel is for grown ups who like trendy hot spots.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: gloriousglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel as everyone in our party did. The chic decor, the indoor/outdoor spaces, and view made it very hard to leave. We enjoyed the cabana lounge which made it easy to come and go between the beach and pools. The pool by the beach was incredible with an infinity edge pool that made you feel like you were in an oasis among the sand dunes with great views of the ocean. The pool that was closer to the lobby was surrounded by trendy outdoor furniture and potted plants with a second tier that cascaded into the pool at the bottom. While we were at the hotel we enjoyed a great meal at La Perla with an incredible view of the Condado beach strip lit up at night. Our room was high up with amazing views that we couldn't get enough of; I don't think any room had a bad view. The location was great in between Old San Juan and Isle Verde. We had a lot of great active pursuits planned. We went deep sea fishing and caught a 250 pound 9 foot Blue Marlin with Mike Benitez Fishing Charters. We went hiking through the San Salvador Rain Forest and repelled an 80 foot waterfall with Ecoquest tours. We went scuba diving on a catamaran through the hotel where we enjoyed pina coladas and a beach picnic after two great stops at reef and small island. We toured Old San Juan and walked along the coast to the tip of the El Morro Fort. We all loved Puerto Rico, loved the hotel, and loved all of our excursions. I would go back in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy with a smile!”
Reviews.Author: missl989
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at La Concha. It was everything I expected and more! The hotel was very trendy, but not snobby. The best part of the hotel are the outdoor areas. It looks exactly as it does in the photos, cool-looking furniture, huge potted plants and 3 amazing infinity pools (which are open very late...) The rooms are OK, nothing amazing but the views from the oceanside rooms make up for it. The Neighborhood - There are so many reviews about this. I think the neighborhood is fine. It's clearly up and coming, they are building everywhere. The abandonded store fronts everyone is talking about is ONE building diagonal from the hotel that is being torn down to build high-end condos. That's it. I preferred this neighborhood to Isla Verde because it's more residential, you'll see people jogging at all hours and walking their dogs. Isla Vede is a busy 4 lane highway with big-box american stores on either side, no neighborhood. If you walk left from the hotel and go towards the Marroit, you'll find a cute little neighborhood with shops and cafes. If you walk right, there are 5 high-end stores then construction construction, but if you keep going there a 4 amazing little Puerto Rican food cafes all in a row that sit directly on the ocean with views to die for and even better food. We ate at Il Mulino and Koco at El San Juan and the Ritz and found this local food to be 10 times better. The hotel staff was AMAZING. We got an upgrade to an ocean view room - just because. The waitress at the pool gave us free drinks - just because. This was one of the friendliest hotel staffs I've ever come across. I agree, the concierge was useless, I had a feeling they were just guessing. Do your own homework before you go. A great perk no one mentioned is that the business center is free! It's open 24/7 and you can get online for as long as you want. We made the mistake of booking our trip Sat - Wed. Sun, Mon, Tues, Wed night there is NOTHING to do in San Juan late night. Tues night we left the hotel at 10:30 thinking we could get dinner at a nice restaurant (we're New Yorkers...) and it was impossible. We ended up getting room service. If you want to party till the wee hours, you must go Thurs-Sat. We went to the Marriot for brunch Sunday and it was really disappointing. It felt very pedestrian and had kids EVERYWHERE!!! La Concha had children here and there but they were very quiet. The ONE complaint was because the hotel is newish and cool, its a destination spot for people on the island. That said, you'll see a few random people walking around the outdoor portions where you might be laying by the pool. Also, the infinity pool by the beach is really pretty. So pretty that local people on the beach couldn't resist and kept sneaking in. I saw the security guards kick three groups out in a span of 3 hours. Overall, I'd come back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for a few days away”
Reviews.Author: petrus47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for my birthday and the Easter weekend. La Perla was wonderful for dining in the evening and the tuna salad by the pool for lunch was exquisite. Our deluxe room had a nice view.too bad no balcony and a small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: DW42
Reviews.Content: I recently vacationed at La Concha resort with my friends on Spring Break. Most everything about the hotel was ideal. The rooms were very nice and the bathrooms were clean. The closets in the room were perfect in terms of size. Eating at the resort, while somewhat expensive, was a great experience. The food was excellent and the waiting staff very nice. I experienced that the staff in general was very friendly and accommodating. The beach was great and I went there each day of my trip. The casino, while somewhat small, was actually perfect for me-- not too hectic and most of the dealers were extremely amiable. Now on to some of the minor things I was disappointed with. First, it would have been really nice to have a real balcony overlooking the ocean rather than the small ledge that you couldnt even fit a chair on. Secondly, if anyone is thinking about going into Old San Juan, be prepared for a minimum $20 cab ride there and at least the same price going back. Another thing that was somewhat bothersome was the lack of nightlife in the club. I was under the impression that there was a club there, but there certainly is not. Also, the bar closes very early, around 11 pm, which was inconvenient. The last thing that bothered me was something I saw on my way checking out. On top of a roof there were two birds, caged and trying to make their way out. That was very disturbing and I hope that it was a fluke and if still there, someone frees the birds. While it may seem like a lot of complaining, the hotel was actually perfect for my stay and I hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TPXB
Reviews.Content: After reading the various reviews of the hotel, good and bad, I was curious to how we would form our own opinions. There have been a few reoccurring themes in the reviews. First is the question of construction noise. I can say that we heard construction noise during our stay, but it didnâ€™t really affect us in the least. We didnâ€™t notice it in the morning and during the day it was minimal. Second, was the neighborhood. It was very walk able and busy at all hours of the day. We didnâ€™t feel unsafe at any time and enjoyed the local restaurants and bars. There are empty shop windows in the area, but there are anywhere in the United States right now. Third, was the comparison to the Marriott. We took a walk down to the Marriott and it was more like a cruise ship than a hotel. It was very crowded and had large number of kids in all parts of the hotel. And lastly was noise from the hotel lobby. Again, we had no problems and thought the scene in the lobby would be more over the top. The bottom line is that the La Concha was great. We enjoyed the pools, the ocean and the food. We ate lunch by the pool a couple of days and it was very good. We also gambled on a few occasions and that was fun. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, particularly Juan at the main entrance, Ricardo the bell hop and Francisco the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 20-30 yr old girls trip!!”
Reviews.Author: boodlebop
Reviews.Content: La Concha is by far the most chic hotel in San Juan. My friends and I are all 29-30. There were 5 of us and we're a diverse crowd of black, indian and mixed (black/white) girls. We are a very cute group (which matters because it got us great service from men)! Anyway- the pros and cons... PROS: *The hotel is very trendy. It's bright, colorful and the decor is simply phenomenal! If you want the hotspot, this is it! *The pool area is beautiful...it has oversized plants and tuck-away lounge chairs and couches all over. Very, very nice. *The walk from the hotel to the beach is only a few feet. *There are police everywhere...you see them all over the beach and on the streets. We felt completely safe the entire time. *There's trendy shopping right across the street (Gucci, Louis V, Cartier etc). *The rooms have an awesome view...go for a higher floor room (above 7 or 8 floor). *Not many kids. There were some, but not as many as say...the Intercontinental or El San Juan. CONS: *The rooms are always moist. It's hard to explain, but it feels "icky" all the time. Your clothes will never air dry! Hang them from the balcony. *Construction begins at 8a EVERY morning...aye!!! *Service is SLOOOOOW...no one is in a hurry to do anything! It's ridiculous. And the concierge might as well not exist. This is a PR thing in general. *The music in the lobby (the lobby is a trendy nightspot) is all techno/rave-like. Can you say headache?! *The waves at the beach are crazy! One friend lost her top!! Isla Verde is a much calmer, nicer beach...take a $20 cab ride there. *There aren't many good food spots in the immediate area. Wendys, Subway, Dunkin Donuts, but they all take about 30 mins to order anything! Cafe Angel is across the street- they have good drinks and pretty good food. *There aren't as many sexy Puerto Ricans guys as you probably would imagine :(

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Schmance”
Reviews.Author: jxb534
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a sheek, fancy hotel. I wish I would have taken a picture of the people that the hotel bar attracts on a typical Saturday night. Think gowns, high heels, and button down shirts. A little too much for me. If fancy is your thing, then you'll love La Concha. If you're more of a flipflop, sundress type of girl, you may want to stay somewhere else. The room- The room was very nice. It had a flat screen tv, beautiful view, was clean, and roomy with great lighting and seating. The shower was just ok, but maid service was spectacular. We were never woken up with annoying knocks but always came back to a clean room with made beds. Which I have to say, was very nice. What we WERE woken up by was the construction every weekday morning at 7 am. The constant sound of drilling cement made me want to die. I know it is a necessary evil but it was really annoying. The hotel had a standing balcony with sliding doors. The view was amazing. The location- I liked the location. There are a bunch of restaurants within walking distance (the hotel prices are WAY too expensive). Try Danny's, Columbo, Orchinos, Waiter's. There are a bunch though. Try them all! There is also a Unos and Chilli's within walking distance if you have picky eaters. The beach the hotel is set on is beautiful. The hotel is a short ride away from Old San Juan (you have to go!) and El Yunque Rain Forest. The hotel-As I stated above, the hotel is fancy but cool looking. Marble floors (I don't know how the highheelers don't slip and fall), cool lighting, neat and modern furniture, interesting art work. The grounds are well kept with neat little private areas throughout the hotel (in and out of the sun). There are two hot tubs (one was not working while I stayed) and three nice pools. There was always plenty of seating, both by the pools and the beach. There are three restaurants. We only went to one of them after having a 55 dollar bill for lunch for two. No free refills on soda and they charge 3 dollars a piece! The drinks were ok at about 8-9 dollars for a daquri. Needless to say, we didn't drink much. Room service is ridiculously expensive and the continental breakfast is too. $6.50 cents for a SMALL fruit salad. The staff at the hotel were nice and helpful: Juan the bell man, and Francisco with security to name a few. We picked La Concha partly because of the location and partly because the reviewers said it was a good place for singles. Unfortunately, I don't agree it is a good place for singles. Maybe it was just the time we stayed but there were a TON of kids in the pools all screaming "Marco Polo" and hanging out in the hot tub. I don't understand why you'd want to stay at such a fancy hotel with marble and overpriced food with kids. So while I do think La Concha is a better hotel for singles, there were a lot of families there that singles may not want to "deal with." Maybe it was just because we went during Easter break that there were so many kids there. The hotel has free wi-fi. It was nice but it would go in and out alot. A lot of restaurants in San Juan have free wi-fi. The hotel has a casino with slots and tables. Parking was $15 dollars a day. We parked overnight and were charged $30. There is an underground parking garage with plenty of parking. Overall, La Concha is a very nice hotel. If you're more down to earth, casual, on a budget, you may want to pick somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel BUT....”
Reviews.Author: DCbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I thought overall the hotel was very nice. I didn't set my expectations very high prior to arriving simply because some of the below reviews really had terrible things to say about the hotel. But let's face it - you get what you pay for. We aren't paying Four Seasons prices so don't expect the Four Seasons when you walk in the door. The hotel has more of a trendy 20 - 30 year old feeling. The decor is very chic and the pool area was just the right size. Plus if you're a gym freak like I am the gym was perfect. New equipment, bottled water and well air conditioned. The room was great - it overlooked the ocean and we didn't hear any music playing late into the night like some of the other reviews complained about. Plus one review complained of space between the closet and bed - unless you're an elephant, there is plenty of space! My only regret is that I put a lot of faith in the concierge and didn't fully plan out my trip prior to arriving. Unfortunately the concierge's are completely worthless. If you want to do something else besides lay at the beach / pool, do yourself a favor and research other things to do before you get here. The concierge's (when they are at the desk) are a bunch of young kids who really have no idea what to suggest besides "cool clubs." Also if you want to eat at restaurants off the hotel property, research that yourself, because again, some of their recommendations were really in left field.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha was Great!”
Reviews.Author: babie22559
Reviews.Content: Hotel: I stayed at La Concha for six nights in late February. The hotel, grounds, and pools are beautiful. Check in was easy and my room was very comfortable. Some of the folks I was traveling with had coffee, tea, fridges, and microwaves in their rooms. I did not. But, I didnâ€™t want to rock the boat too much since I asked twice for the window to be repaired and washed. I also had lots of problems with the A/C rattling. Although I asked twice, it was never fully fixed. The parking validation system was a little confusing. The parking process was explained to me several times, but I was only able to get out of the gate by myself (with validated tickets) only once out of the 6 nights I was there. I had to keep running to get the valets to help me out of the gate. The breakfast in the hotel lobby was lovely. Nice variety of pastries and fruit. Thank you for the breakfasts. The workout center was wonderful with plenty of options for cardio and weights. The managerâ€™s reception on Wednesday evening was wonderful. The service was fast, the drinks were good, and the appetizers were delicious. Thank you very much. Casino: Many thanks to the front desk folks and Felipe for the nice match play coupons for the casino. The casino was very fun, but NOT generous. I played table games in the casino, consistently for six nights, for hours and hours at a time, even brought some colleagues, and then over the weekend, brought my husband with his checkbook, and was never comped anything. I got a free tee-shirt b/c I had a birthday in Feb. Otherwise, I would have completely left empty handed. On the flip side, the waiter service in the casino was excellent. I didnâ€™t have to wait very long for drinks â€“ the staff was very attentive. The little sandwiches served were very good and much appreciated. The table minimums were nice and low during the week I was there. Be aware of the Blackjack tables on the weekends. If you won a blackjack, you had to win the next hand to actually receive your winning from the blackjack you won the hand before. They really make you work for it (at least this was my experience over the weekend). Then, if the dealer forgets you had blackjack (even though the chip is visible near your hand) you may have to speak up in order to get your even pay out. Restaurants in the area: I dined at several Ashford Ave restaurants during my week. The little window restaurant directly across the street was nice if you wanted to grab a breakfast empanada. The Latin Star restaurant was just ok. The Chinese/Japanese/Sushi place a couple streets away from La Concha (on the beach side) was very good and had good service. My favorite place was the Japanese place located right next to the Marriott Stellaris Casino (a few streets down form La Concha). The service was fantastic and they food was even better. They also offer an early bird special before 6:30pm. The soup, salad, and meal was only $22 with tax and tip. Best place in town. My husband and I love to drive over to Highway 813 to try the local foods in San Juan. We had empanadas for $2 and huge steak and chicken skewers for another $2. Itâ€™s really the best way to eat local flavor. Rental car: Again, many thanks to enterprise rental cars. We visited San Juan last fall and had the best rental car experience ever with the Enterprises located by the airport and on Ashford Ave. This trip - although the prices were a bit higher in Feb, (maybe in-season prices?) the customer service received was fantastic. We picked up the car at the Ritz and returned to the off-site airport location with no penalty. Thanks again for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: DavidNY_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, with modern room design that doesn't always work. Our room is kind of damp and musty, depending on how the ac is working. The design of the closets prevents access to drawers while the sliding door to the hanging portion is open, so to get dressed you've got to slide the door back and forth. A minor inconvenience, but a crazy design (as are the bathrooms, with only 1/2 a partition to the shower). The staff is very nice, but it is now 5pm and with two requests, our room has still not been cleaned. We're on the 7th floor, and you do hear the music late into the night. The pool area is terrific, as is the beach. I would recommend the hotel for 20-30 somethings that would anjoy the bar scene at night. There is a decent casino. While I'd recommend the hotel for those that would enjoy it, for older travelers I'd suggest a different hotel. At this time of year THERE IS A 13% "RESORT FEE" that is not clearly advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to typical 4* business hotel standards (yet)”
Reviews.Author: stompin_pt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at La Concha a handful of times over the past two months and while there are several things my colleagues and I enjoy about the hotel, we've had enough bad experiences that I wanted to warn other travelers about. These concerns have been shared with management previously (and repeatedly). First, the pros: -Convenient location, easy to get to from the highway. Plenty of food options at a range of cuisines and price points, and proximity to other conveniences (e.g. drug store) -Like the hotel food options: Solera to eat outside and quite reasonably, Perla for a treat. Nice morning breakfast buffet at Level 25 -Have always had an ocean view room and it's a very pretty view of the beach and ocean Next the cons: 1) (Self) Parking validation just doesn't work. Well, it usually works the first day (probably about 2/3 of the time). The staff will tell you that your parking is validated for the entire stay and you should keep the same ticket. However, 90% of the time we've tried to exit the lot with a validated ticket on our 2nd or 3rd or 4th day, we can't exit the lot. At that point we need to either call the hotel and ask the valet to come let us out or walk to the valet stand and do the same. We all have the hotel # speed-dialed on our phone but it still adds about 3-5 minutes to our exit each time this happens (depending on whether or not the hotel answers the phone, how quickly the valets hustle, etc.). The front desk continues to tell us that our tickets should work and we should keep trying; it does not appear they are actively trying to fix the problem. Several staff have acted like this is a new problem despite the fact that we've faced it for 8 weeks now. We've mostly switched to getting a new parking ticket every day and validating it at the front desk every day. But this annoying thing, though little, is leading us to consider switching hotels. 2) Can be very tough to sleep if you're staying on a low floor (3 thru about 6 or 7) on a Wednesday through Saturday night due to loud music in the lobby until very late at night (past midnight). 3) Several times my colleagues or I have been unable to check into our rooms even though it was after 3 p.m. (and usually 5 p.m. or later). This is a relatively infrequent occurance but it's very frustrating when it occurs because there are literally no public spaces besides a small business center where it's quiet enough to take a phone call or work peacefully. 4) High speed internet is very inconsistent in the rooms. We've had enough experiences of losing our connection or weak signals that we mostly just use our sprint cards now. But this is quite disappointing. Also, the room service prices are outrageous, though I know this is not uncommon.

Reviews.Title: “Solid but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: NCE40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a four-night/five-day stay at La Concha. The hotel was as stylish as expected and everything has clearly benefited from a recent freshening. Our room was a decent size, had the advertised ocean view, modern fixtures and a very nice bathroom. It was right next to the new tower they're building, and as others have written, they start construction promptly at 7 AM, every day except Sunday. For the most part, it's not a terrible intrusion, b/c chances are you're there to go to the beach or pool or sightseeing, and not spending most of the day in the room, but it was annoying to wake up to the sound of drilling, so be sure to ask for a room at the opposite end of the hotel, since the construction project looks like it will be going on for quite some time. Service was inconsistent. The first couple of days, our room was made up while we were down at breakfast, but the next few days, it didn't get made up until after 1 PM, and we had to call downstairs to request it. Staff was uniformly friendly. Food at Level 25 and poolside was decent, but nothing spectacular. We ate at Perla one night. The setting is fantastic, but the service was horrendous. In a half-empty restaurant swarming with servers, we waited 20 min. before anyone even brought us a menu. The people at the table next to us were reduced to pouring their own water and we witnessed another couple get up and leave b/c they got no service whatsoever. The food was good, but not out of this world good, and at this level (and prices), a restaurant has to be on its game. We ate at better places in San Juan with less pretension and far better, more attentive service. We'd probably stay elsewhere next time, primarily b/c we'd prefer a location outside of the city. For San Juan, La Concha is a good bet, but it's probably best to hold off until the construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MDR12
Reviews.Content: Better than I expected. Staff is very attentive and professional, I would be more than eager to stay there again. I was there only one night while I waited to join friends the next day but would have gladly stayed a bit longer. Very clean, modern hotel with a great location right on the beach. New addition to the hotel is being built and you at times hear the construction but don't let that deter you; this is temporary and you want to be up by 09.00 to enjoy the beach and the pool anyway. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “My Nightmare Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tzipi95
Reviews.Content: Loved Puerto Rico- The hotel was a disaster- was a dump- I can not beieve I made such a poor choice. It was dirty. The pool was a joke. It was small and the seating area was dated, it fact the whole hotel was dated and worn out. Upon checking in we were first we were given a room with an obstructed view. We paid 350.00 a night for an ocean delux view. No view and no balcony. We moved to another room where the chairs were broken and we were awoken by the construction next door at 7:00 a.m. well we moved again. This time it was even worse. The hotel, was really not a hotel I believe, it is a front for a night club because at 11:00 bar scene and music started and the lobby and pool area filled with hundreds of people and music was blaring in our room. We were on the 7th floor. After complaining to the front desk, yes, they knew me well by then, I was told it would stop by 2 a.m. Yes, you guess it, 2 a.m. came and went, I called down again and was told it would go on at least until 4 a.m. I would say that it was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. The staff's clothes were dirty, the food was poor and basically everything about it was low class. I would tell anyone that they would be crazy to stay there. We left in the middle of the night, took a cab to the Ritz Carlton and salvaged the rest of vacation.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars for sure - but not 5”
Reviews.Author: SuckeredBySandals
Reviews.Content: I've been in the fortunate position of having to make 5 business trips to San Juan in the past 6 months.. Each trrip was 3 to 10 days in length. I hve stayed at the Marriott, the Courtyard on Ponce de Leon, the Radisson, and La Concha. La Concha is unquestionably the best of the lot. Like all of the other Ashford Avenue hotels it has access to a large choice of mediocre restaruants albeit in a dodgy neighbourhood. Its pool and beach facilities look wonderful (I don't get much of a chance to use them). The staff seem inexperinced but try very hard. On my first stay in February, my bathroom still contained evidence of hte previous occupant but thereafter was spotless. On my March stay I found cockroaches on two occasons and managed to kill them the second time. Otherwise the room, the view, the cleanliness were highly satisfactory. I ate breakfast at the bar and at the poolside restaruant and found good value and excellent service for the money (conparred to waiting half an hour for a coffee at the Residence Inn). My only complaint is that when I asked to delay my checkout I was told firmly and rudely "no". So much for the weight of my $2500 hotel bill.

Reviews.Title: “I am astounded by others' reviews! This place is DIRTY and SKETCHY.”
Reviews.Author: debtorrie
Reviews.Content: I am really astounded by others' reviews of La Concha. "Simply Spectacular?" Are you blind? Sorry if you are - but I hope all travelers read my review before making a decision on La Concha. Let me first say that I do like my 4 and 5 star hotels - I expect cleanliness, friendly staff, safety... and I prefer updated decor. La Concha markets itself very well online and many people who have only visited its bar at night think that the hotel is upscale, trendy, modern, exciting etc... But PLEASE - you cannot rate a hotel by its bar at night. In the daytime, the bar is barren with a handful of sketchy locals, slumped over the bartop, making hotel guests feel uncomfortable. At least this was our experience (I traveled with my husband and 2 friends) when we arrived at La Concha just recently. As we waited for our rooms to be ready (we waited 3 hours), we tried to enjoy cocktails at the bar, but were made very uncomfortable by a very intoxicated man who was giving us the finger across the bar while he laughed and laughed, holding up his red napkin and then revealing his middle finger to us (sounds strange, but it really happened and it was very bizarre). As the waittress laughed it off (when she should have SHUT HIM OFF), we all looked at each other and felt very uncomfortably. The man then proceeded to laugh at the top of his lungs at passer-bys and then stumble around in circles on his way to the bathroom. NOT my idea of a great first impression. Later, when our friend's room was ready, we decided to all put our bags in her room so that we could relax and change our clothes. This is not what happened. We soon realized what kind of standards the hotel had. The glass shelf in the bathroom was filthy. The bed sheets and pillow cases were stained with brown and orange stains and we also found hairs beneath the sheets. The carpet was stained almost everywhere and there was a micro-fiber beige chair with stains all over it. The room also smelled musty and old. I do have pictures but I haven't taken them off my camera yet. When I do - I will post them with this review. In addition to the room, the hallways outside the room were filthy - with dirt, leaves and litter. The public restrooms in the lobby were also awful - they smelled like urine and the floors were muddy and the stalls were wet and filthy. We eventually did get all of our money back as we transitioned over to the Ritz (which was beautiful - thank God), but it took about 45 minutes of arguing with the staff. Only when we asked, the woman at the counter called the manager who was "in a meeting" and he/she never came out when she told him/her that they had 4 unhappy guests leaving their hotel before even staying one night. She did offer us another room, but based on the looks of the first room, we were very skeptical that another room would be any better, so we declined. I also forgot to mention that the street the hotel is on is frightening. There are old stores that are not in service - with boarded up windows and graffiti everywhere. There are also very shady people everywhere - slumming around and loitering. There are "gentelman's clubs" all over the place and other shady bars and restaurants. I found one tiny convenient store, but other than that - the stores were not anything any tourist would be interested in visiting. Like "cash your checks" type stores and dirty diners and janitorial supply stores. Seriously - nothing touristy at all. I can't believe they put a hotel on that street that they market to leisure tourists! I didn't feel safe - even in the middle of the day. I can't imagine what it's like at night. So - if you can't tell by now, I'm urging you NOT to stay at La Concha. Do not trust the website. It looks fabulous online - but believe me - don't find out the hard way like I did!

Reviews.Title: “Another Amazing Visit!”
Reviews.Author: JeffUSA1112
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a second week-long trip to La Concha (Febuary 22-March 1). Once again this year, I have only the most positive things to say about this beautiful hotel and resort. My best friend and I traveled together again to stay at La Concha for my birthday. We were joined by another friend whom had not been to San Juan before, as well as three of her friends who had visited San Juan many times and always stayed at the El San Juan Hotel. The hotel staff at La Concha is absolutely unbelievable. During the entire week, we were treated with such kindness and warm regards; it was more like visiting close friends than your typical hotel staff. For example: upon arriving on our first day, the valet opened the door to the taxi, looked at us and smiled (recognizing us from the year before) and said, â€œAhh, youâ€™ve come back, welcome home!â€� So many of the staff members from the previous year were still at La Concha and each of them remembered us from before. Their hospitality and friendliness once again truly made for an enjoyable week. And just like last year, Lousie (from concierge) baked a cake for me and brought it in from home on my birthday. So many others who work here also made the trip memorable, including: Jeannice, Michelle, Carlos, Jaime, Jaemy, and Jorge from the Lobby Bar; Jan-Michelle, Tania, and Doriana from the Lobby Bar lounge area; Lorainne, Carmen and Jessica from Solera, and Michael and Louise from Concierge. I know thereâ€™s probably people Iâ€™m overlooking or for whom I donâ€™t remember a name, but in general, everyone is so very nice. Check in was flawless without any kind of wait. During the check-in, I asked if there were any upgrades (as Iâ€™m a Marriott Platinum member), but was told that there wasnâ€™t anything available. Moments after entering our room, the phone rang and it was the front desk informing me that she had found a junior suite if I would be interested in the upgrade. Both rooms were on the 10th floor and I opted to take the suite to have more room. We spent a great deal of time staying on property, which is exactly what we wanted to do. We ate a few meals at Solera (still love the Latin Sliders!) and one dinner at Perla (for my birthday). I have to comment that dinner at Perla was amazing! Itâ€™s a beautiful restaurant with an incredible menu and view of the Ocean. I will definitely eat there again! Other restaurants nearby include di Parma (wonderful!), Tijuanaâ€™s (we ate there three times for lunch) and the new Sidewalk CafÃ© (at La Concha). We didnâ€™t get to Pure & Natural this year, but I still recommend it for a take-away lunch back to the pool (and it is just outside of the hotel). While I really had no major issues with La Concha last year, I did note in my review that housekeeping often made up the room late in the day and that the elevators seemed slow at times. Noticeable improvements were made in both areas this year: there was only one day that our room wasnâ€™t cleaned before noon (and that was because we were in the room at the time they originally came to clean) and the elevators seemed to always be available (my only comment would be that the â€œbeepingâ€� noise on the elevators as you pass each floor could be turned down; itâ€™s kind of loud). Yes, there is construction in the area (at La Concha and other nearby properties) but that was not bothersome at all. And the music from the Lobby Bar on Thursday through Saturday was not an issue either as we were down in the bar area till late in the night. This is such a fun hotel if you enjoy nightlife. I wouldnâ€™t stay anywhere else. The friends who traveled with us, who always stayed at the El San Juan, fell in love with La Concha and have already booked their next trip back to this property for September (my friend and I have booked for two more return trips: his birthday in October and mine again next February). I can not recommend this hotel highly enough and Iâ€™m greatly looking forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Happyagentnl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous - the coolest hotel I have ever stayed! The king size beach beds were memorable! La Perla - spectacular and the lobby bar absolutely rocks at night - it was amazing! Definitely the hottest spot in San Juan. I won't forget my ocean view room and sleeping with the doors open to I could hear the waves crash on the beach. Treat yourself and stay at La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience, plan on going back!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gocoogs
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend at the time of the trip (now fiance) had an amazing time on this vacation... best one yet!! Right from the start we loved La Concha! The staff was very welcoming upon arrival, and although there was a delay in our check in we didn't mind because we used that time to walk around and check out the beach and amenities. As soon as we got our room, the front desk employee wrote an apology note for the delay and gave us a fruit basket!! Room and bathroom were clean and we had a lovely view of the beach. There was helpful staff at the activity desk that helped us pick out different trips to Old San Juan that was near by, The Forts, El Yunque Rain Forest, and The Bacardi Distillery. There is some great places to eat all along Ashford and they range from fairly cheap to moderately pricey, so we just switched it up. The only restaurant inside the hotel that we ate at was the one by the pool. I had some kind of sandwich that was good but a bit pricy for a simple sandwich. If you are into the nighlife, the lobby is a nice place to hang out, sometimes live music and other days they had a DJ. This trip turned out to be really special because on the 2nd day of our stay my boyfriend proposed!! I had no clue because the concierge staff was sooo helpful in planning it out with my fiance. He proposed while we went out for a walk on the beach in the evening using white stones that he borrowed from the lobby that spelled out "MARRY ME". They helped make it extremely unforgettable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome public space, lovely ocean front property, good service”
Reviews.Author: sarahwanwan
Reviews.Content: Love it as soon as we arrived and stepped into the lobby, almost like a hot nyc lounge with at a beach front setting! All the public area is modernly designed and very clean/well maintained, including lobby, multiple pools and cabanas (free!). It's catered to young fun crowd, unlike the nearby hotels that are packed with family (aka KIDS!!!).... It's loud, yes, but it's defo lively with good relaxing party vibe. It's great for people who just wanna enjoy the beach, the view, friendly services, while drinking the awesome mojito delivered to the beach for you.. The only thing I wasn't impressed by are the rooms. It's decent, clean and comfortable, but it almost a bit bland that it doesn't match up to the overall sleek design. We stayed in 2 rooms throughout our 4-night stay (moved to a higher floor for better view on day 2), both are clean and well maintained, but it doesn't wow you like the rest of the property do...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Very Cool Public Spaces”
Reviews.Author: NYCJOHN
Reviews.Content: The public spaces of thge resort are excellent--pools, gym, beach, bars, restaurants are all great. The rooms are mostly good but DONT stay in rooms on side of hotel where there is current construction. Lower numbered rooms are best.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: ohiohioian
Reviews.Content: Just returned. We hated to leave. True there was construction that started early in the morning, but who wants to sleep in when the weather is so beautiful outside. Besides if you open your window the sounds of the ocean tune out the construction noise. Stayed at the Marriott last year, which was also nice, but highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “chic,modern hotel in condado”
Reviews.Author: treefreak
Reviews.Content: we only stayed here one night pre-cruise, but would have loved to stay longer. the ambience is definitely ultra-modern chic. the design and choices of olors were the best we have seen in the caribbean and we travel there every year. our room waqs ready for us when we arrived, even though it was only 2:00. the front desk people were all very helpful and cheerful, as well as capable of answering dining questions. the room was large and cheerful decorated in turquoise and green. it was very clean and had a beautiful view of the pool area and ocean. we booked with marriott points and were bumped up to a full ocean view without having to ask. i would estimate that the hotel was only about half full. there were many quiet areas around the hotel both inside and out. little niches where crowds could not congregate. the beach was very nice and you could ask them to set up your chairs in the palm grove away from the crowds. we would definitely stay here again, and for a longer time.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and the Smelly”
Reviews.Author: born2sunbathe
Reviews.Content: For the record, I travel frequently and prefer luxury properties. In Puerto Rico, I've stayed at the El San Juan, Ritz and El Conquistidor over the years. This was my first stay at La Concha. I decided to stay at La Concha because during my previous visit while staying at the Ritz, we ate at La Perla, La Concha's gorgeous seaside restaurant, and also liked that the hotel wasn't on a landing strip like the Isla Verde hotels. I also liked that the Condado area has some retail appeal, as opposed to Isla Verde which has none. The hotel staff was very friendly, although s-l-o-w. Our room wasn't ready when we checked in, so we changed in the bathroom (might want to consider a room devoted to early arrivals and late departures) and went back to the front desk to check the bags, but we couldn't get anyone to help us for a half an hour. When we were finally helped, they couldn't find the reservation even though we had just checked in thirty minutes earlier. (They might want to consider a bellman's stand.) I could live with the delay, but I couldn't live with the stench in the hotel room. Musty, mildewy and just plain WET. I've experienced this before in other seaside hotels in Puerto Rico (El San Juan to be specific), but this smelled like a wet sofa. They sent us a bottle of wine to make amends which I appreciated, but I wouldn't recommend a seaview if that's the tradeoff. The pool and beach areas are relatively small, and the view from the beach is graffiti and construction. A nice try, but it ain't the Ritz in South Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Not living up to its motto”
Reviews.Author: fescamilla
Reviews.Content: Hotel design and ambience is modern and chic. Pool area is fantastic! Hotel service and maintenance left much to be desired. Facts: --Room was not ready at 4pm --Toilet was not functional upon arrival --2 light bulbs were out --Bedroom window lock stuck and would not open --Carpet had stains --Duvet pillow cases had stains --Balcony was not clean (e.g. cigarettes, bird fetus, etc.) --Some towels were ragged --Poor housekeeping except for one day --bar service poor (on average it took 10 minutes to get a drink even when bar was not crowded) --lobby restroom by Perla restaurant never got paper towels despite 2 personal requests and 3 from another client --dead bolt lock did not work throughout stay Staff does not take responsibility for lack of service including the manager on duty on the evening of 2/6/09. It was always someone else fault . Needless to say La Concha Resort in Puerto Rico is not living up to its motto: "Ready to serve you at a moment's notice that means RIGHT NOW" (most repair requests required follow up). I can only recommend this hotel to people that don't expect quality service, a well-maintained room, or value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “ultra modern”
Reviews.Author: lookingforculture
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern hotel. Pros: balcony view to beach, watch cruise boats at night modern furnishings nice pool area, not crowded Cons: loud music until wee hours very rough surf (a woman had to go to hospital) balcony to small to sit on We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: IDONTTRAVELENUF
Reviews.Content: Our Celebrity cruise was shortened by one day at the last minute so we decided to spend the extra night at La Concha rather than coming home early. The cruise line released us at 9 AM so we were at the hotel by 9:30 AM and I was prepared for our room not being ready and it wasn't, they told me 2-3 hours and it was almost exactly 3 hours when they called my cell. We had an amazing room on the 10th floor (1018) directly facing the ocean with a floor-to-ceiling wall of glass displaying this amazing view...and the window opened! The room was very cool with an ultra-comfortable king-size bed and and an amazing bathroom with a "rainshower". The room had a large closet, desk, and a frig, as well as a 37" LG flat-screen TV. The room was not large, but very comfortable. There is no other seating other than the bed or desk, so this would not be an ideal room for having friends up for drinks. The hotel is gorgeous, the lobby area is amazing with a huge bar and lots of seating areas, everything is open to the outside. The terraced pool area is beautiful with lots of seating and pool-side service. The beach is lovely but not terribly large and the surf was very rough (ideal for surfing). There is a third pool out by the beach. There is a lot of construction going on in the area because the Condado is sort of an up and coming area of San Juan (if it wasn't, Gucci, Vuitton, and Dior would not be here!) We did not have any noise issues but we didn't keep the windows open. This is a fantastic hotel, but if you're looking for something more like a traditional Sheraton or Marriott, this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Winter get away to La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Albiani
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4-nights at La Concha Resort and I would highly recommend this location and plan to return again. The hotel is very nice and in a convenient location if you want to visit old San Juan or if you want to try some of the local restaurants. The bar at the hotel has the best night life in the neighborhood and as such I would recommend staying on one of the higher levels so the music from the DJ on Fridays and Saturdays do not disturb you if you are not a night owl. The grounds are wonderful, the beach convenient, and the staff is both friendly and helpful. I would definitely suggest asking the concierge for breakfast and dinner recommendations because we had wonderful meals while there. We had a room overlooking the ocean. We thought the rooms were spacious and clean and the view was beautiful. I took a nap every day listening to the crash of the waves below. The only negatives I can think of are the loud music on weekends, the fact they do not have a spa on site (if you are looking for some pampering) and there is a fair amount of construction in the area. None of this dampened our trip and we will certainly re-book for next year.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha - A Truly Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfanforever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at La Concha from January 22 through January 28, 2009 and loved every minute of it! The staff at the hotel from the valets to the front desk staff, concierge and pool/beach attendants were all wonderful and really made us feel that they cared about our stay and were willing to do whatever was necessary to make us happy. The hotel recently added a small casino for those into that sort of thing and the lobby bar is done up in a real modern decor. The lobby flows into the pool area with open glass walls and the two connected infinity pools are spectacular with service available from the poolside tapas bar Solera. There is another smaller infinity pool right on the beach to use to cool down from laying in the sun. Our room was an oceanfront king and I do mean oceanfront! What a view to wake up to and just enjoy whenever we were in the room! There are some reviews that it is noisy on weekends from the live music in the bar/pool area and we didn't find that to be a problem and if something like that bothers you find a B&B somewhere! The beach is clean with attendants available to provide lounge chairs for sunning or just relaxing in the shade of a palm tree. The surf was a bit rough during our stay but we could still wade in and feel the warm waters. We did spend a lot of time at the beach and especially at the pools and the hotel has several little areas around the pool with comfortable sofas and chairs for those who just want to enjoy the warm air. We ate at Perla, the upscale restaurant under the "shell" and while it was super expensive it was worth every penny! The food and service was A-1 and it was a truly memorable meal. We also ate at Solera, the poolside restaurant which was casual and al fresco and the food there was also very very good. There are several low to high priced restaurants within walking distance and we went to Ajili-Mojili and Ropa Viejas, again, two really great restaurants only a feww blocks away. There are several breakfast spots just down the block if you don't want to spend the $20 per person for the hotel breakfast buffet each day. We didn't have the buffet but people we talked to all said it was wonderful. For those who MUST have franchise food there is a Subway, a Wendy's and a Chili's nearby. We had a car so we were able to drive to the El Yunque rain forest on one day and into Old San Juan another day and the driving wasn't bad once one gets used to the fact that no one in Puerto Rico seems to use turn signals! Almost all signs are in spanish and english and if you have a good road map you shouldn't get lost driving (even though we did a couple times!). In conclusion both my wife and I loved La Concha and Puerto Rico and all the people at the hotel had obviously been trained to render Class A service. Marriott certainly did it right with this property. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CTRealGirl
Reviews.Content: I spent a great week at La Concha with a couple of friends. We liked the fact that this hotel is smaller than the Marriott Stellaris. It wasn't as noisy and crowded and gave us a chance to get to know the staff and them to know you and all your likes and dislikes. We thought the hotel was retro chic and inviting whether sitting at the bar or lounging on one of the sofas outside the lobby. Our room was large enough for the 3 of us and all our suitcases. We were bummed that there wasn't much of a balcony, but our room overlooked the beach which was beautiful. The bathroom is small, but has a great shower. The staff was incredibly accomodating! They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, including the hotel manager, Alfredo who was clearly busy but always willing to take the time to address any of our requests. The pool was clean, attractive and had enough lounges for everyone. The beach is also beautiful and clean. The highrises do block the sun at a certain stretch of beach during the afternoon, but there is still plenty of beach with sun. Waves can get big and rough. We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel, both very good. Prices are what you would expect on an island. There are also good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The fitness center is large, has good equipment and is never very crowded. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would definitely come back to La Concha!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Skivt89
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had stayed at the Renaissance, La Concha resort for two nights (Jan 25th & Jan 26th). We had an excellent time and thought the hotel/resort was 1st class. From the minute we pulled up to the hotel in our taxi we were greated by the doormen. I had read some reviews that people were not able to get into their rooms till later than the hotel promised, but we did not find that all all. We arrived at the hotel around 3pm and had requested an early check in and that was not a problem, We had an excellent member of the front desk staff ( a shorter woman with long black curly hair that was so friendly and helpful to us) that was working on Sunday Jan 25th in the afternoon & also on our check on Tues am at 11am Jan 27th). She took great care of us putting us in room 817 (that has a great ocean view). The pool and hot tubs along with the location right on the beach really made this a special stay for us. I loved the waves and the warm ocean water. The Condado area is awesome, with tons of food / bar options along with high end shops along Ashford Avenue. We would def go back to the La Concha again as it was a 1st class resort with an excellent staff that was very helpful for anything that we needed. Thanks for an excellent stay for our first time in Puerto Rico (Mark & Katie from Boston)

Reviews.Title: “Not really CLEAN..”
Reviews.Author: AnonOP
Reviews.Content: I must admit; the hotel itself is quite lovely, and the Lobby is beautiful..but the condition of the rooms ruined the whole experience. I checked in around 4:30 pm, and when I got there, I saw that the floors had footprints all over, some parts of the room had unknown hairs (this is repulsive!). The nightstand was completely filthy! It had old cup stains and apparently some type of grease smeared all over it. Ugh. The carpet was completely disgusting. It had stains all over, and in some parts you could actually tell that it was a 'high traffic' area, since it was uneven. I hesitated walking barefoot! The beds were ok, the linens were crisp and clean, although some had a few black stains when they made service. The bathrooms were clean, although the tile grouting apparently had old soap scum and instead of WHITE, it was GREY, which is quite disturbing for me and my wife. The view would have been nice, if it wasn't for the terribly opaque glass sliding door.. it was encrusted with sea salt, making it very 'foggy' and hard to see outside. The air conditioning was a hit or miss, really. Sometimes it was cold, sometimes it was terribly warm. The pool was alright, although very small for such a 'modern' hotel. The food was pricey, as always, so me and my wife ate out around in Old San Juan. It's a very lovely place! Overall, the hotel isn't really a bang-for-your-buck, but if you like lovely shore views, and trendy stores surrounding you, it would be considerable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha - Fantastic Time & Gay Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Joshblaylock
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I along with 3 friends recently decided to visit Puerto Rico for the first time. We had previously decided to stay at the Condado Hotel but was told to stay at La Concha. BOY were glad to make that decision! Our room at the Condado was 229 so we decided to call La Concha to see if they would match the price and guess what....THEY DID! They gave us a deluxe ocean view room for only $220 per night. The usual price is almost $300 per night. When we first arrived, we were instantly greeted by the valet who took our bags and directed us to the front desk. We arrived around noon so our rooms werent available till 4pm which was fine. They called us on our cell as soon as the room was available. As you can see in the pictures the rooms are gorgeous. My boyfriend and I were staying in a king deluxe ocean view and my three friends were staying in a 2 queen bedroom. The room is filled with lots of light and what a view!! Extremely clean. The bed was super comfy. The small living area was a nice a touch and allowed us to entertain our friends before we went out at night. The flat screen was a nice touch as well. I have a big pet peeve with hotel bathrooms. They never feel very clean but the bathroom was really clean, open and spacious. There is a walk-in shower with no curtain or door so if you're shy about showering in front of the person your with then you should definitely leave enough time to get ready. The shower had a rainfall shower head which felt great. The hotel has a mixture of couples young and old, single men and women and gay people. I was very surprised and happy to see many gay couples.
