My boyfriend and I never felt uncomfortable and the staff was always very attentive. My boyfriend and I went to the forts and the concierge was extremely helpful in telling us when the guides were available and what times we should go as well as the prices. She also made dinner reservations for us at Dragonfly. The beach was great and the beach attendant was always ready to help us get chairs for the beach and towels. Ice water was always available if you needed a quick refreshment. There was also a lounging section on the beach if you wanted to take a quick nap in the shade. I love gambling and the casino if first rate. I play $5 dollar black jack and loved every minute of it. The dealers were very helpful. The best thing is mon-thursday they give $5 vouchers in the morning. I had the $20 breakfast buffet at the restaurant there Level 25 and it was wonderful. All in all, I was so impressed with this hotel. If you are gay, DONT stay at the Atlantic or any other hotel. Spend the extra money and come to La Concha. Gay or straight , this resort is worth every penney and so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately revisit”
Reviews.Author: amistaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha from Wednesday January 14th until Friday the 16th. I thought that the checkin was slow but then i later realized that it's just my NY fast paced attitude that expects everything to be done with the quickness. Checkin was nice and easy, the front desk person was very nice. We were in room 317. As soon as we walked into this room we were in awe. I've been to my share of hotels and although most hotels have upgraded their lobbys to look modern chic - most hotel rooms are still classic hotel style. Not this hotel room though. It was very modern and very chic. I seriously think that this room was a hooked up room. I've seen pictures on this site for regular rooms and they do not compare to the room we had. It had a very open layout and the bathroom was pretty cool but you have to get used to it. You definately have to be very comfortable with the person you are sharing this room with because you can literally watch them and hear them do # 2 from the bed. LOL. But we thought it was really cool the way the bathroom was set up. We were quite impressed. The balcony was HUGE - you could see the pool from the left side and the beach on the right side but the view from the front of the balcony was completely obstructed by the Pearl Restaurant. We didn't reserve a room with ocean view so we couldn't complain about the view obstruction because we got lucky to even get a view of the ocean from the right side of the balcony. All in all - the room was pretty awesome. I will definately request to stay in this room when i go back or a similar room with complete ocean view. The lobby was so pretty and the bar looked fun but we were there on a Wed and Thurs night only so it wasn't too crazy - even though I wouldn't have minded. We're in our late 20's so we love loud music and we love staying out late. On Wednesday night we went to dinner at Ajili Mojili which was like a 7 minute walk from La Concha and then we walked around the beach and Ashford Avenue. We ended up at the pool hall next to Walgreens. That was fun. On Thursday we had lunch at Mike and Charley's and then hung out at the pool the rest of the day. Awesome pool let me tell you. Pool service was good - we had two pina coladas and the waitress was really nice. That night we took a cab to Old San Juan and ate at Raices Restaurant. Great Great Food!!!! The bad things about this hotel were that Internet reception from our room was terrible. Could not get a stable wireless connection for more than 2 minutes. Concierge and the front desk were very very slow to call me back for any requests and the elevators were also really slow. We had a couple of problems with our room: there was no safe initially - we had to get one installed - so we had to go out to dinner the first night with our valuables because they couldn't get one for us right away. The balcony door didn't lock - we gave the front desk notice about this the night we got there and they didn't do anything about it until the next morning when i complained again. Also the room had two phones and both of them didn't work on Thursday morning so i had to go downstairs to ask for anything i needed. The problem with that is that the elevators were sooooo slow. I hope the hotel takes these couple of complaints and finds a way to improve the hotel because it really is a nice hotel. By the way - we took a quick tour of the marriot hotel down a couple blocks and the great difference i noticed between the two is that the Marriott had a lot of screaming kids. La Concha was much more quieter and calmer in the day time - which is great for those trying to get over a hangover. LOL!

Reviews.Title: “We want to come back...but”
Reviews.Author: karenklay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at LaConcha on our honeymoon 44 years ago and so, we were excited at the reopening of the property. The hotel physically is beautiful, service is courteous and very helpful. The noise is a very serious issue. The hotel comes across as smart and chic. There is no reason for the disco sound of music until 2:00 A.M. There were many guests sharing this feeling. Hope it can be worked on and if it is, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Some Great, Some Not So Great”
Reviews.Author: southmscop
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for my brothers wedding in Old San Juan on Jan. 11, 2009. Some good news, as well as bad news, on the hotel. First, the hotel is in a great location, beachfront and is very clean for the mostpart. The rooms are also clean with VERY comfortable beds/lines/pillows. At the corporate rate of $209.00, it was worth the money. Now the bad----we arrived at 3:30 but could not check in until 5:30 in the afternoon! Incidentials are EXPENSIVE!!!! Burger and fries are 15.00+, 10 oz. draft beer is $6.50 plus tip and bottle water is $3.00 to $5.00. My neice order room service purchasing a burger, fries and coke and it was $38.00. It was very clear that the hotel would like you to spend hundreds of dollars daily on incidentials. My brother bought beer off site because of the hotel price on beer and was told within 60 seconds at the pool that he could not bring outside beer onto pool grounds! Because of the high hotel prices on food/drink, it was a constant battle to find meals for my family at a reasonable price. I would not go back nor recommend this hotel just for that reason alone. I am far from a cheap guy but $91.00 for (2) burgers and fries and (2) kid's chicken tenders and fries is ridiculous. I wont go back until they change their pricing structure for incidentials----Lastly, the buildings are really close together for a resort area. Be prepared to see many buildings towering around you as well as some construction noise. With some restructuring, this hotel could be a great place to stay, just not now.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Come BAck”
Reviews.Author: sulsal
Reviews.Content: We spend last Tuesday-Thursday chilling at La Concha. It was great. We avoided noise because it wasn't a week-end and we asked for the highest floor available -- spectacular vews from the 10th floor, The staff was very good -- even okaying a late checkout so we could have one more day at the beach, delivering an extra bathrobe immediately, etc. As for the security, I am a middle aged obviously white woman and I was always stopped. This is de rigeur in an area where crime occasionally happens. As for the newspaper, etc, there is a Wahlgreen with everything from the Wall Street Journel to the Financial Times available a block away, as well as cheap places to eat within minutes. We had a very good time, The fact that I wear a Tripadvisor baseball cap when I was at the pool or beach didn't hurt I would guess. Still, a very nice place to escape to from the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha”
Reviews.Author: yayoye
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I stayed in an ocean front room from Jan 2 -5 2008. Arrived about 4 pm in the afternoon and waited a couple of minutes to check in. Used valet parking and bell service - both handled by the same person who was friendly and helpful. Room was very nice with a great view of the ocean and beach. Appreciated: Wireless internet, no charge for toll free number calls, no charge for local calls, in room fridge and tea and coffee. Room decor was lovely. Service from staff was good - front desk was ok, concierge was very helpful, valet staff also very helpful and prompt. Beach service was fine. There is a staff member to get you a lounger and also set it up where you want on the beach. Had service on the beach for drinks and food. Service was prompt and friendly. Had drinks at the bar - service was very prompt and the mojito was made from scratch without a mix which made it very good and fresh. Casino has recently been opened and the dealers were friendly even at the $5 table. Comment on other tripadvisor comments: You can hear the music from the lobby/pool area in your room. It was not loud enough to keep me from sleeping. However, I think it would be disruptive if you have a poolside room. Maid service did not start until noon or so. We always got clean towels, freshly made beds and replacement glasses, tea, coffee and other amenities. Concierge told me that 11:30 in the morning is still considered pretty early in Puerto Rico, something I think was confirmed by the fact that breakfast in the area restaurants is served until 3 pm every day. The shower is half open all the time, but we did not have a problem with flooding. You do need to make sure the shower is not pointed towards the open door however. I was made aware of the resort fee in advance so was not surprised by it. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty place”
Reviews.Author: abbysgrandma
Reviews.Content: Requested early check-in and was given a poolside cabana room by noon. Avoid these rooms if you're looking for quiet time, maybe the De La Hoya fight and the VIP party made for a very, very long poolside noisy night. Customer service is somewhat mixed, a few pleasant reps others not as caring. Only issue was security asking (stopped at least 6 times) if I was a guest at the hotel. I found this questioning a bit insulting, maybe because I'm latina? I got over it. The hotel is very pretty, as were the various pools and relaxing areas. The resort attendants were very friendly. Unfortunately the beach was rough that day -- there were some brave souls out there. Heard from others the ocean view from those rooms is spectacular. All things relative it was a nice hotel/stay.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha- Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steviek49
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 just returned last night from an 8 night family holiday/new years vacation. We stayed at the new Marriott/Renaissance resort La Concha. In short, we had a great time! The weather was OK. The first 4 of 5 days it was partly sunny/cloudy but each day (but one) it rained for a short time and then stopped. It became annoying and led to us cancelling our snorkelling adventure due to the chance of rain and it was also quite windy the first few days. The last 4 days the weather was beautiful-sunny and about 80 degrees far. We did go Kayacking at night (glow), went to a winter league baseball game,and Old San Juan. Now, about La Concha, We booked a Poolview and an Ocean Front and the front desk (Linda) put us in 2 Oceanfront rooms. The rooms were beatiful with full Oceanfront view and sliding glass door that led to a walk-out- no full balcony. Rain shower in bathroom and interesting half glass shower door-but no flooding. The lobby was swank, modern and attractive. The outdoor pool area was bi-level and although we wish the pools were larger they were big enough to cool off. There was another small infinity edged pool in the back overlooking the beach but it was always in the shade.-Great place to read as was the beds to the left of the pool. The staff was very friendly! The business center had 4 computers and was always available free of charge (included in the resort fee). Pool staff was great- towels always available as was ice water. New casino in the lobby was very nice. Last night of our stay was New Years eve and they had a BIG Party that was only open to hotel guests and guests that were invited by La Concha. There were alot of people at this party and it was quite festive, active and loud. They built a stage for live band on the top pool deck (had limited use last 2 days) and we were told that J.Lo and marc Anthony attended- But we didn't see them. I love loud music but this was LOUD!!!!!! Band played till the middle of the night and we could not get away from it. But it was New Years after all. So with all of this great stuff why only 4 Stars? Well, as mentioned here many times -housekeeping was very slow. After a few days of room not being made up by mid afternoon we got into the routine of calling each day to have room made up. This is not acceptable! Also room was really tidied up rather than deep cleaned. Glasses weren't cleaned or replaced. Sometimes they showed up for a turn-down- sometimes not. The hotel has had over a year to correct this problem but I've had better housekeeping at Holiday Inns and other 3 star properties. Pool bar/Grill also VERY SLOW. Order a Hamburger- wait almost an hour till I get a CHEESEburger. Sent it back- only to see the same burger returned to me (10 minutes later) with the cheese scraped off and cold fries. Also NOT acceptable for a high rated resort especially if the hamburger costs $15. Tried ordering the 2nd day- similar wait time- and the pool grill was not that busy. No Concierge/Executive level- so no Marriott continental breakfast/ appetizers/ wine/desserts etc. As a matter of fact no gift shop at this resort to even buy a newspaper. So- Do I recommend la Concha? Absolutely! We had a Great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RayPays
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. The beach is incredible. The rooms are sumptuous. But one caution: If you have a room overlooking the pool area, it turns into a disco bar at about midnight on Friday and Saturday nights and unless you are someone who can sleep through anything you will get very little of it till dawn.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't quite make it”
Reviews.Author: texhills
Reviews.Content: This one of the strangest hotels weâ€™ve stayed in. Parts of it are terrific, like the modern lobby and our spacious, well-furnished sea-view room. Other parts werenâ€™t so great, like the beach area and beachside pool shaded by the hotel, the slow elevator service and the dirty open hallways to the rooms. Some parts donâ€™t even exist: a newsstand-gift shop and a cafe. I found it impossible to get a morning newspaper as the front desk didnâ€™t have any to give to guests. Continental breakfast (expensive and not included in the room rate) is served makeshift-fashion from the bar in the middle of the lobby. We arrived in the morning after a cruise. Reception checked us into a room that hadnâ€™t been cleaned, so after a delay we were sent to another one which was fine. After settling in, we went to Old San Juan, walked around and had lunch at the Parrot Club, which is fun. We returned to the hotel in the afternoon and hit the beach, only part of which was sunny because of the design of the hotel. The tall structure blocks the sun in the winter months, an unorthodox way to design a Caribbean resort hotel. One area of beach further out was sunny, however, so we got towels and long chairs and enjoyed ourselves. The architecture is unremarkable except for the ugly seashell-shaped restaurant on the ocean side of the hotel. This is perched atop a flat rectangular structure that looks to be a ballroom. A walk along the beach finds several abandoned and dilapidated buildings between La Concha and its sister property the Marriott. We walked around the Marriott and much preferred it. Weâ€™ll most likely stay there next time if we want to be on the beach. We had dinner directly across the road at a recommended restaurant that specializes in Puerto Rican food. Canâ€™t remember the full name, but part of it is Angel. It was good and inexpensive. We ate and drank all we wanted for $60 including tip. All in all, I rate La Concha as a 4-star wannabe. It doesnâ€™t quite make the grade.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chaserboi1
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotal was really nice. I like the more modern architecture, so this hotel fit the bill. The staff were very friendly and the room was very clean and comfortable. Only downside was the food a lil exspensive for my taste but it was good. The price is what you get for staying at a resort. haha It also had beautiful views, as i stayed on the 12th floor. highly recommended for honeymooners and people who enjoy the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “December trip”
Reviews.Author: jacksmomtravels
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing it online. It stated it had recently been remodeled. The pool area was very good, but the pools were cold. Food at the Solera was very good, we ate lunch there daily. Excellent restaurants within walking distance of this hotel. Noise was a problem on the weekend in the evening. Rooms smelled musty daily, and bathrooms were small. Maid service was inconsistent.

Reviews.Title: “Great until the noise started”
Reviews.Author: PatinNYC
Reviews.Content: La Concha is a lovely recently renovated resort on a nice beach in an upscale shopping area of San Juan. The room had big glass doors opening on a stunning view of the Atlantic and was equipped with flat screen TV and i-home to play ipods and nanos. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. May husband and I arrived on Wednesday and had two days of bliss before the EXTRA LOUD disco music began on Friday evening, first in the courtyard and later in the lobby until 2 a.m. There was no getting away from it. We left the hotel for a couple of hours. The strange part is that there was no one dancing or even showing any interest in listening when ever we passed through -- just a few people trying to have shouted conversations over their cocktails. The loud music was probably causing the hotel to lose business, not attract more.Then, with only a note slipped under our door overnight as notification, the hotel closed access the beach side pool for hotel guests all day on Saturday to prepare for a private event that evening. And there was more loud music,this time live, in the courtyard, the only refuge during the private party. This music could have been nice if the band has dialed down the amps but both band members and hotel staff seemed not to understand that idea. Our complaints and those of other guests -- I wasn't alone at the desk -- were meet by the staff with shrugs, polite smiles and occassional words of sympathy but no action. I wrote a letter to the manager that I left at the desk but got no ressponse, not even an apology. As much as I enjoyed the first two days, I would not risk spending my time and money there again. The experience could be bliss or torture and you will have no way of knowing which it will be. Pat in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel, only a few minor negatives”
Reviews.Author: AVD29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha for 2 nights after returning from a cruise. First impression of the hotel was "wow". We have stayed at various starwood and fairmont properties all over north america, but aesthetically this hotel is one of the most unique and beautiful places we've stayed. The lobby is just beautiful and the pool area is fabulous. We had no trouble finding a lounge or a beach bed. The beach itself is public, but it is very quiet and mostly had hotel guests on it. Very modern and clean fitness center. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and it was an average buffet , but excellent service and atmosphere. Our room had a beautiful ocean view, comfy king sized bed, and we loved the shower. Very modern interior and kept very clean, but there are places were you can tell that this is an old hotel that has been renovated. The staff was very accommodating, we ended up getting off the cruise ship much earlier than we expected and the front desk staff was able to get us into our room by 9:30am and we were out at the pool by 10:00am. My husband was dying to go boogie boarding, and the concierge was able to locate one that had been left in the hotel for him to borrow (the waves are perfect for boogie boarding or beginner surfing). Minor negatives: Even though the alarm wasn't activated, our t.v. would turn on blaring at 2:00am each morning, which kinda sucked. The price of food and drinks: everything is really, really pricey at this hotel. I realize that it is an upper-scale hotel, but $6 for a canned local beer is a bit much, considering you are in the Caribbean. On that note, there are a variety of restaurants within walking distance to the hotel, my advice is walk around and explore, because you'll have better luck eating off the property. We ate at Mike and Charlie's for pizza - great pizza, good value. It is just a block away from the hotel. We also ate at a restaurant just beside the hotel (between the hotel and the park on the ocean side). I can't remember what the name was, but the food was very good and not bad prices, outdoor seating only. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at La Concha. This is a great place for the late 20s, and 30s crowd. There is a lot of construction in the area, but this is balanced by the cute restaurants and upscale shopping. If you are looking for a relaxing, chill, trendy atmosphere you will not be disappointed with La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel! (expensive though)”
Reviews.Author: maryann617
Reviews.Content: I went to La Concha for a bachelorette party, hence it was not my first choice. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The location of the hotel is great, if you want to be in the middle of the most expensive part of San Juan, called Condado. There are tons of restaurants and shops around, but be prepared to pay. Also, having the beach at your footsteps is wonderful. The hotel is packed with HOT people (for the most part). It attracts a younger, hipper, under 40 crowd, which was great for us, but I wouldn't recommend taking a family there. AWESOME was the fact people came to the hotel to party on Friday and Saturday nights. The downstairs bar area turned into a club and attracted some of the best-dressed, good-looking people. The aesthetics of the hotel are superb. It is GORGEOUS. Reminiscent of the 'W' in style. Very modern, yet comfortable furnishings. Several pools, hot-tubs, and palm-trees abound. For me, the downside was the expense and the customer service. It took 6 hours for them to locate a mini-fridge for our room (it was missing and important for a bachelorette party). Overall, I'd say service was "slow" as opposed to just "bad." And the expense, don't even get me started! You will pay. Overall it was nice, the kind of place I'd go for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “First class service at La Concha!!!”
Reviews.Author: GonzalezPueroRico
Reviews.Content: Date: Novembre 22-24 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Puerto Rico Staying for a weekend at La Concha hotel was the best experience in a long time after visiting diferents hotels at diferents destiantion. Right from the moment of arrival the service was first class! The employees how attended me and the needs of my mother where excelents. Handling every request at it's best. I was attended by Frankie aponte, who delivered an outstanding orientation service about how to enjoy the hotel at its best, he actually took me around the hotel facilities and he made sure that we had every single detail cover. He took me to see the facilities of PERLAS Restaurant that looks like a fancy high class English Ballroom, wich I recomend for that romantic dinner or just for the best treat of the family. The Bedroom was a millionare luxury ocean front property with a great atmotfere. I called room service for coffe and within 5 five minutes they where knocking at my door with it. I shared great memories with others visitors and tourist staying at the hotel too wich made my time even better. On last day I spoke with Hotel staff Mr. Casannova who also gave us that warm feeling of what great service is all about and made sure that we had a memorable time. If You want to feel like a millionare for a couple days in your vacation in PR, I highly recomend this great , luxury and affordable hotel in wich you will be getting pampered and be treat as part of a Royal Family. I will actually stay there again for my wedding night before departing for a carribbean cruise. Thank's. Gonzalez, Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! Horrible customer service, LOUD MUSIC TILL 6AM”
Reviews.Author: mushymile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice in appearance. I am not going to go into detail regarding this as many others have done so already. NOW TO THE CRUX OF MY REVIEW: Let me preface by saying my fiance and I are in our late 20's, we live in manhattan, we are used to noises, we go out dancing late, we have traveled all over the world. This is not our first time off the block so to speak, we are not octogenarian prudes. I am not one to write many reviews, let alone a negative review. However, if you would actually like to sleep at some point in the night,and i mean sometime after 1am or 2 or 3 or 4am, forget it. There is a club called Budathai directly across the street. This club will blast music all night and because of the position of ALL the rooms in La Concha, you hear it. And I don't mean just a little bit, you hear it as if it is being played all the way up in your ear. You hear it as if it is coming directly from your brain. You hear it as if it is some kind of torture device, which for me and my fiance it was. Also please note, this was a WEDNESDAY NIGHT! I can only cringe to thing what a thur/fri/ or sat night would have been like. To make matters worse the hotel staff did not care, they were incredibly rude, telling us that it was not on their property and that they could not do anything about it. They refused to even admit that it was at all inappropriate for the club to be blasting music at 4am that was so loud, everyone in a 2 mile radius in Condado beach could hear the terrible music. We were forced to call the police three times with no results as they said the hotel needs to make a formal complaint, which they refused to do. The night manager at the La Concha, an extremely rude Mr. Orlando Hernandez, shrugged his shoulders and said " not my problem, nothing i can do." Not even a hint of apology. WE WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN AND WILL DISSUADE EVERYONE WE KNOW FROM STAYING HERE.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha lived up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: dmbRJR
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back from a week-long stay at La Concha. Being a loyal Marriott rewards member, we had two options for hotel stays in San Juan: La Concha and the San Juan Marriot Resort. We chose La Concha based on the feedback from this site and also because it appeared to be trendy, hip, and fun. The hotel is amazing. It was recently renovated and would remind you of a hotel out of Miami. It has two/three pools, two hot tubs, is right against the ocean, and has a hip lobby bar that is packed on Friday and Saturday nights. All the rooms are new and upgraded and face the ocean. The staff is very nice and courteous and the hotel just opened their new casino the week we were there. The food and drinks are great as well. We ate one of our best lunches from the poolside bar and also ate dinner at Perla which is a fancy restaurant inside "La Concha" - the actual shell on the back side of the hotel. As for location, the hotel is in an up-and-coming part of town with bars, restaurants, and stores within walking distance including American favorites like Camilles, Dunkin Donuts, Hagen Das, Louis Vouitan, Cartier, and Wendy's. The hotel is also a block down from the Marriott and we stoped by that hotel as well. If you are choosing between the two, the Marriott is exactly what you would expect from the Marriott line. Nothing fancy but nice and clean. La Concha is classy, hip, fun, and trendy and more suited for couples and adults. Only thing bad about the hotel is that it is a cab ride from Old San Juan and you have to drive to El Yunque (the rainforest), Plaza de Americas (the mall), Luquillo beach, etc. Other than that the place is excellent and you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Vacations”
Reviews.Author: sweett27
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved La Concha. The friendly staff and the very modern and contemporary style made this trip wonderful. There is so much to do in San Juan, that we didn't even get to see to entire hotel property. Booking online with Priceline made the vacation very affordable, and we got a great Ocean View room. The bathoom was really sexy...but you have to get used to the 'girls gone wild' shower with no sliding door. It just has one glass panel. The only complaints I had is the fact that we did end up paying a resort fee that of course is not mentioned upon check in. And parking in the city of San Juan is very limited. So if you drive, just know that it's $15/day for parking. I would strongly recommend this hotel to others!!! Oh and thank you so much to the activites coordinator for hooking us up with the San Juan snorkle and picnic package. It was cheaper booking through the hotel than it is when you search online, and it's worth every penny! My boyfriend and I love La Concha. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Beach Front Hotel with greatful Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: KingMarcus
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1 night stay to use the facilities, while in town on our cruise. Check-in, beach front room and service have been amazing! The Lunch at the Hotel was the best I had in a long time, the service by the pool was so personable and fantastic that we decided to come back here for a long weekend! The resort itself is stunning, lounge and house music piped n throughout the resort and the whole inviroment reminded me at the Delano Hotel in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ambiance”
Reviews.Author: DollherBill
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cool and sleek place to stay look no further. The lobby and rooms are outstanding and the level of cleanliness in high. The pool area is fantastic with sun and shaded areas. Best of all they have a business center that offer free internet access (you might be getting away but you still need emails!). A few of their tasty Mojitos, their funky chips and salsa and a good book by the pool make for a great afternoon. I suggest ordering your second Mojito when they bring you your first as the service is probably the only let down at this resort. The area is safe, just ignore the odd street bum, and there are plenty of dining options within walking distance. Try the trattoria next door - good light fare. Another good option is Yerba Buena - if just want "American" there is a Chilis about 10 minutes walk. The beach is cleaned every morning and is safe during the day. At times there is a wicked shore break so be careful and don't turn your back on the ocean - however if you like playing in the surf you will have a ball. The Marriott is five minutes walk where they have a Casino ad across the street from there is a Starbucks. Contrary to other reviews I didn't experience such loud music - the lobby bar had a DJ and in the pool area at night they had a band. Seems like a good thing to me.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysons27705
Reviews.Content: We've stayed and Normandy and Hilton Caribe, and they were OK, but La Concha is breath-taking. Five wonderful nights. Glass wall to the ocean leaves you feeling like you are being rocked to sleep. Food wonderful - yes, hotel food was actiually wonderful. Cuban sandwich and steak/plantain wrap by pool yummy. Decor so hip. Lobby is elegant, open, and inviting. It spills out into broad lounges under palms for cocktails, and then further out to pools, canopied sun-beds, and sofa-lined breezeways with constant silky breezes that reminded us of Hawaii. Surf is rough, and watching surfers good entertainment. Work-out room is large and well-equipped, with separate room for spin class. No spa, but maybe one is planned? The _16, _17, _18,_19 room numbers are tiny, but still have view. The fabulous manager, Alfredo, moved us right out of 1118 and into 512. He is charming and you can tell why the place is so clean and elegant - he stopped to pick up a speck from the carpet while talking with us. Real Puerto Rican coffee and quesitos in the lobby in mornings. And it din't hurt that we ran into George Clooney and Kevin Spacey, who are staying there while making "Men Who Stare at Goats."

Reviews.Title: “Love La Concha”
Reviews.Author: chicago1959
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself went there for dinner (which was my b-day) the reason why we were there at the beginning. The dinner was fantastic and the people were wonderful. We love the decor and decided to stay for the rest of our vacation. I am coming back next year and this is the only place I will stay. The location is great - walking distance to everywhere you want to go. The rooms were clean, the staff helpful - I did not want to leave. Marcia J October 2008

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elirod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, has a great location The bell staff was awesome! We left our car at Valet and they had it ready for us everytime The staff overall was great Food was good The beach is not the best but works The pool is great The room was very comfortable and had great views The fitness center is very modern and has great views Note: Fridays & Sat the hotel lobby is packed with locals and they have music, it could annoy some people...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: travelerD_GJ
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the modern style of the hotel. The pool area was beautiful and the beach was perfect. The rooms where spacey and comfortable with a view that is unforgettable. The bar and lobby area was fashionably decorated. Although the staff was friendly, the service could have been better. Our overall stay was amazing and I would highly recommend this hotel for young singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Atlantafunsize
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is outstanding! Me and my girlfriends stayed there for a long weekend and had a blast. The hotel lobby/bar is a fun place to get a glimpse of the local scene - very vibrant on Friday and Saturday nights. Frankie and Louise were amazing and always there to help out. The last night we stayed it was raining and we wanted to go to a nice dinner. Frankie went outside and negotiated a rate with the taxi - which was above and beyond his role. Louise had a welcoming demeanor and always greeted us with a smile. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ErinPB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Juan Puerto Rico for our 10 year anniversary and stayed in the La Concha Hotel. The hotel is fairly new, I think it opened the previous December. It was very modern. My husband and I joked that it was like walking into an IKEA showroom. We were placed near the new construction, and we could hear the banging in the morning, but it was not so loud that we could not hear ourselves. We left the window open the first couple of nights to listen to the waves as we fell asleep, but then would awaken in the middle of the night to use the restroom and find the tile floors slick with condensation. So we kept the windows closed at night - there is not sound with the windows closed.:-( The overall stay at the hotel was nice. I was a little disappointed in the quality of craftsmanship, there were paint splatters in the bathroom and places where the tile was not aligned well. I don't mean to be over-critical, but when you go to a five star hotel in the States, your expectation is perfection. Beware of the drivers when you rent your car. The posted speed limit might say 55, but no one is going over 50. There are no lane lines on most of the highways, but we did find near the end of our stay a toll highway where there were lines and it was clean and people mostly drove the speed limit. There are many American restaurants near the hotel, as well as some very good local eateries. If you are looking for a really nice place to celebrate a special occasion, the restaurant inside of the shell is ultra fancy (with ultra fancy prices, too!). My husband and I enjoyed a very nice meal and the wait staff were very attentive. Very nice exercise room, which was deserted all but one of the days that I was in there. Nice pools and spas. There was a lot of construction in the area when we were there. My husband and I counted at least a dozen cranes across the skyline in just the Condado neighborhood alone. We went on an all day sailing excursion with Erin Go Bragh. There were only 6 passengers, plus the captain and his wife and activities that they had planned were very enjoyable. I had the displeasure of becoming sea sick on this trip, and Ingrid (captain's wife) was very attentive and had every natural remedy available for my use if I wanted it. We also went on a jet ski tour of the Old San Juan area. We were the only party to show up on the stormy Monday, so we had a very private tour. It was a lot of fun, but the water was choppy outside of the bay, which made it a little scary (my husband would call it "more fun"). The tour guide was a little over the top with having us pose for pictures (which he then attempted to sell to us at the end of the tour) and having us act like pirates from centuries ago storming the fort, but it just added to the fun. The fort and castille are not to be missed, and walking around Old San Juan was fun. We even went to eat in one of the restuarants Rachel Ray has done for her $40 a day show. It was called Bombonera, retro Woolworth's cafeteria place that looks a little scary and has gross bathrooms, but there are only locals eating insides, which always says something about the good food. We did go to Bacardi, the tour was informationaly, but the store was very lacking. We did each get two drinks (swallows) for free. A very enjoyable trip, it was nice for grownups, but I would probably wait until my children are in their teens before considering taking them to San Juan Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience, exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: OrrScores
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed this hotel. Sleek lobby with nice lobby bar, multiple video screens, etc. Rooms were decent, very "south beach" like. Wireless access everywhere. Nice beach. Good service. Courteous staff. Convenient location near restaurants, high end shopping. Concierge was excellent. Very prompt. The only criticism (and not the fault of the hotel) is a huge amount of construction in the area. They are putting lots of money into the area and it shows, but trucks, half completed buildings, drilling noise, etc. detracted a little. No big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Wilde_7
Reviews.Content: Our fantastic experience at La Concha started at check-in when all three of us received a complimentary glass of champagne. My two girl friends and I stayed at La Concha for just two nights of our total 4-night stay in Puerto Rico. I think we got a pretty good deal on our beach front room because of the fact that we traveled during Puerto Rico's "low" season, stayed there during the middle of the week, and because La Concha is currently in the process of building a second tower. The hotel entryway and lobby is amazing. Awesome modern decor with little flairs everywhere you look. There is flowing water everywhere and its lit up at night to give an extra effect. To the left of the lobby is the first outdoor seating area and the main pool. There is tons of outdoor seating - while it was totally empty while we were there, I could imagine it being full of people during a more busy time. The main pool has two layers with a waterfall between the two. At night the main pool is also lit up and looks gorgeous. My one and only complaint about this hotel is that they close the pools at 7:00pm. What a shame, it would've been great to go swimming when it was all lit up! Continue on to your right and toward the beach and you'll come to another outdoor seating area and La Concha's infiniti pool. This outdoor seating area is just awesome as it features beds and couches that you can lay on and just enjoy the ocean views. The infiniti pool also faces the ocean (see my pics!). La Concha even leaves out a pitcher of water and some cups in case you get parched while you are basking in the sun. The beach is also fabulous. Lounge chairs and umbrellas are complimentary... you just have to ask and then tip the attendant (but the nice part is that they'll haul all this to the beach for you and set it up perfectly). I have never seen such crystal clear water in my life and the waves are just big enough that they are fun, but manageable. All this and I haven't even described our room yet! The modern decor continues into the room. Our room was ocean front. It had a huge sliding glass door, but there wasn't any real balcony. Just about a 6" ledge and a railing. Only the very top floor rooms have balconies from what we could see. The room was clean and comfortable. There is an in-room safe which is a nice feature for a beach resort. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but the walk-in shower was really cool. We ate dinner one night at 'La Perla's' restaurant on-site. The food was excellent, but I must say that it was rather pricey (about $70 pp). Most of it was fair for the quality, but I thought that their wine list was a little out of hand (nothing less than $60 a bottle). Unfortunately the Asian Grille was not open when we were there. FYI, the touristy area of Old San Juan is a little ways from La Concha. We took a taxi to San Felipe del Morro fortress and I wan to say that it cost about $15. Overall, we loved staying at La Concha and would return there in a heartbeat if we could get such a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic stay at the LaConcha Renaissance Resort in PR”
Reviews.Author: bgjconnection
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for a long weekend. Upon entering we were greeted with staff who were very helpful. From the bell captain, who went out of his way to provide assistance, to front desk staff, everyone was helpful. We were given a room with a fantastic view of the ocean. To say we were delighted would be an understatement considering we did not know what we would find upon entering. The hotel staff is exceptional, location is ideal to walk and see the area and it is in close promixity to Old San Juan. I really enjoyed the toiletries, I know its a small thing but it does make a difference. We will certainly return and would be happy to get another great room. Oh, I am still at the hotel and didn't want to miss the opportunity to provide positive feedback regarding our experience. BGJ

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ksamuels22
Reviews.Content: I recently visited San Juan, Puerto Rico with my boyfriend from July 25-July 29, 2008 and stayed at La Concha Resort. I am one of the most pickiest individuals on the planet and it is extremely hard to impress me, but I must say that La Concha was definitely one of the best hotels that I have ever visited. First off, let me mention that I am 25 and from Miami. I am used to great beaches and beautiful hotels (The Mandarin Oriental, The Delano, The Tides) so it it takes a lot to impress me. Although I have never written a review, I felt obligated to get online and share with others, my wonderful experience. From the moment you pull up to the hotel, you will notice the hotel's trendy/modern appeal. From the front desk to the restaurants, to the fitness area, to the pools you will be overly satisfied with the overall level of luxury. From the second you open your room door, you cannot escape the ocean. The view is spectacular!!!!! We were blown away by the view and the fact that we could clearly hear the waves crashing from the 11th floor. The rooms are extremely modern and equipped with white plush linens, flat screen tv sets, ipod stations, dvd player, and stereo system. The bathroom is extremely clean (one of my requirements) and very modern. Although slightly pricey, the food was excellent at La Concha. The buffet breakfast is to die for. The pastry chef deserves 20 thumbs up as well!!! Employees are extremely professional and very friendly! Lastly, this hotel will suit people of all ages. Although this hotel is extremely luxurious and modern, it has a fresh, fun atmosphere that is very inviting. On the weekends, this is the place to be for the locals!!! It definitely has a south beach feel to it. I felt right at home. While you are in Puerto Rico, check out El Yunque Rainforest (take the trail to the big waterfall- i think the name was La Melia Falls), Bacardi, Culebra Island, Old San Juan (Try the Dragonfly Restaurant) and Plazas Las Americas (one of the largest malls that I have ever seen). By the way, make sure to rent a car bc that is the best way to get around- and believe me, you will save more money than by getting taxis to take you around. La Concha is in the perfect location bc it is minutes from everything. I will definitely be going back to Puerto Rico next year and the only place that I would even consider staying at is La Concha Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Marriott resort”
Reviews.Author: BFFMaryland
Reviews.Content: My family & I (4 of us) just got back from a short stay at the Concha Resort (Marriott) in Puerto Rico. We had taken a cruise out of San Juan & thought we'd spend a few more days in PR so that our children could see the forts, el Yunque, & experience the culture. Upon arriving, the resort was very stream-lined and modern. There were 2 pools (one facing the beach). They had laptops in the lobby/bar (so that you could use them & enjoy the contemporary decor) or you could go into the business center. They have multiple restaurants (including a tapas restaurant, & the Perla). The casino has yet to open. The front desk clerk (Rosemary) was beyond helpful & pleasant (as was the bellboy working with her that day). We were a little dissapointed in the room (with the exception of the awesome view of the beach & ocean). The resort is not even a year old and the walls/furniture were marked, scratched, & worn. Housekeeping didn't clean our room until (approx.) 5 p.m.. I even saw a silver fish (bug) in the shower. After taking a shower my family & I would walk barefoot around in the room (which was carpeted) & by the time we put our shoes on our feet were filthy! If given the chance I'm not sure if I'd stay there again. There are so many other resorts on the island & for the money people pay to stay at a resort, a clean room shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: fluxmoto
Reviews.Content: Perfect oasis by the beach. Infiniti pool on beach overlooked water perfectly. Every detail in lobby and multiple pool areas were unsurpassed. Staff was helpful and polite. The gym was more than inviting. Great experience everywhere. Rooms were visually exciting and stylish. (slight negatives: small balconies/can't sit outside; no bathtub). Overall, this was a Great Escape following a bad night of mosquito bites in the mountains. Family needed to escape back to city and chose La Concha because of the cool architecture. Couldn't have chosen a more perfect hotel. (Although $15 eggs benedict at breakfast should have come with potatoes or some type of side)Recommendations: pina colada by pool!! Will definately return! (PS-my two year old loved it). PERFECT FOR BACHELOR/ETTE PARTIES!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach”
Reviews.Author: ksdfairy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was chic in style and the staff was so friendly! Our room had a fantastic view of the beach and my favorite part of the day was waking up every morning opening the curtains, drinking my coffee and looking at the waves crash on the beautiful beach below. When I go back to Puerto Rico I would want to stay here again. The worst part of my trip would have to be the Barrachina restaurant in Old San Juan. The place that claims to have invented the Pina Colada. I'm not sure if this is true or not and I don't know if the food is any good. My party and I were ignored for about 20 minutes (not even a drink order was taken) and then as we got up to leave the staff decided to pay attention to us and one of the waiters tried to start a fight with someone in my party. Never go to that restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Concha!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SupaStarr
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed a 4 day, 3 night stay at La Concha. This property is gorgeous, mod, hip, romantic and conveniently-located. I occupied an oceanview room on the 11th floor and recommend the higher floors if you want to avoid the noise/music from the nightscene at the pool and bar/lounge areas. The rooms are spacious, clean and equipped with a large flat-screen tv and iPod dock. The bathroom has a unique setup with a half-glass door and two different showerheads. Although the bathroom is fairly small, they made good use of the space <if that makes any sense>. The art-deco lobby is very bright and has an open layout, filled with lounge seating and a few laptops sprinkled throughout. You can also use the Business Center which has 3 computers and a printer. Very handy!! Although you don't pay for the use of the computers, this cost is being absorbed through the daily resort fee you pay upon check-out. The entire property is not over-populated so you can really enjoy the beautiful pools and beach. There are lounge beds and cabanas strategically placed around the property which are great for privacy or for a romantic touch. The restaurants have tasty food and drinks, however the prices are a bit high in my opinion. There are a few nearby restaurants that serve local food and the prices are more reasonable and the quantities are large. You can get great sangria from these establishments also. Big Plus!! The lobby turns into a hip nightscene with DJ playing techno, house music. If you'd like to experience the sounds of a live band playing salsa and merengue, you can walk 3 blocks to the other Marriott property. There is a nice casino there as well. The staff is extremely friendly, knowledgeable and provided top-notch service. The concierge will assist you with car rentals, directions, restaurant reservations, etc. La Concha is the hottest hotel on the Condado. The nearby construction can be an eyesore, however, La Concha shines on its own--it's a true gem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy With La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Sweebs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Concha from July 13 thru July 17 and were very happy with the hotel. The staff was off-the-charts helpful, the lobby and pool areas were stunning and the pool waitresses could not have been more attentive. The room was lovely (ocean front) and very spacious with a large flat-screen TV and a helpful Ipod charger! One morning we slept in and received a call from housekeeping wondering if we required service. When I said "yes" they actually scheduled an appointment to clean the room at my convenience. Also, we never had an issue with security or safety and were frequently asked for our room key. The few downsides include the surrounding construction in Condado which is out of the hands of the hotel. The area is going thru a rebirth and will be amazing in a few years. For now, you have to deal with some cranes, etc. Also, La Concha may want to rethink the 4pm check in policy. We arrived much earlier and had to kill time at the bar without our mosquito repellent (it was in our luggage). 4pm is way too late. All in all...we liked La Concha a great deal and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Senior-Top-Dog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in July for 2 business trips. Positives: Great location - many very good/excellent local restaurants within walking distance. Very helpful & knowledgeable concierge. Efficient check-in & valet. 5 minute jog east to mostly residential areas of the Condado. Lots of locals mixed with the tourists makes for an upbeat environment. Great lobby/bar area. New rooms (12/07) are sleek & ultra functional. Great floor to ceiling oceanfront windows. Can listen to the ocean, feel the breeze at night!! Improved security in the pool area - Had to show my room key even at 6am! Negatives: Most Marriott properties have a "Continental Buffet" for cereal, fruit, etc. Had to pay $20 for the full buffet every morning, yet still only had a choice of 5 cereals - only 2 "healthy" choices. Had a delay one morning to get coffee - no waiter was around. Room not cleaned to Marriott standards - saw the same 3 pieces of rice on the floor 3 days in a row; bathroom shelves needed more attention & saw some small ants during my last stay. Deadbolt didn't work because the frame wasn't square. Overall: I think it's probably the best place to stay in the Condado area, but could use some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: GAPacheco
Reviews.Content: My sister and I are both from Puerto Rico but we live in the states and had not gone back to visit in a very long time. We decided that going home together would be a great experience since we would be going as tourists and we had not seen each other in three years. We decided to stay in La Concha because of its location and good reviews. We were given a beautiful room on the seventh floor with a beautiful view of the beach. The hotel is very modern and beautiful and the employees are all very friendly, respectful and always willing to do everything that will make your stay more comfortable. La Concha is a hotel for young people, newlyweds or mature people who like to have fun and stay up until late. I would not recommend it to families with small children. Music and loud people can be heard upstairs until early morning hours. The beach, although very beautiful, can be very dangerous to little ones. The location of the hotel is very convenient as you can walk to other hotels and various good restaurants. The food served downstairs by the pool is excellent although pricey. Ikakos across the street has very good food at reasonable prices. The Luquillo beach is beautiful and if you have time to go to Culebra and Boqueron, do so. Culebra has the most beautiful beach with the right number of visitors. It was a delight to spend the day there. Do not expect any conveniences if you go for the day. Make sure that you fly (takes 15 minutes) and that you take your own towels. Once there, you can take a cab from the airport to the beach for $2.00 per person. Old San Juan and El Yunque are a must. Make sure that you shop for items made in Puerto Rico. Do not confuse them with souvenirs made in China. One note: If you intend to pay the hotel with a credit card, you will be charged for your entire stay plus assumed incidentals on the day that you check in. In our case, the extra charge was very high. It took them six days after we checked out to correct this charge to the actual amount. It would have been nice to be told in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PR_Travelers
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel that is centrally located in San Juan. The pool and beach area are great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to book here”
Reviews.Author: ddh05
Reviews.Content: Took a long time to decide on hotel and was glad choose this one. Went on a girls getaway and was also considering Marriott Casino down the street (definately book there if have kids, La Concha if adult vacation). Only heard construction noise one morning in room and think wouldn't have if wasn't already awake. Small noise at pool but there is so much construction overall that is it surprising didn't hear more. Would not hesitate not to stay because of it. While lobby was a 'hot spot' on Friday and Saturday night did not hear noise (was on 10th floor) and was on the young side (early 20s). Was not really set up to met people but to socialize with those you were with. Service was excellent, had to have someone come up to change the ipod connection and was done by time returned to room. If looking for towels always were some down at the towel station by the beach. The pool on the beach has a much better breeze than the upper level pools. Service was great except a bit slow ordering breakfast in hotel lobby. Only problem check out - 1st key disabled before check out time so had to go to lobby and get it reactivated. Also two of the three elevators were down for awhile (finally got two of three working) so there was a long wait as everyone trying to get their bags down for checkout - suggest if don't need room until noon, check out early and check bags. Take the barefoot cruise they can set up for you, if you like the water, well worth the $85 per person for the day. Found drinks all over expensive ($10 to $12 for mojito) Columbos (right when leave hotel) for food down the street a less expensive option. When in Old Town try out Blessed Cafe' - bartender Willie (during day) was happy to give suggestions as to where to go. Dragon Fly was as good as everyone says but do make sure to have a drink in their downstair's bar - more atmosphere than upper bar. If had another day would have ventured to the surf side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Hip and cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dallas1love
Reviews.Content: Just read Plain Vanilla 's review of La Concha and had to comment. In no way, fashion or form is this hotel located in a "vaguely seedy area " of San Juan. San Juan is a very old and very densely populated city, over 500 years old so it is not going to look as pristine as certain areas of North Carolina that have been in existence less than 50 years and are sparsely populated. This is part of the charm of the city. There are stores of the caliber of Gucci, etc within a 3 minute walk from the hotel. A Vanderbilt hotel is being completed next door.These stores and types of hotels do not locate in " seedy areas". There is a lot of construction due to ongoing renovations and revitalization of the area and this does detract a little from the "beauty " of the area. But once completed, be prepared to pay top dollar for what will be one of the most chic and hip caribbean urban experiences. I stayed here in March and will be staying again there next week. The place has a definite South Beach quality and ambience to it. The beach right on property has rough waters, so it is better for lounging. but within 10-15 minutes by car you can be in Isla Verde beach, where you can swim if you so desire. I strongly recommend this hotel for those with a "young and adventorous disposition". For those who merely desire peace and quiet, I suggest resorts outside of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: PlainVanilla
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at this property, so I thought that I'd take a few minutes and share my experience. It's really been a mixed bag. In some areas La Concha met and even exceeded my expectations, but in others it came up short. First itâ€™s on the beach in San Juan. Honestly, the beach here is not that great to me; I'm not a big fan of brown sand beaches, but I suppose that is a matter of personal taste. I will say that the beach looked pretty clean and well maintained. The neighborhood does not seem that great to me either. - Vaguely seedy to my eyes, although it does look better at night. There is a good deal of construction going on in the area right now (including a new La Concha Casino and Suites building going up right next door. Also be aware of the extra charges: $26.85 per night resort fee, there's also a room tax...oh, you want to actually stay in your room?...and there's also an occupancy tax. My room itself was decent; medium size, but big enough for my needs. On the plus side, it's got a full wall window with a view of the beach and ocean, and itâ€™s got an excellent bathroom and shower. On the minus side there are significant stains on the carpet. On the plus side they have complimentary internet; both wired and Wi-Fi, and that's an area where a lot of "luxury" hotels continue to gouge their guests. On the minus side, the Wi-Fi didn't actually work for 3 of the 4 days I was here, at least not in my room. The wired connection did work, but there was spotty connectivity in the evenings on several occasions. The BIG issue (and itâ€™s been posted in other reviews is the noise problem. This is caused by the fact that the hallways leading to the rooms are open to the outside. This means that anything going on in the street (or more importantly in the park next to the hotel, where they have concerts on weekends) can feel free to come right on in. Also exacerbating the issue is the fact that the door to the room has like a 1/4 inch gap all the way around. I'm on the 9th floor and the noise was a significant issue on Saturday and Sunday night. On the other hand, on the plus side they have one, if not the, best fitness centers that I've seen at a hotel. On other points of interest, we didn't eat at any of restaurants, with the exception of the breakfast buffet at Level 25, which I thought was not a bad value. We had a few drinks at the bar, but I can't speak to the prices since I didn't pick up the tab. Other restaurants in the area are fine, although a little pricey for what you get (I suspect that this whole beach area is gringoland). The pools are great, with lots of couches and chairs all around. The staff was fine. With the exception of one day when housekeeping missed making up my room, no problems. All in all, an average experience; not terrible, but not anything to write home about either. I booked through the hotel website at their internet rate, which was about 179, which is not exorbitant for the area and class of hotel. I'm here on business so I'll expense everything, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: rodneytbond007
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Lan Concha today and figured that I better write my review before I forgot everything. Well, this was my first time to Puerto Rico and was there with about 60 family and freinds for a Family reunion trip. Our group ages ran from infants up to grandmothers. First off, the hotel itself was very nice. It was trendy in a Miami South Beach sort of way. My husband and I travel often and have been all over the world. We normally stay in HIlton or Marriott properties and are accustomed to well appointed amenities and service. The service here was good. We never felt like we were overlooked. We spent lots of time lounging at the pool in front and the waitresses kept our drinks full and made sure that we didnt need anything. Be aware that you will spend lots and lots of money eating and drinking in San Juan unless you dont mind Subway and Wendys which are right up the street on Ashford. I do have a few recommendations for eating and entertainment. Eating: 1. J Taste: in Old San Juan was delicious. They have a full sushi bar and a full menu fr those in your party who dont eat sushi. There were 6 of us at dinner and everyone enjoyed their food. 2. Dragonfly: right around the corner in Old San Juan. Try the rock shrimp tacos! 3. Columbos: a cheap spot for breakfast, right up the street from the hotel just past the Gucci store. 4. The kiosks at Luquillo Beach: They taste much better than they look. This was the best and cheapest authentic food we had the whole time we were there. 5. Newyorican Cafe(sp?) : Dancing..in Old San Juan.This spot was good for dancind with other people over 25. 6. La Concha lobby, El San Juan lobby or Condado Plaza and Casino were hot spots from Wed to Sat late night (after 11pm) People were dressed to the nines. Luckily I had packed my mini dress and heels. 7. Request a room on the top floor. Our room 1211 had a full balcony, oceanfront so we were able to sit outside and watch the ocean it was great. Other floors just have little walkouts or nothing at all. 8. DO NOT LET YOU CHILDREN INTO THE WATER ALONE!!! A member of our group (25 YEARS OLD AND 6 FEET TALL) was swept away by the rip tide while playing a game af football along the shore. There is a strong undertow and the floor drops abruptly about 20 feet out. he was literally floating out to see until the guy who puts the umbrellas in the sand grabbed a ring and jumped off the breaker wall to save him. They were in the water floating for 8 minutes before the police and some hotel workers came to help him out of the water. He had to be taken to the hospital. There are NO LIFEGUARDS ON THE BEACH>>>BE AWARE! 9. There is lots of noise from the construction next door and we could hear everything starting t about 7am during the week. 10. El Yungue:Easy to find by car. The lady at the Hertz desk in the lobby has directions. We did the shortest trail which is La Mina and even though it was .7 miles it seemed like a million. I would not have missed it and it was worth the work of hiking to see it. You dont need to pay the $3 at the visitor center. The trail heads are fairly well marked. You will see people parked at the trailheads as you ride up the mountain We found that many of the nightspots did not card so there were many young (under 18) people trying to drink and party with you. I am a teacher (and over 30) and partying with this age group was not to appealing for me. All in all it was nice to visit but I do not think that I woul return for a pleasure trip. I have loads of pictures, will add later.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Chic, but service at restaurant/bar/cabana POOR”
Reviews.Author: melissastx
Reviews.Content: I flew into Puerto Rico for a fun weekend with 30-something friends. I HIGHLY recommend that if you stay here, you pick an oceanfront higher-level floor, as far away from the pool/lobby area as possible. It tended to be very noisy with the band/muisc on the weekend for my friends, who stayed on the 3rd floor. I didn't have a problem up on the 10th. The room itself was beautiful, very chic with a flat-screen plasma tv, ipod doc, great bed, and great rain shower (no tub) that was lighted by blue leds. The only balconies were on the third floor, above the pool. It appeared that a lot of locals that knew each other were lounging at the pool, and the cabana girl/waitress always went to them for drinks, but I didn't get a visit once. I would suggest the breakfast special package, which includes the $20 buffet, which was very good. Overall, however, drinks at the bar were pricey ($10 including all the tax) for a diet and bacardi or cosmo, and service was not that great...unless you are a rich-looking businessman. The guy buying me drinks got continuous service, but me alone took a wait (and I do tip!) :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CarguyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at La Concha and it was wonderful. The service and helpfulness from everyone we came in contact with was excellent. Perhaps we are less needy than earlier reviewers but compared to other hotels on other islands, this one is the best so far. The ocean and beach views from our room was stunning! Our room was large, clean and well-furnished. We weren't in the room much until late afternoon but it was always cleaned by 2PM. This hotel has a very active night life and there are crowds of locals in the lobby and outdoor pool area most every night. One day, the beach pool was closed at noon to build a dance platform for that night's party, preventing us paying guests from using it, which angered us a bit. On a positive note, the music, which definitely could be heard in our room, ended by 10PM. We only ate one meal in the hotel because we're a bit budget-conscious and the food and drink prices are resort-priced! $14 for a hamburger, fries and a 6oz cup of Coke, which they would not refill without charging again, was too much. Fortunately, there are many excellent restaurants within walking distance that are reasonably priced. There is also a Walgreen's a couple blocks away where we could get snacks and water. Speaking of water, the ice and tap water in the hotel is safe to drink but tastes bad. Keep in mind anything you leave in your room is subject to "review" by the cleaning staff. We had some leftover food disappear which we were planning to eat the next night. We complained and were reimbursed by the hotel but we still had to get replacement food. After a long, hot day, that was a hassle. The safe in the room is large and ours was well used! We did not need or want a rental car. The bellstand and concierge gave us excellent instructions on how to take the bus to Old San Juan and water ferry to Bacardi. We had an occasion to call Housekeeping because they neglected to replenish some necessary bathroom supplies (TP). Within 5 minutes they were simultaneously knocking on the door with a fresh supply and calling on the phone to followup. It can't get better than that! We were very pleased with this hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: EVIEGrandRapids
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Marriott Rewards points (30K) for after our cruise. I expected this to be an outstanding hotel based on all the pictures; reviews; etc. However, though the Staff get a 10 - the rest of the hotel rates around a 3 for tripadivsor rating. The pool was super crowded and didn't seem that large. The beach was nice but careful on swimming! The beach area is nothing to brag about since it is along many older hotels and lots of construction. Getting to OSJ is fine if you take Bus #21 (75 cents each way)but plan to wait a long time if you're on a weekend there. We finally paid 2.00 each (returned for 75 cents out of OSJ) with a group of other ladies so as not to wait longer then we had (45 minutes) Once out of La Concha it was great! Also we were "upgraded" due to being Marritot Rewards customers only to be charge 110.00 at checkout. We were told that I would receive an email stating that we were not charged and to date we have not received the confirmation. Waiting on bill from CC to verify. All stores around the area are High End - so if you like this - shop till you drop. I prefer the old fashion shops and stores in OSJ and getting a bargain which includes the ships; people watching; etc. All in all the Staff made up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing Experience - A Dream Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: bri2fry
Reviews.Content: To be honest, the reviews of the hotel made the anticipation of arrival a bit daunting. Knowing that there was construction and a fairly slow build to the hotel/property, it was a bit of risk booking here. But the imagery and location were hard to beat and the fact that the rooms were new, on the ocean (all with ocean views) and many restaurants on-site, it was hard to pass up. And we were not disappointed! The service was phenomenal. The atmosphere, cleanliness and courtesy extended to us during our 6 night stay was perfect. The manager's midweek cocktail party was a pleasant surprise. And the attention paid to us when we came and went, got tour tickets from the fabulous Erika or ordered a drink at the pool bar or getting a beach umbrella and lounger before sunning, was greatly appreciated. (The construction was a non-issue. The cranes were visible but hardly noisy at all. And they stopped around 4pm everyday during the week anyway. People truly like to complain about nothing!). We will definitely come back on our next trip to P.R.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great beaches and excellent service - A great get-away!!!”
Reviews.Author: drember
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the LaConcha over the Memorial Day weekend (5 days/4 nights) and I must say it was an outstanding experience. I was a bit nervous in reading some of the reviews, but I was not disappointed at all!!! The grounds are immaculate and while there is still construction going on, we were away from the noise. The rooms are very contemporary and while there is no actual balcony, the ocean views are beautiful!!! The service was impeccable and Frankie at the concierge desk took care of our every need. La Perla restaurant was wonderful and there were lots of local spots for great food and entertainment. The hotel lobby is a happening spot on Thursday's for sure, so if you are looking for absolute peace and quiet, I would say this is probably not the place for you. Also, can't say that it is very child friendly! I would definitely recommend as a getaway for couples, girlfriends and the guys who are looking for fun/sun and nightlife. I would highly recommend and would stay again. It is rather pricey, but the rooms are equipped with refrigerators and there are lots of local places to purchase food and "spirits"! Hope this helps... Enjoy DKay - Texas

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: hun2
Reviews.Content: WOW! Ok that said this is a great place. We just returned from a 10 day stay and we miss it already. The hotel was simply great. We have traveled to many islands and countries and this hotel is at the top of the list of the best. When we arrived around 2:00 our room was ready, 11th floor oceanview with balconie on the west side of the building. First we met Karla at the front desk who was a ray of sunshine. From the first moment she made us feel that she new us and was ready to help. The room was bright and had all the amenities and most importantly was clean. Houskeepping came all but one day before noon. Each morning we went to the beach, 2 chairs and an umbrella were waiting. The beach was clean, wide and safe. The water was a bit rough the first few days but calm after that. The beachside pool was great. When we needed refreshed we walked a couple of steps and into the pool. The beach waiting staff was great, they came around often and brought cold drinks and food which could be charged to the room so no need to carry money to the beach. The food at the hotel was great, we had the breakfast buffet included in our rate and its was plenty. It was open from 6 to 11 so depending on how late we were out the night before we never missed breakfast. The afternoon sandwich menu was good and the Sliders were a big hit. Louise at the activities desk made our night time choices easy. She was ready and available to help with questions and give suggestions and appeared to be happy to be helping. Both Louise and Karla made our dinner, entertainment and activity decisions easy and worry free. There are a lot of nice restraunts that are within walking distance, all kind of food, and of course night life and casinos. The Friday and Saturday crowd in lobby was fun, if for no other reason than to watch the people. None of the music or construction noise bothered us in our room or at the beach. We went to Old San Juan one day and back one evening for night time dinner and club. We rented a car from Charlie's one day and visited the rain forest and Liquilla beach, fun. One issue, DO NOT try to rent from Hertz which is located in lobby of the hotel, it was a disaster and in the end the hotel helped us solve the problem by calling Charlies for us. They saved our day since Hertz did not have our car ready in the morning and after we waited tried to give us a car with bad tires. There is a lot of construction in the area, but it was not a problem. The shops in area are many and you can get anything you want. Everytime we took a taxi it was between 10 and 15 dollars, and they were available every place. This was the first time we visited PR, other than to fly through, and we will definetly go back. We went to tourist places as well as local places and the people were warm and friendly and more than happy to help and even just sit and talk. We would like to explore other areas of PR also, but I dont think we will go back without at least spending a few days at LaConcha.

Reviews.Title: “classy and very chic”
Reviews.Author: Miel8
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about our hotel after reading reviews left and right. It tured out to be a GREAT stay!! If you enjoy the nightlife than DEF choose this hotel..very hip and classy!!! Upon our arrival there was a human error..we had a pool side view with a king bed..but within minutes we were upgrded to the fourth floor with the beach view BUT after our second night and joining the welcome party with white wine we we're UPGRADED by the guest manager to the 11th floor!! Everyone was so kind and VERY HELPFUL. I would def make another visit.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha-Great Urban Resort Getaway”
Reviews.Author: stbartfan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at La Concha in San Juan. A completely renovated, classic, mid century Tropical hotel. It has been open about six months. I read that there were some problems, but they all have been resolved in my eyes. We wanted an "urban" resort, and this was perfect for us. It is NOT the Caribbean of St Bart. (In fact the hotel is on the Atlantic.) Beautiful grounds, three pools(some would say two), one overlooking the beach. All rooms except the pool rooms overlook the ocean, with sophisticated, light beach furnishing. There is a lobby scene weekend nights, if you want that type of scene. The hotel does NOT have a casino, a plus for us; but they are planning on one. But the best was the staff....have never felt so welcomed,everyone from check in- to to concierge, wait staff, housekeeping, pool staff. Perfect get-way for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, off-season gem!”
Reviews.Author: hanawahine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at this excellent resort. We went for a long Mother's Day weekend and had two stylish, impeccably clean and well-appointed adjoining rooms with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the Caribbean. The experience begins with the amazing lobby (which is also a bar, lounge area, weekend DJ scene) that opens seamlessly to the beautiful pool area with huge, overstuffed day beds with pillows, lushly landscaped and filled with clusters of palms in huge pots, making an outdoor living room effect. Three pools, one by the beach, two terraced outside the lobby, connected by a waterfall. The young, friendly, attractive and very attentive staff are always at your service. The food is excellent: the breakfast buffet is an excellent value, poolside lunch menu is just perfect, and served right from the poolside grill. Dinner at La Perla was superb--the equal of the finest any major city has to offer, at probably half the price, as well as an excellent wine list. The beach is terrific, very wide, with plenty of palm clusters for shade. I would happily pay high-season rates for this resort, but the off-season price was incredible--two rooms for what we would probably pay for one in season. There is a $20/day resort fee per room, but well worth it.
