They are adding a casino and condos next door, so there is some construction noise during the day, but well-screened by waterfalls and other water elements and some mildly intrusive poolside music. I highly recommend this for a romantic getaway or a family vacation with either very small children or grown kids.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: RhondaP13
Reviews.Content: La Concha is definitely a work in progress. The hotel is beautiful though and the staff was exceptional, especially the Manager Marisabil. The lobby is very contemporary with an expansive bar in the middle of it. The pool area was just beautiful and I loved the idea of the lounging couches... Our room was an ocean view, no balcony, a good size and also very contemporary. We had an amazing view of the ocean. The bathroom was adequate, and the bed was comfortable. There was an issue with the air conditioning, but other than that it was a very pleasant room. Our room opened up to construction, but fortunately there was nothing going on, on the weekend. We had no issue with the noise from the lobby, and if you like night life this hotel is definitely a hot spot. For one night pre-cruise it was a nice hotel, but I can't wait until they have completed their construction, and worked out some of the kinks, because its going to be a magnificent hotel. I will return when it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Resort and the area”
Reviews.Author: absolutjp
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to San Juan...so there are some things you need to keep in mind when you compare this destination to others. First, nobody is in a hurry....anywhere in Puerto Rico. If I had only stayed at the hotel, I might not have realized that service is not 5 star anywhere on the island. If you are in a hurry, go somewhere else, because you'll be frustrated everywhere you go by longer than expected wait times. Second, the Condado beach area, where the resort is located, is under renovation/revitalization and is smack in the middle of a city of 2 million people. If you want absolute silence and tranquility, go someplace else. Here, the sound of waves crashing on the beach will be occasionally interrupted by construction or traffic noise during the day. Finally, if you want to enjoy calm beaches and lagoons where your small children can play beachside for hours without seeing a wave, then you should go elsewhere. The beaches here, though a tremendous amount of fun, have strong surf and you need to watch how far out your children go. If you are prepared for the above, you will have an outstanding time, as I did with my family - two children, my wife and I. We enjoyed our weeklong stay. We were upgraded to an oceanview room on our arrival. We were on the 12th floor, so noise from the music below was not a problem. The lobby and poolside exterior was outstanding...Southbeach architecture, upscale feel, very friendly and attentive staff (as long as you're not in a hurry). Restaurants were OK (ask for the kids menu if you have kids), but there are plenty of restaurants just down the street that you can walk to and eat at a different one each night. The location is safe, as long as you use common sense. Old San Juan is a cab ride away for twelve to fifteen dollars, if you want to explore something different than Condado. Most importantly, there is a Starbucks and a Dunkin Donuts within walking distance. Try the coffee in the hotel too....its very good. The rooms were nice and clean, with flat screen TVs and iPod Docking Stations. They were cleaned at a reasonable time each day. The resort is very nice....with beautiful lobby, multiple pools and hot tubs, including an infinity pool, ample outdoor and indoor resort seating and lounging and the beach nearby. It really had a beach club feel. After looking at the other places nearby, this one really takes tops in the area. It will be even better once the casino and spa open.

Reviews.Title: “Love La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl1983
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first trip to Puerto Rico and had a wonderful time, thanks in part to La Concha! The hotel was amazing and I highly recommend it. It's possible that I went in the off-season because the hotel and San Juan in general were pretty empty, which was fine with me. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to an ocean-view room (although, I think most of the rooms at La Concha are ocean views.) The room was great. Very clean with a great view of the water and the smaller pool closer to the ocean. The pools were also great and not crowded either. The poolside food/beverage service was excellent and the waiters will keep the ice coming while drinking your carafe of sangria by the pool. The concierge was also excellent, from recommending restaurants to explicit directions to the El Yunque rainforest (definitely do some hiking while you are there!) Overall, no complaints about the hotel...everything was great. Now for those of you who like food, then you should definitely read below...I love to try new types of food when I go to new places and did a lot of research before I went, but also got some great recs from the hotel. If you are staying at La Concha, you MUST go to the Pure & Natural Juice Bar. It is literally right next door to the hotel, directly across from the Dunkin' Donuts. It was the BEST oven-roasted, carved turkey sandwich I have ever had and got it each day we were there. Pure & Natural makes everything from scratch... breads, hummus, juices/shakes... everything was amazing! You should definitely get lunch there and bring it to the pool/beach with you. Plus, it's way cheaper (and better) than the hotel food. For good, local food, you can also go right across the street to Cafe Del Angel. Slow service (as is everywhere else in San Juan) but the authenticity makes up for it. I liked my first taste of Mofongo. For dinner in Old San Juan, the hotel recommended Dragonfly. All part of the same chain as Aquaviva & Parrot Club which are located right next to it. The ambiance was great and it was the most crowded of any of the places we went, but the food was just OK. Not amazing, but not bad either. It was pretty pricey, but my friend and I did enjoy the tuna tartar, the rice, & the pork. Wasn't a fan of the sausage spring rolls though. If we went back, I would definitely try the other restaurants as well. The last night we were there, we had Cuban food at Ropa Vieja. The Cuban staples were good, but you MUST try the blueberry risotto. I've never had anything like it before and it was awesome. Enjoy San Juan, can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: traveltube
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice when you show up, but disappoints on almost all counts going forward. Service is lousy...example, asking for a towel in the late afternoon at the pool, and the attnedant hands us two towels from the used towel bin. Tried to get a towel at the beach, and the attendant looks as if you're requesting some sort of miracle. Food was mediocre. Ordered some chips with guacomole and the chips came coated in oil, literally. Would never come back. Only good thing i can say is that the rooms were decent...that's it.

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing Experience at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: DaniRam2
Reviews.Content: Words could not express how beautiful La Concha Resort Hotel has become. The outstanding service from the minute you walk in the door, being greeted by very good looking, fashionable attire men/ women to the outstanding views of the pools/ocean. There were things to do through out the evening...ooooh, and let's not forget the amazing breakfast at Level 25.....this will definitely be my official place to stay, while visiting San Juan, Puerto Rico!!!! Thank You La Concha for making my weekend, one of the best I have ever experienced! Que Viva Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: JDERV
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at La Concha and while overall very pleased, it was a bit of a mixed bag.... On the positive side, the hotel facilities are beautiful, very South Beach inspired decor, outstanding pool areas, excellent lobby bar. The room (ocean view - 9th floor) was similar in decor - very contemporary. The bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. The ocean view was fantastic from the room (if only there were balconies..) Each service experience was fantastic, especially Luis in the lobby bar who was very friendly. The bar does get very busy at night but it was staffed by 3 or 4 bartenders and service was good. The Fitness Center is very nice - all new equipment on par with a top line health club. The Valet parking was prompt and courteous. Check-in and check-out were prompt, efficient and courteous. I have traveled to San Juan more than 25 times and this was one of my favorite places - much better atmosphere than the Marriott. As a single traveler I find the Marriott way too family friendly (too many kids in the pool area for example) and there were noticeably fewer kids at La Concha. On the negative side, the air conditioner in the room had issues upon my arrival and also a few days later.. it would not keep the room cool. In both instances a call to the front desk and quick response (within 10 minutes) from Engineering fixed the problem. Also a little surprised to see some stains on the carpet and scuff marks on the wall (from the desk chair) . The windows in the room were also very dirty on the outside - there had been a lot of wind and rain and I know the outside windows cannot be cleaned everyday but nevertheless.. a bit annoying with an ocean view. As another reviewer wrote, I had a similar issue with the wireless internet - requiring use of an ethernet cable, which also had to be brought to the room. The room service menu was also missing from the room. It is odd that there is no hotel directory but not a particular negative for me. Regarding the construction - there were 2 mornings where the hotel-condos immediately next door were pretty loud with hammers, etc.. But the work was done during the day and if you weren't in the room during the day then not an issue. The noise was not noticeable in the hotel pool area. The hotel property itself was having some finishing touches - painting mainly - but not a difficulty or disturbance at all. The Condado area is undergoing a renaissance and while not there yet - it is well on the way to being a true destination spot. Final note - the Argentinian restaurant Uomo - about 10 minutes walking past the Marriott - is absolutely the best restaurant I've been in San Juan.. Fantastic... La Concha is definitely a great place and currently a good value (vs. other properties nearby) and upon completion of the condos and additon of the spa will prove to be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great, service disappoints”
Reviews.Author: thoreaut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights for a combination of business and pleasure. The positives include a great location and beautiful dÃ©cor. Thatâ€™s where the positives end unfortunately. Upon check-in I was informed that our reserved beachside balcony room with King bed was not available but that they could offer me a pool side room with double beds. I was insistent that they give me the room that we reserved months in advance and after repeated questioning a beachside King bed room miraculously became available. They informed me that housecleaning would need to clean the room first and couldnâ€™t tell me how long this would take. Not a good start to our stay when our room wasnâ€™t ready when we checked in at 5 p.m. They took our cell phone number and told us theyâ€™d call us when the room was ready. An hour and Â½ later I went to check on the room and it was apparently ready half an hour ago. Where was my call to my cell phone? We were just waiting in the hotel lobby! The room itself is very modern and nicely appointed. The balcony is a misnomer, itâ€™s really just a thing 1 foot strip that you can barely stand on comfortably. Forget about sitting out there to enjoy the view! In the evenings the lobby and pool area become a nightclub with music and a scene of people. Okay if youâ€™re young and looking for this, but Iâ€™d avoid a poolside room if you want to get to sleep before midnight! Fortunately we didnâ€™t hear any of the construction but some co-workers were woken up by it (I think the beachside rooms are away from all of the construction noise). On day 2, we returned to our room at 4 p.m. to find that housecleaning had not yet cleaned our room. I called the front desk and they told me that housekeeping goes from 9 a.m. until 9 p.m. and that theyâ€™d eventually get to us! Forget that we needed clean towels to take a shower after a day at the beach! This was a recurring theme each day. On day 3 housekeeping actually arrived at 10 a.m. and just walked into our room despite a do not disturb sign on the door. Fortunately we were dressed but the sudden interruption was another major annoyance. Be warned, only 1 elevator works and be prepared for long waits particularly at night when there are a lot of partiers going up and down. Food is okay but we experienced long waits and poor service at the restaurants and bars as well. There just seems to be a general lack of caring by their employees. Just not up to standards that we're used to in terms of service and we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nicely decorated rooms but an administrative nightmare to checkout”
Reviews.Author: jyoung3381
Reviews.Content: Have not been to San Juan in 30 years, so the wife and I went to explore. We are upper level Marriott RW members and stayed at the Marriott just down the street for one night, then the new Renaissance for two nights. We booked mid week to avoid the music. We were upgraded to an ocean front room on the top floor. The room and the view were terrific. But just like others, we were perplexed with the lack of a Hotel Information Compendiums for the room. Called the operator and was told they didn't have one. (First Marriott I have encountered without one.) So we also could not figure out how to work all the new technical equipment in the room. Tried the wireless internet and it connected but would not give me their website. Called downstairs and was told to hardwire connect my computer. (Cable was in the drawer.) Asked them where the cable went, and they responded " Into the back of the telephone." Thought we were back to dial up, but it was high speed and worked great. Guess the telephone is also internet operated. The staff was "the best." They were always asking if they could help. My only negative experience came when I tried to checkout. CHECKOUT TOOK 45 MINUTES!!!! I gave them a $50 Renassiance coupon that they could not post to my account. Asked for a receipt that also included information about my Marriott RW number, which they could not do. Finally got a "basic" receipt and tried to get my car from the Valet Parking. They asked for proof that I payed for the parking, which did not come up before, so they took my car keys and went to figure out the disconnect. The valet came back 10 minutes later and said, "You are all set." I then asked for a receipt for the fee they were going to charge me and I had to have a supervisor obtain that for me. Fortunately I had plenty of time before my flight, but people need to be aware that the Renassiance checkout and administrative system leaves much to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a Hotel or a Nightclub?”
Reviews.Author: h0lidaysun
Reviews.Content: I have never before written a review for a hotel, but after such a dreadful experience at this hotel I feel compelled to let everyone know what they are getting themselves in for with this hotel. I've read quite a few of the reviews for this hotel and am surprised by the positive ones.......this hotel thinks it is a nightclub and is obviously more interested in the revenue/profit from bar sales than it is the comfort of the hotel guests! In fairness, I was very impressed with the contemporary decor of the pool/bar areas, and the contemporary fitout in the rooms is great. But the decor of the hotel does not make up for everything else. The layout of the rooms and the location of the live music means that you cannot escape the music by closing your hotel room door............and the live music goes on to till 11pm, followed by a DJ till 3am on Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. So if you are looking for a hotel for relaxation and to catch up on sleep, this isnt it! Perhaps you should look at the HardRock Hotel for a quieter experience! Also the housekeeping leaves a lot to be desired. When you go to a hotel of this supposed standard, you expect the rooms to be clean......on arrival to the room, sand in the shower from previous occupants, and black hairs in the shower, on the white comforter covers and all over the carpet indicated to me that the room had not been thoroughly cleaned. This hotel is still waiting for the Hotel Information Compendiums for the rooms....over 3 months since they opened. So finding out what services are offered by the hotel is a lesson in discovery. Actually working out how to turn down the brightness of the LCD screen on the telephone so its not perpetual daylight in your room is one such lesson......... So, the two main things I look for in a hotel when on a vacation are the comfort (including quietness) and cleanliness of the rooms. This hotel fails on both.

HotelInfo.Name: La Concha Resort: A Renaissance Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1077 Ashford Avenue, San Juan 00907, Puerto Rico
